description:
Seriously amazing tacos!!

Got the chicken and the baja taco both "Nicks Way" - and SO worth it. The texture from the crunchy taco shell is amazing + the guac is so fresh I had a dream about it last night. 

We came here with a party of 7 on a Thursday night and were seated immediately. The staff is super friendly/attentive + they have a bunch of TVs for watchin' sportz. We got three pitchers of IPA FOR $24 each, and it was chill af.

Would go back again...and again...and again...
author: Jamie J.

description:
Bro really? Wheat tortilla? That's not gonna slide past me dawg... also what was with that toddler sized carne asada fries I ordered all about? $15???? 

Yeah no.

Smell ya later!
author: Kelly T.

description:
Hands down the best freakin' tacos in San Francisco! For a cute little taco shop/bar by Golden Gate Park, this place is so amazing along with unbelievably fantastic service.

This review is for the time I went here about 1-2 weeks ago (which is my third or fourth time coming to this place now). I went here to take my friend out for his birthday. We went on a Thursday night around 7pm, and it was PACKED! I mean we couldn't even find a place to sit! Now, when you walk into any place that is packed, you automatically know it's good. We roamed around the bar to find a spot; didn't get lucky at first, so we waited behind the people sitting at the bar and stood against the wall.

This one bartender/server (didn't catch her name, but I think she was blonde?) noticed us right away and told us she would take care of us whenever we were ready to order. I thought that was really nice because usually when you're waiting for a spot at any bar, you don't really get service until you sit down; so that was super nice of her to do that. Immediately after that though, these people that were sitting right in front of us got up from the chairs and we snatched them right away (thank goodness, such perfect timing!).

Throughout the time of us being there, she just always made sure we were doing okay. We even had other bartenders check up on us if she couldn't, and I thought that was great too. Very attentive, fast service.

I had the shrimp tacos and they were absolutely delicious. I am also a huge sangria fan, and man their sangria's are strong! But they are really good as well. I still haven't tried their burritos so I can't wait to try one next time :)
author: Kanella G.

description: I was bar hopping with my coworkers and we wanted to grab a little something something to hold us down til dinner. The bar was a bit packed because there was a game going on. We opted for the asada nachos and they were better than I thought. They didn't skimp on the meat which was also very well seasoned. Even my coworkers said the nachos were good. If they fried their own tortilla chips it would definitely elevate the asada nachos to another level!
author: Liz M.

description:
I really love this place.... normally. I order take out from here all the time. In the past I've watched many nfl &nba games there. But today, I called in a lunch order for me and my colleagues for pick up. My boss Dan, picks it up and delivers it to us. Im eating my way through 1/2 the gulf shrimp burrito when I take my next bite and I feel something tough between my teeth. As I'm pulling that but away, I'm thinking, "must be a shell from the shrimp, no biggie". I use my fingers to pull it away from my mouth and look down and I realize it's a piece of paper with writing on it. Needless to say I lost my appetite for the rest of the day and I think I will pass on burritos for a while. 
I called Underdogs immediately and spoke to "Melissa" who was super apologetic. I asked my boss if he brought it back to underdogs as I instructed him... he told me, he enjoyed the burrito and ate around the paper. So I really don't know what happened.
author: Dora Z.

description:
One of the best places to get your fish taco fix! This little joint is a grey bar/ taco joint that you should definitely go to! 
This place is a seat yourself restaurant, and they only have about 5/6 picnic style tables. If it does get busy, it is still worth the wait.

Fish taco: 5/5 
If you order their fish taco, order it nicks way! Perfectly seasoned fried fish with a fried tortilla, and topped with guacamole. Definitely eat this with the red sauce that they offer on the table. (The red sauce is bomb) 

Chips & salsa: 5/5 
Their chips are made in house with freshly made salsa. Perfectly crisp and seasoned. (I use the red sauce for this dish too)

Steak quesadilla: 5/5 
Get this quesadilla nick way as well. Super flavorful with the perfect amount of steak to cheese ratio. 

You honestly cannot go wrong with this joint, everything is delish with perfectly packed flavors!
author: Elsa W.

description:
I wanted to like the Taco Shop more than I did, because I love the idea of having a real bar that serves tacos and burritos as bar fare instead of the typical popcorn and cheeseburgers! 

However, I thought it fell short in a lot of ways. I'll start with the cons. I got Nick's taco with chicken, which was a crispy taco shell inside of a soft taco shell with pulled chicken and guac. The chicken tasted weird and soggy, and the corn tortilla on the inside definitely tasted stale. Also, the taco fell apart as soon as I touched it, basically. My boyfriend had a chorizo burrito and had some of the same problems--it was very very soggy, messy to eat even with the foil, and the chorizo tasted weird.

There were some pros: the iced tea they serve is real, brewed tea that tasted fresh. Also, their guac is great and is definitely the best of both worlds in terms of texture. It's somehow right in between chunky guac and smooth guac, which is sure to make both sides happy. Also, this seems to be a great bar if you're a fan of Mexican alcohol. They do Mezcal and tequila flights and have several margaritas to choose from. The service was great too, as the server was friendly and our food came out suuuuuuper fast!

I'd probably come back, but not for the food. I think the Taco Shop would be a good place to go drinking, and the food would be better if you've had a Mezcal flight or two.
author: Claire C.

description: This is my go-to place on a Friday or Saturday when I'm tired but want a margarita and nachos! Their nachos are my favorite item on the menu - dense, heavy, happy comfort food. I have had the tacos and burritos before, and they're okay! But nachos are where it's at. The bar is dive-y in a good, college sort of way (you see college and sports team flags hanging all around the place).
author: Katie C.

description: Two words: "Nick's way"! Can't go wrong with the tacos - great portions and price. It's a gem in the Inner Sunset for sure!
author: Kristin C.

description: I seriously always love coming here for the tacos and corn! The service can be pretty hit or miss though, every time I get a guy server they are always grumpy about something, not sure if it is because they always think i'm too young to be in here or what. I usually get carded for just ordering a taco hahah even though I usually see kids in there all the time. Anyways my go to is the taco Nick's way and corn off the cob. Both never taste any different and are always consistent. I love the sauce they provide on each of the tables, so yummy adding it to the tacos.
author: Siera O.

description:
The only way to get your tacos is Nick's way! Tacos are about $5, but for $1.50 more, you get cheese, plenty of guacamole, and a crispy taco shell. 

Two tacos filled me right up. I loved the grilled fish and carnitas tacos.

My 3 friends who came with me were pleasantly surprised at how good and filling everything was. They kept ordering the elote (corn on the cob with cheese) too.

Overall, a very chill vibe with multiple TV screens and great service. My go to taco place! It gets crowded during game saga though.
author: Corinna T.

description:
I love the "Baja style" fish tacos. Make it "Nick's way" for $1.50, totally worth the extra. I love the soft/hard shell combo and the crispness of the fish. All the different textures really just satisfies my mouth. The portion of fish and guac in the taco is huge! I can never finish more than 2. 

The elote con queso is another you shouldn't miss. Love how it's heavily coated with the cojita cheese. Mmmm

One more thing I have to rave about...that orange sauce!!! Ughhh I cannot have enough! I had to buy bottles of it because it is THAT good. My friends think I'm crazy because I will literally drink it lol

Service is friendly. Food comes out fast. Never had a bad time here. Best time to go would be mid day on a weekday because it's usually not so busy then.
author: Mary R.

description:
I am still mad about something, so I try to avoid eating here. But I stopped by Kevin's Noodle and then Irving Pizza, and just didn't want food from those places. So I ended up eating at Tacoshop after a long time. As I said, I have to get a burrito with meat. I got the California burrito with French fries and carne asada. It was very good and I could not finish the whole thing. I like the fries they have. I had an orange soda with the burrito. I got refills. They ran out of agua fresca by that time.

I'd say the customer service was more attentive and friendly this time. It wasn't too crowded, but they were more interested this time around. Customer service goes a long way in keeping repeat customers.
author: Denise C.

description:
I came here with my friends from work for taco Tuesday. I thought the tacos were pretty good, we had to wait a little long to get a table but wasn't too bad. 
Since I am a pescatarian I ordered the Baja style taco nicks way. The seafood tacos comes in one piece but it's really filling. We also ordered the chips and salsa with guacamole.
author: Deki T.

description:
Tried the SF Burrito with Carne Asada. Carne Asada was flavorful and well cooked. The burrito overall felt a little bit on the wetter side, but I wasn't mad about it. The burrito doesn't look *that* big, but it's very filling. Though I finished it in one sitting, I was so full after that I skipped my next meal.

The people at The Taco Shop are super nice, and food comes relatively fast.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Alright your better off getting a Tewuila shot with your Tecate on the Taco Deals Tuesday! 

Check this delicious spread, they offered a Veggie, I thought I go crazy.  Feeling warm, that's a clean buzz on the tip back for the shot.

The lime with the Tecate is a nice touch.

Definitely goin got come back here!  Service is on point!
author: Matthew A.

description:
I am not particularly a creature of habit, but I do occasionally get cravings... tonight I was craving Nick's Crunchy Tacos from Underdogs. This place has a sports bar dive feel but is welcoming and the food is great. I have never had anything that I didn't like. The seating is sometimes hard to find, but the service is good considering its always packed and seat-yourself. The alcohol is reasonably priced and the margs are strong. 
Pros: all of it
cons: the seating
overall: it's my go to, especially on a Taco Tuesday!
author: Whitney B.

description:
Really can't go this month go by without a single review!

Mexican food?  Check.  Greasy Mexican food?  Double check.  Mouth watering greasy Mexican food?  Triple check.

I have always heard such amazing things about this place but it's always so far out of the way for me that it's been on my bookmarks for the longest time just collecting dust.  

Came here on a relatively quiet day as I've heard it could get quite crowded during game days.  You seat yourself as you please, and service is pretty spot on as you're ready to order.  First mistake I made...ordering the tacos.  Not that they weren't downright delicious, you're much better off with their California burrito if you want the biggest bang for your buck.  They are downright generous with their portions (in their burrito at least)!  Packed with a punch of multiple flavors and grease, half the burrito already filled me up.

Ultimately, one of the better burrito spots in this neighborhood.  Wouldn't hesitate to come back!
author: Kevin C.

description:
When I'm having a taco and street corn craving this is the place that hits the spot.
My favorite is the "nicks way"! You can't go wrong, carne asada or carnitas is where it's at. Literally like a giant football of a taco. Soooo good. 
Elote con queso is probably the best I have ever had.
Reasonable prices, low key bar. Friendly staff.
author: Kehaulani K.

description:
Happy hour here is pretty great!  We ordered the $2 street tacos and some $4 margaritas and everything was pretty spot on - no complaints about the food or drinks!  The margaritas were actually pretty strong, which we enjoyed, and all the servers were very patient and friendly.  I heard that there's a special time on Fridays for $1 margaritas, so I'll be sure to check that out.

The actual place is really nice for socializing and watching sports too!  They have TVs everywhere so you can pick and choose what you want to watch.
author: Tim L.

description:
A fun place to hang and grab a beer to watch a sports game and enjoy some tacos :) Can't say they're the LA/SD tacos I'm used to, but they're still pretty good and usually come here for my taco fix. It's located on the lovely Irving street. There's booth seating for the bar, some small tables, and larger picnic tables in the back. It can get packed dependent on the night, so service is usually pretty efficient. 

I would recommend for a starter their chips and salsa..really good and tastes fresh. There is also yummy red and green sauce to put on..I would recommend the red sauce..it gives it a little kick. They have your usual quesadillas, burritos, and tacos. I have only tried their Tacos..if you get tacos please do it Nick's way :) Nick's way comes with a grilled crispy corn tortilla wrapped in a soft tortilla with Monterey Jack cheese, pinto beans, pico de gallo 
 and guacamole..yummm :) They are very generous with the guac as well! Their carnitas tacos are good, but I usually go for their grilled fish or shrimp. It comes with cilantro, cabbage, red onions, pico de gallo, and tomatillo salsa. Again, not like LA tacos..but still really good! If you're in the mood I would also suggest one of their craft beers. 

Side note - pricing is reasonable for SF life, and parking isn't too hard to find. Remember..Nick's way is the way to go :)
author: Jackie C.

description:
GSW vs CLE Game 1 madness!! Great neighborhood spot to crowd around for games, load up on tacos and quesadillas, and drink.

Pros:
+ Not crazy expensive
+ Generous portions!!
+ TVs everywhere you look
+ Locals hit this spot up
+ Packed and fun on game days
+ Free for all seating, spacious
+ Service was 10/10 on a packed night!!

Cons:
- Margarita pitcher is dangerous

Recommendations:
+ Carne Asada Quesadilla, 4/5

Came by to catch Game 1 of the NBA finals today with my gal pal. TVs everywhere, people everywhere. Our server was patient and attentive even on such a packed night. Food was good, margarita was stronnng. Their pitcher left me so smashed once, I told myself I'd never drink it again. But when homegirl says we gotta drink for every bucket GSW makes...dead. The aftertaste is bleh, but I wash it down with water.

Will come back for game nights.
author: Fanny W.

description: Feel bad leaving this place a mediocre review because on the surface they do everything right. Good, strong drinks with decent specials and good service. But I just can't find a way to justify spending $5 on a single taco that is objectively less flavorful and authentic than the $1-2 tacos you can find at any taco truck. Good place to get a drink and watch sport, but the food is expensive and leaves a lot to be desired. I don't understand why someone wouldn't just go to a normal taqueria over here.
author: Aarom C.

description:
Two years later and I gave The Taco Shop at Underdog's another chance! This time around was a stellar experience. Therefore, I thought it was only fair to update my review and change the star count. 

I'll be back sooner than later!
author: Briana H.

description:
Liked the food, though it was sorta pricey for what it was.  

Came in here on a Sunday night looking for a late dinner.  The place wasn't too busy (but honestly what would be at that time).  They have some cool picnic benches in the back, but the front looks a lot more like a bar.  

I ended up getting a chorizo quesadilla and some chips and pico de gallo.  I was a little surprised that they put the pico de gallo right on top of the chips, kind of made for some soggy chips near the end.  Their chips are on the thicker tougher side just FYI.  I really hope they don't straight up put salsa on the chips.  As for the quesadilla, it had a pretty thin tortilla and was stuffed with plenty of meat and tomatoes.  Overall, not bad, but the texture was like finely ground beef.  Also, be warned it's rather greasy and messy.   

Not a bad place, but I wouldn't say I was blown away.  I enjoyed the food, but at the same time, $9.50 for a quesadilla seems a little pricey.  Chips and pico were $3.50.  What I originally really wanted was nachos, but those would've came out to around $14 with meat. So you can sorta see the issue here.
author: Bryson L.

description: Went here for taco Tuesday! The deal was pretty good: $2 for street style tacos and a few dollars off of beer(selected items only). Unfortunately nicks crispy tacos were the same price as normal, but so delicious!! Must try!!
author: Theresa H.

description: This place is great especially when they have dollar margaritas you cant beat that. I ordered nachos here and they were huge I ended up sharing with 3 other people because it was a lot. Great place to go for some drinks and nachos.
author: Poonam M.

description: Delicious tacos! Chill atmosphere and many screens for watching ball games.
author: Mae P.

description:
What you need to know: 
- a great spot to watch sports, with lots of tv screens 
- it feels like an indoors beer garden with its picnic benches and tables 
- the staff are super friendly 
- the menu consists mainly of tacos, quesadillas and burritos, and appetizers such as nachos, chicken wings and corn with cheese - don't come here expecting authentic Mexican food though 
 
What we ordered: 
- Nachos son muy Grande price $10.25 - a large plate of nachos topped with beans, Monterey Jack cheese, pico de gallo, jalapenos, guacamole and Mexican sour cream - toppings are very generous! 
- Cheese quesadilla - $4.75 - Monterey Jack cheese folded in a whole wheat tortilla.  The quesadilla came out a bit greasy, not so much from the cheese but the tortilla was probably coated in oil/butter when cooked.  My 4-year niece had no problems eating it, greasy or not! 
- Baja Style fish tacos $5.50 and to add "Nick's Way" is an additional $1.50 - "Nick's Way" means to add a crispy corn tortilla, cheese and guacamole.  I personally prefer the fish taco without Nick's Way, because I feel all the guacamole and cheese takes away the crispiness of the beer battered fish. The batter wasn't very heavy, which allowed you to really taste the fish and the portion of fish is generous.
author: Karen L.

description:
Come on!!! You know the time to go is Tuesday! 

I'll be honest and say I don't even know how the food is cause we usually start with some drinks, then eat when we're buzzed. So of course by then most food tastes good lol. I will say I did really enjoy the tacos and especially the quesadilla. 

I recommend this place for good company, good drinks and taco Tuesday. Bring some friends! You're bound to have a good time
author: Raul S.

description: This cheese burger burrito is what I uber there for every time I'm drunk! The service is always good too food is always on point
author: Mike D.

description:
My friend and I were hungry after a day in SF and we were told to come here for the tacos. We immediately took that recommendation! We didn't realize it was a big bar and it was pretty packed. 

F O O D:
We ordered their chicken street tacos...3 for $7.95. Pretty pricey. I know I could get 3 tacos cheaper than that or with beans and chips for the same price. So I thought, they must be some pretty good tacos! I thought wrong. Right away the tacos didn't look appealing. The sauce they put on it was super orange and it actually lacked flavor. I had to put a bunch of hot sauce on the tacos. We were both starving which is how we were able to finish them. 

S E R V I C E:
We had to go up to the bar to let someone know that we needed a seat. Luckily we were able to get seats by the window. The server was awesome and checked up on a lot. 

O V E R A L L:
Mostly likely not coming back for tacos. There are cheaper and BETTER tasting places in SF.
author: Jaclyn M.

description: I've been here at least a half dozen times and it never disappoints. This is easily my favorite place to eat in SF.  Nick's way taco is a must, but the burritos and nachos are great too!  The service is awesome every time I've been there. I definitely recommend it to anyone. I guarantee you won't be disappointed.
author: Robert P.

description:
I've been a fan of this spot for years now. I even moved closer so I can have it more often! Haha. Jk, but really, Nicks Way all the way. 

Quesadillas. Are. Life-changing. 

Solid Margaritas. 

Breakfast tacos y burritos. Morning coffee drinks are good too. That's what a wake up call should feel like! More variety than just your Irish coffee. 

Overall a great neighborhood spot that gets busy when big games are on. 

Reason I can't give it a 5 is the inconsistency. Maybe just within the past couple of years, but I typically crave the Baja Style Fish Taco, Nick's Way, and when I've ordered it, sometimes my food comes out cold like it had been sitting ready for a while or something. Or they've messed up my order in the past when I've gotten it to go. :(
author: Mariel A.

description: Really great service and decent food. Came here on a Sunday to watch the game and grab a bite to eat. I got the chicken quesadilla while the others got fish tacos, and burritos. The burritos were out of this world! The rice inside was nice and fluffy and the chicken was really good. I was disappointed with the quesadilla. It wasn't cheesy like you imagine a quesadilla to be and instead the bread (or tortilla that they wrap everything in) was soggy from the tomatoes and falling apart. On top of this, it was lacking a lot of flavor. Besides that, we got guacamole and chips and street corn with cheese which was both really good. Service is great here and there's a lot of seating available.
author: Nargis A.

description:
Came here because I heard they had tacos made like nick's crispy tacos. Started off with the chips and salsa. I was honestly expected the salsa to be on the side and not on top of the chips because it makes the chips soggy after a little bit. Although I do love the chips itself, it is very crunchy.

I ordered one grilled fish taco nick's way. I have to say compared to the actual nick's crispy tacos restaurant downtown, I feel like the ones here are a bit smaller. The fish tasted pretty dry and I had one piece that was charred way too much. Also, I did not like how the guacamole just a blob on the front of the taco because by the time I got to the back of the taco I didn't have any guacamole. For $7 bucks ($5.50 for grilled fish + $1.50 for Nick's way) I expected better. I remember the tacos at Nick's crispy taco was so large that it was almost like an open face taco. Pretty disappointed about this place and the glass they gave me had a weird white powder ring on the inside of the glass. I didn't notice it until the end of my meal and I was able to wipe the ring away but they should be better with cleaning the glasses. Super gross. 

Because of the chips, it is a 2 star otherwise this would have been a 1 for me.
author: Andrew T.

description:
After the sun started setting on an all day birthday celebration at Hellman Hollow, my boyfriend and I decided to leave and get dinner. We didn't have the stamina to keep up with everyone else who was going to bar hop around the city. Plus, we had our husky with us.

The Taco Shop at Underdog's was a lucky find. It was within walking distance, and there was literally ONE high top table outside, which was perfect for us. It started getting chilly, but we made do.

First and foremost, the customer service here is incredible. Even though we were outside, I felt like everyone who worked here came to check and make sure we were doing okay. For those sitting inside, it can get pretty crowded, but there's lots of benches in the back, tables on the side, and stools at the bar.

Food was delicious and arrived quickly. I had a San Francisco burrito with carne asada ($10.95)... So good. Better than a lot of Mission burritos I've had, in my opinion. It was hot and fresh and stuffed with just enough ingredients for me to actually finish the whole thing. Go me!

I'd definitely go out of my way to come here again. Hopefully we can visit next time without our dog and sit at the bar to enjoy some drinks alongside our memorable Mexican food!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
The tacos aren't mindblowing ... but four stars for 

1. All the mounted TVs blasting sporting events. The dream. 
2. Taco Tuesday and their $2 street tacos, especially the carne asada 
3. $24 pitchers (think 5 glasses-worth) and their decent selection of draft beers
4. Impeccable service and friendliness of the employees
author: Anderson H.

description: Our local taco shop. I like their picnic tables in the back of the restaurant, which has more of a family-style vibe, their margaritas and fish tacos. Service can be hit-or-miss especially when they are busy, but that's to be expected, I suppose.
author: Camille L.

description:
I've only been here twice but both times was a good experience. The Taco Shop is on the busy streets of Irving & 19th so it might be difficult to find parking during dinner time even on a week day. Both times, I went on a weekend and it was pretty busy. The sucky part is that it's a first come first serve kind of basis so you might have to stand a bit till you can find an open table. Luckily a couple of dudes sitting at a table let my friend and I sit at their table and we were able to order. 
I ordered Nick's Way and got to try out the carne asada one. I also ordered a side of Elote con Queso (corn on the cob) and some chips&guac and agua fresca margarita. Everything was amazing. The taco was super yummy and it had cheese, pico degallo and guacamole. You can also order with some pinto beans but I'm not a big fan of beans so I didn't order with it. Just a warning, this is a pretty big taco and super filling! The tacos are wrapped in a soft tortilla and on the outside there's a crispy tortilla! (You're almost getting two tacos in one!) The corn on the cob was also another amazing side dish. The Elote is covered in lime salsa and cheese and some cayenne peppers. I've honestly never had a corn on the cob before so I can't compare it to anything but I think this was the best style of corn I've ever ate in my life lol. The corn was super sweet and juicy. The chips & guac was also good. Nothing special. 
The agua fresca margarita was pretty strong and refreshing. Although we were both kind of light weight so we were a bit tipsy.

Other than, service was good. The worker checked up on us and we definitely enjoyed our food. The food also came out pretty quick which also deserves another star. :) 

I will be back again soon!!
author: Monica W.

description:
We finally got a chance to try the Baja-style fried fish taco and the chorizo quesadilla the other night and it was UNREAL. I honestly haven't had Baja-style Mexican food this delicious since we went to Cabo--this is the real deal (well, okay, this is a lot pricier than what you'd get in Cabo or any place in the Mission...but you get what you pay for)!

I highly recommend the fish taco with guac--each bite was flavorful and satisfying. The fish was fried perfectly crispy on the outside and was exquisitely flaky on the inside. Perfect. 

The chorizo quesadilla was even more mindblowing. I normally take pictures of all my food but I failed to do so this time because the presentation of this beauty overwhelmed all my senses. The plate simply smelled fantastic. The whole wheat tortilla was simultaneously soft yet crispy, barely cradling the juicy bits of paprika-spiced chorizo, cheese, and pico de gallo. I love my Mexican food sloppy, wet, greasy, and this quesadilla delivered just that--I used about ten napkins per bite.

Underdog's is no underdog...definitely come here to enjoy American- and Baja-inspired Mexican in a fun atmosphere!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Almost no customers when we walked in and all staff ignored us, no welcome. Waited maybe 5 minutes before being acknowledged. Really rude bartender. Wont ever come back. I would rather go to bars further away from me than go here again. I only came here because of the reviews but the bartender told me to go to a different bar because i asked him if they have anything fruity. Racist, assumed my and my friend's age. Maybe if he could actually read an ID he'd notice. My friend and i were trying to figure out how we were paying and the bartender made sure to let me know that we have to tip him. I dont think thats what tip means but he insured he wasn't getting one for that.

The margaritas are okay if you like it with a side of hostility.
author: Wendy F.

description:
Service sucks.

A group of college aged dudes standing behind the bar starching their balls and passive aggressively exhibiting customer service. 

Food good.

Service sucks.

...service sucks.
author: M. U.

description:
One of my absolute favorite bars in SF. Great place to come whether it be for food, to watch a sports game, drink, or just to socialize. The staff is always friendly and the food is excellent. I find the atmosphere to be very fun. This place gets quite packed during a big game. 

My favorite thing to order is the carne asada Nick's way tacos and the chips with salsa and guacamole. The tacos are super loaded and eating one already gets me stuffed. The chips with salsa and guacamole are a great snack to munch on while watching the games.
author: Annie H.

description: I keep going back for their Baja style fish tacos and chips and pico! So good. Best fish tacos I've had in the Bay Area. I live in Moraga and drive an hour for them. Been there multiple times and always good. My boyfriend tried the nachos today and they were equally good. Nice spot, fun easy going atmosphere. Good service. I can always find parking easily.
author: Ashley L.

description:
Yelp Bio asks "Last Meal On Earth?" and I'm pretty proud of mine because it's a cleverly disguised inside joke. 

Realistically, I found what could easily serve as my last meal here.  The fried fish taco Nicks way. 

Listen. I like fried food. I don't have room my life for anyone who preaches the sin of fried food. Every now and again it is a wonderful indulgence. An indulgence I enjoy to the last bite. 

So back to this fish taco. Ok have it "Nicks Way" which involves your hunk of perfectly fried fish, pico de gallo, and cabbage nestled a fried tortilla taco shell inside of a soft corn tortilla and then...brace yourself...this ginormous mound of beautiful green guacamole. 

That is what I want my last meal to be because why go out eating something healthy when I could have fried fish tacos slathered in guacamole before I draw my last breath of life. 

I'm serious. I love salad but f salad. I'm going out eating something fried. 

Ah - before I get too carried away, the margaritas are delicious and the service is friendly and efficient. 

I'm glad I visited with my friends. We ate well, we drank well, and we had a great time! 

I discovered what I want my last meal to be! 

Baja Taco Nicks Way.
author: Jennifer C P.

description: Hands down the best tacos and burritos in the entire Bay Area, maybe even California. Healthy, organic, AND tasty?! That's like, unheard of for bar food. Nick's Tacos always top-notch along with the San Francisco Burrito--the fresh guac on both is to die for. Furthermore, the staff is the best of the best. Derek and Max always run the bar with solid attentiveness and stylish flair. People drive from the Excelsior all the way across town to go here. Beyond great.
author: Jimmy G.

description: Returned for nachos. You simply can't beat the amount and quality guacamole and the house sauces. Yummm! Priced rught too.
author: Laura P.

description: This is quite possibly the best burrito I've ever had. Get the San Francisco. Great environment too. Couldn't recommend this any more.
author: Brad B.

description: The veggie burritos and street tacos are to die for! They are just around the corner from my brothers house so I frequent the place whenever I come to visit.  They are very fast with cooking your food and are a fun place to go watch a giants game!
author: Jessica O.

description:
Whenever folks come to visit SF and I give them a "day-tour" of the city, I like showing them places that have become very special to me. We go sip coffee on top of Alamo Square Park, stroll through the Palace of Fine Arts, hike to the labyrinth at Land's End, lounge in the sun at Mission Dolores Park, and always always always get some Nick's Way tacos at Underdogs. At the summation of this packed itinerary, when my visitors are reflecting on the day's activities, the conversation predictably returns to lunch.

Scaling the mountain of fresh pico de gallo and guacamole, deep diving into the deliciously tender carnitas or carne asada, and then washing it down with a cavalcade of ice cold tecate. The experience is pure poetry, and leaves a potent memory. I have consistently had the pleasure of looking over the summit of my own taco to see my guests shake their heads in disbelief at the gastronomic wonder. And did I mention the verde and roja sauces? They should be illegal.

I would highly recommend bringing this stop into your rotation. In addition, this is a lovely bar for watching sports.
author: Will F.

description: I do not drink or like sport as others but I love the food here and the atmosphere.  Friendly, professional and price just right.  the soup tortilla is a must.  the portion is good.  the food is fresh and love the chicken....it tasted like if my mom would have made it.
author: Rocky M.

description:
This place has lost its charm....

The guy who picked up the phone to take my pick up order sounded tired and annoyed by me calling. I instantly got turned off.

I ordered the nachos with no meat and they still charged me the same price with no extras! My boyfriend got the "Mahi Mahi" burrito... barely any fish! For $11 you can go to La Playa Taqueria on Noriega street and get your moneys worth
author: Lauren N.

description:
Their fish tacos Nick's way are on point! Which basically means they are smothered with guac. But here is the part I have yet to understand the menu says tacos Nick's way means beans, cheese, and guac.. so does only the guac part apply to the fish tacos? 

Either way this place is good I walked up to the bar and placed a to go order and it was done and out in under five minutes, that is some legit service!
author: Morgan S.

description: The manager at the time was a total jerk with attitude. how do you expect people to wana come into your restaurant when you're a total douche? Helping you out by stacking plates for you and cleaning after ourselves and you dont even say thank you? Having attitude just because we wanted our bill split up? That bandana on your head must be your ass hat. Some people might not be so kind to you next time.
author: Mojo J.

description: Service was great, food was alright. Expensive for what you get. 3 mini tacos for 10.50. Charged 1.50 for a side of sour cream. Will give it another try when drinking, maybe booze and their food go hand in hand.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Nick's tacos are really good here-- from what I remember, there's a fried taco shell and topped with guacamole. 

Another menu item here that is really bomb (secret menu) are their fries. It comes out piping hot and stays crispy! Unfortunately they don't have ketchup, but fortunately the fries are still good without it.
author: Megan C.

description:
I've long resisted visiting The Taco Shop as I generally prefer a more traditional taqueria. Yesterday things finally lined up such that I ended up eating at The Taco Shop anyway, and I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised.

I thought the street tacos were, well, lackluster. The tortillas were just sort of bland and steamed and became soggy very fast. The fillings were alright, though. The carne asada and the chorizo were both quite good. The pulled chicken would be better served in a sort of traditional sit down Mexican joint context- a freshly fried chewy/crispy tortilla, cheese, and lettuce.

The Nick's style taco was definitely a more appealing option. The thing is basically a half burrito. It's actually a cool, if non-traditional, format.

And lastly, I treated myself to a California burrito with carne asada and (as recommended by the waiter) added the baja sauce to that.

Now, I usually don't usually care for a California burrito. I prefer rice. But, I'm a San Diego native and have been craving carne asada fries (the true traditional food of San Diego alongside the fish taco). While The Taco Shop doesn't do carne asada fries, a California burrito with carne asadad is the same thing but wrapped in a big-ass tortilla.

Again, the tortilla game threw me for a loop. Apparently, burritos only come in whole wheat tortillas. This is a weird choice. I mean, let's be clear ; this is about as white as a taco spot can get. But still, whole wheat only? Nonsense. In their defense, they did a bang up job keeping that tortilla nice and chewy and stretchy and the carne asada and the fries were both pretty fucking tasty. Big ups to the waiter for recommending the baja sauce, as well. It was a clutch move, though it may be too rich for some in this context.

All in all, I was pleasantly surprised. The food was tasty and affordable and clean without being polite or bland. I was also stuck with a very delightful, nostalgic Southern California vibe.

For me, when it comes to Mexican food I'm usually a single issue voter: how good is the al pastor? But even with no al pastor on the menu and whole wheat tortillas on the burritos, I'll gladly be back.
author: Austin M.

description:
Easily the best place for street tacos and drinks on the western side of the city. A must if you live in the avenues. 

I always order the street tacos. I mean for $7.95 for three tacos spilling over with meat, who could say no? My favorite are the carne asada and chorizo. Cover that with some of the red and green salsa and it's a winning meal. 

Great spot for any of the college sports. There always seems to be games on all the TVs. I'm not a big fan of watching sports on TV but it makes the vibe there really awesome because everyone is lively and probably drunk. 

I wasn't a fan of the chips and salsa though. I like salsa not pico and they kinda just throw pico on a basket of chips. Stick to the tacos.
author: Michael P.

description: This was my first time trying this place. I didn't get any drinks and can only vouch for the carne asada street tacos. They were ok, the meat was nice and soft and had great flavor. My only issue is that there was a literal rock in one of my tacos! I was actually kind of enjoying them until I took a bite that almost broke my tooth. Don't think I'll ever be going back.
author: Teta C.

description:
Really attentive service, great Taco Tuesday place! Nice ambiance and good place to watch sports. Great place to catch a game of soccer, baseball, basketball or football. Food is pretty good and awesome deals if you come in the right days! 
Will continue to enjoy!
author: Camille G.

description:
I can't speak to their tacos...but

I came on a Saturday night with a friend to help close down the bar (aka sat there and drank til close-ish). Staff was super friendly. Drinks were good. But the best part......THE MUSIC. 90s to early 00s rap and r&b?! Yes please.
author: Deborah D.

description: Best fish tacos ever!! I never eat fish. But here I will. Best place in the city to watch any Michigan game. Always a good time and always good food. Give me 4 fish tacos a bucket of Founders and some Wolverines football. GO BLUE!!!! ][V][
author: Gregorio L.

description:
This place is amazing!!! I never eat a bad meal there, hungry? Like sports? It's the place!!!! I go there nearly every week their Elotes are the best! 
Street tacos, elotes, quesadilla everything is so good! Don't forget the sauce! 
Taco Tuesday are the best!
author: Jaque H.

description:
My order: steak California burrito. It comes with a few fries on the side if you eat there or chips if you get it to go. Fries always inside and delicious.

Sports bar atmosphere, really god burritos, red sauce in squeezy bottles is inimitable and earned the 5th star on its own.
author: Belle K.

description:
Still one of my favorite places in the city.  The staff -- and I mean ALL of them -- are rock stars!  And every time I come in they make ME feel like a rock star.  Love the food, love the vibe -- and I don't even drink here since I'm usually here in the middle of my Lyft driving shift.  But if you are here to drink, you will love their massive selection and superstar bartenders.

I usually get Nick's Way tacos and elote con queso (corn on cob rolled in cotija cheese - always amazing!), although tonight tried the street tacos for the first time.  These are great if you want to sample several of the meats, although if you want more flavor/fillings then you should stick with Nick's Way tacos, which I missed a little bit. 

My particular favorite protein choice here: chicken (sourced from Mary's Farm Free Range).  SO good!  All their meats are sourced from quality suppliers, and their carne asada is made with Kobe beef.

For some reason, this is the first time I've ever had their chips & salsa, which aren't free -- cost $3.50 -- but loved them.  Fresh & tasty thick-style chips, and they heap the salsa on top, sort of nachos-style instead of bringing side bowl, and thoroughly enjoyed it served that way.

Taco Shop is SOLID and I will forever be coming back.
author: Merrick W.

description: I paid $9 for chips/guac to go, but only found 25% guac under all the salsa :( I LOVE the guac here so I was disappointed to find very little of it for my picnic in golden gate park. Very friendly service, but the quality of the order was incredibly low.
author: Navneet S.

description:
The staff is so nice and friendly. Tacos are sooooo good, especially the red sauce. Drinks are really good as well. Bartenders are really attractive and are down to earth. Definitely recommend and will definitely be back! 
First time here and can't wait to come back :)
author: Heather M.

description:
HUGE. (That's what she said). I know I've got the skill to deepthroat sizeable portions, but tacos 'Nick's Way,' are just outta this world hefty. You'll probably feel like a supreme weenie after conquering only one of these, because I did. 

Nick's Way is a grilled crispy corn tortilla wrapped in a soft tortilla with Monterey Jack cheese, pinto beans, pico de gallo, guacamole, and your choice of meat; in my case, American Kobe Beef Carne Asada--undeniably gratifying, but trust me, if you're not over the top starving, then I recommend that you start with just one of these tacos, instead of immediately jumping to two orders. Do NOT underestimate tacos 'Nick's Way,' people. 

You'll want to stop by here for a taco, beer, and the game, as you'll dig the lively game day ambiance.

+ Vegetarian options Nick's Way as well
author: Merica S.

description: Love this place!!! The tortilla soup and Nicks way tacos are amazing. I usually just go in for pick up and they do a very good job of having the orders ready in a short amount of time.
author: Jamile A.

description: I love me some underdogs tacos! The burritos are also great. Get there early for taco Tuesday because it can fill up pretty quickly.
author: Jenn A.

description: update your fucking hours. says youre open till midnight but we get here to enjoy some late fish tacos and youre closed at 10pm. not cool totally wasted my time coming here this late now i am struggling to find something to eat! thx :)
author: Kelvin R.

description: I don't know what I was thinking about 6 years ago, but Nick's Way Tacos are bomb AF. Salsa is still on point #tacolyfe
author: Daniel S.

description:
Nicks way tacos is the way to go! 
Nachos are really good with carnitas!! 
Definetly recommend this place!
author: Carla Q.

description: Love this spot when I'm craving Mexican and don't want to leave the sunset! Yummy food and a fun sports bar atmosphere. This place is always packed and it is open late on weekends, which is great! My go to order is carnitas Nick's way tacos and a house marg. Try it!
author: Abby R.

description: Tall glasses of sangria, mounds of nachos and fresh taco ingredients.. THAT is how you make a taqueria I want to go to!
author: Aliyah H.

description:
Any Nick's Way taco is bomb.

Place can get crowded as it is a sports bar and is fairly small. Carne asada tacos are the way to go and even better when you pair it with a Pacifico.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
They have biodegradable straws!! Oh, and the tacos, burritos, salsa and chips with guac are yummy.

Only 3 stars because the guy working at the bar kept staring at my teenage daughter when we walked into the restaurant. Not cool. Really gross, actually. I almost went up to him to say something but then we sat down and he couldn't leer anymore. Dude needs to go away. Food is definitely 4+ stars.
author: amy c.

description:
How have I lived in the Sunset for almost two years, and not discovered this place sooner?!  This is the perfect, laid-back, fun, casual spot. I love the picnic-style seating, the arcade games, and ... all of the Michigan gear they have around. (Note to self: come back for a football game.)

More importantly, they have a solid menu of the Mexican comfort food staples - plus, some unique twists. Their nachos are guaranteed to satisfy (and yes, they are as large as the menu insinuates). The Tacos - especially Nick's way - are super good, and filling (two will do the trick). I got the chicken quesadilla, and I will warn you now that it's really more like a griddled burrito, suiza style - it was SO huge, and packed with tons of tender chicken, cheese, guacamole and sour cream ... this definitely provided two meals for me. And it was VERY different from the flat, sprinkle of cheese quesadillas you might be used to. My brother-in-law got a cheeseburger burrito that, while not traditional, looked pretty fantastic. And reflecting back, all of the portions were HUGE. 

The bar has a decent selection of beers, and the bartenders and servers are super friendly and approachable. The fact that they have table service here seems like a bonus, because the atmosphere (and prices) are so casual. Don't expect white tablecloth service, but for bar service - it's great.
author: Catie F.

description:
Such a great place to get late night eats in the Sunset!

I've been here a handful of times and each time, I'm left super satisfied. My recommendation is to go for any of their tacos, made nick's way! Meaning they top the taco with a boatload of guac. Meaning it's the greatest thing ever. 

They're fish tacos are super popular and they're fried to perfection. One is enough if you're moderately hungry but two is my go-to order haha. The carne asada is always grilled to perfection so this is usually my other taco order. 

I recently ordered their carne asada quesadilla and boy was that filling. Towards the end of it, it got pretty soggy, probably from the mild salsa, so it was very messy. Tasty but very messy. Not gonna lie, I'd order it again regardless. 

The service is pretty good, the restaurant is super loud so you'd have to yell during your conversations but that's okay! It's a fun bar environment with some arcade games towards the back of the place. 

Reasonable pricing, very good food. Go go go!
author: Stefanie S.

description: This place has some real good food and the bar is great I got the chicken taco and a fish taco "Baja style". For an extra 1.50 you can have your taco "nicks way" wich consist or a fried shell with and a few extras.... tacos are delicious. The food is kind or Americanized Mexican food.
author: Jarrod G.

description:
Without a doubt the Nicks ways tacos are the best way to get your taco. You get a soft shell with a crunchy one and a load of guacamole. A little
Pricey but if you are looking for some great tacos I'd recommend you visit this place. I always call ahead of time so I don't wait since it can be very busy on weekends.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Came here when the warriors won it all. Our waiter was awesome and delivered. The place was packkkkked and he still gave us excellent service. The tacos are pretty small here so make sure you order plenty!
author: Eric A.

description:
The most gentrified taco place ever. Super basic street tacos which are $2 on Tuesdays. The place gets super packed, especially on game days. Be prepared to wait awhile or swoop on the open seating at the bar. They will not serve you food unless you have a table/seat. 

The tacos have meat, cilantro, and onions. That's it. I would suggest just spending extra on "Nick's Way" since that comes with pico de gallo, guac, and cheese. It's way more flavorful. 

I guess another good thing about this place is their sauces, which are homemade. My favorite is their roja sauce, which tastes like chipotle (not the restaurant). 

I'm mostly here for the elote's, tbh.
author: Rachelle Y.

description: The shrimp salad was really good just took a while to arrive. The party I was with ordered their food and I'm sure since it's ordered more often, came out first but it was quite a wait. But nonetheless delicious!
author: Dayana G.

description:
ordered beef tacos and chicken wings
taste is okay，but really small portion
wings came from really slim chickens

but the sause go with nachos are great
author: 以欢

description: Went here for the first time the other day. I was impressed. Service was friendly and great. Food was excellent. The beverage selections were on point. Cool place with sports on the tvs, hustling servers, fantastic bartenders. I'll be back for sure.
author: Dara M.

description:
The Taco Shop is THE place I always think about first when major sports games are on because hands down, it is a popular spot with a lot of tvs around with delicious food and craft beer on tap. It is probably one of the first sports bars that get PACKED since it's in a more local area. One day I'll attempt to come here on a game day to immerse myself in the wild crowds!

I made it out here on a Friday night with some old high school friends and we ordered two pitchers of sangria to share ($28 each and feeds about 5!) and some food. Their sangria is pretty good! However they do add captain morgan ... two glasses were good enough for me! Try Nick's crispy tacos! It's basically a hand-held taco packed with all your favorite taco ingredients (meat, guac, onions are mines at least; no sour cream!) I finally got to try the carne asada one (5.75) and it's a great snack! We also shared a side of their fries and those are REALLY good for $3! 

Great spot for group hangouts, however it gets very loud and noisy even on non-game days so conversations might involve some shouting. By the back of the bar there are picnic tables for a more cozy gathering and a basketball arcade game for fun.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Placed a delivery order for a burrito and Mexican chocolate mousse. Food arrived quick and hot. Burrito was meh.... the ingredients weren't well distributed, so I alternated between bites of straight chicken and bites of straight guacamole. Chips and red + green salsa came for free - chips were stale and salsas just weren't to my liking. Mexican chocolate mousse tasted like they accidentally substituted salt for sugar. I licked off the homemade whipped cream and tossed the rest.

Sounds like this place might have a good bar scene and tacos, but I won't be ordering from here again.
author: Kristin C.

description:
I adore places that allow me to indulge in two of my favorite menu items for breakfast/brunch - fish and avocado.

The Taco Shop at Underdogs manifests my two loves in a truly beautiful way.

There was no wait and our waiter couldn't have been more attentive or helpful. 

Some of the things we ordered:

Skinny Guac with cucumbers, jicama, radish & carrots. - I couldn't stop beaming as I dipped crunchy jicama into hearty guacamole.

Fresh corn on the cob brushed with lime salsa & dusted with cotija cheese & cayenne pepper. It reminded me of the Cuban Corn on the Cob I used to get in New York.

Mexican Taco with grilled fish - Please note that the taco will come with cheese included in the tortilla. The fish was tasty

Kurobuta Pork Carnitas - Not the most flavorful carnitas that I ever had, but was fantastic once topped with hot sauce and guacamole.

The Taco Shop was well lit and full of easy going regulars watching a variety of sports games on the TVs around the place. I dug the mellow ambiance in the place and how quickly all of our food came out.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
This place was always packed ... it's all first come first serve. Never had any issues with service. I always sat at the bar. They serve bomb carne asada tacos (get nicks way). Taco portion is pretty good. Their burritos and salad is great too. Chips/guac/salsa are on point as well. Never had 

I don't know if they still do it but on Friday's they did $1 margs for 30 minutes only. I don't know if they still do it. That was a killer deal. 

Great spot to watch the game, get tacos, and margs.
author: Mal L.

description:
I haven't been here since it was just Underdogs, several years ago.  This place still looks the same.  Some friends and I met up there to watch the Michigan/OSU rivalry game.  FYI, if you are an OSU fan, stay away hahaha.

We got there in the morning and I had an Irish Coffee that hit the spot, a few friends had tacos and a breakfast burrito and they said it was the bomb.  With that being said, I didn't have a bad time here and I had a great time while I was here. 4/5 stars because nothing really blew me away and nothing here to stop me from coming to this spot again.  

Although I do have to say, if you don't live in the area, its pain in the ass to get to, its far from SF proper and the weather out there in the Sunset district is the worst.
author: Cliff S.

description: Excellent food and service! Great place to watch the game. The only downfall is they're so packed sometimes it's a long wait to get a table but then again for all the good bars in SF there's going to be a wait...definitely worth it.
author: Jennifer T.

description: I have eaten here a few times and the food is consistent and good. Great thing is that it's surrounded by Asian restaurants so Jt is a nice change for the neighborhood. Mexican corn is fabulous
author: Lynda N.

description: My new favorite bar in the Sunset. How can you not like a place that has friendly staff and great Mexican food?  If you're into sports, it's also a good spot to watch a game.
author: Ada C.

description:
Who is this Nick I keep hearing about? I'm not really sure but let's just say that Nick's way is the only way now to do any tacos. 

I came here for Taco Tuesday night even though I don't believe there was any special on tacos available... it is still nevertheless Tuesday, so tacos shall be had anyways (the law of the week). Grabbed a table in the back and sat down and was convinced to get Nick's Way.

Best choice ever! I got the carnitas tacos, Nick's Way (thanks Nick!) and it came out looking like a mini burrito. Wow! It was delicious. Crispy tortilla with a lot of meat and a lot of guac. I added a lot of the orange and green sauce after each bite and it was even more delicious. 

If the carnitas was that good, what would the fish taco be like? I guess I have to find out next Taco Tuesday. ;)

Cool things about this place: TVs everywhere for you to catch any sports game AND there's a basketball hoop game in the back. Imagine trying to shoot hoops after doing a flight of tequila shots.
author: Diana C.

description: Ok food, but very poor service, no acknowledgement when you walk in and even if slow it's like you are pulling teeth to get a hello much less a smile.  I only come in as last resort but no more, at least the drivers of Uber eats and Eat24 know to say thank you or good night.
author: Angel M.

description: Unbelievably good food. The quesadilla is amazing, and both of their salsas are incredible as well. It can get pretty crowded and there's not a ton of table space, especially for large groups, so be aware of that during peak hours. It's just as good for takeout, though! Also last time I went they were playing American Ninja Warrior on the TVs which was super funny.
author: Alex R.

description: loooove underdawgs and their nachos. possibly best nachos in San Francisco. get their margarita with it and you're set. I also recommend their elote. atmosphere is great too.
author: Ksenia A.

description:
Place is always packed but somehow there is also turnover and we've always been able to get a table in the back as a big group. Must just be destiny each time. 
Either way staff is super friendly here, and service is great. Beers and Mexican food so everything is good. Most go with the Nick's way tacos but I was once tempted by the california burrito. The fries were delicious but the burrito was tasty but too dense. I mean that's what i get for a french fry burrito - just a lot of potato and tortilla with a little bit of meat. The nacho plate is giant and a awesome. 
Tv's everywhere but sound is still absorbed well enough for everyone to have a conversation at normal voices. Parking is a pain around there but that's not their fault.
author: Veronica L.

description: I had the carne asada and fish tacos made nick's way and they were huge. Personally, I am a fan of street tacos because I grew up eating 50 cent tacos from a taco truck. The tacos here couldn't be more polar opposites. I did appreciate that huge serving of avocado guacamole concoction. crispy/regular corn tortilla combination was interesting but I'm not sure if I liked it but I did eat the whole thing. I guess the bottom line is whether or not I would crave one of those tacos enough that I would go back? Unfortunately, the answer is no, but if a group of friends wanted to eat there I wouldn't mind either. If I had a choice between that and a taco truck, 10 times out of 10 I would choose the taco truck. Considering the price point, I guess I would understand if I was a college student that I would pay for the atmosphere; and overall, I'm glad I tried it and who knows I might try it again and might like it more.
author: Glenn A.

description: Great place to eat some tacos and get some drinks. The wait staff is attentive. The guacamole is nice. The tacos are okay. The atmosphere is sporty and fun filled with people but not crowded.
author: Byron L.

description: Sat at the bar, looking at the menu. Set the menu down and it took almost 30 minutes before any of the wait staff got the brilliant idea to see if I want to order anything. They seemed much more focused on socializing with each other and doing menial bar clean up task than to wait on patrons.
author: Joe B.

description: Elote con queso  and also the nicks way carne asada is amazing! The place is usually busy but service is pretty quick.
author: Mariel A.

description: The Taco Shop at Underdogs is excellent. We've never been in, as we use Caviar, but the tacos and Elote con Queso (corn on the cob with mexican cheese and spices) are simply the best. period. The taco salad is also tasty as are the quesidillas...you can't go wrong.
author: Jeffrey H.

description: Their tacos are the star! The burritos are pretty good but I can't stress enough how much better their tacos are. A bite out of their tacos are an explosion of flavor. Their beef and pork tacos are especially delicious. But it's all good - tacos, tacos, tacos, tacos, tacos, got it?!
author: Theresa N.

description:
I've been here before, and at the time I wasn't too impressed with their taco Tuesday's street tacos.  Today I decided to give it another shot, I got their Baja taco (which the waiter made it nick's way and I never wanted that way, but I let it be) and I got their carne asada taco.

The tacos are pretty unique, they have a fried tortilla and a soft one on the outside.  In the inside they had a ton of filling including the meat of choice, and they're topped with guacamole and pico de gallo.  The tacos are definitely 5 stars, however,  for 5 bucks per taco that's the least I'd expect.

I will definitely be back and perhaps try a burrito, but it seem that the tacos are their forte.  My advice to anyone who hasn't been there, is to make sure they got your order right prior to taking it in, especially if you don't want any surprises on your bill.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
There's so much to taco about that I'm going to just dive right into this giant bucket of margarita! First of all, we need to all agree that tacos and margaritas are one of the best combination that the culinary world has to offer to everyone and if you have the urge to even disagree, I suggest you stop reading because you're loco! And even though you may be loco, this place still welcomes loco people so come on in!

As you all know, this is a taco shop and all taco shops serve good tacos or why else would it still be in business right? This place serves up some decent tacos depending on which one you choose off the menu. I'd rate the tacos 2-3 stars due to their taste being A-ok (3/5 stars) and overly priced($5 per taco), which is why I only come here on the certain days of the week.

Taco Tuesday - $2 Street Tacos (very basic, lettuce & your choice of meat) and $3 Tecates from 5 pm to close!
Margarita Friday - $1 Margaritas from 6-6:30pm

Keep in mind that if they didn't have these specials, then I probably wouldn't come here as often as I would like.

Overall, I definitely will be coming back for more $2 tacos or $1 margarita happy hours! Nothing is truly better than hanging out with friends, getting food, and watching each other laugh their butt's off!
author: Benson M.

description:
From recently becoming a pescatarian, I have been searching for a great Taco Tuesday place that serves awesome fish tacos. 

Even though the fish tacos are not part of their Taco Tuesday deal, I loved their Nick's way fish tacos (a soft tortilla with a corn tortilla on the inside topped with lotsa lettuce and guac!). You can get any taco Nick's way but it just tastes so good with their nicely battered fish! This taco alone was good for me in addition to the street tacos! My only criticism with the vegetarian is beans being the only source of protein. It would be nice if they can add some other vegetables or a seasonal vegetable. Other than that, I had a great experience and thought the servers/bartenders were really accommodating. Yes, especially on a Tuesday, this place can get super crowded, so I suggest not coming in a large group unless you come early! Can't wait for another taco Tuesday here!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: Best tacos hands down, don't care what anybody says, you just can't  beat  Nick's way solution :) get the fried fish nicks way and you will know what I'm talking about.
author: Alexei D.

description: I love taco shop because of the alcohol and food that they serve also?the workers are really nice!
author: Jory G.

description:
Middle of the week and we were hit with one of the warmest days so far this year. Like no lie, my boyfriend and I were outside at 9pm without a jacket and we were still fine. And warm nights apparently called for beer and tacos so we took our butts to Underdogs. 

Located on Irving, parking could be a pain if you decide to come here before 6pm. Any later and maybe you'll have good luck? My boyfriend and I struggled a bit and ended up parking 4 blocks away but it was a nice night so we're not complaining.

We were super confused right off the bat. I knew that Underdogs was part of a bar but I didn't think it would all be mixed together. I thought there would be a separate window for tacos, but nope. There are tables all the way to the back that are first come first serve if you wish to sit back and enjoy your food. 

Service was amazing. I am super grateful for Magz (here's hoping that was her real name on the receipt) because I told her it was our first time there and we were confused on how to go about ordering food as that was the main goal and she broke everything down for us and told us the top choices for food (including doing it Nick's way) as well as gave us a drink menu just in case. She was patient and even continued to check in on us after we were seated. And upon hearing it was our first time, she gave us some free chips and salsa! Bless her for working there, she's my favorite already. 

The food was definitely a bit pricey. But then again it's located in San Francisco so I have to try to understand that. My boyfriend and I both got their 3 tacos plate with carnitas, carne asada, and chicken and then I added an order of the elote which the kitchen ended up splitting in half so both my boyfriend and I got our own piece. The food was all good especially with their salsas, the only downside really was that the chicken was sort of dry. If anything, we'll probably stick to the carnitas or carne asada tacos next time. 

Overall, good eats for a warm night! It does get super loud in here with the music blasting but who needs to hear what their friends are saying when you're busy stuffing your face with food right?
author: Venus L.

description:
Get your tacos Nick's way!! For an extra $1.25 they give you a huge amount of guac, cheese, and salsa! And the taco is wrapped with a hard shell AND a soft shell... Yummmm. Add the mild green sauce on top and you are good to go!

Honorable mention goes to the carne asada breakfast burrito! My bf and I came in here a bit early because they weren't serving tacos or regular burritos yet. We ended up getting the breakfast burrito and we were both blown away!!! The soft scrambled eggs, melted cheese, tender carne asada (I absolutely HATE it when carne asada is too dry/tough), and crunchy hashbrowns were a delicious combination. I would definitely order that again if I went early enough.
author: Tara A.

description: the tacos here are huge and they give so much guac!! i enjoy the tacos here because they come with a crispy taco shell and a regular taco shell! the nick's taco is sooo huge that i can get full off of just one taco. i always get the carnitas and it's good all the times i have been here. i almost always get the chips and salsa! they usually come with the salsa on top so if you don't like that, make sure to ask for it on the side!
author: diane d.

description:
The food here is amazing! The burritos don't disappoint, especially with the side sauces. I usually order the California burrito with fries in it.

I don't sit down too often at the bar during peak hours as I'm generally repulsed by the convivial denizens who frequent this establishment. Their youthful vigor repulses me in my old age. But if you're young and want to watch sports this is the spot!
author: Jonathan B.

description:
You know that sudden craving you get around midnight because you're on Yelp instead of sleeping? Well this hapoened to me last night as I stumbled upon Underdogs. I've been wanting to go here for quite some time but was always turned off by the parking on Irving St.

The atmosphere is very casual. To sum it up, it's a bar with a few high tables around. Not good for families. Lots of bar seating though.

What I Ordered:

* Fish Tacos (Nick's Way): DELICIOUS! You get a huge piece of fried white fish, wrapped in a fried tortilla that's wrapped in a fresh corn tortilla, dolloped with a huge serving of guacamole, & topped with cabbage and cilantro. I've never had a fish taco like theirs. It'll change your life. And they are huge! (I'm a big eater but got full with just one...BUT I still ate the other piece hehe).

* Elote: Corn on the cob slathered with crema (?) and coated with cojita cheese and paprika. Good but the ones from the flea markets are better.

All in all, I definitely will go back. Even if the parking is bad lol. It's rare to find a good fish taco and I'm glad I found one. Nice one Underdogs!
author: Ralph N.

description: I don't like the dry shredded chicken, but a great place to watch games and drink brew and meet new people.
author: Carla E.

description:
Went here with a friend, and waited 20 minutes for a seat only to end up walking out. While they offer a fairly full and decently priced menu, there is hardly any seating available for those that would like to eat there. When we DID finally grab a table, not a single waiter attempted to take our orders, let alone give us glasses of water.

With $3.50 for chips & salsa & their """street style""" tacos, it's easy to tell from the menu alone that The Taco Shop is nothing more than a glorified, whitewashed sports bar ft. Mexican food.
author: Cody P.

description:
I ordered a Grilled Shrimp taco Nick's way and it was so yummy! It's the right kind of crunchy, not the taco bell kind. Huge prawns, delicious guacamole, all kinds of fresh cabbage, and on point red salsa!  if I'm ever in the area, I'll stop by again. 

Now their sangria, not a fan. It was watered down. Not a great $7 spent
author: Paula R.

description: Holy guacamole this place is amazing.  I was skeptical given it's not located in the Mission, but this is my go to place for tacos!  Nothing beats multiple delicious margaritas and the baja tacos.  The service is always top notch - very friendly and quick, and they keep the drinks coming!  I make the "trek" out here from Nob Hill and it is worth it every time.
author: Allie G.

description:
Underdog's, I love you. 

Thank you for always having my order ready when I pick it up. Thank you for your consistently good food. Thank you for the numerous Nick's way shrimp tacos I have consumed. Thank you for making THE BEST quesadillas in the city (the world even). Thank you for the amazingly sweet and savory elotes. Lastly, thank you for only being down the street from work. It really makes my life easier.

Best regards,
C
author: Christine G.

description:
This is one of my group's very popular go-to places (especially, but also unfortunately on Tuesdays - because it gets so so so crowded - but for good reason!) We love this place for more than just their tacos. 

It's a fun sports bar vibe with excellent margaritas and delicious food on top! 

The only reason I knocked off a star is probably because service can be kind of all over the place -- especially if you're lucky enough to be seated off in the corner, you may get somewhat neglected. I just feel like if they know they're going to be busy, they might have a better system to check up on their customers. But don't get me wrong! All the staff is always super nice, super chill, and super approachable. 

The food is always delicious, the tacos are always loaded one side with too much guac (kidding, there's no such thing) [Nick's way] that makes them fall over a little too easily, but it doesn't matter because they're delicious whether you eat them from the shell or have to pick them up off the plate.

I've been here enough times that yes, everything on the menu is delicious. Fair pricing, considering it's SF. But from the elote, to the street tacos (but why would you get those - cuz helllllooo nick's way), to the burritos -- the meats are always deliciously seasoned and everything is loaded with flavor! 
 
Margaritas are delicious and on the strong and pricey side, but they definitely hit you before you know it. 

Last tip: do NOT forget to ask for their three fresh salsas to add the perfect touch on every bite.
author: Erika M.

description: I was in SF and my friend who lives there speaks nothing but amazing things about the Baja Fish Tacos. I was excited to try and was kind of hesitant when it was $7.50 for a taco, but let me just say that they were amazing! I was honestly full with just one taco and some chips and salsa. The flavor was unlike anything I've had on a taco. Also, to top it off, they have squeeze bottles of hot sauce. I put so much on and was in love with every bite. Now I can't wait to get back to the Bay Area!
author: Michael L.

description:
THE MOST AMAZING TACOS I HAVE EVER HAD. 

You MUST MUST MUST try the Nick's ways taco, it's two taco shells - one crunchy and one soft, this absolutely makes the taco so BOOOOMb. Also, there house made chorizo is soooooo good, I could literally eat spoonfuls of it.

Downside:
I tried to order online but they didn't have all their options :(
author: Loan L.

description: We found this spot because of the 10% rewards toward Uber credits when using your Visa card, and now it's our go-to to-go Mexican spot near my fiancé's house. The salsa is spicy and packed with flavor (always a good sign for Mexican food). So far everything we've tried on the menu has been top notch: grilled veggie burrito, mahi burrito, carne asada breakfast burrito, roasted corn salad, the fish tacos (get them Nick's way!) - all fantastic. Even their chocolate mousse is really good! I asked if they serve flan and was told "not yet, we're still perfecting it." Well cheers to their pursuit of perfection!
author: Yusef S.

description: Perfect choice for a late night snack/dinner. GREAT margaritas (although the jalapeno one burned my face off and I like 'em hot) also great bear selection. Fast, friendly service all around. Tacos came out impossibly fast. We ordered them whatever their signature way is and they were tasty but HUGE. I ordered two and it was more food than I thought it would be. So consider yourself warned. Oh, and ask for their house hot sauces. YUM!
author: Sara H.

description: Great place to watch a game and get together with friends. Love the tacos, dollar margs, and buckets of Calicraft.
author: Marie C.

description: Came here for the first time yesterday and it was so fun! Our friend won a day of endless tacos, beer and margaritas. They had the games on and the place was packed! I really enjoyed the place and will for sure be back!
author: Brittany A.

description: This review is strictly for the food that was ordered to go. I had ordered the street tacos: chorizo, carne asada, and carnitas, all of which were dry on a cold corn tortilla. The only thing that was truly enjoyable was the green salsa. Unfortunate outcome for the price. I don't write many reviews being in the industry myself, but these tacos were an atrocity to what Mexican street tacos actually are. Honestly, truly, maybe the 4 stars are for the bar, but definitely not the  food. Hopefully it was a one time thing.
author: Eddie A.

description:
Love this place! Great bar for sports and just a chill afternoon. Good tacos!

Parking is hard 
Pretty crowded at times, but who wants to go to an I crowded bar anyways? 

My hubby and I like to watch games here.
author: Muneera M.

description: Let me start out by saying I used to love this place! Like favorite spot for a burrito in the sunset, go here at least once a week, recommend it to friends kind of  LOVE. Things sure have changed. This year and last, I hadn't been going to Underdog's as often. I work in the Mission so La Taq and Farolito became my go to spots, but I'd still be sure to make it in here every few months. The last time I came here before this experience was in August and I was happy with it. Cut to Saturday night: I'm leaving a friend's on Irving and, even though I have dinner at home, I decide to order my favorite burrito from Underdog's because that would be so much tastier! I call in a pick-up order of a bean and cheese burrito con todo and they tell me it'll be ready in 10 mins. Cool. I arrive at Underdog's after 10 mins to get my order. I'm waiting beside the counter in the to-go pick up area and nobody acknowledges me until after five minutes I have to call over someone from further down the bar to help retrieve the order. Oh well, at least I have a tasty burrito. I rush home and get settled in and start to enjoy my burrito. After a few bites I find a huge chunk of meat in my vegetarian burrito. Thanks Underdogs...no need to go back when there are other solid burrito spots in Sunset...
author: Shav S.

description:
I totally agree with the reviews of the staff -- Very friendly and nice.

However, the food is pretty bad.  I had the Carne Asada San Francisco burrito -- TOTAL GUT BOMB, and not in any way that could be favorably construed.

As a point of reference, I grew up in southern California and lived in San Diego for quite some time.  I know what good Mexican food tastes like -- This ain't it,  Sorry.
author: David C.

description: I wanted to rate this place because I never got a chance to. I went here a few times while living in San Francisco. I was surprised the Mexican food was so horrible and I was mad my quesadilla was soggy . My first experience was bad because I was on a date and had to pretend I didn't hate the place . I was hungry slightly so I ate what I could and my food was good. The next times I went I went for just drinks and it was fine . I don't care for their food because it's not that good and it's only good if you are super drunk. I like authentic Mexican food and this place doesn't really put much effort into it. They just slap everything all together and most people don't care because they are wasted . End of my story I hope my review entertained you .
author: Megan G.

description: I love burritos and underdogs definitely hit the spot. It's a great place if you want to watch a game and definitely have one of their jalapeño margaritas. I'll be back next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Joseph H.

description:
This is definitely a great place if not, one of the better places to get tacos in the Sunset District. My girlfriend and I are huge tacos al pastor fans and while that is not on option here, we definitely get picky with our taco cravings 

That being said, they have really great "Mexican Street Style" carne asada tacos that will make your mouth water for more. The music is always upbeat, there are plenty of TVs showing whichever game you're interested in, and the staff is friendly. Avoid Taco Tuesday if you don't want the crowds but besides that, give it a try next time you're nearby. They won't let you down. Enjoy!
author: Diego A.

description: Bartender was well versed with excellent recommendations,  polite, good coversstion and welcoming.  As a black women, when I spends my money, it needs to be with a business who values my dollars and this taco/bar DOES! Extra plate to share...no charge. Family friendly too. Now onto the food....the tortilla was pliable, well grilled and of approved texture. Inside was perfect proportiona of rice, beans, avo, and meat, yummy dummy meat (carne asada). NoirNapa Approved!
author: Shalana P.
