description: My husband, sister and I all stop in at least a couple times a month. We bring friends here often to share in the delicious tacos and spicy margaritas. I am vegetarian and appreciate the nachos and taco salad as well. Hubby gets the cheeseburger burrito and loves it. Staff are always attentive and friendly!
author: A M.

description:
When our buddy was here from Florida, we wandered in here looking for quick cheap eats and local beer. Well, we got all of that and more! SCORE!!!

Excellent service, great prices, fast yummy food, and nostalgic atmosphere. It was comfortable, unpretentious, and had just the right amount of choices for an easy going afternoon of chillin' in the city. 

Plenty of tvs filled with sports, and a couple of old arcade machines to boot. We felt like locals and were treated pretty darn well. What a nice casual break from the bustling city outside.
author: KellyAnn J.

description:
What better to do on a Tuesday than to get tacos! I heard about the hype with this place and definitely wanted to come and try it for myself. I have to say that I'm really, really torn. I came with high expectations and wanted so bad to like this place, but I left disappointed. I've had legit street tacos from Mexico which were incredible so it's hard, once you've had amazing, nothing else can seem to compete. 

On a side note: seriously who charges for sour cream? 

1) Mexican Street-Style Tacos(Carne Asada + Carnitas): $2/each on Tuesdays (as opposed to $7.95/3 tacos regularly). The carne asada was cooked nicely, but the carnitas was really dry. They're essentially the smallest tacos I have ever seen and they just contain meat, onions, and cilantro. By itself there isn't much flavor, the sauces they provide on the table do help to make it a bit more flavorful. I think tacos should be good on its own while the sauce merely helps to enhance it not completely bring the only flavor it has. $2 worth of a taco? eh. $2 worth of flavor? eh. I wouldn't order again.  

2) I've been hearing people talk constantly about Nick's taco and I finnnallly got to try it!
Nick's Way (Carne Asada, $5.75): it was a pretty tasty combination, I definitely like the crisp from the tortilla. Was I amazed? Not as much as I had hoped. I was expecting to be mindblowned by the flavor, but really it just tastes like a burrito with tortilla chips built to look like a taco. It's a hit or miss depending on how you like your tacos. 

PARKING: street, I parked near the library which was free, except on Wednesdays 6am-8am. On Irving itself, there are metered parking. You could also park on the residential areas. 

SERVICE: great, very quick! Once you go in, you basically find your own table if one is open, or  you can sit by the bar. We had no trouble finding a place to sit, even on Taco Tuesday! 

Overall, the tacos here were okay. I hate to say it because the service was great and they're really great people. Everyone's experience will be different of course.
author: Vivian S.

description:
I was picking up to go order the other day. On my way out, i grabbed some napkins from the counter, one of the waitresses had the nerve to tell me that there's a Walgreens pretty close by instead of stealing their napkins. Whattttt????  Did I grab the whole napkin box with me or something? She wasn't joking either. 

I get that people get tired from working long busy days, but what she did was blatantly ignorant or just plain stupid. Taco Shop is busy and always packed spot on Irving otherwise.
author: Agus S.

description:
Not necessarily the bestest or most authentic tacos or Mexican food ever, but Underdog's is nevertheless a great neighborhood option to gather in large groups for sports games. If they have deals like happy hour or Taco Tuesday, then that's an added bonus.

It's an unofficial Michigan bar, so there's nothing like a merry, rowdy atmosphere full of folks cheering on the Leaders and Best, all over a nice beer selection and a filling crispy taco or two. Hail to the Victors!
author: Vincent L.

description: This place has excellent food.   Just happened to stumble upon it while visiting San Fran.   I wish I could take this place home with me!   Great atmosphere, as well.  My only negative is that it was extremely loud while I was there.
author: Tim W.

description:
Taco Tuesday, yum. Absolutely loved their Baja Style tacos. Crispy, flavorful, and easy to eat! It didn't fall apart when I took a bite, and that says a lot about a huge taco like this one! I also tried their carne asada tacos, LOVEDDDD those too. Their brown sauce is freakin delish, and top it all of with their sangria and you're good to go. I'm supposed to be on a "diet", but I had two Baja Style tacos and about 2 1/2 carne asada tacos. I don't regret it at all. Get in my belly!

Tips: They check IDs in case you want to drink. But I think under 21 is allowed, too? Not sure, but my brother-in-law took my 2 year old niece last last taco tuesday and was fine. Lol. You also have to put your name on a list, but the bar is first come first serve!
author: Nile A.

description:
The Taco Shop is great whenever there is a big game going on. A wide selection of beer, delicious tacos (Nick's Way!), and a basketball arcade game at the back make this one of my favorite sports bars to go to. So when the Giants had a crucial game against the Los Angeles Losers (formally known as the Dodgers), I put on my orange and black and walked into The Taco Shop expecting a hell of a good time again.

And then the bartender happened.

Maybe she was having a bad day. I like to give people the benefit of the doubt, especially when they're in the service industry. But that wasn't the case. She was flashing smiles to everyone else and reserving the nose-ring RBF just for us.

Or oh shoot, maybe I was wearing a Dodgers hat by mistake! Naw. Looked up at my hat and it was as orange&black as the blood running through my veins.

So why was she so mean to us? Why was she so curt to us like her name Curt Schilling? Why did she tell us to stand at a place where there's no angle to watch the game, but welcomed other folks who stood at the exact same place afterwards? And why did she have to give my friend a "smh" and a valley girl eye roll when he mistakenly asked her to close out his tab?

Again, the Taco Shop is great (and for the record, the hostess, bouncer, and the other bartenders were really friendly as well). But I don't pay $20 for a pitcher for it to come with a side of attitude. There are other cheaper establishments to choose from (Bus Stop, Blarney Stone, Dragon Lounge, Yancy's, Nelly's, etc.), and they are usually equipped with a team of bartenders that smiles. 

I'm going to miss the tacos and the atmosphere, but sorry Taco Shop, I won't come back because I deserve better than that RBF bartender.
author: Ringo M.

description:
Long overdue review! I've been coming here even before legal drinking age just for the tacos! That's right. An excellent taco does not require a margarita to down! I've only ever ordered tacos here. You get a choice of 3 street tacos:carnitas, pollo, carne asada for $7.95. On Tuesdays, they're only $2 each! Although the street tacos are excellent, I usually order mine nicks way, which is basically a soft tortilla wrapped over a crispy shell. They REALLY stuff it with TONS of guac, cheese, and pico. I definitely appreciate places that don't skimp on guac. Get the baja fish. You won't regret it. Also their sauces are like crack. I literally put it on every bite. 

Note: it does get super crowded and noisy on taco Tuesdays. But why would go to a taco shop on a Tuesday without expecting it be crazy?
author: Jennalyn L.

description:
Omg, Nick's way is the best way.

Been here a couple times now and never got around to writing a review until now. 

Come in & seat yourself! Take a look at their menu and order away! To be honest I haven't really tried much here. I've only tried their carne asada, carnitas, and fish tacos - all nicks way. That's definitely the most important... dont forget that cause they add in a ton of guac, sour cream, cheese for you. The most I've ever had is 2 and I'm stuffed. They're kind of like a hybrid of a taco & burrito lol. 

I've also had their margarita and its pretty good - nothing special about it. If you come between 4:30 - 6, Mon - Fri, it's only $4!
author: Carrie L.

description: Dropped by for a quick pre-dinner snack and got their carne asada taco Nick's way, which has both a crunchy taco shell and a tortilla on the outside. The concept was unique and the taco was good and decently sized, but I didn't think it was worth $7 after tax and tip, maybe if they gave out complimentary chips.
author: Cheyne T.

description:
Is it blasphemous to not get any tacos if you come in here?! 

Don't worry I ordered plenty of tacos. All Nicks Way of course; 3 Baja Style Tacos, and one of each Carne Asada, Carnitas, and Pollo. Just order any tacos Nicks Way and you'll be extremely satisfied. 
 

Absolutely devoured them all. Tacos were made to be eaten in multiples and I'll always eat them as so.
author: John M.

description:
For a place called the taco shop, you'd think that they would have stellar tacos at least... but nope. A majority of my group and I ordered the 3 taco plates and were very underwhelmed. Cost around $3 per taco which all came out cold, and could only be saved by the hot and mild sauces on the table. But that's SF pricing for ya

Place was pretty crowded and loud, service was friendly. Typical sports bar environment but the menu was a little lacking
author: Nicolette E.

description: Great service.  Tacos are amazing (Nick's way.)  Plenty of TVs.  And of course the Michigan connection.  Go Blue!
author: Andrew P.

description:
2 Beef Tacos Nicks Way |$13.05|
One of my favorite taco shops ! Environment there is very chill and outgoing. I love eating tacos, so the nicks way is the way to go !
author: Terilyn W.

description:
One of the best places to grab some Mexican food in SF.

This review is for the food only, not the bar. I did not have high expectations coming in to this location, and was highly debating just grabbing some Pho next door or pizza across the street, both of which turned out to be great options. Nevertheless, I decided to give this place a shot, and tried both their steak SF style burrito and chicken California burrito. The flavor on both these burritos is phenomenal, and the great part is that they do not skimp on the meat. The rice, beans, and tomatoes are all fresh, and the fries on the California were great. I wish they gave more than a couple small containers of salsa, because that was great as well.

I am definitely coming back here in the future.
author: Kevin T.

description: Hands down the best French fries I have ever eaten. The steak tacos were delicious as well as the steak nachos. Beers were cold and staff was super nice. Totally deserves 5 stars.
author: Kaitlyn R.

description:
Family friendly sports bar with great vibes. Tons of TV's and plays all kinds of sports. Great place to watch football, basketball, soccer, world cup, hockey, you name it. 

Awesome and friendly staff. Food and drinks reasonably price. they have taco Tuesday specials and happy hour too. 

Clean, friendly warm environment.
author: William S.

description:
Solid bar, solid food

I often pass by this place on my way to Irving for whatever food I'm feeling that day. I've been here a few times, but I am finally getting around to writing a review here! 

I hear they have an awesome happy hour deal, but I was not able to take advantage of it. 

I came here for a quick dinner yesterday (noting the Pokemon Go craze at the moment... there are two poke-stops here that people lure)

I ordered 3 tacos (carne asada, carnitas, and pollo) as well as a regular quesadilla. The tacos are what you would expect from a traditional Mexican taco, with corn tortillas, meat, and onion/cilantro. They were pretty small so I definitely suggest getting something on top of that. 

The quesadilla was much larger than I thought, so its a good deal for ~$4. The sides were missing cheese but I like the crunchy tortilla!. 

I didn't get any drinks, so I guess I'll save that for happy hour next time or maybe for a game?
author: Jonathan C.

description: This place is sooo clutch. Best Fish Taco in the city! Their Carne Asada Taco is pretty delicious too. Great spot to catch some sports over beers and food!
author: Austin R.

description:
Chips were stale, guac was just avo, pico was just tomatoes. I love tomatoes and avocado, but prefer some more flavor, maybe even a little spice if it's not too much to ask. 

Had three tacos: chorizo, Mexican style; baja fish and carne asads nick's style. Chorizo was more oily than usual and lacked that good Mexican homemade chorizo taste. Carne Asada was meh. Fish was good but the nick's style took away from the meat. Just added more of the aforementioned poor items (stale fried tortilla, avo, flavorless pico). 

Mexican chocolate mousse dessert was nice. 

Server was really great as were other employees. Place was packed. All that with 4 stars had me expecting much more.
author: Thomas P.

description: Eaten here several times.  Last night we ordered delivery via Doordash.  After placing the order I realized I forgot to order extra salsa.  I called and spoke to Al and he went above and beyond for me without making me call Doordash to edit my order.  Superb customer service.  Doug hires great people and I get that feeling with every experience I have at Underdog's.  And these are my favorite tacos in town!
author: Steve P.

description:
3.5 stars rounded up. 

A bar that serves Mexican food in the back. It's a bit noisy and grimey, as bars usually are. They've also got a couple tables in the back for people to dine at. 

I brought people who've never had authentic Mexican food much before, and they really enjoyed the food. Since its Baja-style fish tacos, it's easy on the spices and has its own kind of condiments. The fish is in one big piece, rather than the other kind that is fixed and battered individually, so you do get more fish than batter. I thought the fish tacos were delicious - not blowing my mind, but quite solid. However, I didn't really care for the chips topped with guac and pico de gallo... I expected those to be on the side so the chips don't get soggy, but all of the components were just so-so anyway so I didn't eat that much. 

I like the atmosphere, and good fish tacos are not that common around here (I do have another favourite place tho :p), so it's getting a round up to 4 stars.
author: Alice C.

description:
I came here for the NBA finals and it was packed! Can't get a seat anywhere and ended up standing but that was fine. Near the 3rd quarter, I ended up sharing a table with some bros. 

The bartenders are friendly and the service is good. I tried their cheese burger burrito and it was pretty good. There was a chewy piece in there but I washed it down with some beer. 

+for the atmosphere
+taco tuesdays
author: Sam Y.

description:
Whoa... Just got back from here. It was my first time here and I ordered take-out so my experience was very brief, but I could definitely see myself hanging out here a lot more. I had heard of this place because it's by the same guy from Nicks CrispyTacos in Russian Hill. This was right on my way back from Pacifica so I decided to pick up some tacos to take home. 

The staff were incredibly nice. I always take extra note when the staff seem genuinely helpful. Everyone from the guy who showed me where to go order for take out, the guy who took my order. As I waited, a couple of people made sure I was already being helped, and all just seemed overall really nice. Tons of TVs with the Giants game and soccer. Some of the tables toward the back look like arcade games and they also have communal tables in the back, individual tables in the front, and seating at the bar. 

It seems like they have awesome deals throughout the week and they partake in one of my favorite weekday celebrations: taco Tuesday.

I got two tacos one carne asada and one chicken BOTH nicks way. Nicks way is the only way IMHO. Both were amazing but I had a slight preference for the carne asada. Beyond that they also have California burritos as well. I'll definitely be back!!
author: Thielson D.

description:
Tacos!! This is my go to place when I get that taco craving! Baja Nick's Way always hit the spot for me. That creamy avocado, crunchy outside layer, with that spicy salsa makes me salivate thinking about it! Perfect place to watch games, grab a drink after dinner, and just plain chilling with friends. 

Pros:
Good Food
Good Price
Good selection on drinks. 
Basketball arcade 
Tables for medium and small size groups
Friendly servers

Con:
Too loud
Overcrowded at times ( But lines don't lie...)
author: Tiffany C.

description:
What an awesome place! Let me tell you, they got everything from great food, beer, tv's and my favorite a lively atmosphere. Also got to mention the bartenders are pretty funny! I order a baja fish taco nick's way because it's got guac and a few more extra things for $2.50 more. The sauces they got even adds more flavor to your order. Another impressive thing I noticed was they got all sorts of types of burritos from the San Diego burrito with no rice and beans, to mission style and California burritos.

On to the beer, so I order a pizza port draft beer just because it sounds cool and it's from San Diego. That might be my new favorite beer! Also took a shot of vodka and fernet! Was told there's $1 margaritas on Friday's from 5-6 so I have to check that out. 

There's also a good amount of tv's and you definitely get what you're paying for here. The staff is really friendly and easy to talk to! Also gotta mention how the name underdogs is so cool, tacos, beer, tv free parking Sunday's. Say no more.
author: Dan G.

description:
This little hot spot is worth waiting to get a seat in. Best, in my experience, for groups of friends. While it is a little noisy, one can appreciate that the atmosphere lends itself to being a great place to meet up before a night out on the town. 

The top shelf Margaritas, in pitcher-while a bit spendy, are a bargain for the quality-and I think, are appropriately priced. Pay more get more.

I have tried every taco, and will do so again. I can say, after years of travel all over Mexico, I prefer their delivery of the Baja style fish taco to some of the other offerings. The Baja style fish taco is definitely our group favorite.
author: SF D.

description:
10 out of 10 would come back for Taco Tuesday! 

I have passed by this place for over a decade now and finally made it to Taco Tuesday! It was crowded, but not to an absurd level like Nicks on Broadway gets. They have $3 street tacos and the carne asada is awesome. They also have delicious elote (if u haven't tried it, get it) and good tacos nicks ways. I liked the Cadillac margarita but I don't think they had much of a happy hour deal on them. 

The service could be a bit faster, but I do understand that it is Taco Tuesday. I hope to be back again soon!
author: Nikita K.

description:
Awesome place to go for some bomb fish tacos! 

My first time coming to the place was like 3 days ago, and then I had it again today!! Definitely worth going to, especially if you are from out of town. The service is great, too! Very chill and friendly. Many TV's to watch games on (NBA Playoffs and Giants game were on at once, and I was enjoying while eating my two bomb tacos!)

Their margaritas were actually really good too! I think it's a first come first serve seating arrangement. But Sunday around 2pm-ish was a great time. We got our own table! 

Awesome place. Would recommend to anyone!
author: Angela Marie A.

description: Came here to watch the warriors vs cavilers and it was so much fun! It was an energetic and lively sports bar with one of the best tacos on town. Place was packed before the game started, so we stood for couple hours, but we met some really nice people who made sure we were able to sit by half time. We ordered the Baja tacos, carnitas and carne asada. These were big tacos! The sauces were also... crack. So freaking good.. I wish I could just buy their sauces. Their corn on the cob was also one of the best I've ever had. Their nachos were a bit too hard, but overall this place was my favorite sports bar I've ever been to!
author: Joling S.

description: The neighborhood hangout spot. The fish tacos are great and the atmosphere is always fun!
author: Ishani S.

description:
The burritos are excellent, and the atmosphere is great, pretty laid back and chill. 

One small thing: if you get delivery through doordash, you cannot place your order unless you elect to purchase a 5 cent napkin for each item. I mean, it's not a big deal and I wanted napkins anyways, but why would you force people to check a box saying they want to purchase a napkin? To clarify, you don't have the option to not buy a napkin. The only purpose this serves is to make the restaurant come off as super cheap.

But definitely eat their food, it's good
author: John S.

description: The wait is long for a table but every good place has the same problems in SF. The Nick's carne asada taco was really great. I wasn't able to finish it. The service was good but they are very busy. It is a bar with lots of TV screens so be prepared for a noisy lunch on a Saturday. I would definitely go there again.
author: Janice R.

description:
Love the fish tacos "nick's way", and their elotes! It's a little pricey, but that's just SF for ya. 

Anyway, come with your friends and enjoy a few drinks while watching the game or call in and get take out! Food and service is great.  Dinner time can get packed so get there early.
author: bcast b.

description: Food was alright, but the elote con queso was awesome!
author: Vanessa M.

description:
Let's be honest, who DOESN'T like Mexican food? It tastes like God's cooking. 

I've been here quite a few times, and I always order chips and salsa with guacamole, and the entree part is usually something different, considering how delicious nearly everything is. 

But let's take a step back. Let's focus on the guacamole. 

Green Goddess Avocados. 

Not only is it chunky, it's mixed with the freshest ingredients that somehow enhance everything in your mouth. I'm just sayin', if you never had their guac before, you HAVE to have it now. You'll thank me later. 

I was so caught up with my guacamole that I forgot to take a picture of my Mission style chicken burrito with no rice, but if you love the guac, you'll love the burrito, too. 

Please, I have dreams about this guacamole. Go now!
author: Mariam M.

description:
Baja style beer-battered fish tacos, Nick's way. Get them!

Generously coated in batter without being too greasy, the fish is fresh, flaky, and very moist. Ordering any taco "Nick's Way" upgrades the flavor level. This option includes two tortillas (one soft, one crispy), jack cheese, pinto beans, pico de gallo, and real, chunky guacamole. I can't stress enough my hatred when places use the gross, watery version of guacamole.

I've also tried their free-range chicken taco, but the meat was very dry and unmemorable. The nachos with carnitas was quite a substantial portion that's perfect for sharing, and the nacho chips are sturdy enough to hold all the ample toppings, which include beans, pico de gallo, cheese, guacamole, and sour cream.

Food did seem to take a while to arrive, despite my visits during non-peak times (ie: when a major game isn't on TV). But service was still friendly. The walls are filled with sports paraphernalia, so The Taco Shop at Underdogs is an ideal place during big games and on an empty stomach.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
The food is good, but literally every time I come here the service is complete crap. The workers literally don't give a sh** about any of the customers. Only reason I come back is for the food, but the last time was the last straw. They need some new employees. Attitude is received from our server every time we go there. The two main douche bags are the skinny white guy and the fat latino guy. 

Ordered chips and salsa and drops a basket of chips with no salsa. Asked for salsa and comes back with a bowl and extra attitude. Another time we ordered a round of shots and asked him which was what, his response was "smell it". 

Skinny white guy one time complained cause we left cash in tip and he asked for more saying "we don't do that thing around here". Handed him the credit card receipt and pointed to the total tip, he shuttup in embarrassment realizing we tipped our server out even though the service was crap. And the funny thing is is that he wasn't our server that day (thank god, but not like it made a difference). Also heard him mocking the customers about the game. Great service guys. 

Oh yeah, and the last time we were there we finally spoke to the manager, and guess what his response was? "I don't give a shit". We get it if theres a Warriors game and if its busy, but to treat customers like crap for no reason isn't an excuse. If you can't work at a sports bar and take the crowd, then quit. Will definitely never come back. Getting worked up just writing this review.
author: Danilo f.

description:
Was there yesterday for the warrior game. Got there early to get a table and got a pretty cold reception from the waitress. We let other people sit at our table since we had room and the whole time we were there she neglected to check on us if we needed anything. We wanted to order food and drinks but never got the chance to and we did order she had a pretty bad attitude. Ordered one taco and it took 20-35 min to arrive. I know it takes a bit of time when it's busy, but when you see the people next to you order after you and get their food before you , it's pretty upsetting. We ordered shots from the latin waiter. We ordered 3 different shots and when he came back with the shots my friend asked which one was which and his reply was "smell them." 

When I got the bill they charged me for a drink we didn't order. And the manager, Max, came to us to explain what happened. I then proceed to tell him the service was a bit lacking today and his response was "I don't give a shit" 

Pretty baffled that you would curse at a paying customer. Totally unprofessional. 

We've been coming here for years and we love the atmosphere during games. Food here is great. But it sucks that the service brings this place down. Forget this place. Never coming back.
author: Adam J.

description:
The name of this place should be changed to something else Taco Shop is misleading. 

Yes, they do have tacos and breakfast burritos but this is a sports bar. 

We got breakfast burritos which were dumped in grease, very hard to taste the other ingredients.
author: Marcia d.

description: Love love love this place. Tacos Nick's way is the way to go! It has a causal vibe with a full bar and great food. How can anyone say no to that? The burritos and quesadillas are also pretty damn good. Don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu here. I love that this place is open late and there's plenty of parking around. They also show all the big sports games so it's a plus for all you sports fan. The only con is that this place is a little small so it can get crowded really fast.
author: Evonne T.

description: Great food in a great environment.  Feel like you're in Mexico or on a SoCal beach.  Fast service and very fresh ingredients.  My only complaint is that we ordered a quesadilla with pico de gallo for my teenage son.  He didn't like it and when the waitress asked why he said because he didn't like the sauce.  Her response was next time let us know you don't pico de gallo.  Not the response I was expecting.  Perhaps a sorry you didn't like it, can we get you something else instead.  We asked if we could give the quesadilla to her and take it off our bill, and order something else. She said no.  Once again not the response I was expecting.  Really?!!!
author: B R.

description: Upgrading this place - I've been back a couple of times, and quality has improved from my prior visit and review.
author: Nick C.

description:
Baja fish taco Nick's way is a must get! It comes with a crunchy taco wrapped with a soft taco. The red salsa is my favorite. I can finish half a bottle while eating two tacos. You can always buy a bottle of their salsa to take home for about $10-13 (I forgot the exact price). One baja fish taco Nick's way is $6.50. 

Their quesadillas are good too. It's stuffed with lots of cheese and meat. The tortilla is warm and crispy. 


TL;DNR - Delicious fish tacos, quesadillas, and amazing red salsa to go with every single bite of your food. And trust me. you're going to want some of that red salsa in every single bite.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Eh. The food here really isn't great. I've have gotten the veggie burrito a few times and it keeps getting worse it seems like. I've tried the tacos too and it is definitely not authentic Mexican food. It's good when your buzzed hahah. 

This is the type of place to go, get drinks, and watch whatever game is on. Wouldn't come here just to eat
author: Hayley D.

description:
You can never go wrong with any place that serves Nick's tacos.  I've been a fan of his for years but never knew he was behind the one at Underdog's.  I came for lunch last week and while the bar was empty, the service and tacos were great.  The bartender recommended I get the baja fish and carne asada tacos.  I did just that and loved both of them.

I only wish I live closer so I could eat here all the time!
author: Blake B.

description:
I was really really excited to try this place out, but it did not live up to my expectations.

My boyfriend told me that their tacos are bomb, but this may be because he devoured them when he was tipsy.

It was pretty crowded at 8pm on a Tuesday night, probably because it is Taco Tuesday and the Warriors game was on. We put our names down for 2 on the waiting list, but we were able to snag a spot at the bar after 5-10 minutes. We got two Tecate beers, thinking that they were $2 each, but they were $3 each... not worth it anymore haha.

We ordered 2 fish tacos, Nick's way (~$5 each), and 2 street carnitas tacos ($2 each). The Nick's way tacos were good, but not to die for. It's basically a crunchy taco shell wrapped in a soft taco tortilla. The street tacos were just whatever. The carnitas was tough to chew!

I have no regrets coming here, but I would probably only come back when I have the drunchies :P
author: Lincy H.

description: The street style carne asada tacos are amazing. Food came out quick and out server was very nice.
author: Isabel T.

description: Never actually got to taste their food but thought to yelp an interesting experience I had here (something I've never experienced in the city before). I had some friends from Canada visit and some local friends recommended this place. When we started ordering, they refused to serve beer to my Canadian friends who had their Canadian IDs and passports on them. The servers said they weren't allowed to serve them? Idk, people from all over the world come to SF and I know they drink so I'm not sure what was up but probably won't be going back. And for travelers, I don't know if it's just Canada or other places as well but you might have to have your dinner without a drink if you go here.
author: Roxi P.

description:
So crowded at normal hours! Hard to get a table, pity they don't have any room to expand. Maybe if they cut out the bar and just made it a restaurant... okay okay, sorry, forget I said that. What can I say, I'm just not a huge fan of the loud and rowdy scene... it feels  a bit like a college party sometimes.

The "Vegetariano" burrito is really delicious, although more of a wrap than a burrito since it has shredded cabbage and no rice. As a result, it's not super filling so I'd recommend getting a side if you're really hungry. I asked them to add rice to the vegetariano recently and was informed that their rice is made with chicken stock, so vegans and vegetarians beware. 

Oh - and the red salsa is the beeeeeeeest. They don't advertise it, but you can buy the salsas by the bottle. Like literally they just give you one of the squeezy bottles. It's kind of dangerous.
author: Dee R.

description:
First of all, 3 stars isn't bad by any means. I think I expected to give this place 5 stars based on all of the Yelp reviews but once again I learned that you can't always count on everyone else's opinions.  

This place was PACKED on game day, which did give it a really fun vibe while everyone was cheering for their respective teams. Luckily our friends had a table saved otherwise we probably wouldn't have found a seat at all. We ordered drinks and I got a fish taco, "Nick's Way." It was massive. You'll notice in the photo I posted that the avocado is slathered all over it (which is absolutely not a bad thing) and it's kind of spilling out of the wrap that it comes in to hold the taco together. I wasn't planning on getting it Nick's way, but the waitress highly recommended it so I felt a little obliged to try it out.

To explain Nick's Way: and additional $1.25 will get you tons of guacamole, cheese, and salsa. It will also give you a second (hard) shell around your taco. This is the part that ruined it a little for me. My outer shell was so hard that it was almost too tough to bite into, and therefore my force led to my taco spilling all over the place. I think next time I would get Nick's way without the second shell, or just add avo to my taco instead so it's not too overwhelming.

Cool atmosphere if you liked packed places for game day and decent food, but the service was pretty slow on the day I went (granted it could have been because it was so crowded, but I repeatedly saw our waitress going to the same table to check on them and rarely came over to ours). I wouldn't mind coming back to try the food again, but I don't agree that they're the best tacos in the city.
author: Richa A.

description: First of all, our server, Tessa was AWESOME! She anticipated our every need, before we even realized what we were wanting. We had a SF carne asada burrito, nachos, street tacos and chicken wings- YUMMMM! All of it. Don't miss the pitchers of margaritas either...Will was the bartender and they were perfect! Feeling like Mexican food? Hit it up
author: Stacie E.

description: Quintessential sports bar for an early weeknight outing. Service was very good. House margarita and Nick's crunchy carne asada tacos were great. Tacos are made to order and came out fast. Spicy red sauce was bomb. For what this place is I think it's terrific.
author: Rosalyn W.

description: Amazing tacos!! Had two tacos "nicks way" the asada and carnitas... carnitas was bomb!!! Margaritas are nice and strong just how I like em! Definitely coming back here next time I'm in the city!!!!!
author: Frances O.

description:
Awesome food, entirely gluten free fryers, corn chips, corn tortillas, delicious agua frescas, always have a variety of sports games on and rapid, helpful service. Can get busy during popular games or later at night. Highly recommend elote corn and crispy tacos (and having a margarita made with the agua fresca!!)

Bonus: California golden state cider (6.9%) pitches for $29!!! 

Celiac friendly
author: Katie B.

description: San Francisco Burrito with Carne Asada. Favorite burrito in SF. Also the red salsa, AMAZING. Though when you get it to go be prepared to pay for extra (totally worth it).
author: Michelle K.

description: Food and drinks are always good at this fabulous Sports Bar. I've been coming here for years and have never had a bad experience. Their Grilled Shrimp Taco Nick's way is off the charts good as is there taco sauces & Elote con queso & guacamole. I can't resist. I'll keep going back.
author: Ivy D.

description:
Parking here is difficult to find so you may need to circle around the block a couple of times.

I came here with a friend because we were given the impression that there was 50 cents margarita. Turned out that they "never" had it, as told by a server.

I ordered Nick's Way. At first, I was overwhelmed with my food because it was huge. I had to crunch it up to be able to eat it and it tasted mediocre.

Not only was their food mediocre, but their servers weren't that attentive. Waited 10 minutes for one just to get a refill and another to get our check.

Would not go back to this place.
author: Aj C.

description: Absolutely outstanding, life-changing tacos. This is the new standard for me for tacos. The double tortilla, one fried, one soft, and the pile of fresh, delicious ingredients inside is seriously unbelievable. Highly recommended!
author: Vanessa G.

description:
Their burritos are merely OK. They give you chips for free but only about 10 chips (literally). The place is a bar, and the taco shop part seems to be a bit of an afterthought for their business. But it's around the corner, so I go there often. 

Oh, and don't get chorizo in your burrito. They don't know what they are doing with the chorizo
author: Karina R.

description:
For the last two years I've come here nearly every week to watch sports and have a Carne Asada San Diego style burrito and a Drake's Pale Ale. This is my favorite ever sports bar and as a native New Englander it was a great spot to watch a Pats game even if everyone hated me. 

This is hands down the best sports bar in SF.
author: Michael H.

description:
For starters "Star" (cute as a button waitress) was awesome! Great personality and service in a super cool establishment makes for a super cool dining experience if you ask me.

The food was matching; I tried the corn on the cob which was sooooo mouth watering I could eaten 3 more and took 3 wrapped to go.  I decided instead to try thew tacos; 1 Shrimp Taco and 1 Mahi Mahi Taco.  Although both were delicious I enjoyed the shrimp more.  The flavor was simply magnificent.  Charred to perfection, not too spicy but with a teenie weenie kick to awaken the taste buds.  They were laced in a double layer soft tortilla shell. I removed the outer shell, as one was more than good enough and held the taco together just fine.  If your heavy on carbs live a little and eat both.

There were an array of arcade games, a full bar, great music that kept my head bobbing the entire time and plenty of TV's along the bar area for sports entertainment.  

Next time I'm in San Fran, I'll definitely be stopping at the Taco Shop.
author: Christy A.

description:
As someone who never leaves bad reviews, its annoying and frustrating to do this. I came in last night and I was digging the place; it was a busy Monday night and it looked like a good bar to hang out in. As a bartender myself, I would NEVER treat my patrons the way these guys treated my date and I last night. First, they were ignoring us at the bar, even though I had clearly hailed the guy and all five of them saw that I was ready. When I work, I greet and serve all my customers as promptly as I can. M Unless when its a super busy night, and even then I acknowledge people who come in and make sure they know I'll get to them. I can chit chat with my coworkers and take orders, its called multi-tasking. Finally, one of them comes to us and we place our order. I get a Michelada and some other food. Granted I was already peeved at the service from the guys behind the bar so I ordered to go. Tell me why my Michelada was extra spicy? No matter how annoyed I am when Im on the clock, quality comes first and I would never purposely mess anyone Im serving, and trust me, I've wanted to do that many times before. That just makes you look like a bad bartender. We get our order, and my date decided he wanted to eat at the bar because I had my shitty drink, and well, we might as well. The douche bartender that serves us proceeded to scold us about how we: "can eat here, but its just that you just made me waste a bag and plastic utensils, and I have to plate the dish now, but you can eat, not trying to kick you out or anything." Well guess what dude? You were, and I didn't wanna start a fight and ruin everyone else's night so my date and I packed our stuff and left... 

First of all, I paid for the paper bag, there was a bag tax on my receipt which means its mine and I can do with it what I want, along with all the plastic accoutrement that was given to me. Do you buy all the bar supplies yourself? No. Your boss does, so whats it to yah bro? Second of all, yes, it might be annoying when my patrons do that, but I would NEVER say that to those Im serving. My date and I didn't ask you to plate the food, nor did we ask you for silverware; we were trying to be as chill about it as possible. So what was the problem here? Are you new and not know how to treat people? Did your team lose tonight? Is it cuz we were a gay couple trying to dine at your "hetero" sports bar? Are you just a dick? 

And not only that, but my date and I tipped this kid... Not only did I get shitty customer service, a bad drink thats not hard to make (Rim glass with tajin, pour in ice, a little over 3/4 beer, the rest bloody mary mix, garnish with lime... Einstein), and a rude ass bartender, but we tipped this guy out too. I'm getting angry again writing this so I'll end it here. But goddam dude, being a decent bartender is not that hard homie...
author: Peter G.

description:
5 stars for their fish tacos. The best fish tacos I've ever had. Also their sauce!! Omg so GOOD! I tried their other tacos which are okay. But the fish ones are the best. I usually get 2 and thats perfect. They're deep fried fish tacos not the usual grilled ones so its nice and crispy! 

Chill atmosphere.. nice waitress.. and TVs at the bar. Perfect place to grab and drink with friends.
author: Anh N.

description: Almost ate here. Glad I checked the menu first.  Roach stuck to it told me everything I needed to know.
author: Ryan F.

description:
Forget the mission. This place has the best burritos. I always go for the SF burrito but the best part are their two sauces that they provide you with. One is a chipotle style and the other is cilantro. It really ramps up your burrito to the next level.

This place is your classic sports bar setting with loud clapping and cheering for the team that is on the screen. So be prepared for a rowdy time if there is a game on.
author: Thewanderingmutt B.

description: You get what you pay for, and this place was awesome.  Nachos are huge and worth the price.  All food was tasty, place is clean, service is great....no I was not drinking, so this is a true review. :)
author: Better B.

description: I ordered a Carne Asada Nick's Way Taco and an elote and they both made my tastebuds really happy. The taco had a generous amount of meat and guacamole and the elote had just the right amount of seasoning. Nick's Way Taco reminded me a lot of La Taqueria's super taco (from the Mission), but The Taco Shop at Underdog's is definitely a more convenient location for me. They've definitely made a regular out of me!
author: Jackie T.

description: My friends and I came in here to watch the warriors game, we ordered our food and ate when we got there. We came 30 minutes early to make sure we got seats. After we finished our food we were asked to leave (this was only ten minutes into the game). We were paying just like everybody else but since we finished eating, we had to leave. I'd understand if there was a 2 hour limit but we were there for less than 45 minutes. Terrible...
author: Joseph H.

description:
Nicks way taco! Got it, ate it, loved it! Was a huge taco.. Probably like a mini burrito. It was prewrapped in paper for you making it super easy to hold and eat. Crispy taco inside a soft shell taco was an amazing idea, plus it comes with guach! Any person knows that at any other restaurant they charge you at least a dollar extra for guach. 

The atmosphere was like a sports bar. Swimsuit model picture inside the men's bathroom (haha where I was seated you can see the pictures on the wall when anyone enters the men's bathroom), mini arcade games here and there.
author: Jenny N.

description: Amazing place! The best chips I think I've ever had. I had a chicken taco nicks way and it was delicious. My husband had the California burrito. It was huge and amazing. Would definitely recommend. Great service and we were in and out quickly.
author: Samantha J.

description:
Love this bar! It's always a fun, casual, sporty atmosphere (and not to mention it's a bit of a Michigan bar so holla at my wolverines ;) #GoBLUE)

This is also one of my favorite places to go for Taco Tuesday in the city. One of the best fish tacos in town for sure. But a word to the wise, it gets crowded. Fast. So come here early and park it at one of the tables in the back if you can.

Never come here without getting the Baja style fish tacos Nick's Way. An easy way to get delectable tacos without making it all the way over to Nicks' Crispy Tacos. The other tacos are no slouch either (carne asada is also delicious), but don't regret not getting one of these babies.

Word of caution: parking is INCREDIBLY difficult in this neighborhood, but the N train is literally one block away and there are a few bus stops nearby also, so it's easy to get to via public transportation (plus, if you're gonna drink, don't drive!)

Order yourself a few tacos, a bucket of Tecate and sit back to enjoy the vibe.
author: Jay P.

description:
This place isn't a bar that just happens to conveniently have food for when you get the drunchies. This place serves bomb Mexican food conveniently in an establishment that has a full bar to wash down your tacos with a nice cold beer or a margarita. It is more of a dive/sports bar environment, so if you want more of a restaurant the original location on Broadway is more spacious.

A must try for everyone here is a taco Nick's way and you'll get the option of ordering any meat with it, but one of my favorites is the Baja style. It's beer battered fish in a crispy tortilla layered on with a soft tortilla and melted Monterey jack cheese to hold it all together. It's topped with a generous amount of pico de gallo and fresh guac. It gets a little messy when you start working on it and can get a little soggy.

One taco always is the perfect amount to get me full with a little more room for an elote. They also have street style tacos which are much smaller, about the size of your palm. Their chips and salsa are really good also because their chips taste like their made fresh from tortillas and not from a package.

There's plenty of seating from the bar, stool tables and picnic style tables in the back that become community tables when its crowded. This place gets really packed for taco Tuesdays and you can't order off the menu unless you actually have a seat at the bar or a table. But mind you, they have decent happy hour specials all week from 4:30-6 with $2 tecates, $2 street style tacos and $4 house margaritas.

It's a great place to go with a group of friends or for a casual, fun date! There's plenty of TVs throughout the place which makes it an awesome spot for Giants/9ers game days/nights. Two tables on the side of the bar has the old school Pacman arcade game as the table top that you can actually play, pretty neat!
author: Georgina G.

description: Love this place! Great food and drinks. Fun to come during a game even though it's usually PACKED! Love bringing friends from out of town here to show them a 'taste of SF'. Love it. :)
author: K W.

description: This is one of the best Sports Bars in the entire Bay Area. The ambience is awesome! It can be extremely crowded when big games are playing or during their Taco Tuesdays ($2 street tacos and $3 Tecates). I never get around to ordering their street tacos because I always get the fish taco "Nick's Way". My hubby swears by the fish burrito with their table sauce. Their chips and salsa is awesome too!
author: C L.

description:
What do you do when you're waiting for someone who is 15 minutes late and you don't have a smartphone... nothing.  At least the servers were very attentive and checked in with me several times.

After he finally arrived, we ordered water and a taco each.  I got the Nick's way Carnitas taco.  The taco is HUGE and I could've had two, maybe three but I'm a messy eater so I just stuck with one.  

Good service, good food.
author: Linda N.

description:
Great customer service. The guy came to check up on us very often. It can get pretty busy, but we found a seat when we walked in.

The food was good. Got the street tacos and nicks way fish taco. The carne asada and fish taco was my favorite. But the highlight of the night was the elote. Was craving it and it fulfilled my cravings. Add a couple more dashes of tapatio and you're in heaven.
author: Mark B.

description: Awesome street tacos. Crowded on weekends, but good service. Bartender forgot my beer order and lagged to remember, don't blame her though. But overall, still good experience.
author: Fernando G.

description: This place was great!!! I really loved the food. I ordered a carne asada quesadilla and wow was it filling. It was very large and very delicious. My dad ordered the nicks way carne asada taco and that was also quite tasty. I am obsessed wth their guacamole!!! I ate the majority of our chips and guacamole order. The vibe of the restaurant was nice and casual and fun. I would definitely come back here!
author: Lauren S.

description: ELOTE - sweet corn with mayo?, cotija cheese, lime juice, and cayenne pepper. One of my favorite foods. I was super excited when I found this place because the last time I had good elote was in new york and haven't been able to find any in the bay area since! I went to Underdog's twice over the 3 days I was in SF because it was so good!! Make sure you eat it while it's hot! I can't wait to get some more the next time I'm in SF!
author: Annie L.

description:
Baja fish taco Nick's way, elote, chips with salsa and a Mexican coke.  Just order that for lunch and you can skip dinner because you won't be hungry.  I wanted to see what Nick's way was all about, and man, was that worth the trip.  The avocado spilling out of the soft/hard shell combination is amazingly good.  My daughter is sold on their California burrito - french fries wrapped with carnitas in a tortilla.  I did not know that was a thing.    

I watched the Preakness and the Belmont Stakes here and loved being able to yell at the TV in frustration at California Chrome failure to get the Triple Crown.  Nothing like 30 of your closest strangers feeling the pain of an exciting event to make you feel at home.  

Looks like they have a great beer and tequila menu.  Maybe next time when I'm not the designated driver.
author: Maria S.

description: Good tacos and drinks. Overpriced though. Cool atmosphere although place was small and there were no tables so we sat at the bar. No parking as usual throughout SF. Bartender was rude and was too busy on her phone while people were waiting for their drinks.
author: Kev N.

description: Pretty good tacos, good crowd  and good beer selection. The staff is pretty nice but the taco quality can definitely go up. If they were to bring in a good chef that reworked the menu then this place definitely could go up in value. They need to bring in better chefs!!
author: Cindy H.

description:
I stopped in for some tacos on a slightly drunken Thursday night after hitting up the Corner Spot, one of my favorite bars in the city.

Since I was slightly inebriated, I was uhh.. A little less attentive than usual BUT let me break it down one time:

- CHEESEBURGER  BURRITO( ~$10): Hot damn, this thing is like a California burrito except with a Kobe beef patty con queso chopped up and wrapped with French fries and jalapeños. This is a big time burrito; I couldn't even finish it! That's definitely saying something.

- GUAC AND CHIPS (~$7): I'm not sure if these were actually that amazing or if the drunchies kicked in. Either way, the guac was solid and the chips were fresh. I'm not a fan of the tomato salsa layer between the guac and the chips because it made everything kind of soggy towards the end.

- FULL BAR: In case the Corner Spot didn't do me in, Underdog's full bar definitely put me on the ropes. Touché.

- STRONG SERVICE: Servers would come by every 5-10 minutes to make sure we were taken care of. I started to wonder if the service was that good or if I looked like I was in constant need of assistance. Either way, I like the attention.

- OTHER STUFF: There's a basketball arcade game like the ones at D&B where I can get wrecked at.. I mean wreck people at. Two blocks from the N MUNI. 

All in all, I was a happy camper at the end of the night. Seating can be a pain because they restaurant / bar isn't very big but that's San Francisco for ya.
author: Chris W.

description:
Tacos are definitely the way to go here, especially if you order them Nick's way. They are loaded with tasty goodness and have the perfect crunchy/soft bite ratio, making them one of a kind. The burritos are good enough, but not really authentic. If you must, go for the breakfast burrito. 

I can vouch for the beer, sangria and surprisingly, bloody mary. The one time I ordered a margarita, I didn't enjoy it at all, so I haven't ordered one since. 

The biggest con for me is the salsa. It's pretty average. I really wish at least one of them was spicy. 

It's a casual place that seems to have a steady flow of people regularly. I often see people with their kids there during the day, so I guess I would consider it a pretty tame sports bar. Taco Tuesday is a little too overcrowded for me, so I'll pass. 

Take-out is a great option too. It's always ready fast and they give you chips and salsa free of charge!
author: Gloria B.

description: Come here on Fridays. They have a great happy hour, lively atmosphere, friendly service, and... amazing, big, tasty tacos. One or two are big enough for a solid meal.
author: Mikey J.

description:
The more "Americanized" taco - seasoned meats, loaded with fresh Cali avocados & salsa. If you wanna go all out, get it Nick's Style. It's not your authentic corner store taqueria, but more like your edgy street food truck. 

Their chips & salsa & guacamole are bomb! 

I come here to watch football w friends, talk crap about the other teams, drink a few Cadillac margaritas & eat some Mexican food. The avocado/guac is the icing on the cake here, get anything that contains it & you won't be disappointed. 

Sports bar vibes - long bar table & more tables/benches in the back. You seat yourself, communal-style, which can be irritating on game days especially when the Niners are playing. I highly recommend coming early as parking can be a b*%&@ & it usually gets packed. It's like an indoor BBQ on and given Sunday Football.
author: Alyssaaa S.

description: This place is so good with the shrimp tacos I can't even lie. The elite and nachos I might add are super delish! This place seems to be the only place I can find with Green Flash on tap. Love this spot so much
author: Maria M.

description:
After my evening activities I usually come by here on my late night dinner restaurant rotation. It has a decent sized sports bar w/a taco shop in the back. 

For the main food it's best to get the fish tacos and quesadillas. Get the salsa on the side when you order the quesadilla, unless you want the runny salsa to run down your arm and have the quesadilla soggy inside. 

If you've a burrito craving it's best to go somewhere else, because their burritos are smaller and pricier if you're used to eating burritos around the city.

I'm not really a fan of drinking alcoholic beverages since it takes up stomach space for food, but I'm sure the drinks here are pretty good as the friends that I've come here with order them.
author: Eric T.

description:
OK. I'm going to start this off by saying that my review is completely biased because this is my favorite sports bar in all of San Francisco. The service can sometimes be slow (for food), it gets crowded pretty fast (especially on game nights), and it's not very big (hence, it gets crowded easily).

Underdogs is mostly known for their infamous tacos Nick's Way. While they're delicious, I mostly go for a San Diego burrito (pico de gallo, cheese, guacamole, with carne asada, carnitas, or pollo) when I actually come for the food. Otherwise, it's an elote, obscene amounts of beer, and the BEST guacamole and chips I've ever tasted in life!
author: Tor E.

description:
The Taco Shop at Underdog's is under the same guy, Nick, of Nick's Crispy Tacos, which I had in 2012. At the time, I rated Nick's 4/5 stars. However, I've lived in SD for the past two out of three years, and living so close to the US-Mexican border I've tasted what I consider authentic, quality tacos (The Taco Stand in LA Jolla for my friend, and Oscar's in various SD locations for me). Underdog's does not even compare. 

Our party of three ordered one carnitas taco and one corn on the cob. The guacamole was both generous and delicious, but the meat was tougher than expected and the tortilla was too thick. As my fellow SD compatriot stated, it's a good taco, but falls in the middle in the spectrum of taco goodness. The corn on the cob fared a bit better. It was creamy with light parmesan, but I definitely doused it in Tapatio. I've had better Mexican corn at local street fairs in Socal (I'm talking about you, Downtown Anaheim street fair!).

Overall, good service and a decent-looking bar, but rated #1 sports bar in SF as a sign inside touted? The tacos tell a different story. Head to SD, my friends.
author: Phoebe C.

description:
Busy sports bar.. 11 television.
Kitchen open till 10pm Sunday and Monday.. 
12 midnight Tuesday- Saturday.. 
Street style tacos are amazing.... 
Nachooooos are huge. 
If getting the chips and salsa / guac ask for the salsa and guac on the side. They are normally served topped the fresh Tortilla chips. No one likes soggy chips. 
Picnic style family tables in the back past the bar. Perfect for kids etc. 
Street parking only.
author: Frances L.

description:
Pained to write this since this was one of my main places since I moved here in 2012. I've had birthdays and parties here and it used to be amazing. Last year at one point we found a chunk of what looked like a wood chip or piece of plastic in my burrito. They were gracious and I decided to give them another chance. 

This most recent time they said they won't allow dogs inside (my dog is 9 pounds and was in my purse, and doesn't make a peep). Bartender obviously felt bad and I was told the new owner says even if it's an emotional support dog (I showed proof to prove I'm not faking) that's not good enough and there is an ADA law that they only have to accept dogs that are helping their owners with diabetes(?) 

So we sat outside which reeks of cigarettes. Tried to order sangria but they don't have a liquor license outside. Get yourself a fence and one more table and a liquor license, dude. This is absurd.
author: Lauren C.

description: The food was great! The service was fast and friendly. Would recommend to anyone in the area. Definitely get the carne asada tacos and put the red salsa on them! Also, the chips were amazing! Other reviews suggested parking would be difficult but we found a spot right away.
author: Ashlee T.

description:
5 stars for their vegetarian tacos "nick's way"

The staff was super friendly and the margaritas are just right
author: Lena M.

description: Holy shnikes this place is the bomb! I can't count how many times I have literally drooled over the thought of getting some of their carnitas tacos into my mouth...it's ridiculous. And their salsa roja, my GOD, their salsa roja is fricken out of this world. Please give me your salsa and carnitas recipes, I'll do anything.
author: Kate S.

description: The margarita was excellent and the nick's way fish taco was good too but I was underwhelmed by the service...I must've placed my order a couple of minutes short of 4:30 when the happy hours start and the server didn't inform me of this while typically most servers do announce the offers when you are seated. The tacos were plopped at my table without even a backward as the waitress walked past my table so that did take away from my experience.
author: Megha K.

description: Reliably the best taco in the sunset. Love the Nick's way carnitas tacos with guacamole - 2 are usually more than enough! Beer selection and bar is solid for a sports bar. Great spot to watch a game.
author: David A.

description:
If you're a foodie, you can't miss this place! A typical divey type bar scene with not-so-typical food choices! 

I've been here twice now and I look forward to coming back. I will definitely bring my friends and family here when they come to visit. 

The seating choices are: 
-Your typical "sit at the bar" stools. 
- a few tables along the wall for a group of 1-3
- OR there's community seating at bench tables towards the back (if you're feeling social) 

There are a few arcade style games in the back to entertain while food is being prepared. 

The food is great! The first time I went, my two friends and I ordered five dishes and shared them all. Highly recommend doing this!! It lets you try a couple dishes and the portions are huge! 

Pros: Good alcohol choices, great food, service was great: 

Cons: if you're not into the dive bar or sports bar scene, you might not like it. It is small so seating can be hard to find when it's busy. But it's worth the wait!
author: Brittney P.

description: After reading reviews raving about the tacos I was immensely disappointed. I had the carnitas, asada and pollo which were all dry and lacked flavor. They also did a weird soft shell over a hard shell thing which just left a soggy stale tasting bite. Way too much guac and tomatoes but I'm assuming it was to just mask the tasteless meat. Just go to a true taqueria and don't waste your time here unless your plastered drunk.
author: Dylan L.

description:
This is one of our favorite places in the sunset! Really low-key, good beer and the staff are all super friendly. Love the nachos son muy grande. And all the burritos are delicious. 
Actually a great spot to have breakfast burritos and watch sports.
author: Margaret M.

description:
The food was good but the service was absolutely horrible.  
We had to wait around for such a long time before a server came to help us out and we had to wait a long time before we could get someone to print out our check. Finally when my friend asked the server if we could pay and she was condescending and responded as if we were stupid. "I'll bring you the check. You put cash or a card down and then I'll process it"

Probably wouldn't come back here because of how rude everyone was. The food was good but there are other places with both good food and a friendly staff.
author: Jaynee L.

description:
Four stars for the beers, three stars for my California carnitas burrito.

The only problem I had with my burrito was that the carnitas were dry.  If mine came with some guac and/or sour cream, it might've not been an issue.  But mine came with french fries, good ones that weren't greasy.  It would've been nice if the meat had some moisture.

My friend and I also ordered chips and salsa. The salsa is placed on top of the chips. so they get soggy after awhile.  But for the most part they were good.

It's a divey, sports bar atmosphere that's family friendly in the day.  Come here to grab a cold one and watch a game, and dine only because you need to sober up.
author: Vira P.

description:
Came here to watch the Warriors game with one of my girlfriends! Amazing place. The tacos are yummy. Get 'me served up Nick's style, you won't regret it. It was my first time there (the friend I came with us a regular) and I got two tacos, when they arrived I realized I could have been okay with one because THEY'RE HUGE. They have a really good cider on tap too. Highly recommend you try it. Multiple screens so we could watch different games, so you'll never miss a play. Delicious tacos, great cider + beer + full bar, all the sports your heart desires? I'm sold. 



They had a Michigan flag up, but I'm a UCLA Bruin for life. On that note, GO BRUINS !
author: Tati N.

description: I love the Taco Shop! Yummy margaritas and Nicks Tacos are so flavorful!  If you go once, you will definitely be back again
author: Jocelyn V.

description:
I was lazy and got this using DoorDash. Of course, during Cinco de Mayo, I was craving tacos so I finally got around to trying this spot. I must say, I was not disappointed. 

I got the Mexican style street tacos with carne asada and carnitas. My boyfriend got the Shrimp taco, Nick's way. We loved them all! Nick's way is bomb, btw. And totally worth a try. It's definitely a lot bigger than your normal street taco, but it's packed with lots of goodies.  Our order also surprisingly came with chips and salsa (green and red) so, needless to say, we were absolutely delighted. 

Look, you're in SF..in inner sunset. You won't find $1 tacos, but these are good and worth a try if you're craving it. Will definitely be ordering again.
author: Steph S.

description: The tortilla soup is not only delicious but a large meal!! The San Francisco burrito should be made a city treasure!! I know what my place of comfort will be while I visit San Francisco.
author: Monstruo G.

description:
FRUAD ALERT

Had 3 tacos & 2 drinks here 4/29/16. Paid my $26 tab with my credit/debt card. On the tip line of the sign off form I wrote "cash", left $6 on the bar as the tip & left. Today as I'm looking at my tally of purchases on my banking app. I see that they added a separate $4.10 charge on my card.  Do not  trust these people. Tacos were pretty good, though expensive. Bring cash if you go into this place.  I'm not really into posting S on Yelp but this burn my ass pretty hard. If you've had this same experience I urge you to post about it. I know it's only $4 but it the principle.
author: Dz N.

description: Very good food/booze for the price. Shrimp taco seems pricey (5.50$ for 1 taco) but it is gigantic. Will return next time I'm at Ocean Beach! Burrito was excellent. Short walk from Ocean Beach- was hungry after a beach day. Perfect spot.
author: Allie K.

description:
We ducked in after enjoying the sites (and not enjoying the teeny old penii sitings) of Bay to Breakers. 

We were carded which honestly surprised me, but we self-seated at the bar and were promptly given menus and a large carafe of water (kudos.. Saves bartender time and keeps me happy and hydrated). 

I had 2 vegetarian tacos which were far larger than I was expected. With corn tortillas, the outer tortilla was soft and the inner one fried a bit - never had this and it was delicious! The green hot sauce (not actually hot) was super flavorful and I totally drenched my food in it. My pal got a chicken salad of some sorts but didn't love it near as I did (that's what you get when you order a salad IMO). 

While we were dining, a gentlemen walked in and was carded. A barkeep hollered to the door guy and said he's got a seat here, let him in. After we had finished eating and gave up our seats to some folks waiting, we noticed the bar stool that guy had been sitting on had his name carved in it. So I guess if you are a regular or otherwise associated, you can be immortalized on a bar stool. I dig it!
author: Kate K.

description:
This was the second time I've been here. The first time was not a pleasant visit and it didn't do anything for me to want to come back. But the boyfriend put it out there again, so we came here for dinner on a Saturday night. It was chill, not too crowded. Which was the total opposite of our first experience when we stopped by on a weekday. 

Anyway, we ordered the carnitas and fish tacos, buffalo wings, and chips/salsa. Their prices are pretty high for tacos but they stuff it so it's not too bad. We really enjoyed our tacos (Nick's way). They gave us a heaping amount of salsa so I like how they're generous about but, their chips were stale and really hard. And the chicken wings were cold when they served them to us- yuck! 

Honestly, I don't think I'd come back for the food. Maybe for the drinks? This place is overhyped, maybe because the neighborhood is filled with college students. That's just my opinion.
author: Dara S.

description:
Whether you're a sports fan or a foodie, this place is BOMB.  When you look at the menu and see a taco is close to $5, you kinda take a step back, but trust me, it's worth it.  Parking might be a little difficult to find, but if you come after 6 or on Sundays, meters are free!

I took my friends from SoCal here and they LOVED it.  At first, they thought $5 fish tacos? No way Jose, but we got them Nick's way and boy, did they fall in love.  There's so much guac on that and the crunchiness of the fish the hard shell with the ooey gooey of the guac, there's just so many texture differences and all the flavor is there.  We also got the carnitas nachos which were alright.  They also have beer on tap which is great for hanging out.

Be careful, this place can get pretty packed on game days and you might have to wait for a table to open up, but you can always have a beer while you wait!  Highly recommend this place for anyone that loves tacos.  Nick's way all the way!!
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Holey moley are these tacos chubby! They've got some serious weight on them. I'm used to whimpy little street tacos that fit in the palm of my hand and require about 4 to qualify as a meal...but not here. Underdogs doesn't mess around!

Carne Asada and the "Baja style" fish tacos are amazinngg!!! Nick's style will get you a taco with a little bit of crispiness along with the soft exterior. The meat is flavorful and tender and the ingredients are all really fresh! The green and red hot sauces are a must-have complement. ~$4.50 a pop and completely worth it! Two will do you just fine. 

Service can be a little spotty, but it's only because they're so jam-packed with people having a great time! It can get crowded and really loud, but it all equates to a fun and lively atmosphere. When the servers do get around to you, they're friendly and energetic though. If you want a table, find the girl rockin' the clipboard and put your name on the list. No table swooping!
author: Deanna Y.

description: The first 2 times we ordered door dash it was great, now we order to go and were very disappointed. Almost no carne Asada in the nachos and burnt chips
author: Dee D.

description:
I remember Taco Shop fondly from a few years ago but this time the quality was just completely off the mark - such a negative experience that I'm pretty sure I won't return.

I called in an order for takeout and when I walk in and stand in the area to pickup, no one helped me for a good few minutes. This also happened to the other takeout patrons that entered after me. This was annoying, was I standing in the correct place to get service? Why are all the staff ignoring me? I feel like an idiot standing here with everyone shunning my existence as they walk back and forth past me.

Finally someone helped me and took my credit card. He let me know the food isn't ready. So I wait for some more minutes. That staff member  never checks on me again. Second staff member asks me what's up and I repeat the motions again. This time the food is ready. He tries to take payment from me because communication is utter shit in this place now it seems. 

I come home and of course they forgot the $4 elote I ordered. Thanks a lot. The burritos were not as good as I remembered and quite humdrum. Nothing special about them at all this time around. All my friends for this dinner agreed. I forced them all to eat from here since I vouched for it so hard. Taco Shop made me look like a fool. Never again.

Overall a huge disappointment. Now that I have relived this experience while writing this review I'm definitely not going to be coming back again.
author: Jeff L.

description:
This place gets 1 star because chipotle has better tacos for cheaper. There's no reason to go somewhere with such uninspired and bland food. 

Also, when I checked my credit card statement about a week after going to this place I noticed that I was overcharged by $30. This is either a careless mistake or an intentional overcharge to my account. Either way. I would never go to this place again.
author: Kira D.

description: The tacos I had were bland (non-Nick's) and all the chips were burnt. My wife's SF burrito was okay though so maybe stick with the guac burritos.
author: Shawn L.

description:
My favorite Taco shop in SF. Delicious Nick's way Taco which is fried and has an outer soft shell. Chips and Guacamole is great. Must try the Cheeseburger Burrito here also.
They have several big TVs, Great spot for watching sports. They also have a mini arcade for fun games :)
There are benches and tables in the back as well for groups.

A must try if you are in the area...
author: Kimia R.

description: Definite hole in the wall place but so worth it. The food was excellent! Tortilla chips were a little crunchier than I would have liked but still delicious. Guacamole was perfect. Crunchy fish taco was amazing! Huge portions. House margarita was really great too. Great people watching!
author: Jenni B.

description:
OK THIS PLACE IS SO GOOD THO. 
Lemme tell U about my experience w this restaurant.
My husband and I were playing Pokemon go and we were starving and so we found this place on Yelp. We walked into this shop like 3 times and walked out cause FIRST TIME we thought it was a 21 and over because we saw that they had a bar and we r like 20. SECOND TIME there were too many people and so there were no seats so we walked out because we didn't wanna stand around awkwardly. THE THIRD TIME, we walked in and like no one was serving us?? And it was our first time obviously and it wasn't clear on what we were supposed to do or how to order. So we walked out three times THEN we decided to go somewhere else. We drove like a block away from this place and lost our rlly cool parking spot THEN decided to give it another try. So we turned back around and found parking and walked in and just sat at the first place we saw that was empty (although it had dirty stuff on it). THEN we got serviced super fast and our orders taken. 
I ordered the Baja taco nicks way and my husband ordered the carne asada taco also w nicks way. 
The wait wasn't long and it's the perfect date night place to go too. 
When the food finally came to us. We were super hungry and excited to try it. 
I gotta say that my Baja taco was extremely delicious. There is a sauce in there that is like no other. Also these tacos were HUGE. And my husband was just as satisfied with his carne asada taco as I was with my Baja one. 
We were still hungry tho so we ordered one carne asada quesadilla. RIGHT WHEN the quesadilla got to is we were like holy shit we can't finish this. It was very stuffed. 
But once we took a bite, it was literally like melting in our mouths. And idk how we finished it but we did. 
Super good service in the end and I'm glad we decided to turn our car around to give this place a shot. (^:
author: Nicole H.

description:
Wow where to start?  Well I guess with the fact that when I got my take out home it went into the disposal. 

So disappointing!  It began when I reached into the bag   the drive home excited to have a few homemade tortilla chips only to find a greasy overlooked stale bag of corn chips.  Since I had ordered guacamole I quickly realized I should stop at Safeway (yes I said I would need to stop at the grocery store on the way home from the restaurant to get food ).  Thanks god I did!
When I finally got home the disappointment continued.  The vegetarian taco was beans and raw cabbage in another greasy over cooked shell.  Needless to say it was also inedible!  Then the corn,  compared to the other items it was at least edible but that's about it.  It was afar from fresh and covered in an odd cheese that was somewhat dry if that's possible.  It also went in the trash.  
The only item that was edible was the guac.  Not great but at least I ate it with my chips from Safeway.   

So Le me also say that the terrible food was no reflection on the staff who were friendly prompt and personable.  I so wanted to love this place since it is highly rated, I loveeee tacos especially the kinda which don't require cooking myself , and the staff was great.  Unfortunately, until they improve their food, I will not return.

If your looking for Mexican.  Don't waste your time.  But maybe stop in for a drink and chat with the staff.  They are the only reason to stop at the taco shop.

PS, it also smelled like stale beer as soon as I walked in.  That should have been my first clue that it would not end well.
author: Julie S.

description: Best fish tacos ever, the nicks way Baja style was crunchy, tasty and perfect. Can't wait to go back for their taco Tuesday
author: Liz H.

description:
Came in during OSL was going on. Found VIP parking across the street. 

Person at door to check IDs and to give out wristbands. Mine was on so loose that I could've just taken it off to give to someone else. 

We scored a seat near the door. Our drink orders were taken fairly quick. I ordered the Cali burrito with carne asada and my husband ordered two shrimp tacos. The music and place was so loud that I could barely hear the girl that took our order. When our food came, I got a breakfast burrito with carne asada and my husband got one taco. We were hungry and didn't want to scream over the loudness of the place so we just ate it. My burrito was actually really good - hence the 3 stars. My husband did not enjoy his taco that he ended up eating half my burrito. 

It's a bar, so I didn't dock stars for the loud atmosphere. Two stars docked because our orders came out wrong.
author: Serena F.

description: I haven't been here in a while but best tacos I've ever had aside from my own!! The staff is cool and fast! The decor is on point and the games on the monitors are all I would want to watch!
author: Lisa T.

description: Fifty six bucks for two beers, 3 stale nicks tacos, 1 garbage corn on the cob, and got asked to move for other people to sit on our stools for the warriors game? Maybe get some fresh ingredients before serving some garbage to customers. Fish tasted hella old and reheated in a toaster oven. Also, lemme finish my damn drink!!! This place sucks. I ain't coming back to some gentrified millennial crap. This s**t was hella expensive and filled with motherf**kers that are hella rude, and the people that work here act like they're too cool to be friendly. Maybe smile for once??? Underdogs is a has been and I'm coo off that.
author: Alex G.

description: What more can you say?  Great Tacos - served up in a neighborhood sports bar.  Get them Nick's style and and they pile everything into a double taco. I like the carnitas and also the crispy baja style fish tacos.  The guacamole is also good.  Note that it is a bar though, so I would not recommend bringing the kids here.  But if you have a burning desire to watch some sports, eat a few tacos and drink a cold one then this is a good spot.
author: David Z.

description: This place has amazing tacos! Always order Nick's way - another layer of tortilla that is crispy, guac, and cheese.
