This place is great to come to with friends if you want to catch a sports game and order some super filling, delicious, huge tacos. Don't underestimate because they are ginormous and two will definitely fill you up! The chips and salsa are also great because you get a huge basket of chips.
author: Steph V.

description: A special blend of Mexican and American but done right. You could get their street tacos... but you can get those any where. Why not go wild and get your tacos Nick's Way. Theres tacos are MURICA made with all the fixes and meat you could ask for. On average two will fill you up and three if your dying of hunger. Their Burritos are also bomb most notable their California burrito with fries, and their
author: Rokuda R.

description:
Go here and order a taco. You won't be disappointed at all!!! I had the chicken tacos... They were so good. 
Good drinks and good atmosphere too!
author: Samar R.

description:
This place was the first place I stepped foot in when I moved to the neighborhood. Great selection of beers & tequilas, however the tacos is what I am here for...Nicks Way as well as the street tacos! Authentic ! 
Ps They also have habanero sauce for the brave
author: Mario S.

description:
Friend and I came here to watch the NBA All-Star Weekend festivities on Saturday. 

We came here early around 5 pm to get a small table for 2 people with long bar stools. I ordered a beer and we ordered three orders of tacos in total. 

Around 7-720 pm just as when the dunk contest was starting up, a waitress came up to us and politely asked us to vacate the table because there was a line of people waiting to get a table. We acquiesced however after spending over 30$, we could not even finish watching the event for which we came. While speaking to the waitress, we ended up missing part of the event. 

So we ended up standing like a couple of bums hovering over some people and blocking the waiters while trying to catch the last moments of the event. Not what I had in mind to watch the event at the bar. 

The tacos were ok for bar food. The atmosphere was typical, though the big TVs were in the back with tables and most of the people there were not really there to watch the sport events(from my observations). The TVs up front by the bar are on the smaller side. You could tell this is not really a sports bar. 

I found this bar on Yelp while looking for a place to watch sports so if you're a fan of sports and want a place to root for teams or have like minded people, this is not it.
author: John L.

description: Just stopped in today for dinner.  And yes, it's still 5 stars!  Food was delicious!!!!   Will def come back next time I'm in town.
author: Laura O.

description:
If you're in for a taco I would recommend coming here on Tuesdays. It's not the best taco in the world but it's two bucks on Taco Tuesday's. 

My friend and I came in and spent 10 bucks on tacos and about 50 bucks on pop-a-shot

They have large picnic style benches great for groups but the best part is the pop a shot for sure!

The Pop - a - shot, a.k.a. video basketball, is well lit and very fun to play. We got a little match with some other dudes that were there to.   Friendly competition.

I'm thinking about going back next Tuesday, it's a fun time!
author: Justin G.

description:
Allow me to introduce my FAVORITE taco spot everrr. This is probably the only yelp review I've written where I have NOTHING to complain about.  Everything I've tried here is the BOMB.com. My go-to's at this place are:

1) Baja Style tacos made "Nick's Way" meaning guacamole included + they're made in a crispy taco shell instead of a soft tortilla. Hands down my fav thing on the menu.

2) Shrimp Quesadillas - Sooo cheesy & delicious. My 2nd fav thing on the menu.

3) Nachos es muy Grande - I get these w/ no meat & they're still BOMBB

I usually digest all this with the help of they're house Margaritas which are YUMMMY. To top it all off, service is consistently fantastic. Food is always served in a timely fashion by friendly waiters/waitresses. They're bartenders are also super friendly & efficient especially Danny. Ever since I've ate tacos at this place, no other place seems to hit the spot. I'm hooked and will refuse to satisfy by taco cravings anywhere else.
author: Som S.

description: Do yourself a favor and get the elote off the cob! So delish! I haven't had anything I don't like here. It does get super crowded on the weekends tho!
author: Jasmin R.

description: came here after a long all day hike. Not sure if it's the exhaustion and the hunger but damn what a mean taco they make! Got the "baja style Nicks way" - a beer battered fish taco served with guacamole, corn tortilla, and flour tortilla. $7 for one taco so it's pricey but the taco is pretty hearty. Will be coming back to try other items!
author: Wendy L.

description: I like this place. Food is good. Drinks are fine. Service is usually pretty good and quick. Dropped one star for when I use door dash to get delivery from them. Just eat there, it will be way better! But overall I think it's a neighborhood gem.
author: Ella M.

description:
Street tacos, beer, and sports = heaven.

I love this place though don't frequent often. Better to come in large groups so you don't get drowned out easily by the huge crowds coming in. 

A variety of Tequila choices and the Mexican food fills you up and leaves you completely satisfied. I had a street taco and Nick's taco before heading to Outside Lands 2015. Literally devoured it...
author: Melanie G.

description:
My go to burrito spot in San Francisco. It's not operated by your typical Latinos nor does it taste like your south of the border taco. What really fondles the balls is the habernero sauce that they homegrown. It has the type of spicy that makes you cry to your mother if you have enough of it. When you build up the tolerance to it and stop acting like the little kid you are, it tastes great on everything. My standard/usual order is the carne asada San Diego burrito. 

No beans and no rice is what I like. (Opinions vary). Also if I feel like being Paleolithic I'll go without the burrito blunt I'll go with the internals in a bowl, creating a carne asada salad. 

The salsa tastes fresh and makes you feel healthy as fuck, but too many chips lead you to a guilt trip.  This place is vegetarian friendly. It has fish, shrimp and no meat options. 

After swinging around planet granite I end up at this joint (Eating not smoking).  The bar is well stocked and when there is a home game of any sort going on, bring your ear plugs you sissy, because you're in Northern California bitch. 

There are hustlers on that basketball game on the corner, I've seen it go past 150 points 

Customer Service 4/5 
Ambience Varies
Price $6-$15
Food Quality 5/5
Bathroom 3/5
author: A P.

description: This was my favorite sports bar in SF since I love the Nick's Way tacos and vibe.  However, it's hard to consider it the best sports bar in SF if it doesn't even have the PAC-12 network.  Despite the back tables being empty, they said they wouldn't switch from the Michigan game to the Cal game, and couldn't anyways since they didn't have PAC-12 network.  It's SF...  gotta show the local teams! Go Bears !
author: Brian Y.

description:
First of all, this burrito is delicious. Second of all it took about 45 seconds from order to table. 

Parking is a bit of a nightmare, but if you want amazing tacos and burritos with a decent beer selection - this is it. 

Also the chips for the chips and guacamole were spectacularly crispy. Total gem. 

Only thing that didn't get it five stars, there's a few flying bugs chilling everywhere.
author: Devin L.

description: Loud student crowd, sports dive bar vibe with picnic tables and various pennants and flags and TVs pertaining to teams (sports! I have no idea.) Most crucially, the food was super super good. My SF friend said his friends, nearby locals, order the marinated fish taco Nick's Way, so we all did that and it was glorious: heaping mound of marinated fish on pickled cabbage and guac in a hard shell taco then wrapped in a soft shell taco. Just a terrifying mouthful which I got all over my face and enjoyed every minute of. Couple good local beers on tap, mountain of chips and salsa in front of me, face full of fish taco, suddenly all the cheering and flags made sense. Loved it, 10/10, would taco again.
author: Risa D.

description: Tuesday tacos for 2.00, Carne asada from kobe beef, so tender, little cubes of deliciousness, pork, free range chicken, you actually taste the chicken flavor, , and vegetarian with Monterey jack cheese and red beans.  We ate a total of 9.  They were small but filling.  We also had the corn, tender and sweet, requested to have it cut.  No gnawing at the cobb for us, afraid the old dentures might fly out.  We went at 10:30 pm, couldn't find any open restaurants except this one. This was our third try at a spot.  Great service with great recommendations. Music was loud but we actually can converse.  Lots of TV screens, can't miss sports report of Giants winning their game.  Got to come back to try the quesadea.
author: Helen L.

description:
Definitely need to re-review this place. I''d give it a 1.5, but being the nice guy I am, I'm giving them 2. I came here last night after doing some research. As of Feb 13, 2013, 2:40pm this is what their website says:

Super Bowl Special
$20 for seat reservation, includes your first drink.

Taco Tuesday 5pm to close:
2 dollar Tacos
2 dollar Tecates

Happy Hour and 1/2 Monday to Friday 4:30 to 6pm
2 dollar Street Tacos
2 dollar Tecate

1.00  Margaritas
Friday 6:00-6:30
$1.00 Margaritas

I have no qualms about this. However, when we came here yesterday, TUESDAY, Feb 12th, 2013, this menu was not honored. I had to have been updated some time recently around the superbowl... right?

We entered this super packed place, and they had a list for seating. First thing I noticed was the heat. So much body heat. It was really uncomfortable. We were seated immediately luckily... and we ordered. 

My friend ordered the Nick's Way Tacos, which we thought were the 2 dollar tacos...; instead she clarified that the 2 dollar tacos were the street tacos. 

1. The confusion comes in here because from their website, they have "2 dollar Tacos" and later they say "2 dollar Street Tacos"; this usually means there is a difference, and there are only 2 kinds of tacos on the menu... street and nick's way. 
2. Second, I asked if they had the 2 dollar tecates, and they said no, it's 3 dollars now. Should have paid the premium for another beer because Tecate tastes like crap, but for 2 dollars, eh. 

We get our food, which takes forever, which is excusable, because of how packed it is. However when the food comes, these street tacos are super small. Not worth it at all. The chicken is extremely extremely dry. Don't get chicken. Carne Asada was alright at best.

Finally, I ask for the check which comes quickly. However, it took about 5 minutes of waiving my credit card in the air and multiple waiters/waitresses passing me at least 7 times before one notices my flailing arm. 

I'm pretty sure I won't be returning for tacos ever again.
author: Kaje Y.

description: I stopped in here late on a Thursday night for a burrito and it was a delicious, pleasant experience. Great burrito, multiple TV's to watch, and friendly staff. I will be back whenever I am in the area and want tacos, a burrito, or a drink
author: Jay P.

description: Awesome drink selection and a really wide range of tacos; I opted for a quesadilla, which was perfectly crispy and very satisfying. The tacos have both hard and soft shells, allowing everything to stay together while still giving you that crunch. As the evening went on, the sports bar energy got louder and louder, to the point that it was a little too loud to have a conversation. Probably an excellent spot for watching a game, though.
author: AJ P.

description:
Delicious!  Dont really even need to say more.  Fish taco's fried and grilled, tastes like I am in Mexico at the beach.
The drinks tasty and strong.    Lastly, the service EXCELLENT...attentive, prompt and friendly!
author: Kim A.

description:
Came here one day around 4pm, place was pretty chill, not too many people, just a few people watching the basketball game. 

As soon as I walked in, I smelled a mixture of bleach and mop water. Gross. The place smelled disgusting. 

I ordered the carne asada taco trio, NASTY. They came out all cold and when I took a bite, it tasted like dog. The smell of the meat was just nasty and smelled like wet dog. EWWWW. The smell of the mop water place and the dog tasting tacos just made me wanna throw up. 

On top of that, the bartenders and waitresses were extremely slow, which doesn't make sense because the place wasn't that packed anyways. 

Wouldn't come here again if it were my choice. This place is nasty and the service sucks.
author: Amanda R.

description:
Girlfriend was raving about the tacos at this place so I finally decided to try it. The taco shop is situated inside a sports bar so set your expectations properly (don't take your date here, for example, unless they want to watch the warriors kick some ass). As for the tacos themselves, I definitely wasn't disappointed. The nicks way tacos with guac were pretty damn good. I got the carnitas, and my girlfriend got the shrimp taco + nicks way. They definitely don't skimp on the guac here as it was overflowing from the top. The salsas they provide on the table paired very well with the tacos. 

The four stars is due to two reasons. The tacos are very top heavy, meaning that once you eat the guac/cheese/meat from the top, the bottom of the taco was basically just tortilla and some melted cheese. Actually on that note, I wish they gave me less guac and a little more of other filings (tomato, meat). The other reason is that I don't consider this place cheap in terms of tacos (carnitas was $5 and shrimp + nicks way was $7, and that's for ONE taco).

In any case I'll probably still come back here in the future.
author: Jinyan C.

description:
- Nick's Way tacos looked really good but I didn't have any
- Carnitas taco were better than the grilled fish taco
- On second thought, just don't get the grilled fish taco... it was dry and flavorless and just blah in general
- Great for happy hour
- Liked the salsas
author: Sherry L.

description:
I recently had a knee injury and wanted to get out of the house to watch the Warriors game. They were not only super friendly but very accommodating. Woody was our server and took great care of us! Woody and Max checked in with us frequently even when I could tell he was very busy. 
The overall team ensured I was comfortable and taken care of it was very nice. They even kept asking if they could get me a fresh ice pack. 
Thanks for making my night out enjoyable. We'll definitely be back for Taco Tuesday really soon.
author: Amy L.

description: I would say the food is great when you can get it. Don't try to order to-go in person. Call in and save yourself the headache. Don't know about the drinks. They suffer the same problem and can't call those in.
author: Johnny Z.

description: The tacos here are awesome! The food here is really good. Especially the fish taco! That was probably one of the best fish tacos I've ever had. Really cool laid back spot and somewhat family friendly. The food here is good and so are the drinks! Definitely a place I'd come back to. Especially during this month with march madness!
author: Kevin C.

description: This is a great place to chill with a group of friends especially since they close pretty late. The environment is laid back and their waiters are very kind. Their food is reasonably priced and two meals can fill me up for the afternoon. I recommend the Carne Asada cheese quesadilla or pescado (fried fish) tacos. I had those two my first visit there and have been my go tos ever since. This taco shop is great for game days or relaxing, they show all sorts of sports for their customers to watch. This place is great for a variety of people, such as high school students, college students, and even for those that enjoy to drink. They have a bar on the side and the benches in the back for those looking to eat. If you don't mind the liveliness and noise then this place is wonderful for you.
author: Benjamin C.

description:
GO TO NICKS THIS PLACE SUCKS 
Went here last Tuesday with friends for tacos and margaritas. Our blond waitress basically swindled us then lied about it being her last day probably so that we would still tip. She brought us three tacos and one single pitcher of margaritas. 
The total? 70 bucks. I almost flipped out and walked out on the bill.  Should have and everyone I was with agreed after the fact. 
Tacos were, like always, eh kinda whatever. You could go to any Mexican food place in San Diego and get better tacos for half the price so I was highly unimpressed on the quality to price ratio. Especially because on taco tuesday everyone's tryin to have cheap, tasty tacos and a good time. 
As for the margarita (and the main reason why I felt tempted to smash the pitcher on the ground say f u and walk out) was able to modestly fill 4 glasses with mainly ice. My boyfriend commented that it must have been good tequila because he could hardly even taste it. Wrong, to this day I wonder if their was ever tequila in the margaritas in general. Price? 45 bucks after tax meaning we paid per person about 11.25 per person for half a virgin margarita. 
The manager came over and tried to explain the situation, to which I gave about zero fs about hearing. 
I work in a vaunted restaurant which prides itself on customer service, quality, quantity and sustainability. So I know just as well as you mr manager guy their is no excuse for sht service, mediocre food and crappy drinks. None. 
Not returning to be fkd and unsatisfied when I leave.
I know u payoff this site to give u the score u maintain. Why else would all the five star elite  reviewers pop up first.

Y'allpay foryour ratings. How else does Only 5 star elitespop up as your suggestedreviews ?
author: Samantha S.

description: Attended Sunday evening.  This is a fun and relaxing sports bar type atmosphere with plenty of lively crowd, 80's music, plenty of activity at the bar in front and full picnic tables in the back next to the skeeball,  large screen tvs (x4) KC vs Boston, dinner conversation.  Notable craft draft beers from various So Cal coastal locales.  Diverse menu. Baja taco Nick's way was so enticing, forgot to snap a photo.  Elote con Queso was also devoured by my particular son.
author: Brian D.

description:
This review is solely on the food!

So i've been here a couple of times now and i've had my share of experiences. Okay, so every time I come here I make sure that there is no game going on. I say that because if you just want food without the fuss, don't go on a game day because it tends to get pretty packed. I've been here with friends and have noticed that some servers there look at us differently because we're not there for the drinks. Or that we slightly look under aged and I believe they think that we don't belong there... -1 star for the nasty looks.

Food wise, i'm a big fan of their carne asada tacos. If you do end up getting a taco, get it Nick's Way!! I believe it adds, sour creme, guac, and beans??? Anyway, one taco is already ~$4 but it is worth your money. Also add those sauces that they provide because it definitely brings out the flavor in their food. Occasionally when i'm there with my bf, we get nachos. Steak nachos. Those are heavy. Please share 3-5 people if you guys end up ordering tacos as well, it's pretty huge. Nachos, cheese, guac, steak, sour cream, beans. Make sure you eat it right away because it gets soggy pretty fast.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Didn't expect to come here on a Tuesday night but... *cue the Tuesday song by that one rapper dude*

First things first: do not forget your ID. There's a bouncer sitting in front of the shop that will ask for your ID. I think after a certain time of the day, it's only open to 21+... but don't take my word for it. My friend and I didn't have to wait long for a table although the hostess said it was going to be a 20-min wait. It was more like 3 minutes.

There were a handful of beer on tap but I chose Speakeasy and my friend chose Drakes ($6/pint). For food, we settled for one of the Baja fish taco, Nick's Way style ($5.95) and Nacho es muy Grande with carne asada ($12.95). The food and drinks arrived relatively quick! I swear it was no more than a 10-minute wait. And boy oh boy, was I in for a treat.

The nachos were HUMONGOUS. Literally a mountain of fried (seemed double-fried to me) tortilla chips covered in meat, salsa, jalapeños, and a very generous portion of guacamole. It also came with a side of sour cream on the side. I don't know if they always served it on the side (in a plastic sauce container) but I liked that they did that without me asking.

Can I get a drum roll please... *insert air drum* The Baja fish taco was the star of the meal. The fish was fresh and juicy - juicer than the ripest apple you've ever bit into. Again, another generous amount of guacamole on top of the taco. I ain't complaining.

I would come back again. I want to try their HH margaritas!
author: Annie S.

description:
If I can give this place ZERO STARS, I would. Long story short: not a spot for San Franciscans and especially not friendly to Latinx folks. (Be prepared to be ignored & offended if you're not a transplant) 

For some reason, every time I go here the service is rude and the wait time is ridiculous. On more than one occasion, I waited longer than people who ordered after me and the wait staff have either given me attitude or my friends attitude. This past weekend was the LAST STRAW. 
I get that their demographic is for hipsters, but it should also be inviting to locals. 

Incident one: 
Rude server complained as my friends and I were leaving because we wrote on the credit card 0 for tip since we left it in cash (even though he was inattentive and gave too much attitude when we asked for more rounds of shots). He then put his hand on my friends shoulder!!!! Then proceeded with his sarcastic tone "just to let you know tips are obligatory not optional". My friend immediately said "don't touch me bro" and was getting mad because this guy has been rude to us all evening!!!!! How inconsiderate! Tips are OPTIONAL and if he bothered to clear the table, we left it in CASH on the table. 18% too.... Not okay! 

Incident two: Just recently (last Thursday to be precise), I placed a takeout order on the phone with my mom who is Salvadoreña and pronounced all the Spanish words as they should be.. Not only did the woman who answer the phone hang up on my mother, she did not verify the order, gave us attitude for calling back to make sure the total & did nothing to try to slanderer our question. We wanted a cheese quesadilla with sour cream and guac but she placed an order but it was SEVENTEEN DOLLARS!!! I got so mad at her condescending tone to my mother that I demanded to ask her why the online website price is more than 12$ cheaper. 
She then claimed I was wrong and looking at the wrong menu. I told her it was 4.75 for the quesadilla before tax & then told her the total that was including our additional 0.50 toppings, 2.50 rice side order, and tax as well. Instead of checking the menu to see the other options for quesadilla, or asking us more questions, she just HUNG UP ON ME!!! 

Once I arrived, I asked about my order and it was nowhere to be found. 
The nicest wait staff in that whole taco shop was this young Asian American lady who fixed my order, paid attention to our table, and tried to make up for the TERRIBLE & RUDE employees. Turns out, not only did they not put my name down properly but they made a POLLO QUESADILLA not their "poco quesadilla". Had she checked the prices, she would have seen I wanted the 4.75 quesadilla and not their 9.50 chicken quesadilla. 

 and the server who took my order argued with me instead of fixing her mistake and kept pronouncing pollo as "polo". You work in a taco shop... even if you don't know much Spanish, you should educate yourself on the menu of your restaurant/bar... 
it's very offensive to those of us who identify as Latinxs and speak Spanish. Not to mention disrespectful too. 

This Asian American waitress was able to tell that we were being ignored since her coworkers took orders of the people next to us and couldn't even bother to turn his head to see that I was raising my hand. 
I appreciated her constantly trying but felt frustrated because she kept apologizing for something that's not her fault! 

Incident three: let's just say this place may also need a new manager because the manager Max cussed out someone I know. They were just expressing the inattentive and rude server and they were met with a hostile manager. NOT PROFESSIONAL AT ALL. 


That's it. Never going back again. This place lost future business with me AND MY FRIENDS.
author: Emi N.

description:
I've heard great things about Underdog's  tacos and wanted to find out myself. I ordered Pescado "Baja" fish tacos with Nick's Way for the ultimate taste. The serving size for the taco was decent for $5.25. I would come back here if I was in the area. Watching football game or baseball game seem like an ideal place.

Their service is a bit slow for a weekday afternoon. Took quite awhile for the food to come out. They also did not have some drinks on their menu when it clearly said "special of the day", way to crush my excitement. Other than that, the place is great.
author: Owie N.

description:
Over one hour wait time for a table after arriving at 8:30 PM--completely understandable on Taco Tuesday, one of their busiest nights (especially with the Giants on.) However, some tables sat for 15-30 minutes before being filled. Not sure what the logic behind that was.

Anyway, baja tacos are DELICIOUS, definitely get it Nick's Way. Actually, get anything Nick's Way. Nick is a bloody food genius. Chips and nachos are amazing as well. The meat in the carnitas taco was dry though, I'd recommend just sticking to fish or carne asada instead.

The drink menu is extensive--they have a variety of beers on tap along with a huge supply of other hard liquor (someone say tequila?) Their cocktails could use some work though. My friends' Tequila Sunset and Lemon Drop tasted off compared to what we usually drink. Couldn't quite pinpoint what was wrong with the Tequila Sunset, but the Lemon Drop had WAY too much Sweet and Sour. Granted, the place was pretty packed, so I can see how mistakes can occur.

Not sure if it was because they were so busy because or the game or not, but it felt as if they were understaffed due to the slight lack of service. The workers were friendly when we did receive service, but execution was a bit lacking. Even at the end of the night when we received our bill, we waited for a good while before having to hunt down a waiter ourselves in order to pay.

Tldr;; Great food and drinks, long wait. Get there early if you're going on a Tuesday.
author: Felicity L.

description: If you haven't been here and need to meet up friends in SF, suggest this place next time. This is a great place to meet up with friends, grab a few drinks and catch up over some amazing/affordable/high-quality grub. There are picnic tables in the back for group seating and small bar tables and bar-top seating out front. You can't go wrong with Nick's Crispy Fish Tacos, a side of chips/salsa and guac, and their rich, but worth it, elotes. I also recently tried their agua frescas since I didn't want to drink alcohol, and thought it was very refreshing. It can get crowded here at times with a lot of lurkers trying to get your picnic table, but the staff isn't too pushy to get you out. My last visit here, I met up with old friends from college and they let us get separate checks. I really appreciated this since I was traveling for work and needed to handle my reimbursement. For those of you with a little Steph Curry in you, there's also a basketball game in the back. Happy to report I always crush my competition, but that's probably because my husband is better at shooting a real basketball and I do better off in the Chuck-E-Cheese league. If I needed to state one gripe about this place, it would be the lack of Golden State Warriors representation. Ownership must not be a fan lol.. there's a ton of other sports memorabilia in there though. I hate driving (and parking) in SF, but the parking fairies have always blessed me with help in this neck of the woods, so it's never too painful.
author: Ghia G.

description:
One of my favorite spots to grab a quick bite in the city. I love their take on Mexican food from the 'tacos nicks way' to the 'elote off the cob'. I have never had a bad meal here. The service is always on point (fast and friendly). 

My roommates and I find ourselves trying to go to new places only to wind up here on the weekends eating and drinking. Cheers.
author: Paul V.

description: Hands down the best Mexican food outside of the mission. I live in the sunset and getting really good Mexican food is very tricky. Their carnitas are amazing. Both salsas they offer are a must. Something about their carnitas burritos with both salsas just hits the spot. I'm so glad this place exists.
author: Ami B.

description: Just demolished the vege street taco... Cabbage, corn, beans, onions, cheese, cilantro.... Sooooooooooo good!!! Two chicken street tacos amazing also. Simple, fresh, clean. Oh! Attentive happy service!!
author: J D.

description: I've had breakfast burritos all over this town for years, but the La Bomba burrito here is hands down the best I've had anywhere in San Francisco.  A massive portion with perfectly cooked eggs, well seasoned potatoes, andouille sausage that isn't too greasy, and perfectly crisp bacon.
author: Joshua W.

description: Don't you dare eat a fish taco anywhere else! Nicks Baja is thee best fish taco I've ever had! And I've had tacos in Baja! Lol The bartenders are fun and nice. Pro taco tip: order one taco at a time so they don't get soggy.
author: Melissa M.

description: Great quality tacos but the few times I've gone during Taco Tuesday's have been packed to the max. Always a fun vibe going with friends and the service is usually great.
author: Eduardo P.

description: They have the best fish tacos here! Be sure to get the Baja Style fish tacos Nick's Way! Trust me, you won't regret it :)
author: Sharon P.

description:
The fish tacos are the sleeper here. I mean these are out of this world, insanely good, heavily packed fish tacos. The baja tacos are deep fried but with a light coat (so you don't feel like you're chewing grease) and with a hard shell wrapped in a soft tortilla. 

And if you get them nick's way? It's night night. 

Extremely affordable
Open semi-late
Great place to watch sports games as well. 

I love this place.
author: Allen J.

description: My favorite place to go out and eat. If someone wants to go get dinner or lunch this is always my first suggestion! My girlfriend and I always get either a Baja Fish taco each (nicks way of course) with chips and guac and a side of elote( which the first time I ever ordered the server was nice enough to suggest us to have it served cut off the cob which made it perfect to share!) or sometimes we both just get two tacos each and call it a night! The staff is usually super sweet and always polite! There is this one blonde girl who is super sweet and always on top of it! When we came on a game day just to eat she made sure we got a table despite the fact it was packed because we just wanted to eat and leave. The only down side is the space and little seating but it's worth it for the bomb food! Awesome atmosphere as well! Oh and the homemade sauces are bomb!
author: Bianca J.

description: Love coming here for a casual meal and beer.  It's great to hang out with friends.  They also are a great place if you're looking to watch something like the World Series, Superbowl, etc.  If you come on a Tuesday night it's 2-fer tacos and you may  need to wait for a table..its worth it!
author: Charles H.

description:
The fish tacos and nachos were first rate, the ambiance and decor are unique and make it easy to spend a more time than just eating...great bar...highly recommend...service is first rate and friendly.

I wish I lived near by to go more often.
author: Jason J.

description:
I love tacos.
Pork.  Beef.  Chicken.  Fish.  All of it works.  

But I do love pork the best.

Nick's Crispy Tacos (of Polk Street) is also in the sunset!  They're The Taco Shop @ Underdog's.  Muy convenient!

Affectionately known as Crispy Nick's, they do some straight up friggin delicious taco grub.  Street style tacos.  Nick's way tacos.  

Nick's way?  A soft corn tortilla envelops a crispy one.  That way, you don't lose any delicious crispy bits when you nosh.  Muy thoughtful.  Kinda genius too.

Oh, that Nick!

You can order @ the bar.  You can also call in ahead for pick up.  I called in.  The gentleman that answered my call could not have been nicer.  I love getting A+ phone demeanor.  Don't you?

I've done the street tacos.  I've done the fish tacos.  I've done them Nick's way.  All great.  But remember, this is gringo fare.  It's called Nick's.  It's not called Juan's.

The quesadillas are really more like burritos.  Just a warning.

Love Crispy Nick's.  The sunset is muy lucky to have them.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Since I live in the sunset I try to come here as much as possible so I don't have to go far for a cheap meal and drink sangria (or pound cheap tecates if I'm in mood). 

My go-to is the Baja taco, nicks way. And if I have a bigger appetite I'll just turn that into a burrito. 

Try to avoid the crowd if you're trying to eat since seating is either wait for server or self-serve. It's confusing and awkward. Taco Tuesday is usually crowded but it's one of the best times to go for a good time.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
Stopped by a couple days ago since I decided to make the trek up to SF, and I have to say--
my server (Tessa, I think?) literally made my experience. I've never had someone so attentive  and focused. Absolutely amazing! :D
author: Jill H.

description:
With regard to my last review, I just want to say that it obviously depends on the time of day or evening you go to Underdog's that will dictate the type of service you get, as I stopped in yesterday with my friend after a long walk in GGP and our early afternoon pho around 4:30PM and we had a nice time with good, fast service to boot.

I was really jonesin' for chips and guac with salsa and the green sauce Underdog's makes, and we had a great parking spot around the corner so I talked my friend into going with me. He was really sore from a volleyball tourney the previous day, so he got a Bloody Mary too. The chips and guac with salsa is a favorite of mine, and I love that green sauce like a man loves boobies. 

Our waitress was very attentive and sweet, and forthcoming with the recipe for that green sauce! She even offered to send me home with some which was so cool, though I declined as I want to try to make it myself. It was pretty empty when we got there but started to fill out by the time we were leaving. Overall, a solid spot and you really just have to wear your patience hat when you come on a busy night.
author: Crystal C.

description: LOVE LOVE this place.. Best fish taco I had. I go there weekly that's just how much I love it. Great place, nice stuff and delicious Mexican food
author: Dylan L.

description:
I was taken aback by how great this food was. Cheap, GIANT tacos, great quesadillas,  great burritos. Everyone I was with loved their meal and it was a fun, relaxed environment. 

So excited to have found a place like this in the sunset!
author: Marilyn M.

description: Tacos Nick's Way. Just do it. They're like gordita crunches at taco bell, but obviously better. I had them yesterday for the first time and I can't wait to come back for more!
author: Cynthia S.

description: We ate here while visiting San Francisco from out of town. We had the street tacos and chips and salsa. It was decent, not fantastic, but not bad. Server was pleasant and efficient. We've only been once though so I will be sure to update my review if and when we ever make it back.
author: Jessica C.

description:
This place has the "Best" Mexican Food in the City. 

Its a pretty cool atmosphere with plenty of TV's to watch the game and hang out with friends. 

The service is great and the price for the food and drinks are not bad at all.
author: Matthew M.

description: Perfect place to watch any sporting event. Great food and even better service. Definetly will be back again especially for those Baja tacos.
author: Bianca Z.

description:
Pretty good food. Decent happy hour specials. Service is really geared to regulars and the close personal friends of the servers and bartenders. Waited quite a bit for someone to even acknowledge me, despite several looking me right in the eye. Several of them just shooting the breeze with their friends about nothing right next to me. Then when taking my order acted like they were doing me a favor. Not cool, unless you're a friend or hipster like them. I want to say good things about the place because of their story and their food, but after several visits this is my last. 

Then only a half order of chips in my bag with or green and one red salsa for 3 to go items. No thanks. Just here you go. Owner standing by too.
author: Chris H.

description: On a trip to San Francisco and our Airbnb is right down the street. Lucky us. We came here for dinner because we are taco snobs and we're impressed. The chips and salsa had a very good portion of fresh salsa, not just a couple scoops. The tacos prepared nicks way are unreal and the corn was amazing. Finally, the cocktails and atmosphere make this place. It's the busiest place on the block. If ever in San Fran again, we will be back.
author: Anthony W.

description:
What if there was a place where you and your buddies could watch multiple widescreens featuring yet another game of Steph Curry doing what he does best, everything on the menu is delicious with hefty servings so you really can't go wrong, a moderate number of beers are on draft, and there's a formidable array of tequila? What if there were dope squeeze bottles for sauces? And, just for shits and giggles, you can play PAC-MAN or shoot your own baskets at one of those arcade basketball things? On top of all that, the service is friendly and efficient? I know, right? Good luck finding a place like that.

Anyways, parking gets really difficult / the joint gets really busy around 5pm. Street parking in nearby residentials are your safest bet; don't be a lazy prick, go up to Judah or Kirkham to look for spots.

Taco Tuesdays -$2 street tacos and $3 Tecates
Margarita Fridays - $1 margaritas

If you're new to the area, take 5 minutes to look up Nick Fasanella.
author: Douglas Y.

description: Everything here is great. The food, the people and the service. I always like to start out with the Elote con Queso and then maul some Nick's way tacos.
author: Kirsten F.

description: Really enjoyed the vibe at this spot. Came for the Bloody and wasn't disappointed. Chased it with a Tecate. Tacos were good, however I wouldn't advise getting the "Nicks Way". Inner shell was difficult to chew and became soggy pretty quick.
author: Ruby M.

description: This was a great place to watch a baseball game have beer and eat some delicious tacos the one night I was here in San Francisco by myself. The tacos were great especially the free salsa in the bottles that I could dump on top of it
author: Ed C.

description: Last time I was here was about a month ago and the only thing going through my head was "why haven't I decided to come here sooner?"  Whether you are a sports fan or just like really good food, this is definitely the perfect place to go. I ordered the tacos, although I wish I would've ordered the quesadilla everything still tasted great. Great atmosphere and I loved the place.
author: Rommel A.

description: came across this place couple yrs ago on my way to work. checked it out and was not disappointed! my go to are the tacos nick's way, and chips/guacamole. they're really good and pretty similar to the ones at la taqueria in terms of style; meat obviously little different but tasty.  decided to try something new the other day and got the SF burrito; I missed the part about the wheat tortilla - not a fan! the inside ingredients and the size of that thing were good of course but I'm not a fan of wheat tortillas, it has a weird smell to me.  I grew up in the mission so for me the whole diff flavor tortillas for burritos is not for me. next time I'll stick to my chips, tacos and beers.
author: E S.

description: They have the best carnitas tacos and burritos ever!! My to go place for cali burrito (no salsa) and Nick's tacos. Friendly staff too
author: C N.

description:
I've been coming here pretty frequently for the past 2 years and I'm surprised I haven't posted a review and recommendation until now. The Taco Shop lives up to their reputation.

First off, the Taco Shop is a great neighborhood bar with a diverse crowd. It's a great place to catch a game or have a rowdy night with friends. But the main reason to come here...it's all about the tacos. If you like Nick's Crispy Tacos on Polk, then you can find them here too. 

Which taco should you have? They're all good, but you gotta get them Nick's Way, which is a soft taco wrapped around a crispy taco and filled with delicious goodness. My favorite is the fish taco. 

As for value, add the Taco Shop on your list of cheap eats. Regular street tacos are $7.25 for 3. But it's Nick's Way all the way. Their only $4.50-5.50 each. One Nick's Way taco is quite filling. Two might lead to some belly rubs. Your choice, your risk.
author: Albert L.

description: Love this place, mostly, because they serve tacos, Nick's way! Can't ever go wrong with Baja Style (beer-battered fish taco) done Nick's Way (flour tortilla, cheese in-between, crispy corn tortilla, GUAC) -- but no cheese for me! This is is my favorite fish taco ever. One is more than enough because it is the size of a mini-burrito. I also love that I can get this in Sunset instead of driving all the way over to Nick's Crispy Tacos. House margarita (by the pitcher, of course) pairs perfectly with the tacos! I don't eat cheese, but my friend ordered a carne asada quesadilla, which looked gigantic, crispy, and so meaty that I almost ate cheese just to try it.
author: Anna Z.

description:
Ummm...giant tacos?! Hell yea! Margaritas and beer? Oooh yes! 

No outside drinks!

They only serve food at the tables and its open seating. It gets crowded so you might need to wait a while before you can snag a good table.
author: Nika L.

description: Fabulous fabulous fabulous!!!!! Baja fish tacos are one of the best! Black bean and corn taco salad was delish!!!  Won't go wrong stopping in this Sports bar.  If you're a Chicago fan, so is the owner!
author: Valerie I.

description: Not the most authentic Mexican food and it was also pricey I might add. They have TVs to watch sports and alcohol drinks. Small restaurant and self seating. I had the carne asada (NIck's Style) which was tough. I also didn't like the hard taco that came with the Nick's Style.
author: Kimmie H.

description: Oh yeah! Whatever you get. Get it "nicks way"
author: Miguel E.

description:
The worst tacos I've ever had. Period. They were so bland and dry, left us thirsty for both flavor and of actual thirst.

The "house margarita" is nothing but a sour lemonade with salt on the rim. Really bad.

Lastly, to get a table you need to literally chase the hostess to put your name down. She had no order in how she took down the names or how she called them. It makes no sense.

I'm beyond disappointed and ashamed to have brought my best friend here.

Save your money, time and taste buds.
author: Miss E.

description: Great Mexican-inspired tacos. Great music. $3 Tecates poured by friendly staff. But the kicker just might be breakfast burritos with New Mexico green chile served 'til 4:30p. Pair with a red snapper. Love, CompassionateCareCA.com
author: Mark E.

description:
I come here for celebratory tacos every Saturday at 5:30 or so after my team wins. Why? Because the tacos are so freaking delicious. The michelada is delicious. The guacamole is DELICIOUS. That's why this place will continue to be my celebratory taco place. 

Carne asada tacos nick's way are the most amazing thing to grace this earth. Serious business stuff with guac and pico and just 1 taco fills me up and keeps me happy.

I ventured out of my comfort zone and tried the grilled fish taco and the grilled shrimp taco. I definitely like the grilled shrimp taco more than the fish taco. But the last 2 times I got it, they skimped on my pico :( and it's like 1 part fish/shrimp, 3 parts cabbage, and 1/2 part guac and pico. I think I'd enjoy it more if it was 1 part fish, 1 part cabbage, 1 part pico, and 1 part guac. 

ERMAGHERD. The corn is AMAZEBALLZ. Spicy, cheesy, and absolutely drool worthy. Order it. Do it. Or you'll regret it. 

I'll have to find an excuse to be back every Saturday when football season is over. It won't be hard since the food is so good!
author: Sujin Y.

description:
Fabulous place for tacos! I love the traditional street style tacos, so I ordered a plate of those and I couldn't have been happier.
Thankfully I kept a menu handy because as I looked through it once more, I noticed on the side there were... *gasp* coffee drinks?? It's rare to find a menu that includes coffee cocktails, so of course, I had to order one. 
My boyfriend never had one before, so I insisted he try, and I'm glad they make them so delicious here because I got him hooked! 
Not to mention, service is extremely great here, although I wish there was a bit more seating available? Perhaps we had some difficulty because we came right in the middle of dinner time.
Regardless, I'm happy to have found this place, I will be back!
author: Krystyna R.

description: Love this place. I always come back specifically for the chicken nachos, grilled fish tacos *nicks way, and their house margaritas. AMAZING. One of the best fish tacos and margaritas i've ever had.
author: Vee T.

description:
I'm not sure if I can give an accurate review because I was tired as hell when we came to have a late bite to eat here. 
The fish taco was really good but at nearly 7 bucks for 1, you can find just as good or better elsewhere. I also had the soup which was nice because I didn't really feel well, but nothing to write home about. 
This place seems more geared to sports fans so I think people who are into sports would enjoy it. Apparently they have a $1 margarita Friday happy hour, again good if you are into that.
author: Vivian H.

description: Good food and a nice well set up sports bar however the service by the hipsters is pretty poor. They left off some food items, never checked back in with us so we could tell them, and just seemed too busy to bother with a second round of beer for us. If you could blow out the staff and hire someone that gives a darn the place would be pretty perfect.
author: Heather W.

description:
The Taco Shop at Underdog's
SF:
Sunday March 4, 2012
Two stars

[SF#10]

We wanted to watch the Laker v. Heat game, so we headed down to the underdog's.  The place is real awkward.  There are banners for every northern California team plus a bunch of Chicago Teams.  We sat in the back on the bleachers.  We spent $10 playing Super-Shot (mini basketball game).  It was really fun, competitive, and exhausting (I held the record of our group of 58 points).  Then a family with small children sat next to us making drinking and merriment decline rapidly. 

The drink: Two Expensive $28 Margaritas Pitchers
The food: Nachos, Nick's Way Carnitas Taco (Fancy Double Decker Taco), and SF Burrito.

The food was slightly expensive for the quality. Plus everything tasted just a little bit off.  I mean when you are farther from the source, the worst the food gets (like NY Pizza).

Not a Big Fan.
author: Leonard L.

description:
Solid four stars. Came on a Thursday night around 10 and it was super packed because this place is also a sports bar. Located a waitress and places my to go order. The service was great, the waitress was very help and my food came out within a minute or two of ordering. 

Nick's way taco with carne asada: 4 stars, love that they put guac on without extra charges but wasn't a fan of the corn tortilla. Carne asada was good. 

Elote con queso was pretty good too, but it needed a bit more spice. 

Would come back here, esp since they have insane kitchen hours. (Morning till late night)
author: Kay A.

description: Great Sports bar with the best fish tacos I've had in the bay. Make sure you get it Nick's way!  Great experience to watch a game with a few buddies, and prompt service when ordering takeout.
author: Logan B.

description:
The Fish Tacos Nick Style are killer. I started off my Birthday celebration with a shot of tequila and an order of chips and salsa here. Oh, those damn chips and salsa are amazing! I typically order two.

I ordered two tacos Nick Style one with Fish and the other with Carne Asada. Nick style is a corn tortilla inside a flour tortilla fried. It's amazing!! 

The Carne Asada was mediocre. Too much fat and not enough flavor. The Fish tacos were amazing!! So good I ordered a second round.

This place gets pretty packed. There is not much table seating so if you see a spot when you walk in take it!! Especially on a game day. The service is alright but inconsistent when it gets busy. It can take a while to get your order so order up ahead of time.
author: Caro S.

description: Can get really cramped and crowded with no seating availability if your coming in as a group. But the service is great and the tacos, oh my the tacos! Yaaaasss!!
author: Za T.

description:
Kinda like a dive bar. But the taco's are amazing.
Great atmosphere for a game. Ask for Nicks way to take your taco to the next level. Ask for Genisis. She's the bomb waitress/bartender.
author: Mack J.

description: Love coming here for burritos and beers! Busy on game days & the weekend but plenty of seating in the back.
author: Jes C.

description:
Excellent Mexican bar and grill

I've been wanting to try this place for a long time from reading all the good reviews. Finally tried it today and I had a great experience.

Food was great, I got the fish taco nicks way which is the crowd favorite over here. They do a hard shell over soft which gives it nice texture and the fish fried perfectly, nice gold crunch in the outside and soft tender on the inside. The different sauces they give to compliment the meal was very good as well, I personally like the habenero sauce.  Also had a chance to try the steak quesadilla and it was also really good. The tortilla was cook to a nice toasted crunch but still soft. 

Nice place to watch games they have a good amount of tvs. Overall nice place to hang out.
author: Noel I.

description: Went here on Taco Tuesday and the service and food was great! The kitchen is very much on point and you can order as you go and the food comes right out....This place is a must try if you come to SF for cheap good mexican food and drinks!
author: AVERY R.

description:
Solid casual bar to watch sports, drink, and eat tacos! The bartenders/servers were busy but attentive and friendly.  Aaaand that's what's going to keep me coming back. Maybe because the food here is good and decently priced as well ;)

There is usually seating on most days (unless you're trying to go for Taco Tuesday, sheesh!....)

Drinks are reasonably priced. They had sangria and moscow mules as their special that day (for $5!) so hailllllllll yeah.
One Nick's Way taco will keep you full. It's definitely one of the best fish tacos out there (if not the best in the city!). What more can I say that others haven't!?
author: Emily C.

description: Was looking for a great atmosphere to watch football on Sunday and try some yummy food and thank goodness for yelps recommendations for this place. The tacos were amazing!!! Actually one of the best fish tacos I've tried. So many flavors going and I tried one of the homemade sauces and it tasted like a creamy hot salsa and I loved it. The taco portions are big! I could only finish one taco along side a couple margaritas I tried it Nicks way since that's what was recommended and it was so delicious. Good fish to taco toppings ratio. So glad to have found another great restaurant in the city. Only thing I was a little thrown off by was the seating. I wish there was more room for tables and such. But hey they do a really great job with accommodating everyone that walks in!
author: Natalie L.

description: Love Love Love this place!! Actually, I just love the food! Too noisy for me, but that's why I do take out!! 2 tacos- 1 Chicken and 1 Carnitas Nicks Way is my ideal dinner!! From the crunch from the shell to the flavors from all the toppings, everything was just perfect!
author: Darlene M.

description:
Super disappointed. I've come here a couple times and had a good time. Tonight was a different story though. 

Tonight we came in and ordered drinks. My order was wrong, and they corrected it, telling me the other drink would be free. Yet it was on the bill at the end of the night. At least the food was as delicious as always. 

Then the real comedy started. The bartender (looked to be bar manager maybe?) got in a fight with one of the girls working there. He yelled at her before smashing one of the bar stations. Yes, you read that correctly. He smashed a bar station with his fists right in front of where we were sitting. They then continued yelling at each other outside. Twice. Once wasn't even enough to embarrass themselves enough or to apologize for making a scene. 

No one working there even acknowledged what happened. A cop even came in after someone called about a disturbance outside. Yet they continues to "work". Everyone sitting around me was floored, and a few groups asked for their checks and immediately left. We were too stupid to do that. 

Meanwhile, the other employees didn't do anything. Our drinks sat empty. We watched multiple employees pour themselves drinks while ours sat empty. I was again given something I didn't order (also on the bill) when they finally did come over. 

They also played the same song on the sound system 5 times super loudly. The margaritas were weak. I can't really say anything positive except the food was good. 

This was just an awful experience. I can't believe I had to pay good money for that.
author: Sal F.

description:
Stopped in for some lunch tacos and was not disappointed. I got a chicken and a baja fish taco, both served 'Nick's way' which means both a hard and soft shell plus extra cheese and guac. They were hefty and quite delicious. Someone in our group had a Bloody Mary which was on the spicier side which depends on your preference. 
The decor is sportsbar-y with an odd mix of Bay Area and Midwest teams represented.
Overall, I'd certain go back for more tacos.
author: Jerusha E.

description:
This review is long overdue, but they don't really need it. I don't care. This is easily one of my favorite 3 joints in the city, and I'm here at least once a week for better or worse.  They have you covered for yummy Mexican food, with pretty late kitchen hours for SF, a wide range of drinks, and a chill Sunset vibe.  I'm from San Diego, so I slightly favor the style of food they serve here, which is a little more fried and a little more fusion-y, over that in the Mission.

I usually order one of two different things -- a couple of Nick's way Baja fish tacos, or the Cheeseburger burrito.  

The fish tacos are my favorite.  You get a decently sized cut of fish, battered and fried to perfection, inside a crisply fried tortilla wrapped by a soft tortilla.  Add to that a generous helping of delicious guacamole and their house "orange" salsa, and you have a winner.  Comes with a sprig of cilantro and slice of lime.

The Cheeseburger burrito is a funny invention that sounds odd, but it's very delicious.  Seasoned ground beef inside, with french fries, and some cheese and pickled jalapenos to round out the cheeseburger aspect.  Also some pico de gallo.  That creation is YUMMY, I usually only eat half of it and have the other half as a nice lunch the next day.

One other thing you should try is the Elote con Queso, aka corn on the cob with butter, cotija cheese, lime, and chili.  Yum.  I'd get it more often if I weren't so full from the other stuff.

Drinks wise, they have a full bar, ranging from the welliest of the wells up to a pretty good top shelf.  They have a good house margarita and a decent sangria, and plus a range of draft beer including macro and craft brews.  Being that I'm usually here to eat, I like to keep it simple and get their Northern Special, which is a shot of Four Roses Bourbon paired with a Bud (yes, a Budweiser, don't judge) for $7.  They also have a Southern Special, which is a shot of tequila paired with a Tecate.

I love the crowd here, people from all walks of life show up, usually to watch a sporting event on one of their many TVs.  The staff is very friendly; it's understandably harder to get an order in if the place is packed for a Giants game, so if you like prompt service you probably want to go on an off night.

Solid neighborhood bar that's also a destination in itself.  This place makes me happy to live in the Sunset.
author: Jeryl C.

description: These tacos truly live up to the hype! I ordered a Nick's Way style fish taco for ~$7. $7 is probably a overpriced for a taco but it really is fantastic. The taco was loaded with guacamole and fish. There was so much flavor packed into each bite. I got full from one taco. They have great beers on tap. The atmosphere is casual as you should imagine a taco shop to be. There are plenty of seats and its a great place to go for a casual dinner and drinks.
author: Nicole J.

description: Lots of great choices for everyone. Unless your a traditionalist you got to try their Elote con Queso off the cobb. It's mui bueno.
author: Rob B.

description:
3 stars for tacos, but 4 stars for the California burrito = average of 3.5 stars

Yesterday was my first Taco Tuesday, and I ordered one of each meat: carnitas, carne asada, and chicken (I shudder at ordering a vegetarian anything. I'm pro meat!). The best was the chicken: nicely charred meat that had good flavor. The carne asada came in second, but I can't even remember the taste today. But I do remember the carnitas taco... and it was terrible! The pork was dry and flavorless. Its only saving grace was the salsas in which I drowned it. 

Taco Tuesday made me sad because I have eaten here before and remembered thinking that the California burrito was amazing (the first time I've thought that of fries within a sandwich-type vehicle... which is saying a lot since I love potatoes).

As far as the venue, it's a really chill place to come watch basketball.
author: J J.

description: Seriously, the greatest tacos in the city. No doubt, no competition. I've been in SF for 2 years and I cannot seem to like tacos that much anywhere like I do in Underdogs. Amazing. Selling my soul for these. There's simply no taqueria that won my taco part of heart like Underdogs tacos did. I was thinking a lot whether I should write this or not since it's more likely that more people will read this and come to eat all of my tacos. Come. I'll come earlier and get stuffed before you.
author: Petra M.

description: Honestly not worth it. First off if you're ordering tacos especially to-go, make sure you know they'll immediately think you want it "Nicks way" which cost more but for me I was craving simple street tacos, not a taco smothered in guac, tomatoes &Beans. Otherwise I would've gotten a burrrrrito. Also their chips are way too crunchy, I could barely eat any. The only thing I liked was the salsa verde. Baja taco too overcooked. Chicken taco lacked flavor, & carne asada meat was too tough.  6 tacos cost $40? Whaaaat?
author: Camille B.

description: Came here for lunch and ordered the elote, fried fish taco, and carnitas quesadilla. Everything was so yummy; the quesadilla was huge and probably the same size as a burrito. Excited to come back for more.
author: Christine T.

description:
WORST SERVICE POSSIBLE. 

THREW OUR TO GO FOOD IN BAG, LITERALLY. 

I had been looking forward to the Baja tacos Nicks way for 5 years. My husband and I drove from Modesto to eat these tacos. After spending a day at the CA Academy, we placed an order online in hopes of being able to sit down and eat without waiting too long.

We arrive. The white man server (younger, Caucasian, 5'9", dark straight close hair cut)) says my order is not in because probably my card didn't go through. I said I had gotten an email confirming my order. He said sorry, but it didn't go through and walked away. 

Then, a girl waitress came up to me to ask if I had been helped. I explained I had put an order in and she said that because it was more than 15 minutes until our order was supposed to be ready, that was probably the reason our order was not showing up. She found our order and had to tell the male waiter how to look for the order - I'm assuming this guy is fresh out of waiter school.

Then, we sat down and the guy slammed a receipt down in front of us.

We waited a few minutes more and again, like he had a slamming problem, slams our to go bag down on the table
On top of the napkin holder. Doesn't even say thanks for your order and takes our receipt where I had already given a tip.

As my husband is pulling out his taco, the same jerk comes over and says because it's taco Tuesday, orders to go can't stay. DID HE EVEN ASK OF WE WERE GOING TO BUY A BEER??!?? No. We were a to go order. Simple as that. 

So we left.

It will take a miracle before I go back to this place.

When we got into the car- look at how they prepped our food.

Obviously the important thing to this guy is get em in, get their money, and get em out.
author: misplace c.

description: The food is so good here. I usually get the quesadilla which is super delicious. But last time I got the Tortilla Soup. So freaking good! Thick and kinda spicy.  I strongly recommend it on a cold day.
author: Melissa S.

description:
3.5 Stars.

Used to be obsessed with this place last summer, when I regularly inhaled Baja Style Nick's Way (fish tacos). I came back and dragged my family with me, and while it was still tasty, it didn't blow me away the way I was expecting :( I'm pretty sure they either forgot/were really skimpy with the special sauce, which is what makes the taco so amazing. 

I'd still recommend going, especially if you're in the area, but definitely ask for extra special sauce!
author: Neha S.

description: Probably my favorite taco shop in my neighborhood, if not SF as a whole. I recommend getting the Nick's Way tacos and smothering it in their delectable red sauce. You will not be disappointed.
author: Genevieve H.

description:
Finally got to try "Nick's crispy fish taco's"!!

Initially, I thought... daaaanggg $5 for a taco??? But then when my order arrived I realized that it was pretty big and I realized how full I felt from just ONE.. It was really good... I was sort of disappointed that my fish was soggy by the time it came out... but the generous amount of guac made up for it... used tons of the red sauce because it went so well with the taco...

Also had a order of buffalo wings which were WAYYY TOO SALTY...

and shared a carne asada California burrito (french fries in the burrito)... it was interesting... the meat had an extreme burned flavor to it... and the fries made the overall burrito way dry... even when drenched in the red sauce.. :( 

Service was good, except I got kind of annoyed when the chick started refilling the napkins RIGHT INFRONT OF ME / IN BETWEEN ME AND THE OTHER PERSON WHILE I WAS EATING... a bit rude IMO..... couldn't it have waited til AFTER I was out of there????!

I'd come back... but only for Nick's crispy tacos.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Offers the best fish tacos in town. Place can get crowded but has a good vibe to it.

We went for the Baja style fish tacos Nicks way and it surely hit the spot.
author: Nikhil P.

description: I love catching a game at Underdogs, a bunch of my long-time friends live off Irving, so we've been going here for years. Last time I was there we got a dozen Tecate specials - Tecate Beer + Tequila Shot for $7, pretty good deal! I've had Nick's Crispy Tacos and they're legit as well.
author: Elaine N.

description: I went on dollar margarita night, asked for a straw for my dollar margarita and was given one. Then an employee came up behind my friend and I and grabbed our straws out of our glasses and said no straws with $1 margs.  Completely inappropriate for an employee to grab a straw out of a drink, not to mention he was rude as hell. Will not be coming back.
author: Raelynn S.

description: You have to get tacos Nick's Way. They are the best! The tacos are pretty big so they are filling. I also love the street corn. Sooo good! I will be back for more!
author: Elena N.

description: Ok service. Ok food. It's a sports bar so I guess I can't expect all that much. The sister taco shop on Polk blows this place out of the water. Not really into "nick's" style, it's ok but a little underwhelming. Had the veggie and fish taco and carne asada nachos. Nachos were no bueno, didn't care for how the meat was cooked, almost too dry. Staff was alright. Would I go back - not likely.
author: Linda H.

description:
I used to like this place strictly for their $1 margaritas on fridays and cheap Mexican food in the sunset. 

But after my last visit, I will never be returning again. First I asked for a straw for my margarita, the guy said no which was weird so I asked another bartender and he gave my friend and I a straw with no hesitations. Then the first bartender came up to me and said "I said no straws" and took mine and my friends straws right out of our cups. First of all that's just unsanitary and second just plain rude. Then I got a soggy quesadilla where I literally could not pick up and when I told them I could not eat it, I had an argument with about 4 employees saying that "they don't want to argue with me" yet they argued with me for about 15 min while saying I won't have to pay for the meal. Such a waste of my time! I'm pretty sure I was talking to the owner too and he was the rudest out of all of them. 

Never giving them my business again.
author: Talia K.

description: Stop by with a friend last week.  Liked the funky & comfortable atmosphere.  Bar staff greeted & served us immediately.  Shared the chicken nachos - very hearty portion for two.  Could have used a tad bit more seasoning on the chicken, but overall we were satisfied.  The margarita made with fresh lime juice was awesome with a great punch!!!  Price for what we got was reasonable.  I plan to go back & try other items on the menu.
author: Diane K.

description:
HOLY SHIT!!! Nick's way baja tacos are just fucking delicious Two of these bad boy w/ their brown sauce (and let me say LOTS of brown sauce for each bite) will fill you up. Hands down my favorite taco joint in the city and a nice sports bar to hang out on a friday night or a spot to watch a game.  Come here on fridays and add-on the tecate special w/ a shot of tequila for i think $6. WHAT A STEAL!

Waiters here are pretty attentive so thats a plus. Come here early to grab a table if you're coming with a big group!
author: Michael L.

description:
Love this place. We live a couple blocks away and it was certainly a selling point when moving into the neighborhood! Great sports bar and a Sunday staple for my husband during football season.

They serve Nick's crispy tacos plus other Americanized Mexican fare like burritos, street tacos, tortilla soup, quesadillas, nachos, and a few other items like a Mexican salad, elote, and chips/salsa or chips/guac. Simple but delicious menu. Tacos are around $5 each and bigger items like burritos are around $8-$10.

They also have tons of TVs with all the sports games and a full bar. If you come to watch a game in the morning, note the kitchen doesn't open until 11:30am so there's a limited "breakfast" menu with 1-2 breakfast burritos and that's it! 

Popular neighborhood spot so don't be surprised if it's busy and crowded when you come! Seating-wise there's high tops on the left side as you walk in, bar stools around the bar and then 4 picnic tables at the back which people tend to share unless there's a large party occupying a whole table. Don't be afraid to jump in and share a table if there's empty seats!
author: Allison R.

description:
This place is always good, giving it 5 for
Being a consistent place to go. Always incredible food. I love nicks crispy carnitas taco, and good prices. Service is always friendly. Our server just now was carolynn, she was a sweetie and gave great service. Obviously, ill be back!
author: Kayla C.

description:
One of my favorite taco places. I actually like this location better than their Marina location. The staff are a lot more friendlier, and also they have a full bar. I have come here many times for game nights or just to get some really good tacos. 

Their carne asada Nick's Way taco is my favorite. It is HUGE! Usually one does it for me especially since you also get chips and salsas. I also really like their Elcote. I ask them to take it off the cob for me and so it is a lot easier to eat and less messier. They also make pretty good Cheladas here. If you are in the neighborhood you should for sure stop by for a quick bite.
author: G O.

description:
Went here with a couple of roommates for Taco Tuesday and I ordered two fish tacos Nick's way.

They were HUGE and I could barely finish my second one. The tacos reminded me of tacos I used to get in San Diego. Very legit. And the hot sauce they have is good.

Still not a fan of the layout of the bar, and the fact that you are literally always standing in someone's way. I would come back here again for sure just for the tacos. So dank.
author: Mika S.

description: I love Underdogs. This is my sunset neighborhood bar. The staff is extremely friendly. Shoutout to Derrick (sorry not sure how to spell his name), one of the Bartenders that has such a wonderful disposition, talks great sports trash, and always makes great food and drink recommendations. I'm Mexican from a family that ate home cooked delicious meals every night thanks to my mom and when we went to Mexico to see our family, we always ate at all the taco shops. When I think of living with my family in Mexico, I think of street tacos because they're a combination of simplicity, quality food, and an unbeatable taste. Underdogs perfectly translates the street taco into art. I kid you not, this is one of my favorite places to get tacos in SF. I'm not a burrito person but every so often I'll have a bite of their burritos. Everything is good here. You can even buy their signature salsa, I usually buy once a month because it's poppin! Lastly, this is a great spot to watch Warriors games. Come through and enjoy it!
author: Gladys M.

description:
i walked into this place and couldn't get any help at all.  Thank goodness that Victor noticed my friend and I and took our order and offered us drinks. Its my first time. Also Maggie has the best customer service and helped my friend and I clear a table. God bless. I thought that no one cared and I would have to go above and beyond for some help.. 

P.s Maggie deserves a raise, shes the reason for 5 stars.
author: William S.

description:
Ever since the movie 'I love you, Man' came out, I have seriously been on the hunt for the perfect fish tacos. I've tried several places but a co-worker took me here for lunch one day and advised that I get the baja (fish) taco nick's way. 

Note; always get the taco nick's way. 

After my first bite - OMGGGGG I FINALLY FREAKING FOUND THE PERFECT FISH TACO THAT I HAVE BEEN SEARCHING FOR! 

Literally, so good! Their service is great and I like how they carry my favorite beer, Golden Cider. Parking can be a bit tricky, but definitely worth it. 

What is not to love about this place? A bar, that sells beer AND fish tacos?! 

C'mon now... You have to go! Don't forget to get your taco Nick's way!
author: Aloha D.

description:
Such a good place!!! Would've never guessed this place was good if my friend didn't take me here!!! 

We ordered a huge plate of crispy nachos with beef and cheese, guacamole, sour cream, and salsa!!! Damn now these are some bomb nachos and the size was perfect for the three of us to share!! 

We also ordered two quesadillas. One was with carne asada and the other was was chicken. Both were soo juicy.... Mmmmmm :) 

Flavors were incredible!!! Great place to come for some Mexican food! Also the price was really good for everything we ordered. The total came out to $37 dollars! 

Awesome food and great spot :)
author: Julia K.

description: Baja tacos-nick's style! By far, the best fish tacos! I thought I found the best...but I was wrong. This is it! They are not stingy with their portions at all! $7 for 1 taco is a bit pricey but it's worth it! Nachos have the melted mozzarella instead of cheese sauce, and fresh, thinly sliced jalapeños! Their bottled sauces-one red and one green have a tang to them where you want to squeeze half the bottle on your food. Service is great! Staff are attentive and don't lag! Pretty impressive for a sports bar environment. Definitely will be back again!
author: Roxanne L.

description:
Stopped on over here with a friend for some lunch, beers, and to watch the game. The Taco Shop at Underdogs isn't large by any means, but it is definitely worth your visit. If anything, you'll enjoy their street tacos, which are surprisingly legit. The place itself is set up similar to that of a sports bar, with a bar area in the front, and tables scattered throughout the rest of the spot. 

I ended up going with the 3 Street Tacos for about $9. The have a variety of meats that you can choose from, so I went with the variety option: chicken, beef, pork. As far as the tacos, they pretty much resembled tacos that you'd get at any Mexican food truck. Out of all the three meats, I'd have to say that the carne asada was by far the best. I found the chicken to be on the dry side, and the carnitas was just alright. For a lunch, the 3 tacos might not be enough, depending on how hungry you are, so you might want to get some chips or even more tacos.

Service is a little slow, but I can imagine that that is attributed to the masses of people that are coming in and out of here. As long as you don't mind the crowd and slower service, this is a pretty great place to grab some food and catch the game in the process.
author: Michael W.

description:
Underdogs, I applaud your consistency.

This is your typical neighborhood go-to for bay area sports, cheap booze and edible food.

Despite my overly sarcastic reviews and high-brow approach to some situations, I am a very easy patron. I don't ask a lot of questions, I don't demand perfection and with bartenders... I'm not the guy who is waving you down out of frustration saying "bro, hey bro. BRO". I have friends in the service industry, more specifically bartenders, and I know this is annoying and will usually lead to being ignored. So I get it.

Underdogs must be some weird exception. 
I go in. sit down. Bar is half full. Grab a menu. Wait. Wait. WAIT. The last time I was here I waited at least 10 minutes of passing by bartenders filling up limes before even glancing at me. 
Random hipster walks up aside me, and yells/waves, "BRAH. CAN I GET A TACATE". And just like that, served. 
So I took it upon myself to do the same and sure enough, a tacate/taco order. Strange.

So come in with a few bucks, your mad aggressive ordering techniques and game face ready for a good time.

Notables:

- The tacos are good. 
- They have daily HH with $2 tacos and $2 tacates from 4:30-6 (Tuesdays 4:30-close... but come early because it gets packed)
- Fridays they have awesome dollar margaritas from 5:00-6:00. It. Is. A. must.
- They play bay area sports above all, which i applaud. 

The staff is nice but you definitely have to be more aggressive, which isn't my style per say, but whatever,
author: Ryan L.

description: This is definitely a go-to spot if you stop by the Sunset district. They are always fast with my order, the tacos (nick's way) are actually amazing and the atmosphere of a cool sports bar is exactly what you'll get. The place is packed during game days and on Taco Tuesday's so expect to order out or come early. I love this place and by now, I think they know I'm a regular.
author: Kastania C.

description: Nommy nom nom!! There are few things I hold near & dear to my heart and tacos and margaritas are definitely both on that list!!! This place just happens to be great at both. We came in mid Saturday and ate at the bar. Nice bartender who was plenty friendly and attentive. I had one chicken taco- Nick's way- and it was a flavor explosion! The margaritas were good too- we ordered the house pitcher and drank every last sip.
author: Alyssa J.

description:
So, one night my friends and I are roaming SF looking for some grub to eat! We decide on Izakaya Sozai because we like that skewered meat! MMM. But, unfortunately, the place was like an hour plus wait, and the store closed in like an hour and a half.. So, we decided to roam around a little further down the street, and we found THE TACO SHOP AT UNDERDOG'S! My friends had been here already, but I'd never been here! 

The place was loud and packed on that fine Saturday night. There are a bunch of adults drinking at the bar, and my homies and I just want some grub. Luckily, we managed to snatch a table. Like, two minutes after sitting, a friendly server comes up and takes our order! WOW! So fast in such a crowded place, and she's delighted to greet us even! We order a couple of tacos. (Fish taco is duh bomb dot com.. ermergerd.. so yummz.) Each of us get full after eating like three fourths of the taco.. It's soooo big. There's so much delicious goodness inside. Ermergerd. And! The price is pretty inexpensive overall! 

So, there you go! Nice service! Delicious food! Good portions! And is able to serve and fill up the stomachs of a party of four for dinner for only $34 including tax and tip! Yah. Would come back most def for late night grubbin in SF.
author: Kim N.

description: called to inquire about burrito bowl, a belle answered & they have the music blasting, she can't hear & all i hear is blasting music. how is it a burrito without beans & rice? Yup that's the end of that call, plus she couldn't hear, so she hangs up on me! called right back &  asked her why she hung up on me, denying it all the way, so i asked to speak to someone else, another Dork said she couldn't hear me, I asked to speak to a supervisor or Mgr & bitched at him abot his employees hanging up & playing me, he couldn't give a $hit! but, he could hear me fine! that's when i found out what a bowl is,NOTHING! you need to learn what a burrito bowl is before trying to sell them!
