SORRY, THIS PLACE IS FOR ROOKIES. I THINK BANQUET MAKES A BETTER COMBO! STICK TO THE AUTHENTIC MEXICANOS OWNED TAQUERIAS.
author: david c.

description:
I KNEW I CAME HERE BEFORE!...

anyway, the burrito was delicious! i would give it a 5/5 for sure. it gets one star less because the chips could be better (i.e, thinner!). their sauces are tasty accompaniments! i hope another 4 years don't pass before i come back here!
author: Asmita J.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos without having to venture downtown. 

Friends were visiting from LA and we decided to hit up The Taco Shop @ Underdogs. After a long 2 hours in the car due to the bridge closure, $10 on tolls, and two bridges later, my boyfriend, my appetite, and I joined 4 other friends who were seated at the picnic tables in the back. 

For those who have been to Nick's on Polk, you know the only way to go is with the fish tacos Nick's Way, or the "Pescado 'Baja' Style" tacos. In addition, we ordered 2 of the carnitas tacos Nick's Way. 

For $4.25 each, the tacos come to you stuffed with toppings wrapped in not one, but two tortillas..one crispy corn tortilla and one soft tortilla. They may look messy, but they weren't too difficult to eat at all. My only wish is that there wasn't so much sauce in the fish taco.

The Taco Shop is a great place for a quick bite with friends, and I'm sure it'd be fun to watch a game here, though I've heard it gets packed.

Bring coins for the parking meters if you're coming through before 6pm!
author: Camille B.

description:
Fast and friendly service , delicious tacos and fresh guacamole , what else you can ask in Mexican restaurant. May be some drinks but we were not in drinking mode. 
We are coming back for this place again
author: Alireza R.

description:
The taco shop at underdogs is probably my favorite bar-food place. They have the best crispy fish tacos, salsa chips and elote con queso. It's a perfect place to be with friends. Theres a pretty good amount of seats inside along the bar and in the back they have a couple picnic tables. There's a couple of tv's, an old school gamer-machine and a basketball shooting hoop machine. It gets pretty loud inside, but what do you expect? It's a bar. They usually have a different flavor agua fresca each day so be sure to check in with the waitress-if you're planning on not drinking. I had their sangria last time and let me tell you-it's super strong. They add captain Morgan to their sangria's-so if you can handle it, go for it. 

Tip- make your taco's "nick's way". Guacamole changes everything.
author: Laura T.

description: Great tacos. I have no complaints! I love the guacamole they put in the tacos. The brown sauce to dip the chips in, I don't know what it is but it's heavenly. My rating is for the location though. Impossible to find parking. Don't even order to pick up unless you have a friend that can hop out of the car to grab the food. If you're by yourself just pray to god u find parking then eat inside.
author: Kayla K.

description:
Are you serious?

One of the most delicious tacos I've ever had for sure.
I got the nick's way carne asada and baja fish tacos. Amazing stuff. I literally could not speak after taking bites of these beauties. I'd 100% return to try all their offerings next time.

HIGHLY recommend.
author: Sung K.

description:
I love underdogs!

Great customer service
Great food
Great margaritas! Esp $1 Fridays
Great atmosphere
Clean (compare to Chug Pug -- place is so dirty! Feels like a drunken holy cow)

Best of all, it's close to my house and everytime when I dine in I know I will leave the place full and happy (buzzed) :)

Favorite local bar
author: Carol Y.

description:
I was about to venture all the way to Nick's Crispy Tacos in Nob Hill and quickly changed my plans to the Taco Shop at Underdog's when i found out it's the same tacos! Underdog's is a lot closer to me and i'm afraid i may be giving up important healthy habits by being tempted with their delicious fried fish tacos done nick's way. It's a sports bar with plenty of flat screens against the wall of one side of the bar, with smaller tables lining against the other. Kids are allowed in and you can seat a family at the picnic sized tables in the back. There's a basketball arcade game they can keep themselves busy with. 

For $4.50 each, two pescado taco (nick's way) was enough for me for under $10. There's something about their fried taco, wrapped in another tortilla, a piece of fried fish, a lot of guacamole, and their red sauce!!

I'm going to be coming here soon on a Tuesday for their $2 Tecates and $2 tacos!
author: Samantha L.

description:
Seriously, I dream about the Baja Fish Tacos - Nick's way. They are THAT good. 

One of my chef friends turned me onto this place and it's been blissful since. When she first told me about it, I gave her one an incredulous look, "The best tacos are in the city, no way can they be in the OUTER SUNSET!?! 

Proved me wrong....

They wrap the taco in a crispy shell AND a soft corn tortilla over it which gives it a nice crunch but the soft tortilla still absorbs the delicious sauces.

Beer battered fish tacos, that somehow don't get soggy with all the sauce, cabbage, a creamy sauce, topped with lots of fresh guac on top. The place has these two great sauces they offer as condiments. I pour them on top idea what they are but it's a spicy green sauce and creamy brown sauce.


Brought a friend here who was going through a really rough time and stopped eating because she was so depressed. One bite of that taco and her appetite returned. She ordered another.

Nachos here are also really great as are the margaritas. 

Only reason they didn't full five stars is because of the atmosphere. It can be super noisy inside with rowdy college kids and can be hard to hear. This atmosphere makes for a great place to watch Giant games! We were here when they won the World Series and we got sprayed with beer and champagne. Given the circumstances, we didn't even care. 

Great Value!! A pitcher of margaritas, two orders of nachos, an order wings, and five fish tacos, and a steak quesadilla and the bill was only $100. 

Well worth coming out here if you are on the other side of the city for the food!
author: Meaza S.

description: Came here for dinner with a friend. It was kind of packed so we had to share a table with a couple. The service was fast. Although they did run out of the melon juice and said they were making more but never came back with more. The chips were stale and I prefer salsa on the side but no biggie. Other than that tacos and elote and delicious!
author: Jackie F.

description: 2 stars for missing out on chips and sauce! not happy at all. ya'll wasn't even busy when i rolled through at 10 pm tonight.
author: Wassily S.

description:
Ah yes, the glorious combination of Mexican fare and alcohol. If you hold these gastro-twins in high regard, please find your way to the Taco Shop at Underdog's one night. Your stomach will hug you. Is this a good feeling? Yes. 

Every time, I go for one of two things: either Baja Fish Tacos Nick's Way, or the Baja Fish Burrito. Both come perfectly hot, and both satisfy most savory-food-lovers preferences. These being: hot, crunchy, satisfying, filling, and the fact that they get along with beer swimmingly. The avocado is not skimped, (never skimp the avocado, you will be noticed), the fish is crispy and perfect, and whatever else in in these two dishes tastes massively delicious. Wash either of these down with a pint of Green Flash, your tummy will thank you. 

Note: beware of ordering guac with your salsa + chips; you will feel slightly robbed. That said, their tortilla chips are perfect.
author: Chelsea B.

description: This was my first time coming to this place and I loved it! My husband and I were coming in for dinner and decided to try this point out. We were even more lucky that is happen to be taco Tuesday! $2 street tacos! We tried the cane Assada carnitas and chicken. My favorite was the carnitas! We also had chips and salsa and it was delicious! You have to check this place out !
author: Louise T.

description:
This place has a special spot in my heart because I met my lovely girlfriend here. Taco Tuesday's gets packed but you stay busy with the pitchers of margarita and the buckets of Tecate. The fish tacos are great, 1 is surprisingly filling, as long as you order it Nick's Way. I also tried the loaded nacho appetizer which was super bomb another time.

I did order 2 burritos for pickup once and I stood by the "Pickup orders here" wooden sign and tried making contact with numerous employees. One acknowledged me. That was nice. Finally, I said "are you the one I talk to for picking up orders?" And she said "Yeah what's your name?" All I know is that my only experience in customer service was working at Jamba Juice but number one is greet every single person you see and make sure they don't need anything.

Other than that, I love this place. Like I said, it can be tough to get a seat on a tuesday but they have these big picnic bench seating in the back for big groups.
author: Marty J.

description:
I've been here a couple times, it's awesome! The tacos are pretty good, burritos are a bit pricey. Margaritas are good. But the best part? Arcade basketball!! So much fun. We just grabbed a table in the back, order some food and drinks and then took turns playing. 

Nick's way is the their famous tacos--double the carbs, double the yummy! The burritos aren't that big, I'm used to socal burritos, you know they're better. But the service is good, servers are nice and responsive. Overall, a good experience to hang out and grab some food. And challenge each other to basketball!
author: Teresa F.

description: Staff is really nice, some of the best service in town! It's not the best Mexican food, but it's still pretty tasty. Also a fun atmosphere. Always usually poppin. Keep it up!
author: David D.

description:
The Taco Shop is in the back. was told you could order at the bar. so i did.

eats: baja fish taco(4.5)
-nice piece of battered fish with all kinds of veggies, sauces mixed in
-2 dipping sauces provided, also crisp taco chips
-pretty tasty, probably worth the $4.5
-usual taco fillings available, burritos 8ish.

crumbs:
-tacos are a nick's creation. first for me.
-burritos or quesadilla at next stop.
-tacos tasted better than at eat real's.
author: Victor G.

description:
Went for Taco Tuesday. 

The Carne Asada street Tacos were definitely good.  I was unimpressed by the Carnitas.  Whatever the red sauce/salsa in the squeeze container was, they figured it out.  DELICIOUS.

Either I was confused by the Taco Tuesday advertising or they are mis advertising it. I thought Tecata were only supposed to be $2, but apparently they were $3? Maybe the $2 Tecata is only till 6 but the $2 Tacos are all night? Unclear.

Very nice people and chill environment, although by the time we left (around 7) it was really getting packed (but we never felt rushed), so I guess the moral of the story is come early.  

Unfortunately you have to pay for chips and salsa, which is a serious downside, and $2 for a small taco is not really that great of deal.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Somehow we ended up here to kill some time and to have a beer so we weren't here very long. However, the service was friendly and helpful. The boyfriend said the beer was refreshing, so that's  a win in my book. We also had some chips and salsa, which were delicious. 

Didn't have a chance to try the tacos because we still had to go to a dinner in 30 mins  but as the terminator says,... I'll be back!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Every time my bf and his roommates are starving and don't know where else to go, this is our go-to. My first time here our waiter brought us free chips and salsa simply because it was our first time. I thought that was awesome cause we really weren't expecting that at all. My eyes lit up when I saw fish tacos on the menu... Being a San diego/socal girl EVERY mexican restaurant has fish tacos. Here, in the city, it's really not the case. 

I always go for the grilled fish tacos Nicks Way. The other dude's always get Baja Fish, which is equally amazing, but grilled fish is just not as heavy (especially when you get Nicks Way with an extra tortilla and a fat scoop of guac). I have been going here for a year now on the regular (not sure if I'm proud of that or not). Nonetheless, every time we get the same exact thing, because it's those fish tacos are soooo damn good.
 
I finally decided to branch out with the bf and try something new. He got the Cheesburger burrito, which he really didn't like at all and was left sad that he didn't get what his heart wanted. I tried the grilled shrimp tacos Nick's Way and the corn on the cob which is amazinggggg. Might change my regular order to one fish and one shrimp taco.. The chips here are perfectly crispy, the salsa is delicious, I could drink it if I wanted to. Also great place to have a beer with friends. The margaritas looks good too, but still have never tried them.
author: Bat V.

description:
Wow - these tacos are AMAZING! You've got to order it "Nick's way". 

I had the carnitas taco and the vegetarian taco. Soooooo good and super filling!

The crunch of the inner tortilla with the soft outer tortilla paired with the amazing fillings were just out of this world!

They also have a great sports bar vibe with plenty if televisions to make the hubby happy.
author: Emme F.

description: I always enjoy coming here. The tacos are great and the nachos are the best deal imo, especially to share. The atmosphere is always good, sometimes it is a little hard to find a spot to sit down if a big game is going on. I've never had a complaint about the service even during the madness that is the Friday margarita happy hour.
author: Dave S.

description: Love love this place. Great bar atmosphere but kid friendly if you sit in the back. They have a basketball game set-up for the kids (& adults) near the back tables too. The Taco Shop can have a long line/wait most days and it's one of those you got to squeeze by people kind of place. As long as you don't mind rubbing elbows with someone else I can't think of anything wrong with this establishment. The food hear is fantastic. You can't go wrong with the nachos- all the fixings are piled high and enough for 2 people to get full. The burritos are my second favorite; not your typical flavor and burrito ingredients, but a must try to understand why this place is so great.
author: Julie Z.

description: It has a college dive bar vibe, which I love! Super crowded during happy hour and Friday nights! Get your tacos 'Nick's Way' and you will not regret it! The staff is super friendly and  some of the tables have arcade games built into them.
author: Katie P.

description:
Tacos nick's way is a MUST every time I walk into this place... I think I've tried one other burrito and nachos... But everytime I go there I get tacos! 

Imagine if you went to a steak joint and instead of them asking you of you want mushrooms and onions with it, they asked you if you wanted it nick's way?! Pretty sure I'd forget how to say no at that point.. 

Service is chill. Bathrooms... Seem like people spend time in between ordering and eating to doodle on the stalls. Otherwise, pretty clean but that's because I only go to underdog in broad daylight. 

Oh also..... Their orange sauce is the best!
author: Karen B.

description: Best fish tacos ever!  The only thing stopping me from giving this place a 5 star was how crappy the service was. Our waitress not only gave us the wrong check but also made us wait 20 minutes for our bill. I got so annoyed that I just went up to the registers to pay and leave.  It wasn't even busy that evening.
author: Tiffanie T.

description: Best Mexican in SF. Everything done right, Nicks Way, love the pork the beef is also good. Fish tacos are great lacking in the fish sometimes. Great bar to hang and have a bite at also sometimes gets pretty rowdy
author: Max G.

description:
Man, their tacos are so phreakin good! It's been a while since I last visited this one. Parking is a nightmare around here, but the tacos are well worth parking 4 blocks away! 

I always get the 3 tacos with a side of chips and guac. I have never once had a taco from this place that I did not like.
author: Steve C.

description:
I've been here once before a few years ago. I stopped by again with a few friends to grab a few drinks and tacos.

I got the chicken tacos and a long island iced tea. Everyone got their own tacos and drinks too. We shared the super nachos and used the check-in deal to get the $5 combo of a bottle of High Life and a shot of 4roses. 

The tacos are good, but not as great as I remembered them to be. The long island was okay. I actually asked for different kinds of drinks but found that the bartenders didn't really know a lot of recipes. Even if you tell them, they won't have all the ingredients needed for the drink you want. I guess this should be expected of a sports bar.

The nachos were good. More monstrous than any of us expected but that's a good thing. We weren't able to finish all of it. As for the High Life and 4roses, it was alright hah. Good deal though! You should take advantage of it whenever you go there. 

Another thing I like about the place is that some of the tables...are video games. One of them was Mrs. Pacman! 

Overall, great bar and food. It's a fun place to hangout with friends.
author: Sofia R.

description:
My friend and I were on a mission to try some fish tacos and so here we arrived.

We went on a weekday, so there wasn't really a wait.  

Can't say the service was that attentive either.  They seemed very laid back with coming around to get our order.

We ordered:

-Sangria strawberry
Pretty tasty.

-Pescado "baja" style make it nicks way
I liked the crunch and sauce to it.

-nachos
A little too dry and cheesy.  I would have liked some more other toppings.

Overall if you are looking for a dive bar with fish tacos (bar food really) then definitely come here!
author: Michelle T.

description: A local recommended this place to us- and it was EXCELLENT. Best tacos I've had in a very long time, and margaritas were great too! A simple walk from the Golden Gate Park.
author: Shannon J.

description: Huge portions of guacamole on the baja tacos and definitely recommend Nick's way. I love the chips and salsa, along with the red/green sauces. The service has always been great and we even received extra refill on the chips with no extra charge. The beers are great as well and love the sports theme.
author: Katherine L.

description:
MMMMM! Fish tacos!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I haven't tried their other tacos, but I'm a huge fan of fish tacos, and their tacos here were unexpectedly good. I didn't think a sports bar could deliver good food ever, but they were really yummy. They're stuffed with fish, salsa etc so it's a little messy but still really good!
author: Yannie S.

description: Great food as always. You can't beat it for the price but the music was so loud that I left with a bad headache. I know it's a bar as well but this was at 2 pm on a Monday. I couldn't hear a word the waitress said nor my dining companion. Not sure I'd come back, take-out for sure tho.
author: Anne F.

description:
Very nice vibe here! Been here the first time and it took a while to get a table because it's first come first serve. However.. they have waitresses and waiters, so its not quite fast food, but not quite full service. 

FRIDAYS------- Margaritas for $1 from 6pm-630pm. They are strong too, not super watered down. When they come around for a refill, they let you empty the ice into a bucket, so you get a full true glass again. 

FISH TACOSSSSSSSS BOMB!! you have to get all the possible options on it. The crunchiness. I forget what it's called, nick's way? 

Very nice, diverse atmosphere, lots of tv to watch.
author: Ryan E.

description:
The service here is usually a hit or miss. Its crazy packed (at times - mostly when games are on) the music is super loud but i guess thats ok. The last time i came here my friends and i had some bad service. We placed our order and when our food came.... We didn't realize we were given the wrong food orders until we took some bites....and when we informed our server ... Well lets just say it could have been handled more professionally. I mean i get that the place is packed and loud but we know what we ordered and we know thats what we asked for. I just couldn't believe the service we were getting especially since i really enjoy coming here.

ON A BRIGHTER NOTE... THE BAJA STYLE FISH TACO NICKS WAY IS THE BOMB.COM packed with a lot if guac for all you guac lovers and the fish was fried to perfection. Bad service or not the food never disappoints. We also ordered a pitcher of the house margarita and it was a lot stronger than i thought  it would be. Well maybe because we didn't mix it well but I'm not complaining for stronger alchy.
author: Kristina L.

description:
Hands down one of my favorite burritos I've ever had!!! The atmosphere here is nice, lots of TVs, people, and games. 

I've had their quesadilla, and it's not like your ordinary flat quesdilla, it's stuffed to the max,and with flavor! My friends originally recommended me this and told me this is what they get everytime they come here!! It even tastes better with both of their special sauce. The sauces definitely give compliment to the meal!!

Overtime, I tried their San Francisco burrito, and it's hands down one of my favorite in the city. Ever since then, I always come here late at night when I'm craving some mexican food, and its super satisfying. Their tortilla is cooked to a nice crunch, it's just the perfect amount of ingredients inside the burrito. They're also pretty generous with their guac here too. I can never finish it, because their burritos are pretty big! But hey, I dont mind their leftovers, still so delicious.  And make sure to eat this with a hint of both sauces with each bite, and you will be in heaven!

I've also had some sangria here, and I was not disappointed. Everything here is amazing! I would love to come back during happy hour and have a taste of their famous fish tacos!  Can't wait till the next time I'm in San Francisco again to get another one of their burritos! 

Parking however, is a bit difficult.. since it is Irving and theres a ton of restaurant. Keep circling the area, and eventually you'll be able to find a spot. Thats one of the downside. Another downside is that they are pretty stingy with their sauce when I order to go though. They only gave me 2 containers when i ordered two burritos. When I saw it, I was just thinking in my mind, are you serious? I noticed other people had to ask for more as well when they ordered to go. Therefore, I do recommend you eat at the restaurant then you can use as much sauce as you want. Otherwise, everything else is on point!
author: Cindy D.

description: Decent Nicks Tacos.  Good atmosphere, but don't be fooled if you think its some unique place because there are at least 3-4 of these in SF.  Nonetheless, good food.
author: Jordan S.

description: My boyfriend and I love coming here together. The food is really great and it's a fun atmosphere as well. I really enjoy the corn & black bean salad with chicken and also the California burrito since it has French fries in it! I can't get enough of their red salsa either. YUM! Can't wait to be back again.
author: Hannah R.

description:
Underdog's is a fun place to watch a ballgame with good food and good people.

The place has a fun vibe and a cool atmosphere.  The spot is totally dedicated to Bay Area sports and, oddly enough, it also attracts Michigan and Chicago faithful as well.

Now, about the food...very good "Americanized" Mexican fare.   The popular fish tacos are legit, especially the Nick's style.  They were absolutely delicious, so no disappointment there.  The  quesadilla was HUGE and had tender and perfectly seasoned carnita with warm, tasty melted cheese.  The tortilla was crispy and flaky.  Very enjoyable.  Don't forget the sauces too.  They add an extra kick.  

On the down side, I was not too crazy about the steak nachos.  I thought it lacked punch and got a little too soggy and watery after a while, likely due to the enormous amount of pico de gallo.  I also thought that the guac and pico de gallo need work.  I thought they were fairly bland.  They slathered such a liberal amount that it actually almost muted out the lively  flavor of the food.

Overall, I am very pleased with the food, delicious despite a few kinks.  Before I forget, let me emphasize...their bartenders are AWESOME...fast, friendly, attentive.  Special props to our bt Jaimie, who kept things fun and flowin through a stressful day.  The extra friendly bartenders and the lively vibe add to the great experience.  This is a cool spot.
author: Angel S.

description: I've been here so many times! Can't get enough. Me , my wife, and our little daughter love this place! The food is so amazing, delicious, and the best I ever had. Super nice service and super friendly staff. they're the BEST!!!
author: Mohammed Z.

description: Thought I left 4 stars, but apparently I didn't. Don't want to discredit these guys for what they should be receiving. Like I said before the beef tacos packed a mean punch of flavor.
author: Koby G.

description:
The food is delicious but the redhead waitress is extremely rude. We let her know we had more people coming for the Giants game, ordered food and drink, and showed no signs of being done ordering. 

The red head waitress accused us of just trying to "save" a table rather than actually ordering and being customers. And she threatened us with a five minute warning. No one came when our pitcher was empty or we had empty baskets.

Then she charged the people next to us for our pitcher.

Used to be one of my favorite places but now I'm not sure I'll ever come back.
author: Kellen M.

description: Service is on point and so is the food! Everything we ordered was delicious and though the elote is too overpriced it's almost as authentic as the elote man in Los Angeles. I will be back when there's a game on! Minus one star because it is difficult to find a table and it is first come, first serve.
author: Esther P.

description: Taco Tuesdays! Actually quite a let-down. $2 for the simple street style tacos, which were bland and severely needed big squirts of the orange sauce. Carne asada was ok, chicken was dry. The Nick style tacos were fully loaded with guac and salsa. Why would you pay so much for such lackluster tacos? LA spoiled me, I think. I'd come back for $1 margarita Fridays though.
author: Vivian H.

description:
I stopped by to get a cup of coffee from Starbucks, and saw the place and people are waiting for the place to open so I decided to look at the menu on the window I saw San Francisco burrito sounds good I ordered one to go couldn't wait to get home, to try it, I used to eat burritos in the mission for the last twenty five years, I owned a place on 16th st. at at Valencia (Truly Mediterranean) let me tell you this taco shop is my new place in the city to eat a burrito. 
The burrito was so moist juicy and full of flavor I ordered the chicken burrito, I gave my wife 1/3 of it and she was amazed by it. It's also sports bra you can sit an watch the games maybe my next supper ball will be there, can't wait to take the family there. Yummmmmy
author: Jasco S.

description: This place is awesome! Delicious food (try the tacos Nick's way), great bar, cool space with picnic tables in the back, and lots of TVs. Perfect for watching sports or just grabbing a meal!
author: Neel P.

description: I don't see how this place is so popular. The food is really bad and the drinks are over priced. Maybe it's because there's not much else going on in the sunset.
author: Kyle C.

description:
Get the corn. You just have to. My kids didn't love this but I did. Amazing guacamole, loved the grilled shrimp
tacos. Nice mixture of textures and spices. Super casual and inexpensive
author: Jorie M.

description:
If you're a sports fan, this is the place to be.  There are lots of  TVs here to watch your favorite game!  There are seats at the bar, bar tables behind the bar, and benches in the back.  However, seating is probably limited if there's a game going on.

We ordered:

Chips & Salsa with Haas Avocado Guacamole $6.50 (3.5 of 5) - salsa & guacamole was fresh!  My only gripe is the cilantro is pre-mixed in.

"Baja Style" Fish Tacos Nick's Way $4.50 (5 of 5) - I loved that the fish was fresh and didn't taste like frozen fish or have the seafood-y taste to it.  It was fried to perfection and tasted sooo good!

Mexican "Street Style" Tacos - If you're unsure of what to order, this is a good option as you can select three from the following:  carne asada, carnitas, pollo, & veggie.  Hubby chose carne asada, carnitas, and pollo.  The meats were all flavorful and tender.  

Also, the roasted tomato hot sauce/salsa had a nice smokey flavor to it.  I didn't try the green tomatillo sauce as there was cilantro in it.  

Parking can be quite difficult, but I definitely plan to come back to try the other items on their menu.
author: Candice H.

description:
This place is eh at best.  Let's face it, not much competition around.

The place is either dead or crowded.  Not much in between.  It is chaotic when it is busy and there is no system whatsoever.  Survival of the fittest and you'll have to fight for service.  Don't expect them to come to you.  They won't.

The food is just ok (compared to the taco stops in Mission): nothing spectacular, not bad either.  But the price is a bit high without happy hour.

The drinks: well, let's just say that it is hard to get drunk off the mix drinks.  Beer is beer.  They can't mess that up.  So I would advice you to stick with beers.  

This is a hole-in-the-wall hip place for the young locals.  The food and drink is just a byproduct, not the main attraction.

-1 for service.
-1 for price.
-1 for watered drinks.
author: Jason L.

description: Bomb tacos and burritos!! This place is hella good!!! and the guacamole is a generous amount!
author: Jacqueline J.

description: I'm wondering why it took us so long to go to this place.  The food is delicious at reasonable prices.  We usually get the tacos -- the Mexican street style tacos and the Baja style taco made Nick's way.  The service is also very friendly.  For Happy Hour, they use their top-shelf tequila for margaritas which is rare.
author: Tina C.

description:
One of my favorite bars in the city hands down. The vibe in there is always chill, regardless if it's packed or not. I've always found a way to get a seat in there, at all times. Food is amazing, they have a good variety of mission style Mexican food. Accompanied by some San Diego style Mexican food for example they put fries in a burrito!! So good. Their super quesadilla suiza one of the best I've had in SF . Trust me I've had my fair share in this city. Also, their tacos are bombb!! If you get their tacos , always order it "nicks way" you won't regret it. I almost forgot, their red sauce! It's in a squeeze bottle on top of each table, you can't miss it. Yeah put that thang on your food and on your chips. I have no idea what it is, but if I were to guess its some type of sweet and spicy, tangy, roasted and creamy
Chipotle sauce . I can totally be wrong but whatever the hell it is, put it on everything! 

They have a full bar, and good beer on tap. They have a good selection of IPA's, and other special drinks they make. 

All in all, good food and good drankk! Good spot to catch a game, and a good spot to just grab a drink and some tacos. Definitely my go to
author: Victor S.

description: I came to the Taco Shop to satisfy my Mexican craving during the first game of the World Series and found this spot stuffed to the brim with sports fans. I thought my taco hopes were dashed, but alas, we were able to order takeout and enjoy a beer within minutes of arriving at the takeout section of the bar. Our server was really friendly and fast, despite being slammed. The tacos here are fantastic and I would highly recommend ordering them "Nick's Way" - a grilled crispy tortilla wrapped in a soft tortilla with Monterey Jack cheese, pinto beans, piico de galllo, and guacamole.
author: Jaime L.

description:
chips and salsa were great. the chips are the thicker cut kind so the chips will not get all soggy in the salsa.

I got the street tacos and a taco nicks way. if you havnt tried it nicks way, definately try it. its crispy and loaded with guac. great contrast of flavors and textures. flavors are not overpowering. the street tacs are decent, reminiscent of so cal  taco trucks. i got all my tacos with carne asada except for 1 i got with carnitas. carnitas still need work, its dry and crumbly. 

over all good experience, excellent staff, great ambience. will come back to try more.
author: Jason C.

description:
After all of the hype I really REALLY wanted to like The Taco Shop at Underdogs. It's basically in my backyard and I walk by it on my way home every day. 

We've gotten their food twice and both times we were just disappointed. The baja fish burritos were okay, but I've had better. The quesadilla was meh, and the nachos were so bad. My boyfriend tried the special burrito with the french fries and only had a few bites before throwing the rest away.

The atmosphere inside seems great and if we were Giants fans I would definitely consider going inside to watch a game and have a beer, but food wise this place just doesn't add up for us.
author: Daphne W.

description: I was really impressed with the quality of food in this place the very first time I tried it. Tacoshop is a cozy bar with good drinks, and it used to have really good food as well. However, their food quality has been going down drastically even though the prices have gone up. I hope they bring  the quality back.
author: Atieh G.

description: Come here all the time it's my closest sports bar. It's always packed you can barely ever find a spot to eat. Although the food is good the service is not and the bartenders are douche bags. Sometimes they wear dodgers gear? WTF? Don't waste your time at this chad bar.
author: bob d.

description:
We've been coming here occasionally for three years, because it's in the neighborhood and they make damn good nachos.  damn good. 

But to echo the other reviewers, the service is terrible.  I'm not sure where they consistently find mute, disgruntled servers who ignore you, cannot make eye contact, and mishear your order. 

At first, it was entertaining.  We would always leave with a great story to tell friends about the terrible service at The Taco Shop:  "Today, the waitress didn't even look at us as she served us our food.  Seriously, she just set it down, looked the other way and grunted as she shoved it in our direction.  It was absurd!  hilarious!" 

Then it turned into:  "Should we dine and dash?" We jokingly considered this many times because it takes 20+ minutes to get the check once we finish our food, and it's clear none of the servers would notice or care if we just left.  (We of course never have, and for some strange puritanical reason, we still tip.)

So we started getting food to go.  But do not (do not!) bring in coffee from down the street. Today I did just that. I grabbed a coffee at Starbucks, then decided, "Hey, how about a breakfast burrito!  I'll get it to go since the service is so terrible."  I was greeted with "You can't bring Starbucks in here!" I just wanted to give them money to make me a burrito that I could eat at home, in peace.

We tried really hard to stick with this place, but the bad service is no longer entertaining; it's just offensive and confusing.
author: Sarah P.

description: Amazing quesadillas and Elote! Always a fun spot to hang out for a drink or two.. And watch the game. They have great specials on beer buckets for the sporting events too! Service is always fast and friendly.
author: Carol B.

description: Great food, good ingredients and fair prices for the quality. A nice sports bar in the Sunset. Bar staff is always nice and will find your game if you ask. Tortilla soup is a must! Full of good chicken and vegetables. I always get it as takeout when I am sick, but I love it even when I am not. Just an all around good place to go!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Super surprised by how good the burrito was at this place.  I had the California Burrito.  There were so many flavours and it was so, so awesome.  

After living in San Diego for 5 years, it's surprisingly hard to find good Mexican food in Northern California.  This place nailed it.

Recommended.

Note, it's also a full bar, with TVs, beer, drinks, etc. 

Staff is super friendly.  It's kinda small, but you can find seating pretty quickly from my experience.
author: Brian B.

description:
Taco Tuesdays

Beer bucket: The bucket was covered in basketball material and I wanted to take it with me! Hehe. $15 for only 6 Tecates. A bit pricey. 

$1 tacos: Although it's a good deal, I'm not a big fan. First, the tacos were tiny, smaller than regular tacos. The meat (beef, chicken or pork) was dry.

Nick's Baja-style fish taco: #10 on 7x7 Big Eat list. Basically this taco has a hard shell tortilla and a flour tortilla with melted cheese layered in between. Some sauce, cabbage and piece of fried fish then topped with a wad of guacamole. Nick had told us this taco is on the dense side, and I agree. But nevertheless, it was really tasty.

This is a great place to hang out and grab some food. If you manage to get a table or seat by the bar, then you're all set. Game time!

And just in case you were wondering, they are supposedly open for all the World Cup games =)
author: Marti L.

description: Came here today to watch the giants game and enjoy some tacos. Usually get the nicks way tacos which are packed with flavor and really filling, the guacamole is great. I enjoy these more than the tacos at Nicks itself, definitely coming back for more tacos and some beers.
author: Josue V.

description: I really ought to review these guys based off of how much I come here. I get the grilled fish tacos nick's way. I actually think this spot is better then the Nick's inside of Rogue on Polk & Broadway. No waits. Plus I swear the fish is fresher! It's the best. Nothing satisfies like a taco from here!
author: Shannon R.

description: Love the Taco Shop! Baja fish taco Nick's way is the best! Great hard working staff and always great food! It is a little small and does get packs on certain nights, but it will always be a place I will go for a taco and beer. The community picnic tables in the back are awesome, as long as you get lucky and have nice people to share the space with.
author: Natalia H.

description:
FOOD
1.) Tacos fish nicks way  = This is the thing to get!  I fiinaally understand... this is so good! Maybe coz slightly buzzed from drinking for World Series. But still - the soft taco plus the slight crisp crunch of the hard shell nom.... perfection

SERVICE
happy hour $2 tecate, but I missed the happy hour and it's $3.


ATMOSPHERE:
Kinda like a dive bar, gets crowded with games, and limited seating. If with a group, best to go early to barge up a picnic table in the back. 

12.16.13    10.30.14
author: Angela L.

description:
Great vibes! Perfect for catching up with some friends while watching  sports. 
Also the burritos have french fries inside them.... Delicious!
author: Jasmin M.

description:
Love the sports bar theme. But that's where my praises end.

"Healthy" mexican food for about 5X the price of a delicious LA street taco. And when healthy means whole wheat tortilla, grassfed kobe, etc.. I'd love to jump aboard, but I cannot justify the hefty pricetag for trendiness without taste. I love it Nick's way, but his other shop - Nick's Crispy Tacos - has got the better tacos.

Me and my beau waited in line for a good 30 minutes before being seated and treated to mild tasting carne asada and chicken burritos. My chicken burrito was a little on the soggy side (too much sour cream)... and the sauces featured here are a bit extreme:
Black Pepper - peppery, dark water
Red - tastes like ghost pepper, one drop and your mouth is on fire
Green - mild, jalapeño, cilantro, not much of a kick

When the burrito itself is not too appetizing, I rely on the sauces to mask the flavor, and the sauces here were all a little off-putting for me. I still love ya Nick!
author: Fiona Y.

description:
This place is awesome!

I'ts a bit small but that's it's only drawback. In some ways it makes it even funner. You're usually forced to share a table with strangers, which in SF just means you end up making new friends. 

Great place to watch a local team play and eat mexican food. The food is very good (better than one would expect). Has a funny hole-in-a-wall + pub atmosphere. It's always a good time. Big tvs, lots of drink choices, and a great location. 

Highly recommend it. Go early if you want seats.
author: Jaqk T.

description: I am a disabled veteran and was told that my service animal, which I have for PTSD, was not allowed inside. I explained to the bar tender that I was disabled to which he replied "do you have any proof". I tried to explain ADA rules to him but he was not interested. I told him to call the police to remove me, but since it was my birthday my wife dragged me out because she knows how far I will take things like this. Denying access to persons protected under ADA is a federal crime. Still mulling my options. But be prepared for ignorant pricks here.
author: Jackson D.

description: native san franciscan...no shortage of great places to eat in the city.  have to say that this place is solid.  not only is the food fresh, but the service is fast and friendly. Fridays between 6 and 6:30 is $1 margaritas. Even in that frenzy, the staff is attentive.  loved it.
author: Vivian S.

description: Watched hockey games here, rolled in when I was very drunk for margaritas and nachos, everytime I have a great time. Sometimes the service is hit or miss but the drinks and food always have me coming back for more. Also I've heard the happy hour is awesome.
author: Alex N.

description: pretty awesome tacos, sauce isn't overpowering but it could be a little hotter. good vibes and atmosphere for sure
author: Noe M.

description: This place has some amazing street tacos for only $2.  It is always my choice for Taco Tuesdays!! Their margaritas are also pretty good.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Nick's Crispy Taco! 

Need I say more? Best ever beer battered fish taco Nick's way! So good!

Taco Shop is a small bar on Irving. Definitely stop by here for a drink and a Nick's Crispy Taco if you've never had one before! It's the best! Nicely beer battered fish with a crispy taco on the inside and a soft shell on the outside! Yum! :)
author: CeCe C.

description:
My boyfriend and I happened upon this place on our way to Golden Gate Park.  We were starving and tacos sounded great. 

We managed to snag the last open table in the place and began to pour over the menu.  While not especially big, the menu looked really good.  I had a hard time deciding, but eventually went with the Mexican "Street Style" Tacos and a side of rice.  My boyfriend got one of the burritos, though I can't remember which one.

The tacos were super tasty!  I liked the chicken and pork best, but they were all delicious.  Their chile verde and chipotle sauces are also awesome and tasted good mixed up with my side of rice.  I didn't try a bite of my boyfriend's burrito, but he inhaled the thing and proclaimed it delicious.

Prices are pretty awesome - my three tacos were only $6 bucks!  Without drinks, we were in and out for about $20 bucks including tip.  Awesome deal.
author: Sonya L.

description: Go to place for tacos.. Gotta get nicks carne asada with a beer on tap I prefer one of the ciders but can't go wrong. The environment is pretty awesome to very laid back spot to just eat and catch up with friends or watch one of the games on
author: Matt F.

description: Best hang out in the 'hood! Great hang out spot, live sports and awesome staff! Oh and the food rocks! The quesadillas are delicious!
author: Matthew F.

description: The street tacos were good but the customer service was terrible. When my friends and I got there the Hostess was rude and sat everyone else around us and made us wait longer then necessary. While we waited the bartender had a bad bottle of Vodka he was told to throw away and he looked in our direction to see if we were watching. If my friend didn't make eye contact with him he would've served me that bottle. This place is a no go for me ever again.
author: Jasmond W.

description:
I liked this place for what it was....a loud bar with music blasting and sports games on every TV in the venue. I wish I came here to watch a 49ers game and have some drinks. Unfortunately, I was trying to catch up with some friends I haven't seen in a while and because this place was so loud, it was very hard to have a conversation. I was almost yelling when conversing with friends around a small table and this was a Sunday evening with no home games going on for any bay area teams.

However, I think this place is great for the purpose....to be a loud, energetic sports bar. I may return to watch some games here, we'll see. Although, I thought the noise level was too high, even for a sports bar.

Full bar, as expected and the fish tacos we had were awesome! Make sure to get the Nick's way baja fish tacos, you will not be disappointed! 

Good fish tacos and a fun atmosphere but too loud, even for a sports bar.
author: Russell G.

description: Best bar in the city, still. Came here for the Giants World Series run. Come here for birthday parties. Come here to decompress. Nachos, tacos (done Nick's way, of course), pretty cheap beers, and $6 tecate and tequila specials. $2 taco tuesdays and $1 margeritas on Friday nights. Win.
author: Danny C.

description: Delicious La Bomba breakfast burrito and nachos.  I was skeptical when my friend took took me here today.  But that burrito was tasty! Crispy bacon and potatoes.
author: Gary B.

description:
Soooo let me tell you about this wicked awesome experience I had at Underdog's because of our server, Maggie. I bet you're probably thinking, "Omg Dan, tell me how dope Maggie was." Well I'm gonna. 

From the moment we sat down, she was friendly, cheerful, and better yet, spunky! Pretty much what I would expect from a server in thick Rayban frames, skinny pants, and dirty Vans. 

Maggie is the homie. Next time you come to underdogs, don't settle for anyone else. Maggie for city Supervisor! Well, at least for Head of the MTA.
author: Dan O.

description:
I am an LA sports fan and this is a San Francisco sports bar, so I am going to write this review with as little bias as possible.

I have tried many burritos in San Francisco, all of which have been a great disappointment - especially compared to what I can get in LA and SD - but the Taco Shop has the best burritos I have tried in SF thus far. Their burritos are a little pricey ($8-10), but I would say it is worth it since they actually taste like quality burritos, unlike other places in SF.

My recommendation: The carne asada San Francisco burrito or the California burrito, but the San Francisco burrito is better. 

The margaritas were pretty good as well. Their pitchers are $32-40, but it is worth it because their margaritas are pretty strong. After two pitchers of margaritas split between three people, we were all on a great drunken level.

Lastly, the service was excellent! Our server, Brittany (sorry if I spelled your name wrong), was really friendly and helpful and humored us despite how dumb we must have been acting. She even took the time to pour the leftover margarita in the pitcher into our glasses before taking the pitcher away. I definitely haven't had a server do that for me before :) 

Overall, I would definitely return to the Taco Shop and I recommend this place to anyone. 

PS GO KINGS GO!!!
author: Mark B.

description: Had tacos Nick's way. They were really good. The crispy, deep fried tortilla inside the soft shell is really tasty. Burritos were good, too.
author: John S.

description: The BEST place to watch sports. This place gets crowded. But hey, it's for a good reason! The Mexican food here is GREAT. Weird right? A sports bar with tasty Mexican food? That's my kind of bar. Make sure to come here at least 2 hours early for big sports events. The Kobe beef nachos and quesadilla are killer. Even the chips and salas here are of quality. Sit down grab a beer and enjoy some good food.
author: Alexandra B.

description: This place is no-frills. A sports bar that can fulfill a taco craving while you drink a Negro Modelo. Nick's Way is, in my opinion, the only way to eat their tacos as the guacamole plays well with how they present the meats and ingredients.
author: Steve L.

description: Ordered three tacos Baja Style Nick's and a chips and guac way to share with someone.  Didn't order any drinks or other food.  The tacos come folded nicely in a paper holder so it's easy to eat and also pretty sanitary.  The sauces they use in combination with the freshly fried battered fish made for a delicious combination.  The order was sufficient for us to feel satisfied and the surprising variety of textures in the taco was pleasant.  The warm soft tortilla, the light but crisp breading, the tasty fish, crisp but finely chopped cabbage and red onions, all contributed to a memorable meal.  These are the best tacos I've had in a while.  The guacamole was good, and the chips were standard; both were generously portioned.  Overall I'd recommend this place, and I'll likely come back to try some of the other tacos next time I'm in the area.
author: Reid H.

description: Best taco I've had in a long time.  I would frequent if I lived closer, but was driving through the City.
author: Sondra M.

description:
Strictly reviewing on the SoCal burrito cause thats all i really really ate

the Socal burrito is meat, rice, pico de gallo, and lastly...FRIES! o baby!

i got it with the chicken and it was a little dried which is how i like it.  Not overly saucy but just enough juice to make the dry chicken better.  I do love the taste of fries (the potato-ness) with my burrito...the mushiness of the missing bean texture.  

They have this sauce, which im assuming is the habanero sauce....its SOOOO good with the burrito and the heat builds and burns but its so good!

i miss the sauce already =(
author: Laurie W.

description: Wow! The manager on a Friday night should be managing anything. The manager with the glasses and   obviously profiling . Amazing after sitting with a group of 12 people for 2 1/2 comes to us to move be a table because he needed a space for the waiter to walk to a wall what ? Makes no sense! Then comes to the women's side only and doesn't address the side with the men and tells us to move the table in 5 minutes because it's going be margarita time and they needed our table what? We were waiting for margarita time and wanted to eat more food but because Caucasian women wanted our table he was asking us to hurry and leave when we still weren't done. Not sure what was really going on with him today but we won't be back
author: Yvette C.

description:
The first time i came here, i was hooked.

My bf was always preaching about the place, so we decided to go one afternoon for lunch. I definitely fell in love with their veggie tacos, super great with all the lettuce and other condiments. And the fish tacos that my bf ordered also proved to be absolutely scrumptious!

It's also nice that it's a bar that's adorned with so many sport teams, this place is definitely good for a kick-it with friends :).
author: Jerianne G.

description: We usually order Baja Fish Tacos Nicks Way... And the Elote. We have also tried the steak street tacos which are also really good but the fish tacos are amazing! Food is definitely 5 Star.
author: Daniella G.

description:
AVOID

Pencil-thin $10 burritos that they should be ashamed to serve in San Francisco.

A horrible, rude staff and a manager that verbally assaulted me for not finding my meal enjoyable.

This place is run by punks and owned by them too.

Zero customer service skills and a very slow kitchen (40-minute burritos)

I really don't understand why people still go here.  College kids, wake up and take a trip to the mission if you want real burritos.  This place is Chipotle but without the smiles and actually Chipotle is more generous.  hahahahahhaha...

they suck.
author: William G.

description:
I like to throw 5's around at places that I enjoy. I'm gracious I guess. The fact is that I live I chico and I thank my lucky stars that we don't have a place this good there or that I don't live here. If either were so I would spend all of my money in my bank account eating this food day and night, then I would take out the biggest loan that I could and max my credit cards, I would do nothing but eat this food until I was the worlds fattest man. I would then, in this state be homeless likely and I would beg feet away from the business. Every time I got enough money for more food here I would go straight in and buy/consume the food. In closing, thank you made up Jesus for not giving me constant access to this place.

Also, get the beers if you want drinks.

Lastly, the bathroom is so awesome! Stimulating!
author: Matthew S.

description:
A great sport bar place to have tacos, burritos or any other food that they offer, drinks, and watch sports games here. This place is small, so it can get crowded/full fast whenever there's a game on from any sport.  

I had Mexican "Street Style" Tacos and Pescado "Baja" Style taco.  To me I think their price for the tacos are a bit pricey (between $4.5 - $5) for one taco and their tacos are small. If you get two tacos, it's $8 but still expensive. The Mexican street style tacos come in 3 tacos for $6. in the end their tacos are really good. If you add in their sauces and lime, it add in a lot of flavors to the tacos. the tortillas are a bit dry when i had their tacos.  

Had long island cocktail drink. Whenever I have this drink at other bar or restaurant, it's usually sweet and have the right among of alcohol where you don't taste it as much. Long Island at  Taco at Underdog was pretty strong that you can actually taste the alcohol. I guess it depends of the bartender of the night. 

Parking are difficult to find here on weekend during the afternoon and early evening since that is when a lot of people are out. 

Come here if you enjoy watching sports while you eat and drink with your friends.
author: Julie N.

description:
Nuuuu, whyyy. My first time here was over a few years ago when I had the best fish tacos ever. I've been meaning to come back since and finally made it back last night ...But left incredibly disappointed. 

We both ordered two tacos each and chips to share. We finished our chips and waited for nearly 20 minutes before our tacos showed up. The waitress apologized for the wait and comped our chips so that was okay. But the tacos were when disappointment hit. 

BAJA FISH TACO, NICK'S STYLE
The beer-battered fish was soft and soggy, damnit. It's supposed to be crisp and flavorful but with each bite, the fish melted away and completely missed my tastebuds. WHY. WHY! I know you can do better! 

GRILLED SHRIMP TACO
....was cold. And the tortilla hardened from sitting out. Everything was dry and bland.

Just... What happened!? My friend has been here several times and last night was his first time with bad food. Something went wrong and our tacos were the victims. I'm very sad that after a few years, I finally made it back but caught them at an off night. My fish taco craving is left unsatisfied but I've had Underdogs at its best so until next time...
author: Sandy T.

description: Excellent food, excellent service. Had carne asada and fish tacos, Nick's way, and they were delicious. I ended up throwing away the outer corn tortilla though. Seating is communal and first come, first serve. Plenty of TVs to watch multiple games at once.
author: Q C.

description: Weekly spot for me. They have lots of TVs playing sports, great taco Tuesday deals, a big selection of tequila, and the Nicks way tacos are amazing. Definitely recommend!
author: Kirill P.

description:
The service here is really wonderful, they have a great staff. Unfortunately there was a problem with our food here recently... 
 
The kitchen sent out a dish with a bug in it.

It's disappointing that we can't go back, even though we've always enjoyed this place.
author: Michelle W.

description:
Awesome bar to catch a game! They have plenty of TVs so different groups can watch different things. Today in particular had a lot of things going on (college football, USA basketball, US Open, MLB) and there was at least one TV for each of the events.

Tacos here are pretty great, as well as nachos (at least until those get soggy). However, I wish that their meat was shredded rather than chopped into relatively large chunks, since they just kept falling off.

Brownie points for hanging a Cal banner and not a furdie banner. The bar supports most local teams, as well as Michigan and some Chicago teams. There were lots of Michigan fans leaving the bar today after their game was over so I guess this is the place to go in SF if you're a Michigan fan.
author: Allen C.

description:
Following the 7x7 list my friends and I had to try out Nick's Baja-style fish tacos. I've been to Nick's tacos which is the same owner as Underdog's but Nick's wasn't on the list! LOL and they do serve the same thing. Is that cheating if I said I ate it @ Nick's than @ Underdog's? LOL 

Any-hoot, we ended up @ Underdog's off Irving street in the Ave's and the place ended up to be a sports bar that served tacos!!! So the salsa was good! really fresh, the wine I ordered was bleh! the fish taco was Yummy! tasted exactly the same as Nick's tacos off Broadway. I still think it's expensive for a taco which is $4.25 compared to the mission you can get it for $2.00
author: Kathy V.

description: The service here is SO good! Her name was Magz on the receipt, so I guess that's her name. She's super sweet and so nice. The food here was really good! (esp Nick's Way tacos). The atmosphere is fun, a little loud if you plan on having legit conversations with people. They have TVs for sports and even a basketball arcade game thing. Cool place to chill!
author: Christina X.

description: Came here on Cinco de Mayo. It was packed and took sometime to get a seat. It's kind of a scavenge for your own. After we finally sat down we ordered and the food was alright. I wasn't supremely amazed. Prices are a bit high for a mexican restaurant with this ambiance, but it was okay. Margaritas were just okay too. Nothing too amazing about this place. I can see how it could get packed though on a game day.
author: Julie L.

description: Liz was great and is a cutie!!!. She helped us right away, gave me and my friends great recommendations and also recommended near by places to visit since we were new to town. This place definitely became my spot while I was in San Francisco.
author: Rodriguez B.

description:
Really small space, so the wait was long. In the end, totally worth it!

Taco Tuesdays; street tacos for $2!!!

Affordable and delicious!

One of the better Taco Tuesday happy hours that I have been to. Will definitely come back.
author: Eric C.

description:
Man what better place in the Sunset to go that offers insanely great tacos ( you HAVE to go the Nick's way route) paired with a delicious michelada. The helpings here are hearty so make sure you go on an empty stomach! 

One of the best appetizers I've had in the city without a doubt is the elote. You can either get it on the cob or shaved on a plate. What follows is a tasty mix of buttery quest with a hint of lime; it;s like a mexican mac n' cheese! Honorable mentions goes to the authentic tortilla soup and the quesadilla that pretty much looks like a stuffed fried chrunchwrap supreme on steroids. 

Although it may be difficult to find seating, the service is always pretty fast whether you choose to order at the bar or one of the few lucky ones to find a seat during peak hours.
author: Dreski S.

description:
I can barely write this because all I can think about are Nick's Tacos and it's making it incredibly hard to concentrate. 

I order ONE thing here: carne asada tacos Nick's Way. It will blow your mind and change your whole life. I could probably eat these for the rest of my life. 

Nick's Tacos aside, Underdogs is pretty good place to catch a game. It's a bit small so there aren't too many seats so plan ahead! There are lots of TVs if you can get a seat somewhere near the bar. There are picnic tables in the back but the view's not as good.
author: Alli Q.

description:
Blah de blah, tacos Nick's Way. 

I think what needs to be highlighted here is the Elote con Queso: corn on the cob with lime salsa, cotija cheese & cayenne pepper. I mean, sure I can make this at home but what a savior when I don't feel like eating a heavy taco or quesadilla.
author: Margaret S.

description: Be prepared to wait, and wait, and wait some more. The bartenders are nice people but there are never enough of them. Because of that, the service has always been slow no matter when I've visited. Once you get your tacos you will find that they are merely okay.
author: Thomas M.

description:
The food here is decent, the margaritas are usually pretty strong.  The benches and picnic tables are free for the taking and sharable.
The food is decent, as I said.  I like the tortilla soup, tacos and their nachos.  The guacamole is also tasty, but pricey.  I think this joint is a little overpriced.  However, I can eat here #glutenfree and that is worth the extra coinage.
author: Heather S.

description: Breaking news: The grilled fish taco has replaced the fried fish taco as my number one favorite :D
author: Jacquee P.

description:
I've been wanting to try their tacos for the LONGEST time, it's been YEARS. People tell me their tacos are a MUST try. So I had the Carne Asada Taco. I'm not sure what happened to my taste buds that night, but I only thought it was eh, okay. However, they don't skimp on avocado so woohoo! 
I think maybe next time I'll give their fish taco a try. 

My friend shared his nachos and it was GOOOD. It's a good serving size. It's pretty big. To finish the nachos alone, you will feel pretty uncomfortable when you're done. 

Drinks will be drinks, especially drinks from the bottle. 

Overall, cool place to hang out with friends. The service isn't bad. Nothing to complain about.
author: Jess W.

description:
I craaaaave this place. The carne asada is spot on. I've even brought a good mexican friend of mine here with me and she justified that it's as good as her dad's! I've been here twice in the last month and both times they were super swamped, the average wait time here is about 15-20 minutes for seats of 3 or more. But if you come in a pair, it's pretty easy to get seats by the bar or on the tables next to the bar. 

And my usual breakdown:
Service: Quick and friendly service. I'm not sure where to put this but you are not allowed to bring drinks from another place in here. This place is right down the street from T-pumps, how could you not! But the owner and waiters are super nice, they gave us cups to pour our milktea into. They're also good with checking in to see how you're doing and whether you need something even when they're swamped!. A+ service

Ambiance: 
The place is a bar, so of course it's going to be pretty loud. Usually you can even watch people attempt to break the last highest score on the basketball game machine, it's pretty entertaining. 

Food:
I've tried the burritos and the quesadillas here. For the price and quantity, I'd definitely choose the burrito any day. Like I said, always pick carne asada if you're debating between meats. So. So. Good. I got the California burrito, there were fries in there, and they also include the extra fries on the side. I'm craving it as I type this. 

Definitely recommend if you're wondering about their food. Haven't tried their drinks yet, but I will soon!
author: Sheri N.

description:
Excellent place for beer, watching sports and really good food. Chicken and steak were of great quality - nice and tender - the green sauce had a little kick but it tasted Great!!!

Customer service was excellent - very fast, courteous, food came out quick - no long waits. 

Great ambiance - great for sports fans - just the right amount of noise where you can't hear the table next to you but enough for you to carry your conversation with your friends. 

Right of 19th street - on the way back home - excellent location - food - ambiance - check it out !!!
author: Sam M.

description:
This was tough, what I'd consider a hard choice between a three and a four star.

On one hand, one guy behind the bar makes a mean michelada and the food is reliably what it is.

On the other hand, it is overflowing with 20-something year olds who sadly all have hearing deficiencies and will be shouting at each other for most of your stay.

If you want to spend 40 minutes gesticulating at someone over mid-level but fresh Mexican food and cheap drinks, you've found your place.
author: Rafael S.

description:
$0.50 margaritas, anyone?

Too bad. Because in these recession times, the price has gone up to $1. There are two different listings for Underdog's and since I did eat tacos at the sports bar place, I'm just gonna write about here. Deal with it.

This isn't the sort of place I'd come to if it weren't for the margaritas. Because of the cacophony of douchebags, I wouldn't come here for the games, not for the trivia night and certainly not for an after work drink. In fact, I wouldn't even come for the food. Since it was Friday and the sign outside said, "$1 street tacos and $2 Tecates." We figure we'd kill time until the clock struck 6 o'clock in the evening for the slashing prices Cal Worthington margarita extravaganza. There were some tables available when we got there at 5:30, but damn did that place fill up fast. I'm talking lasso'in the corral fast.

Needless to say the tacos were a Debbie Downer. The teaspoon portion of meat was dry and BLAND, the tortilla missing that char from being grilled and hardly warmed through and the cilantro and onions thrown on haphazardly. I was smiling sarcastically when me lad responded, "Come on now, you can't complain for a buck in the city." Oh, I can...and I shall. Pricing things at a lower cost than the regular menu price doesn't allot you fuck up leeway, I still expect quality. And you should take pride and dignity.

Rowdy and restless patrons started to buzz around like bees when the barkeep lined the length of the bar with glasses of ice, filling them all with margaritas. I blinked and they all disappeared. The margaritas are good...really good. They're knock you on the ass strong, but still tasting acid and sweet. 

One thing that I'd like to really praise, are the two waitresses that served us. They were sweet, attentive, speedy and funny. I guess a place can survive in these hard times with cheap margaritas and great servers. Good job girls!
author: Illyanna M.

description:
The tacos are delicious here.  My dad and I came here to pick up burritos and tacos for a Sunday family dinner, and he's pretty old so he didn't care for the noise/crowd.  I disagreed, and said it was vibrant, young, and full of life.

Anyway, back to the food.  Again, tacos, nick's way, are fantastic; I mean really tasty.  Their burritos, on the other hand, are far less good.  We ordered two shrimp, one mahi mahi and one vegetarian burrito, in addition to two vegetarian tacos (nick's way, of course).  We waited for 25 minutes for this to-go order to get assembled; simply put it wasn't worth it.

Don't get their burritos.

They were packaged in a thin bag, and the server unceremoniously and sloppily shoved one handful of chips (containing 15 or fewer chips) on top of the burritos and taco box (I'm fine with rustic and quirky serving, but come on now, that's crazy sloppy), and we were given two salsas (ALL FOR FOUR PEOPLE AND FIVE ORDERS, are you KIDDING ME?).  When I asked for more salsa, the server blankly said, "which one?"  And he only gave me one more salsa.  Man, that's some bull excrement; although their salsa's pretty middling and the burritos are just bursting with salsa, so I kind of understand.

To add insult to injury, after the 5-minute drive home, the bag breaks because two of the burritos, the mahi mahi and the vegetariano, are so full of salsa they are leaking like a super-wet sponge.  The quality of the ingredients is undeniable, but they are so off on the proportions; it was like eating Chipotle's shut-in burrito brother.

Again, do not get their burritos, stick with the tacos!
author: Phillip W.

description:
I have tried and TRIED to like this place, but every time I go back it gets worse. When I first came here, the food was good, but it ISN'T Mexican food, it's the chef's version of Mexican food and it isn't bad, but it isn't Mexican. The burritos are half the size they used to be, the kitchen has gotten my order wrong 4 out of the last 5 times I've been in, and it doesn't matter if it's busy or 2pm on a Tuesday. The last time I ordered a burrito, I sent it back TWICE, and it was STILL wrong. I didn't want to eat it at that point because I assumed the staff must have spit in it. How hard is it to read a ticket? I mean, really? The server's consistently blame the kitchen, then HIRE NEW PEOPLE!

My experience last night was no different. I order a nick's taco with a group of four at a table in the back. All is well, I'm considering getting the elote if I see the server pass again (which I don't), but I happily sit with my drink and wait.

A busser brings out the entire group's food, but not mine and only one of my friend's two tacos. Then the busser asks if we need anything else. Confused, I say, "My food?" And she says very rudely, "Oh... it should be right out," and walks away to the bar. (This would have been a good time on her part, to check with the kitchen).

Ten minutes later, the entire group has finished eating, the tables surrounding us that ordered after us are served their meals and my friend and I still do not have our tacos. I catch our server, who says, "OH! Let me check!" and walks away.

Five minutes after that, I catch her on her way to the kitchen and tell her to forget it, bring my friend's taco, but I don't want mine anymore. 
"It should be right out!" She says frantically rushing to the kitchen, she comes back with my taco and NOT my friends.  SERIOUSLY. 
"I have it right here!"
"I don't want it. Send it back."
She gives me a dirty look and walks away. The busser brings my friend's last taco five minutes later after we RE-ORDER IT.

We received no apology. Nothing.

Whatever. Never going back again. This place is a hot mess and I hate them with the passion of 1000 fiery suns.
author: Lara E.

description: I just discovered the Baja Taco "Nick's Way" today, and I'm thoroughly impressed.  $5.95 for a fat, juicy fish taco loaded with all sorts of guacamole goodness! The beer on tap has a good selection and the bartenders are busy but attentive to your requests and easy to get along with. I've got a pretty big appetite, but 2 of these  tacos and a beer will do a pretty good job of filling you up as you watch whatever sports team you happen to root for. Great late night grubbin' in the Inner Sunset!
author: Sam L.

description:
Came here last night for a Mexican bite!

Ordered the classic style taco selection, one fish taco Nick's style and a beef quesadilla to share. Oh and of course the house margarita!

Everything was tasty with plenty of meaty filling. My favourite filling was the chicken classic style taco but I liked the Nick's style taco shell better. 

I liked the sauces that were on the table- the green one adds an extra spicy kick!

All pretty good value. I'd definitely like to come back on a Tuesday for 1$ Taco's!
author: Steph A.

description:
We discovered this place while looking for a sports bar to watch the Knicks game little knowing that we would be eating some of the best Mexican food of our lives!

Standouts:
*Elote con Queso    3.50
Fresh white corn on the cob brushed with lime salsa 
& then dusted with cotija cheese & cayenne pepper. You are an absolute fool if you do not order this corn...unless you hate corn..The best corn on the cob of my life!
*Pescado "Baja" Style   
Beer battered fish in two soft corn tortillas with cilantro, 
cabbage & red onions. Lime & roasted tomato salsas.
make it Nick's Way   5.25..order it Nick's way for sure which is Way" is one grilled crispy corn 
tortilla & one soft tortilla filled with Monterrey Jack 
cheese, pinto beans, pico de gallo & guacamole. The best taco in all of SF..maybe in the entire country !!
*Sopa De Tortilla     6.50
Homemade chicken soup with tomatoes, onions, 
jack cheese, avocado, tortillas & lime. The best Mexican soup of my life and I've had a few hundred bowls.

The best red and green squeeze bottle,fresh in house made salsas, especially the red that tastes like they roasted chilies on an outdoor grill  or ground up smoky toasted dried chilies...World class. I could drink it as a beverage.  The green is the best green salsa you will ever have. 

Very good Margaritas and pure...no bar mix.  Mexican Coke too!

What a find...My new favorite place to hang out.  Lot's of big screen TVs too and very friendly service.
author: Bleep S.

description:
I've been compelled to taco bout' this bar that's reminiscent of a New Orleans shotgun house.  Why's it called a shotgun house you ask?  Instant history lesson: You, fellow Yelper, can open fire from the front door and it will make it's way through each room to the back door.  Shotgun houses are a Feng Shui enthusiast's nightmare.  I diverge, back to this review. 

Interior: A narrow hallway separates the bar from tables that line the wall.  The pro in that consists of simply being able to snatch up extra napkins and their bottled version of carafes for water.  Sports flags hang from the ceiling and a few TV's line the length of the bar.  Big ups for the basketball game in the back by some picnic table seating.  Typical, nothing to write home about.  A sports bar-esque establishment in the Sunset deserves a chance to surprise me and become my watering hole.  

Food: The BF and I split chicken nachos.  Just going to say that I'd rather risk the hot sloppy's from everyone's favorite 3am fourth meal destination.  I say this because I'm not a fan of shredded chicken, especially when it's drenched in whatever red sauce that was completely devoid of any Mexican seasonings.  It's also safe to note that I'm not a crock pot concoction aficionado.  The stuff triggers thoughts of soft food that's easy on dentures.  I'm neither a teething infant or a toothless geriatric, so I'll pass on the chicken anything at Underdog's.  You know, it's difficult to settle for non-authentic Mexican in California, in general.  Anyways, word on the streets is that they have Taco Tuesdays here with drink specials.  But I'm a good Samaritan, so make your way to Blue Light on Union in the Marina for better food and drink specials on Taco Tuesday.  De nada. 

Service: Was there.  No silverware for sloppy nachos nor a refill on our water carafe.  The server was present. 

Underdog's again?  No bueno.  Gonna trek to San Jose for my taco fix from now on.  

Yea, this review is boring.  My BF noted that Yelpers either have too many good reviews or too many bad reviews.  This is my attempt at meeting somewhere in the middle.  Proof positive that mediocre places don't deserve reviews because there's obviously NOTHING substantial to say.  Take this review as my sincerest attempt at describing an erroneous place we visited next door to the closed KFC.  Oh yea, that's why we ended up there. Lates.
author: Angie N.

description:
Come here before 6pm on a Tuesday, and you get $4 margaritas and $2 tacos! That's what we did and we were fortunate to get a seat at the bar with the Giants game on. The bar tenders were awesome and I think all of three of them asked us if we were ready to order and some point or another. 

We got a round of margaritas and they were delicious! Definitely strong and well worth it.  I ended up getting one Nick's style carne asada taco and one street style pollo taco. Only the street tacos are included for taco Tuesday. My boyfriend got 2 carne asada tacos, one pollo, and one carnitas, all street style. I think I was so annoying because I kept saying "this taco is SO good!" like ten times. Not exaggerating either. That Nick's Way carne asada taco was absolutely amazing!! They pack on the guacamole and have both a hard shell and soft shell in the taco. The red and green salsas they have are really flavorful and we put them on all of our tacos.

I am obsessed and will now be a regular here. We got another round of margaritas to complete our taco Tuesday. By the time we left, people were hovering us for seats at the bar. So I recommend getting there before 6 and take full advantage of happy hour and taco Tuesday.  We got five street tacos, four margaritas, and one nicks way taco and the bill was only $32. Great deal for great Mexican food!
author: Alisha K.

description: I will say I didn't want to come here because I'm not a fan of nicks at all. My husband wanted me to meet him here for a quick bite and we made the happy hour. I had the street tacos and I was hooked! Not nicks way. Super good. I also got a spicy margarita and it was delish. Great happy hour. I think it was 1.50 tacos and have drink specials. My husband and I left full and buzzed for under $30. Staff was great too!
author: Kimberly W.

description: My husband and I happened upon this place after visiting Golden Gate Park - and I've been craving it ever since! We both had Baja Tacos Nick's Way. I'm a huge fan of fish tacos, but these were by far the best I've ever had. The perfect amount of crisp on the fish, and the sauce was amazing. I also loved the texture of a soft and a hard taco shell. The chips and salsa were amazing and unique as well. I wish I could find someplace like this in Phoenix (seriously, if anyone knows of a place that has tacos like this in Phoenix, I NEED to know!)
author: Bekki B.

description:
It's a sports bar!  Can you believe it?

Taco Shop At Underdog holds a special place in my heart.  It's got good sangria and great baja style fish tacos.

Now I should be clear:  if it's sweet, tastes kind of like juice, has a hint of alcohol to it, some fresh fruit added, and gives you a bit of a buzz, then by my mark that's good sangria.  I have some friends who always complain to me that the sangria I enjoy is not good sangria.  If you feel that sangria should contain a $40 bottle of Merlot from Gundlach Bundschu in Sonoma then we may not only disagree about what good sangria is, but about the concept of sangria itself.  If you feel that the sangria I have described above, with the fruits and the sweetness, is what you are after, then my god dear reader go nowhere else.
