And back to the fish tacos.  They come with some awesome fried fish that is crispy and delicious.  Below that is cabbage, and it's wrapped in a delicious corn tortilla.  On top of that they have decent salsas that are contained within plastic squeeze bottles.  I really love their chips with fresh tomato salsa and cilantro.

So it's a sports bar and I love it.  File it under guilty pleasures.  It's fun to come here at night on a day there's no sports because then I get the place and the killer cheap food to myself.
author: Alex H.

description: Catch happy hour before 6 for $2 tacos, the chicken is excellent quality white  breast meat and the other varieties ain't too shabby either. Good service and cool picnic table dining toward the back  past the more traditional bar setup. No deserts and a bit too much ice in the margarita; all good otherwise.
author: Gordon W.

description:
I had the bad luck to have  a really bad waitress. I wanted a grilled fish taco and she encouraged me to get the batter fish taco because the grilled fish wasn't that good, the batter was better. She actually gave me a look when I insisted on the grilled fish. Then when she brought me my DELICIOUS grilled fish taco, I asked for salsa and she grimaced and pointed to the Tabasco bottle already on the table. There were bottles of salsa two paces away at the bar. The waitress proceeded topointedly  ignore our table. 
The taco was so delicious that I will be back. 
UPDATE-  Several months later, the aforementionned waitress took the time to write to me via yelp, not at all repentant about the lousy service she provided. True to form, she was irate and rude. And she no longer works here.
author: Susan B.

description: Great food but beware if you plan to go on a Tuesday or a weekend. This place can get quite busy and there isn't much seating available.
author: Chaz M.

description: The wait to have tacos on a Tuesday took forever! But after waiting for about 40minutes, we were finally seated in the back near the basketball arcade game. I loved that we were able to doodle on the tables so my sister, brother and I left our marks ;) I had 1.5 tacos which is super filling . Got the steak taco and fish. Both were delicious and filling. We also ordered the nachos which was also not bad, but nothing too special either. I ordered their elote because of my love for corn. This one was differently than most Elotes because it was more on the peppery side. Other than that I loved it because you can't go wrong with corn! They serve Tecate can beers with a small lime on top, but I'm definitely not a fan of that beer. Service was nice and friendly and also quick since we were right next to the kitchen. Will be back :)
author: Amanda C.

description:
Had late lunch/ early dinner here and it's my absolutely my favorite place. Greg, my bartender, took very good care of me... Well to mention it the whole staff did a very good job.  

Carnitas tacos nicks way (crispy AND  soft corn tortilla with tender beans, flavorful juicy pico de gallo all served with a mound of creamy guacamole) are so freaken good I'm scared to try anything else. Overall everything coming out of the kitchen looks very good too, especially the quesadillas. 

I guess if something ain't broke why fix it, right??? 

I highly recommend coming here for sure!
author: Angel R.

description:
Underdog's has always been a solid spot for Happy hours and for hanging out watching a Niner, Giants, or Warriors game over a brew or two. 

Most recently, Underdog's was cool enough to let us hold our Fantasy Football draft there. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cx6y2D1Q77R6dEqMOvnL7g?select=-GvAm1lOcU2I5HQ-G6OhXg#-GvAm1lOcU2I5HQ-G6OhXg)

We took up a couple tables as it was a 12 team draft but what I really appreciated were that the waitresses weren't pushy with having us order stuff. I mean seriously, it's a money league and the last thing I need is to do my draft drunk and pick Alex Smith while Drew Brees is still on the board and win the toilet bowl again. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cx6y2D1Q77R6dEqMOvnL7g?select=aCIB8Z8NeuVdM0GfOKA0HA#aCIB8Z8NeuVdM0GfOKA0HA)


They are even family friendly. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/dg9mx2jOLV-u7QorwpOtqg/l  

Even though the tacos aren't Mexican taqueria style they are still good. 
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cx6y2D1Q77R6dEqMOvnL7g?select=4IMgdmgDQoAyfnQx9NB09g#4IMgdmgDQoAyfnQx9NB09g)

 One of the previous times I was here they a pretty good loco moco plate. I'm not sure if they still offer it but I'd recommend it. 

I've came here when they first opened and I'll continue to come here. I guess you can say they've went from Underdogs to one of my favorites.
author: Earl G.

description:
We came here for margaritas and tacos late on a Saturday afternoon arriving at about 5pm - College football was on and the place was pretty packed but we were able to get 2 seats together at the bar.

Ordered a pitcher of house margaritas ($28) which were excellent - made with fresh squeezed lime and I could actually taste the tequila. I wouldn't bother with the more expensive "top shelf" margarita - the house margarita is made with Cabrito tequila which IMHO is much better then the Hornitos used in the "top shelf"

For starters we ordered chips and guacamole. Very tasty - the chips were perfect and were topped with a generous amount of guacamole. The two salsas were pretty damn good too!

Next we had crispy carne asada tacos - HUGE and tasty - overstuffed with meat, pico de gallo, and guacamole.

We left with bellies full and a nice buzz from the margaritas for about $50 including tip
author: Bumble B.

description: My favorite taco shop in San Francisco!  Every time I visit San Francisco I always have to stop here.  Make sure to get the taco Nick's way!
author: Michael K.

description:
I love this place.
The best item on the menu are the
BAJA FISH TACOS NICKS WAY.
you can add the Baja sauce to any item.
There hot sauces are amazing and they make the best tortilla chips I have ever had. No lie. Not too salty. Just the right amount of oil and super thick and crunchy. The bar tenders are great and friendly.
You must try the quesadillas as well.
Their margaritas are made using decent brand tequila and all natural agave nectar sweetener. No triple sec. They are great and refreshing. Perfect paired with the tacos. 
THIS PLACE IS PACKED ON TUESDAY NIGHT'S !
Kitchen is open till MIDNIGHT except Sunday and Monday nights.
author: Roman J.

description:
Tried this place out for the first time a few nights ago and boy was it packed around 6pm. As my bf and I arrived we are automatically asked for an ID, and I was really not expecting that. Thought it was just a taco place, but at the same time I saw the bar, so of course they would need to card me. We got in and the wait for a table was 20 mins, so we said no problem we would wait. 20 mins went by and the girl took us to the back. 

The place was really narrow and I didn't like the whole idea of sitting at the same table as other ppl. The music was beyond way to loud, but the food and drinks were great! The tacos are good, especially the fish taco! The quesadillas are huge so be prepared, and the burrito is bomb! It's a good place to go hang out with some friends and watch some games on tv. They also have a basketball game in the corner. Lol.
author: Lisa K.

description: Nick's Way were probably some of the best Tacos I have ever had. And I eat a lot of Tacos. Def a must have.
author: Maddie N.

description: While it is no secret that there is a ton of Mexican food throughout San Francisco, I have not found anything that can beat the Nick's Way fish tacos! Always ready fairly quickly to stay or to go, and always amazing. Should you decide to stay to eat, it can be a bit crowded since it's a popular place, but the staff is extremely friendly and attentive to detail.
author: Kendra B.

description:
Order one of the "Nick's way" taco. Best Taco in my whole life!!! The Margarita also tastes great... 

Thank God I have the yelp app in my iphone, otherwise I would never know about this place when I was starving after a long walk in the Golden Gate park. :)
author: BIGBOB K.

description:
As close to SD tacos and burritos as you can get here in SF.  A great place to watch football on Sundays - lots of fans of all teams.  
- Service is quick and friendly.
- The fish taco is pretty big.  One is plenty.
- Ask for the habanero hot sauce!  It's really hot!
author: Michele S.

description:
The mexican street tacos were pretty good. I had chicken, carnitas and carne asada. The chicken and carne asada were good but the carnitas were a little dry and bland. 

The steak nachos were delicious though, smothered in guac, pico de gallo and cheese. 

The steak quesadilla is also a must have.
author: Ray W.

description:
$2 taco Tuesday specials!

I love the taco shop @ Underdog's. My new favorite bar/taco shop ever. 

Their tacos, Nick's Way, of course, are the best. Very filling and a little pricey for $4-6 depending on what you get, but way way worth it! 

They have some brunch/bfast burritos and tacos if you're into weekend brunch (maybe weekday brunch/bfast too?) 

Their sangria is good, they have angry orchard on tap, for $20 a pitcher. 

Stop by, but be warned on game days, it gets super crowded.
author: Alison N.

description:
I LOVE their tacos and quesadilla. Very similar to Nick's Crispy Tacos in that they have tacos "Nick's way". 

Fish Taco- a huge piece of fried fish in a crispy and soft tortilla and a wedge of lime to drizzle. AMAZING. Please get it "Nick's way" because there is no other way that will make this taco tastes so good!

Carne Asada Taco- HUGE and super delicious, can't go wrong with this

Carne Asada Quesadilla- this one never disappoints. Crispy and golden brown on the oustide and the filling inside is so good! I got it with guac and sour cream. They had 2 different kinds of sauces at the table, the darker red one tastes really smoky and the green one is more mild. 

DEF coming back!
author: Carmen C.

description:
Decent bloody mary, but not for those who don't love spice. Only celery and two olives, nothing fun and pickled.

Otherwise, fish tacos are always great and the Santa Fe breakfast burrito was pretty delicious. I could also drink their green salsa with a straw.
author: Colleen M.

description:
I love their happy hour here (happens every Tuesday).  My girl-friend even called me her cheap date. ;)

I only had 2 tacos and 2 of their $3 margaritas the entire time I was there and it filled me up.  The beer-battered fish taco (Nick's way) is a must--costs about $5.  They stuff it with a giant fried fish cod that's crispy on the outside while it's still moist inside along with a generous amount of guacamole and coleslaw.  It's amazing.  It's probably one of the best fish tacos I've ever had.  

You can even top it with 2 types of mildly spicy sauces to strengthen your taco flavors.  One is their red sauce (my favorite) and the other is their green chili salsa verde sauce.  

Their street tacos were OK since you can pretty much get the same type of taco elsewhere so it was not a big deal.  I was glad they were only $2.

You might want to get there before 6pm on a Tuesday.  Any later than that, you'll be waiting for a seat.
author: Wendy T.

description:
I expected an orgasm in my mouth when I took my first few bites of carne asada tacos done Nick's Way.  The meat was full of flavor and juicy, there was plenty of pico de gallo and avocado too, yummy!  While it was very tasty, it didn't make me totally weak in the knees.  

My bf & I each had a carne asada taco & shared a carne asada quesadilla.  It was HUGE & nice & crispy.  Not that cheesy tho..hmm next time we'll get a cheese quesadilla.  Love their orange colored salsa!  

Service was really attentive as well, and this place (including the bathroom) is clean for a sports bar.  Underdogs is the perfect college bar.
author: Cat C.

description: I was lucky enough to live down the street from this place for 2 years, and now that I live in the peninsula I still drive up to SF just for these tacos! Chips and guacamole, 2 baja tacos "nick's way", a pitcher of margaritas, and I'm happy camper! I love the salsa they have in the squirt bottles, too. Such a fun touch! The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is that sometimes it's REALLY hard to get a table here around dinner time. The other day I came by and the wait was quoted as 45 minutes...35 minutes later I went back to the hostess and asked her about how much longer it would be, and she told me an hour! If you're going to give a time...make it accurate. If something changes, please just let me know! Other than this snafu, LOVE this place.
author: Melanie M.

description:
Even though it was madness after the Niners won the game that day, we found seating and two waitresses came to take our order right away. We had to bus out own table before we sat down and it was generally sticky all around, but I guess there was some charm to it? It seems like a great place to watch sports, with tons of big screens and high spirits.

The crispy tacos are obviously must-orders. The California burrito with french fries in the middle was an awesome idea, but poorly executed (soggy, darn). Drinks aren't incredibly cheap, and I didn't have anything but beer so I can't attest to whether they're strong or not.
author: Cat N.

description:
My sister and I both got food poisoning the last time we came, but I am still giving them 4 stars.

Their pescado "baja" tacos made Nick's way are just too freaking delicious! You get a perfectly battered fish in a soft AND crunchy shell with loads of guac. What is better than that? They also have the best verde sauce - try it.

I wish this place was bigger because its always super packed when I go. Even so, their service has always been great despite how busy it is. 

I've been here many times and I really wish that I didn't get food poisoning because now I'm really scared to go back. I'm sure I'll get over it...
author: V L.

description: Basically the same as Nick's Crispy Tacos. The carne asada tacos nicks way is the best. Also the chips and salsa are amazing!
author: Collin W.

description:
Went here for the first time the other day and must say that I was extremely impressed. The service is AWESOME! Not only was our server nice and fast, but at least two other servers stopped by our table to ask if we needed anything. 

The food was awesome! Chips and Sals were some of the best I've ever had and the Mahi Mahi burrito was not bad. We also had a Taco with Carne Asada and I must say that it was some of the best cooked meat I have had in a long time.

I will definitely be coming back to try different things on this menu.
author: Bernard D.

description: I love this place and it is certainly a go-to spot as I live in the area. I love so many things on the menu that I don't even have to repeat orders often but am pleased every time. It's crowded when there are sporting events, etc., but you should just know that about this place and set your expectations going in. I think it gives it a certain fun vibe anyway. I see families eat here, too, so it isn't like people are obnoxious or rowdy. They have great margaritas (if you don't know about their happy hour I might just have to keep the secret to myself), and have had other great drinks. Never had a problem with the service. The staff is understandably busy, and even still I've had some great conversations with the staff there who seem to enjoy it. As far as I'm concerned I'll be visiting for a long time to come!
author: Elise S.

description:
Well, tasty Mexican was probably among one of the last things I expected to find out in Sunset. But there we were, ushered in by a friend who lived nearby, and was craving some tacos (never mind that she ended up ordering a quesadilla instead).

Sharing an order of chips and salsa, I ended up getting two Nick tacos [ http://flic.kr/p/cfz5Ej ] (a soft shell wrapped around a hard one), one with carnitas, and one with carne asada, only to be further surprised at how stuffed they were with meat, salsa, and guac. Managing to finish just one, I packed the other one away, scarfing it down for dinner that night - though be warned that the shells don't hold up too well to being reheated (the already hard shells became so hard as to be near-inedible).

Both ended up tasting great, especially when had with their spicy habanero salsa (you have to explicitly ask for this one). And for $4.50 each, they're a great deal too, though I suspect that most people eat far more than i do. Combined with friendly service, and the whole sports bar environment, I can certainly see why this place is popular among the locals.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - No issues with the entrance, or interior, but note that half the seating consists of stools at the bar, while the other half are picnic style bench-tables, so those in wheelchairs will need to situate themselves at the ends.

Bathroom - Two private bathrooms with plenty of space inside, and handrails. I assume this applies to both, although I only checked out one of them.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Tacos and a beer pitchers, what more could you ask for? Came here with a larger group, started by occupying high tables towards the front and slowly made our way back. Eventually the picnic benches in the back of house cleared up and we called that perm residence. Staff was a good sport about the whole ordeal. 

Fun and chill vibe here. Tacos are amazing double deckers that makes you think wait, Taco Bell who? I can generally take on four, but the tacos at Underdogs had me tapping out at two. Usually I'm a carne lover, but chicken takes the pot here.
author: Julia C.

description:
best tacos in the city as far Im concerned. 
drinks can get a little pricey, but its a fun place to hang out and watch a game.
gets packed, so be prepared to share a table.
author: Ashot B.

description:
Nothing makes me happier than authentic carne asada tacos and for $2 each on Taco Tuesday I couldn't resist eating 3 in addition with the following:

Chips & Salsa: Should be renamed to chips & pico de gallo because that's all it was. They put a large serving on top of your chips which made some on the bottom soggy, I'd recommend to ask for it on the side. Oh and if you want guacamole it is an additional $4

Classic Margarita: The Asian female bartender looked cute and innocent but damn she can make a stiff drink. I was not complaining. 

Sangria: I am not a huge fan of wine or Captain Morgan but this was really well made and is something I would order again. I had 3 apple slices in my glass :)

I had no problem getting a seat when I arrived at 4:30 but when 6pm hit there was a waitlist for tables and not enough room at the bar for those waiting to sit. Come early!
author: Adrianna V.

description:
NICK'S WAY. ALL DAY ERR DAY. 

the combination of soft tortilla/hard taco shell in the carne asada tacos = ooohwee

add some beer, diff sports games on multiple TVs, and great company = OOOH WEEEE. 

they also offer drip blue bottle coffee for the non-drinkers/caffeine-dependent...
author: Caitlin C.

description: Came to watch the Warriors game with my friends. Even though the place was packed, Maggie was our server and she was sweet, attentive, helpful and so much more. She was everything we could ever want in a waitress. If I were her boss, I would be so proud of her. Food was good too.
author: Tyler F.

description:
This place is great. Neighborhood bar that attracts a lot of customers. It's spacious, the drinks are good, and the prices are just right. Best of all, they got food. And they good food. Some of the best burritos and tacos around. Defintely the best in the area. I come here for taco tuesday and it gets really packed. But doesn't every place in the city now. 

I love to come to this place and will continue to do so. From a selfish perspective, I hope it doesn't get too popular.
author: Yevgeniy K.

description: I love this place ! Best tacos in San Francisco ( Nicks way ) . Service is great , beer is cold and it's in a great little neighborhood . I don't get over to this side of town a lot but when I do this is a must stop !
author: Arnie G.

description:
I was happy that the place was pretty sparsely population at 10:30 AM on a Sunday, well into the first football games of the day. It definitely was filling up by 1 PM for the second group, which was fine. They had all the games on and the TVs were good enough.

The bloody mary (which, as far as I could tell, is not on the menu for some reason) was GREAT! Nicely spicy and really flavorful, with good accompaniments of celery, a big olive, and lime and lemon slices. The burrito was not as great, especially because the tortilla seemed in no way heated. It seems like a good idea to stick to the tacos.
author: Lisa K.

description: I got a chicken burrito and wasn't thrilled with it. The chicken was shredded and had no flavor to it. I think people mostly come here for watching sports games and drinks. I did enjoy the free chips and salsa though, I think it was chipotle salsa. My friend got a carne asada burrito and loved it so I may give them another chance.
author: Tanya Y.

description:
Energetic bar with lots of TVs to watch sports. However, seating is limited. There are seats at the bar, bar tables behind the bar, and benches in the rear. But if there is a game on, I recommend going early to get a good seat.

Food menu is pretty good too.

*Carne Asada Taco Nick's Way $4.50 (3.5 of 5) - The taco was huge and robust. Huge chunks of guacamole and everything else. Yummy.
*Fish Taco Nick's Way $4.50 (4 of 5) - My favorite taco. I really liked the fried fish in the taco. The freshness and the friedness was a perfect combo. Tasted soooooooooooo good. 
*Nacho $9 (3.5 of 5) - Huge. Stacked high and great with beer.  
*Margarita $6.50 (3 of 5) - Not bad, but not a WOW.
*Bourbon Shot and Budweiser $6 (5 of 5) - $6 for a shot and a beer,  you can't go wrong.
*Tequila Shot and Tecate $6 (5 of 5) - $6 for a shot and a beer,  you can't go wrong.

This is a good food & drinks & sports watching place.
author: Janice T.

description: Disappointed by the nachos. Tacos (Nicks way) not a fan..meat was dry and lacked flavor. Fish tacos were good though and I did like the burritos. Loud and divey (nothing against it..just depends on your mood).
author: Howe L.

description: California burritos all day, err day. Nick's tacos aren't too shabby either.
author: Albert C.

description: i can get a way better and more authentic taco in san jose. the prices are outrageous.  service was ok, it was busy.
author: C.R. M.

description:
Best damn tacos I ever had. If you ever get a taco get it Nicky's Way, especially their Baja taco. My favorite is the Grilled Shrimp taco (Nicky's Way of course). The shrimps are grilled to perfection. Nice and crispy-how I like it.

And their roasted pepper salsa on the counter? Drizzle that ish on everything.
author: Justina L.

description:
If you want to live life the right way, get two Nick's way Veggie tacos.  My life has forever been changed.

The service here is always great.  The servers are fast, fun, and flirty!  Who does't love that.  The manager El( I foot his name) seems to run a tight ship and gets the job done.

Check the schedule for games, it can get pretty wild there.
author: Julia Q.

description:
My friends and I came here on a Thursday night around 10PM after the CAS Holiday Bazaar Nightlife, hoping to grab a few drinks and burritos/tacos to fill our appetites. Unfortunately, the only thing that filled us was frustration up to our throats. Let me count the ways... 

1. Lack of organization - With 5 people at our table, they managed to mix up my friend's order of a chicken San Diego burrito (she received beef instead) and serve our two other friends' meals to the wrong customers. Fortunately, they made corrections to our bill and apologized for their honest mistakes. Their ordering/ticketing system could use steep improvement!

2. Underwhelming food - The San Diego carne asada burrito had a paltry amount of meat compared to the countless burritos served in SD. It was more like a sandwich than a burrito. The guacamole sat on top of a spoonful of over-salted steak, and at the bottom was a pool of thick red sauce that oozed out of the tortilla into a messy pile. Thankfully, they had napkins at the table. Overall, the food was only passable as a late night snack to hold over a famished person with low standards. Call me a burrito snob, but I have higher expectations at a 4-star-Yelp-rated restaurant.

3. Terrible service - A sandy blonde waitress wearing thigh-baring black shorts and fishnet stockings (talk about professional attire) took our orders and was blatantly inattentive after she realized two guys at our table had opened tabs at the bar. She informed us that the picnic table where we were seated was for "dinner service only." Apparently, five people ordering food from the dinner menu wasn't enough to qualify us for "dinner service." Then she proceeded to ignore us for the rest of the evening. After closing their tabs at the bar, my friends were hoping to order more drinks at our table. The waitress stood staring at her cash register for next 20-30 minutes, snubbing customers, completely oblivious to our attempts to flag her down. She even walked over to clear the table next to us and deliberately disregarded our polite requests for water and our questions about the bill. Maybe she was sight/hearing impaired, having a bad day, or just plain rude. We will never know, because we're not coming back here again (sober)...
author: Tina C.

description:
A solid 3.5 but I'll give a 4. This place reminds me of some of the beach bars/restaurants in San Diego's PB but with a slightly less bro-dude element. A little confusing at first because it's a "sit anywhere you like" type of establishment but around 1 on a Saturday we found the end of large picnic table to share with a pair of strangers.
Extra $1.50 for chips and salsa but SO worth it. Fresh and warm chips and salsa full of flavor. I just wish they put the salsa on the side-the chips on the bottom got soggy and I hate wet food :(
My boyfriend ordered the chicken tacos and I got the veggie burrito. Everything was served up quickly and seemed to have fresh ingredients. Cheapish and not overly greasy-it was a great experience overall. Friendly place, nice servers-I'd go back if I found myself in the area again-I can see it being a solid go-to neighborhood spot.
author: Jennifer N.

description: Try their tacos! I've tried nick's way and the fish tacos. It's delicious. They also have arcade games like street fighter! The bar tender is always friendly. Their chips and salsa is a nice cheap snack with your margaritas as well.
author: Pam Y.

description:
My buddy lives just down the street from where I'm staying and insisted that we meet up for a beer to catch up.  There wasn't very many places open so late at night so we ducked into Underdog's for a brewski.

I tried to order a snakebite, but unfortunately the bar only had cider in the bottle.  Not wanting to have to buy both beers and building my own, I opted for just the cider.  As expected, it was as good as you would expect, a feat that the bar itself had nothing to do with.  While we didn't order any food, we were served some warm chips and salsa with our beers.  I liked that the chips were warm, but didn't like that the waitress had dumped the salsa on top of the chips and making them soggy to eat.

As a place to kick back and enjoy a beer, Underdog's is pretty good.  It's definitely a dive, but if you want to go to a place that's unpretentious and gets the job done, this place is as good as any.

Food: 6/10

Service: 6/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 6/10
author: Joe M.

description: Just moved to the neighborhood a couple months ago and so far, this is my favorite place. Their street tacos are delicious and you can't go wrong with either the carne, pollo, or carnitas. Order them "Nicks way" and prepare for a foodgasm. Also, the interior is very friendly as are the bartenders. Good beers on tap, TVs with the game on, etc. Go here and spend all of your money.
author: Nick F.

description:
Love this place! I always go on Tuesdays. The downside is that it is usually really crowded and you might have to share a table with others if you have a small group. They have $1 street tacos that are small, but delicious as well as $2 Tecate. They do charge for chips and salsa, which I usually don't like, but it's worth ordering because of the salsa(s) they have on each table; one red and one green. House-made, AMAZING! They even sell it by the bottle at the bar ($5). 

I do wish they would have better prices on tacos "Nick's Way" on Tuesday like at Rouge/Nick's Crispy Tacos. They have lots of TVs and sports memorabilia all over the place too, great place to watch a game! They also have a fun arcade style basketball game that we always play when we go.

Staff is usually always friendly and overall a fun time if you don't have to wait too long for a table!
author: Brendon N.

description:
damn, this is my favorite spot in the Sunset. I love the food and beer here so much, I find myself rooting against the Giants, hoping they will have a bad/short season and the Taco Shop will be less crowded when I just want to get some dinner and beer. 

I typically go for the Carnitas Nick's Way Tacos and Drakes 1500 beer, but the quesadilla's, nachos and guacamole are also delicious.
author: Aaron S.

description: Food was cold. The coffee was stale and the music was way too loud. Also the staff was ignoring me and seemed like they wanted a tip afterwards , which they didn't get because the food was cold, come on. Bare minimum. Came in midday 02/01/2016. When I came in the first time months ago my burrito was hot and good
author: Tracey H.

description:
Finally got a chance to try this place considering I live a few blocks away. I've tried to go before, but it's always so crowded, which is normal with bars in SF. I just don't have the patience to battle with other people for a table and the bartender's attention.

Came for a slightly early dinner on a Sunday and had no wait. I thought the food was delicious. I ordered a Shrimp Taco done Nick's Way and Elote and it was so good. Oddly, the corn kind of outshone the rest of the food my friend's and I had ordered, but, then again, how good is corn smothered in butter and cheese, ammiright? The salad and burrito that my friends got looked good, but I still think it's all about their tacos and elote.

The atmosphere is cute and kind of funny (like a sports bar crashed into a Mexican restaurant) and they have a couple of games that were fun to watch other people play. (people were seriously good at the basketball one)

the minus star comes from the service. It was pretty fast, but the girl didn't talk to us even when we ordered. She just looked at us until we spoke, didn't greet us at all, and, frankly, just looked super bored and disinterested. She also would forget that we had asked for water, etc. There was another server that was super friendly though and brought us water even though we weren't in his section.

So, I would definitely go back and really want to try their awesome happy hour/Taco Tuesday deals and hopefully I won't get the same waitress.

Pro tip: my roommate always just orders the food for takeout if you're not there to drink and it's crowded.
author: Christina R.

description: Short blue haired bar tender was extremely rude and disrespectful to customers! Ruined the day
author: Adam D.

description:
This place serves up some bomb ass tacos! These babies are huge too! I was full after scarfing down two fish tacos. I got one baja fish taco and one grilled fish taco, both Nick's way which adds the good stuff like salsa and guacamole. I would definitely recommend getting this option.

The place was pretty busy when we went for dinner on a weekend. Luckily, we found some large benches in the back to seat our party of seven. I can imagine it gets pretty packed when there's a game on.
author: Kevin N.

description: Best Mexican food that I've had. Quality meat and lots of guacamole!!! I had Quesadilla and my boyfriend had mission style Burrito! Both of them were amazing.
author: Nahal S.

description:
Favorite fish taco place.  
I always enjoy going here for big games as they have TVs all around the bar.
But don't go, it'll take longer for me to find a seat! :)
author: Heidy S.

description:
Not that impressed, I've been a fan of Nick's Crispy Taco's in Nob Hill for a couple years, and haven't looked back. What brought me here was a friends birthday evening, sharing beers, shots, nachos, and quesadilla's. From what I all munched on. The food wasn't that impressive.

One great thing that caught my attention, was the basketball hop in the back corner. My boyfriend was all over that, and could keep him in there for hours. But note: There was some hustlers posting next to it that do have a good shot. If you play, expect to go one-on-one for shots. My boyfriend and friend did, and luckily, they won and played for shots - but didn't bother to collect their shorts from these boys...
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Came here for the homegirl's birthday...since the front porch couldn't take a group of 7 immediately at 8pm. 

As I walked in, you can tell at this point I was getting hungry and thirsty and the underground hip hop was glaring into my eardrums giving me a little bit of a headache. Took us about 6 to 10 minutes to find a bench in the back to rest our asses on. 

The birthday girl informed us all that we needed to get was nick's style tacos errthing. These aren't your typical street tacos let me just warn you. If you order more than 2 you  must have a huuge appetite or you don't know what nick's style is exactly.

My conclusion is that nick's style is a soft taco with also a hard shell very similar to a gordita from taco bell. lol The baja and the carne asada nick's style taco were both bomb! They were also easy on the wallet. This is a good spot to take a bunch of friends for some cheap eats and some drinks. oh yea the margarita's were muy delicioso as well!
author: Mike P.

description:
Love the food here, but they have a really strict "no outside food/drink policy". I placed an order to go and I sat outside with my Starbucks coffee. They told me I couldn't bring my coffee inside when I walked  back in to pick up my food and pay, and made me leave the coffee outside. 

They also have a bad habit of not hanging up the phone, so good luck trying to place an order over the phone.
author: Amanda H.

description:
Carne asada taco, Nick's Way, drenched in a special red sauce? Delicious! I have come here numerous times and it never fails, the tacos are always excellent! My favorite thing about these tacos are that they are filled with fresh salsa and guacamole! The best part is that it doesn't fall apart in your hands! They wrap it perfectly so the taco can easily be held even though it is so big that it's hard to fit into your mouth! These tacos are a must-have!

Might I add that I got a taco to-go so I could eat it after a long night clubbing. It's great for drunk munchies. Even after it's been refrigerated and eaten cold, it's still scrumptious!!
author: Britney L.

description:
All I have to say is get your tacos "Nick's way", you won't be disappointed. You get a crispy grilled corn tortilla on the inside and a soft tortilla on the outside. I have only tried the fish and the carnitas, but the fish is amazing hands down. I got an order of their nachos and I was not disappointed either.

Ever since I have had them I have been thinking about them none stop. I even had a dream about them, and let me say, even in my dreams they were good. 5 dollars for a taco might seem expensive, but it will be worth it.

The place is small, so you should come early, otherwise you'll have to wait for a while.
author: David C.

description:
This place has BOMB tacos! The flavor is on point but today I was a little disappointed because my nachos were everything but satisfied. I tried online ordering for the first time and got the Baja tacos which were amazing per usual. But I also got an order of nachos and there was no guac, no sour cream, and no salsa.... So basically I just got a bunch of chips with some melted cheese and slices of jalapeño. 

The food is great and I will most likely be back but... How do you forget all the key ingredients?
author: Lauren S.

description:
This place is a solid 4 stars. I get my haircut up the street and usually treat myself to some tasty tacos here when I'm done.

The beers always flow here and the service is usually spot on. The only thing I'd like is to spice the meats a little more so I don't have use so much of the sauce on the counter.
author: Art O.

description: Great tacos!! The nick's way taco's are the way to go. Also, ordering just two tacos is plenty of food secondary to the shells being packed to the brim with deliciousness! Ask for the habanero sauce for a flash of awesome flavor and heat !! The fish tacos are my favorite :)
author: Stewart D.

description:
First off- the food here is fantastic. I am a fish taco expert and these guys just do it right. Get a couple of "Baja style" and make it nicks way, you will not be disappointed. 

Food comes relatively quick most of the time, I would not recommend coming after 6 on any day if you are planning on sitting at a table (picnic table). The vibe here is probably the most hip and cool in all the sunset. 

Now comes the waiters- most, not all, but most are some of the most arrogant, disgustingly hipster people (and I don't throw hipster around lightly) I have ever seen. While this doesn't take away from the stars, because I'm judging food and prices, it can get a little annoying. Shout out to the Asian waiter, definitely the star of the show and I've been coming here weekly for 1 year. Watch out for the short philipina girl- she sucks and is usually a B. 

Hate to end on a bad note so I just want to reiterate: YOU SHOULD DEFINITELY COME TO EAT HERE. avoid on big game days or taco Tuesday, it just get to crowded. Lunch for me is the best. 

Cheers
author: Nick O.

description: First time here. The quesadilla was delicious and very filling. Very loud though more of a bar atmosphere than a restaurant.
author: Kavion M.

description: This place has an interesting vibe. It's a sports bar that serves Mexican street style food while playing hip hop music in the background. The food is good and the service was great. Best of all, this place is very cheap compared to places around it.
author: Sammy S.

description:
It's been a week, and Caro S. and I are still talking about The Taco Shop At Underdog's. We visited last Saturday, and got a table near the front. 

We started with an order of the chips and salsa. The chips are definitely made in house, are thick and crispy, and the pico de gallo is actually poured over them. They were SO good we may have ordered a second basket (sidenote- chips and salsa cost $2.50, but they're definitely worth it).

For our entries, I ordered the carne asada "street" tacos, which comes with 3. The carne asada was so flavorful and tender. And enough meat to fill all 6 tortillas. Not bad for $7.25. Caro ordered a fish and a carne asada taco, made "Nick's Style." That means that your corn tortilla is wrapped in a flour tortilla, and that you also get cheese, beans, pico de gallo and guacamole. Well played, Nick. The carne asada Nick's taco was SO good, I'll definitely be ordering mine that way next time. And there will be a next time.
author: Jessica H.

description:
This place was nice. menu was good. food was alright. However, I did have to wait a while for the food. I understand it's a bar, but still...

Not only that, I waited for a while sitting there and found out the food was ready all along, but no one noticed it enough to give the order to me.
author: Joey T.

description: This is a really cool "dive". Great little bar, with lots of screens to catch a game. They cover almost all sports - from Baseball, basketball and football, to tennis and soccer. What makes this place really stand out is that they have surprisingly good food. You wouldn't think that a small dive like this would, but you'd be wrong. Make sure the first think you eat is the Baja Fish Taco...and make sure you get it "Nick's Way". Then make sure you thank me after! Haha ;)
author: Tom M.

description:
I'm a total fan of Underdogs for their tacos Nick's way but felt compelled to leave this review because of our experience this past Saturday 4/14. In short, the service was god awful.
- The bar wasn't terribly busy and we were able to be seated pretty quickly. Things started off well because a guy who was previously at our table started bussing it (he didn't introduce himself but it appeared that he worked there and had a vested interest in making sure we were happy -- maybe a manager?)
- Our orders were taken quickly and efficiently. No complaints there.
- Our drinks arrived in short order.
- 4 out of 5 of our orders arrived without any fuss.

This is when the annoyances began.
- 5 minutes went by and my order (a straight up Baja Fish Taco Nicks way -- no customizations) didn't arrive.
- After 10 minutes, I had to flag down someone and ask about my taco. There was no apology about missing the order; the waitress just went over and "checked up" on our order.
- Since we were in the back, I could see the kitchen's output counter. Five minutes later, my taco showed up. 
- NONE of the waitstaff bothered to check the kitchen counter while food piled up; after the kitchen rang their "ready" bell TWICE, I had enough and went to get my own taco. I specifically recall their being 3-4 meals stacked up besides my own.
- In the meantime, noone bothered to refill our water or generally check up on us.

- Now, I could forgive all of this for wait staff having a bad day but the next issue merited this review. A second waitress came up and introduced herself as our replacement waitress. Smooth move on their part as we had no reason to be annoyed with this second waitress. 

When we got the bill, they had automatically put an 18% tip -- even though their menu clearly stated that was only for parties of 6 or more (we had 5 ppl).

That's total BS.

I complained that this wasn't right and they changed my bill without further comment. We still left a tip (but certainly not 18%). 

Just in case you think we were just being "difficult customers": on the way out I had a chat with two guys who had stepped out of the bar for a smoke after they had finished a drink. They too were experiencing really shoddy service that day and claimed to have waited 40 min for their tacos.

Lesson Learned: sit at the bar. From previous visits, the bartenders have always been friendly and its harder to ignore you when you are right there in their face.

Bottom Line: The tacos are always great and the kitchen staff was apologetic. The two waitresses though either need additional assistance or retraining. 
-g
author: Gunn S.

description:
I was in the neighborhood after touristing the city for a day. This place is a great environment to catch the game! 

I ordered the carne asada taco nick's way. Order it nick's way! It's both hard and soft shell taco. The meat was nice and tender. There were plenty hot sauces to put on the taco, I counted at least 3. Now that football season is coming to an end, I'm sure the cheers and high fives will be for other sports like NBA and Baseball. I will miss you football season :(
author: Kevin C.

description: Love Underdogs! The staff is amazing and so friendly! They all work together to take good care of you. Go Blue!!
author: Julia D.

description:
This place really struck me by surprise. Usually when I think of a sports bar, I think of a kind of dirty joint with typical mediocre American food. I came here with a bunch of friends to watch the last game of the NBA playoffs (Go Mavs!) and the place was jam packed, but luckily we were able to swoop quickly on a table. 

MUST try their tacos!!! The tacos had a soft inner flour tortilla and a crunchy tortilla on the outside, and the meat and guacamole they give you come in generous amounts. Their quesadillas were also really good, kind of similar to El Farolito's quesadilla for those of you who know what I'm talking about. 

All, in all, I had an awesome experience here with my friends  Great food, decent prices, and good beer? I'm in!
author: Angela K.

description:
Super disappointed with this place. I rarely write bad reviews, but this will have to be an exception. Stopped by here on Tuesday night, not crazy busy, but was able to get a couple of seats at the bar. The bartender didn't really acknowledge us for a while, but she did finally come by and when we asked what the specials were she just seemed irritated right off the bat. 

We ended up ordering the Nick's special tacos... a margarita and beer/shot combo. The drinks were served in a relatively quick manner, and the food took a while longer. No big deal. Once the food arrived though, we were both disappointed... the carne asada in my taco was cold, merely warmed up slightly by the heat of the inner fried tortilla. The tortillas on the second fish taco were mealy, like barely steamed. When the bartender paused the conversation she was having with a patron next to us, we mentioned the food was cold she became completely inattentive and down right rude. When the second beer/shot combo was ordered, she only brought the beer and again seemed bothered when she was asked to bring the shot that she forgot. 

I was disappointed since I had heard a lot of good things about the food here. But even if it was on off night for the kitchen, passive aggressiveness and rudeness is never acceptable. I'll take my dollars elsewhere.
author: Amanda F.

description:
My first impression of The Taco Shop was walking by it once and noticing how BUSY it was!  My friends and I then made it a goal to try this place at least once, and we were not disappointed!

The ambiance of The Taco Shop is very "sports-bar".  There are flags of almost every Bay Area team within every sport hung up on the wall.  There are about 2 TVs, and also an arcade basketball game chilling in the back!  The noise level is pretty loud, but I didn't expect much else seeing that is a sports bar.  The place itself is pretty small... Besides the bar, there are few tables lined up along the side, and a couple larger tables in the back.  I personally have never had too much trouble finding seats, but on a really crowded night I could see it being a bit of an issue.

As for food, their chips and salsa are super good. I'm huge fan of pico de gallo, so I order the chips & salsa every time I come here.  My go-to meal at the Taco Shop is the Fish Tacos - Nick's Way.  The fish tacos are great! The fish is fresh, lots of salsa and lime, and I can't forget that good guacamole! I recommend those tacos to any friend I take here.  Along with that, I have tired their carne asada street tacos, and those were pretty on point as well.

For alcohol, I felt that the prices were pretty decent.  My friends and I usually get a pitcher of whatever is on tap, which works out the best for us.  I have been here only once for happy hour, but from what I remember they had a good deal on margaritas (and I think $2 tacos as well), so I will definitely be trying that out next time!
author: Megan K.

description:
Heard great things about Nick's crispy tacos.  So, there was bad traffic with the Bay Bridge closure so I decided to kill some time and check out this joint as it's close to the commute line.

Checked out the carnitas taco, Nick's style - I think Nick is my new favorite person......the carnitas was crispy and creamy, so much flavor.  The taco alone was stellar, not a new concept of putting a fried tortilla with a warm flour toritlla, but they make it awesome here.  Loads of guac in that taco as well. 

Then followed that up with a carnitas burrito, California style.  New thing to have fries in your burrito, but I've had many cuban burritos in the past with potatoes in them, so...why not?  Still unclear why fries make a burrito "California", but......it rocked!  Again, the carnitas was ridiculously good and the fries stayed crispy.  Could have used a bit of a kick inside, but the flavors were sooooo good all around.  

The side sauces in the bottles on the bar were both flavor packed and well balanced.  I think I went through at least a quarter bottle between the two.    

I rolled out (literally) with a huge smile.  This place totally lived up to the hype.

Thank you Nick and staff.  F'n Awesome!
author: Dan W.

description: Had the BEST experience here! From the moment we walked in with our 3 kiddos, the staff was super friendly & attentive. (Seriously, might have been the most accommodating dining experience I've had with my kids in SF...no joke)  The food was fabulous (chips & guac, tacos, burrito, nachos & soup), the margaritas & drafts were delicious and bonus for not having to trek all the way to Polk Street for a 'Nick's Way' taco!
author: Leah M.

description:
I'm a huge taco snob, so when I heard about a new place right off the Park, I was skeptical, but I'm glad I went. Underdog's is a sports bar off 19th Ave great for watching any local games (or Michigan games, apparently), but the tacos I ordered were stuffed fatter than most any other I'd ever ordered.

They're a little pricey at $4.50 a piece (if you get them "Nick's Way", but I think they start at either $3.50 or $3.95 without), but they're packed with pico and so much guacamole I was worried I would turn my whole face green. (But not so worried that I didn't dive in anyway.) The carnitas might have been my favorite, but the fish tacos were definitely worth it too.

If you find yourself in the Inner Sunset, with no time to make it to the Mission, and you're craving a taco fix, check out the Taco Shop!
author: Kevin B.

description: Strong happy hour margaritas and cheap, delicious tacos on Tuesday. My friend is a vegetarian and she said the veggie tacos (beans and corn) were the bomb.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
The nick's way tacos here are nothing short of amazing. I have came here for the 2nd time and it was just as good as I remember. I got the carne asada nicks way taco and the shrimp nicks way taco. The smoky like chipotle sauce they have on the table goes fantastic with these. Its about 5 bucks a taco which at first you might be like "what?!" but when you get your food, you'll realize the price is pretty reasonable for the size taco you get. Everything is fresh and the staff is friendly and able to handle the crowded and busy environment as well. The only thing I don't like about this place is that you have to wait since it's always crowded no matter what day you come. But the wait is very well worth it! Wish this place was bigger lol. You have to sit literally at the same table and next to people but they don't bite so who cares? The food came out super quick which I was happy about. They also have a full bar and have little old school games on some of the front tables which is kinda dope. 
Entertaining restaurant overall. You just have to check this place out. It'll be well worth it.
author: Andrea M.

description:
The tacos Nick's Way are EPIC. I want them in and around my mouth at all times. The guacamole is fucking delicious. The margaritas are STRONG, especially for the price ($28 for a big pitcher and my boyfriend and I were both sauced at the end...bravo, guys). But mostly those tacos. They took forever to come out but once they did they were well worth the wait. 

I will say that the organization at this place is non-existent. We walked in around 2 on a Saturday and it was packed but we couldn't find a host/hostess. There's no sign indicating the apparent sign-up-with-a-server system and everybody was dashing around haphazardly so I didn't want to bug them. We managed to snag a table without getting yelled at, though, so maybe nobody else was on the waiting list. They forgot our order of chips/salsa/guac, which was disappointing since we'd been walking around for 4 hours and were starving and looking forward to an appetizer. But when they did bring it out (with the rest of the food, after being reminded) it was huge. 

Normally I don't give good reviews for places that have mediocre service and are this disorganized, but the food, margaritas, and reasonable prices won me over. I'd go back for sure.
author: Dani W.

description:
The Taco Shop was busy as we came for dinner right after happy hour had ended. Our "table" was a table pacman video game, which was awesome! 

We started with the chips and salsa. The chips were homemade, crispy and crunchy. I got the nick's way taco, vegetarian, and it was delicious. The combination of the crunchy homemade shell and the soft tortilla was different and exciting. I also got the corn on the cob which was a bit too spicy for me but overall very tasty. 

Excited to be back for more tacos! Especially during happy hour.
author: Nicole S.

description: Cool little place. Not very big. We came in on a Sunday afternoon. They had the football game up, so we almost didn't find a seat. We were quickly greeted and got drinks within less than a minute. By recommendation I ordered the elote con queso and the nicks way carne asada. I don't do well with spice but the corn was soooo good I couldn't stop. My lips were on fire by the end but who cares. Taco was amazing! Good service. Good food. Chill spot.
author: Yasmine M.

description: Soo, good.  Soo, good.  Everything is good.  Carnitas, check.  Bean and cheese burrito, check.  Tortilla soup, check.  Salsas, check.  Dos X Lager on tap, check.  All of which you would expect but, the chicken wings...CHECK! Soo good.   At a Mexican place, chicken wings, who knew? Best I have ever had.  True story
author: Tara W.

description:
BEST TACOS EVER.
Thinking about these tacos and reliving the moment I ate these tacos makes me want more! I had yelped "tacos" in SF and this location popped up. I asked my gf about this place and she said its pretty bomb. I came here last Thursday and was going to go in a big group, but things didn't follow through so my boyfriend and I decided to just go. This place is a taco place/sports bar. 

When we first got here it was super packed! There was no where to sit! You pretty much seat yourselves and then just order. We shared a table with this sweet family. Get the "Choose Two" tacos for $8.50. It's a better deal if you don't come during the 4-6 pm happy hour from Mondays-Fridays OR the $2 Taco Tuesdays. (btw I wanna come back during these deals). 

My two taco choices were the "Carne Asada Taco" & the "Pescado 'Baja' Style Taco". So satisfied with what I ordered!!!! The tacos were so CRISPY and BIG!! They put a scoop-like amount of guacamole on my tacos and I absolutely love avocados. My carne asada was cooked to perfection and complemented so well with the crispness of the taco. The beer battered fish was really fresh. I like the fact that the  tacos come with a crispy tostada like shell and the corn flour tortilla. Extra flavor! 

Since this place was pretty packed with regular priced tacos, I'm trying to imagine this place on Taco Tuesdays....It's probably worse! Also out of curiosity, is this place similar to Nick's Crispy Tacos?!
author: Katrina T.

description: It's unfair for the rest of the world that I live close enough to get Taco Shop for take-out.  Deal with it.  I've been too afraid to get it Nick's Way to go, so I generally get the burritos.  The fish burrito and carne asada Mission burrito are my faves.  The bar itself is lively and really fun.  Chips and salsa are bomb, too.  Perfecto.
author: Ronald T.

description:
3 stars for the food (kind of on the weaker side in terms of taste), but the full bar and service bump this up to a 4.5!

At least half a dozen HDTV's to watch the game (Giants prioritized, but they will flip the channel only if you're okay with it), great deals, and a full bar.

You see all sorts of people here ranging from sportsfans up in the barfront, students with backpacks and laptops on the nearby side tables, families with kids sitting on the diing tables towards the back.  and you've got a full bar!

taco tuesdays are packed and the guacamole here is pretty good! did i also mention there is a full bar?

had a hefe, house margarita, a carnitas taco, grilled fish taco, chips with salsa and guac for 25 bucks pre-tax.

awesome place, highly recommended.
author: Christopher N.

description:
The tacos are SO good.  Last time I was there I had the regular tacos, comes with carnitas, carne asada, and pollo.  They were surprisingly filling and so good with the two sauces they give you.

And what's not to like about $1 Margaritas from 6-630pm?
author: Liz W.

description:
FISH TACO, NICK'S WAY - AHHHHHHH.  It was absolutely delicious.  All the ingredients were well-proportioned.

Seems like a great place if you want to catch a game and eat some delicious food.  Can get crowded quickly, so if you have a large group, you may have to be prepared to wait.
author: Can C.

description:
This place is ok
Nothing really special about it. Happy hour is weak, one beer in the cane LOL on happy hour
author: Lally S.

description:
I've been back twice recently and the tacos are delicious again. Their salsa is delicious and the spicy sauce for the tacos is incredible.

Plus, it looks as though they added more tables to the back which is nice. Oh yeah, and a list of tequillas to try. Now all they need is a tequilla sampler to make my day!
author: Audrey H.

description: fish tacos are popular here and are good but they also serve one of the best elotes ive had. im always looking for elote on a menu but this place has surprisingly nailed em!
author: Sarina A.

description: The food is amazing, best quesadilla you can found in sf at a bar, they have tv's everywhere and a cool basketball hoop game, I'm knocking down a star for not having tv sound on important games and another star knock down for drinks, although they have variety of spirits but not great drinks!
author: Mony K.

description:
I love you baja style fish tacos Nick's way! 

 I love our Monday girls nights here. I love the buzz in bar, great mood and energy. The food is what brings me back every time and the service is solid.
author: Jade W.

description:
First off: We brought a baby. to the bar.

Classic. 

Second: damn good tacos. Soft-crispy tacos, filled with perfectly seasoned tender carnitas, overstuffed with guacamole and salsa. There was just the right amount of sourness from the lime that gave it such fresh taste. 

Third: damn STRONG margaritas. Yeah, the 50 cent margaritas that they serve in cups that's about the size of a dixie cup from your office's water cooler. Don't underestimate them strong 'Ritas.

My only gripe was the waitress/bartender who must have passed us SIX times but didn't even ask if we ordered or not. You just have to FLAG her down. Like, twice.

I take it she has bad peripheral vision?
author: Janice C.

description:
Make sure to get your tacos Nick's way, because that just adds a ton of flavour on top, though I'm always bias towards guacamole. The fish tacos were very nice and definitely more flavourful than the chicken and carnitas, however, I felt that both the tortilla chips that we ordered and the crunchy inside taco shell (for Nick's way) were stale so that took away from the experience. Also, it seemed somewhat inconsistent where another member of our party and I got the same taco but hers had a little bit of spicy sauce mixed in whereas mine didn't (didn't realize until I tried hers after finishing all of mine.)

Service was quick and very pleasant, and the location has a great sporty ambiance, great for a quick meal or even to just sit at the bar. Overall, definitely still worth going to.
author: Landon E.

description:
Went in twice so far. First time, I made the mistake of asking for "spicy salsa" on my California burrito. I have no idea what happened, but it tasted like the beef was marinated in capsaicin crystals. I couldn't finish it, even after generous helpings of milk at home.

The second time, I made the right call and we kept the spicy out of it. Tasted perfectly fine, but unfortunately not too memorably delicious. I'll probably give it another go later, but for now it hasn't made a mark.
author: Richard K.

description: I've never had a bad meal or drink here. Love the casual atmosphere. Their Sangria is fabulous on a hot day too. Baja Tacos Nicks Way are the best!
author: Amy L.

description: It's super casual reasonably priced and the food was great. We had fish tacos, carne Assad tacos, and elote. Their Sangria wasn't great but the food, service, and prices more than made up for it. I wish we had a place like this at home.
author: Yadira i.

description:
Came here for Taco Tuesdays - but Nick's Way is the only way to go, and those aren't part of the deal, so I would highly recommend coming on a day when the servers aren't b*tchy and elitist. 

Service was so rude it's enough for me to be turned off from this place forever. My friend gave her NY ID to the guy at the door, and the first thing he said was, "You're kidding me right?" (implying that it was a fake and it wasn't) -- my friend got annoyed and pulled out her wallet, getting to ready show him all her school IDs, credit cards, etc and he waved her off without even giving her eye contact saying, "I don't know I've never seen one before. Whatever. I don't care. Just give me your hand." 

So many problems with that statement. A). How are you the doorman if you can't tell a real ID from a fake one/never seen IDs from a different state before? b). Letting the person in when you aren't even sure C). Also explains why I saw him checking out a tiny blonde girl who looks like she's 16. 

The Mexican street style tacos aren't good at all, which makes me wonder if Nick's Way is only good because of all the additives are hiding the actual taste. Although I have tried their Fish Tacos before and those are amazing. So it really wasn't A-okay, and with the attitude-filled personnel... meh. 

Salsa and chips were good though. Granted, we were starving.
author: Christal Y.

description: I had 2 of the tacos nick's way. Carne asada and carnitas. They were both fantastic and the chips were great. I don't know why there are some negative reviews but ignore them and try it out for yourself!
author: Tyler T.

description: the rebuttal, and now the rebuke ... the patron's response to the owner's retort... well if in 2009 that was not enough and the updated almost verbatim experience did not teach or at least alert you that hey, maybe this guy has something to say, then i fall on my sword ...you lucky i care enough about my craft and my lifelong service to my customers that your staff has failed in seven years to change, then you will never ever (thank you taylor swift) my billable is $75/hr ... done!
author: tim y.

description:
I didn't know there was such good fexican (fake Mexican) food in the Sunset! Super good.

Get a Nick's Way, it's a must. Also, I think their chips and salsa are probably one of the best things in the whole world. Non-stop flow of chips! Salsa tubes on the table! A person can dream and they'd dream of this!

Ordered takeout once and got a normal burrito. This is what lowered it by one star. The burritos are just not nearly as good as Nick's Way! Believe me!
author: Carleen W.

description:
This joint is my go to Sunday morning pre-work hangover let's watch some f@#@#n football stop. Their breakfast burrito with bacon is one of the most solid breakfast burritos in the city and they have blue bottle coffee to cater to my more bourgeois tendencies.

I've actually yet to have a beer here but once my work hours get late this will be my monday night football spot.
author: Misha T.

description: This place is great for groups.  I've come here with classmates and we just take over the picnic tables in the back.  It has a relaxing atmosphere and the waiter service has very good communication skills.  I suggest being like me by coming with friends and enjoying a good time.  Don't forget to grab a pint.  I hope to visit again.
author: John P.

description:
The tacos are great. 
The drinks are good. 
The customer service bad. 
The burritos are sad excuses for burritos. 
If you want delicious tacos and something to drink on come here. 
Also, If you want really skimpy, over priced, baby sized burritos and subpar service then come here as well.
author: Sam S.

description: I visited here for 7 days from minnesota. Was greeted by Liz when I came in and she took such good care of us. Recommended new food and the drinks were great. Kept everything smooth and was really personable. We came back then another 2 times on our trip here because of her and she remembered us! She is very resourceful and we will miss her so much. Highly recommend coming and asking for Liz.
author: Lincoln P.

description:
Coolest place to get tacos in SF. I am from San Diego and I felt right at home in this place.

The service is phenomenal and the tacos/ food are right up there with them. 
I got one beer battered shrimp taco and one grilled shrimp taco both with the guacamole and fixings. 

I would have to say I preferred the beer battered shrimp..my grilled shrimp felt a little charred but nevertheless it was delicious.
The sauce that comes with it is fantastic and famous too. 

So clean and ideal for those who want to relax and have a good time while eating tacos.

Would definitely go back...and plan to!!!
author: Annie C.

description:
I would never advise anyone to go here.  I was visiting my friends in CA in mid-April and this is what happened: 

First, they got my order wrong. I ordered online two veggie tacos for me and also a carne asada burrito for my friend. Arranged to have her pick up the order. They got it wrong, and gave us all veggie options.

Then, they were rude to her when she tried to correct them nicely. What happened to customer service and when the customer is always right?

Lastly, I had to veggie taco's "Nick's Way" which is a hard shell surrounded by a soft shell. The shells were both oily and chewy and gross, taking away the flavor of the rest of the taco. All I tasted was oil. As a vegetarian, I've had many a veggie taco and these were just gross. I'm from California and come home regularly and I know what good Mexican tastes like, and it's certainly not this place.
author: Jeremy R.

description: Great spot for tasty tacos! Had nachos and a Nick's style carne asada taco... both very delicious. Would be a great spot to watch a game and grab a drink as well. Parking on the weekend is best east of 19th avenue. Will definitely be back!
author: Josh L.

description: Yummy tacos. Chill sports bar with plenty of tvs if you want to watch a game. Happy hour 430 to 6pm during weekdays with $2 tacos.
author: Joe W.

description: Went here with some buddies of mine. We had a pitcher of margaritas.  They were excellent. My buddies had the tacos, which were also excellent. I had a burrito that was pretty good. The service was great. As soon as we put our menus down, they were there for our order. They made sure we had water. The only complaint was it was hard to find parking and a little bit of a wait for a table.
author: R J.

description:
I would've given Underdog's five stars had I written this before! I'm sorry it took so long!
I do not think I have ever left this place disappointed! 
I ALWAYS get tacos Nick's way and if I am feeling so crazy, I will also get tortilla soup!

Let me tell you......
Nick's way is the only way! One taco is enough to keep you full forever and you still never want it to end.  If you love avocado like I do which love is even an understatement, you will surely understand! Carnitas...always on POINT!

The tortilla soup, is tassstyy! And once again CHUNKS of avocado! The cheese is also melted in EVERYWHERE!

Let's not forget this is a bar....and I gave them five stars! 
Which means, you want to get what you pay for, so there better be tequila in your margarita?! Hellz yeah there will be! They seem pricey but it's always worth every penny.

I don't know if I should be proud to say, I even came here two days in row.....
author: Jessica S.

description: Delicious Tacos, good cheap drinks, wonderful service, and generally a great environment! One of my favorite places to come for Taco Tuesday Nights with a group of friends. Unfortunately you can't make reservations and it gets quite packed, but for the vibe you get and the excellent food, it's totally worth every second, it certainly helps to get a few drinks in while you wait for a table. If I'm not here at least once a month, I've probably done something wrong!
author: Joshua S.

description:
Young crowd, cool bartenders/waiters, and Lagunitas IPA on tap. For a Saturday night, this place wasn't very crowded and even the bartenders said so. My friend came to visit me at my new place and we decided to scope out the area. After grabbing some dinner at Kevin's Noodle House, we wanted to grab some drinks. It was between this place and Chug Pub, but after taking a look at the crowd, we opted for this place. 

After taking a seat at a table, we were greeted by one of the waitresses/bartenders and she took our drink order. She asked if we wanted any food, but we had just eaten dinner. I ordered up a Heff and my friend got the Lagunitas IPA. I'm a light-weight and since I'm out of practice, I get that lovely asian glow really easily. I'm pretty sure the waitress was worried about me because she offered us up some waters and gave us some chips and salsa on her before I was even half way through my beer.

Either way, she was super nice and was cool with joking around with my friend and I who initiated a few coaster wars. The staff her are all really young, and you can tell they have fun at their job. This just might be my new local bar.

For those who want to watch the game, there's multiple TV's, but it's mostly college ball.
author: Leana L.

description: The Elote con Queso (Fresh corn on the cob brushed with lime salsa & dusted with cotija cheese & cayenne pepper) is a MUST! Kobe beef in a crispy tortilla Quesadilla was heavenly. Nick's way grilled fish tacos is a religious experience. We'll be back!
author: Dhar J.

description:
We're hungry and wanna go somewhere chill that we've never been before.  Thanks Yelp! Found The Taco Shop @ Underdog's! 

Chill sports bar atmosphere, Nick's tacos, stiff drinks, some good lookin waitresses, and local team love throughout.  What's there not to like?!

Nuff said...shortest review thus far! =)
author: Ninja H.

description:
fantastic bar for the locals in this area, but more importantly great Mexicali food. i had an amazing beer battered fish burrito. nope, not the fish tacos but the burrito. made with a good amount of fish, filled with coleslaw, i believe some red onions and a super tasty tarter-like sauce. also ordered fresh chips and salsa - a pico de gallo type of salsa, Mexican corn, one order of Nick's taco, and of course a beer. dinner came out to be $25 for two. great place for happy hour on Thursdays! 

next time when i feel like being completely guilty, i'd like to try their cheeseburger burrito: ground Kobe beef, cheese and french fries. sounds like a terrible heart attack. 

i'm a big fan of not-so-fancy local bars. if you're looking for something more snooty or whatever, this isn't the place for you.
author: Thao T.

description:
While the food is delicious, if you call ahead for takeout, they have a 50% chance of messing your order up, and there is a 100% chance that your order will take twice as long as they said it will, which is a dream come true when you're trying to run in to avoid looking for parking around here. Oh, it's going to be another 5  (read: 15) minutes? I'll just circle and cross my fingers. It's to the point that it's just not worth it. I used to live by the real Nick's and miss it dearly.

Got our food home tonight and they charged us 2.50 for chips and salsa and we found about 10 chips at the bottom of the bag and...no salsa.  So disappointed. What a waste of time and money.
author: Katie D.

description:
I tried the grilled corn and black bean salad on this trip. It was delicious. I enjoyed it much more than the taco on my prior visit.


We tried just the chips and salsa (no guac) the chips were good and piled with pico de gallo (chopped tomatoes, chillies,  and onions). It was good.

Service was good as well. Glad we gave it another try!
author: Zoe D.

description:
TV's are a plenty, with beer flowing and hot tacos coming out of the kitchen like hot cakes, this place is jamming.   
Get here early if you want to table at Happy Hour or get ready to swim in a sea of people.

  The tacos here are fantastic, and the chips and salsa make me want to wish I had a second stomach.  

So grab a few taco's, a beverage of your choice and chilaks.

Decor: 5
Food:4
Service: 4

Would I go back? You bet your pastrami I would!
author: Kelson H.

description:
This is my first Yelp review. Ever. 

After using Yelp for to decide where to eat practically every time I eat out, I have decided it's time to contribute. And I KNEW that The Taco Shop at Underdog's HAD to be the first place I reviewed. It would be wrong of me not to, considering how many times I've returned here.

Let me start off by saying that this place is AMAZING. That's not only referring to the food, but to the service and atmosphere too. It's a sports bar, with some arcade games lining the walls, and if you're a Giant's fan (who in SF isn't?), you'll definitely find yourself a home here. The wait staff and bartenders are super friendly, and the owner Nick is awesome too!

You MUST get the tacos here "Nick's Way." It comes served in a crispy taco on the inside, and a soft tortilla on the outside. And LOTS of delicious guac! The carne asada and pescado tacos are both tasty, and since I can never decided which of the two to get, I just let myself be greedy and order one of each.

And can I please just give a special shout out to that red sauce they serve?? It is seriously what dreams are made of! I would take a bottle of that stuff home with me and smother all my food with it if I could.

The carne asada quesadilla here is also top notch! They are MASSIVE, and they definitely do not skimp on the meat or the cheese. (On the downside, one time they did serve me my quesadilla a litlte bit burnt, and me being the timid little girl I am, I didn't ask for a new one.... but it was still yummy and didn't stop me from consuming the entire thing.)

Chips and salsa +/- guacamole? YES PLEASE. The tortilla chips are delicious, and they pile on the salsa and guacamole. And even if you somehow run out of the salsa, that red sauce is sitting right next to you and waiting to devoured.

My one gripe with the place? Taco Tuesdays here are just okay. You only get a deal on the street tacos ($1) and PBRs ($2), but Nick's way tacos are still regularly priced (~$6). But it's not enough to take away my 5-star rating.

It gets crowded, and seating can be a bit of a challenge, but it's definitely worth the wait. Parking around the area can be a bit of a pain as well, but it's not as bad as other parts of the city. 

Also, as a side note, Nick's Crispy Tacos off of Broadway also offers tacos "Nick's Way", but in my opinion, this location is MUCH better. Come here instead.

When I used to live in SF and first tried this place, I was instantly HOOKED. I used to come here at least once, if not twice, a week (I know, a bit much), and I would introduce anyone and everyone I knew to this little piece of heaven. Go here. Your stomach will be grateful.
author: Sally T.

description:
I had this intense thirst for tacos & burritos that urgently needed to be extinguished. I love Mexican food any day of the week but having it on Taco Tuesday is especially fun here in SF due to the multitude of restaurants & bars participating in drink & taco specials. 

Like many of their Taco Tueday rivals, The Taco Shop @ Underdogs is busy, but it's not the clusterfuck that those other places are. No stool at their extra long bar was available & the picnic tables in the back were full but we were able to grab the last open Pac Man "table." Awesome touch & good use of space.

The Foods:
- baja style fish taco (nick's way): good batter on the fish. Served in a crunchy taco *AND* a soft tortilla & topped with a hefty dose of guac. 
- carne asada California burrito: so disappointing. the french fries were more like just regular potatoes b/c they were not crispy & carne asada was chewy & not well seasoned. I don't recommend it at all. 
- $1 street taco: carnitas, carne asada & chicken: did not try, but looked smallish
- shrimp taco: did not try but my lovely companion said it was mostly slaw & the shrimp were super tiny. 
- strawberry agua fresca: thick, not that sweet, a real winner.
- chips & salsa:  addictive. we ordered 2 baskets at $1.50 each, so worth it. Thick cut chips & fresh pico de gallo.
- guacamole: they are generous with the portions but it is nothing special (no heat, no kick.) 

For under $30, we ate well. The waitresses checked to made sure our order was taken & was attentive to us throughout the meal. I would definitely come back for that huge fish taco & their chips & salsa. As for a good California burrito (burrito w/ fries inside), I guess I'll have to head south for that.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Visiting for the week in San Francisco and visited twice during my stay. Went with a bunch of friends. Everyone enjoyed their food. Burritos, nachos and street tacos were ordered. Great to see this place packed on a Wednesday night (got last 2 seats at the bar). Service was standard. Ambiance in the place is inviting. Would recommend to others.
author: Craig A.

description:
i arrived late at night one night 30 mins before closing. service was extremely rushed the food was sub par. I visit this place at a minimum 2 to 3 times a week and typically they are on point but unfortunately this experience made me never to return to this shit hole . First off the ordering was rushed and borderline ignored by the wait staff. the food arrived luke warm and we didn't receive silverware. fine and good it was closing time. when the check arrived the waitress was more interested in talking about bringing a bottle of wine to a party then taking care of our bill she walked by i showed her the check ready to go. this action made one of the bar tenders give us a look and say that we were rude. well i felt it was rude she didn't collect our check so we could be on our way to her party that was more important than collecting our check. so i gave her a tip and wrote a note on it stating "fucking hipsters" this Statement was in reference to the overal treatment we received like we are not good enough to be in this environment sorry im not cool enough for your restaurant.  all said and done i left smoked a cigarette outside where your bar tender decided to confront me stating he didn't say anything and that im crazy and imagining things  i replied i heard him state we were rude snd that was un called for. he continued to say I'm
