delusional and told me to leave the property i replied  stating this is a public side walk  and i can stand where i like. i also stayed i visit this restaurant 2 to 3 times a week and do not appreciate your treatment we stated i do not again calling me a liar. we left back inside the restaurant soon after i returned inside asked to speak to a manager where he quickly said he was in charge . explaining to him look i know your tired and trying to close but your behavior is un acceptable lets let bygones be bygones  and he stated what do you want.nin said an apology is acceptable enough and his reply was get the fuck out of my bar and never come back then the waitress came up saying i heard things and that is my own insecurity i guess in reference to my heavy stature. this was completely un acceptable behavior from any staff and they are lucky having grown up i. east Boston that side of my did not come out. food is good here but i guess they have enough business to not care about loyal customers and to belittle and berate them. im just not hipster enough for this place
author: T C.

description: Really good tacos! I come here pretty often and I love their Baja taco made Nick's Way, which is a hard taco wrapped in a soft taco. Eat it right when you get it because it might get cold/soggy. Fast, good service. Opens til midnight :)
author: Jacquelyn W.

description: A few coworkers and I stopped by here after a meeting on Taco Tuesday. Little did we know that Underdog was certainly the place to be. There wasn't an empty table anywhere not even at the bar. We put in a reservation for us and after an hour of seeing the mouth drooling tacos be delivered everywhere around us, we ordered to go and got our food all within 10-15 minutes. I'd give this place 5 stars if they had remembered our name was on the list and sat us  down. I watched three times as empty tables cleared big enough for all of us and other customers were given priority even though we had been there longer and had been first on the list. But what's really important is the tacos. I had the Chicken Taco Nick's way with chicken, guac, salsa and more. It was hands down the best taco I'd ever had. Here I am a day later, craving those tacos. I would have taken a picture but I was so enveloped eating it that I forgot. It's easy to see why this is the place to be on Tuesdays
author: Chandler K.

description:
LOVE this place. The veggie street tacos are delicious! Great place to hang out with friends and the happy hour menu is great! They also serve hard cider if you're gluten free. 

Mmm... tacos...
author: Wendy R.

description:
Nick, I don't know who you are but you know how to make a mean fish taco. I've been here a couple times and I always order the same thing:  beer, chips and guac, and the Pescado baja fish taco (nick's way of course). This isn't a measly little taco you would get at Rubio's, this taco will fill you up pretty good. 

If only I could say "I want it Nick's way" to everything in life and I automatically get crispy tortilla chips, a slab of guac and cheese, that would be AWWE-SOME.
author: Cindy A.

description:
I love Nick's crispy tacos!  They are a little pricey, but I love the combination of crunchy and soft texture of the two tortillas that are stuffed with all kinds of goodness!  Two of these tacos are enough to fill me up for lunch.  The Baja style fish taco is my favorite here, followed by the Carnitas.  

Bar style seating with some picnic style benches in the back if your group is a little bigger.  A nice place to eat a great taco and watch part of the game.  The service seemed to go a little slow for me, but if I can't have La Taqueria, this place will do just fine.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Really awesome food experience.  It's located in a shared space with a dive bar.  Which is actually quite a perfect complement.  Get a buzz, get hungry, eat.

I tried the fish tacos and carnitas.  Both were excellent.  Fish tacos was fried perfectly and had a nice crispy wet type batter that just melted in your mouth.  The fish was noticeably fresh.  This fish taco would rival that of any fish taco in Baja.  As for the carnitas it was delicious as well.  I wish it had a little bit more texture from having it fried on a flatop after the initial braise.  Aside from that small critique the seasoning was nuanced with the proper hint of marjoram and cilantro in the meat.  

Salsa and guacamole that adorned the tacos had a vibrant taste only found when it's newly and freshly made.  This place doesn't skim on the quality of ingredients.  

Good to hear that they source the meats from small local farms and the animals are naturally raised and not from factory based farms.
author: Stephen V.

description: Came here after a walk in Golden Gate park. Good tacos, full bar and a great playlist. Definitely recommend if you're in the neighborhood
author: M M.

description:
First time here and I thought the food was great!  Had wings, asada taco and asada nachos.
The place is clean and bright.

Parking was easy and not far away.  I will definately come back here.
author: Kenneth G.

description:
After recently moving to the Sunset I think I have found my new favorite restaurant. I usually get the San Francisco burrito and a margarita.
I have also tried the Nick's way tacos, which comes with one crunchy and one soft tortilla, and a large glob of guacamole.
The servers are usually very friendly, and are quick to take your order and deliver food.
Since it is a sports bar it can get busy at times.
They have large picnic benches in the back for large groups, as well as smaller two person tables.
author: Aniek V.

description: 5 stars for baja fish taco Nick's way and zero stars for the gross bathrooms. please comply with public health rules and provide toilet seat covers.
author: v. C.

description:
The Nick's way Tacos were amazing!!
The crispness of the fries were just right!
The tenderness of the meat was juicy!

but most of all the bottle of fire roasted tomatoes sauce was the best on everything!!!
author: Kayla S.

description:
I've never actually eaten here, so this is solely based on the food. I fell in love with Nick's crispy tacos a few years ago when I first had the pescado tacos at their original location in Nob Hill. I was so excited when I heard that Nick would be serving his tacos in my hood! 

Anyway, what I've learned from my girls at work is to always call in your order cause lunch time should be spent reading magazines in the office--and not spent waiting for our food to be made, no siree. So, always call ahead. Whenever I call from work for pick up, the food is usually ready in 15-20 minutes. 

The last time I was there, my friend and I wanted to dine-in instead, but the bar was so packed cause there was a Giants' game. So, what did we do? We walked over to the Starbucks around the corner and phoned in our order, haha. Trust me, if you had seen the crowd at Underdog's that evening, you would've done the same. Since I always get the fish tacos, I opted for the carnitas this time, and they were just as good. My friend says their carne asada tacos are good, too. We always get some chips & salsa to go with our meal. I've never had chips like these before; they're super crispy. I have a love-hate relationship with them. It really just depends on my mood, LOL. All in all, if you're in the neighborhood, stop by for some fish tacos from Nick's cause they are tha bomb!
author: Audrey T.

description:
We watched one of the NLCS games here and it was really fun! You're surrounded by lots of black and orange because tons of fans were here! My friends showed up early to grab a table. When I arrived (a little late), lots of people were just standing around because of lack of seats. I'm just glad we got seats! There's lots of TVs everywhere so you'll be able to watch from any seat. Seriously.

It was a Monday afternoon so there were $2 tecates until 6pm. 

I got a carne asada taco for $4 and it was good. It's a big taco but I wish I got another one because I got hungry an hour later. Also, it took a while to come out but what could I expect... there were tons of people crowded in there!
author: Connie Y.

description:
This place is packed all the time. 
The service is kinda crumby.
The bathrooms are disgusting.
The tables are huge so you have to share tables with other people.
Pretty expensive. 

Despite all these things, the place is a must go to. Because oh my god, the food is good. Anything and everything on the menu is 5 stars. The baja burrito is quite possibly the best thing I've ever tasted. I forced myself to eat the whole thing because i couldn't let it go to waste.
author: Jamie P.

description: Love love love the food here, it continues to be amazing.  The staff is really nice and manages to take care of everyone with a smile, even when they're busy. The only drawback is the music is super loud hard rock, like def leopard and Zeppelin and you can't talk to your friends at all and have to shout for the servers to hear you. I'd stay longer and eat and drink more but it's just too uncomfortable.  I don't mind it loud in a club but in a neighborhood bar it's a bit much, especially during the daytime.  I used to hang here a lot with friends but I'm not enjoying it as much as I used too.  Food and service 5 stars, ambiance 1 star.
author: Melanie S.

description:
Love this place - you walk in and it's so much larger on the inside than it appears on the oustide. it's long not wide.

They have a great long woooden bar to sit at, nice beer selection and cheap beer pbr and others if you're on a budget. Taco tuesday is great and their tacos and other food is always good - a step up from bar food. well make it a step up and another step up - it's that good.
author: Rew C.

description: Food was better than your average bar food and the environment is a typical sports bar.  I will go back, I liked it.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I was a fish taco virgin until I got the tacos here, and it was THE BEST. My mouth was ravished by the great taste it had to offer ;). Nick's way is the way the go! It's crunchy but not too crunchy and tastes SO good. I find myself in a pickle because I'm trying to review this put I'm all giggly trying to remember the tasty experience.

It looks like a small place from the outside, but it's quite the opposite inside. However, despite the size of this place, you really need to go early or plan your dates. I went down there on a Giants game night and it was packed, no room to sit and barely any room to walk! Being unable to grab a seat, we ordered the tacos to go and it took about 20 minutes to have six tacos done. (Having it done Nick's way costs about 6 dollars a taco, but I believe it's less if you order a regular taco)

We could have stuck around to watch the game, but I'm not interested in baseball so we took a stroll around to check out the restaurants around. 20 minutes passed quickly after talking about cars, so we went back to grab the grub but unfortunately had to eat in the car. It finally came down to the tacos... It came down to unwrapping it, and it looked AMAZING.. These guys weren't stingy either, for six bucks you definitely get your worth in fish and in great taste! And if you think the tacos were something, even their CHIPS were great! Fresh, warm, and crunchy it went so well with the red sauce they had in the bag.

After two of the tacos, I was like "THE BEST, SO FRIGGIN GOOD OMG" and it almost felt like eating this was all a dream. I swear, I would probably drop $50 dollars here easily eating their tacos. These tacos definitely would have gone down great with some beer, but since the universe looks down upon me I could not get any.. beer that is. :(

This place DEFINITELY deserves five stars, but it gets four because I can't enjoy a drink there while eating my tacos YET. Once I hit 21, I'm going to head back here and enjoy everything this place has to offer. Then you'll see the five stars this place deserves. 21 or not, you need to try the fish tacos here!!
author: Richard C.

description:
Pretty solid stuff.  Hidden among what seems like a china down is taco delights.

The tacos have a great crunch and wonderful meats. I'm very fond of the carnitas

The salsa though could use a bit more kick

I love to go out there more often
author: Justin N.

description:
I was dubious about the quality of Mexican food in the Sunset, I really was. But rest assured! Nick's Way tacos come overflowing with gooey guacamole and fresh salsa, and the layering of hard/soft taco shells is genius. You can choose which type of organic meat you want -- I got the carne asada, my sister got the chicken, and we were both very pleased. It seems you can't go wrong with their tacos! (I've heard less flattering things about their other menu items, but can't speak for them since I personally haven't tried anything else.)

The squeeze bottles of salsa on the table are a nice touch. But most delightful is the nonstop flow of freshly baked lime-salted chips. Great for stopping in for lunch or a chill evening with friends.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Listen here kids.  
You want da taco.  You want da sports.  You go here.
"here", is the Sunset.  on Irving.  
Where the Irish & Asians conglomerate for taqueria fare
Where mixed chirren are probably conceived
and the reason why you keep meeting baby boys named Nick.
I come for Two dolla Taco Tuesdays.
Cuz I ain't tryin to buy no $5 taco. 
I get it Nick's way.  Sometimes.  (soft tortilla wrapped over crispy corn tortilla)
They also have $2 Tecate Tuesday.
But I never partake.  Cuz to me it tastes like extra sharp aged piss. 
But if you really wanna know why I come -
I go for the camaraderie.
For the high-fives from the Niner Faithfuls.
For the hand over the mouth (ohhhhhh!) high-fives from the Dubs fans
Or for the both arms up in the air high-tens from the orange and black.
Sometimes a rival fan will cause a stir.  Just a liddle one though.
Worst thing that could happen is that the rival fan enters tough as shit but then leaves a Hipster.
Can be easily reversed w/a backhand to the face and a splash of cold water.  

Soooo.....

Gimme a T! (Tee!)
Gimme an A! (ay!)
Gimme a C! (si!)

Whaaaaaaaat's that spell?!?!?

TAC! 

er.

btw, their guacamole is slaaaaaammin.  Always tastes freshly made and they've never skimped on me yet.  It's avocado season too so you know what that means.  Taste so good I do the avocado dance.

Go avo! Go cado!
Go avo! Go cado!

Whatever you totally wanna hang out with me.
author: Rho T.

description:
Mmmmm YUMMY sauce- roasted tomatillo and (lots of) garlic sauce! Simply divine!!!! If I could, I would slather this on anything & my stomach would thank me.

SF's 7x7 Big Eat list was on point w/ this cozy, chill, & casual spot- another good, cheap eat. The Baja Style Pescado taco, served Nick's Way is a must. The fish is deep fried & served w/ a bed of shredded cabbage, sliced red onions, & guacamole in a crispy tortilla, blanketed by a soft tortilla. Spritz on some lime & a dallop of that good 'ol tomatillo garlic sauce and you have yourself a WINNER!!

Tips:
*Try their $1 "Street" Tacos- choice of carne asada, chicken & carnitas. (They are seriously only a buck!)
*Wash it down w/ their Tecate.. only $2.
*Too crowded? You can use their vid game, Frogger, as a table. We did!
author: Joy A.

description:
I've only been to the Taco Shop once, and only briefly.  I was meeting some friends nearby but didn't have time for dinner so thought I would just grab a  Baja style fish taco at Underdog's since it was on the 7x7 Big Eat list for 2010.  I'm not sure exactly how the food at the bar works but I walked all the way to the end and asked the staff if I could order a taco to go.  They were really friendly and it was no problem.  The taco took maybe 10 minutes and I just hung out at the end of the bar and chatted with them.  

I only had a block to travel before being able to eat the taco, so it was still pretty fresh.  I thought the taco was a pretty good fish taco but didn't understand why it was on the big Eat list.  My friends recommended that I get the fish taco Nick's way instead so I'll have to be back.
author: Jean K.

description: We had a burrito and chicken wings. Both were excellent. And the waitress was very helpful; patient with us out-of-towners. Definitely recommend the place.
author: Jay R.

description:
Watching the Giant's game here was a bit crazy, but one of the best ideas ever. Don't be fooled from the outside, this place extends in with decent seating in the back. And plus, their food aint that bad either. The nachos were pretty good, and the lighting wasn't dark (in the back) like it is in most places. The bartenders and staff are friendly, especially since they were spraying alcohol and pouring shots down everyones throat after Romo got the last out.

Definitely the place to be during any major sporting event. Then again, I'll try it again on a more mellow day, just to get the right vibe.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Love this place.  Good tacos, good house margaritas & sangria.  Tuesdays can be a little too busy, but other times it is usually easy to find a table.  Really good for GF people, all corn tortillas for the tacos.  

I admit I walked by this place for years!  Looked kind of like a sports bar with tacos... didn't call out to me in an authentic way.  BUT THEN after going to SoCal and getting introduced to the California burrito... what do you know this place is one of the few here in SF serving up California burritos.  Lots of good sauces & cute wait staff.

Go & enjoy!
author: Mary J.

description:
even though many come here for the tacos, i have to say the hidden gem is the tortilla soup! One of my favs! Tacos are a hit and be sure to get them Nick's way...

Tends to get busy and its hard to find a table, but worth the wait
author: Larisa V.

description: Really in a league of its own.  You'll be hard pressed to find better tacos or margaritas in SF.  Tequila list is vast, and the bartenders mix the drinks with it well.  Baja style tacos are phenomenal, as are the carne asada.  Pretty hilarious that the best tacos and margaritas in SF are packaged into a laid back sports bar, but they are.  Super friendly staff.  Decent prices.  Come here. Even if it's out of your way....
author: mario k.

description:
If you're in the sunset and craving Mexican food, look no further than The Taco Shop at Underdogs.

Although the menu is extensive, the best-selling and mouth-watering Pescado Taco, made "Nick's Way" is the way to go.  The taco is made of crispy fried fish wrapped in a crispy taco shell, then wrapped in a soft corn tortilla.  It's topped with cabbage and the best part of the entire meal: their Hass avocado guacamole.

The guac is the best I've had!  The creamy Hass avocados are mixed to the perfect texture - a little bit chunky, so you can still feel like you're eating the world's best veggie, but augmented by other spices and flavors.  If you're craving guacamole alone, you can order the appetizer size.  The price, $5, is a bit steep, but the guac is well worth it.  Hass avocados aren't cheap, after all.

Luckily, the guac comes with many of their other popular dishes, such as their nachos, some of the many available burritos, and the previously mentioned tacos Nick's Way.  While the famous Pescado taco Nick's Way is pretty expensive at $5.25, it's a fairly large portion.  I only need one to fill me up (plus some of the chips & guac), and many guys I know only eat 2.  When you consider the fresh, delicious ingredients used to craft such a fantastic meal, the price is worth it.

In addition to the food, Underdogs is also a sports bar, serving draft & bottled beers, sangria, and delicious margaritas.  Friday nights from 6-6:30pm is the $1 margarita special; I'm told it's absolutely packed!  They also have Taco Tuesdays, but unfortunately, only the street tacos (devoid of the guac) are discounted to $1 each.  Still, a great deal.  They have lots of TVs, and during my most recent visit, the Laker game was on one TV and the Giants game on another across the room...ensuring that my boyfriend could watch the Lakers and my friends on the other side of the table could watch the Giants.

Whenever I've been there, we've managed to find a table, but if it gets really packed, it can require some hovering over tables that look like they're nearing the end of their meal.  The staff won't let you order unless you are seated, but you can also take your food to-go, if you have to.  Try to find seats though, because the service is usually really good, even when it's packed.

Just writing this review makes me crave a Pescado taco, Nick's Way, so I will definitely be heading over there again soon!
author: Caroline K.

description: Fish.  Taco.  Yum.  It's like a taco sports bar, but instead of bar food, they serve the best tacos I've had in a while.  Two tacos is enough, but I suggest you get the fish taco and the three Mexican street style ones.
author: Matthew J.

description:
NICKS FRIGGIN WAY!!!!

Its always packed in here so I always come by for lunch. The salsa is so freshh and the queso con leche? (SP) absolutely captivating. You can shoot hoops at the witttttle arcarde, grab a seat and watch the game over a glass of cold beer on tap. Really different vibe from the same ol goody two shoes Irving st. Bringing in some edge yenno? :) 

hint: GET TO-GO.
author: Wendy X.

description:
I love this place!!

Taste almost identical to La Taqueria, but cost way less, closer and better parking.

When you come here, DO...I repeat DO get their Tacos w/ everything. Make it Nick's Way, which means w/ a crunchy taco on the inside.

You'll thank me later.

I'm droooling for some as I type this review.

Happy Hour - $1 Tacos
http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/rCtkftNa0mL3SmMh94wniA/l

(Friday, June 4, 2010)
author: Kenny C.

description: Went for happy hour. Tacos needed a lil bit more flavor but we're still yummy and nachos were super good so were the chicken wings. Overall great experience and will be coming back.
author: K E.

description: Maybe I'm too used to the Mission's mouth-watering tacos and burritos and endless tortilla chips but the tacos here just wasn't cutting it for me. Nothing too special about the $7.50 Mexican street style tacos. Haven't tried Nick's tacos so maybe they're a bit better. I also had the nachos and while they were good the first five minutes, you gotta eat it pretty fast otherwise the cheese hardens up and it's not as appetizing especially with the large amount they give you.
author: Cathy N.

description:
this is as good as it gets!!! gotta get a couple of tacos NICKS WAY! Such a fun place, such good vibes and the choclo (cheesy corn) is so so so delicious. The taco salads are also delicious, love the dressing. 

if it wasnt such a mission to get to i'd be there every week.
author: Maxine S.

description: Went in for a beer in afternoon...the place was practically empty and it took 25 minutes for a bartender to even notice that I didn't have a drink. Rude and unfriendly staff more interested in themselves than serving their patrons...
author: JP S.

description:
Review is only for FOOD:
The crispy fish taco **Nick's Way** is better here than at THE Nick's Crispy Tacos location, IMO! Highly recommend getting the beer battered fish, but the Mahi Mahi is a lighter option, also great.

They also have California burritos. I went to school in San Diego so I'm constantly on the hunt for these. The french fry is different than what you would find in SD, in that it's the kind that is double battered, fried and more seasoned. No complaints about that!

Also, I'm not sure what is in their bottles of hot sauce/salsa but both the roasted tomato and green tomatillo sauces are delicious! I'm usually not a big fan of the green sauce, but this one is quite tasty.
author: Jennie Y.

description: Couldn't get enough of the red salsa.  Also loved the skinny guacamole - nicely seasoned selection of fresh veggies and tasty guacamole.   Tacos Nick's way messy but good.  Grilled fish tacos were yummy.  Surprisingly good wings for a taco bar.  Strong beer selection.
author: Joel V.

description:
Dunno how this place got 4 stars.  I'd say it's okay.  I went here for happy hour because my friend told me tacos were $1 each.  They were super tiny tacos.  Pretty cute for happy hour, but if I had to pay $2 each for those "pocket" tacos I would have left...they definitely weren't worth it.  Chips and salsa were more worth it, I'd say ($1.50 each).

Service was excellent, they really took care of us asking if we needed anything, etc.  They always picked up our dirty napkins every time they stopped by, which was pretty impressive (every waiter/waitress!).  I guess it was good to try, but I wouldn't go out of my way for this place.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Happy belated Cinco De Mayo.  The $7.50 taco (or burrito) lunch special caught my eye (after tax, it's $8.21).  You get 3 street tacos, chips and a choice of drink (soda or agua fresca).  It took a really long time to get my food (street tacos shouldn't take that long?) even though hardly anyone was there at the time (it was still early).  

Each tacos features two soft small corn tortillas covered with meat, sprinkled liberally with fresh cilantro and chopped onions.  I don't think you get to choose the type of meat.

* Chicken taco: skinless, didn't seem grilled, somewhat dry with not that much flavor, skip
* Carnitas taco: Just okay, also lacking in flavor other than the flavor of salt, dry
* Carne asada taco: Best tasting, most flavorful, least dry, chopped into small bits
* Chips: homemade, thick, extra crunchy, oily, barely received any - maybe a handful
* Salsa: best part of the lunch special, they include three kinds, all of them were excellent especially the spicy green tomatillo one.  They are seasoned just right, full flavored, fresh and zesty.  The next best one was the smoky chipotle.

Even though some of the meat was dry and not that tasty, the salsas make up for the meat.  I also read that the ingredients are sourced from local farms when possible so that's a plus.  Happy hour is 4:30 - 6 PM, M-F, and during that time you can enjoy $1 street tacos.  As for ambiance, it's a sports bar and it looks like every inch is covered with some sports flag or sign.  My favorite part of the decor is the picture of "Underdog".  They have multiple TVs and an arcade area in the back. 

$10 credit card minimum
author: Lolia S.

description: Love Love LOOOOOOOVE the Taco Shop.  Every time we've been there (with the exception of one, but it was an anomaly and I heard from Doug right after the incident), the food is amazing, the beers are cold, and the atmosphere is fun.  I love the picnic tables in the back, and people are always cool about sharing space with you.  Sometimes there is a little bit of a wait for a table, but typically people will let you join them - with the exception of Taco Tuesday, when it's just insane.  It's kid friendly in the back.  I highly recommend the Taco Shop!
author: Cori D.

description:
I visited SF in July, and I still can't stop thinking about this place. I just gave a friend a recommendation to visit and my mouth started watering! 
Fish Taco's - Baja Style, make it Nick's way  
The best fish taco... best taco in general, that I have ever had.
Casual, fun atmosphere. Love the picnic tables & basketball arcade game.
author: Morrisa L.

description: Corner bar with several TVs for watching the game. Make sure to order everything Nick's Way and get the elote con queso. You won't be sorry.
author: Crystal S.

description:
Come here for happy hour... $1 street tacos, how can you beat that?! The happy hour tacos may be bite sized, but I'm sure 5 or 6 of those will help keep you full :)

My friends and I also tried the baja-style Fish tacos and those were really good too. If you're a spicy eater, like me, be sure to add lots of salsa on it.  Oh and you can't beat their $1.50 for some chips and fresh tomato salsa. It will also help get you full along with your $1 street tacos.

Since it's a sports bar, it's a really great place to come here with your friends and catch the game.  However, be sure to come early if there's a big sporting event you want to watch.  My friends and I came here to watch game 7 of the NBA Finals, so you can imagine how packed this place was! So be sure to come early (Happy hour starts at 4pm anyway) if you wanna get seats and be able to eat before the game gets exciting.

I'll probably come back sometime soon for happy hour. I just wish their other drinks were happy hour prices too. I'm not a big beer drinker, but for this place, I might just reconsider.
author: Liezel D.

description:
Nick's way, all the way!
Pitcher of green flash ipa, fresh chips & salsa, carne asada and grilled fish tacos make for a bomb diggity lunch! The tacos are +- $5 but they are hefty and loaded with  tons of guac ! You can get 2 for $8.50; I couldn't even finish two! They also have a full bar and tv  screens, cool place to hang out and have a few drinks and eat delicious tacos! Will def be back :)
author: Kim N.

description: Their food is good. It's a great place to catch a game. Ordering online is dangerous. They have messed up my order a few times. Not cool given the price of the food. Beware of missing guacamole and sour cream!
author: Natasha B.

description: I actually heard about this place from a friend.  Everyones always talking about "Nicks way" tacos so I had to try it for myself. After my first visit to underdogs I can truly say I've had one of the best carne asada tacos ever! They add guacamole, some house sauce and of course carne asada, cheese in two tortillas one fried one soft. Though the bar is quite small, definetely worth the wait!
author: Shelly W.

description:
The tacos here are awesome! Make sure you get them Nick's way! The area inside is kinda small though, so you may have to wait to get a seat if you're with a few people. I came here once for a late lunch with two other people and we ended up sharing a table with a couple. There's also a little basketball hoop at the back where you use quarters to play. The waitress was nice and was willing to exchange bills for quarters.

You would come here for the tacos, the name of this place IS the Taco Shop. Get them Nick's Way for a little more and you get it soft and crunchy for a little more in price but I think it's worth it. I don't remember which was which but I normally get two fish tacos Nick's Way. It's really tasty and satisfying. One taco may not be enough for some people but two will definitely not make you feel hungry.

Overall, this is an awesome little taco with really tasty tacos.

Pros:
- Great tasting tacos

Cons:
- Not much room for seating
author: Paul U.

description: Awesome tacos, quick and friendly service, quirky sports bar atmosphere. I always get three of the vegetarian street tacos which are fresh and tasty. My lady gets the Baja fish taco Nick's way and the grilled shrimp taco, both of which she raves about. Love going for Taco Tuesday - street style tacos are just 2 dollars each all day and there are margarita specials. The guacamole is also awesome as is the black bean and corn salad. The main draw here is the freshness of all of the ingredients.
author: Kelly G.

description:
FIrst time in the city and went to Underdog's with a friend of mine for dinner, and was completely impressed.  The food (I had the "San Francisco Burrito"), was incredible and came out in a timely manner, and our waitress gave exceptional service.  She was friendly without being overbearing, and the second our drinks were low or it seemed like we needed anything she was there.  Underdog's has a great atmosphere for sports watching with a large bar (looks like over twenty seats), and a great view of their many TV's from the tables. Their house margarita is to die for (as you would expect from a mexican establishment I'd guess).  It is made with agave nectar and our waitress was happy to explain what exactly that was (which apparently is off the plant tequila is made out of. Very cool!).

The next day I went in for an afternoon drink, and service was just as great even without the business of the dinner rush. Overall I would recommend Underdogs to anyone, and will absolutely be going back for burritos and a margarita again!
author: Alex B.

description:
Parking: Street parking, bring some coins! be prepared to go around the block 5x
I only say this because there are a lot of stores and this street is 99% of the time busy.

Pricing: Decent

Food: Chips and salsa SOOOO Good. The chips are very different, I can't explain its like newly cooked so crispy. I don't know that's just me i love it.

BEST FISH TACOS ive ever had. Please make sure to always get it Nick's way. LOVEEEE the extra guacamole!

Customer Service: Ehh so-so, I went here a few times, it's always different, sometimes accommodating, sometimes not much care in the world, but hey like I said, I don't care; I love the fish tacos, I'm not here to chat with the employees LOL.
author: Ledam O.

description:
For real? What's the buzz? I only came here because it made the top 100 list of eats in SF. Shame. Baja style tacos... um I guess because there's fish in it? I truly haven't found a place outside of San Diego that has decent fish tacos, besides Baja. 
The tacos were ok, Nick's way was good. Nothing impressive. 
I was very disappointed with the elotes here. The corn has powdered cotija cheese! Yuck! Just go to your local market at get the real stuff, it's 110% better.
Service here was friendly. It's a kid friendly sports pub vibe. Sorry I like tacos in the mission, in fruitvale, in the barrio... but not so much here.
author: Naomi K.

description:
For my birthday, we swooped by Underdog to save our empty bellies. 

It's a comfortable sports bar with a super long bar, some high tables + chairs along the walls and picnic tables in the back. Colorful sports flags hang from the ceiling and there are flat screens above the bar to view the sports.

We enjoyed the chips (crispy & thick cut) + guacamole, the carne asada taco and pollo taco - both prepared 'Nick's Way' (consisting of the meat, pinto beans, guac., pico de gallo + Monterey Jack cheese, wrapped by a grilled corn tortilla and soft tortilla). All were delicious - total comfort food.

They have a great selection of draft beer (both micros + imports), bottled beer and margaritas. Non-alcohols include *homemade* agua fresca, sodas, Mexican cola, and bottled water. Check out their online menu for full details.

Note - Underdogs has a sibling. One is this Taco Shop and the other is an Organic Sausage Shop - about 2 blocks east on Irving.

Thank you Underdog for making my birthday meal a deliciously memorable one!
author: Cathy K.

description:
This place is ok. Nothing special about their 1 dollar tacos. Its really bland and you have to add a lot of hot sauce and salt for it to taste decent. Moreover, you need to order 4 or 5 just to feel semi satisfied. Better to just order a burrito at normal price than ordering a lot of cheap tacos. 

The bar is actually larger than I thought and the service is really good. Multiple waitresses kept checking up on my table and taking away dirty napkins. Overall, happy hour is decent. Not the best happy hour out there but not the worst.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
i frequent this bar alot since im a bigs sports fan and they play all the local bay area sports on all screens...came here for the world series in 2010 and 2012, many niner games, warriors and sharks game.

Like some other people say i would come here to hang out, drink a beer and watch sports on the screens.Food is meh to me here...everytime i have ordered something i have been dissapointed with flavor. Especially last night, my friend and i shared the griled shrimp burrito. There was like literally 5 shrimp max in it, plus it was so soggy that the tortilla unraveled after the first bite. And i felt gimp for the 9.50 i paid for it.

I recommened this place to watch sports and have a drink, foodwise i would go somewhere else for taste and quality. And it is mos def crowded and hot in here...even when the front door is open...so much body heat going on haha
author: Andrew S.

description:
My Australian girl friend raved about this place and its awesome fish tacos. So when she got the chance to suggest brunch here, I was like okay, lady, let's try it.

The place is a sports bar and GOOD LUCK trying to find a seat during game times. This is one of the more crowded sports bars I've seen in the middle of the day, on a Sunday... when everyone else likes to sit in front of their 72-inch HD flat screen butt naked with not a care in the world. That's how important this place is.

So the Baja (crispy) tacos, Nicks way: $5.50... YOLO. 
Get TWO because you will be in heaven TWICE when you eat these. 
My group also ordered mimosas which go great with anything. My boyfriend was crazy to have gotten carnitas tacos or whatever (they were also good, but still).

Service is amazing, our waitresses were totally chill and accommodating. We had to stand around the lone outside table and they still made it a point to check in on us. 
BEST PART: What we thought was a random guy asking if we were done with our food (we thought he was seeking donations)  and started to grab our empty baskets happened to be a waiter who had just arrived for work or coming back from break. Excellent job, everyone. I'm super impressed. (You got the 5th star!)

Wait, it doesn't stop there! Make sure to gorge yourself on that roasted tomato salsa, made fresh and ohhhh soooo tasty!
author: Joanne S.

description: NICK's WAY IS THE BOMB!! Spiced just right and the crispy taco cuddled by a soft tortilla??? The best!!! Love!!!!
author: Raquel S.

description:
You can't beat this California taco sports bar. 

Multiple TVs showing all the games. Friendly bartenders. Decent tap selection, cheap tecate, and fresh limes for margaritas. The food is really spectacular, and it's this combination of great food and great bar that makes Underdogs what it is.

I personally don't like the Nick's way tacos (too much tortilla for my taste), but most of my friends swear by Nick's. I like the street tacos and the California style burrito.
author: Eric S.

description:
SO good! Fresh sangria and REALLY good fish tacos! Fresh and delicious. I can't wait to go back!

Although be warned...when they are busy they are BUSY! And it can be hard to find a seat, sometimes you have to wait. But it really is very good.
author: Tasha W.

description:
First off, let me say that I love Underdogs.  At least twice a month I drive halfway across the city to buy their breakfast burritos because, simply put, they're the best in the city.  Don't get me wrong - the tacos and burritos ain't too shabby either, but if you're only able to get one thing then it's gotta be La Bomba.  

Sadly, the incredibly rude service cannot salvage the experience no matter how delicious the food may be.  Specifically, the woman who works (manages?) there on Sunday mornings.   Her attitude is somewhere between "perpetually annoyed" and "you're so lucky I'm helping you" and it makes you feel unwelcomed and burdensome.  I'll take responsibility for calling 2 minutes before you open, but you have to admit it sounds pretty bizarre to say "call back in 2 minutes when we're open"  Umm okay? Talk to you soon?  

This "experience" isn't limited to chatting on the phone, when I showed up to pick up my food this same woman is hurries you through the buying process, demanding money without telling you how much owe, rolling her eyes when you ask for the chips you're supposed to get with your order, and I won't even bother to describe what it's like to ask for salsa on top of all this.  

It hurts to give Underdog's a 1 star review, but I feel like this is the only way to properly vent my frustrations.  I'll still go there to get my breakfast burritos, but maybe not as often as I'd like.
author: Bobby L.

description:
A nice local sports bar for all the Bay Area sports fans out there. I was here to see a giants game when they were in the World Series and the atmosphere was unbelievable. It's a satisfying feeling to see every single being in the bar dressed in orange and black. 
The alcohol is cheap and you can buy beer by the bucket. I took off a couple stars because the tacos were horrendous but I doubt anybody comes here for the food. 
Plenty of seating but come early on game days to grab a good spot!
author: Alfred L.

description:
I seriously love this place!! I'm not sure why it's taken me such a long time to write a review. They're food is amazing. Street tacos are the way to go! On top of that, Friday nights from 6pm-6:30 is their happy hour. $1 margaritas, doesn't get much better than that. Staff is friendly, drinks are good. 

I only wish they made more space or I'm going to hate myself for saying this but, control the crowd during their busy place. This place gets way to packed.
author: Priyam D.

description: We came here for lunch on a weekday afternoon. As far as mexican food outside of the mission goes, this place is pretty good. I didn't try the famous crispy tacos, but we did get the california burrito and the carne asada quesadilla. The burrito was top notch. The fries that they use in the burrito were nice and crispy. The quesadilla tasted great, but was kind of soggy. Both the salsa options they had that day were flavorful and not too spicy.
author: Alice H.

description: Great Tacos at an awesome price. Food comes quickly! Try ordering your tacos "Nick's Way"
author: Whitney O.

description:
This is definitely the place to be for all your favorite sports events ! Tacos, nachos and beer while watching your favorite sports team on multiple big screen TVs all combined into one, nothing beats that combination !!

The fish tacos made "nick's way" is the high light of it all. it is recommended that you arrive early, because the place will get packed and will be nearly impossible to find seats, that goes for standing room too !! 

Parking can get kind of difficult because it's located on irving in between 19th and 20th.
author: Jeff C.

description:
We headed to the Underdogs for a quick pitcher of beer and an Elote con Queso before dinner.  

I have never had a better corn on the cob as this place.  The fresh white corn on the cob brushed with lime salsa and then dusted with cotija cheese and cayenne pepper! 

Delicious!
author: Nell C.

description:
Great place.  More of a bar than restaurant, but the bar staff will still take your to-go order.  Staff is super friendly.  Food is good, a little different than the norm.  Not bad different, but tasty different.

You might want to talk to the staff before ordering.  Besides being cool people,  they might give you a recommendation you will soon appreciate.  In my case, it was the nick's style fish taco.  (Expletive) it was amazing!
author: Rik C.

description: This was my first time having the famous Nick's Crispy Tacos and they did not disappoint at all.  I had the Carne Asada, Carnitas, and Baja Style Fish tacos done Nick's Way.  Man, these tacos were huge!!!  I swear after the first one, I was already full and shoved in the other two.  My favorite of the three was the Carne Asada and the Baja Style Fish totally trumps Rubio's.  These are hardcore tacos folks!!  You have to try them!
author: Rodney H.

description: Talk about consistency!! Also one of the finest tequila selections in the city, I doubt you will get value for money like this in any other tequila bar in San Francisco! 5 stars, keep up the good work amigos!
author: Paddy Og M.

description: It's been almost three years that I was introduced to this place, I can definitely be a taco snob and I wasn't too sure about this place. Once I received my first street taco, I knew I found my spot. The fish tacos always call me out as well! I like traditional style tacos so I never really opted in to get them "nicks way" until my most recent visit at underdogs. Nick's way is reallllly good, I think from now on I'll go half on each!
author: Alejandra N.

description: Nick's tacoooo! I always come here for the Baja fish tacos! I love the environment. It's a bar / restaurant hang out spot. You can come here and watch sports. Really chill. Come here and Enjoy yourself. The service could be slow depending when you come. But Overall, I love the food & staff :)
author: Stephanie L.

description:
In a word, delicious! Sure, it's a sports bar but they obviously take their food very seriously. The guacamole tastes like its made fresh with every order. The salsas are fantastic, even the pico de gallo is made with ultra-fresh tomatoes. The carne asada is juicy and flavorful, as is the carnitas and chicken. The chips are addictive - handmade from cut tortillas and sprinkled with sea salt.  

Think mission style burrito with super high-quality ingredients. I'd give them five-stars except that the kitchen (not the servers, they are very competent and attentive) can sometimes be a little slow. But then again at least you can watch a game.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Great food and very attentive staff! 

I came here for a friend's birthday and had the best time! This place is a really great combination of a taco shop, a bar and a mini arcade. 

The food is hands-down delicious. I'm a big fan of Nick's Crispy Tacos and The Taco Shop has the same menu. Make sure to order the tacos "Nick's Way".... Delicious!!

I was also very impressed with the level of service. The wait staff came by our table very frequently to check and see if we wanted more beer, tacos, etc. It was great to not have to get up and navigate through a bunch of crowds to try to place my order at the bar. 

There were also several fun games to play- street fighter, pac-man, basketball hoops - all great!

Pros: 

- Has something for everyone! You can come here with a big group of people and everyone will find something they enjoy (beer, tacos, games!)
- Really good service. The wait staff was very quick and kept our table super clean 

Cons
- Probably not the best place to go if you want to have a long conversation with your friends - it does get a bit loud. However, this is pretty typical in a bar so I wasn't bothered too much.
author: Renee N.

description:
i come here only for the baja style fish tacos.  they are my favorite!  
Someday, i'll branch out.

i'd also forgotten they are a sports bar.  I'm not into watching sports, but if you like sports, camaraderie, and the noise on game nights (it gets really loud) along with drinks and good food, then this is it!
author: Animal K.

description: Good food, sports, and laid back. Came here after a run to watch the football game. It was packed (as always) but we found a spot at the bar. Though it took a bit to get service, it was prompt, super friendly, and fantastic once received. The guacamole is so delicious and they aren't stingy, yay! The chicken taco was loaded and the nachos are cheesy and filling. Definitely coming back!
author: Zara S.

description: Stopped by in the evening for a quick beer and was very impressed by the salsa fresca with chips that I got with it!!! Very tasty and fresh! And- it came with three what looked like home-made hot sauces. They had Lagunitas on tap and nice atmosphere. Will definitely be back to try the rest of the deliciously looking menu.
author: Julie O.

description:
The Taco Shop At Underdog's was a pretty cool place. A full service sports bar with a number of huge flat screen TVs. Plenty of table seating inside and also at the bar counter. 

Their menu featured Starters, Tacos, Quesadillas, Burritos and Drinks. They also serve up breakfast during football season only, which I found interesting. 

We decided to start off with an appetizer and got the 'Nachos es muy Grande' - Pinto Beans, Monterey Jack Cheese, Pico De Gallo, Jalapeños, Guacamole, Mexican Sour Cream served with your choice of Steak or Chicken. But we opted for a no meat version. 

My colleagues both ordered Burritos and I got the Mexican "Street Style" Tacos - One Carne Asada (steak), one Carnitas (pork) and one Pollo (chicken) Taco with Cilantro and Onions on small Corn Tortillas. 

Several minutes later the nachos arrived. The plate was piping hot and the portion was nice! The taste, the crisp and thickness of the nachos were perfect along with the medley of gorgeous toppings. The roasted jalapenos along with the green and red salsa took the heat flavors to another level. I'd say it's one of the best nachos I've had in a while! 

It didn't take long until the rest our order hit the table. Out of the three street style tacos, the chicken taco was my favorite - the bomb! It was tasty, juicy and just perfect. However, the pork and the beef taco just didn't do it for me. I asked my colleagues about their burrito experience and got the nodding heads of approval. 

Overall, we enjoyed the food and the ambiance. Service was fantastic! 
Will definitely be back for more nachos and to try Nick's way...
author: Gary E.

description: I had two of the Nick's Way tacos, both a carne asada and a carnitas, and though they weren't the best taco's I've ever had, they were pretty great when paired with their two awesome sauces. I didn't catch what they were called exactly, but one had a bit of smokey/roasted pepper flavor and the other was more of a lighter salsa verde maybe. Regardless, both were very tasty. The tacos were not traditional street tacos, but they were very good on their own, but did need the extra splash of flavor from the sauces in my opinion. We tried the nachos as well, which were also really good; however, I didn't love the chips they use. Not sure if they are common out in San Francisco, but the chips mildly reminded me of Fritos, which I do not care for at all. Again, they definitely weren't Fritos, but something about them made me think of Fritos. Besides the food being pretty cool, the bar is nice and big, the seating area is a good size, and though the place was busy we were able to grab a couple stools at the bar as soon as we walked in. They had plenty of bartenders and servers for a bar of its size in my opinion. The only other complaint I had, minor too, is that their beer selection could have been better.
author: Kevin C.

description:
$6 for the Tecate & tequila special EVERYDAY? I'm already drunk just *thinking* about it! Try the elote con queso and the quesedila. You will thank me later.... Yeah, you're welcome.

Docked a [*] because this place get's noisy and rowdy as hell sometimes. Esp. next to the b-ball arcade. Guess I probably should reconsider bringing my cheap dates somewhere else...
author: Raymond Y.

description: Baja Tacos Nicks Way Hooray! Love this place. Nothing feels better than a Baja Taco Nicks way and a Dos Equis Amber. Yum.
author: Shannon P.

description:
Ok I wanted to try this place and see what all the hype was about after seeing my friends' Instagram pictures.  Operative word: try.  (I planned an event on Facebook with some of my friends to specifically come here and try the infamous fish tacos.)  My girlfriend and I arrived here around 7:30 PM on January 7, 2014.  It was my first time, so pardon me if I didn't know the unspoken rules about signing in with a server in order to get a table.  My girlfriend checks in with one of the servers, a female with frizzy hair who was very kind, for a table for four.  As we were waiting, one of the two seaters over a gaming console opened up, so my girlfriend and I sat down there to wait for our larger table and friends.  A man with red pants and a slight mustache comes over and asks if we had signed in, which we told him we did but that we were waiting for a four seater.  He informed us that we couldn't sit in the two person table and needed to sign up on the waiting list.  I totally understand, so we got up to stand around and wait again.  A few minutes later, a table for four does open up and the woman with the frizzy hair takes a look at the waiting list and seats my girlfriend and I.  The man who had originally told us off the two seater comes over and asks us why we were sitting down, to which I informed him that the lady with the frizzy hair had sat us down and that we had followed his instructions to sign up on the waiting list. He then tells me that "she's wrong then, you can't sit there" and that someone else was before us.  I told him politely to please check with his frizzy-haired coworker.  He stood over our table without answering me and he kept staring at me which made me feel uncomfortable.  He finally walked over to the frizzy haired woman and after having a brief conversation with her, the man with the red pants gives me a thumbs up and walks over to me asking 'how he could help me' as if this sudden change in attitude would make up for his lack of professionalism.  I told him that I wanted another server, to which he questioned "Why?"  I answered, "Because you have been rude to me the whole night."  He informs me that he is the only one working the back section, so I tell him, "Well then, I'm leaving."  I walked out on your establishment, which seems pretty cool other than this man who knows nothing about customer service, while he stood there and looked bewildered of my actions.

Instead of asking his coworker if she had sat me down initially, he already started pointing fingers by saying I didn't belong at the table.  It did not make me feel welcome at all.
author: Brandon Y.

description: First time here. I'm from San Diego, so if I eat a carne asada burrito, I want it San Diego style. This is the first place I've ever seen it as an option. SOOOO GOOD! I was worried when I saw that it was on a wheat tortilla, but you hardly even notice that it's wheat. The meat was delicious. Not the same as my hometown taco shop, but still delicious! I also recommend the "not your father's root beer." Totally coming back!
author: Saundra B.

description:
This place definitely has that college/sports-bar feel to it, with various football flags hanging from the ceiling and TVs at all angles for perfect game-time viewing. It's laid back and fun, and attracts what appears to be a Marina-type crowd, which was surprising to see all the way out in the Sunset. 

The bar area in the front is meant for small groups, while the long communal tables in the back can handle larger groups. There is a basketball shooting arcade game in the back that several groups played during my meal. There is also this really awesome Pac-Man table for two closer to the bar.

The tacos were delicious (and resemble Nick's Crispy--almost 100% convinced it's owned by the same guy, though tried to do some research but could not confirm)! Ordered the grilled fish taco Nick's way, and enjoyed every single bite. Topped it off with a glass of Sangria, which contained various slices of fruit that don't hide the punch in the drink.

The only complaints I have are that the tacos took an extraordinarily long time to be delivered (20 minutes minimum) and that the chips and salsa are not complimentary (I suppose the latter is standard for a sports bar, but I'm accustomed to restaurants where pre-meal chips are a given). 

Will definitely return the next time I am in the area and would recommend it to any taco lover.
author: Ashley P.

description: I use to live in the Sunset District and this was the place to be! It's a bar looking place that serves great food.  What's really cool about Underdog's is the fact that the Bar transforms it's self as the night gets later and later.  For example, you will definitely find and see young kids (keep in mind the bar setting) eating with family some delicious Mexican food.  I'm telling you if parents are willing to take young kids to a sports setting bar during the day, it's because the food is phenomenal.  Every time I come here I order Nick's chicken tacos.  It's huge tacos that are stuffed with salsa, chicken, sour cream, rice, beans, guacamole etc and not to mention how everything always fresh and so tasty.  Hummm trust me you can't go wrong here.
author: Jo T.

description: The Tacos and buckets an awesome combo to watch sports with! The only thing that was frustrating that they didnt want to turn the sound on for the Warriors game. I literally had to turn the volume on myself which was annoying for a huge rivalry playoff game! Had two Tacos and was stuffed.  Get there early for big games because this place does get packed!
author: Kyle W.

description:
so i always heard great things about there $2 taco tuesday so i decided to go, first walk in the wait was kinda long but that is what you expect from a bargain night.. once we got seated our host was very sweet but the table was not big enough for our group so they moved us and thats when we got a horrible waitress.

we ordered our food and instead of serving us water she just brought cups and the jug of water.

the shrimp/prawn taco was the driest taco i have ever had
the mexican style tacos the meat had no flavor, super dry and cold tortillas
they never brought out our other food and he excuse was "you guys sat at a different table i thought you ate it" when she had clearily had taken our order. 

than she decided to grab the male waitor and he decided to give us a free taco, which was cool but still the quality of the food was horrrible.

than when we were leaving they told us " to never come back" 

oh yeah, that is great service to tell people paying your bills to not come back..
author: Cynthia C.

description:
Whooop whoop, Nick's Crispy  Tacos has made its way to the Sunset at Underdogs!

Favorites:

Elote - corn smothered in crack cheese and chili powder.
Chips and salsa with GUAC (You have to ask for the guac specifically) - the chips are thick, hard, and crunchy, almost to the point of staleness, but not quite--making these the tastiest tortilla chips I've ever had.

This place usually gets EXTREMELY crowded at night and during game days/nights. Almost as many as half the times I've attempted to come here, I ended up leaving because there were no tables available and it was just way too crowded. They never seem to be busy during lunch time though :)
author: Lily Z.

description:
Usually I have to go to a place more than once before I review it but the staff was so rude we didn't even make it to food.

I brought some out of town guests here for drinks and tacos.
The place was packed with young college age kids.

We started towards the back to see if there was any seating available when a staff member came up to us to let us know there would be a wait. 
We asked how long the wait would be and the staff member showed me his clip board and said "that long." Well sir, I have no idea how long a table turn here takes, so that doesn't tell me anything.
"So that would be..." "About that long."

You could have said ten minutes, lie to me, anything other than shoving a clipboard into my face and telling me to figure it out. We put our name down but left anyways.

They obviously didn't need or want our business so we spent money elsewhere.

All I wanted was a taco and instead I got attitude. Not the kind of place for me.
author: Sophia v.

description:
Always passed by this place, but never really thought about going in..Last week my buddy wanted to hang out before his shift and said lunch there would be good... 
I went ahead and ordered a Fish taco (nicks way) and a Carnitas taco (nicks way)

So I am not much of a fish taco fan but wow! this was so tasty and worth it! ... granted Nicks way was a bit messy and in your face but good overall...

Carnitas taco was good, surprised i had pinto beans in it... thinking nicks way would have been better on just 1 taco 
because i was way too full....even with a Stella flushing it all down... i had to walk a few blocks to get me out of my food coma....

Service was good... 

Prices were a bit steep but overall i enjoyed the food... i can see myself going back indeed = )
author: Monica D.

description:
Ok I've been here three different times and the first two times, I had a great delicious experience with their fish taco's Nick's way beer battered.. 

  However, two nights ago at about 7pm on Saturday (it should be noted that I haven't ate since 8am that night), I decided to come here for dinner and ordered two fish taco's Nick's way with a beer of Anchor Steam. And while I was chewing into my food, it didn't taste so fresh and when I think back on it, it didn't look very fresh either when I ordered it and got my food unusually quick. 

  So after eating that and finishing my beer, one hour or two goes by, I started feeling very nauseated and sick to my stomach that I felt like yacking. And when 9pm hit, I was yacking like crazy. I yacked so much, that my stomach started hurting while I was yacking. More painful than drinking too much alcohol. I had never been in so much pain in my life from food poisoning.

  After throwing up, I tried eating another home cooked meal, and a few minutes go by, I shower and I had to throw up again in the middle of the shower. And not to mention after trying to sleep, about every 30 minutes I had to throw up throughout the whole night which was at least 8 times. 

  Because of this horrible traumatizing food poisoning experience, I will never ever come back to Underdog's even if the owner offers me free food and drinks from now on. Sure the food poisoning could have came from the bad food, an employee not washing his/her hands, dirty beer or dirty glass. but all I know is I got sick as hell from here because I didn't eat anything or anywhere else within the past 11 hours from being here. And no use reporting it when it ain't gonna do shit for me or anyone else. This is the report you will get from me where I can share it on yelp. And let me add that ever since my first time here, this place never really looked clean to me.
author: Pudgy G.

description:
You know you've got something when the food tastes as good BEFORE a night of drinking as it does AFTER (and during, mwa ha ha). I haven't tried any of their breakfast tacos yet, but it's on my to-do list. The food is tasty enough to where I can drink a bucket of Tecate while eating it (and I hate Tecate).

Usual orders:
-Nachos es muy grande: Yummy and a huge portion, good for a couple. Beans, cheese, pico, jalapeños, guac and sour cream. You can add steak, chicken or pork, personally I like steak.
-Pescado "baja" Style tacos: tasty beer battered fish in corn tortillas with cabbage, onions and salsa. I also got them "Nick's Way".
-Carne asada quesadillas: very tender grilled steak with flour tortillas, cheese and pico. 
-Chips and salsa: pretty standard. I'd rather go for the nachos.

I've had great service except once, where the chick didn't seem too interested in helping us or asking if we needed anything ever. It's pretty crowded here and it can get rowdy, not a great place to have a deep conversation. I've had beer splashed on me once by a group of drunk buffoons who were spraying it on everyone sitting near the back-end of the restaurant, that wasn't too cool but at least I wasn't wearing fancy clothes.

GET THE HABAÑERO SAUCE! Don't be a chicken$h!t :)
author: Stephanie M.

description:
The fish taco here are so good and the staff are always friendly.

Came here again and had the fish burrito without rice and beans and its basically like getting a bigger fish taco minus the guac.

On the pricier side.
BUT: have you ever tried making a fried fish taco/burrito?
I have. its way easier and so much tastier to just buy it here!
author: Ash R.

description:
I use to love this place, I would come here to watch baseball, football, or basketball. Their quesadillas are the best I ever had, the crust is delicious and the steak is flavorful, though kinda pricey, the baha style fish tacos are good along with their homemade orange and green sauce. burritos are decent at best, quesadillas are my favorite thing, nachos are okay, their homemade orange sauce is bomb. What's disappointing is their shrimp taco, the taco came with only two small Cheetos-sized shrimps leaving the rest of the taco with just tomatoes and cabbage....the shrimp had good garlic flavor though I wish it covered the whole taco instead of 1/4 of it. The Mexican chicken soup is good too! Taco Tuesdays use to be $1 for street taco now it's $2. The margarita happy hour on Friday is only half an hour! 6-630. My friends love coming here because there's food and drinks and about ten tvs so everyone can watch what they want. If you wanna come during a good sports game or on a Friday Saturday night then come early to get a spot, it fills up fast! There are picnic benches in the back for bigger parties. They have a good selection of beers on tap and it's a pretty cool place to hang out. I've been a regular here before and when it's slow they'll give you free chips and pico di gallo but I don't know about now. Parking is bad because its on Irving! I just hope they'll lower the prices for the tacos lol!

TL;DR
Come early for seats, get tacos or quesadillas, try their homemade orange sauce. Dont get the shrimp tacos. A little pricey but the food is generally good and the atmosphere is cool.
author: Mike C.

description:
#10 on the 2010 Big Eat SF List - http://www.7x7.com/2010-big-eat-sf-100-things-try-you-die 

All my friends have been going to the places on the list so it was my turn to catch up. I'd been craving fish tacos so decided to make Underdogs my first place to try on the list. 

Recommended: Baja style fish tacos, made Nick's way. 

$5.25 for a fully loaded taco - beer battered fish, cabbage, lime, roasted salsa, red onions, with a slab of fresh guacamole on top, wrapped in two layers - hard taco inside, soft taco on the outside. Add on some of their house hot sauce - and you got oneeee TASTY taco! Also good - the chips & salsa. The salsa was super fresh and the chips were nice and thick. 

If all the places and items recommended on this list are as good as Underdogs, I'm in! 1 down, 99 more to go... womp womp.
author: Natalie O.

description:
I just received a message from the general manager at Taco Shop, and apparantly they can make vegan tacos because the "rice, beans, red and green salsas, and Grilled Corn and Black Bean Salad are all free of any animal products" - just omit the cheese on the veggie taco or burrito.

Still, I would have liked to see it on the menu. It makes me feel happy that vegans are at least acknowledged as people who eat (and I'm a vegan who eats a LOT!).

Anyway, thanks for the message, Eric Dahm. :) Next time friends invite me there, I'll definitely try more food and update my star rating as necessary.
author: Miss C.

description:
So far, Nick's is the BEST fish taco I have EVER had! Remember to get it Nick's way and have it with a Mexican coke and a basket of chips!! 

Their a bar also so if you want a great place to eat while watching the game, they have several large plasma's on the wall so you can view from almost anywhere in the place.

I can't wait to come back here on a Taco Tuesday and get them for only a buck each!:)
author: Petra S.

description: Best burritos I ever had in my life . Great hot sauce, service and chips and sasla. Loved our server and the atmosphere of the whole place !
author: Gina B.

description: Fish tacos's Nick's way or no way.. delicious. They have a special on Tuesday's, $2 dollar tacos that make you holler.. but they are kinda on the small side. It's always packed in there at night so you should come a little early to try and get a seat.
author: Lily S.

description: Great tacos, Nicks way. Great chips and salsa and great elote con queso. I had the Baja and I tried the carne asada taco
author: Andy H.

description:
This is BY FAR the worst "sports bar" I've ever been to!!!  I'm not even sure i can call it a sports bar.  It should just be called a "football bar."

I went there today to watch the Warriors game, a BAY AREA basketball team, and apparently basketball isn't important enough for them, or, they might be scared of some of their customers or something because they wouldn't change the channel on even just ONE of the MULTIPLE TVs they had when I asked.  Initially, they were going to, but these 3 fat pigs were crying and getting butt hurt, so the staff decided to kiss their asses and NOT change the channel.  The nerve of the 3 fat snobs too, acting as if they owned the place.  These 3 overweight idiots acted as if they couldn't turn their fat asses to the side tv that was CLOSEST to their TABLE!!!  Guess just that little bit of movement would've been too much exercise for them.

EVERY TV had on the niners game so I have NO CLUE what the issue is in a "SPORTS bar" where you can't change just ONE of the TVs.  The Warriors are a LOCAL TEAM too!!!!  Yeah, I get that the Niners are on and football is a "big deal" as well, but they have like 8+ tvs or so.  There should be NO problem in a so called sports bar to change just ONE of the TVs.  I bet this bandwagon ass place will show the Warriors in the playoffs though huh?  Lame ass spot.  Never seen a "sports bar" NOT support ALL their local teams.  So if you're a Niners fan, then YAY for you because I'm a Niners fan too but I ALSO came to watch the Warriors game.  Just because it's football season doesn't mean that it can't be basketball season too.

Anyway, I'm definitely NEVER going back to that lame ass wanna be sports bar and SOOOO glad I went back to get the tip they did NOT deserve.
author: Scott H.

description: Not the best food in the world. Everything is pretty much piled on but the actual meat has no flavor in the tacos or quesadilla. The pork was really bad too, it was thick and didn't even fall apart. Supper dry and just not the best! I guess when u have a couple of drinks in u, this place sounds amazing, but truly the pictures in yelp just make it seem to be flavorful. The guac sucked too, this place was just a disappointment
author: Andre L.

description: I usually come here for the $2 tecate and nick's way tacos. After all this time I never knew the had the California burrito. When I ordered it, it was completely different from San Diego's version of a Cali-Burrito. At underdog's, the fries were more like seasoned potato wedges, perhaps some may like it, but I wasn't used to it. And in san diego they're more like shoestring fries. All in all, the California burrito at Underdog's wasn't bad, just not a tradition California burrito from San Diego.
author: Robin L.

description: The Tacos are pretty bomb. Best in the sunset by a solid margin, but that's not saying a whole lot. Celia's is ok on taco Tuesday, but any other day I'm all about taco shop at underdogs. The salsa in the squeeze bottles is hella dope. Get the tacos Nick's way.
author: Dakota S.

description: Came here on a mellow Monday afternoon. Carissa was very attentive and helpful even though she had lots of other guests to attend to. She patiently walked us through the menu and answered allergy questions with ease. What a peach, will definitely be back again!
author: Alejandra B.

description: I had a burrito here and it was terrible. Bland, not fresh at all. I don't know why all the good reviews but I'm not impressed. Never coming back to this place to eat.
author: Hugh M.

description:
What a poor excuse for Mexican food.  I ordered their "street tacos" and found that I was a fool for doing so.  I guess I should have trusted my gut when I saw the quotation marks around street tacos.  Don't try to claim the fame if you can't bring it.  

I asked for two asada and one carnitas and they couldn't even get that right.  Also, what in the world is a place serving tacos doing not serving one of the most basic meats, al pastor?  Then to charge an arm and a leg because they have a full bar or something of that nature.  I'm not sure what the excuse is with that one.  Not to mention, no carrots, jalapenos, or radish.  Also, one lime for 3 tacos?  Get real!  When I did ask for jalapenos they charged me 50 cents for raw jalapenos.  FYI - street tacos tend to come with all the fixings on the side.  To top it all off, carne asada beef was like chewing on a boot.  If you are gonna charge that much for a taco, those meats better be grass-fed.

Potatoes in ones burrito and then charging $10?!!!  Really?!!!  I'm not even gonna start on that mess.  

I appreciate it when restaurants get creative with foods from different cultures, but I am also hell-bent on sticking to plain ole traditional style.  What this place is doing is putting a bad name to tacos and Mexican food.  I'm surprised people have rated it this high.  Maybe I'm just a snob.  I got 3 legit street tacos in LA for 3 bucks and all the fixings on the side.  So much more satisfying.  Also, they made their abuse meat not so shoe-like consistency.  

Work on it Undergod, you'll get it.  But if you folks make enough money on the drinks and don't care about the quality of your food, than more power to you folks.  But that was my first and last time there.
author: Shin L.

description: DIVE BAR! Which makes it totally awesome on so many levels. I went there for taco tuesday! $2 street tacos and $3 Tecate! The tacos were delicious and the homemade salsa they have as well are really good. The Habenero was super spicy, but had great flavor. All the staff seemed very charming and the bartender 'Wes' i believe his name is, was a doll and very helpful with recomendations.
author: Adyson S.

description:
I love going to this place to watch sports. However, if it's bay area sports you better get there early to get a seat. 

The food is great, I especially love the nachos and burritos, and of course the tacos nick's way are delicious. The staff is nice and helpful also. I plan to make this spot my regular sports watching venue.
author: Laura C.

description:
It was my first time in here last Friday and I had a great experienced. It is just so bad that I went there only alone (this place is good for groups), but everything goes well.
I ordered Anchor Steam and Chips/salsa. Hmmm... good!

The bartenders are all friendly! They are so kind after I went out the restaurant, they chase me to give my phone that I left. THANK YOU GUYS!

I'll be back here again, and I'll introduce this to my buddies!
I wanna try Nick's Crispy tacos when I come back.. they said it is good!
author: Calvin Nicholei L.

description:
I love all the tacos here, Nick's way. Comes loaded with the goods and both crunchy and soft taco outside. I like when there are quality ingredients in my tacos, not straight up fat and oil. Also like the elote con queso (corn).

Gets pretty crazy but worth it. Best tacos in the sunset.
author: Antoinette S.

description: So we can all agree the carne asada rocks the house here!!! Reasonable prices and an amazing staff. What more could you want. Also try the tacos. Make you feel like your in the mission district :)
author: Tj J.

description: Went here to watch game 3 Warriors v. Clippers back in April. It was my first time in a sports bar and I'm so glad my boyfriend talked me into it! Underdog's is a great place to eat, drink, and enjoy yourselves. We were able to grab a seat at the bar and enjoyed some tacos Nick's way while watching the game. Loved the ambience :)
author: Lisa D.

description: Long wait, blonde bar girl rude and dismissive, bearded bartenders unhelpful and also rude, disgusting uncooked rice in entire burrito, broken arcade that eats your money.  Will never return or recommend to my worst enemy.  Inedible food.  Wasted money.  Wasted time.  They MexiCAN'T.  Take your money somewhere you can actually eat the food.
author: Lisa R.

description:
The taco shop is still one of the best places in the Sunset to check out if you're looking for a sports bar that has delicious food.

If you're looking for an authentic Mexican food in the Sunset, this isn't the place, because it's more of a tex-mex style, but the food is nonetheless great.
Definitely get their tacos Nick's way ( i.e. guacamole, pico de gallo, beans, grilled/fried tortilla), you'll regret it if you order their regular street tacos which pale in comparison.  I've tried the carne asada as well as their fish tacos and both are amazing.  

The only drawback is that since their seating area is limited, there usually is a 15 min wait time in order to get a table (even longer wait when they're showing playoff or Giants games) so be sure to get there early.
author: Ryan C.

description: Wooohooo! I've driven by this place for a year and wanted to check it out. I thought by appearance it was a small taco joint until I finally stopped in. Super cool bar in front with taco joint in the back. Atmosphere A! Service A (about 3 waiters asked me for my order as I stood by the bar to order to go)! Food A! I got the baha style fish burrito and it was ridonculous! Too boot, I didn't get to eat that sumptuous fried fish with slaw on a wheat tortilla until an hour later and it maintained its deliciousness all the way, which is a total shocker. Good salsa, great food and fish like I've only seen in ol mehico! Great fun place for a casual and already known date or your buddies. It's loud so don't expect to romance anyone, just have fun, eat bueno and tome una cerveza. Bit of a surprise but menu say tacos nicks way only to find out the owner was a founder of nicks crispy tacos which I've never got to try but has a brilliant reputation.
author: Andrew S.

description: It was tuesday so that meant it was time for tacos. I am suppose to be on a fruitarian diet for the month of June, but it's not everyday that I get the change to hang with my friend Felipe. So I broke my vows and ordered a taco. I am happy they had vegetarian tacos here. I was quite amazed! I wasn't expecting a taco quite that big! Also to mention all the Beyonce songs they were playing which I like. The place had alot of games which I wish I should have played.I feel that this place is a great destination in San Francisco if you ever find yourself on Irving St and your looking for a different kind of a sports bar.
author: Joey G.

description:
After having a Facebook fight regarding Nor Cal Mexi Food VS. So-Cal Mexi-food (I grew up in Los Angeles but have been here since 1988), I had pretty much given up on finding anything that could satiate me. I got sick of all you Nor Calerz telling me the Mission is where it's at..whatevs. 

Then, lo and behold, walking back from the Library on a Thursday in my new hood, I see The Taco Shop. 

Now...being the sceptic I am, and knowing that Taco Shops are usually in East L.A., I walked in KNOWING my ass was going to be disappointed. 

I sat at the bar, 3 bartenders/tenDRESSES approached me with smiles, smart things to say and genuine love. I guess that "bartenders must be pretentious , hipster assholes to work in SF" memo was NOT given to these kids. They were witty, fun and arguing about the music, which is my first favourite thing next to tacos. Someone didn't want to hear anymore Foster the People so by consensus, like the GOOD 99% do, they opted for Nina Simone and popped on the Warriors Game, served me their special Tecate and a shot of GOOD tequila for $5. 

ARE YOU EFFING KIDDING ME?!?!? Nina Simone, Warriors, Tacos and $5 drink Specials?? I HIT THE MOTHER-LODE...and said as much on my FB Thread War.

Look...for you relocated So-Cal-erz, you will NEVER find rolled tacos in Nor-Cal, get the eff over it.  What you will find?
