A mighty fine street taco, something they call a 'Nick's Crispy' which is indescribably fantastic, even the GUAC, (which surprised me cos I really only like MY Guac. How do they DO it?), and a crew that is by far some of the most smiley, funny, quick witted, welcoming folks round. 

Try it out, if you hate it, you can come and beat me up.
author: emma g.

description:
Their soft-crunchy tacos are CHAMP!! The environment is so cool if you enjoy the sport environment!! Finding park is difficult but I'm telling you, it's a taco worthy!! 

Long live Underdog!
author: Marsha H.

description:
I am so happy i found this place b/c this brought taco tuesday back to my life.
I used to go out to PB, OB, Hillcrest in SD for taco tuesday when I used to live there, tacos and beers are cheap as hell and theyre fucking good
I kind of missed it when I moved back to SF until I heard about this place....

ohh boy taco tuesday is BACK! and they got california burrito and carne asada fries!!!
they were not as good as the ones Ive had in SD, but it was still delicious, i strongly recommend for ppl who havnt tried CALIFORNIA BURRITO and CARNE ASADA FRIES, please go ahead....there are a few side effects to finishing these aka HEART ATTACK and DEATH

their tacos are awesome, and i loved their crispy,fat,greasy,oversized chips and salsa w/ that red and green sauce they bring out together, ive been here 5 times already and im going back to this place today...JOoooIN ME! (evil villain's voice)

4 stars
author: Michael K.

description:
Sports bar & bomb tacos? Hell yeah!

I love the atmosphere at Underdog's. I might be super girly, but sports culture is one I like to partake in, and Underdog's is THE haven for sports aficionados. I've been here before during the NBA finals to watch some games and of course it was packed. So warning - this place does get filled FAST, especially during huge sports events. Despite the table dilemma (and the fact that we probably stood for most of the time), I had fun watching the game, handing out high-fives here and there with strangers. So as a bar, Underdog's is perfect! And they have decent deals. 

But then.....there are the tacos. Don't get anything else. Do yourself the favor and just try one. The two taco combo for $8.50 is seriously a bargain because the tacos are FAT. Totally worth the price - you'll barely finish eating the 2nd taco, trust. Get it Nick's Way (is there any other way?). Also try the pescado "baja" style. I know carne asada is clutch 80% of the time, but their fish taco is dankkkk. It's battered (but not heavily), and the fish is delicious. Not to mention, TONS of guac, as in they just dump like a cup full onto the taco. And it's a soft taco wrapping a hard shell (think Taco Bell's double decker)! Crazy! You basically get that subtle nice crunch. It's like when I add nachos onto my burrito lol. 

Oh and don't forget to put some of their creamy hot sauce. It's a nice addition to your taco. 

$2 chips and salsa - also a must order. 

I love this place. Good times.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Pretty much Rouge with Nick's Crispy Tacos but cleaner and you don't have to wait in a separate line for food. The drink specials at Rouge are better as is the service but Underdogs is cleaner and brighter. The several bartenders were busy cleaning, restocking, prepping but weren't so great at checking with the bar patrons for more rounds. After waiting for awhile, we decided to get the check and head for another cinco de drinko location. Still, I enjoyed the option of ordering food at the bar and the bright and sunny bar. The bartenders were friendly.

I'd def return if in the area.
author: Kiristen R.

description: I love $2 taco Tuesdays!!!! They have the best carnitas street tacos!!
author: Linda L.

description:
What!?! Nick the original creator and chef of the "Nick's Crispy Taco's" in the Sunset? My neighbor's from Russian Hill said, "Yes, this is the real deal." So they took me there, and I had to see it for myself...

I lived in RH over10 yrs and ate at "NCT" nearly every wk. So, did not know what to expect. I ordered my ultimate favorite baja taco/pescado/Nick's way. What I got was a trip thru a time machine when Nick was running that joint on Polk. Wow, this fish taco was perfectly cooked battered & crispy. The freshest guacamole and a hint of lime gives this taco an edge of bursting flavors. How did I forget? that talk of the town taco...This way better than NCT on POLK*  My mouth watering jus talkin about it. Also, love there quesadilla's crispy and delicious too!

Like the vibe of this place. Casual & good place to chill out. Wait staff supberb, accomodating and friendly. This taco place is no underdog...Jealous my old neighbor's live a couple a blocks away who begged me not to YELP about the BEST taco in town.
author: Sandi P.

description:
I decided to come here to check out their famous Nick's style fish tacos, and after having it, I can say I wasn't impressed. I mean don't get me wrong, it was a great taco and I'll definitely be coming back to get some on Taco Tuesdays. But after eating some of the most amazing fish tacos down in Mexico, perhaps my standards for fish tacos are super high. 

So while these are not the best tacos ever, they are really good and I definitely recommend getting it. Plus, there are tons of TVs so you can almost always watch your local teams kick butt with fellow fans in here. Go 49ers and Sharks!!
author: Gajan K.

description: Good drinks.. Good good.. Reasonable prices..... 4 1/2 stars! The only downfall about this place is that it gets PACKED during Giants games.. BUT! .. They implemented a new system.. instead of having us stand guard at tables and staring them down to leave... you put your name down and the workers clean and reserve the tables for you when they leave. This place is a great hangout place.. It'd be nice for them to expand but other than that... No real complaints. :) love coming back here.
author: Meemee T.

description:
First time coming here after hearing from a friend of mines. 

The bar wasn't as full as it would be say last night when the Giants won game 7 of the NLCS, which was nice. Easy to get a seat at the bar and easy to get service since not many people were here. Ordered the carnitas, carne asada, and pollo tacos with the house margarita. Even though the tacos were small (well for me at least), they were still delicious! Tasted even better after dousing them with the condiments. The tacos were easily gobbled down. Can't imagine the eating experience when there is a Giants game or other game taking place. The house margarita was alright. I am not a big fan of alcohol but decided to try it. I haven't had a good experience with tequila drinks but decided to try a margarita since I haven't had one before. I had salt on the rim and personally I think the salt makes tequila taste way worse than it already does. I had to drink a lot of water with my margarita. During my meal, I used many napkins and I felt bad because the bartender always came by to clean up. Not that I couldn't do it myself it's just I had no where else to put them, the tacos were just so good and messy. I didn't get a chance to thank him for that but maybe next time. 

Overall, a good experience. Not too busy since no game was taking place. The tacos are delicious! Will gladly come back to try more and the fish taco for sure next time!
author: Alex T.

description:
Carne Asada taco=bomb.com

This place is exactly what I thought it would be. Loud and crowded and a place to drink and watch sports and get fat

done
author: Timothy G.

description:
"Touchdown B-E-A-R-S!!!" 

This is one cool place to catch College Football with its youthful ambiance, ten TV screens, video games, and floor to ceiling sports memorabilia. I was here last night to catch Cal thump Maryland in a lopsided season opener 52-13 as local product Javid Best rolled up 137 yards on just 10 carries. Front loaded with bar stools and tables, I was sitting at the end of the bar just right before the stacks of large picnic tables in the back. This sports bar is smallish when compared to others but the groups of people coming in and out to catch the game were persistent and spirited. Contrary to the paradigms experienced at many sports bars where boring burgers and artery clogging finger foods can be shortchanging and one-dimensional, their menu offers a full bar with an array of non-repulsive, quasi-authentic Mexican cuisine that was surprisingly likable and delicious. 

My two grilled mahi tacos, one of which was done "Nick's Way", turned out to be a pleasant surprise. The regular taco ($4.50) had a good portion of smoky marinated mahi on top of double corn tortillas smothered with cabbage, cilantro and onions. These tacos were plump and fully stuffed. I thought the mahi was impressive with a smoky taste that complemented well with their green salsa. The Nick's Way ($5.50) had the same baseline ingredients with the addition of fresh guacamole and a fried tortilla to couple with a soft tortilla at the bottom. I'm not sure how the tortilla was fried, but it was nicely seasoned and tasted better than the regular taco. In addition, I thought their complimentary chips were addictive as it was served warm and nicely salted with a thick hearty texture layered with wholesome chunky salsa. My homemade honeydew fresca ($2.50) was sweet and refreshing.  After realizing that their food was actually good, I was no longer surprised at seeing so many people coming in for take outs. 

I had a great time overall. However, there were several limitations to the experience. First, they put the TVs on mute so I couldn't hear any commentaries and play by play analysis during the game. Second, aside from my server Sam, who was outstanding and personable, the other servers looked stressed out, unfriendly, and awkward to talk to. Price was high but I'm willing to overlook the limitations in exchange for an excitable menu and friendly environment to add to the experience of watching a game. They also have free wifi so I may have to bring my laptop here to hold my upcoming NFL fantasy draft. I've never given a sports bar more than a two stars review but here is a 4 stars experience as I plan to come back to follow my favorite Bay Area teams. Go Bears!

Thanks to B.B. and Earl G for the wonderful recommendation!
author: Daniel L.

description:
The food is good. If they get it right. God help you if they get it wrong.

I ordered 2 tacos with out onion baja style. The waiter repeated my order back to me correctly.  When my food came out the server brought 1 taco baja style. I informed her the taco had onions & I had ordered 2 she took it back to be remade correctly. Then my order came back out no onions but nicks way (which I did not order) I did not actually notice since I was deep in conversation. They seemed different but i couldn't say exactly what was different about them until I took the last bite of the first taco & found CHEESE. I recently developed a horrible allergic reaction to cheese (tragic because I love cheese) so I didn't eat any further. The server came & I informed her the order was wrong again & she apologized. I had to ask a second server for my check. When I informed the second server about my food order having been completely wrong she got me my original waiter which had been on lunch.  At which point he began to attack me over my ordering wrong. He refused to admit the accident was on their end. At the time I ordered he had repeated my order to me correctly & he had imputed it as baja because the first one (the one with onions) had come out as baja style NOT nicks way, all of which he kept denying.  It would not have been a big deal I wanted nothing off the he bill just an apology since I had to go deal with an allergic reaction thanks to their mistake. I didn't get any apology from my waiter instead he yelled at me as I walked out out the door. Super disappointed since I would order out eat in during games. Customer service is really nonexistent!
author: Sandra R.

description: $2 tacos everyday? This place is super cheap with food and drinks and I can see myself going here quite often. This place is a sports bar that serves authentic Mexican food. Great place to go by yourself or with friends. I can eat so many of their tacos. Bartenders are also really nice. Its not just beers but they make all kind of cocktails. I highly reccomnd this place to everyone.
author: Danny F.

description: Great spot on irving, and great far happy hour with daily specials. 2$ tacos, 1$ street tacos, and great chips and salsa. I love coming here for taco tuesday and fridays happy hour. The food is grea for the price, and no its not traditional amazing mexifood like found down south or the mission. Its still just tasty, cheap, and great atmosphere.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
I love and have been to this place so much, I figured it was about time i show them some love on Yelp!

I love everything about this place.  All the staff are extremely friendly and attentive, the food is outstanding and the drinks are reasonably priced and well made.  

Ive made friends with all the staff at Underdogs (its hard not to), and theyre the main reason I keep going back.  They are all relatively young, but are always attentive and extremely friendly, and make you feel welcome. If theres a game on TV youre sure to find it on, and if not they'll find a place for you to watch it on one of their many TVs. 

As for the food, this is my go-to place when I want a taco or a snack.  The baja fish taco, (especially Nicks way if you like guac) is outstanding, and the other tacos are consistently delicious. The carnitas is by far the best meat, and i highly recommend trying it in a quesadilla, but avoid the pico de gallo they put in it because itll get soggy. They make their own sauce called baja sauce, which adds a refreshing kick to all the menu items, and both their red and green sauces are a staple on everything  (I even bought some to take home with me).  But you must, MUST, try the elote.  Its corn sprinkled with some form of cheese and spice, and its more addicting than crack. 

I recommend avoiding peak times (Tuesdays and Friday afternoons) because it gets crowded and you cant find a seat, and unfortunately they wont serve you food unless you're seated.   Although if you do go during those times, its $2 tecates on tuesdays, and $1 Margaritas from 6-630 on fridays, so you cant go wrong with the deals. Their $5 southern special (tequila and a shot of tequila) is also awesome so take advantage of that.  

Overall I love this place and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a full meal, a snack or a just a casual drink!
author: Stephen W.

description:
Same idea as Nick's crispy tacos: I do NOT get the fascination with this place. 

At least Nick's has cheap beer. $1 tacos was really nice, even though I would NEVER pay full price for them but the $4 beer put me off to staying longer. 

The carne asada is pretty plan and lacking in flavor compared to other tacos I have had. As a disclaimer I live a block away from Nick's on Polk and work in the Mission so I have a fair amount of experience with tacos in the Mission and my native LA so I have pretty good idea of what I'm talking about here. 

Honestly, go to any taco truck especially La Tonayese out in front of best buy and any day of the week, not just tuesday, you can get $2 tacos that will blow you away. 

On the plus side it is pretty spacious, the servers were attentive and nice and there is a Supershot basketball machine that I used all night. 

Definitely not a bad experience by any means, just painfully average and way too much hype with both of the Nick's place. I think Nick's places would benefit from recruiting someone off a taco truck and having them share some of the taco truck secrets. Just saying.
author: Carlos A.

description:
taco tuesdays, over priced for what it is. the $2 street tacos are underflavored, on the salty side, and seems like it has been sitting for a little while. Slather on that green/orange sauce and it sure does help masks the underlying problems. Only beer special is the $2 tecate in a can, not sure what to even think of that.... 

On the plus side, the fish tacos nicks way are good. But that alone cant carry the place. Overall, overpriced for a taco tuesday.
author: Norman Who Gives The D.

description: Best place for tacos in the Sunset. I had the pleasure of having a kind gentleman named Viktor provide us with delicious food and a customer experience unparalleled to any other restaurant in recent memory. I had the horrid dilemma of choosing between a California burrito or two tacos, Nick's Way. With a smile and a gentle hand on my shoulder, Viktor said to go with the tacos. I sure am happy I did because they were delicious. Viktor made sure we had enough water, hot sauce, and joyful memories that will leave me wanting to return in the near future. Hats off to you, Underdogs and Viktor.
author: Brian S.

description:
I have been here plenty of times. Sort of my go to spot when I am hungry and need something quick and good. I love the vegetarian and chicken tacos. So big and yummy. You just need one and one good beer and you are good to go. 

A dinner for two can easily be just around $20 bucks. Which is AWESOME! 

The staff is easy to talk to and always friendly. It can be a Wednesday night or Sunday afternoon and they are always ready to serve you. 

It does get busy like everyday so be ready to wait sometimes.
author: Nicole M.

description: The combination of excellent Mexican food, a good beer selection and sports means that Taco Shop is almost always busy. If you want to feel like a delicious bus hit you, try substituting fries for rice in a burrito.
author: jon c.

description:
The Taco Shop is my go-to neighborhood place when I don't want to make dinner.  As a busy nursing student I rarely feel like cooking, so suffice it to say, my husband and I eat here regularly.  

I'm a huge fan of their fish tacos-- Baja or grilled--they are both excellent.  I'm not a big fan of Nick's Way (I know this is insanity), so I usually end up ordering one soft taco and splitting it into two.  And then I eat half of my husband's carnitas tacos because I have no self-restraint and these are damn good.  

Sometimes the bartenders will throw in a basket of chips & salsa, but if they don't you should order one.  The chips and salsa are homemade and delicious.

Bonus points for being cheap and showing Giant's games.  

One word of warning--Taco Tuesday is a hot mess.  You can't order food unless you have a seat, and sometimes that can take hours.  Pair that with $2 Tacate (which you can order sans seat), and you have a whole lot of drunk.
author: Katie S.

description:
Good food, great environment, and a bunch of tvs to watch sports.

Another place for Taco Tuesday.

It can get crowded on Tuesdays, but you can usually find some space in there. There are a few picnic style tables in the back, seats at the bar, and a few more tables by the bar. Their food is pretty decent. Had the California burrito here and it tastes great with everything on it. They use tatar tots instead of fries, which I like a lot. 

$2 tacos and tecates on Tuesdays. But they do charge more if you want the tacos "Nick's Way" (w/ sour cream, guac, ect...). So, you pretty much have to pay the extra dollar to get a decent taco. Not a fan of tecate either. But its nice place to hang out and watch basketball or something. Bartenders are very friendly and serve you if you sit at the tables. 

Not a must try place, but decent for some "Mexican" food and a couple drinks.
author: Arthur C.

description:
I am seriously stupefied by some of the reviews here. "Omg they don't offer super cheap stuff for taco tuesday!" "Wah they didn't play my precious NBA game. Don't they know they should cater only to my tastes!" Get over yourselves. They don't have to offer you anything if they don't want to. Also have you thought of asking them to change over one of their ten TVs for you? 

That being said I love this place. It is a great local bar that I come to whenever I visit my friends in the Sunset. The bartenders are super cool and have great memories. After my third visit or so Zane, one of the bartenders, already remembered me. 

The drinks here are fairly standard, you get some local craft brews and a wide selection of liquor to choose from. That is not intended to be a negative statement, after all The Taco Shop is not a pretentious craft cocktail bar. For those complaining about the check-in offer; how long have you been living in SF? A lot of bars advertise specials like that. Is it really a negative that they offer it all day and to anyone?

I think the tacos here are great. You have to get them Nick's way if you want the best experience. I live in San Diego and I have to say that the tacos here stand up and even surpass a lot of the tacos I can get in my area. I will say that the service can be slow at times, but hey, it's a busy place. I think i'll live if I have to wait a little longer before stuffing my face with delicious Tacos.

Now for something very important to me about a bar; the vibe. There's just something very welcoming and friendly about The Taco Shop. I haven't seen many bars where mixed fans can cheer for their sports teams without fear of retaliation. 

There's a reason why I come to this place pretty much every time I'm in San Francisco, other than the fact that it is around the block from my friend's house. It is a great, casual, bar that offers great value for the money. I will continue to come back for more.
author: Ryan F.

description:
I love you, Taco Tuesdays.

I love that the Street Tacos are $1 including tax.  I love that it comes fresh out of the kitchen in five minutes or less.

I love that a bucket of Tecate on ice is $15.

I love my friends for going early to snag a table.

I love the Giants fans all staring at the one or two screens in front of us, cheering against the Dodgers.

I love that I walked out full and happy while only shelling out $10.
author: Jenny L.

description:
I've been meaning to come out here and grub on the taco's that i've been hearing about, but it took me a whole year of living up here to finally come out and try it.  Of all days was on a random day as well.

Came here on a Tuesday unaware that the deals start after 430, so my friend and I decided to grub on some lunch instead.  Had us some chips and guacamole, which was the shiznit!  The chips were definitely on point and didn't like they bought it from a store and threw on salsa.  The guacamole was definitely made at the spot, which is another plus.  My friend and I had the Carnitas Taco "Nick's Way" and I can say that it was definitely delicous and big enough to satisfy a lunchtime hunger.  That mother is filling, plus the chips that started us off...man, I was good to go after that.  Glad I didn't choose to order two tacos, I would have been filled with the ITIS!

Definitely wanna come back during the happy hour and see what these $1 street tacos are all about, not much of Tecate drinker, but I'll definitely make use of that bar if I come buy again!  Service here was dope and came with a smile!
author: Mark L.

description:
I've only been here for the Margarita happy half-hour so I can't comment on the food or normal crowd.

$1 margaritas are pretty good.  Not as good as the 50cent margarita deal they used to offer, but I understand that deal was too good to last.  The margaritas are kinda small... like a plastic Dixie cup size.  And during the 6-6:30 happy hour on Fridays, this place is really crowded.  It's hard to find a place to sit or stand or a place to put your drink down.  Other than the super crowdedness of this place, I really can't complain about $1 margaritas.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Tacos "Nick's way" all day, everyday! Everything is fresh and delicious.....Try their carne asada california burrito! It does not disappoint. 

Their waiters are awesome, service is quick and the place is spic and span!
author: La C.

description:
Um, yum.

Any of the tacos "Nick's Way" and you're golden but I'm a huge fan of the fish tacos. You really only need one to feel comfortable but 2 if you like that feeling of wanting to unbutton your pants to make room for your now bloated belly. Let's be real, get 2 tacos.

It was pretty organized when I went--even on taco Tuesday!--so go ahead and order your drink at the bar and wait for a table to open up or eat at the bar. 

Pretty sure I'm going to be making this spot my regular taco tuesday stop.
author: Amy L.

description:
Walking in you notice a bar and the dirty bathroom and I'm thinking it's 3 stars, but remember it's sort of like a dive so go easy. I was working all day and did not eat anything and wanted tacos.

It's about after 4pm and most tables are filled because it's football on tv. I sat at the only table outside because I've been inside all day and didn't want to hang where it's dark and with cheering football fans. I ordered 3 tacos and it was way too much for me. I don't eat a lot in one sitting but $4.50, times 3 is very reasonable for a meal in this city.

I taste the tacos and it's about one of the best tacos I've had in my life and I'm from Texas so that is saying mucho.

I'm a fan and certainly will be back and next time will have a drink at the bar.
author: Brandon M.

description:
Tacos is the one Mexican dish SF has better than San Diego where I grew up (at least at the 4 places mentioned below) and wile Underdog's are very good they are not the best in town. 

*** Note that the 7x7 Top 100 meals reference in several of the reviews is for the fish tacos at the original Nick's Crispy Tacos (Polk/Broadway) and while the Nick's Way tacos at Underdog's are quite similar to those at Nick's Crispy Tacos I would not call them the same. Note also that Nick himself is no longer affiliated with Nick's Tacos but he is with Underdog's and Tortilla Heights (which is a reason to support the latter places IMO). ***

I give Underdog's 4 stars overall - the food I would rate just a bit lower but the quantity to price value is better than Nick's Tacos/Tortilla heights so I bumped the average to 4 stars. 

The Nick's Way carne asada and carnitas at Underdog's are great tacos but I have to give the original Nick's Tacos (2nd) and the more recent Tortilla Heights the edge (3rd) so I rank this 4th best in SF. La Taqueria at 25th/Mission is still #1. I found the carne asada at Underdog's to have a lot more flavor than the carnitas and found it much more enjoyable. [Update: the baja style fish taco at Underdogs is even better than those at Nick's which was lauded for those in the 7x7 piece last year. It had just the right amount of crispiness and is the best taco at Underdogs. I still prefer the carne at Nick's/la Taqueria though!]

All four places have similar taco formula of one lightly fried corn tortilla inside a soft corn tortilla. Underdogs is the most unique since the inner tortilla is fried more crispy and the outer tortilla is more soft and they give the largest quantity of filling (just above La Taqueria but about 25% more than Nick's IMO). I don't think there is any cheese in the middle but I could be wrong (I only looked when I had 2 bites left).

The green salsa was good but not great (Tortilla Heights and La Taqueria have the best and TH has more variety). At Underdogs there is a 2 Nick's Way taco special for $8.50 and with the larger size it gives the best value of the 4 places. The chips and pico de gallo are very good ($1.50).

The sports bar ambiance feels very much like a surf pub in San Diego, with picnic tables and such and it was a cool vibe that took me back to college days in Pacific/Mission Beach or Solana Beach/Del Mar.

All in all I will go back to Underdog's since it is the closest to where I live and the pub vibe is cool but when I crave the best I will make the trek to La Taqueria or the original Nick's Tacos.
author: Mike L.

description:
Oh how I love the Taco Shop. This place is my absolute favorite spot to hit in the Sunset District and I'd say it's definitely one of the best sports bars in San Francisco (that I've expereinced). But be sure to get there early! If there's a game on (of any kind) it'll be packed to the brim.

This is also one of those bars that isn't only fun to come and hang out for a drink, but man oh man, they've got bomb food! You gotta get the taco -- preferable the baha taco (which made the 7x7 Big Eat SF). It's my absolute fave and I always get it when I come here - Nick's way of course! And by "Nick's way" I mean your taco comes with one grilled crispy corn tortilla and one soft tortilla, filled with monteray jack cheese, pinto beans, pico de gallo, and guacamole. Here, Nick's way is the only way.

But my newest discovery is the Elote con Queso -- fresh white corn on the cob brushed with lime salsa and then dusted with cotija cheese and cayenne pepper. The ultimate party in my mouth for only $3.50!

The Taco Shop also has fabulous happy hour that you gotta stop by and check out! Starting at 5pm on Tuesdays, tacos and Tecates are oly $2 until close! Sounds like a good deal to me :) They've also got a great deal on margaritas on Fridays that will lead to trouble ;)
author: Sara K.

description:
Sports, beer & tacos, who wouldn't love that?

Plus nice staff & amazing sauces. 
Make sure to order your tacos Nicks Way! 

The only downside is that the chips & salsa is such a big order that you can't possible finish it before the chips get soggy. Perhaps they should put the salsa/guacemole on the side.
author: Helen D.

description: I loved their corn and crispy tacos! I would definitely come back! The only down side is the lack of seating this place is busy! If you are in the area and want to have some delicious carne asada tacos this place is perfect for that. Be prepare to wait for a spot! Perfect for date night :)
author: Claudia H.

description:
Came here for the first time during the All-Star baseball game on Taco Tuesday.  I could see myself getting frustrated if there was a long wait for a table or for my food, but it didn't happen while I was there.  The servers were on top of their game and never dropped the ball.  

- Chips and salsa - $1.50
- Pescado "Baja" Style taco made Nick's way - $5.25
- Carnitas Taco - $2.00

Nick's way is apparently the best way to go.  You get a taco made with one grilled corn torilla, one soft tortilla, monterey jack cheese, pinto beans, pico de gallo, and guacamole.  So good!  The Taco Tuesday deal (only for regular tacos) is kind of pointless since you're going to want everything Nick's way.  A little bit more expensive than some of the taquerias in the east or south bay, but I'd definitely come back here to watch some games and grab some drinks.

MLOU's TIPS
------------

1) Taco Tuesday (5:00pm to closing): $2 tacos; $2 Tecates

2) Happy Hour (M-F; 4:30p to 6pm): $1 street tacos, $2 Tecates

3) $1 Margaritas (Friday; 6:00p to 6:30pm)
author: Marilou A.

description:
I used to do Thirsty Thursdays with co-workers at Taco Shop/Underdogs but been way too busy to socialize lately, however dragged my BF on a Sunday to get nachos and take out burritos for a later meal- what a disappointment!  
Nachos were cold, little meat and no cheese. Only saving grace was being able to watch Giants win.
 Had burritos on Monday and they were mislabeled, so BF got my steak w/ jalapeños and I got his carnitas, which was so dry I threw it away!  Not what I remember from Taco Shop.
What happened?  Bad day in kitchen or quality gone downhill?
I usually recommend this place all the time, but am not sure if I will anymore.
author: May C.

description: Love the carnitas taco here with the red salsa.  Must get it Nick's Way.
author: Miles C.

description:
Out of the "Nick's-style" places, this is my favorite. And not just because it's the most neighborhoodie and where I've most often chatted with Nick.

I love this place, but it's inconsistent. The salsas are usually great but are often a little different one time to the next. The grill on the shrimp is usually just right but is sometimes way charred, others way light (but cooked). The vibe is friendly and casual except when it's spilling over due to a big sports game.
author: Sam P.

description:
Wow, it's a sports bar in the Sunset. And it's actually good. And it has delicious food. That's a winner in my book.

Underdog's is a long narrow bar with some picnic style tables in the back and plenty of sports related paraphernalia. There are a bunch of TVs behind the bar showing baseball, football, MMA, pretty much any sporting event going on.

But the food is the star here. If you get some tacos, you can get the cheaper street style tacos. But instead of doing that, get it Nick's Way (one grilled crispy corn tortilla and one soft, filled with monterey jack cheese, pinto beans, pico de gallo and guacamole). You won't regret it. That crispy corn tortilla in the middle screams to be eaten.

The 7x7 list has the Pescado "Baja" Style Taco Nick's Way - Beer battered fish in two soft corn tortillas with cilantro, cabbage & red onions, served with lime & roasted tomato salsas, depending on your preference. I've never had a better tasting fish taco. The fish was crispy, just perfect. And when Nick's Way says pico de gallo and guacamole, they mean it. Stuffed to the brim. I also had the Carnitas Taco Nick's Way, but it was nowhere as good as the fish taco. The food is a bit pricey, but worth it.

I need an opportunity to come back here with a group of friends and share a bucket of beer while watching a game. Sounds like a plan.
author: Ryan C.

description:
This place is the best. Cool people, cold beer, and awesome food. I have been coming here for years, and I love how although it is so popular, it still maintains that homestyle bar vibe. Avi, Cody and the rest of the staff really know how to make you feel welcome.

As a starter I would definitely go with the corn elote on the cob. TO F*CKING DIE FOR. It is essential to try the baja fish and the shrimp tacos nicks way, as these are what make underdogs so delectable. On a cold night, the tortilla soup is the way to go!
author: Alex G.

description:
Well..

+ The bar atmosphere is cool, basketball machine in the back and some benches for taco/enchilada munchin'. I haven't been at night yet, so I can't give it fair justice. Seems like it could be a'lot of fun 

+ Sports & Alcohol= win win

-  Sorry guys, I was actually disappointed in the Nick's way crispy taco. I'm from the east bay and gotta admit... tacos are way better over there. Didn't seem to catch the essence of a "crispy" taco, and got too soggy by the end. Also... wayyyy over priced in my opinion. $4-5 for 1 taco?? Whoa... Taco truck=wayyy cheaper, and better.

+ chips and salsa were pretty bomb, wish it was super spicy though.

Conclusion: I probably will go there one Tuesday to make the $$ worth it.
author: Julia D.

description: "I'll have a San Diego. Carne asada. Extra pico. Side of Chips."
author: Garland W.

description: $1 margaritas on Fridays from 6-6:30 are the best way to end the week! It's great because they're pretty attentive about refilling your glass and they dump out your ice. The tacos are also $2 the and they are absolutely delicious. The steak tacos with guac and their hot sauce are the perfect accompaniment to the margaritas.
author: Grace P.

description:
Nothing special about this place really.  Typical bar, but it does have a lot of flat screens to catch sports.  When there's a big sporting event, especially, its hard to find a seat.

Drinks are reasonably priced, but their mixed drinks (I got rum and coke on top of others) were weak.  The bartender who "waited" on us was rude, because I waited for half a minute in front of him while he was organizing the glasses to finally take our order.

On a Friday night, the crowd was dying down but it was barely midnight when we were told it was closing.  I haven't been drinking too late these days, but I remember SF's last call is after 1 AM.

The only pluses for this place that make it stand out is the basketball arcade game and the Street Fighter II arcade in the back.  Get my quarter ready!
author: Chan L.

description:
the food here is pretty good. I can understand why it was chosen in the 7 x 7 list. The boy and I ordered 2 tacos each and an alcoholic drink. My drink of choice? A margarita of course. It was pretty well made. He got a beer. 

I ordered a carne asada taco and a fish taco both nicks way. The guacamole is actually really good. The boy ordered a carnitas taco and fish taco both nicks way too. Surprisingly they are super filling. 

They almost forgot our chips, but whatevs. We got them in the end.

It was quite packed cause it was tuesday and there was a giants game on, but it wasn't too hard to get seats...
author: Nina Y.

description: Really??? A lot of people need to sober up before they do a YELP review. The food was good but a lot more average than we expected given the 4-star rating. It was definitely overpriced for what we received - - - which may have been more acceptable if it had been more exciting to our tastebuds.
author: Jim H.

description: Disappointing service is all I can say. They made a mistake on our to go order but had the nerve to give us the attitude when we complain about it. The two guys behind the counter today definitely need some customer service training. I understand that it's busy but your job is in customer service. Not asking you to wipe my ass but man, be professional. Too bad we did not  get the names of these boys.
author: Kitie P.

description:
Have been very forgiving with their lack of quantity (and quality) when it comes to their San Diego burrito (carne asada, guacamole, cheese). Asked for extra meat with no salsa and got what amounted to a kids burrito. Excuse for the size was that there was no salsa in it. Meat does not have flavor to it and have given up on this place.

Encountered this same problem with their carne asada quasadilla that I ordered a few days ago. Don't even get me started with having to wait 30 minutes for my food to be delivered.

Great place to grab some chips and salsa and watch sports, but go to a taqueria for some Mexican food, because it isn't here.
author: David A.

description: Long term staff causes problems with customers.  The service is ALWAYS slow and hostile.  They drive away the new employees.
author: User N.

description:
The underdog is famous for their tacos and 2$ beers. As you can expect this is very crowded. Most of the people come here for the many tvs which broadcast baseball and basketball games.

Le Underdog est connu pour ses tacos et bieres a 2$. Par consequence le bar est bonde. La plupart des clients viennent pour voir les matchs de baseball et basketball sur les nombreux ecrans.
author: Mark B.

description: Can't beat this Taco Tuesday spot in the Sunset! I've also been here for Sunday football, which was packed as well! It's more of a margarita/beer bar, so I suggest skipping on ordering fancy shmancy cocktails. Don't expect the best service because you WILL wait forever to get a server's attention if it's busy, but the good thing is that the food comes in a timely manner. Definitely order your tacos Nick's way! And get the elote. YUMMMM.
author: Cat M.

description:
I've always been in the area of The Taco Shop at Underdogs and everytime I pass by folks are spilling out and watching the game there.

My clinical group and I decided to grab some lunch here and damn am I glad we did. My friend recommended the quesadillas and also mentioned the fish tacos being bomb. The beast in me wanted to get both but she said that the quesadilla was going to be enough. Soooo, I just got that.  I believe I got the carne asada, my friend also asked them for the "fire" sauce. I was like "Oh, okay, I see you, asking for stuff that's not on the table aye. Must be a regular here".  The quesadilla came and OMG, that baby was no joke.  I was imagining, you know, a quesadiila, two flat tortillas with the stuffing in between. But this one came out like a crispy smashed burrito.  I ain't even complaining cause it as bomb.com and then some. Freakin loved the smashed burrito aspect of it and the crispiness of the tortilla was just perfecto. I'm determined to go back for the fish tacos and for a game. Hallelujah, holla back!
author: Annie C.

description:
As you know, I love Mexican food.  If I had to pick one restaurant from which I had to eat every meal for the rest of my life, it would be a Mexican restaurant.  Just by virtue of serving Mexican food, I usually rate a restaurant highly on Yelp.

This place is terrible.  My wife wanted to try it, so we ordered delivery through Postmates this evening.  Her shrimp were burnt, my carnitas was burnt, and even the chips were burnt.  The salsa was soggy, disgustingly soggy - I took a picture.  I understand the name now - the food tasted like it was made under a dog.

Credit where credit is due - Postmates issued a full refund for our inedible disgusting 'food'.  

Going forward, when we're looking for Mexican food, we'll go to El Toreador, Dos Pinas, El Burrito Express, Gordo, or one of the many excellent places in the Mission.  Definitely no reason to subject ourselves to this place again.
author: David B.

description:
What an amazing place! Cheap beer and food! whats not to love
I go there for there cheap Vegetarian Soft and crispy shell tacos.
author: Charles C.

description: Food is good and fresh. Nachos con pollo are awesome. Would give this place a four to five star rating if the service was ANY better. Service was awful. Waited for anyone to look our way.  Had to chase someone down for forks. Had to chase someone down to close our tab. Will consider any other joint if possible because the service is so terrible.
author: Katie B.

description: I've been hearing about this place for the past four years. Finally got a chance to try the tacos.  I had the fish taco's along with the carne asada tacos both done Nick's way.   These were so tasty it made me wish I had five stomachs. I was full after two.
author: Carb Q.

description:
This is my favorite place ever ever ever!! My friends and I go here at least 5 times a month. We are willing to wait 30 min for a table. The food is good, the drinks are yummy. Margaritas are a little expensive, but Fridays 6:00-6:30 they are a $1!! WOW!
its a tad loud on game nights so just beware of that!! 

Awesome place, go there and enjoy!
author: Lauren L.

description:
Roaches.  Under the table, along the wall, crawling up my leg (okay, that was probably just my imagination).  A serious infestation though--this place is in trouble.  GROSS.

The manager brought us tequila shots after we showed him pictures of the little buggers running around our food.  On the brighter side.
author: Sean O.

description:
I have to say this place is pretty freakin amazing. It's super crowded, but what place have I gone to that's not crowded for taco tuesday? My cousin and I only waited about 15 mins so it wasn't that bad. 
The tacos are delicious with the hot sauce/salsa they have in the bottles. I'm going to have to come back and try a taco Nick's Way. Basically it's a fried tortilla wrapped around a soft tortilla taco. Sounds pretty bomb doesn't it? $3 tecates you can't go wrong. I think next time I'll get a bucket for $15. Oh and one more thing they have a special where it's $.50 for a house margarita on fridays from 6-6:30. Yeah, I said it. 50 cents! I'll get six please. I'm sold.
author: Tanya S.

description:
The worst burrito I have ever had by a long shot.  It was allegedly a fish burrito consisting of fish and cabbage and nothing else and came to me virtually cold and somewhat wet.  In my opinion this place has no business selling burritos, much less selling something like this for over $9.00.  Incredibly lousy.

The cider and beer were fine, but that's because this place didn't make them.

My friend did like his taco.  So if you come here stick to tacos I guess.
author: Scott A.

description:
This review is for one of their bartenders, JAMIE and her service.  Okay, I've been coming here on and off for the past couple months because it's next door to my favorite pho spot that I eat every sunday night.  I didn't think this was going to be any special than the last happy hour... until Jamie arrived.   She made last Friday honestly one of the best happy hours I've been to in a looooooong time.  After an unfortunate mistake with my first beer, she was quick with a fix and even took care of my first shot of Jame(son), then she goes, "OMG that's awesome I'll take one with you, my name is Jamie"!  Then she promptly took care of our order and recommended God's tacos haha.  We all ordered one fish taco and one shrimp taco each (NICKS WAY!!!) based on her recommendation.  And the beers and shots of Jameson flowed for almost three hours as we watched the opening day Giants game.  Being the orange and black faithful that I am, I started chants and riled everyone up numerous times while we watched the game.  We even had a crowd gather around our corner and we became the loudest cheer section! After it was said and done, she said our group rocked and wanted us there for all Giants road games.  I think we'll make it happen.  I even invited her to sit in one of my seats at the yard for a home game because she was that darn awesome.

So in summary, if you're in the area and it's a Giants game, stop on in for good food, good drinks, good atmosphere and plain old good time. You'll walk out of there with new friends, I promise. Two thumbs up! Our group was happy, full off amazing tacos, nachos, chips & salsa, shots of Jame, IPA, and the Stella was at the perfect temperature placed in frosted mugs.  The girls had a pitcher of sangria which was on hit.  And of course, we had the best bartender of all, also dressed in Giants gear too and just as loud as us may I add... lol THANK YOU JAMIE! See you at the next road game! :)
author: Myke Y.

description:
Love this place. The food is so good, and I love the ambiance. Perfect place for a beer and some tacos to kick off a night out or just as a fun dinner during the week, or to watch a game. Their condiments are amazing too. 

There was a period of time when we went and we kept ordering chips and salsa and they just never came, or came way late in the meal so we stopped ordering them. Maybe it was a new server or something. 

They do takeout too which is awesome, but the only issue is it takes longer than they predict for the food to come out. 

Still, I keep coming back for those yummy fish tacos! :)
author: Amanda G.

description:
i love this place. whenever i'm in the sunset visiting buddies, i always have this place in the back of my head. the tacos are different than the usual roach-coach fare i dabble with in Oakland, and i mean that in a good way.

if i remember correctly, its a soft tortilla wrapped around a fried tortilla with GENEROUS helpings of guacamole, meat and salsa. absolutely kcufing delicious. i can't recall the sauces they had on the tables, but they certainly were the whipped cream on this meaty sundae. i chased em down with a good ol' fashion Boilermaker, and then i was in my own private beach party. 

highly recommended if you're in the area for a casual outing.
author: Sean L.

description: Nice day out in the city. Was in need of some cold beverage and tasty mexican food. I got the San Francisco Burrito and it was delish!!! Flavorful and meaty. I loooovvveeeed their spicy red sauce. We also got the chips and salsa...the salsa was really fresh and yum but I gotta say that the chips were super/too crunchy/stale/oily. That has to be my only complaint. I really liked this place and have to come back for their amazing looking nachos and tacos!!!
author: Michelle I.

description: What an awesome quesadilla!! This restaurant has become a permanent fixture on my must-taste list in the city.
author: Marisa D.

description:
came here to watch the NBA finals with a bunch of friends and the place was PACKED!

We got lucky and found a table and we all squeezed in around it

I ordered their tacos, which come with a BIG portion of guacamole and sour cream over the meat. hella good!

I tried their carnitas and carne asada tacos, both which I highly recommend.

We also ordered their nachos, but I didn't think they were that good. The cheese was aiite and it didn't really have anything enticing about it. I remember there being more beans than anything else.

Def check this place out if you wanna watch a game and get some tacos though!
author: Steven C.

description:
Tacos + Beer + Sports = AWESOME

I've been having mad intense cravings for Nick's Way fish tacos lately. It's genius. One crispy shell, One soft shell, add in the fillings, combine it with the red sauce...damn. I want one now and I just had lunch!
author: Jenny M.

description:
Supposedly, the best way to have food is "your" way, but over at The Taco Shop At Underdog's, the best way to have food is "Nick's" way. 

Nick's Way: one grilled crispy corn tortilla and one soft, filled with monterey jack cheese, pinto beans, pico de gallo and guacamol

Grilled Shrimp Taco + Nick's Way + Hungry Me = Party in my Mouth. Woot woot! 

Nick's way tacos have definitely set the standard to how every taco should be. Juicy, saucy, savory, crispy, delicious! And the best part to Nick's Way tacos is one taco won't leave you disappointed! You'd think two would suffice, WRONG! One taco provides mounds of flavor, fulfillment and pure satisfaction that ordering two is just not necessary (okay maybe I lie, perhaps those of a bigger build and lumberjack appetite can accomodate two, but for my medium size frame, one taco was just enough) Also get the chips and salsa with guacamole and drench it with their red sauce and if you're feeling brave, go right on ahead with their extra hot habanero sauce for that extra kick. 

Skip the $1 tacos and splurge an extra $4.25 for some Nick's Way tacos, it'll totally be worth every penny.
author: Ally C.

description: This review is for service not the food.  Twice they have messed up to go orders.  Last time we said extra guacamole and when we got home the burrito said no quac.  We paid extra Nd did not get the correct item at all.  We called and we did get them to give us a free burrito so that was nice. However how someone can go from extra quac to no quac I just don't know.
author: Graham T.

description:
First time here because friend of friend wanted to eat here. Tacos were pretty amazing. Went on a Monday with 6 people and bill came out to 110.00. Service is horrible. Very unprofessional. She was rolling her eyes and made it so obvious that she was annoyed when we asked questions. Should go find another job if she cant provide good customer service. Another fact that was extremely rude was, as the server came by to "pre-buss" our plates, she goes around and says, " do u guys mind throwing ur dirty napkins in here?" It's her job as a server to clean. Isnt that why we paid gratuity? I was very unhappy with the service here.

Would I return?

Probably only Tuesdays because they have the Tuesday $2 special on all tacos. Spend total $5~$6 including tip on Tuesdays is so much worth it since service literally sucks. As a matter of fact, i wouldn't dine in. I'd togo my food.
author: Ella A.

description: Staff is very nice for the most part. Food is excellent and makes me water at the mouth. Try the French fry cheeseburger burrito, you won't be disappointed. Kudos!
author: None O.

description:
Overall: Daayam good fish tacos!

Food: Fish Tacos Nicks Way - hands down so freakin' awesome. MUST MUST MUST. For close to 6 bucks - you get this crispy fat juicy fish taco with guacamole spilling from the sides. Make sure you ask for some bottled sauce to put over it. So damn good. Not a fish lover - but this has me converting.

Liquor: It's a bar - so liquor a 'plenty.

Decor: Small neighborhood joint... place is narrow... as you walk in the long stretch of bar is on the right and stool tables fit for 4 or less is down the left hand side. Some park benches in the back for bigger groups. 

Service: Hit or miss - come when theres not alot of ppl - they are all hands on helping ... when its during a sports event or ufc fight or busy hour - make sure you put ur foot out to get a waitress attention - lol im kidding - but yea.
author: Mary P.

description:
There are certain places that will ruin your standards for a particular item or service. In the case of a good "fish taco", Underdog's is that place. 

Because of the "Baja" style fish tacos NICK'S WAY (Nick's Way is key here, people), I now simply cannot go back to other places' fish tacos. Throw in their great salsa's made at the restaurant, and you've got yourself a delicious fiesta o' flavor.

Honestly, friends, there's nothing like it. They use a soft tortilla as the actual "taco" part, but they layer it with nacho chips. Utter genius. Then you've got the crunchy cabbage, the crispy fish filet, sour cream, guacamole...simply divine. And don't be scared of the price of one taco NICK'S WAY (about $5.50). These fish tacos are larger than most. 

And I really dig the atmosphere here. It's more like a sports bar, but I love that. I really do. There's nothing like being surrounded by people who are just as passionate as you (if not more so) about a sports team. The bartenders here are awesome folks, as well. Good sense of humor, which is always a winner. 

Case in point: Get the FISH tacos NICK'S WAY. The only time you shouldn't is IF and ONLY IF you are allergic to seafood. Other than that, you have NO EXCUSE! NO EXCUSE!
author: Daniel M.

description:
My first visit made me want to give it a 4 (based mostly on the tacos), but I had a really annoying experience recently that knocked down the score significantly. 

Before I begin, I just want to point out that this is a sports bar. It's on their website. Check it out. 

Ok, now the rant. I really don't watch sports, but when I do, it's cool to do it at a sports bar. I assumed that since Underdog's describes itself as a sports bar, it would work out. So, I took myself and my two Canadian friends to watch the Stanley Cup at Underdog's. The Stanley Cup, while not the most celebrated of things in America, is still a finals event in a professional sport. However, most of the tvs here didn't even have it on. Not only that, but there was some ambient techno being played rather than the game's play. 

We politely tolerated the techno for the first period and a half. In the meantime, we were served by some really surly waitress who made us lift up all of the items on the table to wipe it down and then instead of telling me whether or not they had Miller Lite, made me refer to the menu (which I didn't realize had a beer list) by saying, "We only serve what's on the menu." That's pretty rude I must say. She also was intent on straightening the wrinkled paper menus, which a friend of mine noticed on a separate trip with another server. Is it a requirement of the wait staff to be OCD? 

Finally, we admitted defeat and acknowledged that it was just too weird to watch a game with a Brian Eno soundtrack. We asked a waitress (not ours) if the sound could be put on while I asked for water for the second time. She told us she'd ask. Then our waitress walked up, and said no way, that the owner doesn't do that. Doesn't play the sound to games? At a sports bar? Weird! 

But we did finally get our water. After guzzling a few glasses, we moved our party to Kezar. As we traveled, I was really nervous that SF just isn't a hockey town, and maybe Underdog's was a reflection of all SF sports bars. I was so wrong. Kezar totally delivered - the place was packed, with nearly every tv tuned to the game, complete with audio. There were fans screaming, drinking, and doing what people do in a real sports bar, not a pseudo-sports-hipster one.
author: Kim S.

description:
Did you ever have that disappointment when you go to a taco shop and when you order and you ask for extra guacamole and they dont really give the extra guac, well not at The Taco Shop!!! They pile on that shhhhht, their taco's are amazing and so was there Sangria!!! 

My mouth is watering just thinking about both, when do I get to go back?
author: T C.

description: My good friend absolutely loves this place.  I think the food is delicious and fresh.  A bit pricey IMHO.  Overall a decent place if you like the boisterous college crowd, drinking beer, and watching sports.  Should be 3 and 1/2 stars.
author: Lawree S.

description:
I have a love/hate relationship with this place.

When I first moved to the Sunset in January, I was still trying to find my bearings, get used to my new kitchen, etc.  So, I ate out.  A LOT!  I mean, I eat out all the time, but I also love to cook so it's usually 50/50.

As I walked down Irving, I noticed a surfboard and a sign that read "The Taco Shop."  

I peeked in and noticed a bunch of T.V.'s with sports and plenty of beers in the coolers.  So, without hesitation I bellied-up to see what I could find.

To my complete shock and delight, I discovered that they had the same menu as Nick's Crispy Taco's, the place on Polk and Broadway.  I had a mild addiction to the food there and knew that I was in good hands.

Fast forward to about $200 of my own money, another $300 with friends from out of town, another $500 in recommendations and a very pregnant friend who had to have the fish burrito everyday for the last weeks of her pregnancy and it's obvious where I stand.  The food is consistently good, fresh and made the same way every time.  

I love the Carne Asada Taco Nick's Way ($4.50) and the California Burrito ($7.25).  The quesadillas are massive and stocked-full of cheese and fresh ingredients. ($4.00-$7.50).  They are big enough to share. 

That is the love part.

Let's discuss my mild frustration:  the service.

I have learned to stick my head in to see who is working.  I have 2 favorites who usually work during the day.  Never drama, always friendly and always efficient.

This is the hard-part for me.  I know only too well how a day can go pear-shaped for numerous reasons, but I do know when  staff is collectively pickled in alcohol and while it seems fun, it can also be really annoying when you have to repeat your order several times.  I actually can deal with it, but if someone came in for the first time, they might consider it a turn-off. 

I recommend getting anything for take-out, and if it is busy, think-twice. The staff, while fun and seem to enjoy their job enough, just don't hit it out of the park as consistently as the kitchen.
author: Gina H.

description:
I was a big fan of Nicks Tacos a few years back. 

Maybe it's me but it's not worth the crowded bar scene and wait.  I would come back on a slow day but will avoid the bar scene.
author: Cin T.

description:
Let's get the useful out of the way first:

Happy Half Hours on Fridays-6:00pm-6:30pm...
Fifty Cent Margaritas. Yes, that's .50 or less than half a euro.

They claim to be the "the home of the $3 Tecate" at ALL times, and they make delicious tacos, have Sierra Nevada on tap and cute and efficient bar wenches and whatever the male equivalent of a wench is.

Worth a detour, especially if you're stuck in nasty 19th Ave traffic. Come on in, watch a game, play a game, conversate, have a taco.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Traveling alone kind of sucks, even in your favorite city in the world. As cool as it is to be hanging in SFO, drinking and eating alone is sometimes not so great. So, when you find a place where you don't feel like a weirdo for being on your own, that's worth telling people about.

An old college buddy recommended The Taco Shop to me. I figured Saturday at 1pm is as good a time as any to go to the bar alone. You know - there's football on. And makes a woman drinking alone totally acceptable - you can just blend in with the screaming masses when something exciting happens with the pointy ball.

TSU was busy but not totally packed. I grabbed a bar stool at the end of the counter and was quickly served a truly spicy bloody mary with all the fixings. A carnitas taco "nick's way" soon followed - overflowing with guac goodness, crunchy taco inside of a soft taco shell, and lots of red and green sauce within my immediate reach for $4.50 - a steal.

I learned this is sort of a Michigan bar, which was kind of cool since I myself went to a Big 10 school, it almost felt like being among my own people. There was cowbell aplenty, a mixed crowd of young and old, parents and kids, dog in the doorway, etc. All themakings of a great place to watch a game and have a good stiff drink. Bar tenders were friendly and on it.

I've found my new go-to place for my solo flights - thanks TSU!
author: Amy H.

description: Best quesadilla in the neighborhood! Food is super fresh. Also, the best place in the Sunset to watch sports. Good times, decent service.
author: jodi s.

description: I'm a fan of their $2 Tacos on Tuesdays!  I like it because it reminds me of Mogos and Koji tacos (moving taco trucks in the South Bay and SoCal), but I can see everything that is in the taco, and I like to know what goes in my mouth =x.  The green sauce is spicy.  Very chill, sports-oriented (sports flags everywhere), and a couple arcade games.  The $2 deal starts at 5pm on Tuesdays, so get their on time, or be ready for a little wait.  Once people get off work at around 6-7, I don't know... Give it try any way!
author: Janet T.

description:
Taco Tuesdays!  

While passing by Underdog's one day, I felt my stomach get tickled with excitement seeing that Nick's tacos were now going to be offered there.  To have those tasty little treats so much closer to me now than at Rouge...ooooo wheeee it was going to be good times!  The Pescado Baja Style taco Nick's way is full of awesome tastiness and the Carne Asada Nick's way brings a smile to my face.  Top it off with an order of chips and salsa (for only $1.50!) and a Pacifico from the bar and I am one happy fella.  

Admittedly though, the tacos are bit pricy, but they are well worth it for an indulgence every now and again.  However, come here on a Tuesday and you can a street taco (carnitas, carne asada, chicken with cilantro and onions) for $1.00 each.  Seeing as how they are street tacos, they are pretty modestly sized, but they are a cheap way to fill up while leveling out your bill.

Now if they only started doing Taco Thursdays as well...
author: Mike L.

description:
If you're familiar with Nick's Crispy Tacos, then you already know what to expect here. It's Nick's Tacos, just in another spot. 

This location is split with a bar, so you have that atmosphere. The service is great and the food is fantastic. We shared the chips and guacamole, which was really good, especially since it was topped with salsa. Didn't feel to heavy or like it was too much. I went with two tacos, the carnitas (Nick's way) and the shrimp (regular). Both were really good and really filling.
author: Shauna S.

description:
-super friendly service
-AMAZING NACHOS
-outer sunset
-happy hour
-super happy Amanda
author: Amanda C.

description: I gave this place a bad review about three years ago...recently I met a bud for hh. Good tacos for two bucks and friendly staff...good local food...leopard can change it's spots
author: R H.

description:
I have never had a really good taco (even living in San Diego), that is, until I tried the Pescado "Baja" Style Nick's Way. Best tacos I have ever had. I have had fish tacos before in Rosarito, Mexico and this taco even tops that. The fish is fresh and you get a big fat fillet. It is topped off with pico de gallo, a generous serving of guacamole, and cilantro. The whole thing is wrapped in two corn tortillas: one is soft and the other is grilled crispy (the crispiness is great). The size of the taco is huge and you will be full if you eat two. 

In general, this place looks like a good place to hang out to watch March Madness while downing some beers along with the delicious tacos that they serve. It's awesome that Nick's tacos are now available in the Sunset and a lengthy trip all the way to Broadway is not required to get great tacos. I will definitely be back to try the carne asada and carnitas versions of Nick's Way Tacos.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
The perfect complement to a Chinatown.

The first time I came here was because it was on the 7x7 Big Eat list. I ordered the Baja Style Pescado taco Nick's Way and it was amazing. Freshly cooked, crispy fried battered fish, fresh vegetables, yum. $5 is a bit expensive for a taco, but it was worth it.

Because my roommates often drink here after work, I've been here a few more times. The atmosphere is akin to a sports bar. They have a ton of TVs playing whatever current popular sports. Don't let this stop you from eating here though!

The plain chips and salsa are good to get anytime you eat here. The chips are thicker than normal allowing it to hold more food and provides a good crunch. Use the chips to try out their two tasty special salsas, the green and red one.

One time my roommate ordered the nachos with what seemed to be everything. It was huge. It should feed 3. Great for a large party, or just a cheap and hungry small group.

They also have special daily deals such as $2 dollar taco Tuesdays and $1 street tacos during Monday happy hour. I once ordered a taco to go and it came with some chips and salsa! A steal.

It's really great to have a solid non-Asian restaurant in the middle of a Chinatown. For those rare times you don't want dim sum and don't want to trek to the Mission, The Taco Shop is the place to go.
author: Rahil P.

description:
This place is a MUST-GO-TO place! My friend tried taking me here a few weeks back only to be 1 minute late after the being kitchen closed =(

So we tried again- this time during the day. Cute bench tables set up and decked out with a lot of sport banners. There was also a shooting bball game where it would randomly start up while we ate our "Nick's Way" fish tacos. FREE GAMES! 

Just thinking about the crunch in every bite makes me want more! Also, if you want to get a bit tipsy, I recommend their Bloody Marys. I've never had one before.... but it was delicious. Maybe even nutrious?! All I know is that I left FULL and tipsy after 1 taco and 1 bloody mary. Glad there were open seats on the bus. Otherwise, I would have gone fallin all over the place!
author: Kathy Y.

description:
I've been hearing about these "amazing" Nick's Crispy Tacos for several years. 

But my two tacos (one chicken, one pork) were soggy/mushy. The flavor was good, but I guess when I'm ordering "crispy" tacos, I expected something crunchy. 

Not the experience I was hoping for.
author: Joel G.

description: Definitely deserved 3 stars. Been here a few times, I like the crowd but that's it. The old Asian guy the bartends is always an a** hole. Not sometimes, like all the time. The food deserves about 3.5 stars and the drinks probably 3. I'm sure I'll keep coming back for cheap tacos but that's because it's the only place I can walk to in Sunset to get Mexican food.
author: Charles R.

description: A regular street taco, I can put down 5 or 10. Here I can only put down 3. That means they're big..and tasty here. Surprisingly enough the vegetarian burrito is decent.
author: John B.

description:
I walked in with my one year old and they didn't bat an eye. Love bars that do that! We made a bee line for the picnic tables near the back.

Tacos nicks way - you can't go wrong. We also got chips and salsa - the chips were freshly fried and the salsa was excellent. Just enough spice and good flavor. The orange one was very reminiscent of a Papalote salsa. 

Didn't order the corn on the cob, but everyone else around us had. Smelled just fantastic.

Minus one star for the dinge and dank - but hey its a bar.
author: Kishore H.

description:
MmMmmM. The tacos Nick's Way are delicious and ingenious. I wish I thought of this idea! 
The alcohol selection is good. I liked the seasonal Oktoberfest beer I got. I love the chips and salsa- I would ask for the salsa on the side because the chips get soggy at the end of the basket. I also really like the red sauce they have. Creamy and a bit smoky. I usually use like a quarter of the bottle. (Yes, I do love sauce.) 

Come here with friends and watch sports!
author: Angela D.

description: Been wanting to come here for awhile and let me tell you it was soo good. I got two tacos one a fish tacos done nicks way and a carne asada taco done nicks way. the tacos were huge stuffed to the top with guac. they give you a huge piece of fish and the carne asada was soo juicy. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants some yummy tacos in the sunset!!! Dont forget to get it nicks way, sooo worth it!!!
author: Megan A.

description: I ordered the Mexican street style taco which comes with 3 tacos of your choice. I ordered the carne asada, chicken, and carnitas tacos. The carne asada was pretty good everything seemed to have enough flavor but I am not a huge fan of carne asada. The chicken was my least favorite it was chewy and flavorless. My favorite was the carnitas taco because it was cooked perfectly to where it was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I would've been happy with 3 carnitas tacos. The chips and salsa with guac was really good too. I gotta come back to try their beef bulgogi taco which I heard was good. Parking can be tough since it is on Irving so don't come if you're in a hurry.
author: Brigitte M.

description: Great place to watch the game and eat good food.  Get tacos and get them nick's way.  The guacamole is good but the salsa is amazing, I would suggest starting with the cheap chips and salsa.  There street tacos are good too!  Tons of TVs with sports! and there is always seating at the picnic tables in the back.
author: Grey K.

description: Wonderful always great food great service --I come once a year just to eat their fish taco's all the way from germany been doing this for 10 yrs. never had a bad anything here
author: Heidi B.

description:
Went here on a recently sunny day for some NBA, baseball, and food before a park visit. Easy to get to, parking a pain, but luckily we found some close by. 

Nice size, loads of TVS and good amount of drinks. Just had a beer and a taco, and that's about all you need. As a vegetarian, can't really rave too much about the actual taco since mine was just cheese and veggies and tortillas (Nick's way of course). 

Servers were nice, a tad slow, but hey everyone moves a little slow when you're inside on such a nice outside day.
Happy to have so many TVs! One of the staff was nice enough to notice that I was checking scores for a particular game that wasn't on a TV, and put up the Angels game for me. Likewise, I was busy watching an Angels game, a Giants game, and NBA playoffs. You go here for some simple good food, and to catch a bit of any sort of game (they had European football playing as well), before or after a park day.

Haven't been during happy hours. Will update when that happens. (:

$ w/o drinks, $$ w/ drinks
author: Sophie C.

description:
Place was super packed when I got there.  Everything seems very chaotic and I had to walk to the back of the bar to put my name down.  The wait to get seated took about 45 minutes and the wait for food was about another 30 minutes.  

The tacos were alright, nothing really amazing.  I went at 8pm so the tacos were definitely overpriced (happy hour between 4-6pm).  

Overall, long wait time for not-so-impressive tacos.
author: Matt M.

description: Wow, I did not expect those fish tacos to be so good. I ordered the Baja Style tacos "Nick's Way," but just one at first just to try things out. Needless to say, halfway through I ordered a second, using hand gestures because my mouth was full. These are quality tacos that are definitely worth the price. Even better when you bring friends to share a bucket of Tecates.
author: Alex S.

description:
Tasty Mexican "street style" tacos at a decent, slightly higher than 'street food' price.

The atmosphere is that of a sports bar with a twinge of hipster-ness. The tacos were great, but begged for a side of pickled jalapenos, red onion and carrots--condiments found at most Mexican street vendors I like. However, if you like spicy, you can order fresh jalapenos on the side.

I disagree with other reviewers' complaints that the salsas are spicy. I really, really like spicy and found the salsas to be tasty and fresh but mild with fire. I hope they get a spicier option.

The service was fast and attentive. Underdog's has an average selection of beer at average SF prices, a nice neighborhood place to get a drink and a tasty dinner. I recommend both the carnitas taco, as the pork is not dry but moist and flavorful, and the pollo taco which had a delicious marinade/sauce.
author: Michael K.

description: Been meaning to write this review for quite some time: After a day of galavanting around the city and playing hookey from work, bf and I went to happy hour at Underdog's for some quick cheap eats. We weren't too hungry (being that we both had just eaten ice cream cones from a soft serve truck we stumbled upon in golden gate park) but still wanted something savory to munch on.  Off we went to The Taco Shop. The after work crowd was already showing up but we were able to snag a table near the front. Waitress was friendly and speedy. It was happy hour so we both got the street tacos with chicken and some chips and guac. Bf also got a Tecate. Food was satisfying, but chicken meat was a bit dry so we doused with salsa. Guac was very fresh. Great place to stop by for a quick bite or come watch a Bay Area sports game over some brewskis with the buddies. I'd return if I was in the area and try out some of the other food choices from their menu.
author: Liv A.

description: I love this bar.   Not only is it fun to watch games there but they hands down have the best tacos.  Much of the food is local and organic too.  Woot Woot!   Taco's Nicks Way are amazing (and one is enough for this girl).  The first time I went there, I ordered two and was full after the first one.   I literally texted my neighbor inquiring if she was interested in me bringing one, perfect taco by.   She was, and also loved too.
author: Lynn P.

description: Food is good! Altho I got the same thing the two times I've been here. My family enjoyed they're meals too.... Cool atmosphere..... no real greeting when u come but once you get someone's attention it seems to be fine....
author: Gigi C.

description:
Giants game. Beer. Tacos.

Three items that when combined with some Bay area locals is a recipe for truly a great ~3+ hours! Right off of 19th, the moment you walk into Underdogs Taco Shop you know you're in Giants territory. Obviously during the games the place gets packed, but that doesn't stop the staff from pumping out great food at quick speeds. 

My friends and I came here post game so we worked around the crowd. We made it for Taco Tuesday so immediately it was a round of drinks and stacks of tacos. We ordered the trio: beef, pork and fish; as we waited the staff helped us keep the night going after an awesome win by sharing shots with us!

As our food arrived after a few moments we were all happy to see how plump each tortilla was. For 1$ each they were definitely a pick when it came to portion size. Ranking the three, I felt that the pork and beef were close ties, with both moist and flavorful and definitely went  well with a nice cool Blue moon ;D. As for the fish, I wasn't very impressed as the other two; the fish was only slightly warm and seemed to flake apart as i bit into the taco- a real downer.

For sure I will be coming here again in the near future as Giants baseball gets kicked off. Though the tacos weren't spectacular, this is an establishment that you go to more for the environment with the food being a plus personally. With the staff and owners being Giants fans this place is a must go if you're looking for a place to hang out, grab a beer and to enjoy the game with a bunch of locals routing for the same team.
author: Jon K.

description: These tacos are the TRUTH,  set off by the truly magical guacamole... It took me places...
author: Daniel I.

description: At first, I losthed this place: noisy, college kids! But, I have to admit the Nick's way tacos are very delicious and worth the annoying clientle. The Carne Asada and Chicken tacos are the best. My brother has an obsession with the CALIFORNIA Carne Asada burrito. Margsritas are also very flippin delish!
author: Sandra D.

description: This place is great! Love the Nachos Es Muy Grande! Only thing is it gets loud and I have to scream to talk to my friends.
author: Anabel N.

description: It does get crowded here especially when there are games and it does not help that the place is a little small,but the food is great! I always always order the baja fish taco nick's way, no other way to get it. It's a fried fish taco with a soft tortilla and a crunchy taco shell as well. The amounts of filling in the taco are very generous. Chips and salsa are always a good accompaniment. Prices are reasonable as well. Good happy hour deals ($1 margaritas), however it is extremely packed since it only lasts for 30 minutes.
author: Tori C.

description: Foods good, One male Bartender is rude. I've been here about 5 times. He looks like he hates his job. Lines can be long to get a table. I always get the mission burrito which is about $12 or something. This is a spot for young adults to watch sports and have a loud time.
author: Rob T.

description:
Great place to hang out with your friends, eat some tacos, drink some beers, and catch a game. Awesome atmosphere. 

Definitely enjoy the Baja fish taco done Nick's way. $1 street tacos on tuesday. The grande nacho is enough for four. I'd recommend the nachos with steak. It's less dry than the chicken. There is too much sauce going on with the chicken, guac, and beans -- resulting in moist chips. 

--the reason for writing this review--

One thing that I found disturbing today after being a patron here for quite some time was an incident with a server cleaning the table.

A party in front of us had just cleared out so the server was cleaning the table. She stacked all the cups on top of each other and there was one cup with water in it. She poured that water back INTO the pitcher of water and stacked that cup with the rest and brought it to the bar. 

In my head I'm thinking ok maybe she'll throw out the water but then again when do you ever notice pitchers of water being cleaned? Ok so I proceeded to pay more attention. 

So the the cups were brought to the back of the bar and then the pitcher of water was placed next to another pitcher.. One that had soda? At the end of the bar. Still curious of what's going to happen next, I continued to watch. 

A different server placed two new pitchers of water with ice next to the other pitchers. Moments later a table was seated and the pitcher (that had water poured back into it) was presented to that party. 

I've been here several times and enjoyed it every time. But I am staying away from the water for sure. Whether that water was touched or not, it should've never been poured back into a pitcher (that would eventually be used again later).
author: Larry H.
