description: In love with the shrimp tacos Nicky's way!!!! Nachos are HUGE and great flavor !! The guacamole alone is the best I have ever had. Great environment to watch NFL and mlb games.
author: Veronica C.

description:
Every time someone says they want taco's, I'm usually thinking "whats the big deal?!" but last night, I figured out why The Taco Shop At Underdog's is such a big hit.

We missed happy hour by 8 minutes so I ordered two of the fish tacos.. One normal and another Nick's way... and yes.. we can all say, "what? 4.50 - 5.50 for a fish taco?!?" but it's so worth it! I loved the taco's Nick's way because the hard shell taco was so crunchy and added so much extra texture to it. The fish was piping hot when I bit into it and the batter was so crisp! They added the perfect amount of guac, thinly sliced cabbage, onions, and tomatoes. Top it off with some of the hot sauce they make and you have the perfect crunchy textured and full of flavor fish taco.   

The nachos looked delicious and I noticed they have grilled corn and totally regret not spending more time looking over the menu so it looks like I'll be returning soon to try the rest of the menu.
author: Helen M.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos right by my house? Color me excited.

The bar is large, and the server's were friendly. They have a decent beer selection, but their menu makes up for it. This bar is perfect for an after work bite to eat, a cold one, or -- ideally -- both. The atmosphere of this particular establishment feels more like a Mission bar then an Outer Sunset one. Which is kind of a treat, it isn't often I stumble across a bar in the Sunset that I actually want to frequent -- and Underdog's definitely made the cut. 

I didn't stick around for the Taco Tuesday specials this time -- but if I didn't already -- I definitely have reason to return now.
author: Gabriel S.

description: What is a artist without a muse? What is a bento without rice? What is a 4 star yelp review without a great taco? The soft and hard shell taco is wonderful- it's that marvelous sensation of biting into flesh and hitting the bone of that 12 year old child you just sacked. Great place though.
author: Jane J.

description:
I like the tacos (chicken or vege) when they get it right. My friends like the shrimp tacos and burritos. Nick's Way is the way to go. Generous heapings of guac on the tacos but not in a separate order with chips.

For the life of me,why is the waitress with the tube top still working there? She is friendly enough but doesn't write down the order and manages to get it wrong...sometimes more than once or twice.

If you like sports bars and good tacos, I'd recommend The Taco Shop. It's loud, a little smelly, and 'eh' on cleanliness.
author: M.D. L.

description:
Underdog's is home to Nick's Tacos outside of his other restaurant; Nick's Crispy Tacos. A family bar, seriously some good food for all ages (except the liquor), multiple televisions, and videogames (incl. basketball) makes Underdog's a fun filled place.

Nick surprisingly came out of the kitchen and tended the bar armed with an apron, and my brother visiting from SoCal and I had the pleasure to shake his hand (hoped he washed it), and we congratulated him on some amazing food he's putting out. 

Chips and Salsa are a good snack to munch on with toasty chip and generous scoops of pico de gallo or salsa fresca on top. Nachos are a huge step up if you're with a group of hungry friends.

Baja Fish Tacos were battered and fried housed in a crispy and soft taco (Nick's way) alongside with cabbage, red onion, and guacamole (cilantro on the side). 

Quesadilla are delicious, greasy, and meaty...seriously yummy, but the pico de gallo they put in some of their quesadillas makes it soggy and more difficult to hold. 

Elote (Corn) con Queso - White corn hit with cojita cheese and cayenne pepper was delicious even without the typical mayo from the typical street vendors. 

I am always down to swing by Underdogs for some great food and good service to go with my delicious beer. Been here a few times and don't see myself stopping anytime soon. Heck this is where I actually saw my first bar scruff, good thing no one was really hurt. In the end, good service, good food, and good times.
author: Casey L.

description:
My boyfriend kept talking about "fish taco, fish taco, fish taco" literally for like a whole month nonstop  to everyone he knew, haha. And like everyone else, it just sounded fishy, and unappetizing. (not a big Mexican food fan to begin with)
SOOOO he dragged me there to give it a go, and strangely enough, they were really good! 

i went back there again when my cousin payed a visit for Oregon and she also found the fish tacos a delight :) I will definitely pay this place a visit again.
author: Harriet W.

description:
best fish tacos ever in life.

make sure you get the 2 tacos deal but it has to be nicks way!

which basically means they add the good shit to your tacos like salsa and guacamole!

the only thing i order here is the battered fish tacos nicks way...

since i moved to socal...i dream of these tacos and am currently salivating.

its right by sfsu so its good for the young crowd....good beers...friendly staff. casual bar that can easily become a second home. 

their salsa/hot sauce is amazing as well!!!

their chips are the thicker crunchy kind compared to the thin flaky kind that i love much much more but add some of that sauce on there and i am in heaven. 

five stars!
author: Jan Q.

description:
NICK IS AWESOME!!
If you decide to pay Underdog a visit, make sure to find Nick and thank him for his awesome tacos. 

The bf and I came here because going down to Broadway and Polk was too far for tacos. We had read previous reviews and was told that these tacos are the same as Nick's Crispy Tacos so what the hell, we gave it a shot.

TUESDAYS = $1 STREET TACOS!
Nothing special about these really. In fact, I probably won't order these again and skip straight to the good stuff. They're just a 3 inch tortilla with either carne asada, pollo asada, or carnitas on top with cilantro and onions. The end. Meh!

THE GOOD STUFF = Quesadillas & Tacos NICK'S WAY!
The quesadillas were made cripsy and nice. I wish I had a side of guac to go with this but I was too hungry to wait for a side of guac to come. The tacos are done the same as the ones on Broadway & Polk but after having sunk my teeth into the pescado taco nick's way, something was a bit off about it. The fish wasn't salted enough probably but overall, the guac saved the day. 

Come in here, grab a table, servers will come to you, watch what's on TV, order a beer or two or three, order tacos but make sure it's made NICK'S WAY! $4 is so worth it for a taco. 

And the best part about the food here? 
RED AND GREEN SALSA IN SQUEEZE KETCHUP BOTTLES! WOOT!

I'll be back...!
author: Heidi C.

description: Baja fish tacos Nick's way with their phenomenal red sauce drenching every bite. The end!!! Fatality!! It doesn't get better than that. I mean in life... I mean... Just straight unbeatable. The only fish tacos for myself that are as tasty are in Ensenada at the fish market. Glad I live so close to this place, just wish it wasn't always so busy and that I ate there more often haha!
author: David S.

description:
Best sports bar in the Sunset!

Lots of TV's for your viewing pleasure, but be sure to arrive early if you want a seat!  They generally have some sort of drink special and buckets of beer are usually around $20.

Taco's here are a must!! Order them Nick's way and they come with a crispy taco shell and slathered with delicious guacamole!  They are sure to satisfy the biggest appetites!

Bottom line:  This place fulfills your sports bar needs with decent drink specials and amazing tacos!
author: Jonathan M.

description:
This place has by far the best fish tacos I've ever had.... Baja style is definitely better than the grilled...

I hear the Margaritas are great, but I always end up drinking soco! 

Oh and the corn on the cob (whatever they do to it) is FANTASTIC!!
author: Ben B.

description:
Ahhhh....Underdogs.  A local favorite of mine.  I can eat and drink, and just stumble home.  I've been here for a few UFC fights and LOTS of happy hours.  

I've only been here once since it turned into The Taco Shop, but one time was all I needed to know the tacos are DEEEELICIOUS!  My friends were always telling me how good the Pescado "Baja" Style taco was, and they were damn right!  What can be better than beer battered fish in a taco???  YUMMMMMM.  It was also taco Tuesday, so I ended up with 4 street tacos...hey...they were only $1 each!!!  

Oh, and you have to try the taco "Nick's Way".  There's a grilled crispy corn tortilla and a soft tortilla.  If you love SPICY food, you have to try the jabanero sauce.  One drop and my tongue was en fuego!
author: Patra I.

description:
Nice place to get drinks and watch sports on there multiple TVs.  They serve decent mexican food here and the drinks are priced well. 

The crowd is mixed, which I kinda like, it's not a one ethnicity bar.  Overall a great place to go to relax.
author: Ben S.

description:
One carne asada taco, Nick's way.
One Baja fish taco, Nick's way. 

Nick's way is a must. If you don't get it Nick's way, you done goooooped. They might not be authentic, but let's be real. IDGAF! They're delicious. Be sure to try all of their house-made sauces too! Absolute perfection. 

This place has a great atmosphere and is a fun spot to watch Giant's games too!
author: Denise L.

description: THEY FORGOT THE FRIES IN MY CALIFORNIA BURRITO! $11 for a tortilla filled w/beef & cheese is a little much. :( should've checked to make sure my food was correct before i left but i'd heard such glowing reviews that i assumed they'd be on their game. guess you just can't get around going to the mission for decent mexican food.
author: Alex C.

description: Dem fish tacos man... Dem fish tacos... Pretty damn good. I came here for a friends 21st birthday, pretty cool atmosphere, they got good fish tacos, sports playing, street fighter and basketball shooting game. Really chill place to be to sit down and watch a game.
author: Wells Y.

description: first of all other times I stopped in and got a burrito it was great but the one and only time I ever went in and had a seat with my brother we ordered a couple drinks and he ordered a veggie burrito. Not only did they give us a meat burrito which we had gotten a new one after he had eaten parts of it but I ordered a vodka tonic and literally only got a full glass of tonic. I brought up that there was no alcohol in it and nobody fixed it so my brother ended up buying me a shot of vodka and poured it in there for me. when I came back from the bathroom I trotted it and was happy they fixed it until I found out he had to buy me a shot and he poured it in himself.  you guys seriously should fix how your staff operates.  one woman asked me if I needed anything and I said yes a drink then she said oh no I'm not a bartender just a greeter you can order at the bar. like wtf? why would you stop and ask me that.  I seriously wouldn't come back just to chill.  I'm even re evaluating whether I'd go back even to grab food. it's such a clustered environment and I'm pretty sure the staff is cluster fucked.
author: Bree M.

description:
This is my first stop whenever I come back to Bay Area (but with my moving back here, this will be on my weekly rotation). Who needs to see their family when they can have a Nick's crispy taco?? Add to the tasty tacos, warm chips with fresh tomato salsa and squirty-bottle sauces, and a corn slathered in butter, cheese, and chili powder and you have yourself a feast from gods. 

The Taco Shop, you will always have a special place in my heart! I love you...
author: Tatyana K.

description: This is a pretty awesome place...I've never noticed this place and I pass by it on the way home all the time.  I had the carne asada quesadila and it was delicious and worth the $8 bucks. The bartenders are very social and nice. I went in to watch a SHARKS game recently and it was pretty busy...meaning no seats.  They also have little video game tables and a hoops game in the back.  I will definitely make this a usual stop especially since it is so close to home...SORRY KEZAR!
author: Zara-Maria S.

description: Love the tacos, and margaritas, a little pricey, sometimes hard to get a server or bartenders attention but the food makes up for that.
author: Star M.

description: Watched game 4 and 5 of the Giants kicking ass here and had a blast! The nachos and fish taco (nick's way) are MUST haves here! There's a long bar with plenty of seating, awesome bartenders and enough TVs to watch from every angle.
author: M W.

description:
A great person once said... "There's nothing worse than eating bad tasting food that is bad for you."

California burrito with carne asada - crinkle cut fries in it... they're not the best type to use in a California burrito. They need to be thin and crispy! I wanted some crisp to it, but that I did not receive... The carne asada was good though... but the fries... that's what really makes it!

Grilled Fish burrito - tasteless fish. Pretty tasteless altogether really. Extremely messy. Drippy mess everywhere. Not sure if it was from the fish or the salsa? Soggy tortillas are a no-no for me.

Moderately priced. I've had better. Convenient location for sunset'ers. Probably won't come here again. I ordered to go, so maybe the ambiance would have changed my mind, but I'm not really a bar person.
author: Timothy L.

description:
Start the meal with chips and salsa, then a Pescado taco, nick's way, oozing with guacomole and add dallop of red salsa with each bite. Follow this with Elote con queso and you've got yourself the best meal you can have after a long day at work or just a chill dinner with friends. 

Daaamn....i want a pescado taco right now
author: Danica C.

description:
Last Thursday evening I dropped by Underdog's Bar with my brother, to find out if they had improved since my last review. The owner, Douglas M. had previously contacted me to explain that my previous experience was a rare occurrence due to unexpected circumstances. So I decided to give them another chance. 

We didn't have to wait long to get our food (4 fried fish tacos, Nick's way) and the food was good. Our friendly server Nicole was doing a great job as usual. Since we enjoyed the food, drinks and service, I've updated my rating to 4 stars.
author: Luis C.

description: This place has been one of my favorite spots to hit up for a burrito after climbing! My two favorites are the San Francisco and the San Diego (no rice or beans) when I'm feeling more health conscious. Oh and the chips and salsa are to die for as well. This last time I tried the Mexican Street Style Tacos with the habanero hot sauce. BOMB!! The place is always extremely fun with a fully stocked bar and some sort of sports on their flat screen TV's. Definite recommendation in my book!!
author: Michael F.

description:
This place is amazing looking! There are six 50" HD Plasma TVs! HUGE! They have a huge selection on tap, and they feature two of my favorite taps as well (Newcastle and Fat Tire). Their Jalapeno Bacon Cheeseburger is pretty impressive too. It left me sweating beads on my head after finishing one. The buffalo wings were also extremely spicy. They tell me that the sauce is actually purchased from a vendor in Buffalo, Montana! Great authenticity! No wonder it had that extra kick to it!!

Underdogs gives out a generous amount of food for the price. It's great because you could be drinking a shit load, be shit faced drunk, and sober up to a serving of burgers and fries, or even some of their dogs! I failed to mention that their dogs were tasty! With a huge list of dogs, it wouldn't be bad to try a different dog every so often. Try one with everything on it! 

The environment is very friendly! The owners are extremely cool too! Stop by some time! This is my favorite Sunet spot to hang out at! 
-------------------------------------------------
Update: HOLY CRAP THEIR NACHO PLATE IS FRIGGIN RIDICULOUS! Check out Dan's Nachos! That shit is insane! There was so much cheese and beef on it, I thought it was an authentic mexican plate for a while! Damn! But then I found out Dan was actually Chinese. HAHAHAHA Oh well it works!
author: Andrew W.

description:
I accidentally stumbled onto this place once a couple years ago .. now I bring all of my friends because their tacos are AMAZING. They serve Nick's Way tacos which are crunchy and soft tacos combined into one awesome taco. The food always tastes great and the service always kicks ass. 

My only gripe is that sometimes its hard to find a place to sit, especially if you come around happy hour or any other busy times of the day. If you come at a random time though waiting around for a seat to open up isn't bad at all. 

Oh and I must mention their basketball game - its the hoop that moves back and forth. Love it, always compete with other people that are at the restaurant. Fun times!
author: Nadia I.

description: So obviously there are not many good Meixcan restaurants in the Sunset.  Was so happy I found this place it's very good.  I always get the super steak burrito with extra chips and pico de gallo.  Super yummy, I wish they had delivery but still worth it.  The only other decent place is Gordo's and it's kind of out of the way.  So happy to have this place close by.  Everything tastes really good and fresh, looks like a cool spot to hang out for a beer as well always seems crowded when games are on.
author: Nirea S.

description:
How can you go wrong with this place. Televisions everywhere, arcade basketball and some of the best damn tacos I've ever had. 
  This is a great spot to watch a game with a friend on the weekdays/weekends. Sure it's on the border of the outer/inner sunset, and there isn't another bar nearby to stumble into later.. But the real reason to make it out here is for the fried fish tacos. Order 2 of them Nick's way to add cheese and guacamole, grab yourself a pint of Lagunitas, sit back and enjoy the upcoming NFL season. 

Just a quick side note, you can also get these tacos at Rouge on Polk if you're out in that direction when the craving hits!
author: Barrett A.

description:
One week ago I went there with a couple of friends. We ordered tacos and a beer each, good service, tacos were good, but.... we were just about to leave and I went to men's bathroom, I saw one of the kitchen guys do his thing and left without washing his hands. When I walked by the kitchen window I saw the guy, he was smiling.

I told the manager about the incident, but I did not tell him who did it. The manager apologized, then walked around talking to every male employee in the place. Nice of him to do, but I ain't coming back here to eat anything anymore.
author: Manolo F.

description:
I was sad that Eric wasn't working last night since he has the best blue eyes. ANYWAYS. Not a regular by any means (just a stalker!!!) BEST CHIPS totally sweet salsa like what do they chop up local heirlooms or something it is THAT delicious and THAT fresh and honestly not spicy one bit but you won't mind... 

Chips greasy! The mark of a good product. Ummm what else? 

Fresh guac, one taco suffice ... Don't be a dumb butt and nix the cheese like I always do and regret (just don't want it coagulating but should take more risks...) 

Awesome margaritas and this place is usually packed on weeknights... 

OH! and the SAUCES!!!!! Squirt a tonnnn of the red sauce in your mouth as your friends watch in horror. Oh yes. Yes. It's that good... 

Green sauce is pretty good too.

Salad looks like the bomb as does soup. I'll need to move back to California if just to try the corn... And the bartender...
author: E W.

description:
This is a college bar, so if your feel like watching the game and don't mind needless yelling go for it.
THe mexican food is pretty good too.
author: Travis J.

description: Love this shop, it's our go to for a sports bar with good grub. Can't go wrong! The street tacos and grilled fish tacos are my fave, and the have the tastiest condiments.
author: Liz W.

description: By far the best Cod in a tortilla I have ever had! My wife and I enjoyed a Tuesday late lunch here and the atmosphere was great. Not very many people were there at the time and the customer service was phenomenal! The margaritas were also very good. Two thumbs way up for this taco shop!
author: Austin B.

description: Friendly staff and fantastic fish tacos! This is a great place to watch games at, have an ice cold beer, and eat delicious food. The only bad thing about this place, being an OSU fan from Ohio, is the detestable Michigan flag inside. You would have had 5 stars, Underdog's, but that flag must come down.
author: Michael S.

description:
This place was great.  I loved the atmosphere, the food was great and it had plenty of screens to watch the Giants' playoff game. 

I would easily have given it 5 stars.  But rude staff always ruins a good time.  Here at the Taco Shop, it was the Asian waitress with the glasses.  I know it's busy, but she was rude, snappy, sarcastic and abrupt. After she finished getting our order, the other people at the table with us (who we didn't know) looked at us with wide eyes. "Dude, that girl was rude".

But then things got weird. Later when I had a complaint (something unrelated), she was rude again, I asked to speak to a manager and she brought the bartender over.

Now, instead of asking what's wrong or ANYTHING, the first thing out of his mouth was "Get out!  GET OUT!".  I almost started laughing at the uninformed tough guy routine.  I was like, "Woah, I have done nothing to warrant being kicked out of anywhere.  I asked to see the manager.  You're gonna kick me out for complaining?".

I will say, after he listened, he helped resolve the situation, so I think he was just a little over anxious and excited to be the muscle. haha.

I even gave the rude waitress a 20% tip because of her hard day . . . but that doesn't mean that I don't think the ASIAN WAITRESS WITH GLASSES AT THE TACO SHOP AT UNDERDOG'S doesn't need to take a courtesy class or not work big days that she can't handle emotionally or mentally

Great place though

The end.
author: Jacob R.

description:
Friends have been raving about The Taco Shop for months.  This week I finally had the opportunity to eat there.  The Nick's Way taco was every bit as awesome as had been described.  It is indeed better than any taco I've ever had.  I had the carnitas which was filled with delicious shredded pork and presented with lots of guacamole and salsa showing.  A soft taco is wrapped around a crispy taco.  It was only $4.50 and filled me enough for lunch. Friends that I was with raved about the burritos, too. 
 I'm looking forward to going back.
author: Andrea P.

description: First time here.  I had a margarita, carne asada burrito and a taco.  Everything was simple, delicious, and juicy.  No complaints at all.  Perfect place to just chill, eat, and drink.  Done.
author: Aly A.

description:
One of the best fish tacos I've had in the bay area (2nd to the #1 Rubios in San Diego and Vamos in Manhattan). *updated*

A single taco can fill the average individual. One order with a glass of really cold beer and there you have it. The perfect meal. MmmHmmm. A beer battered Pescado Baja Style fish taco and the grilled fish taco fed two people. I ordered the Pescado Baja "Nick's way" and the grilled fish as normal. The tacos come wrapped with two soft tortillas, but Nick's way has a FRIED inner tortilla layer and a soft outer layer. The extra crunch from the tortilla goes hand in hand with the fried fish from the Pescado. SUPER DELISH. The grilled fish was pretty good, but having it "Nick's way" was definitely more impressionable. They also have some amazing hot sauces to douse your tacos with.  

*Warning* the ORANGE one is their Habanero (pronoucned AHbanero) sauce. I've only had one experience with Habanero and it went something like this: A tiny drop landed in my nostril. Less than 3minutes later I was crying like a baby. In fetal position. And cursing the living lights out of the Brazilians (I was at a Brazilian cafe). Ok, the fetal position and cursing was a lie (I heart Brazilians). And the crying was more like tearing, but I was in pain for a good 10minutes. Irving you surprised me.

I felt strange being out there getting tacos and not a tapioca drink or something instead, but hey, it was worth it. It's really more like 4 stars, but I'm giving them an extra star for trying to blend in (they have their store name in Chinese outside on their sign as well). Very cute.
author: Alesia T.

description: I love this place! I can order a delicious mission style burrito online and pick it up in 15 minutes. Great burrito without having to trek to the mission. I can't help but feel lazy every once in a while and this place helps! Thanks underdogs!
author: Tessa R.

description: Taco was fine. Beer cold. WiFi (which I specifically asked about before ordering) was useless. Bizarre login that never worked and wanted to post to my Facebook or Twitter? Screw you.
author: Joe H.

description: JJ's suggestion in the Exploring My New 'Hood fiesta. Pitcher of margaritas, nachos, tacos = stuffed. Friendly service, fun crowd, lively, and it's staggering distance away!
author: Mi M.

description: Good place to be with a lot of young people hanging around. I like to be with young people to get their vibes of livelihood and energy even though I am 51 now. The IPA beer is good but you are drunk after two so be careful with driving and make sure you walk it off. Get some fruits outside and check the little shops on Irving. This is a very good tasty place to eat a lot of food. All portions are huge but the price is very reasonable. I recommend this to those who have big appetite and little to spend which would be the crowds that are going there, the young student type. Some very friendly service staff there tending the bar and waiting the very few tables. I wish they had more tables there though. Usually you end up sitting at the bar though. Try the Nachos or one of the burritos with the IPA beer. It's a fun place.
author: Ali B.

description:
First of all, 

Their sauce is freakin' amazing. You finish a bottle of their sauce before you finish your meal, you put it on anything and everything. 

Then,

You buy one or two fish tacos made Nick's way of course. Drizzle more sauce on it and munch in like there's no tomorrow. Orgasmic. Yes. 

Five stars,

For everything said above along with GREAT customer service! Cheers to Underdogs!
author: Jonathan L.

description:
It's nick's way or no way!!

I apologize to the Underdog staffs for writing this review hecka late but I've been here for almost 8+ times now and this place never changes.  (In a good way) Why?  Tacos are bomb, beers are bomb, service is bomb! 

Now normally I would never spend $4-5+ on a single taco, but as you can see from the pics on yelp, it is no ordinary taco, it is NICK's Taco! Taco that I must say will make my mouth have multiple orgasms (point made =P).  I haven't tried a whole lot of the other food yet, but seeing how I love this place I'll give them a try soon.

It is very difficult to get a table if you bring a large crowd.  Normally all the tables are taken and they only have 4-5 tables and a long bar to accommodate.   If you bring less than 3 your only option is to share the table.  So just heads up.  Now go kick back with some beer, tacos and games on TV.  Remember, if you're ordering tacos, it's Nick's way or NO WAY! =P
author: Willis L.

description:
I found this place through yelp and dragged my bf here cuz i wanted to try their "Nick's way" tacos SOOOOO bad ... did i have too high expectation? probably.. we ordered chips and salsa ( which was fresh and yummy but could be cheaper rather than overpriced ) and I ordered nick's way chicken taco and I got one small taco in a big plastic bowl.. yea it looked effortless, I was like " Thants it?????????????????????????????" i meant come on I know its fancy tancy version of tacos but seriously.. that was really disappointing it was good but wasn't worth that much for one freaking taco. 

only good part was they got green flash beer that my bf loves but so hard to find in bay area. but thats it
author: Juhwi K.

description:
My roommates and I had heard about Taco Shop a number of times and finally decided to try it out. We arrived some time before 7 this past Monday and had a good feeling this place would be good since it was packed.

One of the waitresses helped the 5 of us find a seat since it was too packed. Unfortunately, I do not remember her name, but she was the only decent person working there. 

The reason I gave this place a low rating is because of the service and because of how rude the owner Nick was. He came over to get our drink orders and I asked if there were any happy hour specials going on since it was around 7. To which he replied "Um...I don't know where you're from but around here happy hour is usually from 4-6pm". Um excuse me and you're the owner? I did not see him speak to his other customers this rudely and my roommates and I were taken back by his extreme rudeness. I definitely would not come back here because of how rude he was.

The food was okay; I have had better. I ordered a California burrito and that shit was so skinny I wanted to ask if they served me taquitos by accident. Overall, the service was terrible, the owner Nick should definitely not be running a business, and the food was "eh". Head over to the Mission, trust me it is a hundred times better.
author: Surge C.

description: fish taco's are amazing! nick's style has a nice touch with the deep fried taco inside the tortilla, the carne asada quesadilla was ok, not as good a la victoria's because its not as oily
author: Sean L.

description:
Tacos were good, but they should state that the sauce is on the spicy side.  That would have been nice to know & perhaps given a option to have it on the side.  

Our first waitress said that my two young children could not share the 2 taco combo.  This was a strict policy.  This is NOT   written on the menu or posted anywhere in the restaurant.  That pissed me off!  Remedy was to order it anyway & I split the tacos at the table.  

The fish tacos were good not great!
author: Liza W.

description:
Yes, yes, we all know the tacos are to DIE for, but can I get a hell yah for the tortilla soup!? I tried the soup about 3-4 months ago and I haven't had a taco since. It truly is the bomb.com. 

I'll also never get over how amazing their red salsa is. Yum-o!
author: Aviana B.

description:
I totally disagree with the high rating of this place. 

I am very picky with my Mexican food especially after I've experience the real deal stuff from the great taco stands in Mexico.

The place is nice if you're here just for the bar.  It's a good environment but the tacos, even though it's called "The Taco Shop," sucks.  It was bland and dry. After my many experiences with tacos in Southern and Northern California and the country of Mexico, I would have to condemn these as the worst tacos I've ever had.  Yes...I do mean Ever. I can make better tacos myself. 

The only thing I like is their mysterious hot sauces on the table.  I gave them an extra star because of the hot sauces and the environment.  I had chips and salsa also and those were only OK.  Maybe I'm just a Mexican food snob but this place really doesn't cut it.  

My advice is if you want great Mexican food in the city, stick to the places in the Mission District.  Those are the best ones you can get around here.
author: Shirley T.

description:
Underdog's where have you been all my life?!!! We frequent this place and mainly go on Friday nights. Great food and you can't beat the $1 tecates and $1 margaritas during happy hour! This place is always packed. They have plenty of TVs for your viewing pleasure to catch your favorite sports team. And they have this basketball game that I love love love! If you're in the neighborhood I highly recommend this place!!! 

5++++++
author: Monica N.

description: I've been rather underwhelmed with the tacos here in the past, but my most recent experience takes the cake. Boyfriend and I went in and opened a tab, had a beer and some underwhelming tacos and asked for the check. We got the check and paid in cash, and left the card behind the bar. Boyfriend went back the next day to retrieve the card and was told it wasn't there. "So you lost my card?" "Umm... sounds like YOU lost your card", said the sassy waitress. Now I realize that we messed up by forgetting to ask for the card back when they forgot to bring it with the check. But the card was in their possession, and at the very least an "I'm sorry we misplaced your card" would have been nice. Instead, my boyfriend was told by the waitress that she was too busy to help him, so he lost a card and they lost two customers (at least). There are plenty of places to get delicious tacos in the city, many of which won't lose your card or tell you to buzz off when they do. My advice: go to one of those places.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Absolutely 100% magnificent in every single way.

Fantastic customer service
Awesome arcade games
Orgasmic food
Badass margaritas

I will be coming here regularly for as long as I live in SF. The only thing I dont like is having to decide between the chicken quesadilla and Nicks crispy taco!
author: Nelson S.

description:
The food is undeniably delicious! I was first attracted by the $1 tacos and $1 margaritas. The street tacos aren't your typically tacos. They're tiny in size but don't let that fool you. I was stuffed after 6, I think I was even satisfied after 4. The margaritas can be a rip off because of all the ice they use, but nonetheless still good. 

I ordered the pollo quesadilla and the flour torilla was so nicely golden and crispy. The chicken was delicious! Their salsa is fresh and so are the chips!. Try the fish tacos! (Nick's Way of course!) Yes it's pricey but its good, plus, you'll probably waste $6 buying something else anyway so why not waste it on something delicious!
author: Connie C.

description:
If you like any of the following: Sports, games, Mexican food, alcohol, and a crackin' environment, then this is your spot. 

This place is popular so it's ALWAYS packed, especially on Tuesdays, go figure. One of my friends works here so I have a better experience than I probably would otherwise. 

It's a really good sports bar but don't expect AMAZING service, they are really busy but still try to be as helpful as possible. The food is pretty good, I recommend the elote, I love corn and this is hella good. I would stick to the tacos too, I like burritos elsewhere.
author: Kathryn B.

description: Nick's way tacos, how can you go wrong; The service has always been friendly, a bit slow, but nothing too dramatic.  Their food is always good (to be fair I only had nick ways taco and the la bomba breakfast burrito; then again what else do you need).  It has a very kickback vibe, a great place to bring a couple of friends and chill, or get over a hangover with a breakfast burrito.
author: Daniel W.

description:
This is a definitely a college bar scene, so there are times that I simply *cannot* bring myself to go in to eat - even if I could possibly find a seat.  There is very limited seating.  It is basically sitting at the bar, about 4 or 5 bar tables against the wall behind the bar, and then in the back there are long picnic style tables.  There is a basketball shooting machine, which I have never seen anyone using, but they must to take up such prime real estate in a place this small.

The tacos are really good. I love crispy tacos.  They fry the tortillas fresh and then put a soft tortilla over it to keep it together as you eat it. The fish tacos are good, as are the carnitas, beef and chicken.  I like the fish and carnitas best. 

The guacamole is fresh & good & doesn't have sour cream added (like some places do). The chips, when they are hot, are really good.  

One tip I would give is when ordering the chips & salsa or chips & guacamole- definitely ask for the salsa on the side.  They typically put the salsa right on the chips, which makes the chips you didn't eat immediately and the ones on the bottom soggy.  

Oh! And for you spice heads.. They have a super spicy sauce that is really good (habanero sauce) but you do have to specially request it.  

Did I say this place is really good?  ;-)
author: N A.

description: Post world cup final so maybe there were some sad Argentinians working... But the margs were sour, the carnitas dry and the salad extremely salty. The only thing going were the many TVS.  SF Giants won so Yay!
author: Douglas S.

description:
Def get the tacos, not the burritos, and get them Nick's way. This is a great sports bar, I love catching games here, the prices are completely reasonable, and they have a good beer list. 

They are often very busy on game nights so plan for crowds and a slight wait. Always worth it though! They have communal dining as an option, so if you're open for it- do it, it makes the wait much shorter.
author: Kortni S.

description:
Chicken tacos "Nick's Way" + ice cold Anchor Steam = a great Sunday lunch! The tacos were so delicious and the red salsa paired perfectly. For those who want a spicier bite you may want some Tapatio though, as the salsas do not have that much heat. We also had the tortilla soup, which was quite good, but make sure you like a strong lim taste.

All in all a great Sunday lunch and will definitely be back for more tacos and to try the nachos! I also want to know how good the Mexican street tacos are for $6. Maybe as good as a $5 shake? Well have to wait and see.
author: Rebecca D.

description:
the bartenders are great.
the drinks are awesome.
the food.......... well, i've only had the nick's tacos but O.M.G i've been dreaming of this place ever since i bit into that delicious creation. 


you really can't miss with this place, but you might have to wait a bit to get your food on a busy night.
author: Alana V.

description: Definitely not the best Mexican food in the city. The tacos were tiny and the meat was weird and dry, as well as overpriced. Also, a side of guacamole was $2.50 for a quarter if an avocados worth. Service was good and friendly, but I definitely wouldn't go back.
author: Joni M.

description: $1 margaritas for only 30 minutes Fridays at 6-6:30 will be the best bad decision you ever hear of and then decide to partake in
author: Megan A.

description:
Tacos. Ahhh-mazing
Bar. Ahhhh-mazing
Giants game. AHHHHHHHHHH-mazing
author: Joanna H.

description:
I remember when I first visited this bar. I asked for a snakebite and the bartender looked at me like I didn't know what I was talking about. I tried to keep a straight face as i explained to her what it was, thankfully the owner came by and made the drink for me. Beside this one hitch, I have to say i like place. 

they carry a varied selection of drinks. or course they have happy hour where beer is $3-$4. the food is decent, it's regular bar food and a mix of Hawaiian food. id recommend sticking to the nachos, tacos and spam matsubi. 

For a bar it's pretty clean even the bathrooms. Walls are lined with flat screens to watch the games. Mainly the early to mid 30's crowd. I even ran into one of my friend's opponents in his flag football league. During happy hour it gets pretty packed sometimes to the point where it feels like you're 'crawling' to get to the back. Street parking is a pain since it's residential.
author: Lola L.

description: The best fish tacos I've ever had! Got to get them Nick's way. Also they have this amazing sauce for their chips. I've never tasted anything like it, but it's basically heaven in a plastic ketchup bottle.
author: Emily W.

description:
Hungry before Holy Cow. Craving some quick but good food - fish tacos, perhaps? Yes! 

Luckily we found a spot for our party to be seated. We ordered mostly all food including the nachos, which were AMAZING! The bartenders were all sweethearts - very friendly and nice.

The nachos was a really big order, many of us shared it! It came with a generous amount of toppings (guac, salsa) and chips! The shrimp taco was a decent size, enough for one. There is a fair amount of fish in it - they don't skimp out on the good stuff! Also, good amount of toppings.

All tasted very fresh, especially for the time of day I went!
author: Jamie Y.

description: I was a usually since I turn 21. I love their drinks and they make great food. A awesome place to watch sports and the best high fives from strangers. I always make great friends there whenever I go alone. When I do go with friends, I will still have an awesome time. :)
author: Ada X.

description:
Fish Tacos, Baja Style, Nick's way. This is the only thing I order. Best fish tacos in the world (comparing it to gringo/tex mex/mexican style). The orange sauce here is also so awesome I could drink it. If I could I'd mix this sauce with Papalote's orange sauce and mix it with the tacos and call it a night.

Seriously, don't sleep on these fish tacos. Don't even mess around with the other meats... GET THE FISH!!!
author: Marc T.

description:
I recently had the pleasure of working the door at this establishment, which also doubles as a Sports Bar. On this particular occasion, it was during the SF Giants quest for the Championship; we all know how that turned out (finally took one down! awesome!)...

I'd never been to the joint before, but after introducing myself and getting a lay of the land as to the capacity and what the bosses wanted in terms of regulating the door and the patrons, I settled in.

The staff were all stellar; they helped me with questions and offered me grub as if they'd known me forever. The owners were cool and everyone was extremely friendly. I appreciate that greatly.

And, the food is good. On the couple days I was there, I checked the fish tacos and chicken tacos as well, plus they serve the biggest pile of chips/salsa/gaucamole ever. YUM.

I had to be a little hard on some late arrivals to catch the games, and a few of them tried all the usual tricks to sneak in. It really gets aggravating when I say what the deal is and why someone can't gain entry to hear "REALLY?", or "Are you serious?" YES. I am serious. Really!

Keep in mind, people, the establishment sets the protocol, and The City sets the capacity of the place as to how many it can hold safely--I, or anyone who does this type of work just enforces these things. It's NOT personal. Get over it. Show up earlier, and be respectful of the long-suffering fools like me who are trying to do our jobs and keep the business from getting shut down/ fined due to overcrowding, or other similar situations. Be mindful of the fact that's it's not all about you.

Otherwise, I enjoyed my stay immensely, and, naturally, having it be during a glorious moment in history for SF didn't hurt!
author: ACE A.

description:
Mmmm. Burritos. This place is pretty expensive, but I can't deny them that they make a yummy burrito. 

Get the California burrito with carne asada. You won't be sorry!
author: Krissel A.

description: The tacos are awesome but damn if they actually hired some servers that paid attention to their customers id given it a higher rating.
author: Chris S.

description:
Tacos were just alright. 
It was Taco Tuesday so every taco was only $1. We went to celebrate my friend's birthday so we just ordered a bunch of tacos. 

I wasn't very impressed. The tortillas were not very warm so they didn't taste cooked and just crumbled in my mouth. The meats were seasoned alright, but I really didn't like the fish taco. Fish tasted old and actually gross. 

A lot of reviews here say they're good, maybe that Tuesday was just an off day. Not sure - but i don't think I'll be visiting them again.
author: Julia K.

description:
Went on a Sunday to watch the Sharks game - always go to Kezar Pub for sports, but desperately needed a change of pace. Game started at 5pm and easily found a table with two tvs in front of us televising the game. The waitress was on top of things and quickly took our food and drink orders. I ordered the grilled shrimp taco Nick's way, which is now my new fave taco!  They slice the shrimp in half lengthwise to make it seem like there's more shrimp than there really is, but the taco is so tasty I'm willing to forgive. Shrimp was grilled to perfection - not rubbery at all - and the guacamole was sublime. My friend ordered a carne asada California burrito, looked good, but unbelievably heavy.  She was only able to finish 3/4 of it. 

The awesomeness of the night - being given the remainder of a Tecate bucket. I don't drink beer, but my friend happily accepted it. Was also cool to see other Sharks fans in the bar and met a nice couple from Wisconsin who cheer on athletes from the state (Pavelski and Burish with the Sharks).  

Now I'm going to try Taco Tuesday with both the Sharks and Giants playing... Wish me luck...
author: Kim C.

description: I went here with my husband for an impromptu date "linner" while we were in the 'hood.  It's a sporty bar (and I am not a sporty gal) but my husband liked that. Great beer selection but I reallllly loved the "Nicky's Taco" - I got the carnitas and the carne asada and it was DELICIOUS.  It's a happening spot so it did take a while to get a spot.  It has a neighborhood vibe, not too many yuppy invaders from outside of SF which is nice.  I'm dreaming of those damn tacos right now! Will go back again,
author: stephany m.

description: This place was poppin' on a Friday night! But luckily we were still able to find some spots in the back. Service is really quick and friendly and we got served water right away then got our orders in for food and drinks which came out not soon after. Food is not bad for a bar, fresh and quick. Overall just a fun place to hang out for a little while!
author: Mabel L.

description: I like how I don't have to go all the way to the Broadway location to get a Nick's Crispy Tacos fix. However, not only is parking hard here, but it's hard to even get seated. Best bet is to probably take it to go.
author: Nicole D.

description: I didn't know fish tacos could get to this level of amazing. These beer-battered, Nick's Way fish tacos are the best I've ever EVER had. I just kept shaking my head as I ate them because every bite exploded with amazingness. Nick's Way is the only way, btw.  Next time I visit SF, I'm driving directly from the airport to Underdog's. I intend to drag everyone I know to this place just so they can experience this for themselves. The fish is *SOO* not fishy - hard to tell its fish! Its just soft velvetyness. The secret sauce is beyond compare. The crunchy crispy outside complements the texture of the fish so its not a mushy soft experience like most fish tacos are. The guac is great and doesn't overpower. This is a seriously orchestrated experience by a chef who knows what he's doing. The humble fish taco is now a culinary experience. What an entertaining, pleasant surprise. Nick - keep doing what you're doing.
author: Carolyn F.

description:
I am very surprised that there is a wide range of reviews.  My experience at TSAU was no less than stellar.  First I came here to watch the Giants game with some of my friends.  I'm not a big sports fan so I spent most of my time observing. And here is what I found:
We sat down, looked at the menu and within 2 minutes someone came over and asked us what we wanted for food and drinks.  Our food came and some dude came over to see if we were enjoying our food.  I told him it reminded me of Nicks (I had no idea it was NICK) and he shook his hand to introduce himself.  He said a few words and then back to business.  It was after a huge game day!

Then, as I was eating my food I started observing the staff.  If you have worked in the food industry before; here is where we'll trade notes.  The bar is impeccable.  The staff is always moving, cleaning, taking orders, picking up extra bottles and it shows.  Counters are always clean.  There's no "that's not my area" bs going on.  The alcohol is arranged neatly and there was a very tight system here for restocking, replenishing and making sure the beers were ice cold and in buckets.  I am impressed.  

Next I wanted to see how the rest of the place was organized and designed.  The floor is linoleum which is what we use in the hospital. Wise choice Nick.  Its clean, has a good coefficient of friction and its not STICKY.  This is miracle for a sports bar that serves plump tacos.  

And now the crowning jewel of my experience was the bathrooms.  They were clean.  On game day they were shockingly clean, well stocked and yes I could see the floor.  I know now that Nick takes alot of pride in the whole establishment.  
Its a clean, efficient and FUN sports bar.  Thanks Nick for opening this joint! I'll definitely be back.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Let's just get this out of the way: the tacos and quesadillas here are so good it's retarded. Easily the best in SF. Nick of crispy taco fame must've taken over this place recently because it wasn't too long ago when it was just called Underdogs. 

I'm not sure if it was Nick or Taco Bell that came up with the novel idea of using a crispy taco shell inside something soft - in this case, a regular corn tortilla - but Nick gets it right.

We saw them bring out an order of quesadillas for someone and they looked so good, I had to have em. So I got the carnitas and when they brought them out I insisted I ordered only one. The guy looked at me like I was a babbling idiot and said, "that *is* one." DAAAAAM! The carnitas were juicy and had this citrus-y marinade and the outside was a little crispy which gave it just enough texture to eat with hands.

Should I be worried if I can't stop thinking about the food? Getting the shakes?
author: O'Shea J.

description:
Yeah. It's good. If you can find a seat you have already succeed in a great time at Underdogs. We come here for NIcks tacos and the yummy hot sauce that comes with it. The tacos are pretty good, though I would say the chicken lacks the most flavor. They have a $5 shot and beer special too. 

Fun place for an evening or afternoon for sure.
author: Kat M.

description:
To be honest, I can't get enough of these tacos ordered none other than "Nick's Way." I've tried all of the tacos, and they're all pretty darn amazing. I'm typically not one to rave over tacos, but they are literally the best tacos I've ever had in my life. So much so, that I took a group of like 8 of my friends here to prove it to them. 

I was telling them all day how amazing these tacos are as we attended a concert at golden gate park. Typically when you hype something so high, you end up being disappointed at the results. EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THEM thanked me for introducing this gem to them, and immediately started spreading the word to their friends.

So yeah. The tacos are THAT good. =)
author: Graham K.

description:
I absolutely love this place and everyone I have brought here does too! I've been here during Giants games which is the extremely crowded but I love the fans and atmosphere and Taco Tuesdays.

Order any of their tacos Nick's Way and you will not be disappointed. The red hot sauce is delicious! The tacos come in a decent size with two layers of tortilla with melted cheese in between them and guac and salsa oozing out. The bartenders are also very friendly and the service is great. The waiters/waitresses come around to clean up your dirty napkins (my friend and I use alot!) while you're eating which is nice. 

I would go once a week if I could!
author: Vikki K.

description: After extensive research I am willing to say they have the world's best nachos. Great portions and toppings and the chicken is nicely prepared with fitting spices. Anytime I am on 19th and craving some food I will be sure to stop in for a quick bite at a reasonable price. They have captured the essence of a surfer bar quite nicely and I feel I am back in San Diego when I am there. Its a great hang out spot to meet up with people or catch a game.
author: Ted R.

description:
TACO TUESDAYS!!!

Perhaps the funnest day of the week, not the weekend.  What a great excuse to go out on a school / work night and have some cheap food with complimented with some drinks.  

- 1 star for the hour long wait for a table.  

Other than that, the atmosphere is great. Thankfully a Giants game was on while i was there so the bar was very lively.  The tacos are okay.  Nothing special, but it's a bar so that is expected.  $2 tacos and tecate.  The waitress was very good as she remembered all of our orders for a 12 member party.
author: Alex G.

description:
I've lived in the neighborhood for almost 10 years and just discovered the Taco Shop at Underdog's a couple of years ago!  Lucky for me that I did discover it.  Their tacos are soooo delicious!  The Nick's Way Tacos are fantastic - one taco is truly enough because they are huge!  I've had fish, shrimp, vegetarian and steak.  I'm sure the chicken is really yummy too.  My husband loves the chicken quesadilla because - huge, delicious, filling.   The red sauce is to die for - spicy, tasty, delicious.  Their guacamole, salsa and chips are so good; I come in for take out and that's all I get.  

The staff is friendly and attentive and if it's too busy, I take my stuff to go so they can focus on everyone else and I won't have anything to complain about.  Great happy hour specials.  Just writing about the food makes me want to go in there tonight!
author: Cristina M.

description: I went once and got the cheeseburger burrito, which was awesome. Next time got some pretty good tacos for $2 each. If this wasn't in San Francisco, the mecca of Mexican food, I would say it is top notch, but some places in the Mission are a tad better.
author: Ben E.

description:
Sometimes I have the craving for chips and guacamole. Okay that's a lie, all the time I crave chips and guacamole. I can't help it. It's an issue. When I went to Rome, I nearly died. Avocados are hard to come by in the Eternal City.

The chips and salsa here are delicious, but guacamole always prevails over salsa in my book. 

I also had the best steak quesadilla of my life here. I'm almost sure they sprinkled bad things in it like crack because afterwards I just wanted to eat their quesadilla everyday. 

I had a bite of my friend's tacos, Nick's way, and they were okay but not worth the $6 pricetag. But the quesadilla, I'm speechless still...and hungry. Seems like a good place to catch some sports too. I watched a Giants game here.
author: Pearl R.

description:
After a great day at Baker Beach, the roomies and I decided we should go grab some tacos and beer here. While the ambiance and crazed football fans created your typical bar scene; I hated the fact that there weren't enough seats. Luckily our waitress was helpful in accommodating us. 

We sat down, I'm a Dodger fan so my eyes were glued to that however, when the manager, Nick came along he was a total DICK....THAT'S RIGHT NICK THE DICK was rude as hell!!!!!!

EXCUSE ME BUT YOU EXPECT ME TO PAY FOR YOUR SERVICE WHEN I ASK A SIMPLE QUESTION?!? WHO GIVES A FLYIN' F**K WHERE I CAME  FROM!!!!!!

The shrimp tacos(Nick's way) was good but I do not know if I'd ever come back to this joint....point blank
author: Mehgan B.

description:
- delicious taco's
- mexican corn on the cob (elote)
- basketball arcade game
- plenty of room to sit and eat or watch sports on the big screen tv's
author: Brian C.

description:
Tuesdays are generally the worst day of the week for me, but the Taco Tuesday at Underdog's changed that, at least just this once on one fateful Tuesday.   

My friend and I missed the happy hour by a hair (M-F 4:30-6pm, $1 tacos and $2 Tecate) but it didn't matter because $1 tacos (for individual Street tacos with the choice of pork, chicken, or steak) were waiting for us all night.  On Fridays they serve  50 cent margaritas from 6-6:30pm.

The place was packed, and we stood around for a while for a table to open up.  A table never opened up, as everyone was busy watching the baseball game that was on, seriously $1 tacos is just a cheap excuse to stay and watch the game.  Luckily people are willing to share the table so we were able to squeeze in.  So just ask.

We had the nacho with carne asada, and I was ready for 10 of the $1 tacos, and a margarita.  The nacho is huge.  Freshly fried  chips topped with beans, a lot of meat, cheese, pico de gallo, quacamole, jalapeno, and a side of sour cream ($9.75).  Tasty and really a meal in itself, with all five food groups represented into a single pile of goodness.

So after my friend and I split the nacho I was able to eat....one taco.  Such a shame, I know.  I had the carne asada version.  It was simple but still good, and the hot soft corm tortilla makes it.  The margarita was really good, not watered down like at so many places.  

Now I know what to do if a Tuesday fails me.  I will go to Underdog's for tacos, maybe nacho, and a margarita and my optimism will be restored.
author: Alice A.

description: I popped in here for a quick snack with friends and we ended up splitting a pitcher of margaritas and 2 sets of nachos. Their nachos were delicious, but I would highly suggest going with steak instead of chicken. The chicken they use on their nachos was like chunks of shredded chicken but it made it more difficult to get some meat with every bite. I'd definitely go back though!
author: Shruti N.

description:
Wow, I was eating Mexican food and enjoying it!

Came with a meet up group and I was a little reluctant since I don't normally like Mexican food much. (For one, I don't like beans and secondly, may just be that I have never had good ones.)

I ordered two Baja fish tacos and they came piping hot. At $4.50 per taco, it was a little more expensive than normal but the piece of fish was good size and the batter was nicely seasoned to give it flavour. I specially liked the one of the salsas with smoky flavour.

As for service, everyone there was friendly and worked hard but they were so busy that when we needed attention in the middle of our meal, it took a while to flag someone down.

The busy bar atmophere was slightly chaotic and fun.
author: Cindy B.

description: I guess I wasn't hungry enough or my expectations were quite high, but the taco was just OK.  They are huge and double stacked tacos.  If you're hungry, here's your place.  It's very casual and they have draft beers as well.  For most, it's a must drink to accompany this taco.
author: Veronica O.

description:
We went on a Sunday to watch the Niners game, friend's choice, so we didn't get to pick location.

The bar is huge, great selection of beer and cocktails. Service was friendly. (main reason why it got 2 stars)

Now on to the Taco Shop.....it just seems like a cheap rip off of Nick's Crispy Taco's (which is MUCH better IMHO). Tacos could be done "Nick's way", so we ordered the fish taco "Nick's way". It arrived, but Nick's Way was no where to be found. We also ordered the California burrito, basically, it's fries inside with meat, salsa and rice/beans, which sounded good, but when we got it, the fries were mushy and soggy, the burrito was thin and had barely anything in it. All I tasted were the soggy fries.. Great price for almost $8. NOT! One good thing I have to say...I do like their hot habanero sauce, which Nick's Crispy Tacos does not have. The sauce sure made everything we ordered more easier to eat. 

Oh, and if you must go there, order the corn on the cob, they were delicious! (and I didn't even need the habanero sauce for that!)
author: Jenny T.

description: TOO MUCH PEOPLE! It's too crackin' in here. Only wanted some tacos. Took 20 minutes. It's all good, totally worth it. Could have used some seats but there was a Giants game so, had to take out. DAMN GOOD TACOS! pricey but lives up to it.
author: Hui L.

description:
I know this place is known for their tacos...and they are just as good as Nick's crispy tacos or any other taco bar on Union street in the Marina. 

There "taco tuesday" deal however is not so great...the only "deal" were 2dollar tecates...which to be honest in my opinion is turlly what tecate is worth anyways. The tacos were comparable...but again no break on the price for TT???

On the plus side....they have Phenomenal Hot wings that aren't all skin and fatty but meaty and big. The blue cheese dressing they serve it with was delicious with huge chunks of blue mmm mmm

Overall great neighborhood place/sports bar...tacos were good but the lack of a deal for TT (except on cheap ass mexican beer) kinda made me think twice about recommending this place as the go to spot for a great deal on TT.

THIS PAST TUESDAY I WAS SERVED BY THE RUDEST MOST UNCOUTH BARTENDER EVER...I GET IT SAN FRAN IM SORRY IM A LAKERS FAN...BUT GUESS WHAT UNDER DOGS....YOUR A SPORTS BAR...EMPHASIS ON THE SPORTS....DONT PATRONIZE ME AND INSULT MY CHARACTER AND BE RUDE TO MY GIRLFRIEND JUST BECAUSE WE ARE SUPPORTIVE AND VOCAL FANS. GUY WAS A TOTAL PRICK AND IVE WORKED IN THE SERVICE INDUSTRY...EVEN IF YOU'RE HAVING A BAD DAY YOU SHOULD NEVER BROADCAST THAT TO YOUR PAYING CUSTOMERS. COST HIM HIS 20%TIP AND ANY FUTURE RECOMMENDATIONS FROM MOI ! ! ! !

NOTE TO THE HIRING STAFF...START LOOKING FOR A REPLACEMENT. YOUR GUY JUST ISNT UP TO SNUFF AND BRINGS THE REST OF YOUR STAFF DOWN WITH HIM
author: Sachi P.

description:
Get it Nick's way!

Came here to satisfy the munchies after Cal Academy Nightlife. The tacos are really big... At any other place I would order 2 tacos for myself, so I did the same here, but I was way full after my first one. I had the carne asada Nick's way and a regular shrimp one... The regular one was not that great, but the Nick's way one was probably the best taco I've ever had! I will surely be back for more!
author: Kavita S.

description:
good atmosphere for playoff baseball and other sporting events as it felt I was at the game cheering on the giants as they won 1-0 over the braves. They have happy hour specials 4-6pm that includes $1 cheap tacos and $2 beers. I suggest getting here at least 1.5 hrs before the game if you want a seat as this place was packed to standing room only. I also highly suggest getting the $4.50 carne asada nick style taco. It was soft on the outside with a crunchy shell on the inside with all the fixings of beans, guacamole, and salsa. It was simple but one of the better tacos Ive had. 

Bottomline: a good place to go to watch sporting events with a group especially during the playoffs. I wouldn't mind coming back.
author: Robert Y.

description:
"Hnnnnnng."

It's the sound I make when something tastes really, really, really good, and I am incapable of describing it.  In theory, anyway.  I'm not about to make awkward noises in public.

As far as Mexican food goes, I am pretty hard to please, though I confess I have only tried a limited variety and only speak for myself - I mean, clearly.

I got the carne asada quesadilla, I believe, and the tortilla was perfectly crunchy, the meat was tasty (and I'm not that big on beef, pork, etc. - this is coming from a girl who thought tri-tip was fish for the longest time ... shut up), and the cheese! O M G, I would have ordered a cheese quesadilla if they had it available (I wouldn't know; I scanned the menu rather quickly).  While I had quite a bit of shredded leftovers (I like to rip my food and then eat it ... I am well-aware that I might qualify as an eccentric eater, thank you very much), it really was delicious.

The portion was more than decent.  When I got my food, I was actually surprised that it was way more than I was expecting.  

Service was great, I think. I thought the woman who greeted us and took our orders was pleasant enough, I guess. Then, one of the other workers took over and was just really friendly - but not a try-hard either - so I appreciated the overall service.

Atmosphere is good.  I kept thinking to myself that this would've been a good place to watch the Giants games.  It's a large space for a bar with arcade stuff in the far back and sports banners of different teams decorating the ceiling.  

So yeah, they got all their bases covered.  I could see myself here again.

-1 star because it takes a lot to impress me.  I would give it 4.5 stars if I could.  As far as sports bars are concerned, it ranks high on my list.

(Oh, and they had this pear cider?  My friend ordered it, and I took a swig just as we were leaving.  SO GOOD.  I regret that I only ordered my wimpy and kid-friendly diet coke, so I will remedy that the next time.  You should, too.)
author: Ashley F.

description: The fish tacos are my favorite here, but I also eat the california and cheeseburger burritos.  Both very very delicious.  The service is good but you can sometimes get lost in the mix when it gets busy.  They have decent choice in alcohol and are not too pricey.  4 stars for the whole sha-bang, minus 1 because I've been lost in the mix far too many times.
author: Sa V.

description:
I've been here many times and have enjoyed it. I like that the food is fresh and good, especially the habanero salsa. My visit from earlier tonight was definitely not one of my best. It takes a lot for me to complain about a waiter/waitress, I tend to be pretty understanding. Emily was our waitress, she gave me extra time to order my drink as I was not there when she came by to start my table off with drinks and I didn't feel rushed. However, when taking our order, I asked that the pico de gallo salsa be on the side as opposed to being served over the chips. I thought that registered, but when we got our chips I seen that it didn't. Okay then...whatever, no biggie. So fast forward to us paying the check, the person to my right handed her the check along with cash and card. When she brought the check and receipt back, I was drinking water and she rudely reached over in front of me to drop the check off in the middle of the table. I literally had to tilt my head back a bit so that she wouldn't hit my glass. She could have nicely put the check on the side of the table not in the middle, I was just like wow...no "Excuse me, pardon my reach". On a positive note, kudos to the guy with his hair in a ponytail who checked in with me when he seen I didn't have a drink, I had just ordered it and was waiting. 
"R-E-S-P-E-C-T...just a little bit"
author: Sylvia S.

description:
I've found it!  I've finally found it!!!  A taco worthy enough to be classified as "Mexican"!   Hooray!  

I'm a Gringa (or gabacha, whichever you'd like to call me) and I love me some mexican food.  I lived in Mexico for three years and ever since moving back state-side I've been on a quest for a taco that exemplifies all the flavors of Mexico.  I came to Underdog's after a friend wouldn't stop raving about their tacos (and she's a vegetarian no less) for lunch and it was heavenly!  Homemade corn tortilla?  Check.  Perfectly seasoned pulled pork and carne asada?  Check.  Delicious salsa verde?  Check.  $6 for three tacos and a side of freshly made chips?!  Oh, please stop me cause I could go on and on!  

I don't know who this taco-making magician Nick is, but he earns my respect in spades.
author: Ali L.

description:
Tacos, Beers, and the Giants- OH MY!

Met up with my girlfriends here last night and had a great time!  

House margartias for all.  LOVED the carne asada taco Nick's way... mmm... pescado "baja" style taco was so fresh and delicate... tasty tasty!

Be prepared:  Nachos were just alright.  The place was pretty busy given a Giants game was on.  It gets pretty loud that I thought I was yelling most of the time.  Hard to park... BUT would still come back!  A total gem in the Sunset.  

Great customer service and great tacos!
author: Christine K.

description: Gotta have the tacos Nicks way. Yum!
author: Cyd K.

description:
came here tonight with Big Red after months of seeing her 'Taco Tuesday!'-type facebook status updates. i never really made it here because i'm more of a burrito person, but a taco hankering crept up on me the past couple of days, and i found myself waiting almost a whole hour to get seated inside the packed place. POUNCE ON THAT LIST AND GET YO' NAME ON IT PRONTO, SON. shared one of the bigger tables in the back with an already seated party of 4...doesn't matter. ordered straightaway and waited.

we both got the Baja Style Fish Tacos - done Nick's Way of course. That's Big Red's fav, and i've been craving it after reading all the positive yelp reviews. Let me just say that i'm a pretty (monstrously) big eater, and i'm surprised that those two tacos (per order) made me feel full really fast! hella cheap too at $5-ish.

battered fish and whatever else was inside that crispy tortilla inside (yesss, an extra dimension!) that soft tortilla...bumpin' party in my mouf! the guac that smothered the tacos was stupid rich and tasty. satisfied my guac craving for the next month. oh, and that sauce in the tacos! yummeh. all the flavors were intensified with extra squirts of salsa verde and that kinda-creamy reddish hot (?) sauce that they have in squirty bottles on the table.

minus 1 star for the somewhat soggy batter on some parts of the fish piece in one taco. mushy batter was mushy, and it wasn't soaked in the delectable taco sauce or anything...hopefully, won't be getting another one of these in the future, because i will surely be back for more of their tasty tacos and amazeballs guac!
author: Eliza D.

description: Ordering the fish tacos Nicks way was revelatory. Good beer choices. Be warned that it can get very very packed here, making strollers somewhat tricky during busy times.
author: Thomas S.

description:
On the good side this is a great bar with  a good selection of beers on tap, great mixed drinks, and great hd tv sports games on.

The bad news is the mexican food is mediocre at best. The mexican taco special was bland, the carnitas burrito was so white bread is wasnt even funny, the guacamole tasted like it was from costco in the can. I thought it would be better considering all the yelp hype...but there are so many better places to get great tacos y burritos. Plus the prices are more than most places and the servings are small. Burrito express, 1 and 2, run circles around this place and at a better price.
author: David G.

description: Came here during rush hour and the $2 taos i believe and the place was packed. The tacos were good but could have been better but we were hungry so i devored it haha! I also got the corn with the cheese and spice and that one i REALLLLY liked it was my first time trying it and i ate the whole thing. My suggestion is get there early or else your stuck in the "list" waiting to get a table which sucks because people never get up since it is a bar too.
author: Trisha B.

description:
Came here to try Nick's Baja Style Taco on the 7 x 7 list. FIrst thing I must say...one taco should NOT COST $6! It was basically a soft tortilla shell with a hard one inside with a big piece of fried cod and guacamole (LOTS OF GUAC). It was okay tasting but nothing special. Not something I would want to pay $6 for at least. 

They only get 3 stars because of the great service they gave us. THey served us food still even though it was 11:55pm (kitchen closes at 12). Even though there was only 4 of us and we went there strictly to just get tacos and no drinks, our waitress still checked in on us every 5 minutes.
author: Annie L.

description: First time I went, I didn't know if we were suppose to sit ourselves or the bartenders or waiter. I asked one of the guys carrying food passing by who seemed really busy (came on a Tuesday night) if we just sit down. He said yes and he'll be there to take our order. What surprised me was that it said taco Tuesdays were 1$ each but it's actually 2$ each! But those tacos were good. But not worth 2$ each. I do recommend the Nick's way tacos, worth the 4-5$. I got the Baja fish Taco and it made me sick. My stomach hurt and it was the only thing I ate besides a taco. ( I didn't eat much that day) so maybe that was it. I really liked it at the time. Had my bf taste it and he said it wasn't that great but whatever.Anyways, I'm giving one star for the waiter, he was attentive and nice, and one more for the taco that I ate.
author: Noellee C.

description:
I was going to say, I don't get it? But I do...

They're the only place in their area that offers what they do. That's why it's an easy no-brainer if you want Mexican food.

Food tastes good. Nothing amazing, but it's good. I'll give them that.


For the price? ($10+) Not really unless you NEED a taco. The service tends to be crap. They're waiters/waitress' act like they lost hope years ago. When I'm crazy for Mexican, I'll go here otherwise I don't mind scouting for a chipotle.
author: Drew M.

description:
I don't watch sports... but there is a Tuesday All-night happy hour which has $2 beers and $1 tacos (or vice-versa, i don't remember) 
The $2 beers are select beers and I drank Blue Moon and Peroni and they weren't part of that list.  

Besides this Taco Tuesday thing, they can set up beer pong.  They have plenty of ping pongs-I've seen them.  Next time, after a proper dinner, I will challenge someone, but last night I would have been drunk.  

Service is efficient and friendly.  
People there are chill and keep to thier groups; sometimes, you also just meet people sitting around at the bar.  
I remember thier buffalo wings are pretty good; just the way I like it: spicy!  
Like everyone else says, it's a clean place with really nice plasma screens every couple of feet.
author: Debbie N.

description:
Went there for the Tacos Tuesdays ($1 tacos, $2 Tecates, $0.50 margaritas) and realized you get what you pay for - not necessarily a bad thing. Compared to taquerias, Underdog tacos use only one tortilla. The cilantro and onions were fresh. The meats (carnitas-very good, carne asada-good, no al pastor-boo, no good). You'll have to add the salsa to the tacos though (there are three, mild, medium, and burning hot).

Good: friendly waitress (Nicole), quick service, good bar foods, tvs, brightly lit.

Bad: Tecates are in cans, not bottles lol; the chips and salsa has too much tomatoes and avocados.
author: Peter L.

description: Fish Tacos are to DIE for....Buttttt no Corona, no ShockTop, No BlueMoon, No RANCH WTF for my buffalo wings...Im happy the GIANTS won that night or else i would be saying NO to the Taco shop...oh the corn is a must!!
author: Dee M.

description: Perfect tacos, they are a must try as well as the fish burrito. What sucks is getting a table here. If you come on a popular football, baseball or basketball game, peeps be camping out for hours!!! The last time we went we just left because NO ONE was going to give up their tables. That's just rude. Finish your food and let some other people have a chance. For this reason I would rather go to Nicks on Polk where I know I'll be able to sit and enjoy my food.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
4 stars for the brews 3 for the food

watering hole for Giants and 49er fans, I recommend their beers on tap, service with a smile, and mellowness!!

several tvs in this spot, one playing baseball the other playing basketball if not one playing football and another playing basketball, local spot again for the bay area teams haha you wont miss a beat or score for that matter since there are tvs everywhere.

in the back is hoop machine i think there is competitions haha there was postings on the wall haha, they also had one pool table that I saw.

constant cheers and boos in the room depending on the game your watching, lively crowd mellow atmosphere.

Prohibition on tap is delicious haha

the carnitas taco huge hard shelled taco with alot of guac and lettuce, did not fancy the taco in its entirety, lacked taste, meat was bland, size was good just taste for me was not there.

the spicy wings if you love tabasco these would be perfect for you, standard size wings deepfried super soaked in tabasco sauce, again if you love tabasco this would be heaven on a plate, I can do spice but not that much, every bite heat on the lips and fingers.

in all perfect spot to watch the game and have few or several brews

food ***
drinks **** the beers on tap, definitely will bring me back for more
service ***** friendly waitresses with a smile
ambiance **** open bar, roomy, friendly atmosphere, just make sure you have some sort of bay area team your rooting for hahaha

best to go on any game day
author: Clarence A.

description: There are a few times you find a really cool happy hour place is this is you're destination watch sports drink beer and eat tacos simply amazing!
author: Richie F.

description:
Underdogs is the reason I moved into the Sunset.  Well, that may be an exaggeration, but Underdogs being my favorite watering hole is not.  

The service friendly, and the atmosphere is chill.  There's a decent amount of seating, and plenty of flat screens so that wherever you sit, you'll be able to see the programming you want.

The bartenders know what they're doing, and the food is good as well.  My favorites are the Vegetariano $3.25 and the Pescado Baja Style $4.25 tacos, both Nick's Way.  And I religiously order the chips & salsa $1.50.  

Regular specials:
Taco Tuesday 5pm - close:
$1 street tacos

Happy Hour and 1/2 Monday - Friday 4:30 - 6pm
$1 street tacos
$2 Tecate

50 Cent Margaritas Friday 6:00-6:30
author: Sandy K.

description: I'm only giving 4 stars because I ordered for pick up, so I didn't get to stay to evaluate the bar environment, but I will say that the San Francisco burrito with carne asada is delicious!
author: Kaylee D.

description: The Carnitas Tacos Nick's Way are some of the best tacos I've had.
author: Francisco W.

description: I went here tonight for the first time and I'm in Giants heaven! Fish tacos were so damn delicious and then nice beer and cocktail selection and yes great place to watch the giants and with a diverse crowd. It's very affordable and the food is yummy and great Mexican in the sunset is very hard o find!
author: Nadia N.

description:
The Taco Shop doesn't look as bad as the name might possibly imply. When you first hear the name, you think about a small, rundown place that serves borderline Mexican food. Luckily, it's actually a decent sized bar that serves pretty good Mexican food.

The tacos aren't anything spectacular, but they are definitely delicious. If price weren't an issue, I would eat here more often and definitely get it Nick's Way. However, tacos here can get pretty pricey (two tacos can run you over $10). If you do decide to chow down, order it Nick's Way (an extra price, but worth it) and definitely use ample amounts of their red sauce they give to you complimentary. 

Their chips and salsa are a nice and cheap finger food that makes me happy while I sip my beer (or depending on the day, a long island). The drinks are made pretty well (depending on the bartender of course). Last time I was there, I ordered a long island and it came out tasting funny... at the suggestion of a friend, I should try the female bartender next time.

The ambiance of the place is alright. The patrons are a nice mix of races (not like a completely Asian bar-Dragon Lounge- or a completely white bar-buckshot.)
