I did notice, however, that the staff seems to be very... Abercrombie. They're good looking white people (hey, i'm not hating... I do like to look at a white boy!)... that doesn't say much about the bar, but just a heads up that this bar is a bit different than the typical one you find in the sunset.
author: Christina B.

description: First night when I moved to SF I was taken here and got a few beers and a beef taco Nick's Way. Great taco, good service, would be a great place to go for a casual meal/ to watch a game. There a good bar / standing area in front.
author: Max S.

description:
Came here with some friends who live in the city and this place is why I miss living in a city. The tacos were outstanding and the beer was cold.

If you want to play some hoops they have a machine in the back but be warned, if you think you just got the high score dude comes out from the back and just crushes the game in a insane fashion.

Good eat's!
author: Stephen L.

description:
Order one of the "Nick's way" taco. Best Taco in my whole life!!! The Margarita also tastes great... 

Thank God I have the yelp app in my iphone, otherwise I would never know about this place when I was starving after a long walk in the Golden Gate park. :)
author: Lívia C.

description: Get the tacos Nick's Way or take yourself to the highway!  The Taco Shop At Underdog's (not to be mistaken for the other Underdog's a block away)  deliver fresh tacos, burritos, and chips everyday.  This place is definitely not cheap and sometimes I feel like I pay more than what I get out of it, but the ingredients are so fresh, you'll be yearning for more. I recommend trying the California Burrito, and definitely order the Baja Fish Taco Nick's Way.  You won't be dissapointed.  Bring your friends over for Taco Tuesday as well.  It's great to watch sports as well there too.
author: Sam K.

description:
First came to Underdogs with my coworkers to grab drinks & decided to have what they were having, the carne asada quesadilla. Now I'm not a big fan of mexican food. I work in the mission where mexican food is literally everywhere and yet, I bring my own lunch from home. But oh man are their quesadillas good. I know this place is famous for their Nick's Way taco & all that, but you have to try their quesadillas. Crunchy, cheesy, and full of meat & salsa, its the perfect thing to order when grabbing a quick drink with your coworkers or friends. Slather the thing with the red sauce they give you & you know you're in for a good night.

The place is relatively clean, there's a bar with a bunch of flat screens posted on the walls, a couple tables lined up near the wall that can fit two - four people. Near the back, there are those picnic benches you see in the park that can fit like, 6 - 8 if you want to cram everybody in. 

Oh, & one more thing. One dollar margaritas on Friday, 6 - 6:30. Really? One dollar margaritas? Amazing .
author: Desiree C.

description:
Nick's Crispy Taco. Ice cold beer. And the Guacamole and chips. A perfect way to end a long day. 

Servers are really nice - and it's also a great place to catch a game on tv!
author: Kanara T.

description: My favorite kickback bar in the Sunset -- beer selection is decent and so are the prices. Food is priced a little on the higher than what I'd like to pay, but tastes good. Definitely a local favorite!
author: Kevin N.

description:
OMG...HAVE YOU GUYS TRIED THE ELOTES HERE??!?!

I love corn! Seriously, I'm a corn lover. Everyone must try the elotes here.  It's corn on the cob covered in cotija cheese, butter, and cayenne pepper. Not joking, it will change your life. I miss the tingling sensation on my lips when you take that first bite into it. HAHA Man!! Those roasted corn on the cobs at the fair got NOTHING on these elotes! 

This place is awesome.  My BFF lives like a block away from here so it's a pretty chill spot for us to hang out after dinner at Izakaya.  When we're not full, the Nick's way tacos are just BOMB! I haven't tried the burritos yet but that's definitely what I'm ordering next.

The other night, we actually MET Nick! He's honestly one of the chillest person ever.  Always wearing a tee and rainbows.  AHAHA I seriously don't have anything bad to say about this place.  Definitely a great hangout spot if you just wanna chill.
author: Hanna P.

description: I've been thinking of these tacos ever since I've had them!  I've never had Nick's Crispy Tacos so I was super excited to try them here!  I've been craving a good fish taco and this one totally hit the spot.  You have to make sure you get it "Nick's Way" in order to get the whole shabang.  The tacos were huge too... they were overflowing with guac and just simply delicious.  They have a great menu with a lot of different things... My friend ordered the California burrito and it had french fries in it!  I can't wait to come back to eat the tacos again... and try other things as well.
author: Kymberli C.

description:
Came into fart. Stayed for a few beers.

They have Green Flash IPA. GREEN FLASH! I was a bit surprised. Even had to double check by asking the hot waitgirl if that shit was fo'real, fo' real. Its always a gem to find delicious SD beer in SF. 

Tacos? Negro please, I'm from SD. Land of infinite adobada tacos and machaca burritos. And @ $4.50 a pop! Sheesh.

Sat alone, deposited farticles, munched on some chips+salsa ($1.50) and took it all in.
author: I No Lie U.

description:
OK. I'm going to start this off by saying that my review is completely biased because this is my favorite sports bar in all of San Francisco. The service can sometimes be slow (for food), it gets crowded pretty fast (especially on game nights), and it's not very big (hence, it gets crowded easily), but if I'm not at an actual Giants game inside AT&T Park, you'll probably find me here.

Underdogs is mostly known for their infamous tacos Nick's Way. While they're delicious, I mostly go for a San Diego burrito (pico de gallo, cheese, guacamole, with carne asada, carnitas, or pollo) when I actually come for the food. Otherwise, it's an elote, obscene amounts of beer, and the BEST guacamole and chips I've ever tasted in life. Yup, you heard me. 

This place is my "Cheers" in the Sunset District. I've had some great memories here that include the 2010 Giants World Series run, plenty of dates with someone I really cared about, and my 30th birthday celebration! Although I now live in NY, I always make sure Underdog's is one of my first stops whenever I'm back home. It should be yours as well.
author: Abby B.

description: This is my go-to place for fish tacos in SF. I would recommend the Baja style fish tacos Nick's way. You won't regret it. What really sets Underdog's apart is there incredibly addictive fire-roasted tomato salsa they keep on all their tables. I could eat/drink that stuff for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. It's kind of insane how delicious that sauce is. TRY IT.
author: Spencer S.

description: Great Atmosphere. So many TVs to look at. The chips and salsa are always taste fresh and are always warm. The tacos are some of the best tacos i have ever had. So mouth watering and flavorful. Also the staff is great. Even when its a game day and it's really crowded, the staff are great about checking up on you and making sure you're taken care of.  Huge Fan of this place
author: Heather C.

description:
I've been meaning to come here forever! And glad I finally did. Tacos and Especials.. How can one go wrong?

Place serves solid tacos and drinks.. Let's be frank.. It's a watering hole, with good food! And the bathrooms are surprising clean for one at that! 

Initially heard about this place from Doug, the co- owner when he was guest speaking at SFSU a while back. Didn't expect too much, but man... This place might be my new H.h rendevous!

Carne Asda and Carnitas tacos.. nicks way.. Though it isn't on par with El Farolito's tripas tacos..I Wouldn't expect it to be. 

I can say I found another place to bring out of town guests for some good times
author: Jason C.

description:
I've only gotten tacos Nick's way here, but no matter if it's chicken or carnitas, it's delicious.  Nachos are also pretty packed.

Servers are pretty attentive.  Place also has picnic bench style seating and a basketball shooting game to pass the time.  And plenty of tvs to show the game(s) of the day.
author: Ken L.

description:
I love this place.  Unfortunately, so does everyone else in the Sunset district so this place is always packed, especially during a major game.  The last time I tried to come here, there was no where to sit or even stand to watch the Giants play the Braves.

I came here a few times to watch some NBA Playoff games or just to celebrate the end of a semester.  A full bar and a lot to choose from as far as beers on tap.  Also, I'm not big on Mexican food, but I do enjoy the carne quesadillas.  Their tortilla is a good mix of crispy and softy.

Their biggest advantage is that there's a lot of large TVs and since the place is narrow, they're placed pretty well so that everyone can see them.  If you don't have the BEST view of the large TVs then you probably have a perfect view of one of the smaller TVs.

I have yet to find something like this in San Mateo since I've moved down here :(  One day, I'll be back Underdog's!
author: Alyssa S.

description:
Wow! What's not to like? The Baja fish taco and Vegetariano burrito were hot, fresh, and accompanied by some tasty sauces (I really like the green one - it's on the mild side.) Guinness on tap. Lots of giant TVs but sound level was still compatible with holding a conversation. And the owner bussed our table! We'll be back - with friends.

On a second visit I noticed that it's loud in the back, quiet in the front. Sit in the front if you want to hear your tablemates.
author: Anna L. C.

description:
I love The Taco Shop! 

This place is seriously where it's at. A stampede of mythical creatures could not keep me from their $1 street tacos at Happy Hour. 

When here, I have always had friendly, beautiful people bringing me food and booze. Once, I got confused about when their happy hour started, and came in way early. I felt really stupid, but the place was basically empty and the owner saw my pain and misery, and offered to start Happy Hour early that day. Seriously, what an extremely cool dude! That's what I'm talking about. I was so grateful, I ordered like 10 street tacos (with $2 beers aplenty to accompany them). I guess I didn't know how hungry I was? Anyways, it was a blast. 

Also, this is an amazing place to come watch a game. They have a giant, comfy bar and a zillion flat screen TV's. This is a tremendously fun place to hang out and stuff your face.

For being sympathetic to an idiot who can't read posted signage and making my happy hour $1 taco dreams come true, I would give them my business any day.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Talk about a record. Last month was the first time I've been to Underdog's but, since then, I've been back for three consecutive "Taco Tuesday's." Now that's a testament to good food! 

The best value are the street tacos for $2 each on Tuesday's, but stay away from those. Your best bet is the regularly-priced baja fish tacos "Nick's way," complete with a huge piece of fried fish, a crispy taco shell inside a soft taco shell, guacamole and the fixings. Be sure to get the two bottles of green and red hot sauce and try them both. They also have a habanero sauce upon request...but that's only for the very brave. 

Two of those fish tacos and a $2 Tecate will fill you up and give you a hearty dinner for under $10. Add in some friends with a $20 bucket of beer and you have yourself a Grade-A frat party in your corner of the bar. 

Just remember to get there early to claim your seat!
author: Bobby L.

description:
Nice spot. Great for getting together with friends for tacos and beers, or shots of Jameson if you so desire because they have a full bar! This place is a fun-time sports, food, games, and drinks hang out place. The tacos were solid. I'm a fan of the shrimp taco, Nick's crispy taco style. Yeah, add me some deep fried crunch to it. Yup. Good times.

On a side note. I went around 10:30 on a Friday night and there were happy children hanging out playing games and having fun while their parents appeared to be enjoying some Friday night downtime! Totally child appropriate bar/restaurant!
author: Kristen E.

description:
yuuuuummy food. baja fish taco sounds so good right about now.
This place is awesome for watching sports, eating good food, and drinking some good drinks.  
Service is not consistent, however, maybe the servers could smile  bit more.  I get working in a hectic environment and dealing with stupid drunks is not fun cause I've been in that position, but it really effects the tone of the place when the servers act bitter toward guests.
all in all, i really like this place and it's my go to for watching baseball games.  they even let me watch the dundundun dodger games!
author: Vanessa M.

description:
OK, I still love the tacos at underdogs, BUT....it says here (at the top of their yelp page) that they have $2 tacos on Tuesdays.  Isn't that the normal price of the street tacos?  They used to have $1 tacos on Tuesdays.   Last time I went I was told that they have stopped taco Tuesday! So sad! 

It always seemed like they put half as much meat in the 1 buck tacos anyways, so why take it away?!?! Oh well, it was great while it lasted! 

They still have amazing salsa and amazing pico de gallo.
author: M M.

description:
Been to the Taco Shop at Underdog's a few times now... been happy with my experience there; but there's definitely a sports cadence to this establishment - complete with free-throw basketball game in back, several flat screens along the bar wall, a smattering of arcade games & the raucous of staff, patrons, kids, sports annoucers all vying for attention... Don't get me wrong, it's a great energy to be around typically; that being said, I would not recommend this spot during important games days, unless you want you & your meal caught in the excitement.

Food - [Carnitas, Carne Asada Taco & Pollo Taco - prepared 'Nick's Way']
What lovely tasty, crunchy goodness these tacos are... "Nick's Way" which is one grilled crispy corn tortilla and one soft - is a great compliment to the monterey jack cheese, pinto beans, pico de gallo and guacamole packed taco. By far the best meat is the carnitas [that's what she said] - shredded, juicy-dripping goodness may be bad for the arteries, but I can deal with that later.The Pollo & Carne Asada are also very tasty, but nothing to write home about... for me, they usually make the Carnitas taste better by comparison.

***'Advisory***
Nick's Way' would NOT be a good selection for take out... you'll loose the crunchy-ness.

Drink - [Negro Modelo, Anchor Steam, Stella Artois, Pyramid Hefeweizen, Heineken]
They have all the ones I like & more, great selection.

Bar & wait staff are very friendly & work with a great energy... being a bar, there are no reservations - which normally works out [note: sports bar]. It's location, just off 19th Ave makes it awkward to drive to (parking)... & it's always busy in those few block on Irving; but well worth the effort of a10+ block walk - especially with the variety of other shops in the area.

Thank you Nick, whoever you are!
author: Brenton C.

description:
The tacos were good but not the best I've ever had.

Ordered the fish tacos Nick's way (decent, but messy) and the Street-style tacos (which I enjoyed more than the fish tacos). 

I think I enjoyed the atmosphere and the drinks more than the food. I wouldn't come out of my way for tacos but maybe to hang out with friends for drinks and a light meal. Maybe I'm just not a big fan of fish tacos? But I have to admit their taco sauces, especially the Habanero one, are delicious.

My suggestion would be:

1. Order drinks
2. Order Street Style Tacos (or whatever you prefer)
3. Devour the chips and salsa
4. Play a game of arcade basketball


Overall: Good service, good drinks, good people.

The guys restroom does have some nice decorations in front of the urinals, too bad someone took half of them the second I came in to urinate. Not cool.
author: Chris T.

description:
Good food.  The fish tacos and burritos are especially tasty.

We got takeout, but the bar looks fun.
author: Greg H.

description:
I can't say I have ever come here for the bar.  I seek this place out primarily for the tacos.  The BF and I order the chips and salsa to start, with some beer (usually the $3 Tecate).  For tacos, I get the carne asada Nick's way, he is usually orders the 2 taco special (carnitas and carne asada both Nick's Way).  What is there to say about these taco's that hasnt been said?! They are delicious! The taco's are loaded with carne, beans, guac, salsa, and cheese.  I can't eat them without making a mess but I guess that's part of why they are so delicious.  My sister had the fish taco once, and was nice enough to give me a bite, man was it good!  I wanted to trade tacos but she was not having it.

Oh! Almost forgot about the sauces in the bottle.  Both are very tasty to add to the tacos.  I mix both.  Usually I like my hot sauces a tad bit spicier, but flavor-wise, these are so tasty!

The waitresses are always very friendly and attentive.  I've never had any issues grabbing a table.
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
I've been to underdogs before and particularly like the $1 taco happy hour. 

However, after seeing on yelp they would be open for fifa games I struggled out of bed for a 7am game only to find that they weren't open! They specifically said they would open for the early games too! I was bummed especially because a group of us planned to meet here and at 7am it's hard to try and find another place to go. Luckily abbey tavern was up and running and we got to cheer on our team to victory.

Just wanted to write a warning to those planning to go for the early soccer games. Call ahead to make sure they opened!
author: Pearl P.

description: This is the fucking spot. Can't go wrong with anything you order. DOUBLE UP on the sauce it's like magic in a bottle.
author: Paulo N.

description:
this place is great. sports bar atmo with some very decent taqueria food. I ordered a very stuffed carnitas taco and an elote con queso. both were excellent, though I could've used a bit more cayenne on my elote, cause I like it hot, Hot, HOT. 

Since it was packed (not surprising for a saturday afternoon on college game day) and we were forced to sit at the makeshift table that was also a Frogger arcade game. Feeling like little kids sitting at the kiddy table, of course we had to pull out the quarters and get our Frogger on. It was harder than it looked!

The only bummer was the service was sort of spotty. Though friendly enough, our waitress who was other wise on top of things forgot to bring us additional cayenne when we asked for it. Thus the minus 1 star.
author: Phuoc K.

description:
Okay internet, you care what I think, so I am going to go ahead and give you my two cents.

Just went to Underdogs and had the most delicious veggie taco and a pretty good margarita, yummy steamed corn covered in crema fresca and cheesy goodness. Pretty adorable bartender with an epic mustache named "Duke" behind the bar. So cute. I don't usually like sports bars but this one caught my fancy. Must be the yummy cheap eats and the eye candy. Even in the midst of technical difficulties (some crisis with the credit card machine brought back fond memories of the constant ongoing drama of restaurant work) the service was attentive and sweet. Check it out.
author: Maria D.

description: I was here tonight and treated HORRIBLY by the staff. We had a bucket of beer and street tacos and paid with a credit card. We left no tip on the card as we were going to leave cash but didn't have a chance. The waiter picked up the tab and gave us a dirty look after seeing no tip. He grabbed our plate and told us we had to "vacate our seats". I asked why and he said because there were other people waiting to order food. I asked for the manager and she said he was refusing to serve us and that we had to leave and that she was very sorry. She couldn't tell me why we had to leave and just kept repeating that the waiter was refusing to serve us. I have never been treated like that anywhere and will not ever being returning.
author: Jeannie A.

description: Underdog's has delicious tacos that you must get "Nick's Way" and top with their red and green sauces.  Elote con queso and tortilla chips are also must try menu items.  Service here is cool but I'm turned off by the fact that Underdog's is a bar but they let in kiddos and teenagers who can be quite annoying with their whining and immature conversations.
author: Maya S.

description: Excellent food. Clean Atmosphere. Friendly Service.
author: Em L.

description:
Nick's Pescado "baja style" taco is THE way to go. A close second is the pollo taco. The tacos are pretty big, so an order each of these babies will get you pretty full. And at around $4-5 a pop, how can you go wrong? I am officially in love with tacos, thanks to Nick.

The house margaritas were okay, I've had better.. but I appreciate the fact that they use fresh lemon juice :)
author: Helen Z.

description:
Solid spot to both get your drink on and support your favorite team while noshing down on some pretty good eats.  I am not a huge fan of Nick's Crispy Taco's but Nick has done a good job with the food here.  The last time I both ate and drank was for the Netherlands vs. Uruguay match and it was a great spot to watch.  Lots of nice high def flat screens throughout and if you sit at the picnic tables in the back there's table service for your food and drinks which is nice.

They also have pitchers and good deals on some good brands like the Green Flash West Coast IPA I shared with Andrei Z for that particular match.  Went back for the World Cup Final too but it was a bit too crowded then. 

I suspect this would be a good place though to catch most any other sporting event.
author: Gene X.

description:
It's very rare that I find exceptional service, but The Taco Shop delivers. Apparently the kitchen was understaffed and servers had to do some prep. My tacos took longer than they should have, so I was told, and was given some complementary chips and pico de gallo to tide me over. No matter, I was enjoying watching a college football game anyhow and the turnout time seemed reasonable to me. One of the servers behind the bar (which is where I was seated) refilled my iced tea once there was a third left---three times, I'd say. Very nice and attentive.

The food itself was very good as well. The fish tacos were topped with crema and cabbage. A squeeze of lime added the right balance. The carnitas taco benefited from the tasty roasted salsa on the side. I like that the carnitas taco came in a hard (house-made) shell surrounded by a soft tortilla---nice texture.

Great experience--will definitely go back.
author: Charlie G.

description:
We unknowingly came on UFC night.  That was weird. The people who are really into UFC are weird.  I felt like everyone there was acting overly macho while watching two men hug each other, roll around and try to get the other in between their legs to squeeze into submission. That's weird.

However, the Taco Shop is in the back so we were able to slide by the weirdo's and feast on amazing Mexican food. Finally  a place in San Francisco makes the California Burrito known and loved by us Southern californians!! This type of burrito was a staple of my youth in San Diego. Carne Asada, Pico, Cheese, and French Fries! (I add Guacamole) And their hot sauce is exceptional as well. Request the habanero and your small intestines will be pulsing for 3 days after.
author: devon m.

description:
I came here to watch the Superbowl, and luckily, we got some pretty good seats at the bar. We ordered A LOT of food and beer, so here we go.

Nick's Way Fish tacos were pretty darn good! I would definitely get this again. My sister got it the 'original' way, not Nick's Way, but she still enjoyed hers. We also got the Nachos, and those were amazing because the chips were so crispy! Wings were so-so, not my fav. 

But I was kind of annoyed at a point. The bartender gave free chips and salsa to the girl next to me cuz she looked like she was by herself and obviously he was trying to get a conversation started. Then there was a group of really annoying girls behind me, and he asked them if they wanted some shots. -________-
author: Diana L.

description:
We have become regulars for Underdog's take-out.  It our go-to for when Fatty is having burrito-cravings (read: once a week or more).  

I usually get the vegetarian burrito.  It's QUITE tasty!  It is filled to the brim with tasty whole beans, cheese, pico, guac, cabbage, and rice.  SO good!  Totally satisfies my mex cravings!

My partner-in-crime usually orders the fish tacos "Nick's Way," with a crunchy shell surrounded by a soft taco shell.  He SWEARS by these things, though I have yet to take a bite (I'm usually too consumed with my own burrito to notice anything else around me).  

Underdog's could be a BIT more generous with the chips and salsa (we got a pretty meager portion last night, which was sad for my greedy stomach but QUITE good for my waistline).  

Also, I don't love the salsa's.  They're fine, but in the past, I have just used the salsa I've had in the fridge instead.  And the green salsa tastes uncannily like the cilantro chutney my mom makes and serves with samosas.  Which would be great, except I don't think the Indian-fusion flavor is intentional.  

Underdog's is SUPER fast - you can order and get into the car, and the burrito's will be ready by the time you get there (10 minutes!).  

I've never dined-in, but it seems like it would be a fun place to go for happy hour as well!
author: Julie S.

description:
Taco Bell "invented" the double-decker taco. Let's pretend that's a fact and go on to the next deduction: Underdog's perfects the double-decker taco! 

Start off with a $6.50 house margarita (marginally strong & tangy) or a $10 perfect margarita and some $2 chips & salsa. The salsa is very fresh and has whole tomato chunks and the chips are freshly cooked and warm, my favorite style (also very greasy though!).

Then order Double Decker taco's (skip the rest, the nachos grande are only average, the chicken bores me) NICK'S STYLE. This is the double-decker done right! The soft and hard shell combined with all the fixins (2 will be good for a meal) makes it a perfect combo of soft and crunchy. The Sonny soft taco to the hard-shelled Bono.

Don't get grilled shrimp though you'll be disappointed in the tiny, tasteless shrimp. The carne asada and carnitas however are really well cooked, tasty, and a must!

Top it off with Don Julio shots or $20 for a bucket of 6 beers and you'll have a fun evening with friends.
author: Chuck N.

description: Loved their home made Margaritas!  This was our first time.  We had 3 Margaritas, 1 beer, 6 tacos, 1 grilled shrimp Taco & 1 fish Taco, both made Nick's way.  It was delish!!  Only downside was waiting for the food.  It was a bit long, but we will definitely be back.
author: O. A.

description:
The Taco Shop at Underdog's is THE spot for brewskis, Super Shot basketball, and the all-too famous.  Need I say more?  Well, I will anyways.  The go-to food item is the Nick's Way Carne Asada or Vegeteriano Taco.  

Your question: a vegeteriano taco?

My answer: (an emphatic) Hell Yes!

In case you haven't heard, Nick's Way Tacos are some of the best tacos around the city.  Originally from Nick's Crispy Tacos in North Beach, these envelopes of tasty fixens have migrated to the Sunset.  These gut bombs come it at around $4 apiece and will satisfy any taco lover.

In terms of beer, the Taco Shop offers the usual suspects for patrons to wash down their tasty Mexican food and sit back and enjoy the sports event of the moment.  Try to get here a little early if you are trying to huddle with your chums and wet your whistle for any major sporting event.  This place gets crowded and there are a limited number of tables.
author: D L.

description: Brought be by the Kinda Funny guys! Colin Suggested the California Burrito with Pork! It's a must have. #ColinWasRight
author: Mario L.

description:
If you're down for some greasy food, a sports game and a couple of brews, Underdog's Taco Shop is your spot.

It's set up like a sports bar, with a couple tables in the back for consuming your tasty meal.

Both the tacos and burritos are served crispy & greasy, which adds a nice flavorful taste to whatever you ordered.

I've had the California and San Francisco burritos. The California has cheese and french fries, which make it unique.

Order one of their tacos on the side (Nick's Way selection is their best), along with a pitcher of beer and this makes for a great fulfilling meal with any of your friends.
author: Andrew C.

description:
These tacos are too legit to quit!!!!! 

Seriously I've never had a better taco. The best thing about this place, well besides the yummy beer on tap, is the consistency. It is ALWAYS good! The best are the Carne Asada, then fish, then shrimp [in that order]. They have some type of salsa one green and one kinda orange, both are really tasty. The chips are good and they don't salt them which is great!

You can also pop in to watch your favorite sporting events from baseball to hockey to basketball...it makes for a fun environment. 

I haven't played on the bball shooting game but people really seem to enjoy it. 

I had to take away the fifth star because it closes way to early, I believe 9pm.
author: Natalie F.

description: We found our new Tues. night Taco spot. The service was great and I had a fantastic taco salad and my husband had a few $2 tacos that were really good. Get a side of Cotija cheese and you are all set. It was pretty packed but the bartenders and etc. were still friendly and quick.
author: Mrs S.

description:
What makes a great sports bar?  Good booze, good tv's, and good food!  

This place has the best fish tacos in town.  The version to get is the baja battered Nick's way.  Deep fried fish stacked between both a crispy and a soft shell covered with guacamole and slaw.   The only thing better, the carne asada quesadilla!  Tender marinated beef chunks drowning in cheese and salsa.  

Beware, ordering the chips and salsa might just fill you up before your meal even arrives.  They pile on so much fresh salsa that you get an entire day's serving of vegetables!
author: MTBer I.

description:
I was actually kind of impressed with the food here. Came here to watch my beloved Giants whoop some ass, but see my not so loved San Jose sharks get stomped on! The "street style tacos" were pretty good. Very similar tacos you would have on the streets of Mexico(soft tortia, lime, onions, cilantro, and salsa- although not quite as good.

My friend had the nachos which were great too. Appetizing and MASSIVE portion. We settled on a "bucket" of beer which is 6 bottles on ice for $15- pretty good deal.
author: David D.

description: I came here for drinks with some friends. The prices seemed on the higher side, but the general experience was nice.
author: Eric M.

description:
In all fairness, i did not go inside  but ordered to go. I was trying to be efficient while I got my coffee at Starbucks.. next door. Well...I waited a long time for my, one Fish Taco, but it was OHHHHH so worth it!! 

Keep in minf that I never had a Fish Taco in my life, so i don't have anything to compare it to.. BUT...Wow..this was truly delicious, I got the "Nick Style" fish taco. It was loaded with avocado and sour cream, The inside layer is a crispy tortilla while the outside is soft, Interesting...huh?


Anyways...if you have the time to spare...go grab you one..!!!

Love,

D
author: Denise C.

description:
The bar is huge and the staff is friendly.  Both bartenders and the owner came to check in with us.  I call that service.  

The chips come pilled high with pico de gallo and with two bottled sauces you can add to your chips or meal.  We also requested the habanero sauce and were not disappointed, it's fruity and spicy all at the same time.  I ordered the street tacos which is three different kinds of tacos.  All three were delicious, but I could not resist adding all three sauces to them.
author: Megan P.

description:
Love this place, I would come here every day if i could afford it.
GREAT tv's.
Bar staff is best in the city.
Food is out of this world.
Awesome beer and a shot special.
author: N O.

description: Soggy tacos with little flavor. Sloppy nachos. Perfect food for the drunk and hungry.
author: Jen Y.

description:
The Sunset was long overdue for a visit, and ever since I first went to the Taco Shop inside Underdog's I had been wanting to return for breakfast. Then I read they only serve during football season. I do not like football. This was one of the last weekends before the end of the season. It was now or never.

So I went for it, and were you sitting on the other side of the bar, you no doubt would have been amused by the sight of me demurely digging into my breakfast burrito (I was starved from the night before - thanks Miguel Migs/Salted!) surrounded by yelling and screaming (and likely drunk) jersey clad males. And a few females. The guy next to me kept yelling at the TV something about how this team needed to lose and another team had to lose in order for his team to win. Whatever.

I wish the effort would have more star worthy. No wheat tortillas and no egg whites, though I must admit what was inside this flour tortilla - eggs, potatos and salsa - was mighty good. Bonus points for the guy helping double checking on the no cheese, and not even giving me a second glance when I pulled out my own nonfat sour cream for a little topping. I'm sure the football fans around me were thinking "whatever".
author: Jason B.

description:
If you want some really good tacos and nachos while you hang out at a bar this is your spot! It is always "happening." I love going on Tuesday's because they have $2 tacos and $2 Beer so its totally worth it. Its really loud in there so don't go expecting to have a nice calm conversation with someone. Underdogs is for hanging out, having a beer (or 2, or 3 or 4) and playing some pacman or basketball. YES! They have arcade games! 

Don't ever call ahead though because they are so busy they just pick up the phone and then leave it off the hook so they don't have to hear it ring (besides, they can never hear you and you can never hear them so what's the point anyways).
author: Thea M.

description: Have a taco (or two), any taco but it's gotta be Nick's way. I absolutely love the sauces and I feel this is what separates this place from the rest.
author: Cyndi G.

description: Just to keep this in mind but they have a 10 dollar credit card minimum. If you need to meet the minimum, get a shot and do it with the bartender. I recommend the tequila with the deer on the bottle and get it chilled. Very smooth and yummy. So came here for the fish taco and it was okay. I don't know if I would get it again because it was soggy and it was kind of bland. Definitely eat it with the red salsa, makes it so much better. The chips were nice and crisp. The red salsa is delish; you don't feel the kick until couple minutes later so be prepared with some beer.
author: Eve C.

description: Nick's Way carnitas taco was one of the best I've had. Nick's Way grilled fish was forgettable. Otherwise a pretty standard city sports bar feel.
author: Artur G.

description: Underdog's will become one of my regular place from now on. Taco is delicious, drink is  tasty n strong, they have my favor sangria, luv it, the whole pitcher only$24. Good place to chill.  We always want to find some good places which r close by our house to drink n eat simple. Now i found one here again!!
author: Sanly L.

description:
I came here the first time with my boyfriend and every time thereafter has been great! Love the great food! It can get loud but it's a bar! I love it!  I love the fish tacos and the burritos are great too! 
We always order chips and salsa, beer and tacos. It's an awesome hang out spot and it's really laid back.  I would totally recommend this place if you're in the area and lookin for a place to chill.  
I don't give very many five star reviews because i find it redundant if so many people give five star reviews.  It's like stating the obvious...totally unnecessary but because this place has never failed me after multiple visits, I stand behind this five star rating.  it has my awesomeness seal of approval. =)
author: Tu L.

description:
Is it a taco shop, or a sports bar, or a neighborhood bar, or an arcade? 

Well, it's some of all of these things. It's also almost too loud to have a conversation. On the other hand, it has Centipede and Galaga. 

The tacos, chips and salsa, and guac are all five stars and awesome. I highly recommend the Pescado Taco Nick's Way, even at $5.25 each.
author: Adam Z.

description:
D and I were hungry on a recent Friday evening and wanted two things: 1) To avoid our usual Inner Richmond haunts and 2) Mexican.  Enter the Taco Shop (thanks Yelp!).  With over 500 reviews, I won't spend a lot of time on the details of our visit.  Here are the major points:

1) Food is solid, but not specatcular.  No complaints and it met our needs!

2)  Great casual atmosphere

3) Tip: Order the house margarita ... both D and I thought it was better than the premium margaritas were ordered in the first round.

If you live in the Inner Richmond, Inner Sunset or even the Outer Sunset (hey, food options out there are limited!), it's worth the trip.  3 stars ... solid place and I'd go back..
author: Richard F.

description:
I came here with a friend today because we were 1. craving tacos and 2. not close to the Mission. 

I remembered that the Nick's Fish Taco was on the 100 Things to Try list so of course we had to try it.  Although it was very very good, it wasn't $5 good.  I was actually quite shocked that it was only the cost of ONE taco.  We also ordered the Mexican "Street Style" Tacos which comes with one chicken taco, one carne asada taco and one carnitas taco.  All three tacos were way too dry for me.  Almost unenjoyable.  BUT get any taco Nick's way...and it's an instant makeover!!! BOMB DOT COM!

I came to watch a baseball game and even standing outside of Underdogs is fun!! So that must say a lot about how awesome it really is INSIDE.  Super chill and laid back. Love it!
author: Helen V.

description:
Normally a taco/sportsbar place would be way off my radar, but the great reviews on Yelp compelled us to make the walk over to Underdogs. 

Let me say, I was impressed. Great service, tasty margies and .... the corn on the cob!!! We ordered a round, plus the street tacos, a beer battered fish taco Nick's way, a carne asada quesadilla and one of the elote (corn on the cob). Thankfully they brought us two elotes, otherwise there may have been some debate over who was in ownership of the cob. The elote was so dang good that my husband ordered a second and contemplated a third.

The street tacos were admittedly a tad on the dry side, but all else was super-grubalicious. Jeremy has officially made Underdogs his favorite NorCal Mexi-joint and warned me that he will require one meal here each week for as long as he lives. And a minimum of dos elotes per week.
author: Erin K.

description: Cute staff. Decent sangria. Chips and salsa was fresh and cheap! Clean bathrooms!
author: Megan C.

description:
Nicks crispy taco's are more than deserving of all the attention they get around SF. What was once a weird little restaurant in a nightclub is now in a place befitting of its deliciousness. An actual restaurant with a sports bar. The place makes one of the best non-traditional tacos I've ever had. The margaritas are extremely fresh and juicy, and the service is very friendly. I really like this place and will go out of my way to get to the inner sunset (might as well be Egypt) to get my fix of some Tacos nicks way. 

Side note. The salsa they use on the chips is amazing and after my GF ordered the Corn on the cob I will never miss it again... The Corn was sweet crunchy smothered in Cotija cheese and spices and we almost got into a fight over the last bite.
author: John S.

description:
Shame on me. I live so close to this place but never actually tried it.. until a few weeks ago I went with Rabbit. 

Nick's way Taco. MUST TRY.
I read some of the yelp reviews before I went there and was wondering how special their taco would be. So I ordered one of their Nick's way Taco. I actually thought it's 2 Tacos.. I mean it's written on the menu, "1 crispy and 1 soft tacos". So I was actually kind of disappointed when the server brought out 1 taco. But when I had my first bite. My disappointment was gone immediately. Because,

It's A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. 

The crispiness and the softness of the taco...!! Mmmmm. I am hungry now just thinking about it. The size and filling are also generous. 1 taco is good enough to fill me up (but if you're a guy you probably need 2). Rabbit also ordered carne asada burrito. I am never a big fan of it but it tasted really good. The meat actually tasted like.. MEAT!

Thank you for the amazing tacos. I will definitely be back for more.
author: Doris H.

description:
We came by to watch the Lakers eat it. (You suck, Kobe)  In between tacos, we played Pac Man and threw hoops. 

Nick is one cool humble unassuming guy who makes ridiculously great baja fish tacos which explode with flavor and guac. I disagree with previous posters who claim otherwise - it comes down to a matter of taste, and this is a true California style fish taco. Nick also comped us some chips because that's how this place is - friendly and kick-back. I like to take turns squirting the red sauce and green sauce on the chips ...  which comes with a generous helping of pico de gallo on top. Man everything is so friggin' fresh.

Carne asada tacos were also very memorable. On Mondays, Dos Equis are $2. Yes!
author: D N.

description: The food is great. The drinks are great. The price is ok. The service from Chelsea and Joey is amazing. Everyone else ignored us which was extremely disappointing. I was genuinely surprised at how long it took is to get drinks. It's definitely something I will consider before I come back. But really Joey, Chelsea and Annie(?) are the shining stars of the establishment.
author: Katrice S.

description:
The California Burrito- A  very tasty burrito with seasoned french fries! 

For a few years, I've been reminiscing a food experience I had in a 24 hour taqueria in San Diego named Roberto's. I remember ordering Carne Asada French Fries. It was the first time I ever had the pleasure of indulging into the savory crispy concoction. Trying different places in the Bay Area, that same taste was lost from my palette...until Underdogs!

It didn't have to be a platter drenched with ingredients, but yet it had to consist of the two main ones: Carne Asada & French Fries...duh!  Underdog's California Burrito is very simple: cheese, french fries & pico de gallo salsa with carne asada, carnitas, or pollo. Usually I'm Super Burrito kinda guy with a lot of ingredients to satisfy my appetite, but this place definitely filled me up. The seasoned fries crunching with each bite of the carne asada burritto made me think of the Carne Asada Fries from San Diego. 

Underdog's, the quality of your taqueria food is uncanny! The sports bar atmosphere just makes me want to stay longer after my meal! Once again...good job!
author: Paul D.

description: Good tacos in SF. Sf is overrated w / mex food, this joint is actually da bomb.
author: SForiginal T.

description:
Finally a taco you can actually neatly hold in your hand and eat! You know how typically eating a taco results in good amount of the goods falling out of its shell? Well, the tacos at Underdogs are an exception - order the fish tacos Nick's way and you get a half crispy/half soft taco wrapped like an ice cream cone topped with a mound of guacamole all ready to be picked up and eaten.

Tuesdays at Underdogs is Taco Tuesday, meaning $1 street tacos. They're good but wimpy compared to the fish tacos. Street tacos may be good for a snack but you may have to eat about 6 of them to feel like you had a real meal. I definitely preferred the tacos Nick's way. The environment is fun, especially for sports watchers because there are several TV's right in front of the bar, they also have a bball arcade game in the back. I'm not sure if Underdog's is only crowded on Tuesdays or everyday, but it was busting with people. Seats are scarce and if you come with a group of people getting a table will take some time.
author: Nicole L.

description: Awesome HH deals for beer and food. Great place to watch whatever game they have on TV and to chat with the person next to you. Not overly crowded and easy to find a seat. Lots of locals and bartenders to take your order (4 bartenders working around 6:30pm!).
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
I left this place saying to myself... ( I will bet if I go home and look these guys up on Yelp, they will have 5 star ratings all the way across the board!!) I was just about right! The owner, "Nick" is a great guy. Puts his heart and soul into the menu and without a doubt works to the bone to satisfy his customers. (As a business owner myself, gives me great incentive..) 
The Grilled Fish Taco's are the best i've had and I shop the globe for grilled fish taco's! As the other posts read... Home made salsa, pico de gallo, chips, and soup... 
    Just. 1 bowl of tortilla soup and 1 fish taco (Underdog style) with a lil' chips and salsa will fill a good size belly.. If you haven't yet, HIT THIS PLACE UP!!! (~Jay N.~ Daly City)
author: jay n.

description:
Great sports bar and taqueria!! We've been there multiple times and love the food and beer. 

We've tried just about everything. They have great chips, salsa and guacamole! Also love the tacos, burritos and quesadillas. My husband always orders too much and walks out of there stuffed. 

If you want to have a conversation, you might want to go somewhere else. They have many TV screens running with all sorts of different sporting events going on. It can be rather loud at times. Afterall, it's a sports bar. To eat, you can either sit on picnic tables in the back of the restaurant, sit at the bar or sit on tall tables that are at the left side of the bar. 

You won't walk away hungry and shouldn't walk away disappointed.
author: Rachel M.

description: So awesome! Love everything about this place from the games, to the people, to the drinks, and tacos (nicks way obviously)!
author: Sierra M.

description:
This is the best sports bar in the Sunset....and maybe the best tacos in the city. Gourmet Tacos, that is!

I used to struggle with finding a place to watch games in the City. Any games: Football, Baseball, Hockey. Now I have a place that is not only great, but has great patrons and awesome waiters. And of course the tacos. 

Only reason why I didn't give them 5 stars was because it often takes a V E R Y long time to get your food. But I suppose the wait is worth it. 

And try the Habanero sauce....it's awesome!
author: Sergei A.

description: Cheap, great tacos, great bartenders, awesome atmosphere. Happy hour ritas are good. So is taco tuesdays. Street Style is the best. Definitely a great local bar.
author: Gwen K.

description: there is a reason by nick's baja-style fish taco is on the 100 things to eat in sf. i had this and the carne asada taco, and well the carne asada taco i've had better. but the fish taco is the best i've had. generally i prefer wahoo's fish tacos, but for fried fish tacos it's delicious! there's something about having a crunchy taco shell wrapped around a soft taco shell. i love crunch tacos, but this is like the best of both worlds. the guac is nice and generous too!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
I've been coming to Underdogs for the past year and a half after Doug, the owner, revamped the environment and the menu.  The food is absolutely amazing, you could literally close your eyes, point ANYWHERE on the menu and be very happy.  Nachos are a great starter for a couple, then have a shrimp/baja taco and then finish with a carne asada quesadilla.  

This is the place to watch a little bay area baseball/football/basketball with some passionate fans who don't mind a little trash talk/chants/high five's.  They also show UFC fights, (next up Lesnar V. Carwin July 3rd) that seem like they are always full.  

As far as the two previous posts, (Rebecca U. and Andrew b.) here's a little info on Underdog's,  IT'S NOT BAR NONE.  Underdogs is not some trashy bar that is trying to have cheap people come in to see how many of their bro's and ho's can chug $1 margarita's.  It's a SPORTS BAR happy hour special to enjoy after a long week of work.  Sean, Sara, Jaime, Josh, Megan, and the whole crew are fantastic and who seem to have quite the patience to deal with retards like Rebecca, Andrew, and their little group that got THROWN out on Friday.  I was there and will be glad to (hopefully) never see them again.  Spend your $18 on 18 margaritas (Mr. Moneybags!!) in the Mission or Daly City and be sure to take your framed MBA from USF.    

So to conclude my Underdogs review, it's an AWESOME place to come and have great drinks and food.  
Good day.
author: Adam M.

description:
Seriously you gotta try these tacos!! Just go on an off night ( ie not march madness, not football Sunday etc) and get your grub on. Prices on food and drinks are decent, service is pretty good even when packed, and it's just got a good vibe. 

To try: tacos, chicken tortilla soup, chips and any of their salsa.

The staff has always been super cool wether its super slow and they can chat a bit with you, or its stupid busy and they seem to manage with smiles on their faces...
author: Morgan A.

description:
Doug and his partners run a mean sports bar. Fantastic ambiance, good TV coverage, great beer and tequila selections and fantastic munchies. You can tell the staff takes great pride in their food, because it is obviously freshly prepared with good ingredients.

Check out The Taco Shop; you won't be disappointed.
author: Richard P.

description: I'll be honest I had a few tacos Togo from here a few months ago and they were not very good. I will give them another shot one day and see if they have gotten any better. I'll stick to Gordo's an El Burrito...
author: King L.

description: When I get my lifeless carcass out of the Hayward blood bank, I take my $20 bucks reward through the AC transit gauntlet that is Fruitvale and back to REAL civilization: The Outter Sunset! Here I step through the moist sweltery panty fog and into the high life of a stoners dream come true. Tacos and fluffy thighed females adorn the cocktail tables like gargoyles on a baron's manor. Meaty smiles and gooey black eyeliner, the occasional black jegging and "hey girl" said an octave too low. The throaty joy of beans and libations absorbed through pimpled jowls, eyes rolling in the ecstasy of caloric intake, padding the fat in all those illustrious places. The guac is pretty great too. Wash it down with fresh lime juice Margs and let those rose colored goggles get you into trouble!
author: Gunner M.

description: Came back for 2 World Cup games and they changed! They had sound for the games this time. I think the customers enjoyed it more, however by sound 3 pm before the next game, they turned the bad music on again. This time we had a better waitress who had a positive service oriented attitude and knew the menu better and could offer more options. She checked in on is more and didn't misunderstand my order. I don't have complaints about the food. They are consistent with their portions and flavor. I can only ask that they have some type of dessert like Paletas or Churros. The other time we were here we had an impatient waiter in a leg support. If we didn't answer right away he'd leave and then took a while to come back. He never smiled and wasn't too friendly but he took his time chatting it up with one of the other waitresses. I had to catch him when I needed to order more food or a glass of water and he smartly brought a big bottle with several glasses. I know bars are not like restaurants but it's good to be friendly.
author: Crys L.

description:
location: check

good mexican food: check

good beer on tap selection: check

close to the office: check 

lots of flat screen tv's for world cup soccer: check
author: Anthony D.

description: Taco Tuesday! There was quite a wait as expected but it was definitely worth the wait. I got two carne asada tacos which were good but the best was the carnitas taco. The flavor of the meat was heavenly. Definitely a must have! My friends also said that the nicks way tacos were bomb. That means a lot coming from a Latina!
author: Kevin H.

description:
Came for the Tacos...loved the pitcher of beers and old school videogame tables.

So first off these tacos are legit, I don't care what they cost, just give me the crispy tacos. Make sure to get the tacos Nick's way and try the Pescado, delicious fish taco, ...I said it.

Second, games. For those of you with ADD or at least need some other stimulation to go along with your sports watching, well then make sure to sit at one of the awesome videogame tables. Bring quarters, 50 cents a game.

Last, pitchers of beer. Not the best prices, but they have specials sometimes and the Tecate was $15, so sign me up.  When you are devouring, delicious, decadent tacos you should not be worrying about when the waitress is coming back to get you another beer.

Enough said.
author: Caroline O.

description:
These tacos hurt my teeth! 

And, if you think that's awkward for me to admit, you should have seen how awkward I looked while I sat at the bar contemplating how to fit this taco into my mouth. 

Biting straight down felt like a dental procedure, so I decided to turn the taco sideways and pull out the big guns - the molars! 

Unfortunately at this angle the taco no longer fit into my mouth,so half of the taco ended up on my face, and thanks to gravity,  the other half ended up on the ground.

The taco itself was tasty but it wasn't worth the effort. I understand that part of this was user error but eating a taco shouldn't lead me to musing about UI design. 

The atmosphere of the bar itself wasn't really my thing. Underdogs is a straight up sports bar, so people are constantly yelling and getting agitated about things they can't control, and glowing with pride over things they had absolutely nothing to do with. 

At least the server was really nice and attentive. He had the forethought to put an entire stack of napkins in front of me. Smart dude.
author: Michelle B.

description: Great sports bar. I love the beer buckets and the pitchers of margaritas. The food is also amazing, from the tacos to the buffalo wings. If you're up and about for brunch, hop in and order the benedict. It's essentially an eggs benedict but with pulled pork and torta bread instead of ham and an english muffin, and a killer chipotle hollandaise. The best part about this place is the people! Incredibly energetic and nice folks all around.
author: Brittany L.

description:
Been craving their tacos for so long that we finally came in the other day. Was a little disappointed with the service but the food was still very good!

I ordered my usual, which is Carne Asada Nick's Way-  one grilled corn tortilla wrapped with soft tortilla. It definitely was smaller than I remember but still just as good with the guacamole and pinto beans. 

We also had the chips and salsa and added guac. Some of the best guac I've ever tasted. And they give you a fairly good amount too. I was totally stuffed.

Even though the service could use a little upgrade; Our server forgot a few things, but there's one guy who's always helpful and Nick too of course, the taco's are still that good that I'll be coming back.
author: Heidi L.

description:
For awhile I visited Underdogs once a week to get my taco fix.  First things first, get everything NICKS WAY!!! And the red sauce...is to die for!!!  I'm not sure how the fish taco made it on the 7X7 100 things to try.  I think the carne asada taco nick's way beats that hand downs!!!! Another thing to order is their nachos with carne asada... it coud feed a family of 10! It's huge!

After work, a great place, but be prepared to wait LONG LINES for a seat!  

Cons: tacos are pricey, one taco is about $6 after tax and tip...
author: Joanne H.

description:
I'm from So Cal and I was craving carne asada fries, so I typed it into yelp and found The Taco Shop At Underdog's! I couldn't believe after 6 years of living in San Francisco I FINALLY found a place that had a California Burrito.

 If you don't know, a California Burrito is basically carne asada fries stuffed into a burrito. It probably has thousands of calories, but after you take a bite you forget all that.

Anyway, me and the boyfriend went there and it's actually a really cool sports bar. They have about 4-5 tables (that seats 4 each) in the front, tables towards the back of the bar, and the rest of seating is at the bar. They have sports paraphernalia everywhere, which I really liked.

We ordered the chips and salsa, which sounds really plain but it was actually really, really good! The chips are made fresh as well as the salsa, which has a little bit of spice that I like. I, of course, ordered the California Burrito and I was pleasantly surprised. The burrito had guacamole and sour cream, the meat had a lot of flavor, and the fries were crispy! Mmm... I wish I had one right now.

My boyfriend ordered the tacos. He had several kinds: the "street style" tacos and 2 of Nick's Way tacos (the carne asada and chicken). Underdog's used to have the $1 Taco Tuesdays where they have the street style tacos for only $1 but I don't think they have that anymore. Those were okay, but Nick's Way tacos are soooo much better.

Warning: this place is great to watch a game or just hang out but it can get pretty crowded so don't be surprised if you can't get a seat right away.
author: Therese M.

description:
Walked in at 6:45pm to an empty place. Had dinner here with 3 of my girl friends  for our usual dinner ritual before they left for school! Walked in and you can sit on the high tables near the bar, or surpass the entire bar, to reach the eating area. The eating area were of wooden picnic tables, extremely tight as the person behind me had their back graze across mine a few times. Extremely dim lighting. Some arcade-like games also were in the back. Families even came to this place, which was surprising to me, as the bar is larger than the eating area for groups in the back.

 Everyone had their taco's Nick's Way. Shared the 2 tacos with one of them. I got the pescado "baja" style, as she had the carne asada. We also shared the San Francisco burrito w/ carne asada. The other two had their own two tacos of shrimp, carne asada (ordered carnitas but they gave her carne asada, accidently) and 2 veggies.

When the tacos came, seriously. they looked like they were on steroids. Extremely obese (can you even call food, obese?) and topped with a large heap of guacamole. A crunchy taco shell wrapped with a flour tortilla on the outer. They give you a salsa verde, and I guess some special red creamy one. My friend asked for the habanero. HOLY MOTHER. It was so spicy I had underestimated it. I love spicy food, and squirted a giant glob, BIG MISTAKE. My lips reacted quickly and numbed out. 2 of them also reacted the same way with a DAMN that's some SERIOUS SAUCE. Though, all of the sauces worked well together and tasted amazinggg. The burrito was forgettable, not that great, though not terrible. Definitely, on the small side and pricy if you were to compare it to a Mexican joint.

Save the burritos for the taquerias, but come here for the tacos. Nick's way is the right way! :)
author: Ada T.

description: Delish Tacos especially the carnitas. and how do you beat $2 tecates. Fun place- gets a bit crowded on Tuesday nights but if you get in early enough you should get a nice seat to watch the game and enjoy. Oh and service was crazy fast- which was impressive especially with how packed it was.
author: Nicole S.

description:
I had an interesting experience coming here because it wasn't a typical bar visit.  I came here after a blah day, just wanting some good tacos, and I was ordering to carry-out because their phone lines were tied up.  Understanding that this is a sports bar, I was surprised to see tables with young children and babies (??) but somehow the layout of the bar worked to the advantage of those dislocated youth.  The tables in the back gave an air of 'restaurant' while the bar in the front provided the main sports-watching beer-drinking vibe. 

I placed my order and felt awkward because I was by myself and didn't quite know where to wait; thankfully one of the bartenders offered me water and a spot at the bar opened up where I gratefully sat my no-longer awkward behind.  This is where the game and the friendly locals grabbing their after-work brews lifted my spirits.  :)

On the food itself - I tried the shrimp taco and fish taco both Nick's way, and they were the bomb.  A bit pricier than your average taco, but they definitely hit the spot.
author: Jaclyn L.

description:
Delicious!  I would never have guessed that Underdog's was located on Irving because there are so many Asian shops and restaurants surrounding the neighborhood.  

I've been to Nick's Crispy Tacos, and the tacos are FABULOUS.  The tacos at Underdog's are just as tasty as Nick's, even though they aren't affiliated restaurants.  Some items on the menu automatically come "Nick's Way," so you'll be paying a dollar more for certain items.  For example, in addition to the fried fish tacos (Nick's Way; a must-try!), I had ordered a carne asada taco for $4.25 at Underdog's, but I think it was $3.25 at Nick's.  I think Nick's Way is usually another $0.95, but Underdog's charges an extra $1.00.  

Also ordered the steak nachoes-- they were GREAT.  I think the best nachos I've had were at La Burrita (Berkeley, CA), but these ones came pretty close because you get a MOUNTAIN of nachos, cheese, freshly made salsa with delicious diced tomatoes, a sprinkling of steak (or a meat of your choice), jalapenos, beans and a dollop of that delicious guacamole with cream cheese on the side.  It's a mountain, I kid you not.

The scene was pretty cool and the crowd ranged from pairs of chill SF-ers grabbing a quick bite to eat to a crowd of guys having a "guys night out" with buckets of beers and a competitive game on the basketball machine.  You can also watch sports because there are several TVs mounted on the walls for your viewing pleasure.  Lots of beers on tap and a really chill place to hang out at night.  It wasn't even that crowded for Saturday dinner time.

The vibe was super chill, the service friendly and it was just what we were looking for in a no-mess, no-frills-type of restaurant.
author: Sunny S.

description:
me likey. their tacos are giant and so freaking delicious, very reasonable pricing as well. i'm a big fan of their pico de gallo salsa..my favorite! bartenders are friendly, and they offer buckets of beer. makes me feel like i'm back in ensenada! 

can get SUPER crowded if any sort of game is on, but definitely filters out once something ends. LOVE this place!
author: Liz M.

description: I've been here 3 times.  The margaritas are a bit weak, but their black bean and corn salad is one of my favorite restaurant salads of all time.  They put a lot of guacamole on it and it feels very unhealthy while still being somewhat healthy, especially for bar food.
author: Kelly M.

description: Best grilled fish tacos I've ever had there. Nick's way is the best way to have all the tacos. Service is friendly and drinks are good. The Guacamole and Chips are great too.
author: Tina Y.

description:
This bar is loads of fun.  It is a fairly popular sports bar, and it is often hard to find a seat, especially during a big game. Seating is basically the only negative aspect about this bar.  There are big screen TVs everywhere, and an entertaining basketball hoops game in the back.  I have seen a few of the employees absolutely crush this game.

I watched multiple Giants Postseason games here, and they were an absolute riot.  I had to get there over an hour early to secure a seat, and even then I didn't always succeed.  Everyone from college kids to cute old Chinese ladies were all tortured together, enduring the pleasure and pain of baseball.  When the Giants won the NLCS, everyone went nuts.

The bartenders, cooks, and waitresses are all great people.  The atmosphere is very relaxed.  The food isn't the best Mexican food you will ever have, but it's above and beyond standard bar food.  The prices are reasonable, and what you would expect for a typical sports bar.  I also enjoy the softcore porn in the Men's room.

Thanks Underdogs, for making the outer sunset a little more fun.
author: Jackson W.

description:
OUTSTANDING!

If I live up in SF, I would come here all the time. I love sport bars and this place is one of the best ones I've been too. It's tiny and crowded, but that's the sports bar scene, right? They only serve Mexican food so the menu is limited, which can be a good thing if you tend to get overwhelmed by choices. 

The margaritas here are good. I ordered the nachos and carne asada quesadillas. Both were SO GOOD! The server was excellent... refilled my Coke and gave us extra chips for what was left of my nachos. The chips and salsa was really good too.

Lots of TVs, old-school arcade games, and a basketball hoop. Pricing is also awesome!
author: Lisa T.

description: Underdog's is the spot to check out in the Sunset. Some of the best margaritas in the city! The wait staff and bartenders are really nice and how can you go wrong with Nick's tacos?! One of my personal favorites.
author: Montana G.

description:
The tacos are ok, nothing to really to get excited about. I had the steak taco and it was big but lacked flavor. I'm not really a fan of beans in my taco, and if you aren't either, make sure to either ask for no beans or just avoid it all together. I figured, to play it safe i would order the tacos, since "Taco" is in the name.    

Plus:
Lots of TV's, plenty of seating, good beer on tap: Pilsner and Anchor Steam
author: Dennis S.

description:
This place is pretty amazing.  It is a prime example of how diverse SF is.......well, sports-wise.  There are fans for all sorts of teams, even the Raiders!  Everyone was friendly and although it gets hectic, the staff somehow manages to keep beer and food on everyone's table.  Upon my first visit I saw a family with a newborn and one set of the in-laws, a pregnant woman, numerous female sports fans, and magic!  Yes, magic.  The bucket of beer that was in front of me somehow disappeared, but I don't recall how that happened although I was told that I drank them all.  However, based on my staggered exit this may be an accurate account of what happened.  

Oh and can you say NFL Sunday Ticket?  Everygame is on one of their various flat screens with signs indicating what you're watching and what lies ahead.  Oh and the food was awesome too.

The best part..............the Chargers won.
author: Michael G.

description:
These tacos are rad.  One may say that $4.50 for a taco, or two tacos for $8.50 is ridiculous, yet take my word, these tacos are well worth the extra dollar or two you will pay.

For starters, all ingredients including the meat are local and organic, and the fish is wild.

Secondly, order your taco's 'Nick's Way," and your ingredients are placed inside a crispy taco shell with a soft, warm tortilla on the outside.  

Thirdly, to top off the taco a large amount of freshly made guacamole is served on top.  

Whether you choose the battered fish or pork as the main ingredient, you will leave satisfied and realize the extra dollar coming out of your wallet was well worth it!
author: Caroline Q.

description:
Chips and salsa with Guacamole - Loved the huge mound of guac, and fresh salsa, too. ($5)

Friend had Carnitas taco and liked it ($4.50)

Grilled Fished taco for me ($4.25) Mmmm haven't had a grilled fish taco in a long time (I miss Dos Coyotes!! But it's too far away in Davis) Oh, I digress. The tacos here are pretty big, and you get sauces too. They make their own cilantro one and chipotle. Chipotle yums! My mouth is watering!

How could I not have eaten food from here before?!
author: Anita C.

description:
I frequent this bar a lot even though its a fifteen minute drive from my house. The reason I come so often is for the great atmosphere, great service and every once in a while, the food. They have several big screens at the bar to watch whatever game is happening that night. If you don't like sports, its okay. They have a few tables that you can sit at to hang with friends and just chat.
All the bartenders are very friendly and for the most part quick. I personally like to get checked on with my drinks a little more often than they do, but that's just me. If you go more than once a week, the bartenders remember you. They all have great attitudes and clearly love their job.
The food here is mostly tacos, nachos, burritos and such. The chips aren't great so I usually pass on them. I end up getting tacos here most of the time and they're great, except for the price. On average you pay about $4 per taco.
Drinks here are moderately priced, but the best thing is the knowledge the bartenders have. They always suggest something good to my friends if they don't know what to order. Only once did they not have an ingredient to make my drink (it was Cinco de Mayo and slamming).
The reason I give them 4 stars is because they close early. Midnight during the week, and 2am on the Friday and Saturday. A couple of the other bars around the area are open later so I usually end up going somewhere else when they close. So I say, start here, and if you end early great. If you keep going, there's always something else somewhere else!
author: Chris L.

description: Strong margaritas, got to get the corn, and tacos nicks way. Lots of TVs and super shot. Staff is friendly and prompt.
author: Chad J.

description:
Isn't it sad how I've never had taco Tuesdays in San Francisco til now?? My god, I've missed out.  I'm definitely not a fan of tacos and burritos on a daily basis nor do I ever crave it, but I think I will starting now. 

I did'nt think much of their Taco Tuesday 'street taco' deals.  It was small, two bites and you're done! It was also dry and just a few pieces of meat on tortilla and a sprinkle of greens. The Nick's Way fish taco was fantastic! I have to say that the fish taco here was mucho beuno than San Diego's and I'm sure there are legit Mexicans making them in the back! (JK. I'm not being mean here) The taco was slightly on the expensive side, $5.25 for one piece of deliciously beer battered fish showered in lettuce, pico de gallo, and a blob of guacamole. I shoulda ordered another one, but it'll keep me coming back for more.

I came during a Giants/Dodgers game and the atmosphere was wondeful. I miss being around crowds of SF Giants loving-fans and not just boring Padre commentators from a CRT television in San Diego. 

Seats are first-come first-served, so come early or be swift at grabbing open tables. Service is great too.  

I just got back and I'm craving a grilled fish taco... Damn.
author: Rosanne L.

description:
Used to be Underdogs Sports Bar. Now it's The Taco Shop at Underdogs. Cool bartenders. Drinks are normally priced (not low not high) although you can get cheap tecates on Taco Tuesday which is cool. Start with Chips and Salsa. Really cheap and tastes bomb. Then try one of the tacos Nick's Way. They're good. I don't think their Burritos are good though. I tried the San Diego and definitely didn't taste like standard taqueria burrito I'd have in San Diego (or up here for that matter).

Also they stopped showing the UFC events for some reason, and that sucks. 

Overall I like the place and try to frequent pretty often.
author: Josh H.

description: When looking at the menu, the fish tacos seem slightly overpriced, but once they're brought to you you understand why they're $4.50, $5.50 Nick's way.
author: Shannon M.

description:
When venturing outside of Inner Sunset, be sure to get tacos.

Truth be told, I didn't get the tacos, I had the chicken nachos, which were both inexpensive and plentiful. In fact they will be my first leftovers since the move. To boot they serve great house margaritas rimmed with salt (why is salt so great on glass rims?). But the best part of the whole experience... Mexican Coca-Cola. Delicious, sweet, refreshing Mexican Coca-Cola. In a glass bottle!

My fellow diners enjoyed the tacos, of which they are regular fans... but if you really want a lot of food, I can't recommend the nachos enough.
author: Sean K.

description:
Nick can do no wrong!  Underdogs is fantastic.  I can't tell you how hard it is to find a good breakfast burrito in The City.  Nicks is most definitely the place.  Meat, eggs, potatoes - always a lovely combination.

I haven't really eaten their tacos, because I am so enthralled with their Carne Asada burritos.  Now that they have expanded their menu, there's even more options for burrito lovers like me.  

If all you came looking for was a pint, then they have what you are looking for.  I appreciate their selection of Micros and Mexican beers.  Even if drinks are all you're looking for, be sure to get some chips and salsa - you won't be let down.

My only request is to have the breakfast burritos be available year-round.  That would just about make my day.  Nick - I hope you're listening, and thanks for saving Underdogs!
author: Tres S.

description:
Running just as fast as we can. Holding on to one another's taco?

Fleeing the crowds of Hardly Strictly, I was in desperate need of a burrito or similarly satisfying comfort food and my poor hungover friend needed a bloody mary. Her suggestion, much to my delight, was The Taco Shop at Underdog's. Close to the park, affordable and booze worthy, it was the perfect spot for an afternoon bite.

The bloody mary's were impressive. Spicy, potent and containing a small vegetable garden skewered on a toothpick, they hit the spot. Unfortunately, the followup fell flat when I discovered they don't sell Fat Tire and they only have Anchor Steam in bottles. Sad.

The fish taco, nick's way was delicious. Crispy and soft at the same time, with well-seasoned fish and loaded with cilantro and guac, I loved every bite. I was oogling the nachos the people next to us ordered and I've resolved myself to tackle those on my next visit. I haven't been to Nick's Crispy Taco's yet (I know, GASP), but I hear this is where the better half headed post-split. 

Minus one star because they forgot to bring me the corn on the cob smothered in butter, cayenne pepper and cojita cheese I ordered and then charged me for it. I was really looking forward to it. They were quick to correct the mistake and the silver lining is now I have another reason to go back. Well, that and the nachos.
author: Corey F.

description:
UPDATE: I just added a star. This place deserves all five - good food, great service, all the sports you can watch. I always have fun at Underdog's.

I watch a lot of San Antonio Spurs basketball with a group of friends from back home, and Underdog's has become our new home base in San Francisco.

Surprisingly, a lot of sports bars in San Francisco don't have NBA League Pass, so if the game isn't on TNT, ESPN or ABC, they won't have it. Underdog's has League Pass, so you can watch any game, any night.

The staff at Underdog's is young and friendly, and attentive even when it's busy. You won't find better bar service in the City.

If you like Nick's tacos -- who doesn't? -- be sure to go on Taco Tuesday for $1 street tacos from 5pm to close. They've got a great happy hour, too -- Monday to Friday, 4:30 to 6pm, with $1 tacos and $2 Dos XX beer.

I'm going tonight to catch the Spurs-Lakers game. Go Spurs Go!
author: Daniel S.

description:
Underdogs. I need to express my love for you. Your sports bar style, your picnic tables, your pac-man table we can eat off of, I love it all. Your basketball game machine in the back on which I've both won and lost many bets (usually a margarita or something to that effect.) Your buckets of Tecate with little limes in each one, your Taco Tuesdays that pack you to the brim, and force you to make friends. And your food. I can't forget the food. Best baja style taco... hell best tacos around (just make sure to get them Nicks Way,) make for the greatest accompaniment to any alcoholic beverage. Your salsa is out of this world and guacomole is stellar. Friday margaritas for 50 cents during a 30 minute happy hour make for a very happy girl. Happy enough to take off work early and head down to down as many as I can before I go home to get ready to go back out again. 

Underdogs, why are you so good to me?
author: Jacklyn S.

description:
I went to this place for happy hour thinking because someone told me they were the original Nick's tacos.. similar to the one in Russian Hill. I was dying for the tacos Nick's way, which are  $2 during happy hour in Russian Hiil- I was surprised to find out that had to pay the regular price and this place. The happy hour (5-6pm) menu includes beer, corn on cob with cheese, and $1 tacos, which are absolutely tiny and definitely not as good as Nicks. Good dishes but not spectacular. I would recommend getting the Nick's way tacos, despite paying full price, if you are going to eat here.

Overall, cool place to go for a low key happy hour and for game days (usually really crowded and fun).
author: Sirina K.

description:
Try any tacos made Nick's way. I personally prefer the carne asada and baja fish tacos (Nick's way). I've also tried their street taco which I thought was mediocre. I really like their chips with salsa and hass avocado guacamole. It's free when you order any tacos.

I haven't had the chance to try out their drinks yet since I usually go during lunch hours at work and I'm sure my boss would not be happy if I come back smelling like alcohol. But I'll definitely go one day for their happy hour.
author: Christina K.

description:
I've been here 3 or 4 times for their vegetarian street tacos even though the service is out of this world ~ in a bad way. Every time we've walked inside, all of the staff looks up at you and goes about doing their business. I guess you just awkwardly stand there until a table is clear? I've never understood and I guess I never will. 
Today was the day that set me over the top. My friends and I finally sit down, and we order 2 orders of vegetarian nicks way tacos, chips and salsa (FUCKING $6.50!) and one order of chicken tacos. The waitress brought everyone their order and called them out correctly (which is more than I can say for other servers), and we began to eat. Halfway through mine I noticed that the taco I was eating was chicken, and I started flipping out because I've been vegetarian for 6+ years because of serious food allergies.
