I called the waitress over and she said she was sorry 100+ times, and then declared that she didn't know what to do next. So I kindly suggested that she remove the incorrect order from our table and replace it with the correct one. She then agreed she would do so. They brought out the order 10 times as fast and I couldn't even eat more than two bites because I was so upset. Before she flicked the bill at the table, the waitress announced that her manager approved her request to remove the chips and salsa as well as my tacos from the bill. Like why couldn't her manager walk over to the table 15 minutes away? I saw the entire conversation between the two while I was desperately trying to flag someone down for water for at least 15 minutes.
God I hate that place.
author: Emma G.

description:
The Taco Tuesday at Underdogs is definitely happening. And what a deal it is! 3 tacos for $3....try one of each- chicken, carne asada, and carnitas! 

I also enjoyed my margarita, on the rocks, no salt. It was strong, hence, why I enjoyed it. No effing around. 

What I did not enjoy: the three separate groups of young, cute guys (or so I thought....how unfortunate) that tapped my friends and I on the shoulder to inquire about getting our table as soon as we finished eating. It wasn't even that crowded. AND, when we did get up and leave, two guys got in a fight over the stupid table. Deep breaths, people. Calm down. I'M A LADY. Puhleeease. It's Taco Tuesday, for crying out loud. 

Don't forget the guacamole.
author: Laura D.

description: I came here with a friend of mine for lunch and beer.  The atmosphere is great and the food is REALLY good. Also, since it was a Friday they had a 30min 1$ margarita special! CAN'T BEAT THAT!
author: Tiffany R.

description:
I'm chopping this review into two parts. The first part I am going to be wearing my crabby pants. Everyone on here who's been saying "waaahhh, the sunset sucks" or "waahhhh the sports bar thing is a turn off", then don't come. I can walk to this place, there is always parking at my house and I don't have to dodge hipsters riding fixies all day. The sports bar thing is great. I was reading one review and this guy says "if you call yourself a sports bar you should turn the volume up". On which set? They have like 22 TV's and on Any Given Sunday 10 games at once going on and 150 crazed football fans. Yeah, turn the volume up so you can hear over that.

Ok, second part of the review, the food and service. Love this place for a number of reasons, not the least of which is the Baja taco Nick's way. Never a let down, always crispy and perfectly spicy. The service is great here. Even on dollar margarita night. We like to bring our daughter here and the last time we were here we had a group of 12 at two tables. We never had an empty glass or empty baskets. This is a go to place for sure, whether you're in the mood for a pint and a football/baseball/hockey game or just want some darn good Mexican food
author: David G.

description:
Nick (formerly of Nick's Crispy Tacos) makes amazing tacos!  A work of art really. I'd almost go as far as saying Nick is the Michelangelo of our time in terms of sculpturing the perfect taco (sans the twig and berries like on Michelangelo's "David")

It's even worth going out of your way for just to try these amazing tacos done Nicks way.

Oh yeah, how can I forget to mention it's a bar and they serve booze too!!!
author: Thömas F.

description:
I really love Underdog's. 
Obviously because I keep coming back time and time again. The food is great, the beer is cold and the faces are friendly. It also doesn't hurt that I live down the street and I work next door - convenient! I'm surprised that I have yet to write a review for them.. 

So, I've loved everything I've ever eaten there but there are three particular items that I can't live without. 

First and foremost the carnitas taco Nick's Way is my favorite. Crispy delicious goodness topped off with a hardy helping of fresh guacamole. By the way, I love their guacamole. Number two on my list is the Grilled Corn & Black Bean Taco Salad. It is so damn good. It's so fresh and I absolutely love the dressing they use. And finally number three is a relatively new favorite of mine: The Carnitas Quesadilla. The cheese and meat are perfectly enveloped in a thick and crispy shell. Are you hungry yet? 

They also have a pretty great selection of beers both on tap and bottled as well. Their happy hours a great, especially the one dollar street tacos. They are small but a few will definitely fill you up. I also like their 50 cent margarita happy hour although I dislike that it's only between 6:00-6:30. But that just means you have to drink fast. 

This really is a great place. They play great music, it's clean, the employees are wonderful and it's very casual. It's always packed for happy hour and for games (they have a few TVs) so you'll always find yourself in a fun & lively atmosphere. 
Check it out!
author: Denise S.

description:
Just took out an order to go at the Taco House.

I ordered 2 order of chips and guacamole and got only one.  I think they probably only charged me for one - it's probably because they can't possibly hear the phone orders with all the people screaming in the bar.  Why don't they answer the phone in the back?

Worse than that, though, is that for 5 bucks, what I got for $5 was mostly salsa with a little dab of guacamole.  What a ripoff!  I don't think this happens when I go into the restaurant - I guess they figure, screw the takeout customers, by the time they get home with their order, it's too late to do anything about it.
author: Paul M.

description:
I forgot I already reviewed this place, but I came back to Yelp to do so because I was fantasizing about a burrito. Their burrito.

Underdogs is hands down my favorite food in the world. And that says a lot. Because Indian food is supposed to be my favorite food in the world. But if I could just eat one thing for the rest of my life.....any of the vegetarian options from Underdogs, taco, burrito, or taco salad.

Some tips:
-Ask for the habenero sauce, it's amazing.
-Don't go on Tuesday, it's so ridiculously packed (taco Tuesday, what can ya do)
-Their sangria and margaritas are amazing.

OMG I need to stop writing this review so I can go to Underdogs right now.
author: Ambika C.

description:
I've never had Nick's crispy tacos, so I was intrigued to try out Underdogs and have them "Nick's Way". 

First of all, I'm not a sports bar kind of gal. Maybe back in my college days, maybe when it's the only thing nearby with booze, but it's not my first choice. The space is big though, great for groups and fairly cheap. It's great pre, post and during hangover food as well.  

That being said, we came with a semi-large group. The waitstaff was friendly, but not very organized. After having our orders taken, some of us didn't get our food for 45 minutes, while others had theirs in about 5. Tacos should never take that long, and especially before 7 on a weeknight. It was just awkward.

When my taco finally arrived I was a little underwhelmed. It was kind of like the Taco Bell Gordita. Basically, it's a soft taco, with another crispy shell. There's your secret. I had one pork and one chicken. Nothing blew me away and I fear I won't feel the need to trek back out to the outer sunset again. The guac was good though!

The house margaritas were dandy, but I did feel a bit guilty with my foul mouth and food and friends while oh, 3 families surrounded us with their tribes of kids and strollers. I'm old fashioned, I like to drink and keep the kids at home. Call me crazy, but it just added to the less than stellar tacos, long waits between drinks and the screaming babies...these things do not a good night make for me. 

Had it not been for the friends that I love, the good company and nice family friendly feel of Underdogs (thank god there was a minimum of men screaming at the tv's) I might be scarred for life. It is what it is, but it ain't for me. If I was a sunset local or had a fam, I'd come here for sure, but since I'm not, oh well.
author: Jessica P.

description:
OMG. The Breakfast burrito. And a Pacifico. And football. (Or baseball, or MMA...)

This place rocks. The food is great, bartenders are great, find a spot, squeeze in and put some of that food in your mouth. You won't be disappointed.
author: Tony R.

description:
A person needs to recognize when something is wrong with the establishment and when the problem is just personal preference.  

The Taco Shop at Underdog's is a decent establishment with above average Mexican food.  But, it falls short in some personal categories.

What I like:

1.  Sports in the Sunset, YAY!

2.  Nice people, great atmosphere, YAY!

3.  Comfortable seating, YAY!

What falls short in the personal categories: 

1.  Don't like soggy chips, I wish they didn't serve the pico on the chips.  Personally, I like lighter chips.  I could order the pico separately but these kinda need to be softened.

2.  Don't call yourself a sports bar if you aren't going to actually have the audio of those sports on.  On the other hand, it is a smaller establishment and I'm sure it would be difficult to hear the game over the din anyhow.

3.  One taco, when ordering a crispy taco, is not enough.  Overall the prices here are actually pretty great until you realize that they are charging  $4.50 for one taco.  I'm not a huge dude, but one taco just ain't enough.  And, two crispy bar tacos to sate my belly for $9.00 of bar tacos starts getting into the slightly expensive category.  Not expensive just slightly outside of reasonable.

Verdict:  I'll be going there pretty steadily just have some minor complaints.
author: e m.

description: I love this bar!  It is my favorite place to go watch a sharks game or just get a tecate and an amazing fish taco nick's way.  The people who work here seem so happy, are really friendly and pick great music. Plus they have Ms. Pacman! Thank you Underdogs for being my neighborhood spot :)
author: Kelly W.

description: Been here quite often and must say its a great place to satisfy a taco and or nacho or maybe even tortilla soup craving ... everything is pretty tasty and the atmosphere is fun .. definitely during a good sporting event ...service is pretty quick and servers are all kind and hey they even have games to play ... so if you haven't been you must try, you'll enjoy ...
author: Anthony S.

description:
Here's the lowdown: 

I know fish tacos. I know baja style fish tacos.  Imagine my orgasmic facial expressions as I bit into a baja fish taco here, Nick's way of course.  

OMG.

Best. Fish. Taco. EVER

It was huge (that's what she said)!!  A generous piece of fish, corn tortilla, strips of fresh chips, guac, and pour on both the roja and verde salsa...

Hip bar.  Serious sangria.  Pop-a-shot.  Picnic tables in the back.  

I only wish you were in OC, so I could visit more often.
author: Katie D.

description:
I would like to state for the record that i would make a great spy.  
I blend in with most crowds, and love to wear costumes/disguises.  Give me one of those belts with shark repellent and I can destabilize a small 3rd world country.  
What does this fact mean about my review?
Nothing... I'm just that confident in saying that if you give this place a shot, just one chance and i can guarantee you would like to come back.  If you have a bad experience... well, please be sure to speak with any of the staff members in the property and they would gladly rape you with a dirty Godzilla Toy.  That is all.
author: Riko H.

description: Gotta say I love the tacos Nick's way.  The service has been great and the bartenders down to earth and friendly. Like the Green Flash IPA on tap as well.
author: Michael W.

description: Just ok. Could put more meat on the burrito like they do at taquerias in the mission. But then again they're probably paying higher rent soooo....anyway just ok.  Nice atmosphere, good service and the music in the background was cool.
author: Review L.

description: The staff here is exceptional!  Kudos to the management and them.   The people  here really seem to go out of their way to be pleasant and make your experience enjoyable.  The food is really good.  Great, crispy chips!  Great tacos!  For a taco/bar....five stars!
author: Alexandria H.

description:
3.5 stars.  Viva the revolution that went on in my stomach at the Taco Shop.

Just went there yesterday.  I had a rough Friday night, and couldn't really stomach going to a bar bar last night for the Saints game.  Not too bad although the Saints lost last night, and i'm superstitious so that meansI won't go back to Taco Shop for a game where I have a rooting interest in.

Plenty of tv's in the place.  Wait staff was pretty attentive, although we did feel somewhat pressured to leave early, since we finished our food before the first half and there wasn't a lot of spots for people that want to eat dinner.

Prices are avg.  $4.5 for a taco, but the tacos are barebone good.  It'll cost extras for some of the staple additions (sour cream).  Overall a fun place to grab food if you're in the Outer Sunset.
author: Kyle W.

description:
Was so glad to hear I can find taco's done "Nick's Way" at another location.  Although this is farther, I prefer this one.
Generous portions, good ingredients, and easy on your wallet.  What's not to like?!?!
Had some nachos, fish tacos done Nick's Way and enjoyed some beer and sangria with the group.  
I really enjoy the casual atmosphere in which you can take a little breather mid-week. Look forward to going back!
author: Carol K.

description: If there was ever a true love story, it is about me and the nick's style carnitas taco at Underdogs.  Throw in a little beer and maybe a shot of tequila and you have the most romantic story ever told.  I don't even like sports, but when I walk into Underdogs, I turn that anti-sport attitude upside down.  I play some street fighter with my man, I mingle with the sweet serving staff, and I appreciate my awesome life.
author: Audrey K.

description:
Coming here around 3pm, it was a nice sports bar type of mood. Big TV's everywhere, people drinking, having fun, etc. It was not full at all, expected at 3pm. The great thing about the decor was the random writings and stickers on the wall of the bathroom. Hilarious little phrases on the wall for a little laugh while you do your business.

Now on to food. What I had:

Pesce (Fish) Baja Taco (Nick's Way)
Carne Asada Taco (Nick's Way)
Chips and Salsa

Beginning with the chips and salsa, the chips were fairly thick, oily and tasty. The salsa was okay okay, nothing special. The chips and salsa was definitely not worth it because it fills you up before the delicious tacos!

The Pesce Baja Fish Taco was to die for! The creamy, slightly spicy sauce went hand in hand with the prime fillet of fish, beer battered to perfection. The crispy outer battered shell of the fish contrast well with the soft tender fish. Outstanding flavor! The fish smell was not overpowering at all, barely noticeable in fact. I had it Nick's Way, as other reviewers have said: soft taco melted cheese on it and then a crispy taco inside it. The crispy taco really made the difference I think in terms of texture because it blended unbelievably well with the crispy batter and the soft fish. I can't say enough about this taco, but I'll have to go on to the carne asada taco.

Loaded with chopped tomato and nicely cubed carne asada, the taco was above average, but for the price, nothing special. If you like carne asada, you will like this taco, but the taste is just like any other carne asada taco. I had it Nick's Way as well, making it better, but still a normal steak taco. It did not have the flavor-bursting sauce that the Baja Fish taco had.

Together the two taco combo and the chips and salsa, filled me to the brim. Fast and friendly service, definitely a nice place to grab a taco or two for lunch, especially if there's a big game on.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night after Nightlife at the Academy of Sciences and the place was packed. The atmosphere is great and I had an amazing time catching up with my friends and watching the Giants beat the Dodgers 10 - 2! The three of us shared: 

Nachos es muy Grande: $7.95 for a mound of chips, salsa, beans, guacamole, cheese, and sour cream. Add another $2 for meat. So glad that they put the sour cream on the side and all the ingredients tasted really fresh.  

Elote con Queso: Corn is delicious. Corn covered in cheese, cayenne pepper, and lime juice is even more delicious. Don't bother cutting up the corn, just go at it! Like ice cream, it just taste better without any utensils. 

Carne Asada and Pescado "Baja" Stye Tacos Nick's Way: $6 for one taco is really steep, although, it is a lot bigger than your average taco. Good, but I've definitely had a lot better, like at Rubio's on Tuesdays. I wasn't exactly feeling Nick's way either, as the crispy taco was more stale than it was crispy.
author: Adrianna C.

description:
Arguably the best fish tacos in San Francisco (Nick's way of coarse!).  Its a tried and true.  The chips and salsa's with Guac.. fantastic as well.  

It can get busy... so my preferred time to go is early evening, tuesday afternoons.  

Great stop while visiting GG park!
author: Jessica L.

description:
I'd never heard of these famous "Nick's tacos" before - probably since i live 500+ miles away - but I can see what all the fuss is about (and coming from someone who grew up 15min from the mexican border, i think that says something).  so. good.  

It has a sports bar meets dive bar meets awesome food type atmosphere which is really laid back and makes you feel right at home.  Everything is affordable, including the drinks (which reminds me, awesome bartenders) 

A little hint - try the cheese covered corn.
author: Andrea C.

description:
I've only been here on Tuesdays cause Taco Tuesdays are just not the same without the tacos.  I like Underdog's cause the tacos are pretty good and cheap, and it doesn't get super stuffy and packed to the brim like a lot of the other places in SF that do Taco Tuesdays.

The venue is a chill sports bar on Irving Street.  I don't know about you, but I don't want to be trapped in a cesspool of drunkards on a Tuesday night.....I just want my effin tacos.  And for that, I give Underdog's a thumbs up.

Non-alcoholic alternative drink with your tacos - agua fresca.  Yummy.

Nick's Way?  It's a soft taco, wrapped in a hard taco...or is it the other way around?  I can't remember.  Personally, I don't like having my senses tricked with a hard and soft taco in one bite.  Just saying.
author: Betty W.

description: I never knew good tacos existed out the Mission District until I ate over here. I had at least 3 fish tacos along with a glass of Guiness. Putting the orange sauce on the tacos made it taste even better. Also a great place to watch sports (I was there yesterday to see the last few minutes of the Celtics-Cavs game where the Cavs eventually lost). It's kind of neat that some of the tables that you eat over there are table top arcade games too.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
The chicken and carne asada crispy tacos "nicks way" are delicious.
The environment is kinda fun friends/family type atmosphere with flat screen tv's for sports, arcade games, and picnic tables all at a bar. There are tables that also double as old school pac man games. So yea there are highlights.

The burritos taste like the chimichangas you would get at the school cafeteria. There's also the Mexican "street style" tacos which were mini tacos with shredded pork, chicken, and beef (though the beef wasn't shredded). The beef was "okay", the chicken was a little worse though it was "not bad", and the pork was awful. I didn't even finish it.

Everything is also ridiculously over priced. $4.50 for a taco, really?

Three stars---atmosphere+ games + crispy tacos
minus two stars--other food on the menu + pricing
author: Catherine M.

description:
Underdog's...I was first introduced to this place by ex...His friend CJ's Brother used to bounce here back in the day.  I had a blast.  Car bombs!!!  The place is chill and the people are awesome.  

The atmosphere-great for anyone, you can even bring your kids (they have video games and what not, you can watch the game) but remember they still have alcohol and the usual 21+ bathrooms.

The food-served fresh salsa and chips...I have to admit SF has nothing on SD burritos, what can I say I'm a SD boy I practically lived there since I was around 7ish and SD burritos is where its at, BUT...Underdogs has the best tacos I've ever had in SF hands down.  Hefty portion, awesome taste and definitely satisfies that taqueria craving.  If you still have a need for a burrito, California burritos got it going on at Underdogs...what can I say, like I said I'm an SD boy, beans and rice belong ON THE SIDE!

No negatives here, when people ask where to get good Mexican food, I direct them here =)
author: Edrian D.

description: One of the best red sauce I've had. The baja fish tacos made Nick's way was delicious. One of the best I've had... not that I've had a lot...
author: Hae A.

description: Actually this place deserves ZERO stars!!!! We were in the area & needed some food. Saw how many stars this place had & decided to try it. Bad idea!!! Waited 35 mins for our food & when I asked about our order she said it should be on it's way. Two other tables that got there after us had already gotten their food before us! Come to find out they lost our ticket in the back. I saw her reprint our order & saw her walk to the back & ask the cook about it!! Then she tried to ignore me while I was trying to ask her about it!! She just kept walking!!! I saw her go up front to say something to the manager. I'm pretty sure she was explaining what happened w/ our order because he looked right at our table while she was talking. I thought he come up to our table to apologize but no, he continued to do what he was doing. Gave her a couple mins to come back to our table then finally walked out!!! What kind of service is that?!?!? My party had 4 adults & one child, should it take more than 30 mins?!?!? It wasn't even busy. NEVER EVER GOING BACK TO THIS PLACE!!! We ended up leaving without eating!!! Very upset!!!
author: Aileen V.

description:
5-stars? AbsoF@#Kinglutely 5-stars!

Went there yesterday for a social hosted by the group that I circuit train with (Koi Fitness - check out my review for them) and had a great time for the 4 hours that we were all there.

1. Getting there was as easy as drunk dialing. Hopped on the 71 Haight at 7th Avenue and Lincoln and was there in 5 mins.

2. The place is long, with tables for 2-4 on the left and bar seating on the right as you enter. The tables for group seating are way at the back and are picnic tables with benches which was perfect (3 tables in total that can seat 8 each comfortably)!

3. Not being that big a sports fan, I paid scant attention to the flat screens peppered throughout the bar, but folks definitely were getting into the games going on... baseball's like cricket, right?

4. Soon as I set my jacket down and got a seat, a server came up and asked me what I'd like to order for food and drinks - IMPRESSED! She was very attentive of everyone in our group and made regular rounds to check if we needed anything - again, IMPRESSED!

5. I started off with an iced tea and then graduated to a nice draft beer which brought a long day to a good close.

6. Starting to get hungry, I ordered 3 Nick's Carnitas Tacos (I ran 9 miles before so was ravenous, mmm kay!) and they were really filling, fresh, with good guacamole, carnitas cooked well and not too greasy. Perfect post run meal.

7. Final bill came to $25 without tip for 3 iced teas, 2 draft beers and 3 tacos... not too bad!

8. Place is your typical sports bar but noise level was not distracting, service was splendid and our server was uber friendly. We closed down the place but they were not in a rush to get us out. 

Definitely a place I'll hit up again for sure...

... the only downside... two car N N in 25 minutes... SHIT! 71 Haight in 20 minutes... SHIT! SHIT! That's another way to burn off the beer and tacos... walk back home.
author: Amit S.

description: Nick's Way Baja Fish Tacos...I am so addicted. They're pricey but SO delicious (along with their salsa/sauce in a bottle). I've had them not Nick's Way and they pale in comparison. My boyfriend also loves that it's a sports bar with his beloved ESPN playing on the flat screen TVs and the huge 49ers and Giants flags hanging from the ceiling. Will definitely keep coming back!
author: Caralisa L.

description:
Taco Tuesday FTW! 

The atmosphere was very nice. Lots of TVs, people, an assortment of arcade games, and a good bar. I went here for my birthday and had a blast, although it was bit crowded around 8pm (but then again its fucking Taco Tuesday. rawwwwwr)

My friends got me a birthday hat and the guys drinking next to us was coincidentally the owners, Nick and Doug. Nick bought me a drink, something I appreciated and will repay by coming back repeatedly (not just on Tuesday too).

Bartenders and waitresses were friendly and struck up convos, cool
author: Irvin David U.

description:
Amazing Tacos!!!!! I've been here a few times now and it never fails to impress!

also be sure to try the chips with salsa and avacado... very simple but very good!

another plus is unlike Nick's crispy taco's (also amazing) the Taco Shop takes cards!
author: Elissa K.

description: Excellent carnitas meat, chunky and moist and delicious. Try it San Fran style for the sour creme and guac.
author: Sean A.

description: Great place to drink, watch games, and have some good eats.
author: Billy C.

description:
I'm preeeetty particular with five-star ratings but Underdog's made me pant with happiness (get it, PANT, DOG... oh well).  Bottom line is they have absolutely amazing fish tacos.  Order them Baja style.  They are crispy in some places, corny-tortilla in others and covered in a sauce to make you drool for more.

The employees are so very friendly and one of the workers (owner?  not sure) took time to win over my son, my hubs and myself by saying two things:

1.) he was tired of Olympic curling being on every channel and

2.) he buys fish that are wild, not farm-raised

LOVE THIS PLACE!!!
author: Christina K.

description: omg so good.  the best burrito evarrrr!  so happy.  and the elderflower margarita was soooo good.
author: Amy M.

description: What?! A bar with cool ass bartenders?! Yes, its true. Come here and have some effin nachos!
author: Alex V.

description:
I was craving tacos so i decided to try this place.

Fish tacos were mediocre, Los Pinos has BETTER fish tacos :/
Carne asada was alright...

i dont see what's the hype all about? Even $1 tacos taste better!
author: linda L.

description: The service here is just strange. One waitress in particular liked to grab things... whether it be the menu out of my hands (that I was actively reading..), a new napkin on the table that was about to be used, or a drink that may or may not have been finished. It was just weird. Also, I had a hair in one of my tacos and immediately sent the basket back for new tacos. I got my new tacos, but when the bill came, I was charged for the extra tacos on top of the original hairy ones!
author: Becca S.

description: Amazing food! Tomatoes in salsa were incredibly fresh and tasty, and I am not even a big fan of tomatoes. But those were amazing! Watermelon juice was great and super freshly made.  Quesadilla with steak was super tasty. Food is really really good there, and so yummy and fresh. The staff is very nice and friendly. The atmosphere is really welcoming and homey. This is one of the best Mexican food places I've ever been!
author: Valerie K.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant right now!  The crispy tacos are AMAZING as is the elote. I just had a breakfast burrito when I was there last and it wasn't quite as good as I expected.

I wish I had a carnitas taco nick's way right now!!!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
The tacos are 5 star!

The service on my last visit was 1 star.

 I have waited tables for many years and could not believe how a waitress there treated my friend.  Our friend arrived first and sat at a table, then other people came in and sat at the same table (you can share tables there).  My friend told the waitress that he was waiting for friends and that there was not room to share the table.   The waitress was very rude and told my friend to find another table.  Later we saw that the people who had taken our table were friend's of the waitress as she was taking shots with them.  At the very least she should have apologized to my friend when she saw in fact he did have a group of friends, if she had done that I would not have felt comelled to write a review.  I would hope that management expects more from their wait staff and that more training on customer service is done. 

 We will be searching for a new fish taco place as I do not believe in spending my money at businesses that treat their clientele poorly.
author: Isabel R.

description:
Wow.

Best fish taco I've ever had?  Wasn't expecting that to happen, but talk about an unexpected surprise.  Beer-battered fish the way it's supposed to be done with the perfect complement of pico de gallo and guacamole.  Yum!  

Cool non-pretentious sports bar atmosphere that makes you feel like you're back in college.  It gets busy here on weekends, but once you've got a seat, some tacos, and a corona, it's a little slice of heaven.
author: John H.

description:
Delicious!

I have been to Nick's Crispy Tacos once before (what seems a lifetime ago) with a friend and someone else, and I did not have the tacos that time. I had the nachos... whoa, tangent. I'll save that review for the next time I hit up Nick's Crispy Tacos.

It was a Saturday evening, there were 8 hungry twentysomethings, and blocks away was Underdog's. When you first walk into Underdog's you see a bar, some tables to stand and snack on and friendly faces. We sat at the picnic bench-style tables in the back. Now for the food! I had the baja fish taco and the vegetarian taco Nick's way. Nick's way is basically the crispy taco wrapped in a soft taco with cheese in between. Everything was great! Be careful when it gets busy though. They accidentally charged us for a second shrimp taco, but we had only ordered one. They removed it from the bill without argument. I will definitely be back.
author: Tatiana J.

description: Great Place!! Great Food!! Good Drink Specials.....Hard to get a seat on Friday Nights...but well worth the wait.
author: Brian W.

description:
I met Nick, formerly of Nick's Crispy Taco's, last night at his latest venture The Taco Shop at Underdog's.  And while I don't want to lick his face as previously stated in my review of Nick's, I do kinda want to punch him in said face.  

Why Nick, why?  Your new taco shop is LITERALLY around the corner from my house. 

Like I can roll out of bed, slip on some sandales and be at the bar slurping guacamole through a straw in less time than it takes you to say, 

"DON'T GIVE THAT GIRL ANY MORE CARNITAS.  SHE IS MAKING A MESS".

And I will be making a mess.  I will be the girl you feel sorry for, sitting at the bar alone, covered in salsa and stewed chicken.

In 5 days I have visited this new Nick establishment 4 times.  On one of those days we were given free chips and salsa which I inhaled in about 4.5 seconds to the shock and dismay of my boyfriend who, sadly, likes his girlfriend on this side of HUGE, GIGANTIC, CHIP EATING WHALE.

I can't help myself.  The chips, the guac, the carnitas, the salsa, the salty and sweet agave and lime margies are all excellent.  Seriously.  There is NO better bar food than this. 

Beyond the food, the service we have had there each time is impeccable.  Nick is super friendly, as are most of his waitstaff/bartenders.  My water glass is never empty and there are a number of people ready to get you FUBAR at the first hint of a nearly empty glass.

In conclusion, I would just like to say, Nick -- you're a bastard.

And I love you.  

Thanks for nothing.

But really thanks for everything -- can't wait to get fat together.  And by together I mean alone, because I doubt you eat your own food all that often.

Me?  Well, I bathe in it and I smell delicious.  Obviously.
author: Rachel G.

description:
So, here I am. Walking down this one particular section of Irving between 19th and 18th AVE and I walk by this one particular establishment four times a week. Everytime I walk by, I take a fleeting glance inside to hopefully view some the revelry I hear emanating from the inner space of this place. 

Underdog's Sports Bar & Grill now has etched itself within my top 10 choices of watering holes in San Francisco. I actually should say, top five places in San Francisco. 

First off, this is a bar. Drinking is what goes on here. Secondly, Underdog's is a taco joint. A pretty darn nice taco joint to boot. I was pleasantly surprised yesterday afternoon following the suggestion by my wife that we go ahead and check this place out. Thank-you wifey-poo for making that suggestion. We now have a favorite bar near our house. 

Underdogs is a welcoming establishment. It reminds me of the typical small town Wisconsin bar. I don't know why, it just seems to give off that type of friendly vibe to me. I particularly enjoyed the fact they have Guinness and at the same time, Big Daddy on tap. This places me in heaven. My two favorite ales together under the same roof. Now, place some fantastic tacos on top of all that and there you have it. Euphoria! 

Beers, tacos and HD TVs mounted behind the bar all add up to an enjoyable experience for all. The staff was friendly, the place is clean, it's very easy to get to (the 71 runs within a block) and sports out the wazoo. This adds up to yummy-yummy, drinky-drinky. 

I strongly recommend this place
author: Wayne B.

description:
THE spot to get tacos in the Sunset. Get them "Nick's way" for that crispy textural contrast of the grilled tortilla. All the ingredients are fresh (one grilled crispy corn tortilla, a soft tortilla with monterey jack cheese, pinto beans, pico de gallo and guacamole), the meats are seasoned perfectly and the hot sauces are tasty and spicy. Ask for the habanero sauce for that extra kick to take you over the top!

The meat choices are carne asada, carnitas, and pollo. The have a vegetariano and two fish options, baja style (battered) or grilled. Today, I went with carnitas and the grilled mahi, which were both excellent.

They have burritos as well as quesadillas. The sopa de tortilla with homemade chicken soup, tomatoes, onions, jack cheese, avocado, tortillas and lime caught my eye for next time and the server mentioned it was her favorite item on the menu.

The beer selection is nice as well, with Big Daddy IPA, Sierra Nevada, Pyramid, Boont, Turmer Pils, Stella, Dos Equis, Hoegaarden and Guiness on tap. Margaritas, sangria, and homemade aqua fresca round off the beverage selections.
author: Derrick V.

description:
I served a 16-year sentence in Los Angeles that, despite all its detractors, offered some very special Mexican food from many different regions of that wonderful - now somewhat dangerous - country.  Whilst my search for great Mexican food in San Francisco is an ongoing process, I must write that The Taco Shop At Underdog's is truly special in this city.  

First off, I wholeheartedly recommend that you sample all tacos "Nick's Way".  Yeah, a taco wrapped in two tortillas - inner crisp; outer soft - might be caloric and over the top but it makes sense and is delicious.  I adore the carnitas and baja tacos.  Oh, did I mention the corn that would be delcious on its own but it's then taken to another place by rolling the corn cob in some sort of cheese.

I've only enjoyed many a lunch at Underdog's but I'm sure their tacos and corn are super no matter what time of day served.

Do not miss this place!
author: Jay D.

description:
I was looking for a place to go for happy hour before Nightlife @ the Academy of Sciences. Read that their Nick's Baja-style fish taco is #10 on the 2010 Big Eat SF: 100 Things to Try Before You Die and decided to give it a try. 

Got to Underdog's around 4pm. Tons of metered street parking available. Was greeted with fantastic service at the bar. Ordered their House Margarita (prepared with fresh squeezed limes) and the Pescado Taco...love at first bite! Fresh, flavorful, and amazing! Happy Hour (4:30-6pm M-F) included $2 Dos XX and $1 Street Tacos. Had a great time and been craving their tacos ever since!
author: Katie L.

description:
Letting Nick take over the menu at Underdogs is just what the doctor ordered for what I personally felt was a dismal previous attempt at bar food.
Thus, changing the name from "Underdogs" to "The Taco Shop at Underdogs" is 100% on the mark.  
Why?
Nick knows tacos.  Knows tacos like Bo knew football, baseball, and Nike endorsements.
Ordering a taco "Nicks Way" is like ordering your tacos "dorado" at
La Taqueria.
I highly recommend the Tacos de Pescado "grilled" and "Nicks Way".
It's how I would imagine Tacos de Pescado if La Taqueria offered Fish Tacos.
Whatever you choose, and it won't be a wrong choice if you have tacos...
Do not forget to ask for the Habenero salsa.....
Fire in, lava out.
Mmmm Mmmm Bitch!
author: Barry A.

description: I love their Nick's Way tacos and carne asada quesadillas! The meat is juicy and flavorful, and the tortillas are perfectly crispy. I've had better salsa though.
author: Sophia B.

description:
A gem of the outer sunset. They have nightly specials on food or drink and is a great place to go and watch a game.

The food is amazing and you get a decent amount of it for the price. The street tacos give a decent sampling of the various meats they have for future visits. The nachos and their quesadillas are amazing and have become something I order each time I visit

Their beer bucket specials are decent for groups and seem to be really popular with folks stopping by after work. 

Having moved out of the sunset, I still continue to come here from time to time, and I'm on the other side of the city now. Damn good stuff
author: Sam M.

description:
If I could kick off every Giants or 49ers game with two of their tacos and a beer, game on! Here comes the hollering and hooting! You gotta love the tacos here. And if you're going to order it, get it Nick's way. Crispy, fresh ingredients, flavorful, and cheap. That's how to eat before, during, and after a sports game. The crowd here is super friendly and the servers and bartenders are very attentive. Its been packed every time I've gone to the bar and that's exactly how an awesome bar should be! 

Perhaps there are people who complain because they can compare it to the other great taco stands out there. Hey, good for them and that's what yelp is for. But when I'm sitting there looking up seeing the Giants, 49ers, and Cal Bears flags with a taco in one hand and a cold beer in the other, you can't push me off that bar stool even with a crow bar. 

Love the tacos and love the sports bar. Whoop whoop! Cheers!
author: Chau H.

description: It's been a week or so since my first visit to Underdog's and it's even better the second time around! Had the carnitas taco, nick's way of course and the pescado burrito add a Snowcap (seasonal beer) and b-ball games equals a GREAT night!
author: Stephen Y.

description:
Check your Mission district-ingrained, deep-seated pretensions to authenticity at the door, and get ready to enjoy some really fresh, amazing tacos at this unlikely but welcome addition to the Sunset. I recommend bypassing the burritos and street tacos and ordering anything on the "Nick's Way" menu: delicious hand-held meals layered with beans, cheese, guacamole, and meat. Fish tacos also make an excellent choice. And don't forget to add plenty of that red sauce they bring you! I don't know what's in it, but I love it almost as much as the food.

The venue itself is your standard sports bar, plus a few old school arcade games and a respectable selection of domestic and Mexican beers. Not perfect, but a shining oasis in the otherwise pretty homogenous Sunset bar scene.
author: Karin H.

description:
I still love this place.  And my goodness am I putting on the extra few pounds to support this.  
Still, I shouldn't complain.  Everyone I bring here leaves and raves about it anytime they talk about it.
Yum.
Consistently good food and service every time.
author: Deb B.

description:
5 STARS just for for Nick's Crispy Tacos!

FOOD:
*Chips and Salsa: GREAT--The chips are fresh, crisp and not too thick. They hold up well to the salsa that lay a top. The guac which is a separate order is also very good--it's fresh, and oh-so buttery. 
*Chicken Tortilla Soup: YUMMY--Rich chicken broth with tender chicken pieces and veggies that aren't mushy. The cheese and tangy zing from the lime add an extra layer of flavor and gooeyness!
*Buffalo Wings: Ok--nothing special. I wish the sauce was a little but spicer--or better yet, they should have different degrees of spicyness!
* Baja Style Taco (Done Nick's Way w/ all the trimmings): A MUST!  It's so freakin' good. The cod is fresh, moist, and lightly battered. Smothered in guac, sour cream, and wrapped in 2 layers (crisp and soft tortillas)--HOLY MOLY!!! And, you must smother it with the salse verde. It's so good that I think I can drink the sauce on it's own. They should really think about bottling that baby up and selling it!

The taco is pretty big, so 1 should be sufficient! You've never tasted a taco until you've tasted Nick's! 

SERVICE: Always friendly, my water glass is never empty-- so all good considering it's a low-key type of place. Although one time, we asked for Corona Lights, and the waiter brought out a Cooler's Lites which he later gave us it for free. LoL!

This is a great place for a late night snack or after hitting up Nightlife @ CAS. 

Can't wait to return soon to get my fix...
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
This was my second time at underdogs. The experience was HORRENDOUS. 

Today as my bf and I drove to Stonestown, we listened to the UCLA basketball game on the radio. Upon hearing the terrible score we drove backwards from Taravel to Underdogs, since we wanted to try their food and knew they would be playing the game for sure. After looking for parking, we barely made it in time for the last 2 min.

The male barguys were cool, the curly brown haired one was helping us and he asked us if we needed anything. We said chicken wings but he told us that would take 15 min--with 2 min left in the game, we decided to decline, but told him we would prob. need some drinks after the game was over to drown our sorrows. He was totally cool with it and left us to watching our bruins get slaughtered--he even poured us 2 glasses of water which we thought was nice.

THEN 26 sec left in the game: an Asian Girl bartender came up to us:

Girl: Have you ordered anything?
Me: No
Girl: *with some attitude* Would you like to order anything?
Me: Yeah in about 26 seconds (staring at the tv screen behind her)

The girl looks behind her to see the screen we were watching. She walks behind the bar and get this--CHANGE THE CHANNEL to another bball game and turns off the tv next to it. WOW, that was nice of her. The last thing we saw was a foul shot at 26 seconds. The girl ruined our time there--not only were we upset from being out of the tournement but now we felt extremely unwelcome there. So we left and i told the girl, "THANKS FOR CHANGING THE CHANNEL" and she gave me a thumbs up. R-u-d-e. 

The sad part is, I was really looking forward to trying their food finally(my old post is below) and shoot some hoops after the game. In general I like the ambiance of the bar (which is why we drove all the way back here.) i mean the bar wasnt even half full, why the cold shoulder?
We were just sitting there and when the game is on, down to the seconds, can we not be harassed the last 26? Its a SPORTS bar--Was there no understanding of how big this game was to its fans?  Oh and it was kind of obvious i was a fan with a fat UCLA jersey on. Really doubtful that it was a coincidence. I know she is just one bartender there, but feel offended that such pissy behavior is being tolerated. 


The first time I went here, this blonde bartender was really friendly-didnt rush our orders at all (we waited for our entire party before ordering.) So it shows that not all the bar servers here are sourpusses.

Byebye to the Bruins in the NCAA tourny, I am sorry I couldn't be with you in your last moments!   :(  :(  :(
author: Amy S.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

Nick's Crispy Taco's are the BEST Ever!!!! I love the crispy taco with the soft tortilla around it, I love the guacamole, I love the carnitas and i love the fresh pico!!!!

I've never had a problem grabbing a table in back and I usually come with 5+ people! 

I come here all the time! When I write it on my status on facebook status, this is what I always get- "Again?" "Is it really that good?" 

Hellz yeah!
author: Alvin M.

description:
Beer, Tacos, and football.  

A great place to spend your entire Sunday!  Plenty of TVs clearly labelled with the morning and afternoon games that will be shown.  The wait staff is excellent, very attentive.  Good beer selection and really tasty tacos.  Try the Baja Fish ones, and throw some of the Habanero sauce on there!
author: Paul H.

description:
Came here for dollar taco tuesdays and also caught the tail end of a spurs vs suns game. For a sports bar on a tuesday night with regular season games it was pretty full. The crowd was pretty subdued, an excellent way to spend a tuesday evening. Fantastic place to watch some games and a have a few drinks.


We had some tacos, chips and salsa, and a pitcher of beer. The food was great and the prices were good. The chips had fresh picco de gallo on it but my favorite was the two squirt bottles filled with a green salsa (tomatille?) and one with an orangeish salsa. I think it was meant for the street tacos but I loaded them onto the chips either way.

The tacos were also delicious albeit a tad bit on the small side. Good news is that it's only $1 on tuesdays, or during happy hour M-F 4:30 - 6pm. I had seven of those buggers filled with a touch of lime and a generous squirt of salsa. The chicken taco was by far the most mouth watering and delicious, followed by the carnitas if you want variety. Personally, I would just stick with the chicken. Cant wait to sample tacos "Nick's Way" the next time I'm here.

The low point of the evening? When the Spurs lost despite Duncan going 34 and 14.
author: Colin H.

description:
I have patronized this establishment many a-time... I work at the California Academy of Sciences, so I am very close and usually come here for lunch whenever I get a chance.  NOT ANYMORE!

It's my birthday on Sunday, so I got together some coworkers to come with me to Underdogs to eat some delicious tacos Nick's Way.  We got there, sat down, ordered some drinks and chips and guac.  So far so good.  So there are 9 of us.  The waitress comes over (I believe her name was Jess?) and takes our order and DOES NOT WRITE IT DOWN!  ARE YOU SERIOUS?!?!  Even someone with the best memory ever would have a hard time with all the combinations... there is a point where your pride needs to be swallowed and just grab the pen and paper.  SERIOUSLY - this error on her part caused our lunch break to be over two hours.  The orders came, and as we all anticipated, it was F'd up.  No real apology either.  She offered some chips for free, which we got about 30 minutes later.  The food probably took another 45 minutes - not joking unfortunately!  Half of our group ate while the other half waited... some had to leave to get back to meetings - so those who were still waiting on food had to stay.  They did not even try to push through the messed up orders.  I was one of the fortunate ones who got my order correct, but I didn't want to be rude so I held off on one of my Tacos... mmmmm rubbery cold shrimp taco!

I really REALLY want to give one star, but I can't because seriously the food is that good.  Maybe carryout from now on?  Maybe call ahead with my order to then sit and eat there?  I am definitely demanding a pen and paper from now on...

I definitely cannot recommend this place for a business lunch with a larger group because your order will get messed up, and it will be over 2 hours. 

Thanks for ruining my work birthday lunch, Taco Shop!  Big jerks!
author: Kristina K.

description: Awesome little taco shop. Just what I would expect from San Francisco. Good crowd, good food, and solid atmosphere. All around great place to have a beer, grab a bite, an watch a game.
author: Jason R.

description:
I came back a few more times. The quality of the food has decreased. Also their guacamole dip is a smaller portion now! That is also not cool. I ordered their catch of the day fish taco, and it was disgusting. It was mahi mahi and it had a disgusting smell. I sent it back and the server was cool with that. 

I would only come here for drinks.
Service is still good.
author: Chatree T.

description:
Horrible service.
Dirty environment.
Food handling after money handling...just wrong.
Weak and nothing but ice, margaritas.
Too much crunchy fried batter instead of fish (Pescado "Baja" Style taco).
Way out in the middle of nowhere.
Awesome owner who just needs an entirely new staff who care about their work and what they produce.  It has potential, but what we witnessed was pure disappointment and sadness.

Tall bartender guy...please wash your hands before handling the chips.  Taking cash then sticking your hands in the chip bin...not cool at all.  Glad we saw that after we paid and decided to leave.
author: Ayrn H.

description: This is one of my top 10 ultimate places to go. The food, the drinks, the environment is just all a good time. Man, I cant wait to get back out there and get some baja and carnitas tacos nicks way. No second thoughts about this place....EVER! GO NOW if you haven't been before.
author: Arturo M.

description:
Underdog's is the bomb.  All the other reviews are right, the staff is friendly, the food is good, the beer can be cheap (if you so choose). 

But the win for me, living around the corner without TV and not being a SF native?

 It's that they've got enough TV's and an understanding-enough staff that if you want to watch your hometown team you can almost always walk in, get a drink, and ask for it to be put on.  The ability to watch the Giants *and* another game (or four) in a small bar with good food and friendly staff?  

That's what makes living around the corner a win.

I honestly never go anywhere else unless I'm leaving the neighborhood.
author: Wil T.

description:
If you love Mexican food you must try the food here. The tacos are amazing, brimming with quality and hearty ingredients like fresh pico de gallo (made with purple onions!), cheese, and delicious meats. Make sure to try any Taco "Nick's Way," which is a crispy corn tortilla wrapped inside the soft tortilla and topped with the most delicious guacamole I've ever tasted in the Sunset district. The extra crisp provides an enticing flavor to the taco and the extra tortilla helps to support the massive amount of yumminess piled on the taco. I always get the veggie and fish tacos, it's tough to find quality fish at restaurants but this place hasn't disappointed. 

The bar also has 5 huge televisions and several other small tvs that always play Giants games, football, soccer and any other sports games you desire. It doesn't have the aggressive ambiance of other sports bars nor are there any annoying douchebags ruining the atmosphere. Just a friendly neighborhood bar with great food and a relaxed environment. I highly recommend stopping by, it's definitely my favorite bar in the Sunset, and it's quickly becoming my favorite bar in San Francisco.
author: Athena K.

description:
My friends and I came here to watch the 49er v Detroit game. The parking in this area is horrible but at least once we got inside we were lucky enough to get a table in the back.  I was not impressed by the food at all but there Bloody Mary was decent.  The tacos were large but bland and my friend's who had the breakfast burritos didn't even finish them because they just weren't very good.  We ordered nachos later on because were there for 3 hours and got hungry again.  We thought it's hard to mess up nachos... so of course, they were okay at best.

The atmosphere was pretty good but that was mostly due to the exciting 2nd half of the game.  We're trying a new place this Sunday.
author: Laura C.

description:
Ambiance 1/1: It's a nice neighborhood bar with friendly youngins frequently visiting. TV's are in a great view to the point where no one is not facing a TV, and it's great for a late-night stop by.

Service: 0/2
I think these servers and bartenders think that they work at Lockheed Martin or something, and think that they're the bomb. They are always pretentious and give you  attitude when you ask for help...I expect this for when I dine in the Marina, not the Sunset. If the servers were a little nicer here, I'd definitely go more often.

Food: 1/2. 1 Star for the great California-Mexican fusion food. Deduction of 1 star for burritos that require ten pounds of salsa to taste like something, and really fishy-tasting tacos. I get it, they are fish tacos, but the fish here isn't exactly the freshest out of the bunch. Oh well.

Only go here because it's open late night.
author: Anna T.

description: I used to come here all the damn time back when it first opened. My dumb friend ordered for me (the fish tacos yucky), but to make up for it I got the chicken taco nicks way. I think it's such an ingenius idea to have one crispy corn tortilla and one soft filled with cheese, pico de gallo, and guac.....damn goodness right there. I also got the chicken quesadilla and nachos from here too. Good place to watch a game and chill out. I tried their $1 margaritas on Fridays from 6-6:30pm....it used to be 0.50 =P but what a great way to get your buzz going on a Friday. I wasn't so into the taco tuesday since they're kinda small and uncomparable to the tacos nick's way so I'll just stick to my usual.
author: Diane L.

description:
Came here with my lady and met up with some of the old high school buddies. I've seen this place and heard about their tacos...they have a deal on tuesdays where its like $1 tacos..

now tacos for a dollar is pretty good, but I guess I'd rather spend the money i spent on 3-4 of those dollar tacos on a tasty taco you know what i mean? Their fish taco, now that was pretty yummy..

Other than that, I wouldnt really pay more than a dollar for those small happy hour tacos anyways, so I guess if I was craving for it then you would only see me on tuesdays hahaha...

Also another thing, the bar....I think the bar is waaaay too big and I dont think they need that much room back there. I dont kno, they could of changed it up a bit.. Just seems like bad space management or I guess that was how it used to be?
author: phillip w.

description: All the tacos Nick's way are the best! And all their meat is happy, which I realize is more commonplace in San Francisco, but it's a treat being from LA. My favorite is the carnitas. They also have excellent salsas. Careful with the light pink one- it's super hot!
author: Cindy Lou W.

description: Let's face it- mexican food in the sunset is subpar with one exception: Nick's. What a welcome addition to the 'hood! A perfect combination of a dive bar that serves yummy food.  Can't go wrong with any of the taco selections.
author: Cynthia J.

description:
Oh, I know what I'd love with my taco, lukewarm service and dirty tables and seats. The only reason I'm not giving this a one star is that the tacos are good. Although the last time (and I mean the LAST time ever) there was a long line of bugs on the wall. Yum, can I have a PBR with that? 

I'd rather eat a taco at home.
author: Nick G.

description:
We interrupt your scheduled programming to bring you this public service announcement....

Nick's Crispy Tacos are now in the Sunset!! 
Nick's Crispy Tacos are now in the Sunset!!
Nick's Crispy Tacos are now in the Sunset!!
Nick's Crispy Tacos are now in the Sunset!!
Nick's Crispy Tacos are now in the Sunset!!
Nick's Crispy Tacos are now in the Sunset!!
Nick's Crispy Tacos are now in the Sunset!!

And the baja fish taco done Nick's Way is still da bomb!  

We now return you to your regularly scheduled program...
author: LaSha G.

description:
3.90 stars.

Came here with a group of friends (7-9ish) for game 1 of the NBA finals. The place was poppin'! There are multiple large LCD TVs, and most of them showed the NBA finals. One showed the hockey game. This place isn't that big, but there were a lot of people. We "waited" for about 10 minutes, before there was a table available for us.

We ordered beer and Mexican food. The food was good, and their alcohol selection was fairly good (less draft selection that I expected, but it's no biggie). We stayed for a good 3 hours, having a good time.

I would recommend this place, and I would come back.
author: Sam W.

description: I hate that they charge for chips and salsa! BUT I love Nick's way tacos and the huge variety of alcohol.
author: Karen T.

description:
Good times here. A $15 pitcher of blue moon, giant flatscreens, a cozy atmosphere, and to top it off, playing photo inspector on the Max at the front. 

The only reason I give 3 stars is because of how disappointed I was with the tacos. It must have been a bad day or something, but all of the various tacos we got were super dry and bland tasting. Im gonna try them again some other time, but until then, 3 stars it is
author: Brian T.

description: This is one of my most favorite places ever. Tacos are among my favorite foods, and the tacos Nick's Way are some of the best I've ever eaten. I always mean to try other items on the menu, but it's hard when the tacos are so good. There are also a wide variety of beverages to wet your whistle. It's also a great place to watch a [sports event]. I watched the Giants walk-off against the Padres a few weeks ago, and the place was rockin' with chants and high fives. If you're looking for a cool place to chill or have a taco craving in need of satiating, this is the place to go.
author: Nat L.

description:
Holy geebus! I've had a some good tacos in my day, but this place quickly made its way to the top spot on my list. The shrimp ones Nick's way (which in my opinion should be the ONLY way to order them) are too good for words. Every bite from the first to the last was great. I love how everything here is made fresh. I could have devoured their chips and salsa all by myself if I wanted to. It was chunky, not watery. After washing everything down with a 24 oz. PBR, I was good for the night. I could see myself becoming a regular here. 

P.S. Shout out to Brian W. I beat you to reviewing this place! *evil laugh* =P
author: Rhia R.

description:
Came here after dinner last night for drinks with a bunch of friends. The space is pretty big and in the back there are a few games. Too bad we just came from a big dinner, because we saw the tacos and nachos that someone had ordered, and it looked delicious! I'm going to have to come back here to try it next time,

Overall, the bar has a complete selection of drinks. The bartender was great, she said she didn't have sweet and sour to make my drink, but she would make it happen..and she did! My drink was delicious! As we sat on the table, the waitress came by a couple times to make sure that we were okay and if we needed another drink. Half the time, we just wanted to sit and talk and that was fine by them. We didn't feel pressured to buy any drinks at all. 

A few round of shots later, we were all happy campers. The basketball game in the back is fun to play with, esp with a group of friends. Overall we had a nice time here. A great sports bar/lounge.
author: Betty S.

description:
Finally, i set up direct deposit with them to avoid the paper trail. These people have extracted my nomadic soul and somehow have me playing electronic quiz games amidst the punishing sports dreck to sample the unyielding freshness of their perplexedly elevated foodstuff. Its tapered in a unrepentantly sleazy format, execution, stance and medium. And......i just can't stop. 

Chips. Pica. Veggie. Then Baja. Purgatory.
author: Christopher J.

description:
I really like this bar. We serendipitously found it while on a Saturday afternoon jaunt on Irving, and were seduced by the screaming football fans and Atari games/dining tables. (We sat at Ms. Pacman. I totally bit it.)

The place was completely slammed, but the service was really good. I have no idea how, but our waitress was on top of everything, and super friendly.  

We of course had to try Nick's tacos, and they were just...ok. I was so surprised, because everyone I know raves and raves about them.

 I had the grilled fish tacos, Nick's way (crispy and soft tortilla, wrapped around grilled fish, red onions, cabbage, and a sprig of cilantro), and it was actually really bland. I added a bunch of their smoky red hot sauce, and that did help, but on the whole, I was disappointed by how little flavor the actual taco had. 

Maybe Nick was having an off day?
author: Sara A.

description:
When I found out Nick from Nick's Crispy Tacos moved here I knew I had to come try this place.  It took a while but I finally made the long trek out from the inner sunset to the outer sunset.  This place is pretty cool.  There's plenty of flat screen TVs surrounding the bar for your viewing pleasure, and then there's picnic benches in the back for your taco eating pleasure.  

I came here with the boys for taco tuesday and got one of each street taco (pollo, carne asada, carnitas, each $1 on tuesdays), and of course a pescado baja taco "nick's way" to see if he's changed at all after moving from his old home at Rouge.  I'm happy to say the taco was as delicious as ever, however I would definitely pass on the $1 street tacos next time i'm in there.  Which is fine, it puts less pressure on me to get there every Tuesday anyway.  

A few changes I've noticed about Nick's Crispy Tacos since moving to Underdogs.  For one thing I could have sworn these tacos were like a buck cheaper at his old place in Russian hill.  For another thing, Taco Tuesday used to be the regular Nick's tacos for 2 bucks, not those dinky bite-sized street tacos that he now serves.  On the up side, the red sauce in the squeeze bottles is CRAZY good now.  I don't know what he did to it but i go through half a bottle each time I'm there.  It tastes almost like the salsa at Papalote which if you know me, is something I could bathe in and not have any qualms about it.  Just hook it to my veins.  For realz.  

Also I've been here twice now and one time they gave us chips and salsa for free and the other time they didn't.  I liked it a lot better when they were free.  I asked the waitress about it and she was like, "oh yeah, sometimes we comp them and sometimes we don't..." then she gave me an awkward smile and walked away.  WHAT?!  Look just give it to me for free from now on and keep that kind of information to yourself.
author: William S.

description:
If you think the Outer Sunset is too far to travel for Mexican food, then consider Underdog's Sports Bar & Grill a pilgrimage well worth the journey. Allow me to briefly enlighten any nonbelievers:

Stellar food: Everything on the menu is delicious, period. This isn't Nick's Crispy Tacos--It's way better. 

Great atmosphere: It's the perfect blend of space, seating, and TVs... complimented by a fun crowd and welcoming vibe.   

Awesome service: All around a smart, friendly staff. Take special note of the hot bartenders. Sam is my personal favorite.
author: Carrie D.

description:
I cant go a week without my Mexican food fix, it's the Oakland in me, grew up making regular stops to the ghetto taco trucks which stay open till 2 to 3am every night. 

This is one of my regular spots when I'm in the area and have a craving. The fish taco is one of the best I had in SF and everything else on the menu I tried so far was decent/good. But more than anything is there sauces that keeps me coming back! They have a house made habanero sauce that be kicking you in the face like jackie chan! If you like the spicy stuff, definitely ask for it.

With that said, I would easily give this place 4 stars for the food but had to drop it down to 3 for the service. The food always takes forever and the servers are all coo but it's to obvious that they just don't care, which means you have to fight for there attention whenever you want something. I aint mad at them, the food service biz is the food service biz....but the customer experience is the customer experience......enough said. 

Over all, a good place to grab a bite and watch the game.
author: Andy C.

description:
I've been wanting to get a breakfast burrito here for a couple weeks and I'm so glad I finally got one today! I think I got the "La Bomba" burrito....too big but delicious! Chorizo, bacon, egg, potatoes, onions, and cheese. 

Got a Mimosa as well watched some snowboarding on the flatscreen. I loved the reggae music, but wasn't crazy about the Latino music. 

Nick came up and chatted with me for a few minutes, and was very friendly and inviting.  Bartender was kind of quiet at first but then opened up a bit when Nick introduced us.  Friendly gesture I thought. 

Will definitely go back in for some more taco tacos!
author: Courtney M.

description: The California burrito was delicious and the server was super nice! The place was a little crowded and the seating a little uncomfortable. But i also really enjoyed the inside decorations
author: Ce S.

description:
I came back up to SF for Christmas last year and was hanging out with some old friends one night when we ended up at Underdogs to grab a drink. I had already eaten and was not planning on ordering any food but one of my friends suggested that I try one of their Fish Tacos here since they are REALLY DELICIOUS. I had my doubts because I was living in San Diego at the time, a city known for their amazing and authentic mexican food, including world famous fish tacos. I even made the comment that any fish taco up here can't be nearly as good as the ones in San Diego.

So we ordered one. I took a few bites and have to say that although it wasn't as good as the ones I've had in San Diego, it was PRETTY DAMN CLOSE. I loved the crunchy shell on top. The fish was battered perfectly and was nice and juicy. The flavors were amazing! 

Now that I am moved back to San Francisco, I'm so glad that I have a place to get delicious fish tacos like the ones in San Diego!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Hands down the best Taco this side of Twin Peaks. 

Definitely have the taco "Nick's way" which is a crispier tortilla on the inside and a soft tortilla on the outiside. You can tell the ingredients are really fresh, which is key to great Mexican food.

The service is really great and the staff is friendly. If the consistency keeps up, I may very well change my score to Five stars.
author: Kent C.

description:
Underdogs is without a doubt one of the best taco places in the city. The female part of this review team has been a regular customer since it first opened, and has never had a bad experience. Her favorite item is the Baja Style Fish taco. The beer battered fish is flavorful and juicy, and tastes amazing when you order it "Nick's Way." The chips are freshly made and include salsa for $1.50, with free refills. Each table is also provided with two hot sauces that are made on site which have their own unique flavor and add to the experience.

Overall, it's a wonderful place to have Mexican in the Sunset, and we will for sure be coming back again. Oh, if you're just coming for the food it's best not to come during a big game as the place can get quite packed.
author: Sami R.

description: The Nick's way fish tacos are fantastic!! Actually, all their tacos are. This is a great place to hang out with friends, catch a game, grab a beer and eat up! It does get super packed on game nights, and weekends. Its not the most beautiful sports bar around, but it's a great spot.
author: Magdalena G.

description: Went back for my second time, and ordered a regular pollo burrito.  Great flavor, fresh ingredients, but the chef couldn't bother draining the water from either the beans or the salsa, so what I got was a leaky bag of soup wrapped in aluminum foil.  It dripped through my fingers down to my elbow, and pooled in the paper-lined basket below.  After less than a minute, the water-logged tortilla totally disintegrated, and the whole thing fell apart in my hands.  C'mon you guys - this is just plain stupid indifference - why would you want to ruin your reputation to save 3 or 4 seconds of preparation time?  I was pissed.  Wanted to give 2 stars this time but I like you guys and the sports bar / party atmosphere still kinda rocks.
author: Richard A.

description: Tacos here aren't too bad, but I wished they had my favorite meat, the al pastor.  Their salsas is pretty tasty.  It has a nice smoky flavor.  I think they take the Chevy's Salsa and and puree the hell out of it.
author: A L.

description: this place is the best! not "authentic" mexican, exactly, but crazy delicious. love the fish tacos, shrimp tacos, carnitas, etc. nick's way or not, it's all great. try both of their sauces, the green and red. this place had some kind of split with nick's crispy tacos in nob hill, and i think this location is much better, hands down. drinks are also strong and tasty. nothing bad to say at all!
author: Robert Y.

description:
#10. Nick's Baja-style fish tacos Big Eat SF 2010

though I like the ambiance of Nick's off Polk (2009 list) much better, these are still pretty damn good. Dragged my unknowing friend there in my selfish pursuit to check this off the list since I had had the equivalent last year. 

me gusta
author: S V.

description: Overall, I had a good experience. I went there on a crowded Saturday night during basketball playoffs and was able to get a table. Food was amazing and the service was pretty good as well. I enjoyed their fish tacos and my boyfriend got a burrito that was good and interesting. The only downside was that my food took a long time to be prepared, but the large margarita made up for it. Check it out and try some of their tacos nick's style.
author: Magdalena Z.

description: This food here is AMAZING! Happy hours are great, and the taco Tues deal is BOMB. $2 street tacos and $2 tecates you cant go wrong. This place is cracking from 530-9 at night. You can wait up to an hour for a table. If there is a giants game on GOOD LUCK you will be waiting a while. The burritos here are also another amazing items. The nachos are HUGE and well worth the price. I have had nothing but positive experiences here at underdogs. I live around the corner and this is the spot I take all my friends. The salsa they put on the tables for the chips is probably one of the best I have ever had. The service is amazing, bartenders are super nice too. This place is so friendly and they also have bucket of beers which is a first I have found in the city thus far.
author: Krista R.

description:
Great bar... even better burrito, especially after cursing on the Mexican Party Bus (and if you don't know what that is, yelp it up).  

Even though it's in the sunset, I would go back.  It's just the kind of bar I like - a regular bar with drinks and good food.  Bring some fun people, or people who become fun when they drink, and your all set. 

Due to my MPB inebriation, I did try to wrap of half of my burrito and bring it home... I do not recommend this.
author: Brittney B.

description:
$2 tacos and tecate tuesdays?  automatic 5 stars.

bartenders are super cool too.
author: Jude G.

description: Had one of the worst experiences here... Tried to enjoy a beer with some friends and some local/regular guy named Marcello who all the bartenders favored Damn near got us kicked out And to his colleague named Brad kept instigating and provoking dude to keep starting stuff with us and talking his smack!! Lame. Seriously how old are you?? Only best part is when I asked to close out the tab for my boy... The bartender cleared the tab and comped it for all the trouble we experienced. Good customer service I guess once you heard our side of it before knowing your facts
author: Tiffani L.

description:
My bf and I have come in a few times to catch an NFL game, bloody mary and a breakfast burrito.  Waitresses have always been cool, and at least when we came in, the patrons too.  Saw a mom in a patriot's hat offer to buy a packer's jersey-wearing mom a beer if she would share her half-gallon of milk for her tot (beer was refused, milk was poured). Shared a table with an easy-going single guy (place was packed). 

Burrito not SF-style huge as your head, but a decent sized portion.  Chips and salsa good, tho I am tex-mex kinda girl and prefer salsa on the side.

Bloody mary's come with a huge stalk of celery, lemon, lime, olive (yum) but could really use some worcestershire or soy sauce, although the bartender gave my bf a shot glass of steak sauce to add to our drinks for free with a smile.  

Apparently I haven't met douche-bag Nick, but will continue to return as long as service stays friendly!
author: jen t.

description:
Underdog's is a Sports Bar, which serves Nick's Tacos. Nick believes in slow food, fast, which I guess I love.  I don't take part in the slow movement so much, as it is really meat heavy. Unless we are talking about cooking dinner in my apartment. My old roommate Vanessa said I am a great cook, but damn, she can't wait two hours to eat. 
I went to Underdog's on a whim with some friends, as one of them knew the bartender and therefore we'd get 'hooked up'.  Whatevs.  I love drinking and I love tacos. I could tell I was gonna like the food as soon as our chips and salsa came.  SO COLORFUL AND FRESH! I mean, really? In a bar? I was not expecting this.
I ordered the vegetarian tacos, which come Nick's Way, as in a crispy corn tortilla wrapped in a soft flour tortilla.  YES AND YES.
I went again today, as I like to hit that place up after shivering my ass off at Ocean Beach. I mean, I always tend to get some color, which is why I go, but that wind chill I could do without. 
Taco Salad.  SO AMAZING. The best part is that it is a vegan entree, so I don't have to waste time asking for no cheese, no sour cream, and then stress out it's going to come with those condiments anyway. Cilantro Lime vinaigrette? Done. Fresh tomatoes and delicious guacamole? Done. The best part, other than how it tastes, is that it doesn't come in a heavy, fried tortilla shell-the part of the salad I always try to abstain from and then demolish in 30 seconds flat.  Nope. Instead they decoratively top the salad with tortilla spears. Since I am no fun, I'm getting the salad without those next time. 
Two dollar Tecates at Happy Hour.  
The first time I went to Underdog's, my other friend informed me of a second Underdog's up the street (different place of business completely). Second Underdog's serves sausages and has an extensive vegan menu! Plus it's organic. So after gorging on chips, salsa and tacos, I found room in my stomach for a vegan sausage.  And then went home and made seitan.  It's not like I'm a marathon runner-I cannot explain this appetite. 
Go to the beach and then treat yourself right at The Taco Shop At Underdog's. It's tiring trying to keep warm/drinking all afternoon on the sand. Believe me, I know. But if you go to the beach with your friend's kid, who happens to be under two years old, this might not be the best place. It's one thing on an average day, but if it's game day, this place can get pretty bro -y. Someone might yell, "Kids in a bar, great idea' at you.  Dislike.
author: Jenny B.

description: Best tacos I have had in the city so far!! And super cheap, so that's a huge plus.  Even the house margarita was great.  They did not skimp on the guacamole, in fact, you could barely even see the taco underneath the guacamole, which is absolutely perfect in my opinion!
author: Madison M.

description: My favorite place to watch the game. It can be busy, but that is because it is such a great restaurant. The Margaritas are delicious, street tacos are yummy and the staff is friendly. The bar has many TV's and there are games for kids and adults to play. I really enjoy this spot!!!
author: Justin D.

description:
YAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Nick's Crispy Tacos without all the Marina Thug Life and eau de rouge toilette!

as usual love both the red and green salsa, the messican corn, the tantalizing chips and salsa...and fer crying out loud iam a sucker for beers in a bucket =)

dope as hell service with a smile and yes pigtails girl is a cutie- thx for sharing that will all yelp eugey!!!!

the genius part of new mgmt is bringing in a basketball supershot machine that cost them around $4-5K, yet they make easily $500 a night...and I have yet to see how much more peeps play this thing after 10pm.

none of you will beat my girl jen d's score-86!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  believe!  

oh yeah, warriors SUCK!!!!
come out and watch them lose ; P
http://www.evite.com/pages/invite/viewInvite.jsp?event=OCOZPLOWKFXOSCVWGXUD
author: omar b.

description:
The bar itself is a little divey, but not too divey. Just has a pretty awesome comfortable vibe to it. There are a wide variety of types of people that frequent it as well, which I like. When I do go, I try to coincide with a Giants game, because it'll always be on, and it's always nice to be around other fans. Though it can get a bit busy, I can usually find a place to put my booty.

The bartenders are super awesome and attentive. It's nice when it's not too crazy and you actually get a chance to talk to them, I've really only had a chance to talk to some of the guys and all of them are super awesome. In my experience, like at most bars, girl bartenders tend to show a bit more attention to guys more than girls, but I get it, $$.. but regardless, all the girls have been super sweet to me as well. 

But, I suppose the real reason I come here.. is because at least once every week or 2, I crave the food. The tacos (Nicks way) are amazing. The nachos, amazing. The chips and salsa and guac, amazing. And I just discovered the pescado style burrito, amazingx10.. and the red creamy homemade hot sauce they make.. I swear I could drink it out of the bottle. So delicious. 

Mm.. Too bad it's 10:36 in the morning or I'd walk down there right now..
author: Nikkol K.

description: Love everything Underdog's has to offer.  Margaritas are strong and tasty, food is delicious, people are friendly, and the game is always on.  I recommend sitting at the bar- your glass will never be empty!
author: sara b.

description:
Best American tacos!

A friend and I recently visited Underdogs during the weekend because we were hungry; craving a beer or two, and it was suggested to try their tacos.  So we went!
