From the outside Underdogs  appeared to look like a small sports bar while the inside appeared more attractive with flat screens on the walls, a few old-old school games, and decorative flags and banners of local teams.  The crowd itself ranged from families, sport addicts, college students, and drunks.  

Now for the food!  Affordable and tasty!  Where can you find American Tacos that are affordable and tasty?  Jack and the Crack, that doesn't count!!!  Really, I enjoyed it and I detest American tacos.  I highly recommend their SALSA and GUACAMOLE (that's some fresh good guacamole), which is cheap, and their tacos particularly their CHICKEN TACOS.  Service is a little slow though.

They serve PABST BLUE RIBBON 24 ounces...$4 bucks!!!  Tacos and PBR....4 stars!
author: romeo b.

description:
Nick's Way Taco- Fresh, tasty, and big!
Although it is... $4.00. Probably one of the best taco's I've ever had.

Even though it isn't great for my budget but its prettty goood!

Try it!
author: Tony C.

description:
Go Warriors! Kick some Maverick Grannie Panties!

This is not your ordinary sports bar, it is the girly of a sports bar. Extremely clean and extremely nice. It's like a brand new shirt you would wear and never wash. Crisp, fresh, and hot!  

Here, you will find over a handful of HDTV Plasma TV with great food and service. There are limited seating during sports games so plan to be there early. 

However, there needs more draft beer selection, some sticky floors and maybe some hot eyecandy to look at. Give it a hint of B.O. and I'm there.
author: Stanley K.

description:
I would give this place one less star because the service was really bad tonight.  Monday night football and Nick's crispy tacos is the perfect combination.

Ordered a glass of water and the guy gives it to another person 2 stools down.  I asked the same guy for water again and then he takes the water away from the woman and then gives it to me.(funny)

I ordered four tacos..........split amongst the three of us.  I see the same waiter with our tacos walk right pass us.  Walks back to us a few minutes later and gave it to us.(not funny and getting a little irritated)  There are little stands with numbers that tells the waiter where the order goes.

My friend comes in a little later and orders two tacos himself.  The same waiter walks right pass us again and gives it to another customer.  I had enough.  I told the manager, Dan, this is getting ridiculous.  He sees the problem and orders another two tacos for us.  Dan said the waiter gave it to the wrong table.( we kinda figured that out)  Our order comes out again and the same waiter brings it back down to the same table he already served, so we practically had to tackle him to get our food.  No apologies..........nothing..........just gave us the tacos and it was the wrong order.  We ordered two crispy tacos and got two regular tacos.  My friend was starving so he just ate it.(irritated now)

My brother comes in and orders two tacos and I told the manager.........I want you and only you to place the order and bring us the food.  He placed the order and jokingly pass by with our order pretending to give it to another customer. ( I would have bitch slapped him so bad.........he just don't know!!!!)

We would've stayed here a little longer but we were all just a little irritated but satisfied with the food.

Here's why I gave them 5 stars.   The food is actually 6 stars!!!  It is that good.  I would have to say they have the best tacos in the sunset district hands down.  This is what we ordered.

4 pescado(battered fish) tacos (all tacos comes with fresh limes and cilantro)
3 carne asada tacos (all the food are made with fresh ingredients.......you can tell)
1 chicken taco (very light and refreshing......they pack this taco)
sweet white corn on the cob.  It is laced with Parmesan cheese, sour cream, and cayenne. ( sounded weird but this was the bomb)
chicken quesadilla

They have two different sauces.  A red salsa and a Verde(green sauce)

My brother ordered two more tacos to go for his wife................It was that good.  This is the first time I went to a bar and my food bill was more expensive than my alcohol bill.

A definite must!!!!!  You don't need to go to the mission anymore to have great Mexican food.  It's right underneath your nose here in the Sunset District.
author: jason g.

description:
After my first full year of yelping, I am quite astonished by the amount and variety of locations I have reviewed. For the most part I am very content on most of the star ratings I have passed out on my reviews. But on occasion, there is a location or two where I look back and say... man I really wanted to give this place an extra star... or I know this place is rocking, but I must of hit this place on an off night.

Underdog's is one of those joints that fall into that catergory of "what ifs". What if I was here when the crowd was bumping? What if I was here when the drinks were stiff? What if I was here when the music was just right?

I see the potential. The generous amounts of tasty free nachos and salsa. The bustling crowd mingling on an early autumn evening. And a hilarious trip across the street for a drunken pizza run at 2 in the morning.

Alas, I must holster that extra star till my next visit. The mixed drinks were way too light and the live folksy music was not my bag... baby. The crowd was a nice mix, but the bar started to empty out after the Red Sox, Angels game.

At the end, I left with a slight buzz and a plate full of woulda, coulda, shoulda.... Thank you for Yelp... where I can empty my plate. And thank you for review updates, because I know I will be returning here soon.
author: Sam T.

description:
If every neighborhood in the city each had a sports bar with a Taco Shop featuring Nick's Crispy Tacos, the city would be a better place.

They've got the good Modelo, and I've had killer fresh margs too. They got the good TV's, and there are things for your eyes to wander to if your not even feeling the sports. And thats just the bar. The Taco's are the kicker.
All of the mexican flavors offered are solid, from the Nacho's to the Burritos, but I love hitting the fresh fish taco's, nick's way, covered with the guac, epic. Grilled is great, Baja is great super tasty.
Such a good spot for such a low key place in an area typically dominated by various Asian cuisines.  Awesome all around.
author: Adam S.

description:
I've been here a few times now, mostly during the week after work.  This place is great!  

Food: Nick's Way tacos are super filling and delicious, chock full of delicious filling.  The baja fish tacos were good.  Their order of nachos is gi-NOR-mous and definitely worthwhile for a few hungry folks.  

Service: Attentive and friendly each and every time.

Venue: There are games to play in the back, the bathrooms (very important to us girls) are clean, and kids seem to be welcome and look like they enjoy themselves.  The multiple flatscreens with hockey, basketball, golf, SportsCenter, what-have-you, make this a desirable place to grab some beers and watch the game with some friends.
author: Imelda M.

description:
Personal note: The best way to get more stars on a Yelp review is to provide excellent service. The Taco Shop and Underdog's definitely delivered in that respect. 

After some grocery shopping in the area, we stopped by here to pick up a late dinner. I'm not sure what it would be like during a game, but it had a great laid-back vibe for a place that is ostensibly a sports bar. There are quite a few TVs spread out around the place, so I was able to watch them play highlights of Tebow-time during the latest comeback vs. the Bears while waiting for my order to come out. The guy behind the counter was awesome. When we walked up to order, he was really friendly and seemed like he actually cared when he asked how we were doing. We order a Baja (fish) burrito and a carne asada taco Nick's way. Food took about 10-15 minutes to come out, which was fine because it gave me some time to enjoy a Green Flash IPA. I've only gotten take-out from this place, but will try to come for a game soon. They have some benches toward the back that will accommodate bigger groups. 

Now for the food. Sadly, I can only say that it was good, but not quite as good as the original Nick's. The fish burrito is stuffed with some pieces of fried fish and cabbage. While the flavor was very good and the fish was well-fried, the thing was kind of lightweight. Pretty much just the fish, some cabbage, and some salsa wrapped in a big tortilla. The carne asada taco was really good, though, topped with big gobs of guacamole, and stuffed to the gills with tender bits of carne asada. 

Seems like a cool sports bar and with good food, that's a W in my book.
author: Saunders C.

description:
So far I've been here twice, both times on Taco Tuesdays during the NBA Playoffs. After having the Nick's Way tacos at the original Nick's Crispy Tacos, the $1 tacos at Underdog's could hardly compare. I guess if you're going for something a little healthier it's ok? The place was crowded because of playoffs, but that's a given. Overall great vibe and good food/beer!

*Warning: I ordered the fish taco Nick's Way my second time here and didn't realize that, unlike Nick's Crispy Tacos, Underdog's doesn't say anything about ordering tacos without mayo (there are no signs and mayo isn't listed in the menu). My taco had mayo and I lost my appetite. They were great about getting me a second taco on the house, but by then I just wanted to enjoy my beer and the game(s).
author: Diana Y.

description:
I heart Underdogs.  A introduced me to Underdogs about a month ago.  I can't for the life of me remember which taco I ordered, but I ordered it Nick's Way and it was really good.  I'll probably never forget my first Underdogs experience because A, who ordered the street tacos, wanted me to try one of his, which I did.  He somehow forgot that he had drenched it with habanero sauce and I absolutely cannot take spicy AT ALL.  All I can say is, wow.  Spicy.

I came back with Tony L. last week for my second visit and decided to order the street tacos.  Smaller than a regular taco, but you get three!  They were really good.  Tony L. only put a drop or two of habanero sauce in his tacos but said it was plenty hot enough.  I learned my lesson the first time.  No habanero sauce for me!
author: Kris L.

description: Stick to the Baja fish taco. Tasty, moist, done right never dried. Hands down the best Baja Taco in the city.
author: Brent W.

description:
A year later and this place hasn't lost its stride. The house margarita is now $6.50, but it's a fine fine drink. My favorite food item is still the carnitas taco.

I couldn't care less about the NFL, but I do love to come here once in a while on Sunday mornings while a friend of mine watches his beloved Steelers. It's my excuse to have Underdog's fantastic pint-sized Bloody Marys.
author: Eating Sleeping T.

description: This review is so overdue...This has been one of my favorite bar spots since I have been here. Everyone who works there is always friendly and laid back. You get to watch all the games..basketball, baseball, and football are my favorites, and they have the sweetest basketball shoot game that I LOVE to play. Ohh and tacos with french fries in them...come on.
author: KatieRae A.

description:
4.5 / 5, but I rounded up

Sports bar near 19th and Lincoln, with a kitchen in the back

Bar and some picnic benches and chairs in the back

Crowded on Sundays for football

Happy hour 

The food:
Nick's style tacos are the fixture, but I recommend the entire menu for basic mexican american food  ~$4 each

I've had all the tacos - all pretty good

if you're brave, try the habanero sauce, ask Nick

can be drippy / greasy
 
parking hassle
author: peter l.

description:
Although I have been here a few times already, I finally decided to write a review.
A friend and I decided to drop by for a drink or two, snacks, and to just talk and unwind from our recent Tahoe trip. 
I didn't try her raspberry cosmo but my washington apple was good. it was mixed fairly well. 
We ordered garlic fries and I thought it would be a really small batch but it was actually a decent sized order! The 2 of us didn't even finish it but I think I would have on any normal night. Our fries were extra crispy because they were deep fried longer so even though they sat there while the two of us talked the night away, they stayed crunchy on the outside! Yum. 
Service here is great. The bartenders are friendly and helpful...I think it's already been said a million times about the big screens and the paint so I won't mention it again but I think this place will definitely become a local hangout for my social group.

UPDATE: I noticed that a few people have noted the generally Asian customers and one white chick complained about feeling out of place. I've been here multiple times now, and there are actually a few white bartenders here. Actually, the last time I went, my server was a white chick. It was also a mixed crowd when I was there..

I don't work here, i'm not friends with the owner, I just like this place and i'm supporting it.
author: Susy C.

description:
My hubby and I were so excited to find out about good Mexican in the sunset.....then we realized Nick of Nicks crispy tacos was in the sunset and we were fit to be tied! Then.....well, lets just say once we ate at underdogs, tasted the fresh fish, partook of the TDF pork and slurped our yummy margaritas we were basely orgasmic.

The tacos are beyond. 

Even better I've developed a habit of stopping on after work, about 6:30, and having a margarita and a taco salad--no chips because a ladies got to watch her waistline--its  a rare but beautiful thing when a lady finds a bar she can hang in alone and this is it. say hey to nick if you go in. He is a good, good man. 

The staff rocks.
author: Ellen S.

description:
Where else is there in the Sunset that you get a bunch of plasmas with almost all the sports channels, cool staff, cheap beer, and it's clean?  I didn't know it existed until Aaron I. swore by this place and suggested we see the Warriors make the playoffs there.  I was suprised big time!  

Good variety of food, ie. Crispy Chicken Nuggets and Nachos!  They also have specials like tacos and have mainstays on their menu such as loco moco and spam matsubi.  I don't know if it was a special, but the pitchers of beer were like $11.  The place was so packed that thanks to Euge L. and co., we (Aaron I., Omar B. and Sumit S.) were able to squeeze in on his table.  

Underdog's will be part of my rotation of places to watch a game over some man sodas!  Go Warriors!
author: Jason A.

description:
Looking for a bar to take your kids to? No, really...The picnic tables in the back are great for family dining and the tacos and guacamole are some of the best I've had in SF (Yes, that includes the Mission.)

Great joint! Say hi to Nick (the owner) when you stop by.
author: Baron L.

description:
hmm...well since the questionable review history of many of the previous underdogs reviewers has already been touched on, for this review friends, i'd like to take a look at the "sports bar" status of underdogs.

When you step into a sports bar, you want to be immersed in that warm, old sneaker feel of somewhat cheesy sports pictures/memorabilia from the good old days of football when your dad was still in diapers...or something like that. Ahh, the smell? yeah, that would be the spilled beer and nachos....you want to feel comfortable to lay your sports-loving paunch on the bar, and order a frosty adult beverage and just watch the freakin' game. 

Well imagine my friends, that you're in Starbucks- minus the baristas, plus a beer selection- and you get Underdogs. Saccharine pastel painted interior? Check. Copiously frilly wreaths with big bows on for Christmas everywhere? Check. Lack of almost any sports memorabilia? Check. So squeaky clean you are probably consider red a "guest" not a customer. It feels just too clean, just a little too PC- maybe with time it'll break in well. Extra points for good beer selection, but the net is _not_ sports bar material.
author: Tim V.

description:
Go for Tacos - Nick makes delicious tacos makes me want to scream tacorganismica!

After one of those crazy days, I met up with a friend for drinks and tried the infamous tacos at Underdogs. The tacos are as good as they get - fresh ingredients and the hot sauce is out of this world. Fish was super fresh! If it ain't, I would've swollen up like a blow fish. Steak taco was so good - reminds me of Mona in castro(closed) back in the days. A must have at Underdogs - CORN!!!! This one is better than the ones at Obon festival! corn with parmesan cheese, butter and cayan pepper sounds gross but it is delish!

Service is getting better so I would def visit again and try other things on the menu.

SKIP: potsticks! the garlic sauce is extremely pungent. Got pulled over after underdogs once and get away with a fix ticket. The cop only smelled the garlic in my breath. guess it's a good thing (?!) since I didn't have to kiss anyone that night.
author: Stefanie Y.

description:
What a great place. the staff was super friendly. the food was very good. And the ambiance is nice, full of flat screen tvs, some games....

I would go back for sure
author: Fabiana H.

description:
Been here a number of times because some of my favorite game watching company lives around the corner. It's a nice little bar, and very accommodating to sports fans. My pros and cons:

Pros
*While the bar isn't particularly large, they've got a ton of nice HD TV's. I've never counted, but there's enough to accommodate numerous games and I've never seen someone leave because there wasn't a set to show their game.

*They've got all the sports packages, so as a general rule they can show your game, even if its obscure. The staff also knows how to actually work their remotes, which is not always the case at sports bars (go figure).

*The owners are nice as all get out, very friendly and treat their regular customers very well-- always a plus.

*While the bar isn't stocked with the obscure spirits I enjoy they do have a good sampling from the major distributors. I'm not a huge beer fan so I can't really comment, but its my impression they have an OK, but not amazing selection. They do have fat tire, though, which is always a reasonable beer fall back.

*The drink prices aren't bad.

*The food is pretty decent, and decently priced by sports bar standards. The menu also offers some choices beyond the typical fried sports bar crap, including some hawaiian plates and noodles. Not amazing stuff, but you're not really there for fine dining, you know?

*The bar is clean as all get out. Seriously, its almost weird how clean it is.

Cons
*The space isn't huge, so it can get crowded. Not sure there's a lot they can do about this, but it can be annoying. Ditto the terrible parking situation in the area.

*Remember how I said it was clean? It's like, REALLY clean. To the point of being sort of sterile. They've been working on the decor, but it could still use a little help.

*Some of the drunk dudes I've encountered here really don't get the meaning of "go away".

In sum, if you want a place to watch a game in the Sunset, Underdogs is a good bet.
author: Catherine H.

description:
Great customer service! The owner, Nick, was friendly, quick and helpful. Not only did he recommend some great food, he also spent a few minutes shoo tin' the shit with me. I like when establishments make the business/customer relationship personal, and as the owner, he led a great example.

Get the Fish taco! The chicken had more flavor than the carne asada and the carnitas, but they were all good.

His sauces are ALL BOMB! 

Typically I'm very frugal, but I had no problem spending $15.50 (with tax) for a beer, a fish taco and a 3 street taco's. All said and done, they deserved the good tip and I was happy with what I got.
author: Bryce A.

description:
Taco Tuesdays = Windy Wednesdays.

POOT.
author: Albert B.

description: This place is ok as a restaurant but better as a bar. The tacos are good but they are nothing to rave about. Once you get your taco loaded they come out to around $6 each and are just ok. I like coming here as a bar more then a restaurant.
author: Darius A.

description:
Ok so I wish I could give more stars because the service and food at this place in the Sunset was about to get clowned by me if they sucked!! Well I'm glad to say that they didn't. The service was exceptional and the food was equally as delish. I'll be a loyal customer with them for years I hope. 

The chips and salsa were great and the salsas and sauces were out of this world. The staff was friendly and cool. 

My only complaint would be that I paid $10.00 for a Cadillac Margarita and the bartender was I think new made a crappy attempt at this. He didn't ask me for any salt and when I asked him for some he flew right by me. The drink was hella WEAK but the other bartender made me another one and it was AWESOME. Also the crowd on Taco Tuesdays, is a bit douchie...it's a lot of college kids which isn't a problem since I used to be one but they are allowed and obnoxious. I've gone 3 times and the crowd has been the same on Tuesdays. On other days the crowd is chill and real sf natives. 

The owner is exceptional and nice and nice on the eyes. Try it you'll love it and grab a Margarita and some beer you'll be straight. Oh yeah I forgot they have AWESOME tv's...huge flat screens with great clarity.
author: Spa G.

description:
"86" loves Underdog's. 
"86" loves all the big shiny flat screens.
"86" loves the carnitas quesadilla. LOVES IT!
"86" loves the grilled corn. 
"86" loves the buckets of beer. 

But most of all, "86" loves that she got a higher score than all of her male counterparts on the free throw game, and at one point, several of the bar patrons were cheering her on and giving her high fives when she obtained the high score. 

"86" loves this bar. She will be back. Often.
author: Jen D.

description:
Somehow I find myself at Underdogs at least once a week... if not more... its not because I like to drink... its because I like a chill place to drink.

Taco Tuesdays at Underdogs has become a weekly ritual for my roommates and I.  The case of the Tuesdays (or Mondays, Wednesdays, Thursdays, etc...) can be cured here pretty quickly with $1 tacos and a bucket of Tecate.  We're in college so this fits perfect in our price range.. aka CHEAP.
The bartenders here are super chill, and so is the co-owner Nick.  Its pretty normal on a Friday to get free shots with staff.

The place is packed all the time now, so it can be fun to hang out here.. or not.. like when all the L.A. fans hang out, and act underage.  

Anyway, I love the street tacos, I normally get one of each on Tuesdays, I had a pollo taco "Nick's Way" the other night... and it was amazing.  The chips and salsa here are also delicious, something about the chips that are just like no other.  

I like coming to this place because the staff is amazing and its the best sports bar in the sunset.
author: Jaclyn O.

description:
amazing place! love the layout, the bar is huge, service is great and the food is superb! their habanero sauce is off the chain! 

chips: crispy and had lots of fresh salsa on top
carne asada quesadilla: meaty and juicy!
pescado "baja" style & grilled fish tacos: juicy and delicious

definitely will come back to try more tacos and burritos! will also tell more friends about this place! it would also be a dream come true for me to come here for the taco tuesdays! one of these days hopefully :)
author: Tina N.

description: Big tacos on the cheap.  Check out those photos!  Loaded with guac = awesome.  Park table/bench seating towards the back, smaller tables dot along the side of the bar/restaurant.  Seems like it'd be a cool place to watch sports or even partake in one (basketball hoop game in the back).  Even tho it was semi crowded on a Friday night, the waitstaff was quite attentive and two different folks made sure we were ok.  Can't say so much for the second time around sitting at the bar.  Bartenders took a while to pour us drinks.  I'll let that slide though because my beer was quite delicious and this place does tacos right!
author: Dan P.

description:
If you haven't been to Underdogs in the past few months, it's time to stop by.

The menu has been completely revamped. All of the fried, typical "bar food" items are a thing of the past. What you will find now is fresh quesadillas, tacos, burritos, tortillas soup, salad and roasted corn. Everything is super fresh and incredibly delicious. The chicken and beef are local organic. 

Try the pollo taco "Nick's Way" - holy smoke, that's a good meal! Loaded with cheese, beans, pico de gallo, guacamole and tender shredded white meat. amazing amazing AHHHHHHHHHmazing.

We drive from the panhandle to sample the menu here - even with papalote and green chile kitchen within walking distance (both of which are good in their own right... but not as awesome as Underdogs)

This place won't stay a secret for long.
author: Melissa J.

description:
LOVE the tacos Nick's way- crispy and delicious! As many reviews before me have emphasized, the pescado nicks way is seriously to die for. But no matter what your choice is (I've also had the carne asada and the pollo, which are pretty good alternatives), these are not small little tacos- the tacos def come with what's promised on the menu, and these babies will fill you up. 
While I do like the chips and salsa, my favorite starter is the Elote con Queso. For $3.50, you get the most flavorful fresh corn on the cob you could ask for. Seems pretty pricey, but most people probably could never season it that way. 
The vibe is borderline sports bar/dive bar meets a taqueria, with a bar, picnic table seating, little arcade games in the corner, etc. If you are looking for a really chill place to hang with your buddies and watch sports while eating really great mexican food, this is the place! 
The bartenders and the waiters/waitresses are what makes this place a five star restaurant for me. Even when understaffed, they really try their best keep things moving and to get your order in on time. You can also watch many sporting events of your interest... this one woman wanted to watch some random bowling tournament, so the bartender tuned into some obscure channel for her (next to a March Madness game). Correct me if I'm wrong, but I think that's pretty quality service. 
it honestly beats most other taquerias in that it still maintains some of that Mexican authenticity while adding its own twist to the food and the restaurant in general.
author: Guri G.

description:
Ok no 5 stars cuz the chips are really salty had 1-3 chips that were like rolled in salt .

But other than that I love the tacos.and the service is quick and friendly

The trick to eating tacos is downing 1-2 drinks with some buddies and then ordering the grilled or beer battered fish tacos. 

However i am not too big of a fan for teh chicken and carnitas tacos. I will try the nachos next time though.

I try to come here every week if time permits, 

from my experience i noticed that when Nick makes the tacos they are soooooo gude.
But the last time i went someone else made the tacos and it didnt taste that good, not sure y.

ne hows

i will be back and always bring new friends here.
author: DOM d.

description: Fairly good mexican food at this bar a few blocks away from our house.
author: Roman I.

description:
Underdogs actually changed owners and changed their name to "The Taco Shop at Underdogs". The place looks way nicer after remodeling. Big screen TVs in front of the bar so it's great for watching any Games.

Great happy hour place!! Tacos are definitely something you want to get with your drinks, along with their crispy, warm chips with salsa. Mmmm!
author: Nancy N.

description:
When I first moved to SF from good ol Wisco.. I spent many a summer afternoon at Underdogs watching the Brewers play ball. I usually went by myself, and always made friends there.. whether it was the cute guy sitting next to me or the friendly bartenders who are always smiling. 

THEN the unimaginable happened... Underdogs took in an AMAZING tacqueria ! Seriously.. this gives new meaning to taco Tuesday.. Why?? I was reminded of my love for underdogs this past Tuesday... they have the best 2 dollar tacos you will get anywhere, buckets of tecate, and super shots... does it get any better? 

Underdogs is my home away from the Midwest and only loses the 5th star because the owner is a Michigan fan.. seriously.. GO BADGERS!
author: Hailey P.

description: The server who served us today was extremely nice.  Loved her and the services here but I have to give it a 3 star because we ordered 2 Baja Style fish taco Nick's way.  The crispy taco and the fried fish was not crispy at all.  It was soft and soggy and we ordered for eat-in, not togo and it was half the size from the taco shop on Polk Street.  It was a small fish taco and paying $1 extra to make it Nick's way wasn't worth it.  We also ordered the Elote con Queso (corn), it was delish so we decided to order one togo but the togo order was half the order of a corn.  It's like the chef cut it into 3 pieces and saved a piece to himself or something.  Lesson learned never to order togo.
author: C W.

description: Last year on a trip to San Francisco, my boyfriend and I picked this place to watch the super bowl. Before arriving we were worried about being in a jam packed place with no where to sit and enjoy. Well, this place delivered.  We luckily got a great spot at the bar after waiting a few minutes and remained there the whole game, eating great tacos,  drinking cold beer and participating in the game pools. We had a great time and cant wait to come back here for the next super bowl!
author: Joanna T.

description:
After ballin' at the gym with my buddies, whole body is sore. Need food now. Oh, BSU vs. TCU is on too! That's a need The Taco Shop can handle. 

Sarah took our orders tonight again, caught up on NYE. All I'm going to say is that we all survived, woot woot! She's an awesome gal so we all love it when we're kicking at her table. 

Ordered:
*SF Burrito, with carne asada
     +Holy flapjacks, the tortilla was money! 
     +Beans weren't too dry, good texture
     +Steak was grilled with juices intact, YUM...

BSU ended up winning the game on a ridiculous interception. Preponderance of blue and orange fans in the house! Dayum I can't wait to go back there!
author: Chuck N.

description:
Having a 42" TV at home I don't find the need to go out to sports bars much anymore. I'm a college football fanatic so I'd just as soon get my fix at home where I can watch in peace and flip channels to my heart's content.

I have to say though, that I may have found a new home away from home when the time comes. Situation: want to watch a game Saturday but it's not on broadcast or cable here locally. 

Solution: Go to Kezar pub! Ugh. Walked in and stayed for all of 2 minutes as we couldn't even stand anywhere without someone bumping into us or knocking us over with a chair or waitresses constantly walking by "excuse me."

New solution: Go to Underdog Sports Bar! There we walked in and had a table to ourselves. They even handed us the remote so we could control the volume and flip channels if we wanted.

Nick, previously of Nick's Crispy's Tacos, has set up here. You won't find the usual pub grub here. It's all Mexican food. Get a grilled fish taco or the Carne Asada quesadilla. They're big and incredibly delicious. 

They have plenty of TVs, they aren't as busy as Kezar, good food, and more importantly... not that many people really seem to know about the place. 

Make sure you check out the bathroom bulletin board. It's worth a few extra minutes of your time. 

I'm going to try and get my friends to go back for 50 cent margaritas on Friday.
author: keith h.

description: I've tried about 75% of the menu here and everything I've had has been great.  They also have your standard selection of beers at very reasonable prices which goes well with the food.  Favorites include the fish tacos Nick's way, the salad and the tortilla soup.  The downside is that it does get crowded, especially when there's a game.
author: Karen T.

description:
Gotta love some of the negative reviews.  Yes, you're entitled to your oppinions but some of them are straight oppinions.  "...tailored towards the asian crowd.." umm, I walk in here and I do not see fish tanks, asian characters, noodles, or whatever it is that attracts "asians" into a place.  Pretty uneducated oppinion in my view because when you first walk in, I see a sports bar with a long bar, seating for big groups and small groups, tons of TVs, and sports memorabilia.  Don't see 1 specific team being promoted, don't see no signs of a specific "race" it's trying to pull in, don't see 1 specific "gender" or "sexual orientation" if you really must go that far.  Better quote for that person might be, "Don't go to SF because it's tailored towards asians".

The place looks like a sports bar and not highlighting a single team or sport--well, dont see a lot of soccer stuff or other sports memorabilia but i'm guessing that's what the owner wanted.

The reviews that were supposedly left by "friends" are probably a good thing because that means the place is not boring, empty, and limited and if you can't get your friends to like the place, imagine trying to get strangers to like it. Those are probably good friends but I'm sure most places use friends for reviews.  I'll admit, I got to know the owner and now I'm a friend and I bring in some co-workers and other friends to the place sometimes.

Food is decent, haven't tried all the items on the menu and i'm not going to give the place a bad or good review based on that.  I pose a question to all you reviewers, "Have you tried all the alcohol behind the bar and the drinks the place mixes?"  "How about the food, have you tried all of them?"  I'm guessing no--I know I haven't so I'm not going to give a full review of that.  I like the nachos and the popcorn chicken.  I also like it when I order a pitcher of something and they tell me that "that beer isn't cold yet".  At least they're looking out for me.  I'd rather have them tell me that than give me semi warm beer just to get a sale.  I can understand cuz that place was hopping for Super Bowl when I was there.

My only gripe with the place is parking.  Sucks looking for a parking spot in the area, but I can't blame that on the bar, it's just location. Most places I visit downtown--hell, most places in SF have no parking but it's because of the area not the actual restaurant/bar's fault.  

I've visited the place more than a handful of times and I've seen asians, caucasians, afro/blacks, hell I even see filipinos in there.  I think the bar has added some business to the area as well.  I know I eat pizza, vietnamese, and get starbucks sometimes before, during, and after i go there.

Overall, I say this is a good place to drop by and watch games, drink a few things, and eat a few things, and hang out with friends.  NAME ME ANOTHER SPORTS BAR IN THE AREA that is;
1) as big
2) as lively (mostly weekends)
3) has the same if not more TVs (these aren't the tube TVs btw people)
4) shows PPV sports without charging at the door
5) has friendly staff
6) and Hell! As clean (but it is still new, so it might change)

If you find a place, post it here and I'll gladly check that place out and put up a review.
author: Chekmate M.

description:
I went there to try the nachos, have a beer, and watch the Giants not score any runs.  They didn't have Anchor Steam.  I thought it was illegal to not have Anchor Steam in a bar in San Francisco.  It isn't.  But it should be a law.

They have lots of flatscreens which makes it great for watching the game.  There is also a pop-a-shot in the back.  I love that game.  The nachos were OK.  Full review here:

http://nachos.posterous.com/the-taco-stand-at-underdogs

I was still hungry after so I had a quesadilla too which was pretty good.  Overall, I would definitely watch the game here, alas without drinking any Anchor Steams.  But I would order tacos instead of the nachos.
author: Jake A.

description:
Underdog's looked awesome to watch some Sunday Night Football with a daily happy hour til 7 and 50" screens all over the place, according to the website.

When I sit down I ask what the happy hour special was and I hear "No happy hour on sundays." ok well the website was wrong there I guess.
"Ok, well I will take a Sierra, please."
"Only bottles tonight, the drafts aren't working." barkeep replied.
Well shit! no draft beer for my cowboy game huh?
ok a $2 miller will suffice and some chicken strips and chips and salsa. the chips were stale and the chicken was a little funky.
The TV screens were pretty sick and the bartender stayed chill throughout the night. 

I went and got a double chocolate chip frappucino from starbucks next door in the 4th quarter and the bartender said "you want me to put in anything in there for you?"
"hells yeah! some rum in here would be awesome!"
wow what a  cool guy, making up for no good beer.
wrong!
when we got our bill, he charged me 2 bucks each for the 2 shots he put in my frap.
whatever.
Ill find somewhere else to watch my sunday night football.
author: liz c.

description:
If you know Nick's Crispy Tacos, then you know to come to this place.  Nick is now at Underdogs and the food is even better.  For those of you who don't know, there is no better taco for the money.  

And the location at Underdog's is great -- the waitstaff is as pleasant as they come (they even turned on the Wyoming - Air Force game for me) and the decor (new wooden picnic tables) make this a place where you can (and should) take the entire family.  I did.

Bottom line -- a real coup for the Sunset.
author: Jonathan P.

description: Gottta hand it too em.  They got away from serving tacos without anything Mexican about it at all.  Had the Baja Style Fish Taco done Nicks Way and it was very good.  Kept asking myself where does the crunch come from when its a soft tortilla.  Turns out it has a hard tortilla as well.  Washed it down with a ($12.50) pitcher of IPA while briefly watching the March Madness games.  A great sports bar with lots of TV and old video arcade games.  Definitley a happening spot in the Sunset.  Too bad it was nothing sunny about that day but the Fish Tacos is definitely one of the best.
author: Quang T.

description: I came in to ask if they have the 49ers schedule.  This asshole that was standing behind the counter then ask me what am I going to give him?  I think this guy is probably the owners friend.  He was not working or anything.  i ask him because i thought he could help.  He told me what i'm going to give him.  I just ask a yes or no question.  Becare who u talk that stand behind the bar.
author: John F.

description:
round four...quick...where next?.....mysterious calling...."there's no need to fear, underdog is here!"....sign looking like spike...from tom and jerry.....the bulldog....you know...jerry's friend..tyke's father....*shaking head*....gleaming and spotless....sports bar with food...long narrow setup....bar always hand reach away....screens always close...enough of writing review ....continue on with richmond pub crawl....quick..."bar stewardess!...three chilled jagermeister shots".....gulps and out....where next?

earlier dinner hour arrival...munch on carne asada quesadilla the fattest filling option and choice...a nick's crispy taco favorite and same here...or a fat hard soft taco loaded max nick's way....chips and salsa, or chips and guacamole....snack or a meal with beer six packs to share (or alone)....
author: Hen A.

description:
OMG !!!! The best crispy soft tacos I've ever had.  Everytime when I go to a mexican joint, I would always order a burrito or enchiladas. Never really was a taco fan until I had Nick's Crispy tacos. 
OMG!! I llove the tacos which is called Nick's Way.  And the pico is amazing. Portions of the taco is huge too. Even though they charge for chips and salsa, it is still worth it. what can go wrong with 1.50 ? I just love how it is pico de gallo for the salsa, not the watery salsa they have at Chevy's. Sorry Chevy's fans.  But yes even though this is also a bar joint, you can still have alcohol and soak it up with some awesome yummy tacos. 
-Sabrina
author: Sabrina L.

description: I've always had great food and drinks here.  It helps a lot that they seem to always have plenty of hard-working staff here that are very attentive.  The selection of available sports games on the monitors is excellent.
author: David H.

description:
I've eaten here three times.  The first was a take out order.  Amazing.  The second two times, we decided to sit down inside.  The food was still amazing, but not one time, but on two separate occasions, they completely forgot to give us the second part of our order.  The second time it happened, the girl just chose to ignore us as we walked out after waiting for half an hour.

Unfortunately, I feel like giving three stars is almost too generous because of the terrible service we received twice in a row.  If the food were anything less than fantastic, I would.  My recommendation, just get take out so that you can be very happy with what you get.
author: Keenan O.

description: I have never had a good experience at Nicks.  The servers are jerks and terrible, the place will be basically empty and you won't get served.  This most recent time I was there with friends for happy hour, we got our check and I let the server know we were over charged only by a drink or two.  The asshole literally laughed, said it was just a check, and looked at the person behind the bar and smiled.  So he correct (was still off by a drink) the check and I went to pay for the check to a different girl behind the counter was just as worst.  Did the asshole get a tip? Not a chance and I'm sure he will bitch about it until he leaves.  I'd be embarrassed to have people like that working for me.  We had ask before hand to split the check and he responded with I will just bring the check.  Absolutely ridiculous.  We were over charged and treated shitty.  The food is ok but the service at both location is absolutely terrible.  I would never recommend this place to anyone.   My roommate has also order the california burrito on multiple locations, was finally convinced to try the cheeseburger burrito and said it sucked.  Terrible serve for suggesting a bad burrito.  And since that has been told multiple times to try the cheeseburger burrito.  We get it, you like the cheese burger burrito but he does not so STOP suggesting it.
author: Wes D.

description:
I'm sad to say it, but I probably won't ever come back here again.  

I stopped by with my girlfriend and roommate on Saturday, 10/9/2010 at around 7 PM.  We all shared some chips with salsa and had a few beers.  Within 8 to 36 hours, we all became violently ill.  Not just any kind of sick mind you, I'm talking about a tub-girl-meets-the-Bellagio-Fountains kind of sick.

This was the only meal we all shared in the past 72 hours.  I'm assuming it was the tomatoes and/or someone's unwashed hands.

Minus 4 stars for that alone.  Minus 1 more if I could for overpriced food and the retirement of taco tuesday.
author: John D.

description:
I can't say I'm a huge fan of Nick's Crispy Tacos on Polk but Nick's more recent establishment is deff a hit in my book! Love the space (think cozy dive bar); the people - warm & friendly; uhhh and the food!! OMG the tacos BOMB! But even more B-O-M-B are the chips and salsa. The chips and salsa are to D-I-E for! Yum, yum, yummo! Oh not to mention, Nick, the owner, was rocking a Blue Bear School of Music shirt, my kind of guy!  :)

Overall, if you haven't to The Taco Shop at Underdog's check it out! I know, I'll be back for shizzle :)
author: Kat R.

description:
great place to hang out after a hard day at work.

I usually come here to watch the golden state warriors lose, but I can't complain because of the booze and food. The arcade basketball in the back is pretty entertaining enough. While i enjoy my food, I get to watch their cooks and waiters score a 100+ on the machine when I can barely break 50. 

my default is the california burrito, which consists of pico de gallo, carne asada and french fries neatly rolled in a tortilla. i'm also a fan of their hard (no homo) crunchy chips and salsa with a dollop of guacamole. 
 
But first timers I suggest getting the "baja style fish tacos, nicks way". 
If you're really hungry eat two, but one is a large enough serving to go along with your cerveza of choice.

Tecate's are always 3 bucks, but if you're with a bunch of friends i suggest the bucket of 6 beers for 15 bucks. buy 5 get 1 free! 

The only problem I have with this place is that the service can be a little slow on busy days, but the waiters also double up as bartenders so I guess that might be the hold up. 

All in all, a great place to chill and eat some good mexican food.

enjoy!
author: Rommel P.

description:
UFC Saturday night!!! Place filled up quick... Tim Silvia finally got TOOK!
Fish and chips come golden brown with 31/2 big pieces! Nachos are friggin huge... soo big you cant even see the chips anymore!  Pitcher of AmstelLight $15... pretty hot bartenders.  
This place was a sushi Karaoke bar that went downhill...
Now, they are newly remodeled witha  fully stocked bar, clean bartop, 3-4 long tables for groups to chill in the back.. and the best part is that the bathroom is clean! no pissin troff  with ice in it...
author: JASON L.

description:
I went to Underdog's Sports Bar because of Capitalism!! That's right, Comcast was holding a football game I wanted to watch hostage unless I ponied up some hard-earned cashish. So I got all revolutionary on them and did what all great revolutionaries do when they want to get all up and revolutionary: I hit the bar. That's where revolts are born...amongst other things. Plus I'd heard about Underdog's and was cravin' some Nick's Tacos. 

Found a seat and ordered a pint and a couple of tacos. Food took a while and being there on my own, feeling a mix of revolutionary, wall flowerish, and non-confrontational, decided not to get all up in Nick's grill about my tacos taking their own sweet time to arrive. That turned out to be the right move because if things don't work out, the good bartenders at Underdog's have a simple solution: ..... ply you with alcohol until you can't stand. I mean who would miss a couple of tacos after several shots of bourbon, a Tecate, two pints and another "I'm sorry shot" just to make you feel at home. I haven't been that sedated since my Tonsillectomy. Got service with a smile when the taco showed, but who cares about two lil' ol' tacos when yer fallen off the bar stool all drunk off yer ass. That said, what Revolutionary could conduct a proper revolution falling off said bar stool. 

Fun joint, though next time I'd rather have my tacos in a timely manner than a bunch of free shots that will get me feelin' like frat boy on Friday night.
author: Johnny C.

description:
Great tacos -  Nick's way - it comes with 2 tortillas - one crispy and one soft on the outside. Love the concept of a taco shop and a bar mixed.

The service was way too attentive though. There were 3 different servers coming by every 30 seconds. Nice if you need something every few seconds - but very annoying if you want to enjoy yourself. (-1 star).  

If you just want food - I'd suggest just taking the food to-go.
author: Chili B.

description:
I cant believe that I havent written a review for this place yet....as it is freaking amazing!!!! 
So...Taco lovers might know Nicks Tacos. Well, this place is owned by Nick from Nicks tacos....meaning....Nicks Tacos sucks and Underdogs is uber delicious success taco activation! 
Lets start with the basics...
The chips and salsa are amazing. There is a pico that comes on the chips, and you get two squirt bottles of a green and red salsa. Both are tasty and delicious with a good amount of spicy. 
Tacos: I have had the veggie taco, the baja fish, the shrimp......all well super delicious with great quality ingredients. My favorite is the veggie....jam packed full of deliciousness inside one crispy and one soft tortilla. mmmm. take me to heaven. 
Oh...i also HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend the corn on the cob. It comes with this delicious cheese and cayenne pepper all over it and it is soooo good I dont share. I eat it all by myself....and then spend the next half hour with corn in my teeth but you know what....its worth it

Also, the service here is amazing. It really is. I use a lot of napkins during Taco Time and there is always someone walking by to pick those up and throw em away, refill a drink ect ect 

One Important Note: If you plan on going, ask yourself....is this a big SF game night? because if it is it will be crowded, rowdy and fun!!!!!! (with much slower service, obviously)
author: Yuliya R.

description: Let me get down on two baskets of chips and salsa with guac and some house margaritas. I will be confident enough to challenge you to a game of hoops, where I will lose terribly, but happily. Service is iffy. Bathrooms have funny graffiti. Hard to find a table if there's a good game on, but that's to be expected.
author: k h.

description:
For god's sake, don't order it to go. They fold and smash it up so it fits in a little bag and don't seem to follow special requests all that well.

They still deserve 4 stars because the food is good. The pescado taco is great - tasty, nicely battered fish - execept there's some weird creamy sauce, possibly mixed w/ the cabbage, that isn't specified on the menu.  A $4.50 tack Nick's Way is plenty filling and tasty! I haven't tried a burrito, but hope to soon.
author: lynn t.

description: The tacos at Underdog's are delicious and huge!! They're not the typical small street tacos. The shell overflows with amazing goodness. Get there early because the place gets packed and there won't be any place to sit.
author: Michaela M.

description: I have been here 3 times in the past week. A little ridiculous, but I tried it out last week and have loved it ever since. I always get the same thing-- Baja fish tacos Nick's way. Amazing! Also tried my friend's carne asada taco, Nick's way of course, and it was also really good. I also love the pitchers of margaritas :) Can get busy, but I've always been able to find a table (the 3 times I've been here).
author: Florence A.

description: Very interesting place. It's a bar, with a decent Mexican fast food outlet. The chips & salsa you pay for are really good, served in a plastic and paper lined basket. We had the grilled fish tacos Nicks style and a grilled shrimp Nicks style. The fish was outstanding. The shrimp wasn't as good. The drink prices are $4.00 (well) and the Tecate and shot for $6.00 is a solid deal. The salsas in the squeeze bottles on the table, especially the roasted tomato are kick ass good. Get there early for a parking place and table. Great tacos.
author: David L.

description: Best tacos I've ever had. The carnitas Nick's way were to die for. We also had the guacamole and the salsa which were also so good. I loved how fresh everything was and afterwards I didn't feel like I ate anything too salty or processed. Would recommend this place to others and I will definitely be returning again!
author: Penny V.

description: As a followup, they did finally reach out to me. I was informed that they did look into the situation and they did consider what happened to be a very serious problem. They also assured me that they did make appropriate changes to ensure something like this didn't happen again. I have agreed to give them another shot, because seriously, I have been here several other times and experienced nothing but awesome food. I will take a leap of good faith and hope that this was a one time event.
author: James L.

description: Best tacos in town, with plenty of good beer to chase them down with.  Nick's way is always king, giving you everything you want in a delicious crispy fish taco.  It's also a great place to catch a game, but make sure you get there early if there's a bunch of you.  It gets crowded quickly and people stick around for a few pitchers to finish out ball games.
author: Nick M.

description:
Awesome neighborhood place to grab some cheap and really good tacos, good beer on tap, and friendly staff.  

It's my primary spot to go after work when I don't feel like going straight home.  I figure it's socially acceptable to drink alone if I'm also eating food and watching tv!

The staff is fun to talk to and I've met some cool people sitting on the bar stools next to me.

The carne asada taco is so yummy!  I can eat and drink for hours, I go just to grab a bite and usually end up staying awhile; and my tab has never been more than $30 with tip ( and I can consume a lot of tacos and beer!!  So that's a really good deal)
author: Allison H.

description: Order your tacos here Nicks way. You get crunch and soft heaven in one taco. I USED to think this was a 4 star place but lately the quality has been going a bit downhill. Service AND food. Although it been disappointing lately, I would still return if I was in the neighborhood and felt like having a taco or their delicious corn with contija cheese but I wouldn't go out of my way to head over here.
author: Angela P.

description:
Went back to Underdog's recently and was initially a little bummed to see that they no longer served the Hawaiian food that I had enjoyed so much...  Nick's Crispy Taco's quickly quashed any disappointment however... Those are some yummy-ass tacos!

They seem to have improved their beer selection somewhat too. Underdog's just keeps getting better!
author: Brian H.

description:
Cool spot to get tacos, hang out with friends, and watch the game. Really fast service, Good food (recommend get "Nick's Way"), and pretty cheap. 

Overall, good spot and I can see myself being a regular here.
author: julia n.

description:
I like the tacos they serve here.  That guy Nick will occasionally appear and talk to you to make sure everything is alright with your order and the bar service.

Unfortunately, however, this place isn't the most fun place to watch a game.  It gets crowded very quickly, and there isn't enough seating.

During the Lakers-Magic NBA Finals, for instance, I would stop by here on my way home from work, but it was so crowded and unaccomodating that I ended up just going across the street and watching a quarter or two at Irving Pizza.

I think they would do well to put bleacher seats in against one of the walls facing the screens, like the Golden Bear in Oakland used to have.  That way they could seat more people for big events like the NBA Finals.
author: Gopal R.

description:
So a group of us came by here to watch the Lakers playoff basketball over at this sports bar/taco shop.  It's very clean, and we were greeted by a waitress.  We pretty much just self-sat at the bar in front of the flat screen TV.  The service is fairly fast at the bar even though there were a lot of people.  The food came out quickly as well as.

I had the grilled fish taco Nick's way, and I wasn't impressed.  Apparently, Nick likes his taco with too much guacamole and salsa where you cannot even taste the fish.. or even know its there.  The ingredients were indeed fresh, so no complaints there.  I did like the soft corn tortilla with the crispy tortilla which made this taco try and be like an upscale version of the double decker from Taco Bell.  But I don't think it's good enough for me to come back and pay $8 for 2 tacos when I can get some that taste better from the Mission.

food is fresh, place is clean, but fish taco might as well be just guacamole between tortilla
service is great
parking is there if you circle around once depending on the time of the day
author: John D.

description: Local friend took us here after Nightlife at the Academy of Science. He recommend I get the Fish Taco Nicks Way. Sold.... While we waited we chilled at the bar and enjoyed ice cold Tecate =) --- took a while for tacos and burrito's but I'm spoiled from living in San Diego and taco shops are fast there. It's more of a bar scene serving Mexi... the fish in the taco was HUGE and all the topping were awesome! The salsa is amazing!! Roased chiles, ton's of flavor!! Yummy!! I almost went back for lunch today but made myself try something new. Probably be back here though. It's a cool spot, around the corner from my friend's place. =) Yay!
author: Amber F.

description:
FINALLY!! this is the closest thing to a taqueria on irving street!   well theres taco bell but that doesnt count. ugh. taco bell. shits gross. anyways,  i tried the fish taco. and it was actually pretty good!    

FYI, they have taco tuesdays. starts at 6pm and ends wheneverr they run out of tortillas. they also have $0.50 margaritas on  fridays.  thank god i only work 2 blocks away. i can just walk my  happy ass over here, have a taco, have a drink, AND watch basketball games! jealous? you should be. what more can a girl ask for. 


taco shop + sports bar = me likey!
author: B B.

description:
Went for taco tuesday and ate all three tacos - steak, pork, chicken.  They were good, the pork being the best.  The server brought a red sauce and a green sauce, both very good.  Everything on the was just good...not great.  Still, for $1 each, it was worth it.

I will note that the sangria I ordered was a kicker.  It was tall and good enough to get the job done.  ;)

It got super busy.  With one server for the entire floor, things got a bit crazy for her. Definitely wouldn't hurt to have more servers.
author: Stella K.

description:
On game day, what else do you need but cold beverages, big flat screen tvs, and tacos nick's way?

Their nachos are AWESOME, and you really can't go wrong with your tacos as long as you get them Nick's Way.  Our favorites are the baja fish tacos and the carne asada tacos.

All things considered, actually prefer this place over Nick's Crispy Tacos on Polk.
author: RICOLE P.

description: Awesome Awesome Awesome! Everything about this place rocks! Great bar, fun back area with picnic tables and old school games, awesomes beers on tap and tacos and mexican food that is always prepared with care and tastes better than great! Craving a baja style fish taco Nick's way right now! (And, PS, Waaaay kid friendly!!!) Hey Nick, please open for lunch again on the weekdays?!
author: Yodel A.

description: Great place but if you dont like sports then dont come here on a game night because people get rowdy. Try the tacos, they are way better than the burritos.
author: Mikhail K.

description:
Honestly after a mexican make over this place is so so so so awesome at all levels! Any kind of event , either sports, parties, celebrations, and the deals are great. Big fan of their margarita fridays. 

I actually had my birthday here this year and they went all out to give a birthday taco with candles around it. Quite the awesome place. You have benches, stools,. chairs and possibly every drink you can think of. 

The food is awesomely priced. My favorites are the fish burrito, chicken quesidillas, and their nacho dishes are to die for.
author: Peter L.

description: I know I'm just looking for the wrong thing in the wrong place here, but as it's the only "taco" place in my neighborhood it was a bit of a let down.  Americanized Mexican fare, but still - tastes just fine.  Also not the best beer selection.  Pretty noisy spot, but it's fun to hit up with a group of friends.  Can't imagine heading in on my own, personally, but that's just me.  Coworkers of mine rave about the place, so maybe I just need to give it another try!  (HINTHINT, YOU GUYS, TAKE ME WITH YOU)
author: Elise M.

description: If you ever find yourself in SF to visit you must go to UNDER DOGS i lived around that area so i would walk there all the time the place is great real clean and you have to try "NICKS WAY TACOS" do good and the green chili sauce that they give you on point. happy hour is always poppin' and everyone is real friendly
author: Veronica S.

description:
Tried this place upon the insistence of two friends who live nearby.  Being a native San Franciscan and growing up in the outer Sunset, I had never really noticed anything of interest on that block except for the Starbucks.  After eating there the first time, I called this place "the place where White people hang out in the outer Sunset."

I was extremely happy with the Baja Fish taco (Nick's way) that I ordered another one and a couple of margaritas.  I had been back probably 5 or so times after that, catching NBA playoffs, etc in good company despite really slow service.

I had also stumbled upon Nick's Crispy Tacos on Broadway to find that they had the exact (original) same menu...that place was a madhouse with a line going out the door but the food was better with larger portions that at Underdog's.

I went to Underdog's last night and ordered the Baja fish burrito to find that it was half the size of the one at the original Nick's for the same price ($8.50).  Very disappointing and unsatisfactory for that much money.  I assume the tacos are of the same quality and quantity but if you're seeking the best food experience, I'd recommend venturing out to Broadway.
author: Carter Y.

description:
The Taco Shop is amazing! I work a block away and have to restrain myself from going every day (I did not intend that to rhyme)!  Such good tacos, burritos and their quesadillas are yummy and mammoth. 

The only thing I have gotten from here that wasn't 100% delish was their Taco Salad I got to-go - but that was mainly because they serve in a chinese style take-out container and everything just collected at the bottom.  I am sure it is much better if you eat in and get it in a proper bowl. 

All this talk about The Taco Shop...I am salivating and might go get it for lunch now!
author: Carolyn Y.

description:
I have friends who come here every Friday, since forever. I live in the Mission and will come to Underdog's for tacos. The cripsy shell, chunks of guacamole and perfectly spiced meaty fillings make these tacos one of the tastiest and filling tacos I've ever had. 

50 cent margaritas are always fun on a Friday night. There's always a cute guy obliviously shooting hoops for decent eye candy.
author: Mona M.

description:
I was conflicted. I contemplated giving this place a bad review on the basis of not wanting folks to start flooding this place and taking away "my" bar. But based on all the times I've been here it would be lame (and unethical) to do so to such a great place. It's strictly a Taco Shop now (they used to serve a larger variety of food), which I don't mind at all because the "Nick's Way" tacos are delicious. My only critique about the tacos is that they are VERY generous with the salsa.

The drinks are reasonably priced and they offer a lot of different specials like $2 Tecates and $.50 Margaritas. I do recommend getting there early if you intend on watching a sporting event because there aren't too many seats available. It's a great place for sports since there's 4 hi-def flatscreens right at the bar.

I kind of want this place to remain the underdog, but given the bang-for-the-buck experience here I don't know how long that will be the case.
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
Went here to watch the Bears get CRUSHED by the Packers today, pleasantly surprised they had Nick's Crispy Tacos. The food is tasty, they had a bunch of picnic tables set up so you could share a table if there weren't enough seats (it's easier to ask someone if you can share a picnic table than share their table I think). The waitress was nice, and I didn't think the service was slow for a sports bar on a Sunday

My ONLY complaint was there were two sets of parents in there with their KIDS! UNDER 10 years old each. It's a sports bar, not a restaurant that serves drinks. I'm not morally against kids in bars (I actually haven't given it much thought before today), but I just don't want to hear kids whining about playing Ms. Pac-Man while I'm trying to watch sports on a Sunday. They've gotta get more strict about that.......
author: Carson H.

description:
This place is perfect for watching UFC. Absolutely perfect! Underdogs came highly recommended by friends that attended UCSF and love the San Diego UFC experience. The food is really good, the bartenders were AWESOME. Get a Bloody Mary from Jaime (cute little Filipina) she does them perfectly with a great kick. I had 3! 

Can't wait 'til I make it to San Francisco for my second time. I'll definitely be back.
author: Hillary C.

description:
My husband is a taco lover so we can here a few weeks ago. The environment is pretty chill. We sat at the picnic tables near the back section. I got a chicken taco. It was was good BUT imo overpriced for their size/quality. If I came back, it would on taco Tuesdays when they're $2.

Note: you can't bring your Teaway in!
author: S H.

description:
Whoa.  How have I never written a review for this place?  I used to go to Nick's all the time when I lived in Nob Hill and addicted to tacos Nick's way.  A foodie friend of mine recommended Taco Shop at Underdogs and told me the original owner (who sold Nick's?) had opened this place and it was better than the original.  Wha?  How can any tacos be better than Nick's?

Fast forward 1 year.  When Nick's came out with the Yelp deal for tacos, the line got especially long, so I remembered what my friend said, searched Taco Shop, drove to Taco Shop and was amazed to find tacos, ambiance, and service waaay better than Nick's.  So, am I convinced now that I've found the best tacos and this is as good as it gets?  Yes!

Food here tastes really fresh, service is super friendly, and prices are reasonable.  It's a sports bar (awesome) so it's crowded on game days.  And every item on the menu is good here.  It is my go-to Mexican.
author: Trinh N.

description:
The tacos are amazing! Great service, good prices, mellow atmosphere for a sports bar.

If you want to relax, put a few back, and fill your belly with delicious tacos- go no further.
author: Diana H.

description: I love this place! They have the best tacos, all kinds of sports playing on the TV and beer galore! It gets pretty crowded, but it's definitely a fun place if that's what you're in the mood for.
author: Lia B.

description: Lovely Taco/Sports Bar. Super friendly staff and great atmosphere!
author: Michelle G.

description: This bar is unique in many ways. It's a vibrant sports bar within a quiet neighborhood with a fair amount of parking AND they take credit cards! The crowd there is always fun and active. Also the Men's bathroom has rather "interesting"  magazine cut outs in the them. If this doesn't warrant a high rating, you my friend are a communist. God Bless America.
author: Napoleon C.

description:
The carnitas tacos are soooo good. Lots of guacamole which is always a plus and their chips and salsa are yummy fresh. 

Plus on Friday they have 50 cent margaritas from 6-6:30... buy like 6 and your set for awhile.
author: Lauren B.

description:
This place is really great!

After trolling around the city for a couple of years, I'd had a great deal of trouble finding a place where I actually liked going to watch a game.  Nothing was quite right.  Either the tv's were too small, or the atmosphere wasn't quite right, or the food was weak.  Everything was just a bit off from my ideal sports bar environment.

Then a friend brought me to Underdogs.  I love this sports bar.  What's good about it:
-large tv's everywhere
-the bartenders know how to operate the tv's (common sports bar problem)
-the staff is really great
-The chicken nacho's are the best (I make special trips out there to get them)
-People go there specifically to watch sports, so the environment is right
-Normally a good group of people in there.

I could probably go on, by you get the point.  I really like this place and I drive half way across the city to go there.
author: doug s.

description: This place has the best mexican-american food in the western half of san francisco. Street style tacos, Nicks Tacos, Burritos, the Corn, etc. It is all good. The Prices are good. The wait staff are very friendly. I wish i lived in the apartment upstairs.
author: Martin P.

description:
Taco Tuesdays - Always packed so come early!

FYI, come with the entire group to make sure you get a table.

Came here early to sit, chill, have a drink and wait for my friends to come since I live closeby anyways. But it is way to packed to have a whole table to myself. Had to surrender the table, but I understand, they have business to do. Nick was pretty cool though, asked nicely. Found a smaller table as my friends arrived so I guess everything worked out.

On my to-try list is Nick's Crispy Taco. Asked Nick about it, and to my surprise, he recommended it the regular way. Told me it was overkill with Nick's way. I considered his recommendation but I just had to have it Nick's way. Love my cheese and guacamole. Pretty damn good.

Dollar street tacos? Bang for your buck for sure! Choice of Carne Asada, Carnita and Pollo.

Not a bad way to spend a Tuesday night, watching multiple sports and multiple tvs.

Good times.
author: Jimmy N.

description: Amazing delicious fresh food! good drink deals and a very fun environment, also the wait staff is very accommodating and helpful!
author: Jasmine F.

description: Nicks Crispy Tacos = Awesome. Not only is the food tasty but it's a fun atmosphere. There were guys playing the Hotshot Basketball game while we were there and they thought they were killing it...then the cook comes out from the kitchen with a towel on his shoulder and proceeded to double there score and walk back into the kitchen...it was pretty amazing.
author: Justin P.

description:
I really like places with Pitchers of beer and this is one place that does.  So I've now been here a couple of times.  The first time was for a Fantasy Draft.  Alot of TVs and the bartendar was really cool.  

The Nachos were stacked decently high.  And it is pretty clean as some people have mentioned on here as opposed to some other bars.  But they are still relatively new so we will see if that's still the case in a couple years.    

For sure, will be coming here off and on either to catch a game or just to hang out....  

HAPPY HOUR DEETS: (M - F until 7p)
Imports 
Pints $3
Pitchers $12

Domestic
Pints $2
Pitchers $9
author: Mark W.

description: I've driven by this place a million times and wanted to stop by, but never did. I was bored, so I decided to take a walk down here and grab a beer and a snack. The service is good, attentive staff that offer service with a smile. They ran out of Stella that night, so I had a nice big glass of Guinness with an order of street tacos. I thought the tacos were good. They were filled with so much meat that half of it fell out of the tacos, so I threw it into the chip basket and made my own nachos.
author: Adelina W.

description:
- The 5 stars is for the crispy fish tacos. they are done so well that i couldn't honestly tell you to go anywhere else.

- This taco is the king of fish tacos in San Francisco

- on a rainy day in the city ride out to this place, get your college football on, order a couple of beers and then dig in to the taco
author: Eric J.

description: Awesome burritos! So juicy and saucy. Also got a watermelon agua fresca which was lovely alongside this mouthful of deliciousness. Cannot wait to try a breakfast burrito or some fish tacos.
author: Monica D.

description: Being a loyal customer, coming here at least every 8 days, recommending this spot to all my friends who visit, I was actually disappointed with the service during the Friday night special! First of all, the virgin margarita just doesn't cut it, don't make a drink a happy hour special when you are only pipetting one drop of alcohol into the drink and filling the rest up with magarita mix or lime/agave and ice. Ok, seriously, the happy hour timeframe is a mere 30mins, do you really need to skim on the booze?!  And then the service during this time is exceptionally rude. I don't need a tall bartender to tell me what I can and cannot order.Just honor your specials with a genuine smile. =) If we can't order more than 1 drink at a time, just say so, insteading of "NO!!!" with so much anger!
author: Leeseuh K.

description: Came here after Nightlife at the Ca academy of science. This place was busy. But we got a table. Right away server came by and greeted us and took our drink order. After our drinks came, we ordered the fish taco, carne asada taco and burrito, Ca burrito and the elote. The fish taco sure hit the spot. They were filled with a whole lot of guacamole. Definitely a plus because other places are stingy with their guacamole. the elote never came out and they gave us a discount on one of our drinks. I would highly recommend coming to this joint. Great food and Drinks and great service!!
author: Gordon C.

description: Tasty tasty!  This is starting to become my favorite after work hang outs!  Good food, good booze, great happy hour prices... im sold!
author: Evan O.

description:
20 mins to get a table in the back. 
30 mins to get someone to take my order
20 more mins to get someone else to clear off the stuff that was left on it from previous people.
30 more mins to get our order
a lil ridic no?
the food wasnt great this time either but i always leave really really full even though the burritos arent big... the must put some magic in there. 

other times ive come here was okay. i like it when its not busy.

also, soemtimes i get the chips and salsa free, other time gotta pay.
what gives?
author: just k.

description: Underdog's is a sports bar. A dive. But you'll find some of the most scrumptious tacos in SF here on Irving Street of all places.  If you're into beef or pork, get 'em "Nick's Way." Two tortillas, one deep fried with all the trimmings. Beyond fabulous. If you want fish, go "baja."  These are the best fish tacos we've ever had. A BIG piece of cod, with cabbage and dressing. Just thinking about Underdog's tacos makes me hungry. The ONLY reason I didn't give 6 stars is because their music SUCKS. It's ear-splitting rap garbage. You can't even have a conversation with the person on the bar stool 6 inches away from you. My advice? Class it up a bit Underdog's. Play some classic jazz, some classic rock - and take the volume DOWN. People actually like to have a conversation while they're eating! (Oh my aching ears!)
author: Cody L.

description: Oh man. Total lunch treat. Baja tacos Nick's Way = heaven. Personally, the red sauce is hella better than the green sauce, but that's a debate that has been raging around the office with no sign of slowing down. For some it just depends on the day. Doesn't hurt that they usually have soccer and/or the Giants on.
author: Irina Z.

description: Every Friday from 6-6:30, there are $1 margaritas. And they are amazing. The alcoholic in me asked for a pitcher, but they don't do those. I asked for a four at one time, but they only serve them one at a time. Chugging ensues to get as many in during the half hour. The appetizers and tacos are damn good. The bar is nice to sit at and watch a game. Or randomly find people that went to your high school, as I have. Always fun here. :)
author: Lauren S.

description: great bar in a safe neighborhood.  lots of good beer on tap, decent prices.  Lots of TV's to watch sports.  Good food, street tacos are the bomb, burritos are too big!.  Too bad i missed taco tuesdays where the street tacos are $1 each, so i had to pay $2 each, still worth it!
author: Jason Y.

description: When I was a kid, I used to eat at Taco Bell on the other block all the time. I probably gained a good 10-20 pounds that way... Now I've grown up (or the Outer Sunset has grown up), and I eat at The Taco Shop. I always get a taco and chips and salsa. I thought I'd tire of it, but it's still so good every time. I love the salsas and the guacamole on the tacos. My friends think it's not very authentic. I agree, but who cares when it's so delicious and so close by. Here's to the next 10-20 pounds. May they be filled with fried greasy goodness.
author: Jen Y.

description: this place is ok, i think the tacos are quite small but it does have alot of meat. service is good, nothing exceptional. But overall the enviroment is worthy of other visits
author: barabara b.

description: The sauce is the best.  Great vegetarian tacos.  I love the Pacman game tables.  I love the people.  I love the price.
author: Madigan M.

description:
OVERPRICED BURRIOTS and THEY AUTOMATICALLY CHARGE TAKE-OUT CUSTOMERS 10 CENTS FOR THE BAG WITHOUT BOTHERING TO ASK FIRST.

Being a sports bar you just don't walk in and watch them make your burrito in front of you.  You have to order it and wait around for a while (and sometimes it's very noisy with 20-somethings making more than their share of noise).  And food-wise their choices are limited (for my burrito they only had one type of beans). The burrito I had tasted good. It was also the THE most expensive burrito-to-go I've ever had in San Francisco (they even charge 25 cents extra for a burrito with carne asada).  My simple burrito (no sour cream, no guacamole) came to over $10.50.   

After ordering I looked at my receipt and saw a 10 cent charge for the small bag the burrito was to be placed in.  San Francisco may have forced upon the public the stupid pay-for-your-bag law but this is the FIRST establishment I've been to that doesn't give you a choice and imposes the fee on you as though it is mandatory (in the past my burrito was placed in a tiny brown paper back along with a few very thickly cut chips -- I guess I've been paying the bag fee all along without realizing it).  I told the bar-girl I had my own bag for the burrito and she told me the charge was automatic and couldn't be removed.  When I told her to forget the order and give me my money back someone else working at the bar refunded my dime.  The owner also was interested in the goings-on and I told him the situation and he listened with interest but didn't react when I said I knew his establishment would go on automatically charging their customers bag fees without asking them in advance (I said this several times and several times he had no reaction at all -- that's because the Taco Shot at Underdog's will continue to force the bag fee on unsuspecting customers).  

I finally got my burrito in tinfoil, no bag and no chips.  I took my burrito home with me and this is the final time I visit this establishment.

Supermarkets, department stores and other food establishments don't add on this fee without permission and neither should the Taco Shop.  I wonder it, perhaps, it is illegal to do so.
author: Rudy G.

description:
Uninspired decor. Lack of personality bartenders. Doesn't even feel like a sports bar. Does a few big screens and bits of memorabilia tacked up here and there defiine a sports bar? eh. i beg to differ.

The only perk? Its around the corner from my house and yes they have good nachos. 

They also provide a solace for my BF who gets exiled during football season since apparently they have excellent happy hours.
author: Julie B.
