description: Haven't been here much but I did stop in a couple times that I wanted to check the score on some games while I was in the hood.  Seems like a very acceptable spot to stop in and grab some brews while taking in some sports.  Lots of screens.  Decent selection of beers with a friendly and helpful staff.  Can't complain too much.   Haven't been an ardent customer but the few times I've been here, I haven't been disappointed.
author: dan h.

description: Omg my friend actually introduced me to this place. I loove the california burrito it's too yummy and I really enjoy the salsa oh yeaah :D
author: Julie Z.

description: I used to love the food at this place, but it's not the same anymore.  We stopped going when they started adding oil to stretch the guacamole.    The guacamole, which we loved, now tastes overwhelmingly of cheap olive oil.   And the tacos just aren't the same anymore.   We're disappointed.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Love this place! My boyfriend and I found this place on yelp (and it's on the 7x7 list of things to try before you die!!) Anyways, this is totally going to be our new hangout. Great place to watch the giants game! And they have a great beer and tequila shot special. It's awesome. The food is pretty good. We got chips and salsa, a carne asada quesadilla and the street style tacos trio. It was super yummy!!

The carne asada quesadilla was huge and delicious! The street tacos were pretty good. The best one was the carnitas, followed by the pollo asado, and then the carne asada. A little bit of a disappointment, because I love carne asada tacos, but the quesadilla makes up for it. They also have delicious hot sauces. There's a trio of those too.

Also, they have great beers on tap! It's awesome. Love this place!!
author: Margaret L.

description: I can now have crispy tacos Nick's way near my house!  And Nick's way is the best.  I had the carnitas and the fish tacos.   Plus its in probably the best sports bar in the area.   It does get crowded, and the wait for the food can be long.  So grab a beer, find a TV with your favorite team on, and enjoy your food, Nick's way.
author: Funk G.

description: Nice place to meet up with friends afterwork or on a weekend. I really enjoyed the fresh ingredients in their food and relaxed atmosphere.
author: E.J. H.

description:
I had to work after my boyfriend, his brother-in-law, and I went to an A's game, so they dropped me off at work and then proceeded to this bar b/c it was near my work.  I met up with them after I got off work.

They were pretty drunk, and for good reason.  The bartender was fantastic!  Daniel was totally attentive.  And he announced the end of happy hour, so were able to get in a few more drinks before the price jump.  

And the food.  It's good!!!  We had their popcorn chicken and I had a bite or two or three of my boyfriend's bratwurst (with sauerkraut, yum!).  Daniel brought out ketchup, ranch, buffalo sauce, and honey bbq sauce for the chicken.  Mmmm....  Oh, and there were fries.  Crinkle fries, who doesn't love crinkle fries?

Some peeps near us ordered fish and chips.  It looked really good.  And they had a bunch of take-out orders.  So, the rest must be good, too, right?!

Anyway, we plan on being there to catch some NFL games this fall (how lame is it that Comcast doesn't have an NFL package?!).  And maybe some of the away Cal games.

Last, but not least, the bathrooms are immaculate.  Albeit, the lighting totally unflattering (I refuse to believe that it could be me).

***

UPDATE:  Went here to watch Cal beat Oregon last weekend, and it was full of Cal fans.  Well, maybe not full, but there were probably 20 of us by the end of the game.  But every single person in the bar was cheering for Cal.  That's cool.  And every touchdown was followed by the fight song.  And the victory was followed by the Cal drinking song.  Good times.

But the highlight was the jumbo margarita they gave my friend for her birthday.  So, I mentioned it was my friend's birthday, and they said they'd bring her a drink.  We said another shot of SoCo (her college favorite) would be fine.  They brought her out a margarita that was bigger than her head.  Of course, we helped her with it, but how fantastic was that???  And it was good.

I love them.  Although, I can't recommend the nachos.  Fake nacho cheese and lettuce.  Not that that stopped us from eating them (we didn't finish them, however).

Oh, and one reviewer mentioned they dont' have happy hour on Sundays -- they do now.  Sat, Sun, and Mon it's $2 Miller Lites and $9 pitchers of ML.  Yum.

***

ANOTHER UPDATE:  i wanted a half-order of nachos, but they wouldn't make it.  i was sad.
author: S J.

description: The baja style fish tacos are awesome.  Get it Nick's way.  They heap on giant globs of guacamole and the sauce is great.  The fish is fried just right.  The red salsa is delicious, reminds me of papalote, not too big a fan of the green one.  This would be a good place to watch sports and have beers with good mexican food.
author: Matthew P.

description: A must. Get tacos Nick's Way or be mad at yourself. I ate, eat, will eat carne asada and fried fish.
author: Michael B.

description:
low class, even for a dive bar.
a real shit hole
author: C J.

description: This location is 100000 times better than the other Nick's. Coming here was enlightenment. Clean, spacious, well lit, organized. Everything that other-Nick's is not. Plus you get service! And the food, just as good. I would eat a fried fish taco Nick's way every single day for the rest of my life if I could. It is amazing.
author: Lydia W.

description:
Alright I should have typed out this review, a while back when it was still fresh in my head a month ago but now here I am typing it at 3am in the morning. I remember waiting for Dingo, after he had a short reunion with his family in San Francisco. Myself and the Jakesta, went to this bar and rendezvous with my old friend J. We arrived a bit early and the waiter (who's name escapes me at the moment), asked if we wanted to order any drinks.

Giving it a good minute and a half, I decided to Stellas would go well with the occasion. It was the Lakers and Warriors game, later that night so the locals in the neighborhood would come on by, probably after the work hours are over. The ambiance is quaint, think of it as a mini Cheers bar, stuck on the edge of Chinese influenced Sunset district border. The people we're chill and heavily filled tension in the air for their favorite sports teams going head to head. J and her cohort finally show up, and after subtle introductions followed by acquainting daps, a pitcher of Sierra Nevada came around.

Just then the bartender suggested, ordering more drinks before the end of happy hour and to take a look at the menu. To my surprise Underdog's menu rivals that of the east bay's own Top Dog. One dog, stood out from the rest and I was willing to give my heart another roller coaster ride from hell and back; The Danger Dog. It consisted of a nice mixed meat hot dog, with sunny side up eggs on top of the dog, with nacho cheese....how can you avoid such artery clogging goodness.

The suspense was killing me, the Sierra Nevada nearly gone, and finally my Danger Dog arrives. The bartender, again suggested a dab of chipotle sauce would do my food justice...it did. So hot, gooey, and meaty...words that can be twisted into sexual innuendo...no homo reference like manner can continued to be described. We even added a side of nachos, and a sampler, to fill our group up before the big game on the tube.

The basketball game was epic (Lakers vs. Warriors)...that is until the 4th quarter, which I had to exit stage front, because Dingo was exhausted from his mini-excursion with his aunt. Unfortunately, J and friends had to remind us kindly had we paid our leftover bill of Stella and the rest that had been accounted for. This mix up, sadly dropped the perfect score to four stars. Perhaps after maybe a good 35-40 minutes of discussion with J and the the infamous bartender, it wasn't until he discovered it was his mistake.

All was said and done, and we can go on our merry ways. Hopefully in the future the cashier can keep better track of the receipts, to ensure of quality control. Overall, thanks Underdog for reminding me how much I miss my old school lunches as a kid in grandpa's house....hot dogs and sunny side up eggs.
author: Ryan M.

description: Went here on Taco Tuesday. Got me the "street style" combo. They have $2 Tecate after 4:00pm. Friendly servers and bartenders. Overall a great place to grab some grub. Well be back for sure!
author: Harry Y.

description: Good taco. Nice flavour. Don't need to pay extra for Nick's Way on the fish. The two taco combo is the way to go ($8.50). First come, first serve seating. Also, they show all sports on their screens. They also have a basketball game at the back. May have to try this place one more time before I decide on it.
author: Andrew Y.

description: came in for food and drinks. the entire bar closed soon after, due to an ongoing kitchen issue. the margueritas were good, but i am now hungry and a little drunk. I fear this may be my last review, for i will likely starve within hours.  All i can think of for last words are as such "I should have learned to cook." farewell cruel world.
author: John Paul D.

description: I continue to enjoy this casual hangout for its delicious, above-average tacos. Great options for vegetarians and meat eaters alike. And a full bar to boot.  Don't be intimidated by the fact that its a sports bar, everyone is chill.
author: Mark S.

description:
Everyone always talks about this place so I decided to give it a try.  I felt that all the junk on the walls was tacky and dirty.  The bar service was also very slow.  I literally was seated for about 15 minutes before the tall skinny bartender took my drink order (and it was not busy).  When my fish tacos finally arrived after about another 25 minutes or so, I didn't think they were anything to brag about.  The only thing that made the tacos taste good was the red and green sauce that comes on the side.  Without the sauces they were just bland.  
I noticed the servers seemed to be working a lot harder than the people behind the bar so next time (if there is a next time) I will sit at a table for fast and friendly service.
author: Claire B.

description:
I can't enjoy tacos anywhere else, now that I've been here and had the grilled fish taco Nick's way. There's enough fish, guac, and pico de gallo for two tacos.

The aqua frescas are good, too. And all of those TVs don't hurt, either.
author: D E.

description: BEST TACOS EVER! I like to order one fish and one shrimp. The cabbage is so moist and crunchy, and the shrimps are large and hearty.  I can't eat dairy, so i skip the "Nick's way" (with cheese and a hard/soft shell combo)...but i hear they're great that way.  The guacamole is a must-- chunky, substantial in its portion, and yummy.  I'm also a fan of the table sauces- but ask the staff what's in each, as they're unmarked. Oh... and WOW! The agave margaritas (get a pitcher). Delicious! Not that sickly sweet overly processed crap, but real fresh and light, sweet with a bite- i'd recommend upgrading to the Cazaderos.   The price is steeper than your average taco joint, but the food demonstrates a level of attention that says "this is fresh, this is delicious, and you don't have to worry about any mystery ingredients".   And one more thing- even if you don't give a rat's ass about sports- you can go there for the margaritas and tacos with your best friend and happily ignore everyone all night.
author: Maile H.

description: I work just down the block and more often than not, I end up here after a shift for a quick drink and maybe a Baja fish taco. The tacos are awesome, the chips are to die for and the salsa's always fresh. And the bartenders are awesome. It helps when you have a little bit of a hookup, but since we all work in the same area, we help each other out once in awhile too.
author: Jenna H.

description: First time customer, so went top of the menu and ordered the street tacos (carne asada, carnitas, chicken).  The carnitas were a little dry, but everything else was tasty.  Relaxed environment and great service.  I'll be back.
author: Matt A.

description: I walked in last week go takeout and decided on something simple like tortilla chips with salsa and guacamole. The tortilla chips were hard as rocks!!! HUGE disappointment my jaw hurt for days. They really need to do something about that-worst tortilla chips ever!!! Not worth buying their nachos too if that's the tortilla they use.
author: Jenna P.

description:
I had a great experience here today.  

I really enjoyed the baja fish taco, and the grilled shrimp Nick's style was good as well.  The server/bartender was really great about giving me advice on my order - discouraging me from ordering my baja fish taco Nick's style.  He said, "try it and if you miss the guacamole, order it next time."  It was great advice, the baja fish taco was really great with just some of the salsa that came out of the bottles.  Like other people on this board, my boyfriend and I were split on the salsas.  I really liked the green salsa and he preferred the red.  

A couple of things:
Grilled shrimp tacos are available but not on the menu.  
The combo on menu says to pick any two tacos for $8.50, but if you pick Nick's style tacos, you will be charged extra.  

Nick himself came out to talk to us.  He was really nice and clearly loves what he does.  He talked about opening a fried chicken stall at the farmers' market at the Ferry Building and I, personally, can't wait!  When my boyfriend indicated he was pescaterian, Nick told him sometimes eating everything is greener.  :)

After talking to us for a few minutes, Nick called us foodies and asked us for restaurant suggestions.  I feel like I have arrived, now that Nick from Nick's Tacos asked me what restaurants I like.
author: Amy D.

description: The California Burrito is amazing.  I signed up for Yelp just so I could write about it.  I had it last night and I am still thinking about it.
author: Fritz S.

description: Love the grilled fish tacos. Rice and beans are good too. Nachos are even better. Pretty much haven't ate something here I don't like.
author: Lauren P.

description:
Cool Place to hang out & watch games there...........
and the services is good too.. i enjoy my drinks there..
author: mike l.

description:
So I came to the taco shop for dinner because I wanted some delicious fish tacos. Little did I know that Underdog's was showing the UFC fight - that meant that the bouncer wanted to charge me a cover to eat tacos! I pleaded with him and he finally let my boyfriend in to order tacos so that I could take some home. I was left waiting outside alone on Irving trying not to make awkward eye-contact with the UFC fans who were outside having a smoke. 

Once I finally got home with my tacos, (and away from the UFC fans) I thought the tacos were pretty good - although they were kind of on the pricey side. The fish was of great quality and the tacos were not as crispy as they could be but I think that was because I took them home. Next time I will call to make sure there is not a UFC fight before I go back for tacos.
author: Dana H.

description:
what is the deal with Nick's Way? Nick's Way? Am I eating an ego burrito? I mean, the food was decent, but nothing I'm gonna spray the walls with my quacamole about. Reminiscent of a dive taco shack, but even most Mexican's aren't bragging about battered fish wraps. The margarita's weren't even salted. Gotta say, the complimentary chips were bonus.
Overall, pleasant place to grab a brew and chew, but please change the tude of menu.
author: ryan r.

description: Best Fish Tacos EVER! It does get crowded on Taco Tuesdays or any sporting events but the other times during the weekday are pretty good.
author: Elliot T.

description:
first thing. they take credit cards! YAY!

love the tacos, nachos and quesadillas. seriously, so good, you have to try them all.

its pretty chill to come and get a beer and watch some sports on their tvs. they got some games too if you want to shoot some hoops or something.
author: Natalie B.

description: This is a perfect spot for taco tuesdays, nice and fresh for a buck each and make sure you try the hot red sauce on them if you like them spicy. Tons of tv screens so you can watch sports, and good beer selection. Perfect for some great street tacos and some brews, also a young fun crowd.
author: Chris D.

description:
BEST taco in town...PERIOD!

...and get the carnitas quesadilla (there is FAR more meat than cheese, it's the best quesadilla out there) and ask for the secret homemade habanero hot sauce. YUM!

$2 Tecates, $0.50 (yup! that's 50 cents) margaritas.

Get it!
author: Jeff T.

description:
WOW, fish baja taco.

The fish had no taste, but it was crunchy, and the sauce was like an explosion in your mouth.

The guac is excellent!!! But for an extra dollar, can i please have more than that?  thanks!

Chips are like deep fried in lard or something, they taste really good!
author: kim w.

description:
I have never attempted to order a fish taco in norcal just because, it is something that is frowned down upon.  It is common knowledge that socal reigns supreme.  It is something that goes unquestioned; kind of like you know Chicago makes the best deep dish instead of Rhode Island.  However, I have read nothing but rave reviews about Underdogs, more specifically Nick's Way.  I just prayed this Nick was not a recent inmate and "Nick's Way" was not paying to get my chili ring expunged...you never know...this is San Francisco.

We came here before the Angels and Airwaves concert at the Warfield around happy hour.  They have a pretty common happy hour special: $1 streetstyle tacos and $2 tecates.  My girlfriend and I ordered the Baja fish taco Nick's way and I also ordered a Carnitas Nick's way.   The wait was a tad bit longer than I am used to for the rudimentary making of tacos however, the bar was crowded and the atmosphere was real chill leaving my patience untested.  I had an nice old man to my left and a bodacious babe to my right...that's right, just living the American dream.  This is a sports bar so there are a lot of tv's showign some sort of game.  Yesterday was the Giant's opener and the start of the NCAA title game Butler vs. Duke.  Just know Gordon Hayward, I was rooting for you all along.  The tacos were delivered by a buxom babe.  The presentation was very nice.  These were huge tacos, however, 5.85 for each was pretty steep.  Nick's way is just picca de gallo, guac.  They also give you 2 different hot sauces, one red and green, but they really tasted the same.  Biting into it, the fish was really good.  You can tell this isn't your bottom of the barrel discount fish.  It was crispy yet the taste of fish was still very distinct.  The aroma could only be matched by true organic fish taco if you catch my drift...har har har.  The carnita taco was average.  Because it was Nick's way, there was plenty of flavor, however, the carnitas, which is just braised crispy pork tasted ordinary.  We were still hungry after so we ordered 3 streetstyle tacos: pollo, carne asada, carnitas.  They weren't noteworthy at all with the pollo being the best.  The $1 streetstyle tacos are like ordinary taco truck ones, so they are really small.  You will need about 6 or 7 to be somewhat full.  

The sports bar as a whole was very authentic to its nature.  There is memorabilia everywhere along with the logos of every team and it made me feel at home.  I hope stegosaurusrider will allow me to decorate the living room in a similar fashion. (inside joke to an outside eye..sorry but you were not meant to get it).  It is dimly lit so much of people's attention are on the flat screens.  The crowd is very diverse, especially around the time I went and there are a lot of sport junkies if you want to debate on some trivial matters of why Dirk Nowitzki is so underrated yet is currently these best power foward in the game.  4 stars for the fish tacos...i have to deduct for their less then spectacular other meats.  However, you will feel right at home unless you are a shut-in venturing out for your very first time.  It will be a very nerveracking experience.  If so, engage the bartenders in a convo...they are very chill and will treat you like their own sire.
author: Brian V.

description:
We went there before Nik got involved, and the place was pretty bad. But now that they have some tasty tacos and the like to offer, I think the place is taking a turn for the better.  Hard to go wrong with a taco the Nik way. 

Also a good place to grab a bite before heading into GG park.
author: Matthew F.

description: I went to the Taco Shop the other day right after happy hour ended, the place was decently full.  We ordered shots from the waitress who said they can't legally give us more than 1 shot per person, which never has happened at any bar I have ever been to but not a big deal.  We will take a shot and order another.  The shots take over 10 minutes to arrive then the 2nd set of shots take another 15 minutes to arrive.  The waitress over all was just rude.  We placed an order for some tacos and chips.  The Taco was great and so was the salsa.  Half way thru eating, another waitress sees that our PAPER menus were sitting on the table instead of standing up behind the rack on the table so she reaches over us and places them over while we are eating out food. WTF.  Seems like a great place, but the waitresses ruined my experience.
author: Naresh R.

description: Went here on 6-5-10 evening with my friends, I ordered two anchor steam draft beers, cost is $4.50 per bottle, which is not bad.  My friends ordered the tacos, complimentary freshly made chips/salsa which are pretty good.
author: Jer W.

description: not a fan of sports bars, for Nick's terrific fish tacos, I put up with the noise
author: Pamela K.

description: went back here last week and got some great service! The owner of this spot definitely knows how to keep his customers happy! I recommend going early to beat the rush at 5pm but definitely get the fist tacos!! nicks way!
author: Julio S.

description: I came here to watch the bears play the packers this Sunday.  It was busy and we got the last open table. The food was good and it came really fast considering how packed it was. We all got the Mexican style street tacos ($6 for three).  Drink specials were good,  staff was friendly (but takes plates a little too fast), and the atmosphere was good. We will be back!
author: Jessica J.

description: sports bar with surprisingly good fresh guacamole, tacos, burritos, and elote. maybe not the most authentic Mexican meal of your life, but really really satisfying. plus every game is on, so you'll never get bored.
author: Cody L.

description:
Came here for the NBA Finals 09 - Game 3 - on Taco Tuesdays. It was crowded and it was hard to find a decent place to sit, but patience won my friends and I some seats in the back. 

Underdog's is a cool, chill place to kick back with some friends. The dollar tacos were cool, not too much so you need at least 3-4  to make you full, but yummy with some beer. They come pretty quick too, the minute after Had a wonderful time but with the Magic fans, aka Lakers haters, I was a little torn about whether I had a good time there.
author: Linda N.

description: It's expensive, but the bartenders are friendly and the fish taco nick's way (as everyone else says) is one of the best foods I've ever had!
author: Victor L.

description:
In the end, I remain torn on this place.

Every single one of the dozen baja fish taco I have eaten at Underdog's (Nick's Way) has been 5-stars.  Probably the best fish taco in the city (La Mission in Berkeley is a hair better).

Despite this, I have to say; I loath being in the bar itself.  There is just something weird about the vibe.  

I usuallylike just about any kind of bar.  I like chill  LH bars, trendy downtown bars, hipster mission bars, and even the occasional BD fest at Marina bars.  I do not like THIS bar.  The bar tenders are always nice, the patrons always well-behaved, and the TVs always tuned to good sports.  There's just something that doesn't feel right in here.  

So don't judge me too harsh if I rush in, mow down my two tacos, and high-tail it out the place.
author: Geoff E.

description:
This review is long overdo as I have lived 2 blocks from Underdogs since they opened, changed hands, had good tacos, then crappy tacos. It's true, ever since the recipes of Nick's Crispy Tacos came onto the scene, this place has upped it's game as far as cuisine is concerned. The staff aint so bad itself. It is a place that I can enter where I know everyone is going to say hey and poor my drink before I have to ask. They are a great staff regardless if you are regular or not.
I highly recommend the tacos. The chicken is shredded and moist, so so so so gooood. Excellent Nick's way with the fried tortilla and the soft, along with the guac which is fresh and tasty along with the pico which is to die for!!
My other fav is the carnitas quesadilla. HOLY CRAP is this good! When I am not caring about my caloric intake, this is my choice. The pork is so juicy and flavorful, it's amazing.
When I'm trying to be good, it's all about the shrimp tacos or the salad. The shrimp taco is how it sounds, grilled shrimp with nothing that makes it fatty. The salad is a shredded cabbage, romaine lettuce, black beans, grilled corn, pico de gallo, and guac combo. I choose to nix the chips and dressing because I add their amazing roasted tomato and garlic salsa!

I can't say enough about this place, I'm there a little too often to be quite honest.
author: Sarah M.

description: Great fish Tacos and dressing. Try the Nick style.
author: Jacqueline X.

description: Went to this pretty awesome taco shop with a friend of mine .walked in everyone was smiling having a good time and they have pictures of baseball hall of famers by the tables so I can say I had lunch with babe Ruth in the back was a arcade basketball thing which I will be trying next time  . Super friendly servers and the tacos were super yummy.$6 for lunch not bad at all I also got a margarita which I thought was pretty small but trust me it was worth it I kinda wished it would have come in a margarita glass but whatev. Food was good service was good atmosphere was chill and me and the girls will def be going back for taco Tuesday and other days too of course
author: christina a.

description:
***Updated 11/30/07***

On my first visit here I declared Underdog's a 3-star place that's not much use unless you're here to watch a game.  Then they announced they were doing Brainstormer Pub Quiz here, which gave it a whole new raison d'etre (and a bonus star).

So pub quiz is scheduled for Thursdays at 8, but they seemed to have overlooked a little something called Thursday Night (NFL) Football, which kicks in after Thanksgiving.  The game theoretically ends at 8, but of course it runs over and meanwhile the bar is so packed with roaring fans that there's barely room to breathe.  They assure me pub quiz will start by 8:30.  Still, this is right out of Party Logistics 101: always leave buffer time between two events.  So minus one star.

By 8:30 the game is over and we manage to score a table, but by the time the quizmaster gets everything set up it's 9:00, and in the meantime the bartenders are too busy clearing out all the tabs to take our food orders and some of us are getting grumbly.  So minus another star.

Not exactly an auspicious start to the night, and we're expecting to lose as always, but wonder of wonders we actually won (and that in spite of doing god-awful on the double-points last round).  On the whole, it had to be the most anticlimactic possible win, but still, it earns a bonus point for historical significance if nothing else.  The prize?  $35 in Underdog's bucks.  We used them to pay for our pitchers and then got the hell out, because thanks to the late start it's now midnight on a school night.  So in the end, it was a wash, and Underdog's holds steady at 3 stars.
author: Wes M.

description:
I have been completely satisfied with my experiences at Underdog.

First of all... the baja fish tacos nick's way... yummmmm!  This is one of the best meals I have ever had!  Good size portion, good price, and absolutely delicious!

Second of all... they offer happy hour prices all the time on draft beer for members of the Sports 4 Good league.  It always feels good to save a dollar on a refreshing beverage!
author: Carolyn W.

description:
We arrived 10-15 minutes prior to the Superbowl.  We got a seat alongside the wall.  Some of the things that some people have complained about is what I actually like about this bar. 

1) The restrooms are clean
2) The tables are clean
3) The silverwear served with your food is clean
4) The bartenders actually pay attention to you
5) The beer is good....They have Guinness on DRAFT and DRAFT bottle...YUMMMMMMYYYYY!!! 
6) There aren't as many really annoying out of towners as at some of the sports bars in other areas...

I not only enjoyed a beer (or two...or three..or four...), but snacked on some nachos.  It was a memorable evening spent watching a pretty awesome game.
author: Hiromi N.

description: The tacos are awesome, so I can't give less than four stars. I have to say though that we got huge, ridiculous attitude from the manager or host person for absolutely no reason (we happened to be sitting in the waiting area, oops), and we simply can't go back on principle. Hopefully it was just a bad day for that guy, but in any case we won't be finding out. Going back to polk street from here on out.
author: Mark B.

description:
My boss treated me here for lunch today.
I've never eaten in a bar for lunch so it was definietely a new experience! 
We sat on the highchairs and were facing shelves of random alcohol and  four huge wide screen tv's playing football! Despite all of this, it was still a very peaceful and relaxing lunch (well, we did get there before happy hour).
Apparently, the meals on their menu are only $5 before happy hour starts. I decided to try the teriyaki chicken which came with rice and macoroni salad! The meal was pretty good, not the best but it was satisfying!
The bartender was also very friendly and was very good at making sure our drinks were refilled. She also served us popcorn while we waited for our meal!
Overall, I enjoyed this place and would definitely come back for lunch sometime. Some of the other things they have are hamburgers, chicken/fish/steak tacos, and hot dogs.
author: Miss H K.

description:
3.5 Stars.

Pros:
- It's a really clean sports bar.
- Good selection of menu items, including Hawaiian faves like Spam Musubi and Loco Moco. They also offer pretty good garlic fries!!
- Prices on the drinks and food are decent.
- The wait staff is friendly.
- Draws a mix of students and local Sunset residents; all very friendly.
- They take reservations for big groups if you want to reserve seating for you and your friends to watch a game.

Cons:
- Lord, it's hot in there when it's packed with a lot of people.  The management should spring for some A/C, esp. since it keeps getting more popular.
- They could upgrade on the sound system since it's hard to hear anything really.   (At the very least, switch on the close caption during the half time reports and what not.)
- It's hard to find parking, even in the evening because it's near many popular restaurants in the Sunset.
author: Angela K.

description:
**UPDATE 9/16**
OMG people come here and try the new menu....it's phenomenal! I had the chicken quesadilla & carne asada taco-melted in my mouth.....and I think 40% of the food used is organic...yay! Try the new food!

Underdogs is a fun place to hang out on any day-it's so spacey and damn clean (big plus!). The owners, bar manager, and bartenders are overall really sweet and friendly! They have more beers on draft than bottled-and they also serve TIGER BEER (Yes!!!!)! Their menu is killer-i haven't tried everything yet, but what I've tried so far (omelette, nachos, quesadillas) were sooooooooo good! The place gets packed on UFC fight nights and when they have live performances!
author: Dessa R.

description: awesome marguritas and sangrias. the best fish taco nicks way.
author: Kayla O.

description: The California burrito is a must have at this establishment. The french fries give the burrito an extra notch to the deliciousness of it. The crispy tacos are also scrumptious. Beware with their margaritas...they are strong! The guacamole, salsa, and chips are pretty tasty and is a perfect appetizer to start the meal off.
author: Raebern B.

description:
Best tacos in the city. GREAT hot sauce [the red one]. 

Not much else to say. Take it Nick's way. Good stuff.
author: Rahul T.

description:
I have seriously been having a hard time finding some 'decent' Mexican food in the Bay area. I've gotten few and far between recommendations to try one place or another, drive down to SJ or the Mission, you'll be sure to find it there. Coming from San Diego, where Mexican food is the #1 late night snack, I was disappointed that an uber-metropolitan city such as San Francisco lacks more than one 24 hour Mexican food joint. (And if there is one please, oh please msg me!)

Along came Underdog's, a taco shop disguised as a bar hidden in the Sunset. After eating two beef tacos and washing it down w/a Stella, Underdog's restored all hope that SF truly delivers in all things food. The staff is friendly, they have a seating area, you can sing karaoke but honestly, I really could care less about any of that stuff when it comes to zoning out while eating their fare. Hence, I gave U-dog's 5 stars on taste alone.
author: Cecile Q.

description: Fresh squeezed juice for all their drinks, and $1 margaritas! REALLY! Only for 1/2 an hour on Friday, but $1 Margarita! And a good $2 taco, too.
author: Bill W.

description:
Ok so here is the gods honest truth people - I. Hate. Seafood.  Hate it.  Hate fish, shrimp, scallops, crab, and yes, even lobster.  Hate it all, with a passion.   Go ahead, insert 'what? you live in SF and don't eat seafood?' joke now.  I have heard them my whole life....go ahead!

Now then, here is why this matters.  Nicks Crispy Tacos aka The Taco Shop (in Underdogs Sports Bar) on 19th and Irving is the place I will eat....drumroll please....FISH FREAKIN TACOS BABY!!!    That's right.  I eat them.  Fried, grilled - whatever.   Ok Ok Ok, so I mostly eat the fried fish tacos, so what?   They rock.  Period.

Go get some.   Even if you hate fish.  You won't be sorry.
:)
author: Jen p.

description:
I forget why my friends and I came here, but the drinks are pretty good. The bartenders are really friendly and nice. The pricing is alright, comparable to other places. The food here used to be better, but for some reason the portions got smaller. And I remember there being a taco deal - not sure if they still have that... but if its still there - that is not  worth it AT ALL. The tacos are extremely small and not all that tasty. The burritos are alright but I would rather go further down Sunset to get one. 

All in all the drinks are good but food is just mediocre.
author: Jay L.

description: Well, I tried the fish tacos because they were part of the 2010 Big Eat SF - 100 Things to Try Before You Die. Well, let's just say, if I was about to die of hunger and they were the only thing to eat, I would just let myself die. Nick (of Nick's Crispy Tacos) can usually make a decent taco, but these were horrible! First of all, I could not taste the fish, secondly, there was no 'heat'. I had to drown my tacos in Tapatio sauce just to get some spiciness out of 'em. It's easy enough to make a good taco, so most chef's would try to stand out from the million other taco joints by focusing on some salsa or marinade to make their tacos really stand out, not Nick. He instead smothered his grilled Mahi Mahi with cold pico de gaio, lettuce and flavorless guac' (sorry, not enough flavor for the 'amole part). Also, he covered up his crispy taco shell, which he's famous for, with a soft corn tortilla, thereby making it a soft crispy tortilla combo. What is this Taco Bell??? It just defeats the purpose of having a crispy taco shell to begin with. To be honest, I would rather have had a taco from Taco bell, at least there's some flavor, albeit artificial. Thanks Nick, but your tacos are NO BUENO.
author: Rudy G.

description:
My family and I had woken up early this morning to go to the King Tut exhibit at the De Young museum. Once we got out, we realized we were hungry! We rarely go to San Francisco so we don't really know our way around. Luckily, my parents have iPhones and we were able to find the names of some places to eat nearby. One of them that sounded interesting was the Taco Shop at Underdogs, so we decided to go there. And man, am I glad I did.

The guacamole we got with our chips was probably some of the best I have had that wasn't made at home. I got the carnitas quesadilla, which was amazing! I'm not sure how they worked with the tortilla, I think it was fried. But it was nice and flaky and it was made almost like a sandwich. I told my family as we left that I have been ruined for quesadillas, and that they would have to figure out how to make them like that. It was DELICIOUS!

My dad had a carnitas taco, which he also said was delicious, and my mother had a fish burrito which she said was pretty good too. I have decided I am going to have to go up to San Francisco more often just to get that quesadilla. 

Not only that, but the atmosphere was cool. It seemed like a fun place I could hang out at with all my friends at night for dinner and games (there are arcade machines everywhere). It makes a great sports bar. I wish there was another location in the South Bay so it weren't so far.
author: Samantha R.

description:
With bowl games to watch and hungry tummies, G and I decided to try this new spot on Irving + 19th. Underdog's doesn't have a ton of soul yet -- it's in a space that formerly housed a sushi restaurant -- but it has potential to be a cool neighborhood spot. Friendly staff, cheap filling food and big flat screen tv's - hooray! 

We were happy to find that the "grub" (largely bar food and Hawaiian plate lunch fare, like loco moco and chicken teriyaki) had been discounted to $5/entree for happy hour. I wasn't able to discern from talking to the bartender *when* happy hour times are, so call ahead. G had loco moco and I had fish 'n' chips (garlic fries sub'd in.) Food was okay -- I felt that mine was Costco quality frozen food, but G liked his loco moco. And we couldn't complain about the price nor the free refills on drinks nor the free popcorn.

I felt pretty comfortable here and was delighted to see the cleanest bathrooms I'd ever encountered on Irving St. (Largely b/c they're newly renovated, but let's hope that they stay relatively clean!) We'll be back for March Madness, and I'll try the teriyaki next time -- hopefully this'll be better!

[Update 01/09/07: Geez.Came here again to watch the Seahawks/Cowboys playoff game. I want to say good things about this place since it's in the neighborhood and it's got great tv's, but the 'grub' is so forgettable. Had the chicken teriyaki w/ rice and mac salad and found my tongue shriveling from the sodium level of the chicken. At least the pear cider was drinkable, since I was downing it with the teriyaki. I'm thinking we'll just drink and nibble through games from now on - the nachos aren't half bad - and go to the pho place across the street for food afterwards.]
author: Marisa L.

description:
Obviously some of these reviews are written by the owners and owner's friends but hey that's their opinion and I'm pretty damn sure most businesses do this.  I just find these pretty humorous.....

I've been here twice since they opened.  It's obviously geared toward the Asian clientele so expect to see a lot of Asian faces here.  If that's not your thing, then don't bother coming in here.  I came on Christmas Eve and it was dead here.  I was expecting a pretty small crowd here since I assume everyone is busy with  Christmas and everything that goes with it.

I then came here on Saturday for the UFC fight.  I'm glad to see a bar showing the fight in the Sunset district since the closest one showing the UFC previously was in the Richmond district.  The place got pretty packed to come watch the fight and even with the amount of people here, the service was pretty attentive.  I never had a problem getting their attention and they brought out our order pretty quickly.  They also even came by our tables to ask if we needed anything which was pretty good.

I got a few beers and a batch of Calamari.  The calamari was decent size for the money and I was able to share it with someone and we were both decently satisfied.  Overall, Underdogs was cool and I'd come back.

Someone previously noted that the bathrooms were pretty clean which I noticed myself.  Wait after a few months hahaha.
author: Jason Y.

description:
We went there to listen to Bay Area Band Core live Saturday night.  The staff members were very accommodating and friendly.  We ordered endless beers and drinks.  It wasn't crowded and the FOOD - the best part is of course their SALSA. YUM - YUM

A special thanks to everyone who came out to Underdog's Sports Bar!!!
author: Teen F.

description:
The only place where you will find Happier Hour.

Underdogs is cozy local sports bar and now taco shop/mexican joint that offers delicious food and STRONG drinks. You definitely get your bang for your buck here. Taco Tuesdays are pretty crack'n and from time to time there will be live entertainment on the weekends. 

If you are looking for a place to chill and drink this is the place to go in the Sunset area.
author: David W.

description:
Truly a unique taco joint in the heart of the Sunset. 

I've been here twice and it's been really consistent. Only thing I would advise not to order is the Pescado (Fried fish) taco. I barely found any fish as it looked like your ordinary frozen fish stick was dipped in batter and fried again. Barely any fish meat. Maybe it was a bad day for me but I don't think I'd order that again. 

Carne asada tacos are the best, always consistent and make sure you get them Nick's way. 

Grilled fish varies, the shrimp and mahi mahi are always good. 

Chicken can be a bit dry at times but it's still pretty tasty thanks to the marinade and spices. 

Quesedilla was really awesome! Best one I've ever had. It's different from your Taco Bell or Taqueria style so prepare to be amused and amazed.
author: Derrick L.

description: $1 street tacos for Taco Tues. I like the Crispy Fish Tacos Nicks Way the most after trying most of the other stuff. A good place to watch sports with a full bar. Don't come expecting a quiet dinner. Also watch for one of the worker guys, he KICKS MAJOR ASS at the basketball game in the back. Saw him break the high score a few times.
author: David D.

description: Could very much be my new taco Tuesday location, great atmosphere, tasty tacos (secret red salsa was AWESOME) $2 Tecates, only downside its rather difficult finding seating atleast on Tuesdays
author: Chris H.

description: Love this place. Great food, drinks, atmosphere.....I really don't have anything negative to say....it's all good to me  :)
author: Hazy M.

description: Awesome staff!  We sat outside cause we had our pup, but they were incredibly attentive and really cool too.  Food was great as usual!  I can't get enough "Nick's way" crispy fish tacos.  Matt had 2 carne asada tacos, I could only eat one with chips and salsa.  Definitely recommend!
author: Sasha S.

description: Great house magaritas and awesome chips and salsa. Their tomato/basil sause was delicious. Bartenders are friendly and they are quick and efficient. Overall great place to hang out with friends and watch sports together.
author: Selina Z.

description: This is absolutely one of my favorite places. The margaritas are actually made with fresh squeezed lime juice, even the unassuming 4 dollar house marg shames anything you would find at chevy's or the like. The food is great as well, the same super fresh, quality over quantity mentality seems to be shared by the kitchen. The carnitas and carne asada tacos "nicks way" are not to be missed.
author: Jon J.

description:
This was our first experience with Nick's now-famous tacos, and in addition to enjoying the fabulous, yet simple offerings, we were also treated to a visit by the namesake himself! 

Since there were no sporting events of consequence being televised that evening, we only had to share the space with other, mostly subdued, diners and barflies, which suited us perfectly as we were there for the food. The Baja Fish Tacos "Nick's Way" were quite a festive balance of textures - crunchy and soft, and flavors - savory and sweet, and I will add that the guacamole serves well to envelope all of the flavors in a veil of avocado decadence.

Definitely looking forward to a return visit!
author: morgan p.

description: So I can only give the Taco Shop three stars because I've never actually been there. I have super nice friends who always bring me tacos when they eat there. I must say, even their tepid tacos ROCK! Guac and salsa fresca are always super fresh and delicious. The salsa and chips that are included are also fresh and delicious! Wonderful tacos! Nic's way is the best way. I hope to one day actually eat at the restaurant so I can have the full experience. Although, after reading the post about the cook not washing his hands after using the restroom, I'm thinking ignorance really is bliss.
author: Jenna L.

description: I love Nick's tacos!  You have not had a Baja style taco until you have had it Nick's way. They are crispy and chewy, zesty and salty. They are the perfect taco. Sometimes I mix it up and get a burrito which are also fantastic. And in case you don't want to deal with the bar scene, you can call ahead for take out!!
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
Great atmosphere and good tvs to catch the games. The menu selection is a little boring but good for a sports bar. It is defiantly a nice happening hang out for sunset. Defiantly could use a good cleaning.

I tried to order Mexican street style tacos off the menu. I also wanted to add cheese. The server took my order then came back and told me that they couldn't do cheese on my tacos. So I figured that they were trying to cut food cost, I then asked if i could order a side of Cheese which is offered as a side on the menu, more than happy to pay or it. Amazingly she tells me No. The owner won't do it. My friend and me were shocked and asked for an explanation. The only one that multiple employees could give us is the owner is crazy and stuck in his ways which i understand if you Daniel Boulud, or Eric Ripert but Nick from a sunset Sports bar. 
So then I ordered a least expensive taco that already had cheese on it. Im still quite perplexed over the situation. 

You could see that all the servers which seemed very unhappy and had that look of a beaten dog stuck in a cage wishing they could get out. 

Two nights later I came back to watch the giants game since there wasnt to many bars  to choose from in the area, I was sitting down next to a girl that sent back there order. Nick had the nerve to bring the taco out himself and said, "Next time get it right the first time " . The girl then said if its a big deal i will just it eat sorry for the mistake. 

Note to the owner: Customers are the soul of your restaurant. Sorry if daddy  use to abuse you. If you continue to treat people the way you do you will end up loosing every customer and employee. 


Dont worry. Going back this week with cheese in my pocket.  
You may have one the battle not they war never under estimate the POWER OF CHEESE!!!
author: Sean J.

description: The Sunset needs more places like underdogs. It's a fun watering hole with good eats in a land deprived of decent tacos. Thanks for spicing up the neighborhood Underdog's! :) Oh, and the bartenders are super friendly too.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Underdogs was a bit underwhelming.  We went to check out Taco Tuesday having heard about buck tacos.  We thought they would be Nick's Way, but no...on Tuesdays the deal is just $1 street tacos, little uninspired tacos.  After having 3, I ordered a Nicks Way taco ($4.50) and was a bit disappointed....think the ones at Nick's on Polk were much better.  My friends split a quesadilla as their "entree" and said it was pretty good.

Credit is due for an incredibly helpful and attentive staff. They brought chips and salsa pretty much as soon as we walked in (although the chips got soggy pretty quickly under the mound of salsa...)  And they stopped by frequently to check if we needed anything.

And I can't complain about $2 tecates.

Not sure I'll head  back there just for the tacos, but if I'm in the 'hood and looking for a place for a bite and a drink, I might stop in.
author: Todd S.

description:
I come to Underdog's on Sundays to watch out of state NFL games, and it is one of my favorite places to go to watch a game. First off the place is sunlit. It has big front windows. Therefore, one does not feel like they are in a dungeon when they are watching a game like a lot of sports bars.

Second, the TV's are under control. They decide from the beginning which games will be showing on which TV and they post it for all to see. No more guess work or trying to get the bartender to change the channel from womens figure skating over to your team. Also the local (49ers) game will be on in the back on the big screen for all the local fans to go to, so the front 48" HDTV's are reserved for the out of state games.

Third the food. It ain't bad. If you are there with a friend I highly recommend getting the nachos to share.

And lastly, I have yet to have a problem getting a seat.

All the ingredients for a great sports bar. Can't speak to the place for the rest of the time.
author: Craig G.

description: Fantastic burritos.  Try the pescado "baja" burrito.  But make sure to get it "con todo".  The green and red sauces that they give you are amazing.  Beers are a little expensive and the seating is at a premium, but overall the place is really great.  Tuesday is the night to go if you can get there early as it's "Taco Tuesday" and they have a good deal going on.
author: Shawn B.

description:
First off, I must admit the place is very clean and modern looking. The crowd was typical for a sports bar and well the atmosphere is alright.

The negative is that the food sucked, it took about 30mins to come out, and the bartenders/waitresses weren't all that attentive. Me and a buddy were sitting for about 10 mins before they took our orders.

I guess that's okay since they have pretty attractive female waitresses/bartenders.... cute faces, big tits, and nice ass makes slow service tolerable i guess...

Anyway, this place is average/above average, but i'm going to -1 star for the food. Cool to come here and drink, but eat out elsewhere first. Don't order the garlic fries...they taste like something like potato flavored mix and playdough combined...was probably the worst garlic fries i've ever had in my life.

Also they didn't show the UFC PPV in HD....just standard def on the 16:9 format......but a lot of places don't either.....but they have the cheapest cover charge in the city...

There are better sport bars out there, but none as clean though!

Anyway, worth a try...just avoid the food...i'd rather go to burger king.
author: Steven C.

description:
Finally!  Good tacos in the Sunset! 

Now don't get me wrong, Taco Bell is a cheap and often delicious alternative, but the tacos at Underdog's are a-w-e-s-o-m-e.  

Last night we got some carne asada tacos "nick's style" and a Baja style beer-battered fish taco, and a massive order of vegetarian nachos.  Everything tasted fresh and I really like the texture of layering a soft tortilla over a crispy taco shell.  We got our stuff to go and walked home about 12 blocks and it was still in good shape when we got home to eat.


As for the bar/location -- I don't like sports.  I don't like sports bars.  So I doubt that I will ever eat there and hang out, but I am definitely going back to get more food to-go.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Nick sure likes to serve his tacos in unique places.

On Russian Hill, you eat his tacos in a space that doubles as a nightclub.
Here, you eat his tacos in a sports bar that doesn't really advertise the fact that it carries some of the best tacos ANYWHERE. 

I am a huge fan of Nick's tacos:  the fish tacos are consistently hot, spicy, zingy, and not at all "fishy."  Grilled or fried -- you can't go wrong.  

I'm not a huge fan of sports bars in general.... but for these tacos, I'd put up with a lot.
author: John C.

description: OMG....vegetarian taco sooooo good. Especially @ $4.25 and totally filling- this place rocks! I totally wish I still lived in this neighborhood so I could go here all the time and eat these yummy tacos! Nice, fun crowd as well- always a plus!
author: Sonya D.

description: I wanted to eat well on this quick trip to the city. So my friend recommended a place off 7x7's top places in SF to eat. I didn't look too closely at the website and didn't know it was more of a bar that served the recommended taco. There's an actual taco shop in the mission district. Anyways we walked in - there's the bar on the right. And some high tables and chairs lining the wall on the left. We sat down in the back where there's actually like 4 wooden picnic tables. Menus are on the table. It took a little while for someone actually acknowledged us. I think the bartender actually came by to take our drink orders before our actual waitress took our order. Chips and pico de gallo came out first. The pico had huge chunks of tomatoes and tasted so fresh. I got the two taco plate - the grilled fish and the carne asada (both Nicky's way). The typical meats (chicken, beef, pork) and vegetarian tacos only came Nicky's way, which is a soft taco wrapped around a crispy taco shell and topped with some guacamole. It reminded me of the taco bell chalupa. But with the seafood ones (grilled or deep fried fish, shrimp), you get a choice of regular soft tacos or Nicky's way. It's actually an extra $1.25 for Nicky's way. And they will add that to the price to the two taco plate. The carne asada was just ok I was more impressed with the fish - seasoned with spices and topped with lettuce and salsa and a big goop of guacamole. My friends had the baja style fish, which is deep fried, which they liked as well. The tacos are pretty big and it was definitely a struggle to finish both. I also ordered a beer and cokes for my friends. But it took forever to get refills and then to get some change for our bill. It wasn't even that busy and I know the people working there looked at our table several times and still just walked by. We ended up just going to the bar to pay because we were tired of waiting.
author: Alison W.

description:
I like going here during the day.  It has a better vibe then.  There was an improvement in the tacos and I find them quite delicious.  I met Nick and he was a very pleasant person.  I still don't like to go there in the evening as I find the bar tending staff to still lack des
cent people skills.
author: Food F.

description:
The real Nick's Crispy Tacos.

I've never had a bad experience at Underdogs.  The staff is friendly and attentive.  We showed up for tacos and to watch a ballgame.  They didn't have it on any of their screens, but the bartender was really nice and switched the nearest one of them for us.

More important than anything for Nick's Crispy fans: this is where the real Nick works & manages things.  And the food is amazing as a result.  He's often behind the bar, too, ready to help out or shoot the sh**.  Great guy.

Best things on the menu are the chips & salsa (simple), the crispy tacos (Nick's way, of course), and the carne asada quesadilla with everything on it (trust me, this thing is decadent).  

You won't go wrong here.  Parking is easy in this part of town, and there's several easy ways to get here.  This is my place to go now for mexican or sports watching.
author: Andy C.

description: Went here yesterday and got a San Francisco burrito (AKA a "super burrito" at ye olde taqueria) with carne asada. The carne was super good, it was grilled and delicious. But y'know what the best part was? They have orange sauce! There's a taqueria in San Jose that has its own (or so I though) sauce called orange sauce which is an orange chipotle and garlic based sauce and I thought I wouldn't see any other place with it. When the waitress put down the sauce on our table I was ecstatic and just about soaked my burrito in it. Am I gonna be here again? Hell yeah.
author: Kyle K.

description: Great customer service!   A great place to hang out with your friends for some good eats and alcoholic drinks.  We ordered the Baja fish tacos Nick's style and it was delicious, I highly recommend this.  I love their green and red sauce too.
author: Nancy C.

description:
Delicious tacos!  Same as Nick's Crispy Tacos on Polk by Rouge.  But without the cheesy scene.  

Cool sports bar- complete with the basketball game (you know, the one at Dave & Busters), video games, juke box (CDs), and several plasmas to watch whatever game you fancy.  

We had the chips and salsa with guac- super good.  A bit too much salsa=soggy chips.  But hell, I ate 'em anyway.  My baja fish taco (Nick's style) was killer.  It's a fish taco (duh) in a deep fried shell, then wrapped in a flour tortilla.  Super filling and under $5 I think.  

They have $2 Tecate here, agua fresca, it's a full bar- you just can't go wrong.
author: Sarah F.

description:
I understand this is a sports bar, but some people are WAY too obnoxious and shouldn't be allowed in public.  These guys sitting behind us were soooooo loud I couldn't even hear myself or the person I was talking to right in front of me!  but that's not the fault of the establishment--although it did alter my experience.

1.  The food took SUPER long to come out.  It must have been 20 minutes and all I ordered was 3 of their $1 street tacos. 
2.  The $1 street taco wasn't even worth the $1.  First of all it smelled funny, like it was spoiled (my tummy agreed with that later), and they only consisted of 1 piece of chicken, 2 tablespoons of onions and 5 pieces of chopped cilantro.  REALLY?!!? yes really. 
3.  My group was seated next to the swinging door into the kitchen and EVERY time someone passed through those doors came a foul whiff of vomit aroma.  It was sick.  But that's just how my taco smelled too.
4.  Inconsistency!  I ordered 3 street tacos when I first got there & it took 20 minutes.  Then later on I ordered 3 street tacos for the bf and it came out in 1 minute.  wth?!  I ordered it way earlier than he arrived, expecting to wait 20 mins and then it came in 1 min so by the time the bf got there, it was cold...and stinky!
Good thing I had good company to try and save my experience, plus there was a big screen to watch the game.  Yay for that.
author: Jennifer N.

description:
For a sports bar, the taco shop here at Underdog's makes some damn fine tacos. 

My bf and I walked in, took some seats, and immediately a server (don't be expecting anything fancy. He was just a college age guy with a towel sticking out of his jeans pocket.) came and asked us if we wanted salsa and chips ($1.50). We did. The salsa was just chopped up salsa, cilantro, red onion and maybe a little garlic. No spiciness at all. But you can tell that Underdog's doesn't use just any kind of cheap watered down tomatoes they can get. It's rare to find good tomatoes in December, but these tomatoes were bright red, with good texture and flavor. We gobbled the basket up so quickly the server asked us if we wanted another one and brought it complementary. 

My bf ordered two tacos: one carnitas and one chicken, each done Nick's way. I ordered two tacos as well: one carnitas and one carne asada, both done Nick's way as well. I also ordered the elote con queso (grilled sweet corn brushed with lime salsa and covered in a mixture of mexican cheese and chili powder). 

The tacos were fantastic. Because the kitchen didn't mark which tacos were which though (cause when done Nick's way, they all look the same no matter the filling), I ended up eating the chicken instead of the carne asada. Nevertheless, we both thought our tacos were pretty amazing. The tacos get tucked halfway into a paper wrapper, and the end that is sticking out gets stuffed half with salsa and half with freshly made guac. There was so much guac in one of my tacos I scooped some out with some leftover chips and had plenty left over. My bf, who is not a fan of guac, gladly ate his with zero complaints.

Before I got even halfway into my second taco, I was getting pretty full and I still had the corn to eat! The corn was just alright. I'm more used to the street version in LA, where they slather it in mayo and then roll it in cheese (sounds disgusting, tastes amazing). The cheese just tasted too salty and I had to scrape some of it off to eat the corn. I guess it really needs the mayo to balance it out. 

I will be back. And I will control my gluttony next time.
author: Crystal L.

description: Tacos are good at Nicks but the California burrito is probably the worst I have ever had.  4 star for tacos and 1 star for CA Burriot makes me bump this to a 3.
author: Harry E.

description:
When you come in, its just looks like your average sports bar: ok selection of food, great options of liquor, good service, and limited seating.  But what really stuck out to me was the 50" plasmas they had throughout the bar.  I have never been here a Sunday during the fall but I would bet that is pretty crowded and has lots of energy from all the customers.  I was here on a Thursday last fall when both the Niners and Warriors were  playing and the place was going crazy during both games.  Fortunately both teams won that night.  
The only thing they lacked was the number of women that goes here which kind of kills the excitement over there.  Hopefully they changed that up and mixed their clients up by now.  But I will swing by again on a Sunday this fall and experience watching up to football games on five(I think its more than that) HDTV plasma flat screens.
author: Kris A.

description:
Pretty chill place to be on most nights especially now its a taco place moonlighting as a bar. 

Nice big TVs, usually showing the game. They have the mini basketball game in the back which is awesome as well NBA Jam in the front. 

Bartenders are pretty nice and relaxed and have a lot of tap. Drinks are standard, not mind blowing prices or anything, but I won't have to ask for a bailout anytime soon. Owners are usually there lounging around, checking to make sure you're taken care of. Nick, the taco guy goes above and beyond too for your taco eating experience. 

Overall, good eats and good drinks. What more do you need?

(Answer - get more options on your jukebox)
author: Rich H.

description: I went to go visit my bf at lunch time, and we were deciding on what to eat. He mentioned that we should try the taco shop, since the food is really good there. We ordered the fish tacos, they were delicious. We had the "nick's way" batter fish taco. It did not fail to meet my expectations. I would love to come back and try their tortilla soup as well, i hear good things about it. The price is alright, a few dollars more than your average taco place. It's worth it tho!
author: Lily S.

description: Recently ate here and am a little bit disappointed. They still have some really good taco's but not as great as it use to be. I think they are starting to slack on quality control. I talked to the owner of this place a while back and he told me that he tries his best to keep his presence known so that he can make sure that the taco's are being prepared to top standard. It seems that things are taking a turn for the worst.
author: Nick C.

description: One of the best spots to get the folks together for some football (and other sports depending on the season)! Before, Underdog's served regular bar & grill eats, which were decent. Parking is very challenging, but the new takeover of The Taco Shop has made this spot a must visit. I'm totally impressed with their food. Favorites by far are the Pescado "Baja" Style fish tacos and yes, their Sopa de Tortilla, where the portions are hearty. Later on this season, I gotta try their burritos.
author: Leroid D.

description: I got this place confused with the hotdog shop next door! Awesome place. Had the chicken taco and chicken quesadilla. TASTY.
author: Lily W.

description:
As a big fan of La Taqueria in The Mission, it's hard to find another place in The City that matches up to their standard, but thankfully, that day came this past Monday at The Taco Shop in The Sunset District of all places! Nick's Crispy Taco Shop on Broadway and Polk had a huge following for many years, but Nick had a fallout with his partner (A-hole by the way), and decided to venture out on his own to Underdog's on Irving just off of 19th Avenue in The Inner Sunset.

Having heard this my friends and I were ecstatic as I live five minutes away in The Richmond. We went there on Monday afternoon at 12:30 and were greeted with a warm welcome from the cool bartender.  We ordered a couple of Anchor Steam pints ($3 each right on..happy hour price?) and were brought some chips and salsa with two squeeze bottles of hot sauces...one a mellow green chile verde and the other a spicy red traditional. The pico de gallo on the chips tasted like it was made two minutes prior to us walking...perfect taste, freshness and temperature. We proceeded to add little squirts from both bottles on to the loaded chip with salsa, and that look that my friend and I give each other whenever we realize we have hit foodie gold at first bite shined on both of our faces! Pure bliss with the fresh chips!

We each ordered a taco and a side..me a carne asada loaded and her a chicken loaded with a small side of rice and beans, and a small order of seasoned grill prawns. The food arrived within ten minutes and we dug in to our tacoes first...crunchy on the inside and soft on the outside with a generous helping of meat, cilantro and guac. The rice and beans were perfect, but what really stood out were the seasoned prawns. I've had the dish in The Mission, Mexico, and friends' homes, but these were beyond belief! The perfect combo of spice, tenderness, and grilling temp. If you had the chips and salsa with a small order of these you'd be a happy camper...but we were hungry. We devoured everything, and the tacoes were as good if not better than La Taqueria...which is saying a lot...total bill $24 with two beers, two full stomachs, and two big smiles for the rest of the afternoon. 

We'll be back VERY soon...daytime at noon there were five people in the entire place, but I'm sure it was going off for the Niners Monday Night Football beatdown of the Cardinals...lots of screens for great views everywhere of games.

Thank you Nick for moving your shop to this neighborhood for a five minute drive of perfection!
author: SFNATIVE K.

description: Service is always good. My only gripe would be that the food, although really good, should be a little cheaper. I seem to spend $10 on food (while sober) and still leave wondering where I can get something to eat.
author: Chris J.

description: Only tired their tacos ... it's the best in the SF area but not the best I've ever had. I really wish I can give the a 3.5 star rating. It's a fun spot to drink and enjoy a game.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Looking for a great place to watch any local game shoot some hoops or get a fish taco. Look no further this local taco shop once a trip over to broadway and polk is now so close and a great place to go hang out and with friends. Bring lots of quarters because once you start playing Hot Shots game you wont stop.
They have great taco's that come out "Nick's Way"  I get everything Nicks way because they put a mound of guacamole on it.
author: Nathan H.

description: Always get the california burrito & its always delightfully tasty & the red salsa puts it over the top. So good. Just recently discovered they have breakfast burritos on the weekend. Equally satisfied. Almost always bartenders seem annoyed with patrons when the bar is busy or ask for xtra house salsa, but I will always go back for the great food!
author: Mandy h.

description:
One of those little gems where the staff actually listen and are happy to put your "minority sport" on TV (bonus of having so many TV's!)

Add that to great Margaritas - Happy Days
author: Anita W.

description: Decent place to watch a game. Younger clientèle on this Thursday night (SFSU students), though it was for the NBA Finals Game 7 so may have been atypical. Street Tacos were unremarkable at $2 (3 for $6), only pretty good when the two salsas at the table were smothered on top. Uncomfortable seats. $1 Taco Tuesday might compel me back... eh, probably not. The nachos looked gargantuan and pretty savory.
author: Kevin A.

description: Excellent tacos! Ones that I believe my Mexican mom would love. The drinks hit the spot also!
author: Daniel M.

description:
Ahhh Taco Shop, you lived up to my expectations, and so few places do! Yes, five stars - it rocks my face off. This is kind of cliche, but my mouth is watering just thinking about the place.  

So many fresh local ingredients makes it hard to pick from the menu.  The Pick 2 is perfect satisfaction to my indecision.  I went with a Carne Asada Taco and a Pescado "Baja" Style Taco.  Make sure and order it Nick's way!  I actually used my fingers to pick up all the glory that fell on the paper in my basket.  Amazing!

There really is something for everyone.  So please, try it if you haven't, and don't be phased by how busy it always is. It's that way for a reason.

GO TO THE TACO SHOP @ UNDERDOGS. BECOME ADDICTED
author: Andrew G.

description: This is a nice little sports bar in sunset.  Nick's tacos are here!!!!  I've never been to the actual Nick's, but I can tell you that the Nick's way tacos here are SOO good!  They're like mini burritos cut in half and filled with guac, salsa, and meat.  Yum!  I also like their street tacos and the different types of sauce that they provide on the table.
author: Jessica N.

description: This place rocks! But be prepared for a bar full of screaming college kids. If you can get past that, you will enjoy yourself. The tacos, nachos, etc are the bomb. They have $2 tecates on ice and their booze is pretty reasonable. The food is very affordable. Great long bar with T.V.s, and for a bar run by 1st time bartenders (they are all 21, 22), they do a fine job, bubbly and friendly. One in particular, Jamie, with the colorful hair always treats us so well. I like to hit this place between the mobs of kids, though. Oh and another bonus: sometimes you can get food as late as midnight. YESSSSS.
author: punk l.

description:
came on a thursday night, waited maybe 15 minutes for a table to open up. the service was amazing. our waitress Amanda? was super nice. 

got the baja style fish nick's way. ordered 2 for around 9 bucks. they're not THAT big, but definitely bigger than your average taco size. but one does get you pretty full. it's a really good fish taco. comes with one fried tortilla and a soft one outside which is a little too much in my opinion.
author: Grace S.

description: I've always gotten tacos at taco trucks and to me, those are the best and nothing else.  I was never too impressed by any tacos anywhere else, but I was at Chug Pub around the corner last night and being another big eats item, I had to come try Nick's Baja-Style Fish Tacos. Nick's Way is pretty much a crispy taco wrapped with a soft taco.  When I first read the description and the price ($5.25) I thought it was two different tacos, one with a crispy shell, and another with a soft one so I didn't think it was too expensive.  But even though it turned out to be just one taco, it was huge!  A BIG beer battered piece of fish topped with cabbage, lime, cilantro, and a big heap of delicious guacamole.  There was two sauces/salsa that you can top your tacos with, one green, one red.  I don't know what is in either one, but it was both really good on the taco.  Too bad I had already ate dinner or else I would have ordered at least two more! This place is definitely worth the try!
author: Katherine C.

description: Well, I thought I'd give it another spin because the manager contacted me saying that they'd be working on the shrimp issue I mentioned in my last review.  This time, I tried the grilled fish burrito.  I was not impressed.  The fish was mahi mahi, and it just didn't go well flavor-wise with the other ingredients.  Sorry, but the other Nick's has way better flavor and they don't skimp on ingredients.
author: Julie T.

description: Tonight was the third time I've been to the Taco Shop. After a decent meal both times, i wasn't expecting anything spectacular. The happy hour specials made it all worthwhile. 1 dollar street tacos and 2 dollar dos equis. The wait staff and bartenders were attentive and cool. The drinks flowed and the tacos/nachos/burritos were all good. I'm a fan of the Nicks style tacos. The 1 dollar margaritas were only ok but what the fuck they were only a buck!!! I had a good time for cheap and that is all you can ask. Check it out if you are in the neighborhood but i wouldn't go out of my way. It's a great spot for sunsetters and anyone that needs a decent taco.
author: Greg H.

description:
I LOVE SARAH! :) one of the bartenders there. she made my first time there and awesome experience. i went there numerous times after and she even made me my own drink and remembered it every time i came in. it tastes nasty as hell but hey! i cant complain. its called a "SAM TSUNAMI" to anyone that wants to try it, hold your nose lol
 havent been there in a while, hope she still remembers me. 
anyways, 1 star knock down cause of how long it takes to get food.
author: sam k.

description: My friend had been telling me about this place for while, commending their dollar margaritas..(we just graduated college). We hadn't had a chance to go until a couple weeks ago and this whole time, I was picturing a sketchy shop that hardly anyone knew about because, well, who's ever heard of good dollar margaritas?! So, when we finally came in for happy hour on Friday, I was pleasantly surprised. It started off with the parking which was not difficult at all, considering its location. There isn't always plenty of street parking, but it isn't impossible to find a spot nearby. Anyway, back to the bar. Their carnitas and carne asada tacos are amazing (you HAVE to try them with their sauce) and only $2 during happy hour! I've yet to try the burritos, which I heard are pretty good too. They also have $2 Tecates and as I've mentioned, dollar margaritas which can be strong, but really one of the better margaritas I've had. It's too bad they only serve them for half an hour (6-6:30pm on Fridays). All in all, service was great, food was great, drinks were great.
author: Stephanie G.

description: Awesome locals bar/taco shop. The nick's way tacos are amazing, not badly priced, and go great with the extra green and red sauce they give you. Went again and got the quesadilla - oh so good, deep fried. The waitress is always fast and really friendly. There's a reason why this plsce is always packed. Will be going back often.
author: Jeffrey Y.

description:
Came here early at 5pm to save a table for some of my classmates who were going to meet me up for Taco Tuesday, and the back area with the tables was completely empty!  SCORE!!  I landed a sweet table and waited for my friends to come.  Soon as a few others showed up the waitress came over and got our orders.  We initially just ordered chips and salsa, and a few street tacos.  The street tacos were $1, and yes because they are street tacos, they are small.  I've been to mexican joints that serve street tacos, but they do not skimp out on the meat... The street tacos here did.  There was barely any meat on there... ridiculous!  What else is ridiculous is $4.25 for a fish taco!!  $5.25 for fish tacos Nick's way.  Being the fatty that I am, I tried both of them.  I didn't enjoy the Nick's way as much as the regular Baja style fish taco.  The regular fish tacos had plenty of fish and good flavor.  I recommended it to all my friends that came.  The Nick's fish taco was harder to eat and the huge amount of guacamole on top of it masked the good saucy flavor.  Might have been better with the carne asada?  We also got the carne asada quesadilla, which was pretty darn good.  ALMOST compares to El Farolito's Super Quesadilla.  $6.50 for the carne asada quesadilla... not too bad.  It was a good decent size.  USe the green salsa on EVERYTHING. it's soooo delicious, and has a nice small kick to it! YUMMMMM

Unfortunately there were no beer specials for Taco tuesday.  The service was pretty fast.  The waitress was super nice with us in allowing us to split our checks, which was a HUGE hassle for her... which I'm sure she got annoyed about. =P  Understandable...there were 20 different checks with people leaving all at different times =P

I would recommend going here on any day just to try the fish tacos. Taco tuesdays aren't anything that special other than a good opportunity to meet up with friends on a Tuesday.  Oh, and get their chips with salsa ON THE side.. otherwise you'll get soggy chips.

Good fish tacos, just not sure if it's worth $4.25 or the $5.25.
author: Diane L.

description:
baja fish tacos
nick's way.

get it right.
author: Christopher L.

description: Baja fish tacos! Nick's way!!
author: Liz P.

description:
i thought it would be appropriate to write a review about the taco shop at underdog's today, being that it is cinco de mayo and all.....i love this place. we frequent it a lot....my boyfriend has three kids, they love burritos and tacos, it's quick and easy.

 i love the street tacos but if you haven't had a "nick's way" taco you should definitely get a taco that way.....not to mention they have fabulous margaritas.  also, if you like chips and salsa they have the best. for you daring hot sauce lovers, ask for their super hot sauce! it will make your eyes water and your nose run for sure! 

the only downside is that it gets SUPER loud and busy on game nights...it is a sports bar, but if you get around all the sport-o jock types you'll love it.
author: Teri A.

description: awesome awesome tacos. They are so big and full of everything and I'm sure not good for you but this makes them even better. There was no way to eat these tacos and not end up looking like a 2 year old child just wiped their hands on their clothes. The tacos are definitely worthy of that dirty shirt though. Sometimes it's super packed because it is a bar but if you can find a table to sit at especially a video game table (so much more awesome) then I recommend you try this place out.
author: Elisa M.

description:
