I had a pretty lame experience here. Sat at the bar and ordered a Fish Burrito and a beer. When the food came out, they had made a Taco and when I said it wasn't what I ordered, they asked if I was sure I wanted a burrito. Uh yeah! 

So when my burrito finally came, the fish was lacking. I would say it was about 80% cabbage. Bummer! 
Within all this, we were completely ignored. No one was even able to to be flagged for another beer or even a water. Then we sat for probably 15 min trying to get the check. Once we put the card down, it was another 10 min. I should note that it was not a busy day and most of the staff was just wandering around behind the bar which is why it was so frustrating. I have no problem waiting when things are busy, but this was just unacceptable to me.
author: Katie f.

description:
Loved the tacos here.  Also really liked that even though it's a sports bar, that many tattooed and pierced folks were there.  Made me feel more at home, since not a sports fan at all.

Will go back just to sit at the old school Pac Man video game table and eat yummy tacos!
author: Roxie B.

description:
Great place! I love the taco's and the pico de gallo is super fresh. You can always judge a place by the avocado... and they use very fresh premium ingredients, quality meat and EXCELLENT Service! Nick was awesome and made us feel like old time regulars on our first visit. He suggested us the house Margaretta with Corzo which seemed to hit the spot perfectly :) 

We came back a second time a few days later to watch the Sunday night football game. The staff immediately recognized us, picked up the conversations exactly where we left off the last time we left. And I have to compliment our other bartender for having good bar skills... it was nice to see someone know how to make a true black and brown. 

Oh, and please add a 6th star for having SUPER CLEAN BATHROOMS with real toilet paper (not that one ply crap).

Update 3/9/2010  Nate is the most AWESOME-EST bartender EVER!!!!!

I have dreams about these tacos.....
author: Lil Jinni L.

description: Went here over the weekend after seeing the pics and reviews. This is a bar atmosphere, it was very crowded but we managed to grab two setas at the end of the bar. The service was  on point, had the anchor steam beer which was good, and the carne asada nachos. These were the best nachos i ever had and  ive had plenty.  We were really full after just the nachos but I had to try one taco. we tried the baja fish taco, it was huge and delicious. Cant wait to come back for those nachos again, and to watch all the games.
author: Mykia F.

description:
Went here on a Saturday afternoon. Not too busy, which was fine by me. Tacos were great - had a carnitas and later a chicken taco. Nice flavor in the meat, and they are messy - which is alway a plus. Who the heck wants a neat, dry taco? I suppose that would be the opposite of yum-o. 

Wait staff (working behind the bar) were cheeful and prompt. Had several beers to go along with the chow - good selection, but not overwhelming. Beers were nice and cold but not frozen - this ain't lemonade, pal.

Watched college football on the hd tvs and also checked out the artwork in the men's room. Did Hefner leave that stuff when he stopped by to take a whiz?

Only other oddity to point out is that just 2 blocks away , at 1634 irving, is a place called Underdog. I think there is a lack of creativity on Irving.
author: Rich P.

description:
In certain instances Yelp should be able to add a sixth star and The Taco Shop at Underdogs would definitely be on of those special cases.

Nick's commitment to quality is unsurpassed; you'll taste it in just about every item on the menu.  When Nick is in good spirits and the El Jimador starts a flowin, watch out.  This place can turn into a full on party spot. 

WRANGLER = real, comfortable, jeans!
The Taco Shop = damn, good, food!
author: Joseph S.

description: had a fish taco Nick's way yesterday. It's alright, nothing crazy about it. I've definitely had a better one. It is a decent sportsbar close to home so yay for that.
author: Patty P.

description: OMG some of the best tacos I've ever had! You have to get them "Nicks Way" with the soft & crunchy taco together so freakin' good! And they seriously load up these tacos with so much stuff its just amazing!!! I can't believe it took me this long to discover this place (thanks to friends)...their margaritas are also pretty damn good and so are the chips & salsa. Service is nice & friendly and it's a great joint to hang out at...I'll be back!
author: Kimberly R.

description: Elote con queso, fish tacos nicks way baja. delicious. awesome quesadillas. and beer... great service, always good for an after work thing.
author: A L.

description: Great tacos and margaritas, can get loud on game nights though.
author: Ms S.

description: This place has some seriously delicious food for a bar. It's no wonder the place is always crowded. I had 2 of the vegetarian tacos "Nick's way" which is a crunchy shell wrapped in a soft tortilla, and it was more than enough food, the tacos are HUGE! The meat here is good too, my bf got 3 street tacos with different kinds of meat and he liked them all. The whole meal only cost about $20 including beer. This place is often very crowded but it is worth the wait!
author: Linnea B.

description: Ahh Nick's way tacos are so killer. They are basically super tacos. I recommend eating your food their so you can squirt on tons of awesome salsa (the red one's amazing). This place is great gringo mexican food, and good specials
author: Young M.

description: I love this place so much.  Whenever I eat here I am so grateful that we have a decent "taco shop" in the Sunset district.  My husband and I love the burritos, but my all time favorite is the grilled fish taco Nick's way.  Since this place is at a bar, it's open late so you can get your late night mexican food fix.  It's a bit more pricey than I would like, but knowing that the ingredients are fresh, local, and sustainable makes it worth every penny.
author: Karen C.

description:
The tacos are delicious. get it Nick's Way. The basketball hoop game is fun. Bring your own change.

Knock down 1 star because there are better bars out there but the tacos alone is worth coming back for.

True story: my first time there I brought $3.00 worth of quarters for the bball game machine. Apparently I got one of the higher scores there because this crowd of regulars were cheering me on and ooh-ing and aww-ing. I was on fiy--uh!
author: Eddie L.

description:
I've been reading yelp reviews on this place forever. Finally I called up a friend and decided to give it a try during happy hour. We were instantly greeted by the bartenders. It's a pretty chill and sports bar environment. A great place to hang out and unwind after a long days of school or work. We didn't know what we wanted but for sure the fish tacos that everyone seemed to rave about! We were first presented with chips and salsa while we looked over the menu. I ordered the happy hour beer $2 and street tacos $2 each (chicken and steak) and a fish taco $4-$5. It was so delicious! I just wanted more and more but was beyond full. It's the best bang for your buck and with great company, you can't go wrong!

Nightlife bar scene however was a different story....

It was pretty dead on a saturday night that I came. I came here with a group of coworkers and I immediately headed over to the bar with a designated drinker lol. I meant business when I sit my ass on the bar stool. Our other friend joined us and we ordered our drinks at the same time. The bartender was nice and not too talkative which was great because I was chatting with my DD anyways. The bartender gave the tab to my friend that joined us, but I was wondering why we didn't get asked to pay or wasn't given our tab. Huh? Perhaps I'm getting a free drink. In that case, I'll order more 2 more drinks for the both of us! I then moved over to the picnic table area by the game arcade where the group sat and next thing you know, the bartender humiliates me with the tab saying "you ordered drinks remember?" and hands me the bill. Geez, you could've asked me if I wanted to have an open or closed tab. So now, you let the world think that I was trying to get free drinks from you and failed miserably when that didn't happen. Trickery at it's finest. One star off.

I'll be back. I still love the fish tacos tho!!
author: D W.

description: The fish taco nick's way is definitely awesome, so four stars for that. The vibe of the place was odd and a bit cheesy. Like, I would expect to see it in San Diego or a college down like SLO more than in SF. I personally wouldn't go there unless I was going to eat and unless I was in the neighborhood, but that's probably because I am an old Nick's Crispy fan and Nick's is more in my neck of the woods.
author: m t.

description: clutch clutch clutch. I love this place. It's got great prices and it's a great way to get Nick's style tacos without having to fight the incessant crowds at Nick's. I'm a super fan and this is a great place to catch a game - plenty of TV's. Be sure to get here earlier, it will fill up.
author: linda t.

description:
basically a sports bar that serves tacos and bruittos.

love the crispy fish taco, nicks way...still my fav...
author: Karen H.

description: Not a bad taco, but not a true Baja fish taco.  I did appreciate that you could have the fish grilled instead of fried.  I also though it was a bit expensive for one taco.  I expected two tacos for that price.  Bartender was friendly and the beer was good and cold.
author: Amy H.

description: Made the trek out to the outer sunset from Soma.  I've always liked Nick's Taco's in North Beach, but my roommate is adamant about going to this one b/c of the history between the two.  So, I did, and the Taco's  as expected were awesome.  If you don't go on a Tuesday, it can be somewhat pricy since I eat a lot (3-4 Taco's).  Anyhow, I could eat these all day.  You can't go wrong with any of the meats, but you have to get them Nick's way.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
This place is ok.   The bar is usually packed with frat-house types.  

The food is ok, but with so many other Mexican options in the City, im not sure I would order off the menu here again.   

Its hard to find a place to sit here, and there is not a lot of room to stand.  I think if there were more decent bars with menus in the area, this place would suffer greatly.  They are primarily thriving because--for now--they have the corner on the market; that being a decent pub with decent food.   

I say go because there is no alternate really, unless you feel like walking further East on Irving.
author: Johnny C.

description: The corn on the cob had too much cheese but it was still delicious and filling.  I forgot how big those suckers were.
author: Seong P.

description: The lady and I frequent this spot, the food is quite good if you're after a good taco. The Salsa Tubes are awesome, the chips are good. Nick's Way is the way to go on your taco's. Staff is pretty friendly and quick as long as there isn't a big game or event, it gets a little unorganized when there are a lot of people in there and orders come back wrong. Anyways Go when there isn't a big game and you'll have a good time. I think I'll go tomorrow, it was Superbowl when we tried to go today and that was pointless haha.
author: Corvus C.

description: Came here on a Friday night when there weren't any big games on, so it wasn't too hard to find seating.  I never order fish tacos since they're usually not done right, but these were not skimpy on the fish and not too greasy w/ a good tangy orange sauce.  Ask for the hot habanero sauce that comes in a ketchup bottle... it was hard for my tongue to recover after a couple drops. Delicious cotija cheesy corn (it needs some green herbs on it or cayenne cuz it just does not look right), squeeze some lime on it. For non-fish crispy tacos, I'll stick to La Taqueria in the Mission to get my tacos w/out the rowdiness.
author: Mimi L.

description:
After hearing good things about Nick's tacos, I decided to come in with my SD roommates and her relatives from out of town, specifically for Taco Tuesday. 
Taco Tuesday starts after 5pm and means $1 street tacos (either carne asada, carnitas, or pollo asado). They're normally $2, so it seemed like a pretty good deal. I also heard that Nick's Baja fish taco was THE thing to get here, so I ordered a carnitas street taco and  Nick's Baja Fish taco. We also got a complimentary platter of fresh tortilla chips and salsa while we were waiting for our tacos.. mmm.
When our tacos came, I have to say the street tacos were prettyy disappointing. It was basically a tortilla with a 1:1 ratio of meat to onions. Some of the tacos looked like they only had a sprinkling of meat. On the other hand, my baja fish taco (which was 5x the price of the street tacos) was ginormous and almost 5x as big as the street taco. The beer-battered fish was huge, and was complemented well by a big serving of guacamole and lettuce, plus the crispy and soft tortillas. It would've been nice if we had more time to hang out and enjoy the vibe of the place (it was super chill and clean), but we were in a bit of a rush. 
I wouldn't recommend coming for the Taco Tuesday ( I think even my experiences at TT at El Torito have been more satisfying), but I would recommend coming for the bar or any of the regular tacos, Nick's way.
author: Jen T.

description: Fellow yelper Jason G. kept telling me to try it here and finally I did...no way I can turn down taco tuesday. $1 street tacos...yums.  So my gf and I ordered 2 of each the carne asada, carnitas and pollo street tacos.  Our faves were the carne asada and carnitas.  We also shared a carne asada quesadilla.....omg that was the best greasiest thing I have ever eaten...mind you I have been on a salad diet.  But it was to die for...crispy on the outside and delicious on the inside.  We also shared an order of nachos....loved the homemade chips....but I still prefer cheese from the pump...a bit too gourmet for that day.  Overall a great meal that was washed down with some sangria.  I will definitely be back to try the other items that they have here.
author: Allison T.

description: Best Tacos this side of Mission street and a great pit stop for a couple coldies after a surf down at Ocean Beach.
author: Matt K.

description:
I randomly popped in here after a long day at a festival in the park.  What a lifesaver. I was thirsty, and tired of walking....and then I was recharged within an hour. 
$2 Tecates(all day, everyday people!), and free chips and salsa! and its not just any chips and salsa, they are soooo yummy. 
When I have more time, I'll def come back here and grub down on some tacos:)
author: Sarah B.

description: Ok, so next to all my favorite taco joints in socal, this place is the closest it gets to being home. I walk in feeling like I'm back in Long Beach....with Sublime and Bob Marley playing, basketball games on the tv, and good mexican food. Every time I get homesick, I come here and I feel comfort again. Every Tuesday is their Taco Tuesdays, which I love. My friends and I come here almost as a tradition on a weekly basis, and once we even ate 30 tacos between 5 of us!!! If you're not ordering the $1 tacos, I'd recommend any of the tacos "Nick's style." I can't describe it other than it's huge, but you just have to try it. mmm....
author: Emy s.

description: This place is AWESOME! I was just here yesterday for a brief amount of time working a beer promotion, but am already planning my next visit back. Great atmosphere, great food and great people. I had the chance to meet the owner, Doug, who was extremely friendly, genuine and professional... along with the rest of his staff. The Taco Shop has the best tacos/quesadillas I have ever had in my life. (And believe me, I eat a lot of Mexican food.) The ingredients were so fresh and flavorful. I particularly loved the zesty guacamole and soft/hard tortilla shell combination with the tacos. The best part is, they let me experience this culinary masterpiece on the house! Needless to say, I am thankful I was introduced to this spot.  I'm sad that The Taco Shop @ Underdogs isn't closer to my home and/or work... but despite the distance, I will most definitely be back!
author: Shannon E.

description: Went here for a friend's birthday & shark's game a while ago and it's a totally fun place. Get's loud for your team which you gotta love. The staff is very nice and fun even though they messed up my order and didn't really fix it but I'm at a sport's bar, not a 5 star restaurant so it's cool. Fun vibe and good food. If I lived closer, I'd become a regular. 1 sucky thing, bathroom doors open RIGHT up into the main seating area so you can actually see guy's backs at the urinal. lol. Whatever, we're all drunk here anyways.
author: Kristen L.

description: best american style carne asada taco in the city.  hands down.  and the service is fantastic. what else can I say?
author: Mike V.

description: Very busy on taco nights, but the $1 margaritas are awesome. So is the california burrito !
author: Daniel M.

description: I have come to the conclusion that anything you throw in the fry daddy is going to be to chock full of vitamins and give your hair a healthy sheen. Well at least that's what I tell myself everytime I order up something that has the words crispy or fried or crunchy or ass enhancer  in the description. So after a vacation that I needed a vacation from , I needed to start  an intravenous therapy of Margaritas right away, STAT!! Luckily  within stumbling was this place. Nick , you know how to make a taco right. I could just hear Taco Bell's  heart break a little.
author: Sophia C.

description: Usually great, but last night was the worst experience i have ever had in any bar/restaurant ever.  My two friends and I ordered a beer bucket at 12:55 last night. (Tuesday, Aug. 21)  At 1 o'clock the two bartenders (a young skinny guy with a full reddish beard and a smaller brunette female) began kicking everyone out of the bar very rudely.  There was no last call and I told them that we just ordered a bucket consisting of 2 beers each 5 minutes earlier and were not told they were about to close.  The male bartender was clearly intoxicated and began telling everyone to "get the fuck out".  The female bartender approached the table where we had our backpacks and yelled "who ever's stuff this is, get your shit and get out of here."  So we just grabbed our stuff and walked out with our full beers in hand.  It was the rudest experience I have ever had in any restaurant/bar experience.  I understand that Tuesdays are a long night for the staff and when they close, they want to get out as soon as possible.  However, using profanity and rudely kicking everyone out without a last call, right after serving someone a drink is truly terrible service.  So a large group of us stood outside, finishing our beers and talking about how terrible the two bartenders were.
author: Tyler J.

description: Baja Fish Tacos "Nicks guay" are good...when the fryer oil is clean and at the right temp. ; )
author: Sarah F.

description: Great fun atmosphere. Great place to watch sports and have a good time. Food is pretty good, nothing outrageous but ok.  I thought the service was spot on for that kind of establishment. Bartenders were friendly and we're moving fast to get through all the orders.  Nick can be a bit surly but to me that's kind of funny.
author: Douglas C.

description:
I've been going to this bar semi-regularly since I moved into the Sunset five weeks ago. This is definitely the place if you're looking for a no-frills, friendly sports bar with amazing tacos.

Nick, the co-owner, makes tacos "Nick's Way", which entails a soft flour tortilla on the outside, crunchy shell on the inside, and meat and loads of guac in the middle. It might not be the most "authentic" taco you've ever had, but it doesn't matter - they taste better than pretty much any other type of taco I've had! The staff usually brings you out a green and red salsa, if you're adventurous (and like spicy food) make sure to ask for the habanero sauce as well as that will hit the spot. I've also tried the quesadillas, which were alright but not my favorite - I would definitely stick to the tacos.

Other perks of the bar include free chips and salsa on most nights and $2 Tecate beer while supplies last. The rest of the beer selection is decent and decently priced ($4 pints).

Contrary to some other people's experiences, apparently, I've always found the staff and especially Nick to be very friendly. Nick introduced himself from the first time I came and always makes a point of saying hi whenever I stop by. The bar has some nice TVs and the staff is usually accommodating in terms of changing them to the game you want to see and even raising the volume a little. There's also a picnic bench in the back - a little weird but actually pretty useful if you're coming with friends.

All in all a great place to chill, watch a game, and have some great tacos!
author: Nicolas L.

description: I LOVE the baja fish tacos, served Nick's way - they are amazing and some of the best I've tried in the city so far.  The guacamole is really fresh and delicious and so is the pico so I definitely suggest getting the chips and salsa - and with 2 tacos - you will be more than satisfied.
author: Natasha T.

description:
Their food is amazing!!!  Everything tastes so fresh it's as though it was just picked from the garden.  Their chips and salsa are to die for!  The food is always consistent.  The green sauce is tasty on anything.

3 starts are because of the service.  It's hit or miss.  Sometimes they are on top of their game, attentive, and the food is quick.  Other times it takes forever to get your beer, food, or even your check.  And seriously, before you take your last bite they are taking your basket away.  Ummm, hello?  What about the droppings in the basket.  I WAS GOING TO EAT THOSE!!  

I still go on a regular basis because the food is awesome!
author: Meghan F.

description: I dont even know what to say about this place. Other than I have never had a meal here that didnt consist of atleast 2 corns, the very best in the world, there tacos are fantastic the fresh made salsas are perfect and the drunk crowded bar make this place one of my favorites in San Francisco.
author: Jason C.

description: This place is....awesome. Good food, good drinks, any game you could ever want to watch is on one of their many large screens, & most of all their service is to boot. Never once have I had to look around before somebody (even if they weren't not my original waiter) comes to ask if there's something I need. Every dish I've ordered, from the 1$ tacos to the nicks way fish version (which meets up to all the hype it's received) is so fresh! Just go....you won't be disappointed.
author: Elizabeth W.

description: First, the atmosphere is awesome, good vibes.  Second, the food is ridiculously good.  Had a pescado taco Nick's Way w/ guacamole.  My friend was going to get the same but, Nick (the owner) told him it would be better without.  "You can taste the flavor of the fish, with the guacamole it's a bit much." Nick said.  In the end, he was right, the taco with guacamole was good but a bit much, shoulda listened to the boss.  When he came back, I told him he was right.  The chips and salsa were also off the hook.  Chips hot and crispy and the salsa was very fresh.  The Giants game was on, and we won, and we beat the Dodgers, that my friend is what we call a perfect Sunday.
author: Shane Y.

description: have it "nicks way" great tacos, i recommend the baja fish tacos are excellent.  the margaritas have enough liquor in them you get what you payed for this is not  chillis or apple-bees.  great bar, alot of TV screens with the latest stuff on .
author: Louis B.

description:
This is a very cool sports bar / taco shop, BUT:

With respect to the "San Diego burrito" on the menu, it's a let-down. They get the size and shape right, and there's no rice in sight, but San Diego natives seeking food tube nirvana will be disappointed by at least three attributes of this offering: (1) the carne asada is bland by SD standards, (2) they use the wrong kind of flour tortilla, and (3) they encase the thing in aluminum foil, Mission-style. Close, but no cigar.

The nearest legit San Diego burrito to the City still seems to be at Adalberto's in Fairfield. :(
author: Matthew N.

description: I give these guys 5 stars for overall performance.  The tacos are good (albeit not the best I've ever had in my life) but that, combined with the freindliness of the staff, puts them at 5 starts for me.
author: Robert B.

description: I love this place. From a comfortable, laid back atmosphere to super friendly staff, it's just great!  I got the vegetarian tacos which is only one but super stuffed with lettuce, pico de gallo, pinto beans, sour cream, guac, etc.  My hubby got a burrito which was also full of stuff and yummy.  Then the margaritas with lime juice and a sangria floored me.  You walk in there not expecting much, but I came out of there very satisfied and FULL!
author: Liz F.

description: hard to knock a place that was there for me on numerous occasions when I needed to catch my Montreal Canadiens games. They have the NHL package. ENOUGH SAID! There are only a select few establishments in this city who carry it, and kudos to them for that! The staff is very friendly and attentive. The tacos are decent and cheap. The only knock I can find on them is the certain level of douchebaggery who frequents this bar, but then again, it's pretty close to SF State, so I guess it's to be expected.
author: James J.

description:
Overall, this place needs to decide if it's a taco joint or a bar/sports bar.  Once that's settled, they should decide who's running the place: the bar manager(s) or Nick, who runs the kitchen.  It's a badly mixed message right now.  I won't go back while Nick is there.

If it's going to be both going forward though, Nick should stay where he belongs -- in the kitchen, making tacos.  (I.e., not pissing off the bar staff and being rude to customers in the front.)  That said, below are my main takeaways on the place:

-- Great bar staff.
-- Good drink specials.
-- So-so Mexican food.
-- Friction between Nick and bar staff that comes through to customers.
-- Didn't need the porn posted in the mens bathroom (inc. racially offensive comments re Asian women).
author: Dean V.

description: Baja Fish Tacos Nick's Way is the best fish taco ever.  It's delicious and it's so big it's a meal on its own.  I also love their very fresh and tasty salsa.  Underdog's is a great place to catch a game and enjoy a brew, or just to grub on Taco Tuesdays!
author: Anne A.

description:
im not sure if people know this, but i like to have a beer or ten once in awhile.  (laughter subsides....)

sooooooo the other night i asked my coworker if he wanted to watch the warriors game. he said underdogs. i said sure thing boss. 

the place is clean, i mean CLEAN. i was hella surprised how clean the place is. thats a good sign especially if youre gonna eat there too.

50" plasmas on every freaking wall... check
spam musubi on the menu... check
FAT pitchers of fat tire... check
omar b and jason a strolling in for drinks... check 

thats four stars right there folks.
author: Euge L.

description: One of my favorite local bars and grills to go to for Warriors games.  Although I do miss their spam musubi, I forgave them when they provided me with cheap Tecates and a big helping of chips and guacamole.  I normally get disgusted with filthy restrooms of other bars.  However, I don't mind going to the restroom repeatedly after a few beers as they are clean and have a "unique" taste in wall decor.
author: Nelson C.

description: I am soooo happy there is finally a place to get good Mexican food in the neighborhood!  I live not two blocks from Underdog's and have been meaning for the longest time to go and try Nick's crispy tacos, and now that I have I can't stop eating them!  The only thing that keeps me in check is that they're kinda pricey for tacos.  I've tried the carne asada, carnitas and the pollo, and they're all pretty good, but my fave is the pollo.  Their guacamole is awesome, too, and I like that it already comes on their tacos and you don't have to pay extra for it.  Oh, they also have corn on the cob brushed w/lime juice and then covered with some kind of cheese and a little cayenne pepper that is sooooo yummy!  It's smells a little funny, but don 't let that deter you-- it's really delicious!
author: Eileen H.

description: holy shiznits!  BAJA FISH TACO NICK'S WAY!  Go get you some! And i'm sure you will send yourself a thank you card for it!  These are the best tacos ever!  Good lawd!  They're hella good! I was full after having two...but after a few more beers...I couldn't get them tacos out of my head...so I asked the waitress for another!  Hahahaha!  Damn!  I straight stuffed myself!  But it was sooooo good!  Nice spot to chill...great tacos...cool bar...very friendly service...and if you'd rather watch the 9er game and not the patriots, the waitresses will even give you the remote for the tv if you ask! Ha! I only wish they had more tables...but it's all good. Space is limited.
author: Peter M.

description:
i finally have tried an infamous nick's taco -- long overdue.  

we shared baja style and shrimp tacos, both nick's way.

yum.
author: Sheri N.

description: really good nachos and beer specials, just wish that all of their tvs were the same size, in the case that your team is on one of those.
author: Patty C.

description: oh man... this the spot for all your sports games and food... remember they have bomb ass super nahco, $1 tacos, $3 beer and barona.... 151 n corona... drank like 4 of them, got me f up big time... but i haven't been here for awhile.. wonder if its still the same...
author: JessePanda C.

description: Stopped in for lunch after wandering around Golden Gate Park.  Atmosphere was very casual and comfortable.  My husband ordered a quesadilla which was the thickest I've seen (which he devoured) and I LOVED the chicken tortilla soup.  Delicious :)
author: Tara G.

description:
There are not a lot of things I wouldn't do for a Pescado Taco, Baja Style (beer battered), Nick's Way (soft tortilla plus crispy shell). I'd like to meet this Nick, because anyone whose way is this good deserves celebrity status.

Always amusing crowd - kind of to be expected at a sports bar in the Sunset - and the Margs can be hit or miss, but the $15 bucket of beer is always on.

Word to the Wise: If you're meeting a date here (because you're obviously the kind of girl whose only dinner on any of the first 3-5 dates involves something doused in beer, often yourself included), specify address. There's another Underbones a couple blocks up Irving. And I think that one's Vegan - so although it may be just as fabulous, it can give your date the wrong idea - namely, that you're not the kind of girl sitting at a bar up the street enjoying various egg-and-butter-basted meats. Which, naturally, you are.
author: Katie C.

description: The tacos here are my favorite in the city.  We always get them to go - and eat them asap while the outer taco is still crisp!  We prefer Nick's-way chicken tacos.  Add a beer and you have the perfect meal.
author: BW A.

description:
omg their nachos were boooooooooooooomb!!!!
the cheese was soooo goooooood. theres beans and sour cream and guac and salsa!!!!

oh they had tall cans of pbr. DONE!!!!!!!!! im sold!!!!!!!!! i dont even know how much they were. only bad part was that the can wasnt fully cold. nice bartender though. chilled our glasses the best he could. although i would have prefered to just drink it straight from the can...COLD. but beggers cant be choosers.

total collegey scene though. bathroom was clean. well staffed so not a long wait. i dont know if id be a regular here, but id come back for the food.
author: A. V.

description: I love the food at Nick's Tacos.  And I love that I live less than a block away from this dreamy place.  It's totally cheap and extremely tasty.  I've taken my family, extended family, and friends here and they've all absolutely loved it, and all said that the Nick's Street Tacos, especially saying that the chicken taco is the best chicken taco they've ever had.  I get the Vegetariano tacos and they are magnificent, especially with that green salsa.  Plus really hott guys work there.
author: Rachelle P.

description: It's a great place to watch the game. It's an awesome place for tacos. It's too bad that the bartender that always wears the Michigan t-shirt is more interested in watching college football than attending to his customers.
author: Dave S.

description: Tacos "nicks way" are delish, as well as the california burrito. Get a bucket of beer and you're set.
author: Jessica W.

description: what a tasty bite!!! and the sangria was pretty good too.  It didn't have enough fruit but that is ok for the price.  I think I will go there again even though I don't really like watching sports as much as the other people there.  I got the vegi taco.  It has two shells which is interesting.  I like their sauces as well.
author: Barbara L.

description: i come here super often for their tacos and their fresca! i love them all, so refreshing and its not overly sweet which is perfect. i come here just to eat and meet up friends and not to drink or watch sports so i can't comment on that.
author: Anita L.

description:
what can i say, i love tacos, burritos,carnitas, carne asada, pico de gallo, sour cream and nachos. so much so, I was given a personalized cookbook for my birthday this year that was titled..."you won't find a taco recipe in here" cookbook. 

so on to the review, basically what everyone else says, solid tacos, both the nick's way and the street taco variety.  the nachos rival most other places.....i can put down two nick's way tacos and a ton of chips and salsa along with a couple pints and im good.  just be careful on the chips, they're brutal on the roof of your mouth if they end up vertical before you bite down again.  sadly, i can't wait to inhale the food it's happened numerous times....

solid spot during football season. all the tv's are marked w/ the game they intend to show, just don't sleep in cuz it gets packed.
author: Tim D.

description:
On examiner.com, I recently reviewed Underdog's organic hotdogs, but aside from the common name and Irving Street location, this "Underdog's" eatery is a completely different, and honestly, even more compelling reason to head over to the Sunset if you don't already live nearby.  Last September, Nick Fasanella, of Nick's Crispy Tacos fame in Russian Hill, and his friend and business partner Doug Marschke, teamed up to present all the things that a great sports bar and taco shop should have.  I'm talking about lots of flat screen TVs; local sports team memorabilia and banners; a dartboard in the front; a coin-operated free throw basketball hoop in the back; several classic arcade games like Ms. PacMan, Galaga and Centipede; a jukebox; high-top tables for adults and wooden picnic tables in the back for families with kids; casual but friendly and attentive service; a variety of Mexican, domestic, imported and micro-brewed beers; margaritas and sangria; and oh-so-tasty Cal-Mex food. 

Fasanella, who was trained at the Culinary Institute of America in New York's Hyde Park, sold his namesake eatery on Broadway in 2006 and opened The Taco Shop at Underdog's Sports Bar & Grill, his fifth restaurant venture in San Francisco.  Other local projects include Tortilla Heights on Divisadero at Bush which has strong appeal with the single set, and an Italian deli in North Beach called La Spiaggia.  Word of mouth is spreading that those beloved taco's made "Nick's Way" - one grilled crispy corn tortilla and one soft tortilla filled with fresh ingredients like steak, pork, chicken, pinto beans, pico de gallo, Monterey Jack cheese and guacamole - can now be found across town.  They also have a variety of affordable burritos and quesadillas, tortilla soup, elote con queso (white corn brushed with lime salsa and dusted with cotija cheese and cayenne pepper), nachos, chicken wings, chips and salsa, and a grilled corn and black bean taco salad.  Everything is made with local, organic ingredients for under $10, so you get good value for your buck.  No wonder this place has such a loyal following already, especially among neighborhood residents and students. 

If that's not enough, they have free Wi-Fi, frequent events and special deals. On Taco Tuesdays, grab $1 street tacos from 5:00 p.m. to 8:00 pm. Thursdays are college night, so with school I.D., get $3 well drinks after 9:00 p.m.  On Saturday, April 18th, they will televise UFC 97 Redemption at 7:00 p.m., $15 cover.  Check their web site for more happenings.

Now I'm craving a Carnitas Taco, Nick's Way.  By the way, if anyone has an allergy to peanut products, this place is peanut-free!
author: Dina B.

description: Good food, shit they even have spam musubi and hawaiin dishes. This place is great. Screens all around, pitchers of fat tire. Some dude named Euge was so drunk he bought a shot of grey goose at the end of the night and thought it was water!!! The bathrooms are right in the middle so it's kinda revealing. The seats are kinda tight so you'll be bumping elbows. So throw those bows! Otherwise great.
author: Jhoe G.

description:
nice bar, in a buzy corner off of 19th ave.......

you gotta have a pit stop and the chug pub around the cornerz gotta have some competition........

so, come have some good mex food and...

happy hr. friday....50cent maragrita shots............K
author: alex m.

description:
okay, i was checking out the pics they posted, and all i have to say is i've been here 3 times, and not once have i seen a wet t-shirt contest going on....i'm feeling rather gypped right now....that's all i'm saying...

tasty chips....check....basketball arcade game in dining area...check.....hipsters who do not have a good shooting touch trying unsuccessfully to shoot ball through basket...check....headache....check....

you know...the food is decent...the service is super friendly....not sure how people say this is the best taco joint ever, but maybe it's a drunk thing.  nevertheless....it's right by my house, the beer-battered fish wrapped in a tortilla was pretty nice.  their carnitas isn't that great.  corn with cheese and cayenne pepper was awesome, although don't forget to bring your dental floss with you.....

would i go outta my way to drive to this place?...nah....would i walk 3 blocks to this place for a burrito and elote con queso?...yesssss....
author: Miss P.

description: I used to live by Nick's Crispy Tacos, and when I moved to Outter Sunset I thought my life was over. Then I realized Underdog's has the Taco Shop! Get your tacos Nick's Way. You'll die.
author: Caitlin S.

description: Went here last night based on the Sunday Chron's write up on fish tacos. Their Baja style tacos are some of the best in SF. Worth coming back. With the added bonus of a well stocked bar where tequila is not the only drink
author: mack m.

description: Best sports bar to watch a college game. The staff can work the remotes, are happy to do it, and they got all the satellites. The tacos are killer, on par with the mish. And you can bring the kids.
author: Brandon R.

description: The food is good, the drinks are very adequate.... And it's packed...I mean sure some people go for that but I like to be able to sit somewhere not squeezed between two polo shirts shouting "wooooo!" every time they take a drink. There are better cheaper bars. If you want food go when it's not busy.
author: Nicholas J.

description: Okay, so I moved up here a few years ago from San Diego and hadn't been able to find good Mexican food that rivaled what I was used to down there....until yesterday at The Taco Shop! Absolutely delicious tacos - I had a carne asada and a carnitas taco done Nick's Way. Washed them down with a tasty margarita.Very friendly and helpful staff/bartenders! Great find!
author: Michael R.

description: pretty cool place, not as good of tacos as nicks crispy.  Setup kinda sucks for watching football unless you can get a seat at the bar otherwise in the back kinda sucks.  Aight place thou.
author: christopher h.

description: Went here with a super large group to watch the Euro Cup final game. The event organizer had told the bar we'd be there (around 60 of us) and they assured us they could accommodate the group. Bar service was great, but they had literally one dude cooking food for an overcrowded bar. Took an hour and a half to get a burger and a hot dog....not cool. If I go back I'll stick to drinks only and spend my food dollars elsewhere.
author: Beth T.

description:
In the simplest words possible, tacos are my jam. While the majority of the time I am strictly drawn to whole-in-the-wall, super authentic joints, Nicks is definitely an impressively random and delicious spot! Of course, one can't really compare it to what can be found in the mission but hey, we're talking bout the Sunset here, kinda different demographic. 

All their tacos are bomb. gotta get em nicks way, of course, and in opinion the fish and carne asada are the best. the steak quesadilla is crazy good too, with some kinda flakey and greasy tortilla ive never experienced before. the burritos are solid as well and i havent found too many places that serve a legit California burrito either, (not quite like the ones in SD but pretty damn good).

Good place to watch a game. beer selection is just aight, but nothing to complain about. my buddy did order a whiskey ginger and they put gin in it by accident, maybe the ole Seagrams mistake? dunno. All in all, if your feeling a hankering for some mexican food and beer but dont wanna treck to the mission definitely hit up Nicks. you won't regret it!
author: j b.

description:
pushed up against a wall is not how i like to spend my saturday night
and that's exactly how i spend a whole fifteen minutes in this "sports bar" before it was so time to get the hell of there. general crowd appeared to be a bunch of punk asses that are totally fine with knocking drinks on strangers without even apologizing, which totally happened! i don't make this up, I swear. 
I can't even imagine watching a game at this place, thank goodness i have all the sports networks at home 
i would like to give this place two stars because its located in the sunset and I can never completely hate on 19th, but me up against the wall, way uncool.
author: Justine R.

description: My coworkers and I used to come here after work and visit our favorite bartender Erika, but I recently discovered she was let go.  We decided to keep coming but now the atmosphere is different.  The other main bartender (some too-cool-for-school kinda guy) makes weak drinks and tries to hit on every woman that walks through the door.  The popcorn chicken is still delicious, but I am very disappointed that our once favorite dive bar has become just another weak sports bar.
author: Juanita S.

description: The best Tacos outside of the Mission!  I am not a sports bar kind of girl but I crave these tacos.  The carne asada and the fish tacos are the bomb especially topped with the sauces they provide.  Yum!  The chips and guacamole are awesome too.
author: Vera B.

description: This place is a fantasy for me come true, the fusion of a sports bar with a taqueria. The house margs are top notch, made with good pure shootable tequila and fresh lime.  A righteous tequila selection, may I recommend Chinaco Reposado?  And the tacos are outstanding. Nick's way of course. Nick was sincerely hospitable, which is very hard to find these days and makes a man feel good about supporting the business. Wish I lived closer, there's still tacos to be tried.....oh and they have a basketball game, just don't bet the guy in the kitchen. He should probably be on the Warriors.
author: Mike B.

description: I was a bit skeptical at first when they became "The Taco Shop," but I like them even better now! The tacos taste great, and I love their guac. Stick to the $2 tecates if you want to keep your tab in check.
author: Bill K.

description:
Overall:  How can you NOT love this place?  The tacos are to die for, the drinks are mixed/poured perfectly every time, the staff is friendly without that "I am better than you" attitude that WAY too many bartenders and servers have in San Francisco these days.  

The Place:  The TVs are always on and tuned to a variety of channels, so you never have to be stuck in front of a boring-ass basketball game that just isn't your thing.  The bartenders will also change the channel on request if you're the only one watching or if everyone agrees on the change.  I can almost always find a seat at the bar, and the picnic tables in back are an awesome way to sit with a few strangers and make some new friends.  Doug is doing an awesome job running the place, and it shows in the people he hires, the commitment to quality, and the fair prices rather than gouging his customers.

The Food:  The fish burrito is delicious and fresh - with crispy cabbage and literally no grease.  The chips are addictive like whoa and the salsas are delish.  The tacos, it goes without saying, are absolutely incredible and in a league of their own in quality and style.  I have tried every version of taco and have never been disappointed in a single bite.  They are so filling that I generally have to stick with the veggie taco just so I'm sure I'll finish it all!  The roasted corn salad is an awesome surprise - huge bowl of fresh goodies, beans, delish corn, and a good helping of fresh fish.  I mean, come on, what bar do you know whose fish of the day is actually edible, nevermind  is salmon or mahi mahi most days??  This menu is not kidding around, and I have witnessed so many people come in JUST to get food - can you name any other bar that is frequented even by those who don't drink?  Last but not least, the elote....oooohhhh the elote....it is SO yummy and melty and tasty - without just being pure grease and fat.  I literally could eat one with every meal.  TRY IT.

The Drinks:  I've had cosmos, G&Ts, beer, margaritas, sangria, kamikazes, lemon drops, Manhattans, etc. here and every drink has been stellar.  The staff is knowledgeable and always full of suggestions if you're stuck on deciding.  The best part is that even if I have a few drinks, my bill is always reasonable at the end.  Smart on their part, because I can afford to keep coming back!!!!!!!!!!

I may be biased, as you might be able to tell, but I would never in a million years give a review that was not factual and honest!
author: Vanessa H.

description: love the carne asada quesadilla! the meat is tender, the salsa and pico de gallo super flavorful and has just the right amount of acid, and the tortilla is always grilled to perfection. the carnita tacos are awesome also.
author: Robbie R.

description:
oops.. so i wrote a review for the wrong underdog..  didn't realize that there were two on irving.. haha

two friends and i wanted to stop by a bar or something before we headed to classic bowl.. i've never been here so yea why not?.. they don't have mojitos! =( so i got the margaritas.. boy was that thing strong!!! also got the chips and salsa..but it wasn't really like salsa cuz they just sprinkled tomatoes on the chips and gave us salsa verde..

oh n my friend wanted beer but they ran out of a lot, well more like pretty much everything of the ones on tap.. on a saturday night...
author: JUDY L.

description:
review only based on nights when they order pride/ufc fights.

this place is a great place to watch a fight and here's why:

1.they have a thin bar with rows of flat screens over the bar.  meaning you can't get smashed behind tons of people and loose a clear view of the screen.

2. the food is decent for a sunset bar and they have free popcorn

3. yes there are a good amount of asian people, but on a fight night it wasn't overwhelming

4. it is in stumbling distance to my house so after a night of screaming and drinking i can get home in one piece.

5. the bartenders are awesome and the owner was cool. every hour they all grouped up and did a shot together.

6. i never had to wait for a drink. the bartender actually remembered what i was drinking and always offered to make me another drink when i was running low...which looking back was seriously dangerous :)

7. there aren't a ton of meat heads freaking out and then trying to start their own "match" at the end of the night

cool nice spot to watch a fight with the roomies :)
author: rachel c.

description:
Let me just start by saying that the inner sunset has some great food, and I am happy to live around the corner from this joint. 

BAJA STYLE, NICK'S WAY IS THE BEST. 

I've tried other tacos, they're great, but this is perfection. 

Thank you, Nick for blessing the sunset with a bar with excellent food, it was about time....
author: Ally O.

description: I know this place has a ton of reviews, and of course the food here is supper yummy , it goes with out saying! What I need to talk about is the staff...every single time I am in UnderDogs i am really impressed with how nice the staff is and how quick the service is! even when it's packed they are on it! Good job guys!
author: Amy E.

description: Nachos, beer, mixed drinks, the game on a flat screen TV. All a guy needs to sustain himself for a couple hours. This place is awesome! Lots of Warrior fans. I remember watching the Dubs' beating the Lakers in a very exciting game and the whole bar going crazy. During commercials, try the basketball arcade game. If you make enough points, you get a free game.
author: Jonathan L.

description: The tacos here are nicely designed.  Usually, my tacos always fall apart at a taqueria.  At Underdogs, there is a hard AND soft shell which helps the tacos stay together.  On top of all that, they taste delicious!!! beer and tacos, what more can you ask for?
author: Cee L.

description: I've gotta say that the Taco's are insane.  The best I've had in a long time.  But they're 5 bucks each! Jeeze! 10 bucks for two tacos is way too much.  The other issue is that I hate the smell of pine oil.  The smell reminds me of the transbay terminal.
author: Mike M.

description: Edit: After getting a comment from the owners I feel that I may have been a little harsh with my previous post. One thing that made me increase my rating is how the owners care for their customers. I do plan to come here again and will update my post accordingly but any owner that cares about his/her business while taking care of it's patrons is a winner in my book.
author: Jason Y.

description:
i eat here 2 or 3 times a week.
convenient, delicious, casual.
nick is the dude.
author: william m.

description: Underdog is probably the best bar in the sunset. It's so CLEAN!!!!!!! Seriously... i've never seen a bar in the sunset this clean before.. many many flat screen TV. I've have never had a dull moment here before.. Taco tuesdays are the best..$1 tacos and $2 beers! You can't beat it! SERIOUSLY!
author: Brian P.

description: Great bar. Always lively and I have always find the staff to be friendly and efficient. Love the tacos and especially the eloites. LOVE them. Good chips and salsa too. All around a fun place to have a few beers, some tacos etc and chill out. I go here quite often and have not been disappointed yet
author: Cate H.

description:
Taco Bell serves better tacos.

For a place that has "Taco Shop" in its name, you'd think the tacos would be a safe order. They're pretty disgusting!

As far as bars are concerned, it's your typical sports bar - 3 stars.
author: David S.

description:
this is the best taco ive ever had.  no lie.  the carnitas taco, add some of the red salsa, is so perfect.  its a soft tortilla on the outside, crunchy on the inside, and just loaded with perfection on top.  the carne asada is also good, i just happen to like carnitas better.

also had a pretty damn decent margarita here as well...they have a good selection of agave.  definitely coming back here for some mexican breakfast and college football some saturday morning...whos comin with me!?
author: Robert S.

description: the tacos are amazing! Nick's way is the best! service is fast and attentive, just a busy place with super laid back bar and atmosphere.
author: Sharon C.

description: Great place with amazing tacos.  I tried the fish taco and was very very good!! Try it!
author: Cristobal C.

description: Mm mm mmm. Way better than the nicks location on broadway. Amazing crunchy fish taco. Crave it on a regular basis!
author: Erica L.

description: I've been meaning to try these tacos for MONTHS after reading the review in 7x7s Top 100 and it was well worth the wait. Some of the tastiest tacos I've EVER had!  I had the carne asada and the pescado tacos, both Nicks Way, and it was TOTALLY worth the 9.50. It's a good thing I don't live anywhere near this place because I'd probably wind up eating here far to often!
author: DC S.

description: Shoot me if I'm biased, but I used to work here back in the day and left right when it was switching over to new management and Nick's Crispy Tacos were implemented.  I am very VERY happy to know miss Jamie is still here, love you girl, and Eric is a super pro bar manager. I'm pleasantly surprised the way the staff and management work together and flow. The bar itself is huge and fabulous with some of my old favorite selections and some new that I'll have to go back and try.  Beer is always cold, Taco's are always great, and service is quick. I came here not too long ago when it was packed like crazy, and still got service super quick. I should have got the waitresses name, she was unbelievable. My friends and I love this place, and if I can work here again I would in a heartbeat.
author: Loli G.

description: Went there for dinner last weekend with my roommates and their friends. This place is the best....everything is fresh and tasty. And the service was great.....Mark was absolutely fantastic.....can't wait to go back and try everything on their menu....and they are open late
author: Vik L.

description: Thank you dear God. Now I don't have to trek to Polk street to have these Tacos. As many reviews have already stated that Nick formerly of Nicks Crispy Tacos has taken over this outer sunset sports bar and brought over the tasty treats that made the Polk street spot such a favorite. I haven't had the burrito's yet but that's on the list. Tuesdays they have a Taco special from 6pm. $1 Mexican style Tacos till 10pm. That is a deal you cannot beat.
author: medfly A.

description: I live in the neighborhood.  I love both Taco and beer, soo I frequent this place very often.  I have tried Fish and Chicken Tacos and I like the chicken better.  I go there and order chips, chicken Taco and beer that keeps me very happy :-)
author: Sunil P.

description:
Mr Chao is very impressed with Taco Tuesdays.  Underdogs has a huge selection of hot sauces..which vary from the mild Tabasco to some insane *AND OBSCURE* hot sauces.   Beer prices are cheap, the regulars are friendly, and best of all...the bathrooms are CLEAN.  

Mr Chao recommends bringing a few friends and have a good time.
author: Mister Chao ..

description: Yeeeeeeaaaaahhhh underdog sucks. We came in and every bartender was a dick. On "1 dollar Margarita night " they cut you off at 3. The manager is an idiot and obviously has NO idea how to run a business. Because of the extremely rude service I am going to stop coming here every weekend and spending 20 dollars for every 6 people i bring. Good job treating ur customers like crap and talking crap about them 2 feet away becuase they brought straws (which ur employee encouraged us to bring). Giving them 2 less margaritas saves you a lot of money especially when they NEVER come back. My advice to the real manager is to fire that scrub who thinks he knows what hes doing and hire someone who didnt get last in the sf special olympics 100 meter dash (the easiest to win). I told this guy "your treating us unfairly and losing a lot of business because of your behavior" and his response was "have a good night." Moral of the story: hire a "manager" that wont  drive your bottom line down. Bad business. Its cool if he can count cash at the end of the night and create a work schedule for the employees! You really are horrible at A. Insuring your customers enjoy themselves B. making them want to come back C. Spend money. We had 5 orders of food and 4 drink orders on the way when we ABORTED them because we were DISGUSTED with the service. Sarah is an awesome bartender. We have come many nights and BLEW cash at this place and gave her a fat tip. Never again. Btw I would of given it 5 stars but you really blew it tonight because the food is good and 1 dollar margaritas are a steal. If you want to limit people on how many drinks they have and in turn how many tacos they order thats fine. But that is not how you become an elite establishment. You do it by making your customers enjoy themselves and spreading the word. I will no longer be doing either of those things.  I would LOVE to sit down with the real manager or the owner and let them know what they are doing wrong and what would help them MAKE MORE MONEY. PS I have an MBA from USF and managed an eating establishment for 4 years while i was in school. I doubled their gross revenue and created a system that encouraged repeat customers to recommend peers. Good job alienating a loyal customer and someone who surely helped you thrive. Good day.
author: andrew b.

description:
Great Bar, Great Tacos, Great Service!  

Unless you get it TO-GO.  Tacos still good, just takes FOREVER, which defeats the point of take out.
author: Ruby F.

description: I finally ate the tacos here for taco tuesday and they were not that great.   Each street taco was $1 so I guess its a deal cuz the are normally 3 for $5.  I ate 10 tacos then went to eat pho afterwards.  I miss the good old days when $1 tacos were actual big tacos.  None of this dinky whoredourves crap.  The regular nick's taco was $5!  I will never in my fat lifetime pay $5 for a taco when I can get a burrito for $4.  Fat people know who to eat and budget.
author: Fatty A.

description: It's a dude fest in here...which makes it a real sports bar i guess.  Be sure you try their nachos here......all ingredients made by the order.....so good....and actually...this place is pretty clean.
author: Jenny K.

description: Rather family-friendly, Underdogs is clean and spacious.  I went there on a Sunday night with friends and we were greeted by an big and intimidating-at-first waiter who turned out to be super friendly and helpful.   Since it was our first time, he walked us through the menu and recommended us drinks.  The food wasn't extremely impressive but the drinks and service were great!
author: Helen C.

description:
it's good eating. had the carne asada and chicken taco. quality of food stayed true to Nick's Crispy Tacos reputation.

portions are definitely smaller than nick's. service varies depending on the server. our first server was a short haired red head or brunette (hard to tell with the dim lighting) and she looked like absolutely miserable and really ignored us during most of our meal. while she went on her smoke break, the guy in the green shirt, was more attentive and actually asked if we wanted anything else.
author: Bonnie Y.

description: I was glad to find Nick (original Nicks Way taco) behind the bar and in the kitchen at THE TACO SHOP, used to see him at the one on Polk Street and was sad when he left ...These are the best tacos in the city!   I know that the Mission has it's own "authentic" Mexican food.  But for quality of ingredients Taco Shop rocks...and we all love Nicks big personality in the place.
author: Daniel D.

description: Tacos (Nick's way), draft beer, HD sports. Need I say more?
author: Maximillian M.

description:
We stumbled upon this place during a visit to Cal Academy. We took a break for lunch and since it was a beautiful 70 degree day (in SF! in January!) we decided to leave the museum to get our food (plus the cafeteria seems overpriced). After turning on Irving from 19th, we spotted the pizza place across the street, then saw "Sports Bar & Grill" and "Taco Stop". We decided to go with Underdog's. I had a delicious cold Blue Moon beer that really hit the spot after being in the sun. For lunch, I ordered the veggie taco and the grilled fish taco. They brought out chips covered with what looked like homemade salsa. The chips were nice and crunchy and the salsa was good, so we quickly devoured them. The tacos themselves were big - the tortillas are probably regular-sized corn tortillas, but they are overstuffed and wrapped in paper so they don't fall apart. I went for the veggie taco first, which had a generous amount of guacamole smooshed on top. It was made Nick's way (one tortilla is crispy fried, the other is soft) and so good. The fish taco was also really good, but surprising spicy. It made me sweat, but luckily the beer and lots of water helped. My lunchmates all enjoyed their food and beverages. The bartenders were all very friendly and helpful too. What a lucky find. I'm psyched to have found a great place to grab a bite within walking distance of GG Park.

Semi-update: We went back 2 days later because I was obsessing about their salsa and veg tacos. This time Nick was there, and he was super friendly, chatting with everyone. I also tried a margarita and it was nice and strong.
author: Caroline R.

description: awesome carne asada and chicken tacos!  the sangria is not the best i have ever had .. but the $2 happy hour deals for the fresh tacos are sweet!
author: Janice M.

description: I'm a regular there and know some of the wait staff. As kind as they are, their service is reliably bad. Maybe it's because it's always busy and they're somewhat distracted? Maybe they're forgetful? Whatever it is, it takes FOREVER sometimes to get your food. Occasionally you have to re-place an order, and occasionally you only receive part of your order. That said, it's a great laid back atmosphere, and the food is EXCELLENT. It's worth the wait if you're in no hurry, and want to kick back with a bucket of beers and some tacos. It's not authentic mexican taco shop style, but its in another league altogether.
author: Vincent C.

description: This is a good spot to hit up when watching a game. Flat screens everywhere and a bunch of people to cheer with or against.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
taco tuesday!  
hmmm... pretty chill bar. diverse crowd.  excellent attentive bartender.  low level music, tvs playing nba, tables in the back area, and in front of the bar.  ur more likely to be humming the "cheers" theme song than *breaks beer bottle* here.  its that cool...

the tab for two:  $22.
-one beer battered fish taco (
-one carne asada taco, nicks way
-3 carne asada street tacos
-2 chicken street tacos
-1 carnitas street taco
-chips n salsa
-snakebite

skip the mini tacos, they're alright, and order four fish tacos for urself.
author: Ethan L.

description:
do you ever have one of those days where your mind seems to wander away & you can't get your shit together? like when you wake up late for work & mean to toss a bag of bagels on the counter but end up tossing your plate instead? today is one of those days.

or like when you mean to finally go check out underdog's for a big juicy weiner (hehe) & you wander into the sports bar instead? then you proceed to ask the bartender if that giant punch bowl of red goodness is jungle juice when it is so obviously sangria & she raises her eyebrows at you & looks at you like you have three heads?

i have these moments a lot.
they have good tacos.
author: Lizzy L.

description: I came to this place because my friends wanted to watch the Giants game. We had a good time the first time and the drinks were cheap. Unfortunately their lack of communication has me pissed off at this place. I went to the bar after the Giants won the World Series for a round of shots for my friends. I ordered 6 shots of patron and was charged for eight. The bartender even told me how much it was going to be and then charged me a different price. I am usually more careful about looking at the bill before signing it, but I was just so excited that the Giants won. So I called the next morning to speak with one of the servers and he said he saw that I was overcharged and would relay the information to his boss. I gave them two days and didn't hear anything back from them and called again. Again the same response was I do not have the authority to take care of this matter and he said he would talk to his partner about it. No call back, so I call again and they have my number in the system as well as my order number. Finally after like a week of hassle I get a call back that I can get my refund. The person also said next time to figure catch the mistake that night as if I waited a long time to contact them.The excuse was hectic due to the Giants game. I don't know if I want to come back here.
author: Stephanie L.

description: OK non-traditional tacos.  I'm pretty close to this place. For my preference I'd rather drive down to the Mission or wait till I go to work in the Silicon Valley and hit up East San Jose.  La Taqueria has a similar style and it blows the doors out of this place.  I grew up in a predominately Mexican town and so I'm use to the real deal.  My "white-washed" friends who are from the east coast love this place.   You won't find Mexicans here.   Looks like they want to blend in the sports crowd into this place. If you want to catch a big game....  this place should be considered.
author: Demanding T.

description: Not a bad place to get drunk. The neighborhood empties out later in the evening so you don't have to fight for parking. Theres a 50inch tv on each wall, they got it covered. The bar is clean and theres even a handicap section at the bar for short peoples.
author: Wil M.

description: Holy corngasm Batman! Elote con queso! It's corn, rolled in cheese and cayenne pepper! Holy Jeebus I could eat that every day! My new order is 1 pescado nicks way and 1 elote con queso please!
author: Melanie V.

description: Really good, messy tacos. Love the "Nick's way" taco style, one crunchy and one soft tortilla. You can sit at the bar or tables, they will come take your order (I was confused first time). Nice local crowd for watching ballgames.
author: L J.

description: This place was packed when I went in.  Friendly bartenders and lots of 'em so I didn't have to wait at all to get served.  And did I mention they are HOT?  The owners are awesome and they make great use of space.  Their menu looks good, although I haven't eaten there yet.  Seems like a great place to chill with some buddies and watch the game!
author: Nicci S.

description: My friend took me here and what I like best is the atmosphere. It's a good place to take the kids and it's a good place to get a drink after work. I'm not a super-huge Mexican food fan but it was good nonetheless. I did notice, however, that people were sort of waiting around for tables. The service wasn't spectacular, either. Our server checked on us only once between giving us our drinks and delivering our food - and we were sitting at the bar. I had to flag down other servers to refill my drink, which is a HUGE pet peeve of mine. That said, I'd go back.
author: Elle L.

description:
i was hanging out with a friend who lives in the Sunset and he took me to Underdogs for something new.
the bar is as most have described - not big, so not many tables if you're going in as a group. we sat at the bar so were able to sit right away. the service was great and they bar-peeps were very attentive, cleaning up after our spills, making sure we had everything - but not in an annoying way.

there are tons of HD TVs lining the walls playing all sorts of sports madness. there were several several soccer games playing on the screens being watched by many including a bunch of die-hard fans of one of the teams who would go crazy when the team scored.

we started off with a basket of chips and salsa which were very good. the salsa was a little different recipe that the norm and they have some special mixes in squeeze bottles which should be tried. for our main course, we each had three beers, a taco and the chicken salad. the taco was very good, and i wish i could find similar quality here in the 'Loin where i live. Negra Modelo with lime is always good. we both left extremely satiated for $20 each.

a side benefit is that they have several cocktail-style classic video games in the place. Pac Mac and Galaga are some of the titles.
author: FrOg SoU P.

description: Came here to watch a game & had a good time - large hdtv's that are placed throughout the room so everyone has a good view, reasonably priced drinks compared to other bars, and delicious carne asada & fish tacos! The waitress was pretty attentive considering the crowd. I'll definitely be back for more games and to try more items from their menu.
author: Jane K.

description: Having just had some good ass fish tacos from another spot the previous day, my and bf and I were on a mission to find a place that that had equally good fish tacos more closer to home.  Thank goodness for my sister, my go to person for good eats in the city.  She recommended Nick's Crispy Tacos but informed me that they served it here at Underdogs, and added to be sure to ask for it "Nick's way."  While different from what we previously had, it definitely was good!  The guy my bf ordered from suggested to eat it with their sauce (a sort of mildly spicy salsa) and he was right!  The fish is a pretty good size (covered in batter and deep fried) wrapped with both crunchy and soft tortillas, topped with a generous amount of guacamole.  One is good for a snack, but two could be good enough for a meal.  It's $5, but worth it.  I would come back for more!  On a side note, this place is a sports bar off Irving and this area is pretty busy, so parking could be an issue.
author: Tess E.

description:
This place was terrible. I'm so disappointed. Gross tacos and burrito that took for-frickin-ever. All of Nick's other restaurants are great, but stay away from this one. It was so bad that I'm yelping from my iPhone cause I couldn't wait until I was home. More details later...

...details:  

1)  We waiting at least 10 minutes to get service, and finally had to ask for our server from the bartender.
2)  We eventually got cokes/diet cokes.  They brought us approximately a thimble full, and then never came back to refill it...not one single time during the hour+ that we were there.
3)  I ordered a fish burrito (maybe not my best order ever, but I was hungover and craving it), and the BF ordered beef and fish tacos.  THIRTY minutes later, chips and salsa done and no drink refill in sight, we still don't have our burrito/tacos.  How long does it take to throw some ingredients in a tortilla, peeps?  Finally, we ask the bartender (again) where our food is.
4)  Magically, our food arrives 2 minutes later.  Starving, we immediately dig in.  My burrito is dis-gus-ting.  Not only is it a shrimp (not fish) burrito (and shrimp are beyond terrible in a burrito, methinks), but it is completely soggy and mushy...like it's been sitting on a counter, wrapped in foil, for the past 30 minutes.  Maybe cause it had been?  And the tacos were tres tres TRES mediocre.
5)  After picking through my burritomush, I give up and we try to leave...but guess what?  We can't find our server!!!  Oh my gosh!!!  Who would have thought that would happen!?!?  We pay the bartender (poor guy) and leave.

The end.  

I hope these are just growing pains and that this place figures it out and gets better.  Fingers crossed.
author: Dale M.

description: I had the Baja fish taco and the grilled fish taco, both Nick's way, and they were honestly the best tacos I've ever had. I enjoyed the Baja fish taco better, with its crispy batter coating and moist fish. It was cooked just perfectly. If you have the fish tacos, you must have it Nick's way. The contrast of a crispy tortilla wrapped by a soft tortilla is just amazing. Their tomato salsa was very fresh and loaded with ripe tomatos, and the same goes for their guacamole. They use quality ingredients and cook everything just perfectly.
author: Michael F.

description:
What can I say? I LOVE this place! Although their tacos seem to be their claim to fame, when you finally step out of the taco box you will discover a menu of delicious goodness. I bring all my visiting out of towners here and they always want to go back a second time before they go home. 

I will say I was a little sad after they changed 50 cent margaritas on Fridays to 2 for 1s...but really...can you blame them? 

I'll pretend to watch sports any day for a little Underdogs!!
author: K F.

description:
oh my god, i love underdogs. i go here every chance i can get. the tacos and chicken tortilla soup (and whatever those sauces that they give you are ) are delicious. Drinks are pretty standard pricewise except for margarita fridays where between 6-6:30 (i think) they do margaritas for $1! ONE DOLLAR. the people here are nice and pretty efficient, although sometimes the food takes some time.
The other Nick's tacos was a HUGE disappointment. Go to this one instead, its worth the journey.
author: Alyssa P.

description:
Damn you night classes for depriving me of great NBA viewing at Underdog's!

I have been wanting to check out this bar for some time but haven't had the chance due to night classes.  Fortunately for me, my class was canceled, which left my night open for TNT doubleheader.  Only problem: no one was free to go.  However, my buddy Timmon, being the big basketball fan he is, found it very hard to pass it up.  So we left it up to fate: Heads = class, Tails = Underdog's.  Underdog's won, but his girlfriend seemed kind of mad at me for putting the idea in his head since he should've been going to class.  So since this decision got us on her bad side, we figured this bar better be pretty damn awesome.

This bar really didn't disappoint.  We were able to find a table against the wall right in front of one of the TV's so we had a perfect view.  We pick up the menus and one of the female bartenders was nice enough to come over and say hi even though we weren't in her area.  I wasn't really planning on eating since I was supposed to meet up with some friends later to eat, but I couldn't resist getting some street tacos.  Man those were pretty damn good.  My friend Marc had a carne asada burrito and looked like he was in heaven.  I think I gotta try theirs next time.

It's like no sports bar is complete without the basketball arcade game.  I have no idea how much money we put into that machine but it was pretty damn awesome.  My Denver Nuggets lost that night, unfortunately, but we still had a good time.
author: Joel J.

description:
After trying all their tacos, here's a round up...

Chicken, Carne Asada, and Pork are the best tacos I've ever had.
The fish and the shrimp tacos just don't taste as good. I don't know if it's because they were semi-cold when I got them or because it's harder to work with.

Chips and Salsa are still really fresh here.

I commented in a previous post how the bathroom stinks. Well, they kept mopping it this past Friday to try and kept it clean. A+

The service here is always top notch. They guys/girls always come by to clean up the table and ask if we need anything.

This is one of the prime Friday hotspots in the Sunset.
author: Brian W.

description: Oh, god!  This is heaven squeezed between two tortillas.  We ordered Baja Pescado and Carne Asada tacos ("Nick's Way) and we split an order of nachos.  The tacos were HUGE and scrumptious.  The nachos were great, too.  I can't wait to go back for the Taco Tuesdays and the $.50 margaritas on Thursdays.  I may never have to leave the Sunset now.
author: Cristina S.

description: i stopped by for some crispy tacos and nachos. they lived up to the reputation.
author: Ameer N.

description: The food is high quality and the prices are reasonable.  The staff is very nice, (every single one of the young ladies working there is lovely) service fast, and nick is a decent guy who likes to come out and glad hand the customers.  The make a great fresh margarita, and they serve big daddy - its places like this that make the City a special place to live in.
author: Helmut S.

description: I thought this was a pretty cool bar, but hella dark and it was hot as hell cuz it was a hot day and there were a bunch of ppl in the bar too.  drinks are not bad, and one of the bartenders was pretty fine. =)
author: Jonathan W.

description: Pretty cool bar, but if you are looking to go there to watch a fight/game, don't expect a great picture quality.  I went to watch a fight there once and the image was very pixelated.  I'm thinking they use a Slingbox.  Who knows . . . but they don't charge cover which is AWESOME!  They have free popcorn!  I guess you can tell that I'm a whore for free stuff!  Free popcorn and free viewings for games/fights?  Count me in!  All they need now is free beer!
author: Manton R.

description: Wish their was NEGATIVE Stars, would be more appropriate...  Went there for the first and LAST time on father's day for what I though would be some great mexican food.  Placed our order to go, and the waitress didn't even write our order down, just walked away.  Should have known then that something was wrong.  I guess she missed her daily dosage of ginko biloba because when we got home none of the food was correct!!  And honestly after the first bite, when we noticed it wasn't the way we ordered it, well- it was unedible to say the least...  Wasted our money, wasted our time, ruined our day- don't ruin yours this place is a joke.  Maybe if we had stuck around and had a bunch of drinks before we ate we wouldn't have noticed that our order was all jacked up.  Maybe that is why some of these other reviews are so good-Don't be Fooled.  Ended up driving back into downtown to get some REAL Mexican food.  Don't waste your time!!  Avoid this place like the plague...
author: Concerned C.

description: Cool place for a drink or to check out UFC/ Pride FC ( RIP?) fights. The staff is very attentinve the food is good and this place is CLEAN. I've been there mostly to watch MMA events and the crowd is alot cooler then most of the people at the live events. This place is official.
author: Fresh Young Balki B.

description: Tacos Nick's Way are great.  Hard to pass up the carnitas and Baja fish tacos.  Guac rocks! Young crowd and some oldsters like us.  Casual and friendly service.
author: Herbert M.

description: This place was pretty amazing! I have been trying to go for a good couple months. The pitchers of beer were not expensive, the staff was all really nice. There was a group of five of us and we all got tacos..... AMAZING!! This may be my fav spot in the sunset!! I believe we came up all together that the shrimp tacos....are the best!!!
author: Barbie H.

description:
