I got contacted by a guy from Nick's shortly after my negative review. He said they are aware that the takeout thing is a sore spot, and they're working on it. 

I tried them again tonight, and I can happily say that it was an in-and-out experience! Way to go, guys, and thanks for keeping in touch with the people!
author: Andy F.

description: As other yelpers mentioned, plasmas tvs everywhere. Good selection of food from various hotdogs to some hawaiian dishes. Prices are fair for drinks and you get to watch UFC fights here! Clean place in the Sunset district that's great to go with friends to catch ball games and hang out.
author: Andrew L.

description: If you are looking for a wild, trendy, classy place, this is probably not for you. If you are looking for a chill sports bar with decent food and huge plasmas, this is the place for you. I recommend the loco moco and the spam musubi's. It's clean and the people there are generally friendly.
author: Tommy Y.

description: This is one of those great places that you happen to walk by and just wander in for the vibe it's giving out.  Wife and I watched a game on many of the tv's (great volume balance between the ambient noise).  Ordered a couple beers, veggie taco and got a free basket of chips and salsa.  Chips were nice and warm, salty and the fresh salsa were an awesome touch with my Corona.  Great taco too - fresh ingredients and a ton of guac...that's a surprise.  Def. going back for those days you want to just kick back with a group of friends and watch a game.  The food pushes this place into a regular spot I look forward to visiting.
author: Sheetal S.

description: I had been wanting to try their tacos based on their reviews on yelp . I live close to the restaurant, so picked some to go on my way home from work . Yes the food was amazing , except that I was highly disappointed towards the end ! I found a short thick hair in my food. For me personally that's a total turnoff and  I was trying hard not to throw up. I know for a fact that it wasn't my hair since I have long fine curly hair and that hair was short and thick :(...
author: Monica R B.

description: God, I love this place. The food is AWESOME. I've been addicted to Nick's tacos ever since I tried them. (The nachos and everything else is awesome too.)  My favorites are the Baja fish taco, either "Nick's way" or not, and the carnitas taco, which comes Nick's way. Also, I'm addicted to the orange salsa. Not sure exactly what it is - roasted tomato or something? All I know is I love to smother the chips and my tacos with it. I love the picnic table seating in the back and the friendly service. Not a huge sports fan, but I can get into it sometimes, and it's a cool place to catch a game. Only qualm is the lack of seating and wait when it's really busy, so it's best to go on the off hours or arrive early if you wanna catch a big game. Ok, one other small qualm is the somewhat confusing / slightly inconsistent service. It seems that the waitresses all sort of pitch in and you might get served by like three different people. Not a huge deal. I've met Nick, the owner, and he's a really chill, down-to-earth, nice guy who obviously knows how to make a kick-ass taco. The Friday evening 50 cent margaritas for thirty minutes is a must-do as well. Yay, Underdogs!!!
author: Lizzy R.

description: Not open on B2B, pretty lame.  With the amount of unemployed people out there these days,  you'd think they could enjoy the festivities in the park and stay open.
author: S M.

description: the food here is just assimilar to nick's...really good. nice atmosphere. it may have us crossing the park more often.
author: aidan m.

description: Everytime I come here I always look forward to their bottled salsas especially the red one. You can put it on a shoe and it would taste good. Love the atmosphere and the service. Make sure to check out taco tuesdays $1 street tacos. Definitely will be back.
author: Sammy H.

description: I started going here for the $1 street tacos on Tuesdays after my friend's started going and invited us out. I've tried the fish taco and one of their burritos and they're pretty good. They have a bunch of flat screens showing whatever games are going on. The arcade basketball game is what the hype is usually all about for us, along with the $1 tacos. Its a cool place to hang out and grab a drink and a bite with your friends. Theres other places I would go if I really wanted to just eat Mexican food, but this place is fun. Its worth a shot if you're in the area.
author: Cee D.

description: I'm so glad there is finally some "mexican" food in the Sunset. Yay! And it's good and cheap. The atmosphere is great and the staff is friendly. Def try the tacos!!
author: Lola D.

description: My buddy T-Rex practically lives here and I wouldn't doubt that he spends all his hard earned vallet parking tips at Underdog Taco.  T-Rex is very persistent and will go on and on about something until you try it.  He's been telling me that underdog's fish taco "nicks way" is the best.  I tried the taco and have to say that Nick is pretty bad ass.   I come from San Diego where the California burritos flow like red wine, so I was also surprised to hear that underdog taco keeps them in stock (unlike many establishments in Northern-California).  They always have sports on, and a good selection of beer on tap.  The bar tenders are all pretty cool.  There are a bunch of interesting folks that hang out here; especially the Asians who make shot for shot at the arcade hoop game in the corner.  Its weird how they are so good at arcade hoops. It left me in awe; and i've been to a lot of dave and busters.  If your in the Sunset check this place out
author: Ernie R.

description: Very good fish Tacos! Damn good Sangria too! Not your average taco shop.
author: Dustin H.

description: I don't know what else I can say that hasn't already been said.  Their tacos Nick's way are simply ridiculously yummy.  Yeah, they're a bit pricy if you're expecting Mexican street style tacos, i.e. some meat, onions and cabbage in a single corn tortilla but a single Nick's way taco is practically a whole meal.  Their nachos are also stupidly yummy which doesn't sound that impressive because, really, how can nachos not taste good but they manage to take it to that next step where, if you're like me, you can't help but finish every last bite even after a taco while your boyfriend hides in shame next to you as you lick the last of the fresh pico from the plate.  And that, my friends, is a true story.
author: BJ F.

description: 4 stars for a seemingly run-of-the-mill sports bar in the avenues?  You bet! First off, don't go expecting some mid-century minimalist decor.  This is a sports bar with not much to speak of in terms of decor. Of course I love the constant stream of sports on the tube there, and not just during play-offs. The food makes the difference. The chips and guacamole are ample, satisfying and delicious.  The baja fish tacos served Nick's way are outstanding and unrivaled in the city.  The margaritas are well done and unpretentious (cuz you all know that margs these days can be a little too precious sometimes).  Finally, the service is quick, on point and solicitous. I like the fact that the bartenders and servers are aware that you need your messy napkins taken away and always want to ply you with more.  It's the perfect symbiotic relationship of patron and server--they make more money when your drink is always full and you are a happy camper.  Why can't more establishments train their staff to be so aware?  My only regret in writing a glowing review is that more people go there and make it busier than it already is--not that Mission district hipsters are going to come out in droves to the hinterlands, but I'll be pissed if I can't get a bar seat whenever I want.
author: Andrea E.

description: Great place to catch games on the big HD tv's.  Excellent bar selection, hot bartenders.  Not too cramped which is nice when you've got people around you cheering for the Raiders to lose, and it's close to the N-Judah, 71 and 16bx lines, so no D.D. needed!
author: Patrick B.

description: So, I was looking for a spot to watch a little MNF, and I happened upon this place....big screens everywhere, and high def which was a plus. The beer specials could've been better, only $2 Miller Lite drafts, nothing more. I ordered Underdog's "Favorite Burger", which allegedly was a step up from their every day burger, for an extra buck. Basically, the extra buck got you some jalepenos slopped on top, not particularly worth it. The burger was marginal at best, and the fries.... well, they tasted like yesterday's leftovers, reheated in the oil the fried fish is in.  Seriously, how do you screw up fries? Even the ketchup tasted a little funky.  In a nutshell, good place to go for a game, drinks are not particularly cheap, or generous, and the food... well, I suggest you go next door, the pho place was packed!
author: Scott R.

description: This is my favorite bar in the city. They have something like 7 big screen High Def TVs and NBA league pass. It's nice to sit at the bar and watch two or three different games at once. Most the time the bar isn't packed, exceptions being 49er games, I think... and I like it that way. The bartenders are cute and friendly. They serve hawaiian bbq instead of the typical nachos, fish and chips bar food. The noise level isn't so loud that you can't hear yourself think. It's a great bar to chill at.
author: Eric U.

description:
we heard Nick was serving tacos here (of Nick's Crispy Tacos fame).  for that mere fact it gets a 5.  but since i gave underdogs bar a 3, we'll even it out at 4.

come here.  try the tacos.  the chips and salsa with guac is also a must get.  

for happy hour, there are no food specials, but there are $9 pitchers of miller lite, so you can't go wrong there.  good food, good sports, good friends.  so all in all, this place earned itself a 4.
author: Jason J.

description: I had three tacos - carne asada, carnitas and chicken and by far the carne asada was the best. I am from San Diego and it is a relief to find a good taco shop in San Francisco that is not over priced and has good food.
author: Chris D.

description: great service even on a busy night. good food and beer!
author: M B.

description: This place has become a staple for us and our kids on weekends at lunch time. The kids love it, the food is good, service is fast and the back picnic tables are very kid friendly (they have high chairs). Only downside is that there are TVs on every wall which the kids can't look away from...maybe that's not such a bad thing as it keeps them occupied.
author: Daniel R.

description: Great unique tacos (Nick's way), good beer selection, nice atmosphere. One of the places where you can grab a beer even if you have kids with you. Our kids love the place.
author: Peter N.

description: This place is great, I recently went to watch the NBA Western Conference Finals there, and I had a blast. The tacos are great, and the sangria is delicious. Underdogs has several flat screens, so your able to see the game from wherever you sit. I only wished that I had gotten there early because it was a bit crowded when I arrived. But I still had a fantastic time there. I will definitely be going back someday.
author: David P.

description: Great for sporting events. This place possibly has the best bar food I've ever had. My friends and I went there for the Warriors' games, 7 or 8 big screen plasma TV's all in HD. Awesome place! check it out.
author: HENRY M.

description: The only reason I have to knock this place a star is because I get so tired of hearing the word "like" from loud conversations from valley girls who think they're cultured by eating mexican food.  Posers....Underdog's is great for taco's Nick's way but definitely stay in the mission for other mexican items.  Definitely get's your tacos nick's way and get them here instead of at the one on polk st because they are less consistent.
author: jacob s.

description: I love the fact that I can go to Irving and have really great tacos! The dollar tacos are awesome and any taco Nick's way is also a yummy treat! A super yummy treat! My boyfriend and I have frequent the place every week and look forward to going back every time! The owner and the staff rock!!
author: Kathleen P.

description:
holy crap...these tacos are HUGE!  my girlfriend and i both ordered the two taco combo and ended up taking our second ones home.  shoulda ordered one plate and shared!  carne asada was...eh.  carnitas...wow!  awesome!

service was so-so.  what do you expect from a bar in the middle of the afternoon?

my one gripe?  you have to pay for chips and salsa.  isn't this usually a freebie at every mexican place you go to?  nonetheless...the chips and salsa were good.

we will definitely go back.
author: Sarah and Amanda G.

description: Been here twice for their taco night.  Not a bad or expensive way to spend a Tuesday night with your friends, especially when it's all in the neighborhood!  $2 Tecate and $1 street tacos. I usually get the chicken or their carnita tacos. I wasn't a fan of their carne asada tacos, but I hear that it tastes better as a burrito.  Someday soon I will try their fish tacos! Atmosphere is comfortable. Clean, not seedy.  Staff is friendly.  Oh...forgot to mention that their chips and salsa is done just the way I like it, a big mound of salsa on top of non stale chips.  Not the watery salsa, but the chopped up tomato kind.  Will def  keep coming back!
author: Aimey T.

description:
First off, despite anything I say below, I'm pretty sure this won't be my last visit to Underdogs. The food was decent enough (and they are close enough) for me to go back again.

I waddled in today craving a sandwich but not feeling like the walk up to Andronico's. I'd read so many glowing (glowing!) reviews here on Yelp that I figured I'd be remiss to not check out a place so close to my abode. 
Wanting something to-go that was easy to eat, I ordered the pollo burrito con todo (but said "Chicken. With everything." Because I'm white and nerdy and have a major self-conscious issue going on with 
foreign words).
Since I ordered to-go, I can't really make any comments about the dine-in experience or the ambiance of the place. It looked clean, smelled like good food (and limes and beer, but not too much beer).
. 
The burrito had to sit in the foil until I got home (about 20 minutes) and by the time I unwrapped it, it was a little on the wet side. Everything tasted fresh, I sampled the two salsas (green and red) that came with, but didn't love either one (or the heartburn they were pretty much guaranteed to inflict - hi, pregnant lady here). I actually liked the beans best...they weren't too mushy or salty, and they definitely weren't bland. The chicken was okay, but it seemed like it was lacking something...zing? I was kind of hoping for a more grilled or blackened chicken breast, instead I'm pretty sure it was breast/thigh combination that seemed to be slow cooked with some kind of sauce. It definitely wasn't dry which is a huge plus, but again, it needs something. 
Overall, it was yummy, but I have a feeling that without the guac, sour cream and cheese, the taste would have been underwhelming. And it would have been nice to have the sour cream and cheese throughout the whole burrito...the sour cream seemed to be all crammed into one end, and the cheese at the other.

Slightly underwhelmed, but I'll be back, because there were people at the bar eating crispy-looking tacos that looked super yummy and I want to try them. And seriously, so many good reviews? You people can't all be wrong. :) Next time I'll try the baja pescado tacos I think.
author: Christine G.

description: By far the best tacos! Its so nice to have this option out here in the Sunset
author: Kimberlee O.

description:
3.5 stars.

Came here with my boyfriend today to watch the game. They have several LCD flat panels with different games on so it as great. The staff was very nice and courteous. We had the buffalo wings and nachos with 4 corona lights. The food was decent. The most spectacular thing was their secret homemade habanero hot sauce. It was gooooodd! Pricing was good too. Given the current economy, we'll definitely be back to enjoy a lunch and watch a game.
author: Chanli S.

description: No sports feeling here...no neighborhood feeling...just a warehouse with abar and TV's...i prefer the one at 9th ave that's much better
author: Sir Paul L.

description: Went here today for the first time to watch football.  This will now be my main sports bar, everything was great.  It wasn't super crowded (like the Kezar) but there still was some energetic, harcore fans there.  The best thing is the food.  Awesome fried fish tacos, just super and I'm somewhat of a fish taco snob.  The Buffalo wings were good (not as good as the Kezar which are the best in town).  I'm excited to come back for a 10am game and try the breakfast burrito.  The wait staff was great and the manager put the Bills game on for me and ensured we had viewing seats.  The picnic tables are nice too because it allows people to share tables better.  Oh yeah, they have $2 Tecates all the time which is a pretty cheap way to drink.  All in all, one of the best sports bars in SF.
author: Tony B.

description: Damn fine burritos!  They do it no rice style, which can be good or bad, depending on what you're in the mood for, but i dont miss it.  Try the Chicken with everything, its heaven.  good homemade chips too.  Staff has always been friendly and attentive, i like this place.
author: trum d.

description: It's a sports bar.. the drinks are okay, the junk food is alright. Nachos burritios and tacos. Some of the waitresses and waiters are nice some are not. They can do better though. Food and drinks are overpriced.. I'd rather go somewhere else..
author: Yuan T.

description: Shitty shitty restaurant!! Stay away went in at 3pm on Friday 6 people in the restaurant dumbass bartender takes my order walks away and totally forgets and starts talking to his friend! I eventually had to walk out after waiting 10 more minutes because I had to goto work now with no food!I tried this place a couple time and keeps getting worse! It a shame only close Mexican food in the hood and it's run by idiots. I work at bars in sf and if I worked like that I would be out on my ass working at ihop! Screw this place stay far away!I am gonna tell everyone to stay away good food does not mean you treat your guest like a bunch of bitches!!! Goto the pho place next door you will not be ignored!!So many people looking for work why cant underdogs find anybody better?
author: Mark M.

description: Taco Tuesdays and dollar margaritas Fridays! That's all I go for. It's a total sports bar and really popular.
author: Myfood Y.

description:
Look, I do not work here. Nor am I related to, dating, or friends with anyone here. I hang out here. Period.
It is a sports bar, but not your average, run-o-the-mill, dark, damp, should of been shut down years ago, hole in the wall sports bar with only the old-timer regulars to support it.
No, this is a new type of sports bar, it is bright, airy-  and cut the owners some slack on sports memorabilia deco... They JUST opened the joint!
Sure the food isn't 5 star cuisine... But if that is what you are looking for, I can suggest plenty of uppity joints downtown that might more meet your tastes. What we have here: good grub, for the right price, and great service.
Oh! And there is free popcorn to munch while you have a drink and watch whatever game.
They will play anything you ask for, so there is chic appeal, as well as to the dudes...
And if you do not like the atmosphere... Well, maybe it is time for something different, and you need to get off your high horse, come into this great bar, make friendly with the friendly bartenders, and enjoy yourself. Without the stigma of what a sports bar "should be" I think it is high time that a cool bar to hang out at found it's way into the neighborhood.
And for all you naysayers... maybe you should give it another chance. Maybe YOU are the soulless ones!

UPDATE:
OK, I have been to this spot again, given them a little time to work out their kinks... And I must say, they are doing rather well. The walls are a little more decorated, and they actually play the UFC fights! I don't know how many of ya'll are into the fights... but that is pretty nifty!
author: Miss B.

description:
I've been here a few times. The owners are cool, the plasmas are nice, food is decent for sports bar, and the place is usually rather clean except for when the bartenders don't bus the tables after a while. Now why the 2 stars? The bad service! Esp Jamie/J (sp?) who works on Fri nights. She's not only super unfriendly (can we say bad attitude?)-doesn't smile, but also has no customer service skills. Sure, maybe she was having a bad day, but I've been there when she's working more than once. Isn't the job as a bartender to put on a semi-happy face? In my defense, we just chilled out at a small table and we didn't do a massive amount of shots or heavy drinking (how could we when the drinks were coming so slow anyway?). Just usually keepin' it low-key. We're nice guys. 

She's slow, not friendly (I know, I just had to stress this point again), and just made us not want to come back on Fridays. Thank God she doesn't work on Tuesdays. Management should really talk to her scowling being.
author: richard l.

description: The taco's at this place are soo damn good.  I used to go over to Nick's Crispy Tacos all the time, but lately they havent been that good.  I found out it is because Nick left there a few years ago.  I heard he was back in the sunset so I went to check it out, and they are better than they were before. The menu is similar but there are more items on the menu that as so tasty.  It's hard not to order one of everything.  Check it out.  My favorites are the grilled fish taco done "Nick's Way" and the corn on the cobb.  Nick is the nicest guy and he comes out to say hi to all the customers no matter how busy.
author: kate l.

description: I'm not really a sports bar kind of girl, but Underdog's is a blast for everybody. You gotta get there early for your football game because this place gets jam packed and a seat can be hard to find. Everyone there is really friendly and ready to make new friends. They have multiple games going throughout the bar which is pretty cool, so you're never without a game to watch. They have really good bucket specials, my friends and I usually opt for the (6) Pabst tall can bucket for $25. Now, for the food. Yes it is as good as everyone says! I've had their pollo tacos before which were awesome. I've also had a bit of their carne asada breakfast burrito and it was one of BEST breakfast burritos I've ever had. They are rather expensive but the quality and freshness is top notch. Can't say enough good things about Underdogs, check out their menu for all the specials because they have quite a few. I'm craving Underdog's now just thinking about it.
author: Katie S.

description:
I've been coming to the Underdog since I moved here in late 2006. This being the closest thing to a sportsbar anywhere near the 19th and Lincoln area; it quickly became my home away from home. 

When I first began stopping by, it was middle school cafateria-esque. Very bland and lacking character. But, it had flat screen TV's aplenty and any sport game on any sport package you could ask for. Menu - standart bar food with a few Hawaiian inspired dishes.  Food - bland and below average. Service - average to slightly above. Setting: way below avg for a sportsbar.Staff - good. 

Fast forward to today (9/13/08): They've done a lot (understatement) to improve the place. Painted some walls. Changed the chairs/stools. Added memorabilia. To sum it up - they've given it life. Oh, and the menu? Completely redone as of 2 weeks ago. The menu has been redone by Nick of "Nick's Crispy Tacos" - of the Russian Hill fame - and it is quite an improvement. Loving Mexican food (and previous living in So Cal) there is not an up-to-par Mexican food joint anywhere near this area. 

The chips? As the guy siting on the barstool next to me said, "kinda thick, but fresh and very crispy with a great pico." And coming from a hispanic guy who lives and works in the Mission, I'll uphold his seal of approval. 

The tacos? Had 1 carne asada and one of the batter fried fish. The only complaint I could offer is that there was a too much white sauce on the fish taco. Both were big and falling out of their shells (for ~$4/each - they should be). The fish batter was light, crispy, and non overpowering. The steak was nicely cooked and full of flavor. Plenty of guac and pico topping. Very delightful - both. 

The quesadilla is unlike any I've ever had, in a great way. Filled with your choice of meat, pico, and cheese, the tortilla is fried after stuffed w/fillings. Comes out flaky, crispy, hot, and only slightly greasy. Definately worth experiencing for yourself.

What could be improved: the buffalo/hot wings! Have had them many times over the years (favorite bar food) and they haven't changed: small and typically dry. Only offered with ranch - no blue cheese. Sauce is...ehh. But it is a Mexican-inspired sports bar. May be too much asking for great wings. 

A good place that keeps getting better. If you're in the area, give it a try. See you there. I'm the guy rooting for any Georgia based sports team.
author: D. H.

description: Stopped in there last weekend to catch the Buckeye's game and was pleasantly surprised with the delicious food!  The fish taco's were spicier than I thought they would be but I loved them.  Also had the chicken quesadillas and it was the best I've ever tried.  Their chips are thick and perfectly crunchy, and the salsa fabulous!  Will definitely be back...to try the breakfast burrito next!
author: Joann P.

description:
they have alot of cheap food, but they dont have alot of variety of drinks. they have every kind of beers signs everywhere but they dont even carry most of it. 
for some reason the place smells like something went really bad; smells like some one just came out of the bathroom throwin up.

i think i would only go back there cuz they have these really old games machine that i really like.
author: Jess I.

description: Why did it  take SOoooo many years for someone to realize people want CRISPY Tacos--- NOT "soft rolled" mush tacos ?!!!  Finally Nick of Nick's Crispy Tacos of Polk St. fame came over to Underdogs. Thank God !  At this  place they have managed to put together the best offerings of Mex. Great sauces- 3 kinds (be careful the Habanero will burn your face off), great Guacamole- no additives, crispy chips, great salsa ( with ripe not green tomatoes) delish Burritos, unique Quesadillas, filling Tacos and other satisfying offerings.  One little caveat ....since the bartenders travel the length of the bar you never know if you are going to get a strong Margarita, weak or in between unless Nick makes it.....then you are guaranteed a perfect one ! Go early or late if you want a seat at the bar.   8 p.m.seems to be  prime time .
author: Jooles M.

description:
Underdogs is a real cool place it hang out! The bartenders are all very friendly and attentive, and unfortunately not everyone can handle their job...

Such is the case with a girl named Megan D. who was fired from Underdogs less than a week after being hired and decided to retaliate by leaving a very harsh review.

Thanks for the review Megan D. It's really too bad that we'll never know how much you secretly love this place...
author: Samantha S.

description:
How the heck does this place have 4 stars?!?  This is by far THE WORST establishment my friends and I have ever been to.  There was a 30 min. wait to get seated.  The server was nice, but it took another 40 min. to get our food and beers to us.  The food sucked, but at least the beer was ok.  To top it off, the owner of the place asked us to leave the table after we finished our food!  How professional is that?!?  I do think that we were discriminated against, because there were also other customers who were occupying  tables longer than us, and he didn't say one thing to them.  I have never been treated like this in my entire life.  We were disgusted and embarrassed by the time we HAD to leave.  I am convinced that the owner is a bigot and has no understanding of business ethics as well as how to satisfy his customers.  
If there was an option for 0 stars, I would have given that to them.  Please do not go to this place, everything there is horrible, especially the owner.
author: Rodgie G.

description: We have been meaning to check this place out for months. Finally made it on Friday and oh my... I am sad we have not been sooner. Delicious! The staff is super nice and the food was off the hook! We ordered lots of food and two beers and our tab was only $30.00. A steal considering we were stuffed and wishing we had room to order more. I can't wait to go back! I am dreaming of that green sauce that comes with the food.
author: NIcole N.

description:
i am scared to give this five stars because i dont want it to get so busy that i cant make it in. truly a best kept secret in the sunset district!!

i came here with 9 other people, we managed to snag a table and the waitress/waiters were SOOO NICE! we all came for $1 margarita night on friday. its a strict 6-6:30 so you have to be on time, and the cut off is right at 6:30...but that half hour is the BEST half hour you can spend anywhere!!!

the waitress we had was soooo efficient. she walked around continuously filling our glasses, ensuring ALL nine of us had enough to drink, despite the crowded restaurant. she never seemed annoyed or rushed, and she was friendly and fun. it was awesome... had such a blast!!! ill be here every friday night!!
author: Emma B.

description: still a four start rating becuase the tacos are out of this world delicious, but getting a servers attention is extremely difficult.  i think they purposefully avoid eye contact and zoom passed to avoid any kind of serving duties. but still the food and especially the tacos and AMAZING!
author: elizabeth r.

description: fish tacos nick's style is puurrddy GOOOOOD. to tickle your fancy i think it would be splendid with a corona watching your favorite team. i'd come here again if i was in the area.
author: Je M.

description: Underdog has a great neighborhood feel to it. I love the TVs and love even more the taco shop.  Nick's Fish Taco, one of the best in the city, is to die for. Add some chips and salsa with a cold beer and watch the Giants play. Priceless! Can't wait until football season.
author: Caleb N.

description: Thank goodness Nick opened up another taco shop in the Sunset!  I used to live 2 blocks from his Polk St. location and moved within blocks of The Taco Shop last year so I didn't have to suffer withdrawal.  As usual, the tacos (especially baja tacos) and quesadillas (I prefer the one without meat even though I'm a happy carnivore) are delicious.  Of course you have to get their chips & salsa- great pico de gallo.  They have good street taco deals and night and I have yet to make their Friday margarita happy hour special.  Thanks for bringing your tacos to the Sunset, Nick!
author: Charlie B.

description:
the old man is a warriors fan and i'm a red sox fan.  sometimes, this can overlap and cause problems in our marriage.  like in 2007.  it was april and the warriors were in the playoffs and baseball season had started.  so we came here hoping i could watch my game while he watched his (though, i really am a warriors fan too, so i was watching both).  we walked in and literally 5 seconds later, the red sox hit 4 home runs in a row.  manny, drew, lowell and my boy varitek smashed them to take the lead from the yankees.  so it was a great way to start off the night in a sports bar.  this was back when they served hawaiian food, and it was pretty good.  and the warriors beat the crap out of the mavericks so we both went home happy.
since then, i have been back for a few red sox games and some of nick's famous crispy tacos.  the tacos are out of this world and the chips and salsa are the best deal in town.  but there are a few bartenders that have given me shit for being a red sox fan (they were angle's fans) which i love...but they let it affect the service they give.  giving me shit about my team is what i live for, but don't make me wait to order a drink and give me dirty looks and attitude.  i'm paying you to serve me.  i don't care if you hate my team.  give me my god damned bud light and then give me shit.
author: Katie H.

description: underdog's is a great place to be on a friday for happy hour! $1 margaritas! yummy yummy! down those baby's fast cuz it's only $1 for a half an hour!
author: Kaydee D.

description: Love the food. Very easy atmosphere, relaxed, comfortable, inexpensive, and just plain tasty food.  I like going and sitting at the bar, watching the nice big tvs and digging into my spicy shrimp taco, grilled fish taco, or vegetarian taco (all Nick's way, of course).  The taco salad is also very yummy! The reason for the 2 stars knocked off, however, is that the last 2 times that I have visited, we have had the absolute worst service. The cuteish Asian girl with the tattooed shoulder is simply the worst. Has gotten the majority of orders wrong, and simply didn't give a shit. About anyone. Or about fixing the orders.  My entire party had finished eating while I was still waiting for my tacos to even start get re-made. The manager came over and apologized, he was fantastic. Very nice and very willing to remedy the situation by not charging us for some beers. But no, she never apologized or made any effort to make the dining experience a good one.  I will most definitely go back, because anyone else there is really great and the food is truly good. Go give it a try, just don't sit in her section!
author: Sara G.

description: i have to say the tacos are really good... BUT i think its way expensive for mexican style cart tacos. i'd give it four stars if it wasn't so expensive. also it closes early from the bar so get in there early.
author: Darren C.

description: ahhh the avenues...i killed like four tacos = two orders @ this place...couldve ate more but the stella possibly made me more full....tmz.com says that the courts are in a battle on who owns the recipe or has the rite to serve the recipe between the other nicks tacos on broadway....this place is jus sooo yummy....i for sure have another spot to hit up for future giants games & football games....alot of the reviews says it gets too crowded~ill make sure to come early
author: elmer d.

description: It recently came to my attention that I eat mexican food more often than any other type of food. I'm talking like probably three times a week, on average. You will rarely find me in a mood where I will turn down a taco (or a margarita for that matter). I did not know this place existed. I had been to the Nick's in the Polk Gulch a few times and naturally, I was a fan. My buddy who lives in the sunset posted something about tacos and beer in the sunset on her facebook and I was intrigued. Five minutes of research later the lady and I were on our bikes, heading into the fog. We got there and scored two seats at the bar. Important detail: It was a Friday at 5:30. We ordered some chips and salsa, the street tacos (hells yes, a variety platter of tacos, we decided we would pick our favorite and order it seperately, nicks way, see other reviews for details) We then ordered two margaritas. The bartender looked at his watch and said, oh, do you want to wait 5 minutes til they are a dollar? My red headed lady and I quickly made meaningful eye contact. Could it be, did he actually say what we think he just said? Yes. The margaritas are only one dollar between 6 and 6:30 on Fridays. And they make huge amounts and continue refilling as long as you are still standing. I think I had about 6? Maybe 8? Anyway. The tacos were delicious. We picked the carnitas to have Nicks way (it was moist and spicy) and ordered it at approximately 5:25. We think the bartender might have been enjoying some of the margaritas as well, because we had to ask about our taco about 45 minutes after we ordered it. He said he had put the order in, but we suspected he just didn't want to fess up. Anyway, it came about an hour after we ordered it, hence the missing star. When all is said and eaten, this place is in my top ten most frequented.
author: Natalie D.

description: Fried Fish Tacos perfectly battered with an outpouring of sauce, guacamole, and other junk (i.e. veggies) stuffed in a soft and crispy taco shell.......hello......why have i NEVER thought to do that?  This is the perfect late night grub or even fish craving grub - pair your food with some beer, some hot sauce... oh and dont' forget to put that red sauce they have on the tables all over your taco (its' got a garlic kick to it). Overall a great establishment for a chill night of eating and drinking.
author: Jeannette L.

description: fun sports bar and great bartenders! always a good time
author: julie y.

description: So yummy!  we live in the neighborhood and came acroos this place.  I had no idea Nick's taco on Polk opened another shop.  Great taco, nick's way and fun to grab a game.  Service is friendly and quick
author: Nicole A.

description: My carnitas taco was delicious, but the back of the restaurant, where we sat, smelled like bleach.
author: K H.

description: Nick's crispy tacos without the crazy lines, in a nicer venue, and with plasma TVs.  What's not to like?  Same great tacos made "Nick's way," same slightly annoyed feeling at paying $4.50 for a taco.  A good spot way out in the Sunset.
author: Conor S.

description: people who work here are very nice. great place if you want to eat solo. all the salsa (red salsa is just like papalote's)  you want!
author: suzanne w.

description: Have it Nick's way!  Great Carne Asada Taco and really, the best fried fish taco.  Love it and there seems to always be some great beer special.  I've only been there for lunch-- Maybe i'll have to go today, thinking about this place is making me hungry!
author: Mike P.

description: Well.... I went for Taco Tue..I will say it was raining outside so maybe people did not want to show up. There was not a lot of people there, the food is cheap (thats every taco place in the city on a Tue). I would go back here if I was looking for a chill Taco Tue night..
author: Matt S.

description: Finally, after a long week of dealing with punks and one star reviews Underdog saved the day! The service was great. The tacos were great. The crowd was great.
author: Jeff B.

description: writing this on their FREE WIFI! i never knew that!  learn something new everyday i tell ya.  well back in craving a fish taco. very friendly staff, service was excellent and the food was better than i imagined. thanks for quenching my fish taco craving. great job guys!
author: mike c.

description: Thank you for turning the Under Dogs into a Taco place too. The Tacos and food is really good. What I can't get enough of is the Corn laced with white cheese, and ground red pepper. It's like Corn on Steroids. I get roide rage thinking about eating the corn.
author: Mike h.

description: this has to be one of my favorite sport barin the city. the specials they have a great and they also have most of my favorite beer on tap. i love coming on tuesday for their taco special. everyone there are also friendly. great bartenders, great vibe. overall...its a great place to hang out at.
author: Tuan D.

description: Loved the Baja Fish Taco, the Buffalo Wings, and Guacamole! The sign said kids welcome, which lured us in in the first place. The only feeling I got when we left was that they were glad to see the kids leave. But, the food was awesome. So, if you don't like kids...don't advertise that they are welcome!
author: Salina R.

description: I discovered this place about 6 years ago, recently returned during another tortuous trip up 19th "Should Have Been an Elevated Freeway Decades Ago" Avenue and let me say that The Taco Shop at Underdog's is still a welcome beacon on one of life's worst highways. If you've lived in the city for any extended period of time, you've been to Nick's Crispy Tacos on Polk. You know that tacos Nick's Way can cure everything from hunger pangs to hangovers! This place takes all the great food and finally puts it in the ambiance of a sports bar. The prices are great for the amount of food you get. The differences from the original on Polk are noticeable as beer is actually on tap and you don't have to sit in those nasty sticky booths of Rouge that from what I can tell were made of red velvet at some point?! The $1 street tacos are a great deal and the service is very good, phenomenal actually when you actually get Nick himself taking care of you, of which I've had the honor on several occasions. Parking is a problem, especially for lunch and on weekends but the N Judah drops you off about a block away if that. I moved to Marin a while back and this is one of the few places along 19th worth stopping at.
author: Ryan M.

description: the music was way too loud and whoever said the fish tacos were good here needs a tastebud transplant.  three words for you:  lawry's taco seasoning.  barf.
author: liesl k.

description: Not to be confused with the awesome organic hot dog place up the street, Underdog's is the unassuming, if downright cheesy, looking sports bar nestled nicely between the Starbucks and the KFC on Irving. This place is relatively new to the area  and I think would've gone under if not for the addition of Nicks Crispy Tacos.  This and only this is the reason to stop by. The tacos are probably the best you're gonna find this side of the Mission and they've got some decent drink specials if you show up at the right time. The atmosphere is what you'd expect (save for the fact that they allow kids in the place) out of a "sports" bar. I was on the cusp of giving it 4 stars, but ehh, the tacos could be a little cheaper and with so many other bars in the city, I would hardly call this a destination spot. Maybe a pre-party on the way downtown or a I can't afford a big screen t.v.and I'm hungry for a taco spot.
author: Sean H.

description: The most kick ass tacos in the city.  And the price is right!
author: Shannon R.

description: Yipee! Nick's moved to the sunset! Now it's so much easier for me to get a wonderful vegetarian crispy taco! Just right off the N-Judah. I've  gone three times since the move. The veggie taco is $3.50 and all the meat style tacos are $4.50. The carnitas taco had really tender meat. The way it's supposed to taste. For a $1.50 you can order the chips and salsa and there is a huge portion of pico de gallo. (spelling?) $2.50 Dos Equis on tap or in the bottle. The corn elote con queso was not exactly how it's usually made. Too much cotija cheese and not enough chili powder. I wiped most of the mild cheese off leaving more room for fresh lime juice. Elote is usually bar-b-qued as well. I understand it is an indoor facility though. I would say go early if your going on a game day. The bartender said it's  mayhem on big sports game days!  I'm glad Nick and the owner are friends because prior to Nick's, it was just another asian bar in the sunset. Nick, you may have very well saved their ass! I know, I have recently become a regular. I never would have gone back after the first time going to just the bar. It's so much more welcoming and inviting since the remodel.   Good job guys! You made a new fan!
author: monika l.

description: I came here on a Tuesday night. The place was packed.  Overall I had a rather lackluster experience.  My drink came about ten to fifteen minutes after the rest of the group. To make matters worse the drink seemed pretty weak.  When I order a cadillac margarita I want something that taste like booze of quality, this tasted like mixer.  I swear the bartender forgot the Gran Mariner on the first round.  Tacos were alright but not worth the price. It seems like some people enjoy the place, however when the crowd came in, things really looked like they were falling apart.
author: Max R.

description: A must go!  We went last night, check out this budget friendly deal...$2 dos equis draft and $1 street tacos each.  The tacos are really good and service is always friendly.  Sometimes you have to fight to keep your TV/Sport show on...overall great place.
author: Kiki C.

description:
My first review on yelp.  Hopefully it's helpful.

My friends and I went to underdogs to watch the big game of the week in college football.  We've been there before for drinks in the evening, but this was our first time visiting during the afternoon.  After reading some the reviews, we thought this would be good place to catch a game.  Unfortunately, we were extremely mistaken.  When we walked into the back, 3 of the 4 TV's were on the game of the week, but only one had the sound on.  The third was on a different game.  My friends and I asked if the sound could be turned on on other TV's as well, but after telling us they'd try the waitress came back 30 mins. later saying that they were going to turn off the sound all the TV's and put subtitles on because it's policy not to have sound unless it's a Michigan game.  They also said they'd send the manager if we wanted to argue their policy.  Fortunately,  I guess they simply forgot because the subtitles were never turned on, the manager was not sent, and the sound on the one tv that had it  was never turned off the one tv.  Later we were told that they didn't want it to get noisy when 3-4 different games were on, but at the time there was only one game on the TV's in the back and the only other sound was the music they were piping in.

They also changed the game in the middle of the 3rd quarter on all the TV's to an "unsubscribed channel."  It took them 10 mins of loud complaining by approximately 30 people before the realized they should turn it back to the original football game.  But seriously, who turns it to an "unsubscribed channel" in the middle of a football game and leaves it there?  Also, the drinks were like water.  My rum and coke actually tasted more like melted ice + coke than anything else.  

Food was OK, except the carne asada in the nachos were dry and tough in some parts.  The wings were good enough that we were going to get a second plate until all the back and forth with the sound being off and the TV being changed to a blank channel.

The waitresses were nice and attentive even though one of them spilled a water on me without noticing.
author: Alexander C.

description: $17 for a two-taco lunch is kind of pricey. But they are stuffed as full as any I've ever seen -- the "Nick's way" carnitas taco especially -- and the tortilla chips are thick and crunchy. Besides, I don't mind giving my money to the underdog... kind of feel bad for a guy who got bilked out of his own name.
author: A. T.

description: Went there for football on a saturday.  No specials were going on.  The beer selection was ok and pints were relatively pricey (4.50) but within reason for San Fran.  Had chicken and vegetarian tacos (were about 4 dollars each).  The tacos were really good but priced a little too high.  The place is pretty good.  Would definitely go back for another game...maybe on taco tuesdays next time.
author: Sanjiv B.

description: Just came back from watching UFC 100 at this place (it was one of only two bars I found actually showing the fight in SF).  $15 bucks of tecate, great service, cute waitresses, loads of big plasma TVs, and AMAZING tacos.  I think I just found my new favorite place to watch a sporting event.  Cheers.
author: Anthony D.

description: Went here with a group of friends for Cinco de Mayo. We were enticed by their $1 taco deal. The tacos were pretty good, but small. Aside from being overly crowded, I would definitely go back someday.
author: Bern G.

description: yet another reason to never leave my neighborhood. great tacos, spicy hot sauce, welcoming attentive service. go on a weeknight for more mellow atmosphere and less amped-up college co-ed sports bar vibe. did not try the margaritas or sangria yet, but if they could get a better beer selection on tap I might find myself here way more often. good stuff!
author: patrick c.

description: The food here is amazing and really inexpensive.  I recommend any of the  tacos and the elote con queso is a must.  The margaritas are delicious and served up by really friendly bartenders.  To top it off, they have retro video games and flat screens everywhere.  Underdog's is an excellent choice any night of the week!
author: Laura L.

description:
kind of slow and loud, but the fried fish tacos, nick's way, are out of control.  really nice barstaff also.

fun place.
author: annabel l.

description: It was a Monday afternoon when my fiance and I first walked into The Taco Shop at Underdogs. It was the best random decision we have ever made! The atmosphere was instantly pleasing. The bar was very inviting and we sat at one of the picnic style tables in the back. There are huge flat screen TV's on each wall playing 3 or 4 different games. We ordered the Mexican "Street Style" tacos (one each of carne asada, chicken, and carnitas), a Baja Style battered fish taco, and the carne asada taco "Nick's Way". We also got the chips and salsa. Everything was so delicious we left feeling 100% satisfied with everything we had. My only complaint is that the chips were so damn good that I couldn't stop eating them and had to have my carne asada taco later that night because I was too full to finish. Josh was the bartender at the time and he was really helpful and in a great mood. We also had the pleasure of meeting Nick himself who was eager to make sure that we were happy. We've been in to The Taco Shop about 6 times since that Monday afternoon and it has only been about a month. Needless to say we will be back over and over again.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Great tacos! Nice neighborhood bar with great food, sports, fast service, and friendly bartenders. Most nights you will find a friendly 'no tude' crowd. You cant go wrong.
author: Darren B.

description: Yeah, this place is the new hotness.  I love the layout, and the owners are super cool.  The bartenders are highly trained and beautiful.  I recommend it.  Oh, the food is surprisingly good!!  And let's not forget the nice HD big screens...
author: Shawn R.

description: new local joint on irving.  happened by this place on sunday and stopped in for a few beers.  better than most pubs in this area.  didn't try the food but they have a nice selection of beers on tap.  beer is the same everywhere, but why watch the game at home or on a small screen?  this place has got at least 5 big screens goin.  was pleasantly surprised by that.  good vibes here.  except for the few raiders fans.  lol.  i'll be back for sure.
author: ty k.

description: Nick doing tacos in the Sunset!! Need I say more?!?!?  The staff is great, friendly and helpful, the bar is perfect for watching a game, and the tacos are awesome.
author: Amy H.

description: For the tacos, do believe the hype! They are the best I 've had in a long time.  The tacos are crispy and soft, the meat is fresh, tender, and flavorful.  Absolutely recommended when you visit the Sunset!  Ambiance? Pretty cool sports bar.
author: Angie H.

description: Nick's tacos are the best in SF, and the basket of chips with all the fresh salsa and guacamole goodness, and the spicy cheesy corn on the cob... omg. My friends and I all crave this place. Heaven. And Nick and staff  are super easygoing, it's like visiting old friends when you walk in. Definitely try it out!
author: Virginia N.

description: is it possible to give it 0 stars? Manager does not know how to operate this bar. You're better off going somewhere else. Trust me.
author: A W.

description:
great food, service, and location in a neighborhood that needs something like this...reasonable prices, good tvs and plenty of them for a place that size
cons (minor complaints): would like to have an expanded menu (you could pretty much get everything on the menu after a few visits and sometimes i wanna try something new), and it closes way too early
author: Joe K.

description: I really enjoyed this place. It was spacious and they had great service. I was able to try to food and it was really good. With good drinks and good food im excited to have a new place to hang out at.
author: Diana M.

description: excellent food and very generous with the alcohol. the bartenders have a "heavy hand" when pouring if you know what i mean.  those of you that cannot handle a potent drink, you can always request for the bartender to lighten it up a bit.  the service is great! enjoy!
author: walter b.

description: everything just as you would expect at a place called underdogs...including the bartenders. woof.
author: sherah h.
